Reviews.Title: “A sad tired looking place”
Reviews.Author: notalamb
Reviews.Content: We did not stay at Circus Circus but did visit it for a few hours. It has a very tired look. The entrance lobby was almost non-existent, no atmosphere of luxury here. One good thing about this place is that it is the only one in the whole of Las Vegas which seems to accommodate children. It has a floor above the casino, which they call Midway where there are lots of games for the children where they can collect hundreds of tickets for doing not much, and then cash them in for really pathetic prizes. They don't care a damn. Also the circus acts above the casino is a novelty, but overall doesn't make up for the threadbare feel of the hotel. Personally I wouldn't want to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “My view was a cement slab!”
Reviews.Author: Daniel B
Reviews.Content: Went on a vegas trip with some friends, the room was huge and clean. The room itself was well appointed but they need new beds and some more modern decor so people don't get the impression that they are stuck in the 80's as I did. I had high hopes for a view of the world or at least Las Vegas but I was stuch staring at a huge cement slab with a view of a tree, plant or the slightest hint of a city light. Overall it was fun but the line was super long to check in, took 3 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Ran Down”
Reviews.Author: Scuba132
Reviews.Content: To star with the sign needs painted and some new light bulbs are needed. I know a lot of people have stayed there, but duck tape to keep the carpet together in the hallway. But some money back into it. It is nice to have a place for the kids to play. I used a motorized scouter and the one restraurant uses a elevator. It was broken for three weeks, get the part and repair it. The manager and bar manager took me through the kitchen. I was unable to get close to the cashier because of ropes. The bar manager again came to the rescue. Had to go across the street to use the pool. The general manager contacted me and gave us a free night out in the Italian Restraurant, for the hassle I went through being Limited. We didn't ask for that. He was a very nice man. I ate my meals elsewhere after that. I been there for conventions and have seen the Circus cleaner. They still do the circus act and they aren't that good either. It was a big disappointment to me. I wouldn't recommend to stay there until some big improvements are made.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: Polly P
Reviews.Content: Circus Circus is pretty much the lowest priced hotel on the Strip so to start off with you can't expect much. It is a great hotel if you have kids because it is very kid friendly with lots of things for them to do and you really don't have to worry about them. The downside is hat it is at the VERY end of the strip and it is quite a walk to get to other hotels but then you can take the bus anywhere you want. My main complaint was the shower. The pressure was horrible but worse than that you spend more time adjusting the water temp than anything else. Once you get the right temp and you think you are good to go it either goes veyr cold or very scalding so you adjust it up and down then up and down some more. The room and beds were comfortable. So, if you are going with kids this is the place to stay and if you don't go with kids stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus / NON Kid Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Robert G
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Cricus Circus for 3 days in March of this year for my wedding. I have kids, did some research, and found Circus Circus advertising to be the "kid friendly" hotel on the strip due to having the Adventure dome. When we got there, the hotel from staff were beyond nice and very helpful. Things that went wrong; 1. Sent wedding dress to be dry cleaned and told the bellhop to call us with a price BEFORE the dress was dry cleaned and steamed. Never got a call, found out it was $75 buck when I went to their desk at 7 pm the night before the wedding. 2. The room keys are plain and simply ridiculous. I had 2 seperate rooms with 2 keys to each room and most of the time only one key was working and had to use the adjoining door to get in. The hotels excuse was it was getting demagnetized. I specifically put my keys in it seperate pocket with NOTHING by it. 3. At 2 in the morning myself and my wife were walking back to our room. As we took the elevator to the second floor and walked out, right in front of use were two males smoking a marijuana joint. The entire 2nd floor of the hotel reeked of marijuana for the next 2 nights. The hotel had NO cameras inside of the hotel only on the outside, so a fight could happen in the hall and they would even have footage for the police. A room could be broken into and owell no cameras. In closing this is the worst hotel experience I have ever had in my entire life. I have stayed at some cheap run down motels on the side of the highway and they would have 5 stars compared to how Circus Circus runs their business and keeps their rooms. I am going back to Vegas next year for our honeymoon and I can gaurantee we would even think of staying here wether they are cheap or not.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST and ONLY Casino/Hotel to Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: pupsrool
Reviews.Content: I have been to Circus Circus many times and keep going back....It is a FUN place to visit and no matter where you go for food....it is DELICIOUS and very very reasonably priced. For a family it is the only place to go....with so much for the children. (If you don't like children...stay away...as this is the only place where they are welcome with open arms). HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus needs a remodel”
Reviews.Author: L O
Reviews.Content: We booked here because we are not big gamblers and needed a place to stay passing through. We knew they had a place with games and circus acts trapeze etc. It was all very dated but it was also a little city. The place has everything you could possibly need. Fast food restaurants, Crispy Creme doughnuts, stores like a mall, places to get a massage and even a water massage, lots of people selling their wares like a flea market in a way, just purse stores and temporary tattoos, several restaurants etc. The buffet was very expensive and I didn't thing it was very good. We paid a lot but we felt like cattle. The place was big and like a high school cafeteria with people everywhere. A little kid at a table by us was sucking on the salt shaker. Lots of kids in that place as expected. Lots of unruly parents. The room cost was only $27 but they tried to initially place us in these barracks, like five buildings that run along the side of the hotel that look like mini hotels about two or three levels high. That would have been horrible walking to the main building which is endless walking anyway. LOTS OF WALKING to your room or any attraction from your car or room. We ask for a room in the actual hotel building and not in the barracks. They abliged. There is plenty to keep you busy here for a couple of days and lots of machines if you gamble. Looked like some fun machines that are unique. Rooms are dated but clean. Acceptable, but will probably stay in a more upscale hotel next time to see the newer side of the strip and stuff on that end. Long check in line fairly early in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “My kids still love it!”
Reviews.Author: TRIPDB8
Reviews.Content: My husband booked the room online months before and when we arrived our room had been given to another guest with his same name earlier that day! We had requested the casino tower and we didn't know what to expect. (I was surprised since they always ask for i.d to look for the match?) But thanks to the guy that attended us we still got a room at the casino tower #348. I liked it because we were between the elevators to go down to the casino and the hallway to go to the adventuredome and the parking lot. Our rooms were very nice, no fridge or microwave but it was clean and comfortable. Our view was a light outside our window but I can't complain since we weren't going to be there all day! I wanted my kids to go try out any new rides in the adventuredome but they never wanted to leave Midway. We saw the circus acts and they had fun playing games. We bought $4 t-shirts and souvenirs for 99 cents at the Midway store. I saw downstairs they have souvenirs all for 99 cents and a place that had everything for $10. Our buffet was $22.00 for the four of us with the coupons(Buy 1 get one free) that they gave us. We had gone to the bank nearby, washed clothes, and since we were around there we ate at Dennys that was next to a Walgreens . Breakfast totaled $25.00 and my husband shared his plate with my son and I did with my daughter so we wouldn't have extra food! We should ate at the hotel buffet instead but you live and learn! Our spring break went by fast, we won a little pocket money at the casino, the kids came back with a bag full of stuffed animals, we all had fun. Oh, something else that took us a while to learn-I used to think of getting there, checking in, find my room, and go eat somewhere downstairs but it doesn't work that way! Stop somewhere to eat lunch, dinner, snack before you get to the hotel. You will tolerate being in line to check in, your kids won't be complaining or hungry, and things might go a little smoother.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive, not worth staying again though”
Reviews.Author: brattnee13
Reviews.Content: Overall this trip was just ok. Circus circus is beyond packed and we took this trip during the work week. Something about a bunch of screaming ill behaved kids running around while trying to drink and gamble really just throws you off. And the cigarette smoke here is horrendous. Worse then any other casino i have evee been to. We had to go to our room to get some fresh air frequently.

Reviews.Title: “Great would go back to this hotel anytime !!!”
Reviews.Author: rrmall2006
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 1st march 2012 with my mother and i do not understand the bad reviews. The hotel is great, very clean, has everything you need a few shops, resturants, place to buy tickets and ALL of it is great value for money. Breakfast is great has a great range of buffet food, everything you could want from cakes, cooked breakfast, salads,toast,yoghut, everything, tea, coffee, pop, juice and mre.I would say go down before 9.30am because it does get busy but there is always plenty of food. We didnt go for lunch but the evening meal was just the same plenty of food and something for everyone with icecream and cakes and food from all around the world. The kids part of the hotel is great away from the adults section and plenty of games entertainment for them, and its handy that is also has a Mcdonalds inside the hotel. It does have loads of other food places inside the hotel so you will never go hungry. There are 3 or 4 casinos inside the hotel and all the staff work really hard coming round asking if you want drinks ( any kind) for free. The best thing is right outside the hotel is a bus stop, which HAS a ticket machine ( most of them dont ) where you can buy a 24 hour pass for $5, 2 day pass $7 and a 3 day pass $20. The buses are 24 hours a day and every 10-15 minutes. You can buy your bus tickets on the bus BUT you have to have the right money and you CAN NOT buy a 3 day pass off the bus ONLY at the machines. The rooms are basic nothign special but the beds are very comfy, big, it has a tv, barthroom, iron and ironing board, huge wardrobes everything you need from a bedroom. I would NOT pay more to stay in the other hotels as you can go into ALL of them and look around them, eat in them, play the slots, table games. So you are not getting anything more for your money maybe a posher bedroom but how much time and you going to spend in it when vagas is a 24 hour place ??? and it really is 24 hour never sleeps. I would recomment this hotel because it has EVERYTHING, and it is amazing value for money. There were decorating the main areas in the hotel when we were there but to be honest it was all VERY clean and well kept. one tip if you tip the waitress in the casino $1 she will look after you and always come back to see if you want more drinks. It is a big area and sometimes you will wait 30-45 minutes before you see a waitress it is the same in ALL of the hotels. Amazing hotel can not wait to go back and i would ONLY stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could be worse/ could be better”
Reviews.Author: AceAmanda_Au
Reviews.Content: Firstly let me say that I have stayed in Vegas before at other hotels. I always imagine The Strip to be where the action is. If you're staying on the strip, you're in the action. Not the case. I booked Circus Circus for kids.They enjoyed the rides for a few hours but that's as far as it goes. We stayed in the Sky View Tower overlooking Down Town LV. The view was still nice enough but the room was not great. Firstly, the key to our room randomly stopped working. With 3 children, this is not helpful. So we walked back to the lobby. If you don't get lost, it's 15 mins walk. Then returned back to our room again and the key still wouldn't work. Back to the Lobby and they sent security up. They fixed the problem but I felt like something was wrong (was someone in our room?) Thankfully the room looked normal and we didn't have any valuables to steal. The shower wouldn't work properly and when we finally got it working, it dripped for 2 days after. The shower area itself was not really nice. Had water stains in the shower area. It was okay but I don't like showering in a place that alot of people use and is old looking. Doesn't feel hygienic to me. Also, they have a light in the wardrobe. I leaned on the outside and it started sparking. Thought that was a bit of a fire hazard. Also, when it came time to explore the Strip, it felt as though we were walking forever to get to anything. The Sahara accross the road has closed down so that has effected the atmosphere. There is a dark spot accross the road. Next to Circus Circus there is a big car park (another dark spot) and a huge vacant allotment (construction site). We walked several blocks before we got to ANYTHING. Not fun with kids. Especially when there is multiple news stands covered in naked women along the way. The kids complained that they were tired before we reached any action. Maybe this is a temporary thing and things will be different when construction is finished but until then, catch the bus! In general, vegas is still vegas. The room was cheap enough. The kids enjoyed the rides (at an additional cost). The buffet was average. The service was fine. The casino was fine (not great). There are better places to stay. There are worse places to stay. Next time I will stay in a better place.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad.”
Reviews.Author: Carly R
Reviews.Content: The rooms were more comfortable/clean/updated than I had anticipated for the price we paid. The buffet was very overpriced. The circus attractions did not fit into my schedule, and it was far enough from everything that we spent a small fortune on cab fare for our long weekend. Gym and internet were supposed to be optional and cost extra, but it turned out that when we arrived, we had to pay some kind of resort fee anyway which then included those costs...not optional. We had a great time, staff was helpful!

Reviews.Title: “don't believe all the reviews you read”
Reviews.Author: maywill0312
Reviews.Content: we recently stayed at Circus Circus for a week from Mar3 - Mar 10, 2012. i studied numerous reviews of the hotel before we went and saw a lot of negative reviews. our stay was enjoyable, our rooom was in the west tower and had beren renovated. It was kept very clean and was very spacious. We had a view of the strip and it was quiet. A lot of the negative reviews were that there were kids everywhere. It is CIRCUS CIRCUS! What else would one expect.All in all we would stay here again and i would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed twice, great for the price”
Reviews.Author: Steve-and-Andie
Reviews.Content: Split our visit to Vegas in two and decided to stay at Circus Circus both times with a weekend out of town. Wanted a Strip hotel and this was one of the cheapest. A little dated as it is also one of the oldest hotels on the Strip but who cares when you are using it as somewhere to bed down. Our first room was in the Skyrise tower and was spacious and clean with a queen bed. The room safe was locked by the previous occupant when they left and we had to call for it to be opened. Security was with us within 30 mins to unlock it. Our second room was in the West tower. We were upgraded to a suite for the trouble we had with the safe on our first visit....very nice of them :) This room was also spacious and clean with a kingsize bed, far bigger than UK kingsize and so big you could play hide and seek in it!!!! Do not forget to put the 'do not disturb' sign on your door as the maid can call as early as 8am!!! We decided to go for the 'all you could eat' breakfast buffet each day as this would put us on till teatime and was good value for the price ($13) This hotel caters towards families in this 'grown-ups playground'. The large adventure dome would be great for the kids as well as the indoor circus acts and amusement area. The hotel also has a Tix4Tonight counter that sells cut price show tickets from 10am each day. Access to the rest of the Strip is good with the Deuce bus stop right outside the hotel. $7 buys a 24 hour ticket which will also take you on routes away from the Strip. As the bus runs 24/7 along the Strip and stops outside most hotels, this is very handy for getting back late at night without using taxis. It is very popular so be prepared to stand. Overall we had a great stay in Vegas and would highly recommend this hotel to those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer S
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, especially for the money! One issue is how far away it is in relation to the rest of strip. We stayed in the Casino Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to lay your head”
Reviews.Author: j_vogt9824
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd time staying at the circus circus. It is an older hotel/casino but well worth the stay. Let's face it, it's vegas, all you need is a place to lay your head. At $30 a night this is the place for that. Room service was a little on the wanting side.. we did have to complain about our room not being cleaned 2x but they comped us bfast so it all worked out. All in all we will go back

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised...”
Reviews.Author: GrammaKelly
Reviews.Content: I was very nervous about staying here after reading some of the reviews, but it turned out OK! We stayed in the Skyrise Tower. The good: WONDERFUL beds! Very comfortable. Great pillows. Slept very well. Large bathrooms with plenty of space for everything. Reasonably quiet, didn't hear too much noise Plenty of parking if you knew where to look, we found it too late! Lots and lots of games, rides, etc. We were never hassled by any salespeople. Westside Deli has the very best food. We even stopped there to eat on our way back home! The not so good: Very mediocre buffet for the price we paid. So-so food, and not too much selection. Very rundown in the main areas, but they are working on that. The darn place is so HUGE! Kept getting lost...LOL! Bad location, but the bus is easy and not too expensive. We did not use the pool or other restaurants... We will return, especially if we get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “in-room safe won't fit laptop, get a high floor”
Reviews.Author: Jim_and_Barbie
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty cheap hotel, with lots of things for kids to see and do. It's great for families. It's not the best location on the strip, so plan to drive (or take cabs) to see other sights. You can't really walk anywhere from Circus Circus. On my recent stay, my room was only on the 8th floor, and my "view" was looking out over the roof of the attached lower building below. Unfortunately, you could hear the noise from the air conditioning units on that roof, and it annoyed me at night. A higher floor would have been better. The room had a safe (which cost 50 cents to use!), but it was the wrong shape for storing a laptop. So, if you bring your laptop, protect it in some other way. The safe won't help you. This hotel is old and the halls look pretty "tired". However, it seems like the rooms have been remodeled. The room was actually much nicer than you would have guessed by looking at the halls. I would recommend this hotel for families on a budget. Adults without kids probably would be better off staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families”
Reviews.Author: WestIndian4ever
Reviews.Content: Took my wife and 2 young kids great value at less than 50 dollars a night lots of things to do in hotel: adventuredome, restaurants, circus.......overall great value rooms were a bit dated but for 50 dollars a night, no complaints

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and nice.”
Reviews.Author: Jessica B
Reviews.Content: We had a great time. I wish we had more time to stay. When we were there the pool closed at 5:00 and the Adventuredome closed at 6:00, so we didn't have much time to enjoy those. I wish we didn't have to walk through parts of the casino with the kids to get to everything. We stayed in the Skyrise Tower on the top floor facing the strip. The room was very affordable,nice, and the view was great. The beds were very comfy and the bathroom was large.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely renovated !!”
Reviews.Author: mikeythebe
Reviews.Content: Stayed here many times. Pleasantly surprised by the new renovations. Large bathrooms with marble enhancements. New bedding and furniture. Nicely decorated. Gave us late check-out. Quick check-in and check-out. The Steak House is still the best. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “fix the buffet”
Reviews.Author: Larry W
Reviews.Content: the buffet is the worst in vegas and before you book find out how much the resort fees and taxes are the final total was almost twice what we thought my fault for not doing my home work we are use to staying where there are no resort fees

Reviews.Title: “Nice visit, great price!”
Reviews.Author: Chan7977
Reviews.Content: I was very surprised by the Circus Circus. I always wanted to stay at Circus Circus when I was a kid so I figured we'd try it out. I asked for the Tower room which I knew was the most recently remodeled. It was an average room but it was nice & clean. The bed was very comfortable & as I said it was very clean, which is a big thing for me. Now dont get me wrong this is not a 5 star resort but it is very affordable while still being clean. Even the bathrooms are kept clean down on the casino floor. Now in the casino itself the wallpaper & paint could stand some refreshing but the place IS old, so its to be expected, they do manage to keep the carpets pretty clean for as old as it is & as much traffic as it sees. The grounds where dated & it is old but it has a bit of a vintage charm to it & even when we went back & stayed at the Luxor & Bellagio we went back to the Circus Circus to gamble & eat a few times. The slots seem to be much kinder there & at Slots of Fun, then they were elsewhere, we also had decent luck at the Bellagio & NYNY :) If you go to Vegas no matter if you stay at the Circus Circus or not be sure n drop by for the all you can eat prime rib at The Garden Buffet on the 2nd floor...Its not a buffet at all & its EXCELLENT food! One tip...dont stay here on the weekends if you can avoid it...There are kids everythwhere :) It IS after all the Circus Circus!

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back, ever.”
Reviews.Author: Lori N
Reviews.Content: I just came back yesterday from a four day March break vacation with my 11 year old son. We loved Vegas and had a fabulous time as long as we were away from this hotel. Let’s cut to the chase: I will not ever go back to Circus Circus again. - The room was not clean when we checked in. Used towels and facecloths in the bathroom, garbage tucked in behind the bed. - The décor was NOT updated as stated on their website. It seriously walked straight out of the 80’s, complete with thin pink polyester bedspread! - Food was terrible in Rock and Rita's (even my son wouldn’t eat it!). I spoke with the manager who did nothing and adjusted nothing on our bill. - Swimming pool is clearly an afterthought, difficult to find, and tiny. I’m not sure how this could be considered a family resort. - No room service and a 30 minute wait for a coffee at Barista Bagels where the people that work there are clearly in no hurry to help you. - Walking to our room each night we were greeted by the overwhelming stench of pot in the hallways. Do you yourself a favour, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Visited For Dinner and Show”
Reviews.Author: superstardancer
Reviews.Content: While in Vegas I stayed at the MGM Grand, but visited Circus Circus for their Circus Act and ate dinner at the Buffet. The food was OK, quite tasty. The shows are really good, and I liked that they had hand sanitizer at the Buffet. Good to check out the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, especially for the price”
Reviews.Author: francesk55
Reviews.Content: 5th time in Vegas, and I was always afraid to stay here. Never again. We stayed in the West Tower, 7th floor. Not only was the room non-smoking, the whole floor was. Our room was clean, roomy and smelled good. The flat screen TV, well, it actually only got turned on a couple of times, but was a nice bonus. The bathroom was very nice. Front desk was very helpful, and maid service was great. The only bonus would have been coffee in the room, but there are plenty of places easy to reach to grab a cup in the morning. I also appreciated having the Deuce stop basically at the front door. The buffet was ok, the West Deli was my favorite in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Updated and really GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: djdromusic
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week at Circus Circus at the beginning of March 2012, and all the remodeling and updates have made it even nicer. The only things I would change would be to somehow eliminate the timeshare salespeople , bring down the price of Pepsi($3.00 a bottle!) and tell Rock and Rita's to actually play Rock not Rap and HipHop! But for those minor annoyances I am very happy and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal leads to another fantastic week in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: April G
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at Circus Circus. We would recommend paying a little extra for the Casino Tower room. It was a major upgrade from the Manor rooms we stayed in last. summer. The front desk was helpful during check-in. She didn't hesitate to give us a strip view when asked.Our room was spotless upon arrival. The maids do a wonderful job. The valet were prompt and provided fast and friendly service. (After a couple good tips our vehicle was parked in the front) The kids enjoyed many visits to the midway,free circus shows, and adventuredome. We did think the area where the wonderful circus acts are viewed could use a little remodeling (perhaps a new net for the performers). The midway games were fun for all ages in our group and most were only one dollar to play. There is so much to do on the strip and after a busy day Circus Circus is a comfortable place to rest your head. For the affordable price we paid, we were pleased with our room and service we received. There are newer hotels on the strip but they don't offer the affordable family- friendly atmosphere you'll find at Circus Circus.

Reviews.Title: “Family of 5 in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie B
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas from the 14 th of march until the 19th. We stayed at the Circus Circus. We were a bit scared to see the hotel because of bad reviews and bad comments! But we were very suprise overall. We stayed in the Skyrise tower, 28th floor room 28726 and 28727. Both room have been remodeled, carpets have been changed, repainted and refurnished. For the price we payed, very good rooms and everything was clean. They come and clean your room everyday. Very quiet environment. Smoke free room also, wich is good cause one thing that we did not like when you go to the amusement park or the restaurants it smells alot the cigarette smoke. We went to the pool also a few times, it was clean, lot of security, two lifeguards and they really don't tolerate drunk people around the pool. Saw people being escorted out of the area by police and hotel security cause of their behavior. Something worth to do is rent a car so you can see all the attraction on the main strip. Almost every hotel has a self parking area that you can park your car for free, very good when you have little ones that get tired fast! Also we went to see the variety show at the "V" theater in Planet Hollywood, very good show for the entire family, it was quick numbers and kept going from one act to the other with no downtime. Only down part, it's general admission so first come first serve for the seat. With our car we went out of Vegas to Hoover Dam. A must see! 45 minutes drive from downtown Vegas. We didn't do the tour cause we didn't have shoes on, they do not allow anybody in without shoes, so we walked and saw everything by just looking and realise it was enough for the kids. So happy we didn't spent the 30$ a person for the tour. We had a great vacation, missing good food though. We were lucky to have the car so we could get fruits and veggies from the grocery store cause fries and chicken fingers are all over the place!

Reviews.Title: “circus circus fun”
Reviews.Author: TillieMToiler
Reviews.Content: We stayed four days at Circus Circus. I was apprehensive because of the location, but it was great! The room furnishing and decor looked new. We stayed on the 13th floor. Everything worked great. The elevators were often and fast. The buffet was a little marginal. The breakfast food was all cold. The evening buffet was a lot better.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE!! DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kacisunshine9
Reviews.Content: We paid extra to stay in a deluxe king tower room but when we got to our room it had two small beds. After hours of arguing we finally got put in another room with a view of a concrete wall! The carpet was covered in crumbs and the smell was horrible. We decided to go walk the strip to get out of the nasty place. When we returned we discovered our car had been stolen!!!! We reported it to security and they took us to their office for three hours before they ever even let us call the police because they insisted that their Risk Management would compensate us for it. We were finally allowed to leave after filling out numerous papers and called risk management. They told us it was our fault our car got stolen because their parking garage is unsafe and we should have used their valet parking! They refused to give us a refund when we tried to leave so that we could get a flight home so we decided to stay for the rest of the days. Room service did not clean our room once the whole time we were there even after calling multiple times about how unclean our room was. The buffet shouldn't be allowed to call what they serve food. Overall this trip was the most dreadful thing ever all because of this crappy hotel. Please spend the extra money to stay anywhere else!!! A motel 6 would be 20 times better than the Circus Circus!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected...”
Reviews.Author: S C
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned home from our Spring Break vacation in Vegas (3/10/12-3/15/12). We opted to stay at the Circus Circus since it was reasonable and kid friendly. Our room in the Skyrise Tower (22748) was better than we expected! It was roomy, very clean and it truly was a smoke-free room. Our only complaints about the room was that one of the days housekeeping forgot to leave us wash cloths when they cleaned the room and brighter lights would be great. The entertainment was great and the food was so-so. The Westside Deli was the most reasonalbe as far as prices and their food was good. As for the buffet let's just say that we were glad that it was complimentary. We'd stay there again if on a family trip, but if its just the hubby and I, we'd opt to stay some place else. If you stay here make sure to take advantage of the "resort passport" they give you at check-in as it does contain some really good coupons to use within the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Family of 5”
Reviews.Author: Sandi W
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5, kids ages 12,10 & 7 just went to Vegas for the 1st time, stayed 2 nights Mon-Tues. Our rooms were adjoining in the West Tower (Max per room is 4). It was well worth the extra room price to have a bit of space. The Adventure Dome was fun for all but there weren't many rides for my 12-year old. She was a few inches too big for the kiddy rides, and was too scared to go on the bigger rides. Lots of fun on the bumper cars, the 4-D movies and we all loved the Happy Feet ride. We spent 4 hours there and that was plenty of time. Walk around and look before you buy the all day ride pass as you might just want to use your ride coupons that comes with your savings book instead, depending on your kids. They had a blast on the midway, but we spent a ton of money there! Come prepared with lots of cash. It didn't open until 10:30 on the morning we wanted to go...bummer. The pool was far away in the other tower and was only open from 9to5..again bummer, we wanted to go soak our tired feet in the hottub in the evening but they were closed. We all had a blast walking the strip and seeing everything. The kids had to take us on every escalator and stairs they saw. We were all exhausted. It is a LONG walk from the hotel to the other hotels and main strip. We wished we would have driven and parked at one of the other hotels. Must see for kids....The Volcano at the Mirage. We got there about 6:20 for a 7:00 showing and got front row view. Then we went to the pirate ship show at Treasure Island. We got tired of waiting for the 8:30 show, so went inside for a bit and when we came out it was packed. It was hard to see, especially for the kids, and the show is more geared to adults with the skimpily dressed women dancing and inuendoes. Not worth it in my opinion, and I wish we would have seen the Fountains at the Belagio instead.

Reviews.Title: “Mini Vacation”
Reviews.Author: BobHawk507
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent location if travelling with family. If you do not have children you may want to look into another location. Everything went well on this trip and we had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “will never stay there again”
Reviews.Author: freshair2012
Reviews.Content: room dirty, casino area messy, classes drinks all over, no one clean it up.

Reviews.Title: “BEST KEPT SECRET FAMILY VACATION SPOT!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bruce_B_TX
Reviews.Content: FORGET about dropping two grand on a vacation to see that mouse- Circus Circus is the BEST place for a family vacation! This was our second trip in less than a year to Circus Circus and our kids won't stop talking about it. Even though it is one of the oldest properties on the Strip, Circus Circus has done an excellent job updating the rooms and facilities. The Adventuredome provides lots of fun rides and games. The midway area with all of the carnival games, video games, skee ball, and circus acts keep the kids excited and entertained and was a great way to let the kids burn off a lot of energy. They won TONS of prizes! Circus Circus has a wide variety of dining options. Our favorites for great food and VALUE are the Pizzeria restaurant that delivers to your room, the Westside Deli with lots of choices, and Blue Iguana Mexican Express. For the parents, the casino has a wide variety of slots and table games. Slots Of Fun is adjacent to Circus Circus and is also a great place to play. The rooms are very clean and many of them have been recently remodeled. The room prices can't be beat! The ONLY downside I can give you is that if you arrive on Friday or Saturday night, be prepared to stand in a long line to check in. The Circus Circus is the 14th largest hotel in the world and it fills up on the weekends because of their low room rates. Even with every position at the front desk staffed, the line will be long but will move at a good pace. Just set reasonable expectations for check in on a weekend night and the rest of your stay will be worth the wait! One other thing- this place CANNOT BE BEAT if you have kids. If you do not have children, or if you don't like children, then consider another property because this place is full of families with kids. LOTS of kids. If you are looking for a great family vacation, DEFINITELY choose Circus Circus Las Vegas. You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Our 25th Anniversary trip 2 - 9 February 2012”
Reviews.Author: nixchik
Reviews.Content: Review for 2 - 9 February 2012 My husband booked the Large King Tower Room. This was the highest priced room and he wanted to make our Anniversary special. At Check In we asked for a room with a view, explaining that on our last trip we had stayed in a West Tower room with georgous views out to Red Rock Canyon, and that we were paying for the more expensive room because of our Anniversary. The Clerk smiled and wished us a Happy Anniversary, and gave us the card keys to a room on the 7th Floor. When we got to the room, the view was of a solid concrete wall. It was next door to the drinks and ice machines, and an Elevator. My husband was very upset that his trying to make it a special occasion had failed. We were moved to another room - 32nd Floor West Tower. This room at least had a view, but also had 2 large beds instead of one, and was 100sq feet smaller than what we had paid for. We had to fight to get a refund for the difference in cost, it was not offered when the room was changed. Also the fridge, requested for Medical reasons (proof provided) both by email and phone (from Australia), and then again at Check In, was neither in the first room, nor in the second room, until 3 calls to the desk were made. Rating would have been 1 star for this Hotel ( last trip we rated it 5 star) except for the exceptional service and food at the Garden Grill which we ate at twice, the Valets, and another front desk person.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica1206
Reviews.Content: We had a great time! We went with our two teenagers and our daughter which is 2. My kids had a BLAST at Adventuredome. We stayed in the new hotel, the rooms were clean and spacious. The staff was very helpful. Very family oriented. The shops were also nice and decently priced. We ate at Rock n Ritas for breakfast, that was okay we also had lunch at the buffet which was good . We had dinner at the buffet also but we enjoyed lunch more. The hotel was close to everything! There is so much to do! We will definitely be staying at Circus Circus again!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: MdeMontigny
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it had recently undergone room renovations and it was a very low rate. We booked a west tower room and they are actually quite nice, they have done a good job on them. However, when we first got to our room the toilet had clearly not been cleaned from the last guest and we could not access the safe. We called down to have someone take care of these 2 issues, they said someone would come and take care of it....and we ended up having to wipe down the toilet ourselves and never got to use the safe for our entire stay. We also had rooms with adjoining doors, and unfortunately all this did was give us the lovely sound of a crying child late at night and in the early morning. The rooms are not sound-proofed at all. Bring ear plugs! The lobby and casino areas are definitely in need of upgrading, but we didn't expect too much. This hotel is on the north end of the strip and the only nearby casino is the riviera, which means if you want to eat anywhere that has good food, you have a long walk ahead of you or need to take the bus or a cab. If the buses ran reliably every 15 minutes like they are supposed to, this would not be a big deal, but quite often we would wait 30 minutes or more for a bus to show up, and when one finally did, it was usually packed. We actually ended up switching hotels part way through our trip for this very reason. This hotel has cheap rates on weekends, so if you are only going for a weekend and don't plan to be running back and forth to our hotel, then stay here. If you know you'll want to stop in and drop off shopping, or change for dinner or a show, I would recommend staying somewhere else unless you want to take cabs everywhere. One really nice part of this hotel is it has 2 tix for tonight booths, one in the lobby and one in Slots of fun. It was great to get our shows tickets before we left the hotel. If you are on a very tight budget, don't mind waiting for buses and don't mind eating at the same restaurant every day, then stay here. If not, go somewhere more centrally located on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “BOUGHT ONLINE”
Reviews.Author: ScottieCalgary
Reviews.Content: Went online and found a moderately priced room, at just over $40 dollars a night that included resort fees. I was surprised to be upgraded to the main hotel. I found out this happens frequently if you are a couple and book between Monday and Thursdays. Circus Circus have free shows for the kids about every fifteen minutes or so, I enjoyed a couple of them. They seem to have specials on at the bar almost every night, when I played the slots, the drinks were free and they came frequently which surprised me. The rooms are spacious and quiet. They have a MacDonalds on the premises which is handy for coffee. A local told me to go down behind the Flaming Hotel about a block on Flamingo Street, There is a bar casino which served a beer and a Nathan's Hot Dog for $2.50. This had to be one of the better deals in Las Vegas. Carry your ID they don't care how old you are every body gets ID'd. If you have a car there seems to be ample parking at every hotel. It does take a little while to get oriented with where the car parks are. Best if you can do it in daylight.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal on a budget”
Reviews.Author: pokeyz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Circus Circus hotel in November 2011 whilst attending the SEMA show at the Las Vegas convention centre. I was in a room in the Manor Lodge, the rooms were big (compared to UK standards anyway) and nicely furnished, but the Manor Lodge is about a 5/10 minute walk to the main hotel and casino which did get a bit tedious. Breakfast was great, loads to chose from. In terms of the location - it was ideal for the Convention Centre, being only approx 15 minutes walk. The main strip is about 20/25 minute walk. It's one of the cheapest hotels on the strip but ideal if you are on a budget. Would definitely consider staying again for future SEMA trips.

Reviews.Title: “KID FRIENDLY VEGAS, CIRCUS HAS SOMETHING FOR EVERYONE”
Reviews.Author: broy87
Reviews.Content: my partner and i just got back from a vegas trip (we go every march) this year we chose circus circus, an older hotel, but still in good shape. no wear or tear evident at all. obviously well maintained. i wanted to stay there before it ran down and closed like the sahara (poor sahara) we checked in on thursday so there was hardly any line, but the next 3 days it was busy. busy busy! this is one of the least expensive hotels on the strip and a really good value for the money. we stayed in the west tower and were offered a room at the top for the same price as lower. (we like a view) a really nice room, looked to be recently remodled. very clean, even smelled clean. very comfortable bed, big flat screen tv, cable with lotts of chanels, fluffy towels, the works. just remember that in addition to the bargain price there's a resort fee of arround 8.00 a day per room. even with that added it's still cheep. there are lotts of eating options at circus circus, pizza,mexican,steak and a pretty good buffet, probably more, just look at their site. the casino is just what you'd expect in a big hotel in vegas. the slotts the tables and there's areal circus acts above your head and on stage. i remember seeing that in a james bond movie when i was a kid and it's still there COOL!!! for the kids there's the mid-way a floor above the casino that looks down on the gaming area with seating for the circus acts. there are games of every sort and pleanty of stuffed dolls to win. at the back of the hotel is an enclosed amusement park with lotts of rides for kids big and small. i bet in the summer it's nice that the whole park is air conditioned! there's a large kidney shaped pool, outdoors, and a huge hot tub and sunning area. there is a motel on the proprety with even better bargains and if the roons are as nice as the towers it's an even better bargain as you can park much closer to your room than when you stay in one of the towers. as for the rv park, it looks to be huge also and being part of the complex everything else i mentioned is close by.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Kellie B
Reviews.Content: After reading all the negative reviews it sort of put me off, when arrived we only waited to check in for 5mins. The staff were very friendly and we received free vouchers for the breakfast buffet for the two of us for all week which was fantastic food. I would certainly reccomend you try their buffet, loads of different varied foods to choose from. The room was lovely and clean, the maids were round every day putting fresh bedding and towels in. The staff were very friendly and polite. After experiencing the other casinos along the strip we found our hotel staff members were the nicest and helped you to learn how to play on the boards. It was a good location as you can start at the Circus Circus and walk up looking at all the hotels without missing any of them out. Overall a really good hotel to stay in and cant wait to go back and stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus overall...”
Reviews.Author: Amy L
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 2 nights Friday and Saturday night March 2nd and 3rd 2012. We chose the circus circus because this was the only place that was kid friendly as we were meeting a family member there that wanted to visit with the kids too. (otherwise we would not have brought our kids to Vegas period) Friday night we were approached by the same black man trying to sell us weed right in front of our kids next to the elevator in the skyrise tower twice in one night. Then Saturday i had gone downstairs to smoke as I always get a non smoking room. (i know I'm a smoker but cant sleep in a smoke filled room weird I know) Anyway, I sat down at a slot machine next to the elevators and was going to play a few minutes why I smoked. Next thing I know I am being grabbed from behind, my arm was pulled out of socket by some crazy old lady that was yelling... I was sitting there thats my machine... I get her off of me finally and she came back punching me. WTF??? I was simply minding my own business... Thank Goodness there were a few witnesses... cause that old lady told the police I hit her... and I never touched her even after she started punching me because of her age. Then come to find out... the circus circus's policy is that in any incident, that they kick both parties out, regardless of who started it??? Even if your the one being attacked for no reason... even if they have it and see it all on video (which they did capture it all on video in my case) unless the Las Vegas Police sign some form stating your the victim (which luckily for me that is what happened) Still though that is craziness that someone can get attacked in their hotel and there is NO justice. You can be kicked out too??? What kinda crap is that??? That wasted about 3 hours of our carefully planned day.... They did kick that old lady out along with her entire family. They escorted them completely off the property... and on Sunday low and behold they had security posted in there where they should have been all along!!! Especially on a Weekend and Especially being it was the beginning of college spring break?? I agree with the other reviews that the food had no flavor the blue Iguana mexican place had no flavor whatsoever.... The food looked nothing like the pictures... (we had the ultimate grande burrito) it was a dollar more for rice, for beans and for sour cream... 3 extra dollars and then it was 3 bucks for each drink as well... They only sold one size! We didn't even bother after that to try their buffet as we had read these reviews before we left.. The room in the Skyrise tower was alright but everyone was right about the outdated TV. The beds were comfy and loved the pillow... Loved the pillow so much in fact I ordered one off amazon. The bathroom was alright too until we realized the things in the shower were not ours (we all assumed they were each others things eww) and were left by the guest before us,,, they were still in the bathroom when we left as well. we had 2 rooms adjoined and only one key out of 5 total keys worked... they mixed the keys up too... we were supposed to have 3 keys, my family members was supposed to have 2 keys and their key worked only on our room... (Thank Goodness we had the ajoined doors left open to each others rooms) The slot on her door was completely broken.. It did not even light up at all... Our keys all had to be re-keyed. After spending forever in a long line to get that done. Ugg (forget it we sucked it up and used the one key... until after the incident when security took me straight to the front of the line to get it done) We also signed up for and received players cards when we got to the circus circus and mine quit working, so I went to get a new one... everything was supposed too and should have been transferred over to the new card but... I lost all of my points... The kids 14 and 8 had a blast at the Adventure Dome and at the Midway carnival games. The circus acts were much better then we expected! Those were actually spectacular and a joy to see!! The kids loved it!!! The roulette table on the other hand had an admittedly strung out on crack guy at the table... He was clearly messed up and kept saying loudly how he needs to stop doing so much crack? Rockin Ritas was full of hookers... They were bragging about being hookers and the bar tender seemed to know they were hookers too... It is so sad that the Circus Circus is turning into a drug and prostitution hub for Las Vegas! So all in all we had a good time and bad time all in one trip... It kinda evened itself out with the good and bad... Circus circus not great but just Okay. We also stayed 2 nights at the Flamingo and 2 nights at the Cosmopolitan... So the circus circus was defiantly a downgrade but was perfect for the kids!!!

Reviews.Title: “No wounder it has been 15 years since I visited!”
Reviews.Author: Richard C
Reviews.Content: To be honest, I would not be going any time soon! We stayed 3 days and I had a better time visiting Hoover Dam on the way home. To start off once we arived and got our room, we took a trip to the buffet and was stopped by every merchant (for two floors) to try and buy their product or to check out their promotion (including Circus Circus employees). Even the door greaters were tring to get us to buy a time share! We planned on staying four days but decided to leave early. Hotel room had mold in the shower, room cabnet had a hole, no fridge, and room key sometimes worked to let us in the building. And you can feel the springs in the bed at all times. The only part that was good was the Adventure Dome. My kids loved it, but that was the only thing worth going to. All I can say is that if you like harassment then this is the place to be. This vacation/honeymoon was no vacation/honeymoon. Good luck and hope your stay is better than ours!

Reviews.Title: “There are better places for the money”
Reviews.Author: TimT_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because they had a special deal. And it just wasn't worth the few bucks we saved. The room was in an area that hasn't been upgraded yet so stuff in the rooms didn't work as well as it should. And the casino itself is one of the worst. Tons of kids around, boring food choices. We went to one place for lunch and the folks next to us were so drunk it was uncomfortable. The pools were small and off to the side, really an afterthought. It's about the best place around if you are really on a budget. And they do have free Wifi. But the location of the place is not ideal and the overall quality is weak.

Reviews.Title: “Too Many Hawkers”
Reviews.Author: tpahlers
Reviews.Content: The room was bad shape. Wall paper was torn or there was paste smeared all over. Bathroom was very dated. Every time we wanted to do anything we had to go through the pramanad are and get swarmed by hawkers with everything from makeup to kids toys to time shares. By day four and saying NO inumberal times I was sick of it. For very little more we could have stayed in nicer digs without sales people bombarding us every time we walked by. Never again at Circus Circus!

Reviews.Title: “Stay only if you have a family......”
Reviews.Author: Scotster_1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in February this year and have to say that I was not impressed. I will say that this is partly my own fault for choosing based on price. I found that the hotel is literally thronging with children, at all times of the day and night. I did not feel that the rooms were at all clean with obvious thick dust over very prominent surfaces (like the bedside table) and I do believe we were in one of the remodeled rooms (with the flat screen, unmovable TV situated on the opposite wall but six feet to the right of the bed so that you have no choice but to crane your head 45 degrees to watch - this in itself says to me that the management do not give 2 hoots about your comfort here). Without wanting to sound prejudiced, we felt that we were in a gang environment in all public areas. Having visited almost all of the hotels on the strip, this seems to be the only one that is happy to allow time share touts to slam you every ten steps that you take. We had arrived after a transatlantic flight and were hammered the moment we walked in before even checking in. The guy looks and acts like he is hotel staff - beware. Good points. The bed was comfortable. I can't think of anything else. What can I say to help you? Spend and extra 100 bucks and go anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “I was pleased”
Reviews.Author: Lexi_Travels81
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Circus Circus during the week and I was beyond pleased with the hotel. The lobby is a little outdated but the skytower rooms are nice and I even had a decent view of the valley lights at night. The room is updated and the beds are comfortable with plenty of pillows. The bathroom was clean and the shower head was nice, with a lot of hot water. The only two complaints that I had about the hotel are petty but I still think relevant. The first is that I have recently started a training regimen and since I get up before everyone else I was going to hit the gym both mornings I was there. I could not find the gym, I asked a few different workers and they didn't know, I asked the front desk and they stated that it was in the main tower but I still couldn't find it. Really it didn't matter, I ended up walking down to the other end of the strip and back and I'm actually glad that I did it instead of hitting the gym. The second complaint is about the buffet, yes I know they give most customers a few free passes but it is seriously lacking. As dumb as it sounds, when I go to any buffet (hometown for example) they have different toppings to put on your salad, even if they are just basic carrots and peas. Here they had a bowl of iceberg lettuce and another of mixed greens and four different types of dressing, that was it, I didn't even see croutons. Overall, I would stay here again but only in the Skytowers and I would eat at the buffet but only if I had free passes, the last day I was there I went to Luxor Hotel and for the exact same price their buffet was loads better. It's not as bad as most of the reviews state, also I checked in at 6 pm and there were only two people in front of me, so I would avoid 3pm since that seems to be a common complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Time”
Reviews.Author: Leticia H
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the service we recieved at Circus Circus and not to mention the excellent rates we recieved and free stuff! My family really enjoyed their time in the Adventuredome where the kids could ride rides! The room was clean, we never had to ask for anything as it was re-stocked when room was checked by maid service. Also, the hotel has a buffet style restaurant but it is rather expensive which is why my family chose to eat at the McDonalds located next door to the hotel as it was cheaper for our family of 5. There is also an IHop located a few blocks away passed the hotel going away from strip area. Also, I was not aware that the hotel had a shuttle that will pick you up and drop you off at the hotel... my family first took a cab from airport to hotel which costs us about $30.00. However, when leaving the hotel we were made aware that the hotel had a shuttle so we took that to the airport for about $20.00. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone that has a family and wants a nice, comfortable and ejoyable place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteG86
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night in March 2012. The room was in the casino tower, it had two double beds, bathroom and TV. In the bathroom I found that one of the towels had dirt on before it had been used which wasn't too nice. However there were lots of other towels to choose from. The room was good and the bed comfy, the bed did sink into the middle a little but was still comfy.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: rut1na
Reviews.Content: Ok, lets be honest, if you're going to Las Vegas, you should probably spend a bit more and stay at a hotel closer to the center of where everything's happening. But if your on a budget, Circus Circus certainly isn't a bad choice! Don't be put off by the shabby exterior & interior in the common areas. The common areas smell like tobacco and despair. The hotel is very sad compared to its strip counterparts. The rooms are good. I was actually surprised by the quality of our room in the Tower wing. I was expecting something a lot worse but the room we got was very clean, not at all run down, the bathroom was very clean and nice. The view was amazing (the bonus of staying a bit away from every other hotel is that you get to see them). I wouldn't recommend Circus Circus to anyone with the money to pay for a better hotel, but for the budget traveler it's a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic hotel”
Reviews.Author: pancho12
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing less than pathetic. They are real thieves. I booked an addtional room for my stay and got the keys alright. The hotel staff told me that they have to give me additional keys for my existing room and made me sign 2 slips. The next thing i notice is that they charged me an additional room on that signature ! When i called them to enquire about this charge, they were arrogant and said they cant take it off my card. Ridiculous hotel and even worst stafff, wud never stay there agian.

Reviews.Title: “Room broken into, items stolen and Circus Circus laugh it off.”
Reviews.Author: Bert V
Reviews.Content: My recent fiancee and I stayed in the Circus Circus in Las Vegas on the 22 Feb to 23 Feb 2012. We checked in around noon on Wednesday and just dropped off our bags and went down to grab some lunch. We bought a few souveniers and went back up to drop them off also. We spent the rest of the day walking the strip and seeing the sites etc. When we returned around 1am that night, our room's lights were on and bags had been opened. At the time neither one of us thought much of it, both thinking it was the other person who left the lights on a looked for things in the bags. Needless to say, the next morning when we were getting ready we both noticed several stolen items totalling approximately over $600. We immediately finished up and went to the check out and reported to security. They gave us a ticket and told us to contact them in a week while their "Risk Management Department" investigates. I phoned a week later with noone available in the office and asked to be contacted. Noone called me back. The next day I phoned back again and finally got through to a representative who basically said everything was our fault because we did not report that the door was malfunctioning before we got robbed!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money”
Reviews.Author: dimples_41
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my Mother and Sister for an easter break. Good value for money for what we were looking for. Good Location hotel for exploring Las Vegas. The atmosphere was good and the theme throughout the hotel was a nice novelty. The rooms could do with a bit of tlc and updating, but overall the stay was good.

Reviews.Title: “Good for kids & families, north end of the strip”
Reviews.Author: tb8986
Reviews.Content: 3-day trip in February 2012. reading the reviews always makes me nervous but when we arrived, we were able to check-in without any problems. There is always line but it Did go fairly quickly. We stayed in the West Tower, elevators right next to the lobby & Adventure Dome - which i didnt see until our last day!! Our room was nice, no problems. It is on the North end of the strip, so be prepared to use a taxi, walk alot, or monorail. (The monorail is farther then you think since Sahara is closed) If you dont mind the location of the hotel, or the fact that there are 1000 kids everywhere (even at 3am!), then its a great value. Buffet line was long, but went quick. Gambling is pretty good. Gift shops were well priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: goldy18_1999
Reviews.Content: I went for a 4-day girl's trip in February. After reading the reviews, I was a little hesitant. When we arrived, shortly after check-in, we were able to check-in without any problems. Was there a line? Yes. Did it go fairly quickly? Yes. We stayed in the Skyrise Tower. Our room was very nice. We had no problems at all. The only downfall was it was kind of a trek to get back down to the lobby to go anywhere, but hey, you're in Vegas, you didn't come sit around. Like the reviews said, it is on the end of the strip, but we used the unlimited daily Duece passes, which took us where we wanted to go, even the old strip. I think it's crazy for people who spend a couple hundred dollars a night for a hotel room when you're only there to shower and sleep (and we didn't sleep much - too much to see and do.) If you can deal with the location of the hotel, it's worth it!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “circus not realy”
Reviews.Author: dave195499
Reviews.Content: This is a well priced hotel and they gave us complimentary breakfast and a room upgrade, without us asking, the reception is a little off putting but get past that and the hotel room was very good and clean and the house keeping staff very good. I would use this hotel again and recommend it too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Room”
Reviews.Author: TheSaent
Reviews.Content: I am surprised at the negative reviews, I had a very different experience! Some friends and I booked the C.C. during a spring break trip, just one night. It was a budget friendly hotel so I wasn't expecting much, but to me surprise the room was very nice! The decor was quite modern, our room had obviously been cleaned and probably refurbished recently. The beds were comfy and we had a partial view of the strip. The blackjack tables were cheap and we had a good time gambling as well! I will stay again when I pass through LV next!

Reviews.Title: “Family hotel for the budget-conscious”
Reviews.Author: baummy617
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, we were offered a smoking room. I told the desk clerk that we were confirmed for a non-smoking. Her response was very pleasantly put to me that I could take it or leave it..they were full. After a long day of travel, I took it. As it turns out, the Tower rooms were recently renovated, so the only real smoke smell was in the hallways (whew!). The hotel offered no compensation for my inconvenience. In the casino, I did not see any rewards cards offered. Maybe Circus Circus players do not use them. This hotel clearly caters to the budget- conscious family travelers. I read the review from the woman on her honeymoon, who was dissatisfied with her stay. What was she thinking, booking this place for her honeymoon?! Oh well, it's not my last-time ever in Las Vegas, but my last time staying at CircusCircus. I must give credit where it's due: the cleaners, KrispyKreme workers, security/lost & found people, and buffet seaters were all very nice. Oh and by the way, I did quite on the slots here.

Reviews.Title: “It's boss”
Reviews.Author: samba_is_crap
Reviews.Content: We went here for the first time in 2008 an we thought it was amazin never seen anything like it before one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in,we went in a group an we loved it.me an my mates went back in 2011 an we got put in the hotel in a car park or Suttin but we found out you had to pay more to stay in the hotel so we paid it an had a amazin time.

Reviews.Title: “Typical casino hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sc0tty66
Reviews.Content: The rooms were ok. Didn't have a microwave, fridge, or coffee pot in the room. Guess they wanted you to go downstairs and spend 12 bucks for a breakfast buffett. A couple of drunks in the hallway one night woke everybody up. They did mess up my bill. Took almost 30 minutes to check out. Then when I got home and checked my credit card account online, I found that they had double charged me for the room. Word to the wise, always check your credit card statement.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: cuca48080
Reviews.Content: I recently bought a package deal and stayed in this hotel... However, when Jet Blue sells you the package they neglect to tell you that you will be staying in a motel called the Manor Motor Lodge behind the hotel. It is dirty, smells like cigarettes and seems very unsafe especially if you need to come back late at night .. I do not recommend it at all. Excalibur is a great hotel... close to the strip or right on it rather....

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, Great service!”
Reviews.Author: nomad401
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights, excellant rooms - I was told they had all been recently remodelled and they certainly lived up to this expectation. Very comfortable beds and friendly staff. I woulddefinately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “In the budget for LV”
Reviews.Author: QueenbeBuenosAires
Reviews.Content: I was there with a friend, just for a night. There bedroom was huge, very confortable. The bed was very good. The bathroom was clean and neat. There was a tv and free wifi. Then the hotel was very 90´s so I didnt really like it, but as I was there for a night, and the bedroom was ok, I cant complain.

Reviews.Title: “Moderate hotel”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaCabinGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed a Circus Circus February 17-22, 2012. We were traveling with my sisters and their husbands and two teenagers. My sister chose this hotel because it was supposed to be more kid friendly. The place was jam-packed with many families because of the long President's day weekend. I was concerned about the reviews but our stay was fine. The lobby was very dingy and I was nervous, but we were checked in very quickly and our room was clean and updated in the casino tower. The were updating carpet in the casino while we were there, so they are trying to update it, but it really shows its age. The good news is that the casino is right by the bus stop and you can inexpensively and easily ride the bus to Fremont Street or the length of the strip and get off where ever you want. Good stuff: Paul is one of the bartenders at Rock & Rita's and he won a recent bartending style contest, so have a drink and be dazzled by the moves ala "Cocktail". The kids liked the Adventuredome. Bad stuff: it was really busy, but service was pretty slow everywhere. The hotel is dated but the rooms themselves were clean and comfortable. If you are looking for a cheap place to stay, this is not a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever, HORRIBLE customer service”
Reviews.Author: Erin144
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here this last weekend for our honeymoon. I was completley appauled at this hotel. When we got to the hotel to check in, the entire hotel smelled like trash, it looked like there were refugees just posted up in the lobby, it took us over an hour to check in. When we checked in, they told us that we could upgrade to a mini suite room with a view. Well we had to pay for the upgrade, I thought they would do it for free cause it was our honeymoon. So I had to pay $60 extra for the upgrade. Well our room with a view was a brick wall. Plus this mini suite was so tiny, I was afraid to see what our original room would have been. Our room smelled like trash as well. I walked back down to the front desk to complain about our "view" and the smell. The manager on duty said he would refund our $60 for the upgrade, but said he couldnt switch us to another room cause they didnt have anything available. Really? that hotel has a million rooms and there was NOTHING else available? and when I complained about the smell, he said they couldnt do anything about it. The entore staff was rude to me. I can never get my honeymoon back and I am so dissapointed that my honeymoon was ruined. THis is the worst hotel ever, I do not recommend this hotel to anyone. Do not waste your money with this place.

Reviews.Title: “unpleasant surpise”
Reviews.Author: Stanislaw K
Reviews.Content: I had cockroaches in my room! had the room changed by the reception but if I could I would have gone to any other place in LV

Reviews.Title: “No clowning around...seriously!”
Reviews.Author: Lexa_1334607
Reviews.Content: On my first Las Vegas visit back in 1984, I stayed at Circus Circus. Twenty eight (28) years later, it's still a great family hotel/casino. Very affordable, nice rooms, good buffet, and great entertainment! A special thanks to Joseph at the check-in counter. He has a great personality, and made sure our stay was extra special. Thank you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Bang for the Buck”
Reviews.Author: carlofatx
Reviews.Content: For the money I've spent to stay at the newly renovated West Tower Rooms, Circus Circus exceeds my expectations! Checking-in was a breeze, and the staffs were very helpful. The room was very clean, up-to-date, and large! All in all, the money I've saved here were spent elsewhere! It is truly the best bang for my buck at the Las Vegas strip!

Reviews.Title: “oh my god what a DUMP”
Reviews.Author: Chris L
Reviews.Content: i mean i guess for 30 bucks what did i expect? i've seriously stayed in motel 6's that were nicer kept. i felt like i was going to get stabbed in the parking lot and was honestly surprised when our car wasn't broken into in the morning. would NEVER stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't judge a book by its cover / Great times!”
Reviews.Author: kassv98
Reviews.Content: I read reviews about Circus Circus AFTER booking, was very nervous about what our room was going to look like and what the hotel itself was going to be --- after getting there, my fears (as far as looks) were confirmed. Oa scale from 1-10, compared to other hotels in Vegas Circus Circus is 1.5 (vanity wise). I went with a group of friends, so it really didn't bother us since the hotel was only going to be a place to sleep. Our friends stayed in the Skyrise Tower. If you are staying in that tower, I highly recommend that you switch towers. My husband and I stayed in the West Tower which was very nice compared to the Skyrise. The Skyrise is very outdated and ugly. Low celings, smaller rooms. The West Tower was a lot newer and very nice. The first night we went out and didn't come back to the hotel until around 3am - full of energy and not wanting to end the night, we stopped at rock and rita's to have a few more drinks...WE FELL IN LOOOVE! At other hotels my husband and I were spending about $30 for two drinks, Rock & Rita's had great 2 for 1 specials. This turned out to be the best place to end the night (or morning ;-D) at. If you're just looking for a great time in Vegas, not wanting to stay at the hotel during the day and want to come back to a fun atmosphere with great drink specials then Circus Circus is the place for you! If you're looking to stay at the hotel for dinner and for your fun, then I'd suggest you book somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, horrible, horrible”
Reviews.Author: ShaneONeal
Reviews.Content: Checkin was like a visit to the free clinic on free flu shot day. Waited more than an hour baking in the 100 degree line with a hundred other pissed off people and their screaming babies. Finally got to the front to claim the room I had already prepaid online and was informed about the usurious fees they add on and don't tell you about until you get there. Tried to refuse them, but smug, patronizing front desk lady wouldn't let me. Made an angry scene, took my keys and my wife and I dropped our stuff in the room and went to eat dinner and cool off. Came back and my keys didn't work. Went to the front desk and had them reset, but they still didn't work. Came back again to the front desk, asked to speak to the manager and was informed that I was to be escorted out for making a scene 2 hours earlier.

Reviews.Title: “Makes Walmart look High-End”
Reviews.Author: BikerKaye
Reviews.Content: I enjoy finding a bargain as much as the next person, but cheap-beyond-belief isn't a bargain in my book. First impressions count, and we almost drove away when we pulled up! The place looked really, really shabby. A coat of paint at the very least would have been an improvement. The valets at most of the hotels in Vegas are really hustling. Circus Circus valets were invisible. We waited for about 15 minutes before one even strolled up, no smile, no hustle. Inside we were assaulted with cheap, cheap, cheap "boutiques". I've seen better merchandise in flea-markets. There was an "Everything-for-ten-bucks shop", then an "Everything-UNDER-ten-bucks shop", then the "Nothing over 99 cent shop". There wasn't a single "nice" shop in the whole place. We went to Circus Circus to see the Chuck Jones Experience and figured we'd get something to eat at the hotel before we left. After the over-priced and less than exciting "experience", I asked my husband where he wanted to eat. He said "Let's get outta this place." I can't imagine what the guest rooms must look like. Be afraid, be very afraid. In short, this place should be imploded by Friday!

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus where clowning around is allowed.:) wink, wink!!”
Reviews.Author: Anne H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a great time in Vegas and at Circus Circus. The hotel employees were very nice and helpful. The hotel was very beautiful and clean.. We live in alaska and it was so great to get away from here for a week. Cant' wait to go back. There was nothing about your hotel that I wasn't happy with. Thank you for making our week such a wonderful one.

Reviews.Title: “Dump!”
Reviews.Author: Joe M
Reviews.Content: The outside of the Hotel is very dated, the casino area is unclean, VERY smoky and just hectic! My husband and I felt like we were staying at a Wal Mart. Our room was on the 28th floor of the hotel, we had a view of the strip; however, the curtains and walls in the room were DIRTY. We were unable to determine what substance was stuck on the walls and curtains.....YUCK! I would play extra to stay on the "main" strip and have a clean room/hotel. NEVER again!

Reviews.Title: “A convenient spot in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: DrumMan49
Reviews.Content: Circus Circus is not one of the luxurious hotels of the strip but It is a huge hotel. We stayed there at January 2012. Rooms are also quit big and clean. We choose Circus Circus, 1- Price was very good, 2- Having the indoor theme park was a big advantage for the kids, 3- the Hotel is not far from the strip. There is a big car park behind the hotel and reaching the strip is only 4-5 min. from the hotel by car.The Lobby area is very big and there are many souvenir shops and fast food facilities at the Entrance Level.For sure "casino" is also there. ( There is subway and Mc Donalds outside on the corner) During check In they are charging 18 USD per room as resort fee. The Restaurant area is also very big and american style open buffet..( You can continue with the fried chicken and ice cream after your breakfast:) We stayed on a lower floor , inside of the room was ok but the view was terrible.Looking back of the hotel , probably direct to the air-conditioning building or something like that. As we spend all the time outside of the hotel, kids never used and never asked about the indoor theme park and other facilities :) Las Vegas is quit interesting city anyway and walking on the strip was far more then enough for them and also for us . I can advice this hotel if you want to stay in a big hotel close to strip but don't want to expect to much and not to prefer to spend to much money.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Carolyna C
Reviews.Content: I loved our room very clean and a great place for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money but out of the way.”
Reviews.Author: MartinQ
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd trip to Vegas, the first was 12 years ago at Mandalay Bay, I chose Circus Circus as we decided we wouldn't be in the room much and would prefer to save the cash for other things. We got a taxi to the hotel from the airport and paid $33 incl tip. If there's 2 of you I would suggest one of the shuttle buses as they ar so much cheaper (our return journey was $16 incl tip). Check in was busy, so we waited about 15 mins. Our reception was friendly, I asked for a strip view(I had requested one when booking online). We were put in 1550 which is the top floor of the casino level rooms, they had just been refurbished and were a nice size. 2 double beds, flat screen tv, and a partial strip view. The bathrooms were very tired looking and old, be warned when you flush the loo, it's so powerful the noise will make you jump! Lol There are ice machines near the lifts and vending machines for drinks, $3.00 for a bottle of coke is a rip off. If you need to withdraw cash from an ATM DO NOT use those in hotels, as well as the $3 fee they charge 4-5% on top. So 400 would be about $424.00!!! There are ATM's in the 7-11 or in Walgreens and at the fashion show mall which only charge a few dollars regardless of how much you withdraw. Would I stay in circus circus again? Despite the great price of about $48.00 including tax and resort fee, No I wouldn't. The hotel is a lower class hotel, and most of the people there were a little older than us, and it's too far from the main strip. All the staff were very friendly and we had no real issues, it's just not for us. Any questions please ask :)

Reviews.Title: “Updated and clean rooms, good for kids”
Reviews.Author: Goodvaluetravel
