Reviews.Content: This hotel is not one of the fanciest on the strip, but my kids enjoyed it as there was much themed towards them. There is an indoor theme park, carnival style games, circus acts, shopping and a variety of restaurants. The hotel casinos and common areas are still fairly dated and dingy, but the rooms are more updated and are kept very clean. The staff were very accomodating and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “been there 4 times within 2 months”
Reviews.Author: Harley V
Reviews.Content: had a great stay was able to check in early front desk was nice and helpful cant wait to go back again

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Don B
Reviews.Content: Great value hotel - excellent location on the strip and walking distance to convention centre. Good restaurants in the hotel, the Bistro is great for breakfast. Clean, comfortable rooms with nice beds.

Reviews.Title: “It does the job”
Reviews.Author: Ozmiga2012
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my girlfriend late last year because it was the cheapest hotel around those days. I was worried because of the poor reviews, plus its a little far from most of the action. But honestly it was not bad, the staff was very friendly and check in was fast. Beds were very comfortable and the room was clean, we were in the Skyrise Tower. I lost my wallet on the Monorail and a very nice gentleman found it and took it to the Circus Circus, they immediately contacted me to let me know someone had returned it, so I thought the staff were excellent. This is Vegas, you wont be spending a lot of time in your room anyway so if you are on a budget and know that it is an old hotel and not a luxurious one then this place will do the trick. PROS - Cheap, great staff, there's a lot of restaurants on site, comfortable beds, clean rooms CONS - outdated, a lot of kids Overall, I recommend it. Just know that its old and not a luxury resort. Approach the Circus with an open mind and you will like it.

Reviews.Title: “Top quality rooms, ok to bring kids, a bit off the main action”
Reviews.Author: LuciaSA
Reviews.Content: Our room at the tower was 4 star hotel quality and clean. We had booked it for $29 so REALLY good deal for the price. The complex includes, aside from the hotel and the casino, a few amusement park attractions, six restaurants, and an indoor recreation of a street with some stores. We were traveling with a toddler and she had a great time. They were a lot of children running around (they are very strict about them not walking through the gambling area so watch out). The customer service was good but impersonal as it can be expected from such a big hotel. The buffet (we tried dinner and breakfast) is absolutely worth your buck. A lot of variety, good quality, and also kid's friendly. Note, the whole complex has a funky smell to it of smoke and musty carpets, very subtile, but it is definitely there. It is located about four blocks away from the main Las Vegas strip action. In exchange, you get a bit more of a family friendly action plus ample space to park your RV or trailer. Overall, if you are passing through Vegas or traveling with children, you have your place at an unbeatable price. If you are going for a wild Vegas weekend a la Hangover, you may want to choose something more noisy and closer to the action.

Reviews.Title: “CIRCUS CIRCUS ACCOMADATIONS”
Reviews.Author: edward d
Reviews.Content: Circus Circus casino and hotel is a great place to stay at a resonable rate. The room are nice and clean and the service is great. Super environmnet in the casino area with a very nice sports book and good selection of places to eat. For the money, it is my place to stay when visiting Las vegas.

Reviews.Title: “A hectic dump but average once in bedroom/night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: seasonedtraveller84
Reviews.Content: Off the beaten-track but bus stops very near hotel so 15 mins to strip/downtown. Takes about 10 minutes to actually get to and from your room to the Strip so factor this into so factor this into your timings for flights, shows etc. Also - switch yourself on fully when making your first journey to your room - mine involved escalators, stairs and only certain elevators in different directions so just be aware of retaining all of this info. The walk to the hotel is basically through the casino, which was extremely busy, with quite a lively atmosphere. Walking past the food area was unpleasantly smelly. Reception - where I arrived at about 3 - was hectic, but they had lots of staff on and the receptionist was extremely pleasant. Hadn't read or heard anything of a resort fee (on top of paying for the room) and unsure what it entirely covers, though it does include Wifi which was reliable and useful. The bedroom was a decent size. The bed was not very hard at all, but given the calibre of the people staying at this hotel (well-nourished is a phrase I'd use) I think the springs had probably been used for all they were worth. Was woken up by what I thought was a few people waiting outside my bedroom door. When I left to check out, the entire floor was almost dominated by a group of South Americans, lounging about sprawled across the floor, presumably waiting for friends? Either way, not sure on which planet waiting outside people's bedroom doors at 9am making a lot of noise, rather than in a lounge/reception area, is a normal way of conducting yourself. So overall a fairly poor stay at a hotel which looks thoroughly dilapidated both outside and in.

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: brian-o-mac
Reviews.Content: Good: (1) Sky Rise rooms are nice enough (2) Comfy Beds Bad: (1) Location is the end of the Strip - bring your walking shoes (2) General cleanliness of the Hotel (3) Internet is very unreliable Ugly (1) Resort fee of $8 per day for non existent amenities (2) 45min wait to check in

Reviews.Title: “A little unloved”
Reviews.Author: Deirdre W
Reviews.Content: Hotel was a little shabby in places although new carpets were being fitted in the walkways. Stayed in the Sky tower and found it a long walk to get to the strip. Food was good and plentiful. The beds were very, very comfy. Staff a bit slow at responding to a request but did their very best in the end.

Reviews.Title: “4 night stay”
Reviews.Author: BeckyLane
Reviews.Content: Circus Circus has a few seperate blocks and our room faced towards the Stratosphere hotel. The stip is so large that it doesnt matter where you stay, the hop on hop off bus that runs all the way along and to Fremont Street stops right outside. Our room was spacious with a good shower and large bed. It was clean and good value. We weren't too bothered about spending a fortune on a hotel because to be honest, you're hardly in it! The buffet breakfast in the hotel was purchased separately and was really good value with lots of choice. The hotel is not as far down to Fremont Street as the Stratosphere and is walking distance to the Wynn and other well known hotels. Be sure to try the Peppermill restaurant straight across!

Reviews.Title: “West Tower”
Reviews.Author: Jeanne M
Reviews.Content: We were 'upgraded' to the West Tower after reserving a room at the Skyrise Tower. Room was comfortable and clean. The safe didn't work and we put a ticket in to have it repaired, waited or an hour and half still nobody came to fix it. Told the front desk that we were going for dinner after waiting that long for a no-show. Called the front desk again and was told we had to wait at least an hour! She was condescending after I told her that we had already waited 1 1/2 hrs prior! We had been driving all day and was exhausted! Rates were very reasonable, front desk service sucked.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but not worth it.”
Reviews.Author: raspberryd
Reviews.Content: Cheap price but the hotel is at the end the strip away from everything. Even though they said they updated the rooms it's still soo dated. Next time I would rather spend more money and stay in the middle newer hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: JustMe123170
Reviews.Content: I just stayed returned from my stay at Circus Circus in Las Vegas. It was way better then I expected it to be. I have never really been a fan of Circus Circus but I was looking for somewhere inexpensive to stay and they fit the bill. Stayed in the Skyrise Tower. The room was clean. The bed was very comfortable (more comfy then my bed at home). The staff was friendly. I read a lot of reviews about the check in line and was worried. I only had to wait about 5 minutes to check in and the desk staff was very friendly. So all in all, I was actually impressed with Circus Circus and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It's Circus Circus!”
Reviews.Author: db98026
Reviews.Content: I did not have any problems at all with my room and experience at Circus Circus.You MUST stay in a West Tower or Casino Tower room.The Skyrise tower is old and DON'T EVEN THINK ABOUT A MANOR ROOM!That being said..Our room in the West Tower was your typical Vegas room and was very clean and comfortable.Everyone that complains on here about kids and noise should have known that when you book at a place like Circus Circus.Rock and Ritas had good food as did the pizza place but stay away from the buffet.It is at the North end of the strip and close to The Riviera and Stratosphere but a rental car or cab/bus is needed to get to the center of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “The cleanness hotel room I have ever stay in or seen.”
Reviews.Author: Larry68m4
Reviews.Content: I have worked in a "5 star" hotel in KY, but Circus Circus' rooms made that 5 star room look like a dump. No dust, smears, or dirt anywhere. Room was always refreshed, bed made! And carpet vacuumed. I will stay at Circus Circus again..

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus!!!”
Reviews.Author: Neil E
Reviews.Content: We took this break in October about three years back, didnt know anything about the hotel except what we had read/were told, so took it at face value. Initially on entrance after an easy check in it was slightly confusing getting to our room but once we got our bearings it was fine. You pass through the casino itself to reach the rooms and also to get to the various restaraunts. Room was standard fare for US hotels, clean, comfy and fairly quiet (10th floor I think), non smoking also. The various eateries were either buffet style for one of the larger ones with plenty to choose from and others had a menu style which was vast and available 24/7!! You can also order in from an in house pizza place. There are also a few small shops, coffee and donut places etc. to occupy a few moments. We travelled as a family and although you might think this would curtail things a tad this was not the case as there are LOTS of other things aside from gambling to see and do in and around Vegas for families. Book excursions in house and broker a good deal and also look for cheap show tickets at some of the ticket vendors on the strip. As a quick example we got the Excalibur dinner and show for less than $20 each. Dont miss Freemont Street at night, but take the bus (cheap) or a taxi there as its a fair walk and not that safe at night. All in all we would stay again as it was a reasonable hotel and ideal if you are on a budget. After all, you only flop in your room, the rest of the time is spent out exploring! Dont forget the in house theme park also. Warning though, Vegas is intense so be prepared!!! Nevertheless, good fun was had all round!

Reviews.Title: “circus circus hotel”
Reviews.Author: soni_lozano
Reviews.Content: Clean and friendly experiance at a great price . They have so many freebies and your in beteween Las Vegas Strip and Downtown (which I love!). I went in Sept. 2011 and going back Feb. 2012

Reviews.Title: “Everything We Needed”
Reviews.Author: firequeen1962
Reviews.Content: Although Circus Circus isn't the flashiest hotel on The Strip it is very reasonably priced, comfortable and provided everything we needed for our short stay. We stayed in the West Tower which cost a little more than some of the other rooms but I think it was well worth it because it was quite modern and spacious. Our rooms included vouchers for 2 people each day of our star for the breakfast/lunch buffet and we certainly made use of them. Using these vouchers meant the 3 of us ate a full buffet breakfast/brunch for about $12.50 each day, I don't think that anywhere could beat that. Because we'd had a big, and slightly later, breakfast it meant we didn't need lunch. We'd just have dinner before whatever show we were seeing that night. I'd say that Circus Circus is definitely great value and I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: kamalkrishkapoor
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this property from 15th January to 18th January . I have been to Vegas earlier also last year and that time I stayed in Excalibur , but this time couple of my friends also joined me here and they were staying in middle of the strip. I was looking for some thing on low budget but value for money and this hotel just fitted the bill perfectly. Check in was within 5-10 minutes and I was given a room in their Skyrise Towers. Room was spacious with Flat screen TV, free wi fi , iron and a safe in room was also given. Beds were comfortable and room was clean. Food joints in the hotel were not so good and the variety was not there so if you are looking for some good food you need to look for other restaurants. Hotel offers all you eat buffets which serve breakfast , lunch and dinner for different prices and the quality is ok so if you wish to have a hearty morning break fast and then start seeing different places around vegas then it will serve your purpose. Casino there is just about fine. Drinks are expensive so better to have your own supply in the room :) Bottom line value for money. Only disadvantage which a traveler can find is it is just too far away from the action but a bus covers all the strip and it drops you at circus circus. I just bought a daily all you ride pass for 7 bucks so the distance problem is solved with this pass.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you Pay for.”
Reviews.Content: This place is really old and run down. The rooms are big and they are cheap - $26 plus $7.90 fee. The whole place stinks of ciggaret smoke, if you walk through the casino you will smell like smoke for the rest of the day. Good place to take family if on a budget but stay elsewhere if you can afford it. The adventure zone is great for young kids. On arrival both rooms safes did not work and there was no WIFI and the front desk would not answer. Finally got the maintenance guys up after 30 mins (these guys where great) who also tried to fix the WIFi with no luck and no help from front desk, finally after 2 days with no WIFI contacted the laptop support people who fixed it. One day room did not get serviced and we contacted maid service for fresh towels but they never arrived. Staff here seem to be not happy and no one is overly friendly. Purchased some drinks at one shop and the assistant didn't even get of the phone when she served me. After going to some of the other hotels such as NYNY and Treasure Island you can really see the difference compared to this old hotel. Another problem if you have young family nothing here opens till 11am, so you have to find some alternative entertainment for the kids. Parking is free.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of what I expected”
Reviews.Author: vegas657
Reviews.Content: I was out in vegas in Jan for the CES show, it was a last minute thing so did nt book hotels and flights until 4 days before. Consequently could nt get anything close to the exhibition center that i fancied not for less that $400 a night plus...and seeing as I was staying for 5 nights that blew my budget. Then I checked Circus Circus. I have been to vegas a few times and never thought of staying here as it looks a little tired and its at the wrong end of the strip for me. But all that being said....it was ok. I paid $800 for 5 nights at a peak time and booked short notice, it was full of families but its the only place that is. so bang for your buck it was ok. I guess you get what you pay for. I met a friend in the Bellagio for a beer and paid $32 for 2 drinks . Vodka on the rocks and a corona...Circus circus...half that...for a couple of beers at the end of the day Circus circus was quite ok.

Reviews.Title: “the worst”
Reviews.Author: Artice S
Reviews.Content: don't do it. Rooms are filthy and ugly. You might think you are saving money, but there are better choices that will save you a headache. You will feel low class if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Quite poor”
Reviews.Author: Andy P
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as others members of a wedding were staying here It's quite dated and is just okay. This seems like the poor relative of Vegas. Wouldn't stay here again, but if you on a budget then it's okay

Reviews.Title: “It's in between poor and average”
Reviews.Author: tsjn n
Reviews.Content: Me and a few friends booked our reservations at Circus Circus a MONTH + another week or so for the suites in the west tower, we had paid online for these suites, we were looking forward to this trip being as it was our first time in Vegas. As we were going to check in, we waited in line for about 30 minutes to find out that they had given our suites away!!!!!! We were not happy campers the first 2 nights because of this fact. Another thing, if you are going to Vegas to party with your friends (we were there for New Years which was theeee worse decision EVER), obviously Circus Circus is NOT the place to stay being as parents have their kids in strollers out with them pretty late, if you mind being around children while under the influence, I would suggest staying somewhere where there are NO KIDS!!! I would say the service is good, they come to the room daily, but the check-in service was BS being as again, they gave our suites away!!!

Reviews.Title: “A good value for the price.”
Reviews.Author: mainellonlady
Reviews.Content: The hotel is over 40 years old and they are working to update it. If you want glitz this isn't the place for you. If you want a good value, I'd chose this hotel. Located right on a Deuce stop (bus route), its convenient for getting around when your feet give out! The room wasn't well equipped, but it was certainly a good value. You don't spend a lot of time in the room!! We didn't sleep well due to softer mattresses than we're used to and noise from the town below, but that is probably our own issues. The employees were helpful and friendly. The casino has $3 blackjack, which is a rarity in Vegas! We ate at a couple of the restaurants in the hotel and the food was very good. There is a 1/2 price ticket booth located right in the lobby, which we used daily. If you buy a show ticket there, the next day you can skip the lines and use the VIP line with your stub from the previous day.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for what we wanted, but not hugely special. Value for money.”
Reviews.Author: ClareTheHutgirl
Reviews.Content: Booked Circus Circus as it was by far the cheapest on the Strip when taking into account their regular 50% off room sales- weekends are obviously more expensive, with midweek prices being extremely reasonable. It is a little further up the strip than the majority of the other hotel/casinos, making it necessary to take the deuce bus down the strip to explore (just a little past easy walking distance). We arrived at about 10pm on a thursday night and stood in line for around 30 minutes to check in as there was only one receptionist on duty. We were 'upgraded' to the Casino Tower from the Skyrise Tower due to this wait, which was nice as it put us in a more convenient location (I'm not sure the room was nicer, however!). The room is spacious and fairly well thought out, although there is a little bit of a shortage of storage space (although the same can be said for hotel rooms everywhere). One fairly major downside is that they only change the linens if you request it, and despite our requesting it, the sheets have only been changed once in our fortnight long stay. The towels etc are replenished daily however. There are plenty of restaurants on site, but we've avoided the buffet so far because of mediocre at best reviews. Rock & Rita's and The Garden Grill were both nice but fairly average. The Pizzeria was pretty good, and delivers to your room, and the Westside Deli seems expensive at first glance, with deli sandwiches coming in at around $7.99, but they are stuffed full and very tasty. Overall, while this clearly isn't one of the best hotels on the strip, it's easily worth the money, and it's slightly inconvenient location is balanced by the fact it has free circus entertainment acts and an addictive arcade to keep you busy here, and the Deuce bus stop just outside the door for when you want to go exploring. As a minor point, as the pools are all outside, they shut them down during the winter- so even though it was 21 degrees C plus (60's), easily warm enough for swimming, they consider this too cold and aren't planning on opening the pools until 1st March (this information was super hard to find out!)

Reviews.Title: “I'm sure Circus Circus would have been great in the 20th Century”
Reviews.Author: Alan504022
Reviews.Content: Circus Circus is at the far end of the strip and at the time of us visiting it was almost by itself as the casinos at the top of the stripped have been knocked down and new ones are being built in it's place. Unlike the newer casinos Circus Circus is very dingy and a bit depressing, even the waitresses seem to have not been let out since the 20th Century. On the good side it is very cheap!

Reviews.Title: “great if going with kids has a carnival on top of hotel yes carnival roller coaster and all”
Reviews.Author: alice b
Reviews.Content: did;nt have enought time there would go back again. was only there for the two nights as i was traveling big hotel gave me a map to get to reception then when i got to reception got another map to get to my room. rooms big and clean.its at the other end of the strip but you get to see a lot of the strip others wont see riveria across the road .injoy

Reviews.Title: “You have to consider the price and it's unique property features”
Reviews.Author: Abe C
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a bit for work and have stayed in all kinds of hotels and motels. I get a travel expense account and if I stay in a hotel that is below my allowance, I can pocket the difference. Don't get me wrong, I don't stay in every dive I can find to save a penny, I have seen the news specials about how dirty hotel rooms really are. But for less than $25 a night, the Circus Circus is the Beverly Wilshire of Hotels under $30! The $100 a night I saved over staying in the Bellagio allowed me to eat better, see the "O" Cirque Du Soliel show and see the Grand Canyon for what I would normally spend in New York doing nothing in a inferior hotel. I love Vegas for this reason, and I hope to be back soon, it's crazy cheap compared to other places. Circus Circus is a great hotel for the money, it does have it's major downsides such as it's remote location being a far walk away from where all the action is. It's also an old property, but the rooms are surprisingly nice and spacious, this hotel could easily cost $200 a night in any other major city. If you have kids, this hotel has more to offer than any other property with the Adventure Dome. One of my favorite things about Circus Circus is the Steakhouse, unbelievably good and a great value. For the money, you can't go wrong with the Circus Circus, if it was any lower price, the homeless could afford to live here.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back to Circus Circus”
Reviews.Author: themomWarren
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean, spacious, comfortable and the bed was beyond comfortable. Check in was very fast and we got a choice of high or low rooms. We had a great view to the North. I don't think I've ever had such a big bathroom in a hotel before. Nice power strip next to the desk was very handy. I hope to be back in Las Vegas next year and will be glad to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: tradlyn
Reviews.Content: I have stayed as this hotel many times since the 1970's and it has not improved at all. What is required is paint and good cleaning. The location at the east end of The Strip is not good as all the newer hotels are on the western end. I shall not visit Circus Circus again.

Reviews.Title: “1st time there”
Reviews.Author: bradley m
Reviews.Content: I found our room very nice, it had a king bed which was comfortable, it was a good value check in is a breeze from what i had heard i would be a wait, the lady at the desk was very friendly slots of fun was a place for cheap drinks and barteners were good guys were travel up and down the strip by bus which stops right outside over all its was a nice place we had no problems

Reviews.Title: “If you have children, this is a great hotel to go to.”
Reviews.Author: NewarkScubaDiver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Circus Circus hotel with a group of eight. Two senior citizens, my wife and I, our two teenagers and two year old twins. It has an indoor amusement park which is great for two or three day stay. Add in the 'circus' portion of the hotel and you're good for about 3 to 4 days maximum.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but there are better for the same price”
Reviews.Author: Homero A
Reviews.Content: Its a very good hotel, nice rooms, great attention, but you can find great deals at the same street in better hotels

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, wonderful budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: dippydaisy21
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our visit to the fabulous Las Vegas...what an experience. Staying at the Circus Circus was absolutley perfect for us. Located at the quietier end of the strip we weren't bothered by noise or traffic. The room was huge, clean and the beds exceptionally comfty. Check in was a breeze, we were expecting at least 1hour wait as we have read other reviews. The guy on the desk couldn't of been more helpful and the little book of coupons very useful as we found the States very expensive! Overall we found the hotel to be a wonderful budget hotel with lots of things to do and useful little shop on site for everything from that much needed cold drink to snacks for when you get peckish. All the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful which always makes such a difference to your stay..we would definatley stay again. Top tip for me would be to get up early and walk from the hotel all the way down the Strip popping into all the other hotels along the way, must visit Dennys diner for a fabulous breakfast ..it takes all day but so worth it..you miss so much travelling by(very expensive) cab! Don't miss the view from the Stratosphere..breathtaking.

Reviews.Title: “CIRCUS CIRCUS....SKYRISE TOWER KING”
Reviews.Author: naslund999
Reviews.Content: We were told not to stay there, it's too far and outdated....WRONG!!!!! yeah it's one of the furthest on the strip, but from the center of the strip to there was around an $8 cab ride. Room was clean and big, staff was excellent. Hotel has all you need in there. We had a GREAT time.

Reviews.Title: “Fun for kids”
Reviews.Author: Bollywoodmum
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights and was the only hotel that we could afford two rooms for a family of 5. Reluctant at first but the kids were very entertained and the security was faultless. Chn enjoyed watching the free shows which are very regular, free rides and the arcade area right next to McDonalds within the hotel. Room is basic but clean. Good value for the price- the only disadvantage is it is located at the very boring end of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive and reasonable”
Reviews.Author: skaterdude
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because of its proximity to the Convention Center and inexpensive price with decent ratings. I was in LV for CES, so wasn't looking for lots of amenities. I took the shuttle from the airport and the trip was LONG because this hotel is at the north end of the Strip - they had to drop darn near everyone else off before they got there, so beware. Check-in was quick - much better than I expected after reading some of the other reviews on this and other sites. I had picked a tower room due to the spotty reviews of the cheapest rooms. It was quite a hike to get to my room. And then when I wanted to go out for a walk, it was an even longer walk to get to the street! So if you choose a tower room, take that into account. The room was just OK. It was clean, but you can tell it's a little older. The high-speed internet was disappointing. It was included in the resort fee, but I ended up using my mobile phone connection instead. The bathroom and shower were about average. Little things like the toilet seat not staying up just made it irritating (it's a guy thing). The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet, so I got a good sleep, which was my main goal on this trip anyway. Check out was fast - I used the TV checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Changed my review”
Reviews.Author: FEnriqueCV
Reviews.Content: I just checked my room out. Nice surprise, my friend chose this hotel in Vegas eventhough I was not conviced at all as the last time I stayed in "manor rooms" which are a disaster, but in "skyrise" section Circus has newly renovated rooms with new carpet and some renewed furniture. Location is good as the strip is the best place to walk along, fast food restaurants really close and a plus is the ross store there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay in the Off Season”
Reviews.Author: Alison O
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were doing a cross country trip when are car died on us in Las Vegas- using my iphone Hotels App we came across Circus Circus for $30 which was great because it fit out budget and still was in an area which allowed us to walk and enjoy the city without our car. The only downside of this hotel is that the didnt honor the price we found on hotels.com. They charged us $35 and an unexpected "Resort fee of $7" so after taxes it came out to $45. I realize that this is still cheap, but it was misleading and had we known that we would have found a cheaper place which the now added expense of repairing our car. Aside from this, being that I am a bit OCD, cleansiness is always my biggest priority. The rooms, although far from the main hotel, were IMMACULATE. Extremely clean room and SO COMFY!! We had a huge king size bed, with a lovely bathroom and all the amenities!! Would def stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “My stay wasn't bad, but not really spectacular either.”
Reviews.Author: John1971NC
Reviews.Content: I stayed in one of the manor towers from the 4-6th of January. The rooms looked clean, but had smell of alcohol, once inside the building. There were no vending machines to be found. The free buffets and two complementary rides in the adventure dome were alright. It is quite a walk from the manor bldgs to the casino though. Also, even though MGM owns circus circus, the m life card does not work there as circus circus has their own players club card. And the closest casino that accepts the m life card is the mirage, about a mile down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus..Cheap, but still fun”
Reviews.Author: tdhbm
Reviews.Content: Since we spent almost $500 on Phantom of the Opera tickets and $120 on Beatles Show tickets, I decided to cancel my $420 2-night stay at the Palazzo in favor of a $108 2-night stay at Circus Circus. Yes, from one extreme to the other!!! But, since we spent a lot of our time going to the 2 chosen shows, which were in nicer locations (The Venetian and The Planet Hollywood), we still got a taste for the opulent side of Vegas.....enough that would be appropriate for 11 and 13-year old children! Smoke was everywhere at Circus Circus (except the non=-smoking room, of course), and my eyes were red and stinging by the time we left. The Casino Tower room we were assigned had been nicely remodelled and was on a nice high floor. They even threw in 2 free buffets as well as 2 free kids rides and 2 free arcade games. The kids loved the Adventuredome and all the arcade games, where prizes were not too difficult to win. (Except for those claw machines with stuffed animals...they really cheat you by dropping the item you actually capture before it gets to the drop bin...it is as if they make the mechanism jerky purposefully to prevent anyone from actually winning...very disheartening for kids) Overall, this is a fun place for kids and fun for adults if you enjoy watching your kids have fun. The breakfast buffet was good. Rockin ritas was expensive for our dinner and very slow service. (albeit, it is a great environment for watching sports). Do NOT go to Haufbrouers... it advertises itself to be a sports bar, but it is far from that. We were there at 3:45 and were given the dinner menu... 1 big pretzel with mustard dip, 2 sandwiches with fries and 3 beers came to $80. It was a really bad experience...we watched football alone in a huge beer garden, where we went there after seeing an ad touting it as a sports bar. Back to Circus Circus...It was fine for the price for what we wanted from this family trip. We saw some "interesting" characters there, but got out enough to experience higher-class venues as well. Since it was winter and pools were not a factor, I am happy we chose to spend our budget on the shows. Circus Circus was a fantastic value for what we got. They give a lot to keep you in their facility long enough to get money from you in other ways...but it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: dopo2121
Reviews.Content: This hotel was cheap, but not enough to make it worth it. Let me start by saying that while this hotel wasn't HORRIBLE, you can get a room at a hotel that is much better located and probably not as gross and costs the same. I stayed in one of the "manor" things, which are more crummy than the rest of the hotel, but I don't think it makes much of a difference; I've heard bad stuff about the sky tower as well. First of all, this hotel is right at the end of the strip (and at the boring end, as well). We were there for a wedding at the Mandalay Bay hotel, and it took us a few hours to get back and forth on the public transportation. Now I realize that it's close to the convention center and stuff, but if your goal is to be spending time on the strip, this is a very poor location. The rooms were moldy and gross and obscenely aged. We didn't take our shoes off while we were in the room, and there was visible mold in the bathroom. The attractions were decent, and I can't speak for the casinos, but there were enough tacky rides and shows to entertain us for one of the two nights we were there. Again, it wasn't HORRIBLE, but we could have done a lot better for our money. At least try to get one of the towers if you really want to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice way to end a trip”
Reviews.Author: PrincesseEm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before our flights after having stayed 3 nights at another hotel in Vegas and having taken a short road trip for 2 nights. We just needed a place to lay our heads and ended up being happier with the Circus Circus than the other more expensive hotel we'd booked for the first part of our stay. We booked an incredibly cheap rate on hotels.com and went in with no expections beyond sleeping. The check in agent who helped us was fantastic - so friendly, upbeat and polite! She chatted with us and made us feel welcome and comfortable. She also upgraded us to a tower room but did mention that what we'd booked (something in the Manor) was the "motel" and one would definitely benefit from paying a little extra to stay in the tower. Anyway, we found our way to our room and though it had older furnishings it was nice and large with a decent view of the strip. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom (again, older fixtures) was clean and well maintained. We had breakfast the next morning in the hotel (don't remember the restaurant) but we were given a savings passport full of coupons to use at various restaurants and shops around the property. Breakfast was cheap, delicious and plentiful. No complaints there. Overall we actually decided that should we ever come back to Vegas that the Circus Circus will be a contender over the other more centrally located, "higher end" and more expensive hotel we had chosen to start!

Reviews.Title: “Nearby the convention center”
Reviews.Author: The_Wayfarer2
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times when visiting shows at the convention center. Hotel is showing it's age, but it perfectly adequate for a short business trip. It's very near where I need to be which is why I choose it. Hotel is very big, with many towers. I found the section 'Leisure Skyrise' to be the best tower. Rooms are large and generally pretty clean.

Reviews.Title: “on par with expectations”
Reviews.Author: TimoLV
Reviews.Content: Although I had to wait a long time to check in, It was Friday night and while other hotels were way more expensive... I was fine with it for the price. The room was decent though very quickly cleaned. I would not pay full price here ever as the way they cut corners it is not worth it. For their discounted rates, however, this hotel is totally worth it. The beds are decent, the linens smelled clean, the towels are tiny so you need them both when you get out of the shower. Don't touch the shower curtain since it probably hasn't been washed in a month. The hotel's food establishments are horrible, with one exception. The steakhouse which has been around for years. It is great.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: czadco
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect place for families traveling with children, also there is not much in the way of barely covered staff so feel free to walk around with your kids. That being said there is no club or night life for adults although the location is so good and close to the deuce you can easily be transported to any of the destinations in minutes. The service is very good and rooms were clean, worst part was checking in, but after seeing other hotels it was not bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “Not for regular price”
Reviews.Author: goingblonde
Reviews.Content: I would never stay here for more then the discount rate. We got a great deal for a friday and Sat night which is the reason we stayed - which was also our first time staying at Circus Circus. It is okay overall unless you do not wish to be around a lot of kids- which we do not , but like i said had a great deal so we expected t be around them this time. The room was nice -again for the price for the normal rate i have seen them charging oh no way - There are many places to shop located right in the casino and that is nice. But the location of Circus Circus is not a great one. Across the street we went in the Riveria and it was empty on a friday night- ugh.And then there is that big empty Sahara not far up the way and that is just plain creepy to look at. I think Circus Circus has seen its better days long ago and the rides and games for the kids is what keeps it up and running- if all the famalies with children were not there it would have been pretty empty as well. I would highly recomend this to those that are bringing their kids to Vegas. As far as a casino in general it seems out dated in a way i cant really desrcibe - but i have seen and been in worse. But unless we get a good discount again would not go back.The rooms are not very sound proof and i was kept awake from the people next to us -not fun! oh and as for check in we arrived late after 8pm- so we didnt have a long wait -i cant say how check in would be at normal hours but from the look of it it may be a long wait.Also they charge a resort fee when you check in that was NOT mentioned before hand- RESORT CHARGE ?? UM??not even remotely a resort here -L.O.L

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids”
Reviews.Author: Aussie-traveler-04
Reviews.Content: As mentioned many times before, the check in is shocking up to 1 1/2 hours, but if you survive that it is a great place for the kids. Ours were mid teens and we were able to leave them and go to the adult areas, knowing they were safe. (it is a casino with more cameras and security then you poke a stick at) The rooms are what you expect for the price and the maintenance is starting to overwhelm them as it is quite aging and our aircon was trying to take off with the noise it was making. Overall if you want somewhere in the middle of Vegas and you have kids, this is the place, they loved it

Reviews.Title: “not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Stella B
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my friends last year and we didnt like it from the beginning - almost one hour spent in the check-in queue, annoyed staff, in our non-smoking room we could smell the smoke, really annoying....well, the prices werent too bad but it wasn't worth it....Nevermore is all I'm saying

Reviews.Title: “Decent rooms but it is literally a circus”
Reviews.Author: bitzywoo
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend stayed here for 5 nights over New Year. We had to queue around half hour on check in and the lobby is like a day care centre. it was only 6pm but it is still the same around the whole hotel even at midnight! we had free breakfast buffet and were astounded at the amount of food available, we didnt eat for the rest of the day so was a real bonus. it is a way down from the main strip but we enjoyed the walk everyday. We were in skyrise towers and our beds were really soft and comfy, roomy and the bathroom was spotless - really pleased. The actual hotel is outdated and is one of the budget hotels. It is a family hotel so if you are prepared to bump into kids and really rude arrogant guests then this is your place!

Reviews.Title: “Well is a cheap hotel, do not expect more”
Reviews.Author: MXvoyager1
Reviews.Content: I was at the Luxor hotel, they recommend me to book at the Circus Circus due my kids, but, rooms are small, room was not cleaned one day, even I call the managemente and the kindly offer to do it but I was too tired, anyway, but I expect a daily clean for my room anyway! If you are looking out for a cheap hotel this is an option for family , but not for couples or firends neither business, do not expect anything more.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Columbus37
Reviews.Content: Having read all the reviews about Circus Circus I had very low expectations, however after the initial check in which was horrendous, things got better. The Garden Grill Restaurant was magnificent and Rock n' Rita's gave us real American experience. We went for New Year and although located at the bottom of the strip perfect for children, we were able to stand and watch the fireworks from a safe distance from all the crowds. Premium outlet north was a short taxi ride away and the bargains were fantastic. Although circus circus is old and a bit smelly in the manor lodge where we stayed you got used to it and although cheap you actually get more than you paid for, therefore I would not hesitate in recommending. Yes, it's not as glamorous than some of the magnificent hotels in Vegas but it is the only one that really caters for children, with the Adventure Dome and Circus on site.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap cheap”
Reviews.Author: rv50
Reviews.Content: We paid 40 $ per night to stay in this hotel buffet included. Location a bit far from the main attractions and need to take the bus. Nice rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad, good price, rooms ok, but - what's that smell?”
Reviews.Author: debnfred
Reviews.Content: Stayed just after New Year's, long wait at check-in and of course they didn't give us the adjoining rooms they promised us. In fact, they tried to put us on 2 different floors. But as always, stand firm at check-in and they'll put you on the same floor at least. The best part was our room deal came with free buffet vouchers, and they gave us a list of other resorts that honor the vouchers, so we dined at Aria. Most delicious! The beds were comfy, the linens were nice, but the bathroom was a little grungy. The worst: That Smell. Both rooms experienced it. Sulfur-sewer-y. We figured since both of our rooms were experiencing it, it wasn't worth the trouble to pack everything up and just experience it in a new room. It was too far down the strip to walk so we drove and parked free at resorts, or took a cab. Just be aware - if you don't specifically say to stay on the strip the cabdriver is legally allowed to take a "shortcut" and one driver took us out onto the freeway and got us stuck in a traffic jam for 45 minutes. We expected to see lots of kids, so that didn't bother us. At Rock n Ritas they sell a large ceramic toilet filled with beer for $26 - very classy. I might stay there again, the price was great, but we did spend a lot of money on cabs....

Reviews.Title: “Kids paradise in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Erika A
Reviews.Content: A lot of people ask who takes kids to Vegas, but the truth is that Vegas has a lot of activities on and off the strip. They even have a Childrens Museum. Plus, it is affordable. That said, Circus Circus is the most kid-friendly hotel with the midway, free circus acts, and the Adventuredome. Both the sky tower and casino tower have been recently renovated and are very nice. Check-in is fast and easy. You can get an all day ride pass for 17 bucks for kids and 27 for adults (5 bucks off if you use the coupon book) which is way cheaper than Disneyland! The buffet is ok- I don't like buffets personally. Overall, a great value and fun in Vegas. But don't go if you are put off by kids.

Reviews.Title: “a childrens playground”
Reviews.Author: stevejtenmen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is exactly as it says-Circus Circus...but dont be put off too much if you are travelling without kids. We read various reviews before travelling to Vegas so it was no suprise that the hotel and facillities are aimed at the family market, Having said that-our stay was pleasant the room immaculate (casino tower) and staff superb and very helpful.We travelled as a couple .

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: laguys
Reviews.Content: We are so sorry we stayed at the Circus Circus at the end of our vacation. It left a bad memory. Terrible room, dirty hallways, noisy, drunk neighbors, crowded and pushy people everywhere, and noise, noise, noise! Even our 6-year-old son hated it!

Reviews.Title: “save your money and go elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: nashvillejonny
Reviews.Content: Started our vacation with our 3 grandkids at circus circus, Thought they would enjoy the first leg of the trip........ WRONG!!!! The dirtiest, Rudest, Way over dated, Overpriced resort i have ever seen!!! Go to the golden nugget downtown, Now thats a place for all!!

Reviews.Title: “NOT IMPRESSED”
Reviews.Author: William L
Reviews.Content: I stayed here back in March of 2011 for a business trip. I must say that I was not overly impressed. The customer service I received was much better than I tought it would be when I checked in and out, however, some of the other employees in gaming and some of the shops need a few lessons in treating their guests with some respect. I do not plan on staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money but you get what you pay for....”
Reviews.Author: victorialad
Reviews.Content: Quick one on Circus Circus. Spent a few nights last summer with my family in the renovated rooms. Booked through their website, it was very cheap and got some extras (kids eat free....). I kind of knew what i was getting so i was not dissapointed, saved money and the klds liked it. Plus, - they have a very good indoor amusement park which is great for kids - buffet is same as in other hotels - loads of food - but cheaper, so good value for money. Not worthy going down the road for a coffe and a donuts, trust me you end paying as much - room in the renovated area are just fine and good value for the money. Cannot comment on other rooms or swiming pools as we did not use it. Things to bear in mind: - it is not in the middle of the strip so for us coming from Europe and all jet lagged it could be a bit tiring to walk/drive down the strip. Having said that, all hotels have free parking so you can always drive around - it is a huge hotel so avoid peak check in times otherwise you will be queing for hours, as it happened to us. If you see a huge queue, go for a walk and return late in the day if you can - you may (will) not get the requirements requested when booking. I asked for intercommunicated rooms and could not get one. Not a big deal as they helped us by getting us in the same floor but be aware. - service is limited but we only wanted a decent place to sleep pand keep our stuff. So depending what you are looking for, Circus Circus could well fit the bill. Stay in the refurbrished rooms though. If you are looking after luxury, service, nice pool,..... Circus Circus is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: LIVINGlifewithGI
Reviews.Content: OK so this was the cheapest accommodation on the strip, This hotel is so far from the strip it takes 30 mins walk to get to the strip and walking through Circus Circus is really like being in a Old Circus this place is so dirty and run down, The rooms are the same run down and paper thin walls you can hear everything, the hallways have the worst smell it's like drinks have been spilled and never cleaned up. When walking around this hotel it's like getting pushed through like cattle we spent more time at other hotels then in ours we would go home sleep and leave and not come back till we had too really didn't want to be there but already prepaid non refundable, So really I wouldn't stay there ever again I would pay double and stay in the strip then here even with kids, this place needs a massive makeover just to put it nicely.

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus at Christmas”
Reviews.Author: lisa c
Reviews.Content: Overall, this hotel was good. On our check in our room needed hoovering and dusting! we waited for two days before saying anything where shelly on reception changed our room - strange i know as nothing a hoover and duster wouldn't have cured! (shame the room attendant wasn't so gracious apart from taking the tips!!) our new room in the main tower was lovely spacious and clean. The hotel itself we felt was the ideal place in the sence in the middle of old and new strip but would recommend getting the three day pass on the double deuce bus which is only $20 for the 3 day pass. Don't be fooled and get the sightseeing bus its $40 for 2 days and the double deuce will go to all the same places and runs 24hrs whereas the tour bus finishes at 6pm big bonus you don't have to tip the bus driver!!!

Reviews.Title: “Most understaffed hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Hoggg6
Reviews.Content: Arrived 10:45 pm and waited in line 1 1/2 hours for hotel room, everything we did at hotel we had to wait. so understaffed, worst time we've ever had in Vegas, rooms clean in casino tower but everything else was a mess... Don't do it, stay somewhere else and just visit one day if u have kids, staff was friendly management cared a less!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away unless you have kids”
Reviews.Author: redwhiskeypete
Reviews.Content: Ok, this place does the best it can in accommodating families with kids but that being said, stay away if you don’t have to bring the kids to Vegas. The rides in the adventure Dome are way over priced. There is one ride that shoots the kids up a pole then plunges them back down, whole thing lasts 30 seconds and eight dollars. When you check in you will pay a “resort” fee. With that you will get a book with coupons, one of these will be $5.00 off an all day pass at the Adventure Dome Use it. Its cheaper then three eight dollar ride tickets. Here is another tip, give yourself plenty of time to escape from this place. We had to wait on six elevators before we found one that wasn’t full. This was common during our three day stay. We also had free buffet coupons which we used for breakfast. I would never pay for the breakfast we had. Bacon was pretty greasy eggs cold, ect. To be fair though, it’s tough to do a breakfast buffet style. Another peeve was at one of the bars Rock & Ritas where they had video poker. They will not comp you a drink while you play at this bar even when there is no entertainment and it’s dead with no one else at the bar. To add injury to insult the video poker machines at this bar have a horrible payout. Just a short walk away there is another bar with better payouts and you can get comped drinks. We stayed in the skyrise towers which are a pretty long walk to the casino and you have to walk though a maze of kids and shops to get to the casino. Rooms were very basic, may have been an over site but wasn’t even a hotel book in the room describing the restaurants or other hotel features. One bed spread also had something crusty on one spot and anther section had been repaired by sewing a patch over a hole. The only plus side was the casino and bar staff were very friendly. Only reason Im not giving this a one star is because of the situation the hotel is in to try and please kids while also running a casino.

Reviews.Title: “Who Brings Kids to Vegas?”
Reviews.Author: Mary Elizabeth H
Reviews.Content: I know it is called "Circus Circus," which implies a child-friendly zone, but who really brings kids to Vegas? As a first time Vegas-goer, I was SHOCKED to see how the hotel was literally over run with children-gone-wild. Every time I tried to walk around the main floor of the hotel I was run-over by screaming children. This is not a hyperbole. My husband and I called it the Gauntlet. The parents would let their kids run wild while they gambled. One of the shops sold "samurai-style" swords, and a kid almost slashed my husband because he was swinging his sword crazily in the middle of the walkway. No parents in sight. I'm not a "child-hater"; in fact, I am the opposite, as I am a ninth grade teacher. I love kids---just not ones who are unattended, screaming, budging in line at the pretzel shop, or slashing my husband with samurai swords. Check in took 1 hour, and we arrived at 12 am (yes you got that right--an hour wait in the middle of the night!!!). I saw the same people stay at the same check-in booth for 45 minutes trying to haggle prices or room upgrades. The staff did nothing to push them along and serve the rest of us. Our room was clean and comfortable, but they never cleaned it once in three days, and we did not have the normal hotel amenities in our bathroom such as shampoo. We had a resort fee, which seemed pointless; it was supposed to grant access to internet, but it never connected properly. It is pretty far way from the main area of the strip, so be prepared to spend your money saved on hotel costs on cab fare. Hotel plus: 44oz beer in giant plastic footballs. Stay classy, Circus Circus.

Reviews.Title: “CIRCUS CIRCUS IS OK”
Reviews.Author: toya4ever
Reviews.Content: I'M 23 years old since i was 7 years old.I'm shocked to see all the comments about childern all over the place duh it's a hotel that caters to kids the name explains it all.Yes this hotel is not 5star hotel but i think this hotel is great depending on your budget yes the hotel can stand to upgrade but for the price i think it's great.This hotel is located at the far end of the strip this can be a long tough walk in the heat or the cold my best advice is to ride the duece bus located in the back casino entrace of the hotel next to macdonalds you can ride the bus for 7dollars all day.Also please don't stay in the motor lodge of the hotel this located in the hotel which is a 5 min walk to the casino which can be a little dangerous make sure stay in SKYRISE OR WEST TOWER MUCH BETTER THEN MOTOR LODGE.Also if you have a flight after the check out time you can pay a extra fee to check out after 3pm or 6pm this hotel is great depending on your budget it also in walkin distance of dennys the rivera hotel which have a food court ,denny,the wynn buffet also a mc donalds is next door also the hotel have a mc donalds inside on thr top floor where the circus circus acts are.Also the rockin rita bar have cheap drinks and cheap little finger food the staff at circus circus is always nice and kind.

Reviews.Title: “Just don't get the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: bb24680
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before a this is my third time. Sure they have lots of kids, Its circus circus. Once again check i was a breeze and only took about ten minutes and i arrived around 5:00 pm. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The room might be called a little dated but it sure was clean. The bed is so confortable and the room service staff (meaining those that clean the rooms, I just dislike the word maid.) were outstanding. As a non-smoker, even the casino was okay. I guess they use some kind of filtration system for the smoke. The coupon book is great, free stuff and cheap drink coupons. About the distance from the strip... you can make a left at the front of Circus Circus and walk down to the next hotel and catch the Monirail.. Great price for 24 hours unlimited rides. I woluld recomment this many times over.. Great price for what you get.... Just my opinion

Reviews.Title: “Family hotel”
Reviews.Author: Littledear57
Reviews.Content: Good place for kids, rooms were average, but we were not in them very long.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected!”
Reviews.Author: linke26
Reviews.Content: Do not be fooled by all the negative reviews! I was quite scared and nervous upon reading all the bad reviews for this place after booking my hotel&flight package, but upon arrival, I was pleasantly surprised. My bf and I arrived about half an hour after check in, and only waited a few minutes in line. We were upgraded from the Casino Tower to the West Tower, which I had read were the nicer rooms. And the rooms were pretty nice indeed. The room was pretty big and clean; the bed was comfortable, as were the pillows. Our room had a flat screen TV and a small sofa chair and ottoman. There were enough towels, and our room was cleaned daily. The decor wasn't shabby or ugly at all. We arrived expecting the worst kind of room and the room definitely exceeded our expectations. Didn't eat at the buffet or inside the hotel, so I cannot write about that. There are numerous kids running around the place, so that was a negative for us. Other negatives include the long walk from the Strip entrance of the Casino to our room, and the fact that the Hotel is so far north on the Strip, it's about an hour walk to the Bellagio/mid-Strip. However, as we only used the hotel to sleep, the location didn't really bother us too much. Plus, there is a bus stop for the Deuce right out front that will take you down the strip for $7 (one day pass). For the price, this hotel is a good value. We definitely wouldn't mind staying here again, as long as we got a room in the West Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive but awful.”
Reviews.Author: sagekilz
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Las Vegas for the Christmas holiday and we are not gamblers, rather travelers. That being said we went to Las Vegas because we had never been and wanted to go somewhere exciting and warm. We booked Circus Circus mostly because it was inexpensive. Negatives: The hotel is ALL THE WAY at the end of the strip - want to go anywhere plan on a LONG walk or LONG bus ride. You could tell the hotel was built in 1963 and was refurbished in 1993, with nothing updated between or after. The room was a Las Vegas hotel room but everything was mismatched. The door was the original door but the bed was from last year - nothing matched. Everything was dated, badly. There was no individuality to the place, just seemed like a tourist stop. The gambling areas were grungy and run down, almost "ghetto". By far Circus Circus has THE WORST buffet in the western part of the country - 5 choices of food 6 different times (chicken, pork, rice, mash potatoes and pasta). They also cleaned our table, completely off, before we were done eating. Children running around obnoxiously without supervision and no staff implementing order (random kids were sitting at our table putting our silverware in here mouths). Go to the Wynn for a much better experience. In addition to all this, the layout is a disaster. You have to go to different sections of elevators for almost everything. Nothing is laid out in a manner that makes any sense, everything is scattered. While walking down the main inside "strip" of the hotel, you are hassled every 15 feet with someone trying to sell you something. It gets real old REAL quick. Every restaurant seems to close at 1 p.m. Nothing was ever open to do anything. All food we ate in the hotel was brutally bad. We had no good experiences relating to food within the hotel. Positives: The bed was one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept on, hotel or personal and pillows were amazing. Room was always clean when we came back from the Strip. Hotel was clean and kept up. The bar Rock 'n Rita's was a blast and I highly recommend it. Overall we picked Circus Circus because it was cheap and we paid for it dearly. If looking for a glitzy, high class, fun Vegas hotel experience, DO NOT go to Circus Circus.

Reviews.Title: “Very old hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ruben_Chittagong
Reviews.Content: we went there for their very affordable flight + hotel deal, rooms are ok and need to improve interior lighting, a bit old decoration and furniture's, because of price the hotel is very busy, too many people with thousands of kids. I'm not going to that hotel again. pools were always busy, crowded and the staffs were very rude.

Reviews.Title: “More kids at Circus circus then a real Circus.”
Reviews.Author: JimMcD
Reviews.Content: if you like to gamble with kids running down the aisles then this is the place you want to be. I always thought children could not be in the gaming area but while I was walking through this casino, I saw 6 year olds at the slots pushing buttons and pulling handles...where was security? It is sad seeing groups of young children gathered in groups sitting on the floors around the perimeter while the "adults" gamble. I guess because of the theme of this casino it is "kid friendly" but wouldn't they rather go to Disney World?

Reviews.Title: “Nice remodeled rooms but restroom has problems!”
Reviews.Author: weluvtrvln
Reviews.Content: We went with our four kids so we decided to stay here. This was our first time at Circus Circus. We booked two connecting rooms which were nicely decorated. The rooms were great and spacious but the restrooms.. Ugh! They were remodeled as well, granite countertops, tiled tub area but there is no fan in there hence no circulation and if you look at the top of the walls you can see mold starting to grow.....not good. Also tub drain clogged every time we used it. I might stay here again but I will check these issues when I check in. The value was good, $80 total for both rooms and the rest of the casino was family friendly. My kids loved it! Oh one last tip, the buffet was not good, I would try the buffet on the 2nd level or somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Price, Not so Great Location”
Reviews.Author: aby61
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Circus, Circus in Vegas in a Tower Room. The room was very clean and spacious, more like a suite than a room! The bed was very comfortable. The price was definitely right at less than 50.00 per night! We ate a few times at the hotel restaurant which was reasonably priced and the food was good. Unfortunately you cannot stay in the hotel for the whole vacation and this is where the problem arises. The hotel is very far down on the strip, it is a long and dirty walk to all the "main" areas of the strip. We had chosen this hotel based on the recommendation of someone that had stayed there many years prior and was very sorry that we had done so. The area was so bad and depressing that you just did not feel comfortable at all. Obviously the neighborhood is not the hotels fault, but you can't discount it nonetheless. Unless you are planning on driving everywhere or staying holed up in the hotel...either pay a little more and stay in the mid strip area or better yet, stay for about the same or less on Freemont St(the old strip), it is spotless, exciting and has plenty to offer. There are stores, street vendors, the Freemont street experience, hotels, restaurants galore. Best of all the area has a much more festive vibe and feels safe and inviting!

Reviews.Title: “Looks like a castle but this is Vegas”
Reviews.Author: GarageBear
Reviews.Content: The place was noisy since I got a room backing up to the elevator shafts. I guess if I had a room further away it would have been nicer. As with any strip hotel they are huge and the walk to your room can be long. The nice thing here is that you can park near the towers and quickly get to your room without having to go through the entire casino.

Reviews.Title: “Holy Alarm Clock”
Reviews.Author: dl2006
Reviews.Content: Second Visit to CCLV and have to say still very impressed with their offerings. 2 FREE BUFFETS (used at Aria's "The Buffet") Visited Rock n Ritas on 1st night, their burgers are GREAT (be sure to look for 2 for 1 coupons on Food and Drink in your welcome packet) We stay in the WEST TOWER Rooms as this Tower's rooms have been remodeled. This go around had room on the 31st floor with a View of Strip. I dont reccomend this as the sun rises on this side of the building and sucks when your coming back from Casino at 5-6am. Beds are Comfy and sheets were clean. Enough Towels and soap for the two of us. Now the BAD! I work for a Hotel I understand this is unexpected however someone should explain to guests what to do if the below ever happens. I was even confused due to lack of Communication. On last night we were asleep and the FIRE ALARM Went Off at 4AM. Needless to say, the fire alarm did its job and shot us the hell OUT OF BED, attempted to call desk, no answer as expected they have 3,000+ rooms and I'm sure everyone wanted to call to see what the hell was going on. Many guests in hallway half dressed screaming at their kids and families to possibly evacuate. I was able to use a HOUSE phone and talked to Operator. I told her I work in the Industry and asked if I should let the guests know to evacuate or Stay In Room. I then explained to other guests that they were locating area of alarm and they asked us to return to room and wait for further instructions. About 20 minutes after it began, an ALL CLEAR message was given and we all TRIED to go back to sleep. Definitely will go back, Such a GREAT Value, Friendly employees and great Tables!

Reviews.Title: “" Worth the Gamble "”
Reviews.Author: totomau
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Vegas. Although we were not much in gambling , we took a gamble here and scored well amazingly enough. The West Tower was not in our reservations but being on the 22nd fl of the Sky Tower was better then anticipated by past reviews. Our room was clean decorated well with some attention to detail needed. We were in a non- smoking floor but the " old air " for lack of a better word gave a small hint of past smokers. What really caught our attention was how well located we were with a price that could not be beat. This place is great for kids as the rides are under a dome. Considering the age, we were impressed as a whole. It was worth the gamble - hope yours will be too !

Reviews.Title: “Value for money and fun too!”
Reviews.Author: JonnyBravo76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Circus Circus this December and it was great. I read reviews and was reluctant to stay there but for the price we took our chances. Check in took about 5 mins and Richard at the desk was very courteous. He provided us with coupons and guide books. We stayed at the west tower. The room was very clean and did not smell of smoke. The bed was very comfy and clean. Maid came in every morning and re-did the place with fresh towels and soaps so when we came back in the evening it was very welcoming. One thing I missed was a coffee maker every morning and had to walk 10 mins to get coffee. There are timeshare guys in the hotel who will approach you and try hard to get you to attend their presentations for free shows or dinners. If you want to avoid them, just say you are leaving the next morning and the conversation will end quickly. The buffet at Circus Circus was just OK not great or fancy. The Casino is huge and does have a stale smoke smell to which you get accustomed in a while. The $5 blackjack tables and the dealers were fun. This was my first time to Vegas so had to try the slots as well. Played video poker for a few hours and lost 40 bucks but it was all fun. Booze is free and keeps flowing as long as you tip the cocktail waitress. We also spent a lot of time at Slot A Fun which is just outside the hotel. It has a $1 blackjack and craps table with virtual dealers and believe me it’s a lot of fun. Again booze keeps coming for free and I tipped a dollar for every 2 drinks. There are security guards in there so I did not see any bums in there. There is a bus stop just outside and a daily pass is $7 and 3 day pass is $20 which will take you to the strip every 10 mins 24/7. There are shuttles to/from the airport to the hotel every 30mins. Overall we had a lot of fun at the Circus Circus and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It has definately seen better days!”
Reviews.Author: ILuv2Mingle
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the fourth floor in the main casino tower. The room was just old. It smelled old. It didn't "feel" clean. It had a Kinda seedy feel to it. It was the first time I'd stayed there in almost twenty years and very little had changed. Only one bank of elevators worked, we figured that out after an extended wait. One good thing about the stay is that the room was inexpensive, just over $30 including resort/hotel tax (but I guess we got what we paid for). The kids enjoyed themselves but everything about this place is old and in need of a facelift.

Reviews.Title: “Good and cheap choice in Las Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: Felixrs
Reviews.Content: This was one of the cheapest option we found for staying in the same Strip in Las Vegas for not much money. Maybe you may find other more luxury options, but most of time in LV you'll spend visiting other hotels and wandering around. Near this hotel you may find other nice spots like The Venetian, The Bellagio, etc. Heading north, not far away, there's a good outlet called "Las Vegas Premium Outlet". The hotel is very big, so expect to wait some time for checking in. The quality of the rooms was good for us, big beds, good bathroom, everything clean. Apart from the casino, without leaving the hotel you may find a buffet restaurant and some amusement good for the kids. The quality of the restaurant wasn't the best, so we just preferred to eat somewhere around town (we recommend a visit to the "Old" Las Vegas). A good thing about the hotel (and most places in LV), is the free parking. To get to some spots in the city the car is quite necessary.

Reviews.Title: “good for the price”
Reviews.Author: thimdat
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice, and for the price I pay, I'm happy with what I got. They have a few buildings, and I was in a Manor Tower (or something like that), which you need to go outside to get to that building, but it's really 1min walk. When I stayed they had a deal that inclulded 2 buffets at any MGM resort (which is $40 value), and I payed $30 a night for 3 nights, so that was an awesome deal. I used my buffets at Aria, which had just opened and their lunch buffet was $20 each. Circus Circus does have a buffet, but it's nothing special, and I would rather go somewhere else for food. It's great for families with kids for sure, free circus act every 30min (or 15min, I can't remember), and lots of fun stuff at midway, It's on the strip, but far from most of the hotels, so the location may not be the best, but again, for the price that I paid, I'm not gonna complain. I stayed in June when most of the hotels on the strips are sold out or quite expensive. I think the resort fee was $8 or $9, and that will include the Wifi as well. The place could have more updates to modern style/nicer carpet/etc, but this is a place for family/kids, who don't wanna spend much, so if you are looking nice, high-end hotel in Vegas, you should probably pay more and book somewhere else =) Staff are always friendly there too.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZINGG!!!”
Reviews.Author: dhar_sneha
Reviews.Content: being in Las vegas itself was a life time experience for me and staying in Circus Circus made it even more memorable for me. Common Circus Circus doesnt need any reviews, its a City in itself. From food to rides to games to casinos to shopping booths to anything that we can ever think of. The room wass just incredible and the cleanliness wass woww. Though just finding the room in the huge property was a bit difficult since we dint have the map of the hotel, so I'll advice that one shud ask for the map from the reception and den get to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and great for kids”
Reviews.Author: 808hawaiigirl
Reviews.Content: First time traveling with kids to Las Vegas. This location would be best cause they cater to children with the adventuredome and circus etc. Traveled with a big group and many stayed at other hotels, only to have their kids beg to come to circus circus. Other hotels are not as kid friendly and many had their kids staying in the room all the while so the adults could go to casino. I had mixed feelings on staying here due to some review read prior, but overall my experience there was good. Hotel room was clean and recently upgraded. Good size. Would stay here again if traveling with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Badly needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Michael L
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and helpful. However, the carpets are threadbare in many places. The smell of smoke is overpowering anywhere near the casino. We did not find that to be the case when we were at the Mandalay Bay to see a show. Although we were on a non-smoking floor, the smell of smoke was there, too. Rooms had a 50 cent per use safe deposit boxes, which should be included in the room price. There was no small fridge in the room. Restaurants were a good value. If we had kids, they would definitely have enjoyed the Adventuredome--basically a fair in an air conditioned dome, along with a super roller coaster and water rides. The smoke and appointment issues will cause us to choose another hotel our next Vegas visit.

Reviews.Title: “If Circus Circus is your only option in Vegas, decline it”
Reviews.Author: ACF1979
Reviews.Content: I don´t know how the didn´t implod this hotel yet. Dirty, bed smelling, old. As my dad says: Never travel to a place that´s worst than your home. Spend a little more and go to somewhere else. If you stay in this hotel in Vegas, you might not like the city.

Reviews.Title: “okay but”
Reviews.Author: mobi136
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here before and the price is great until you get the resort fees. Way over priced. We were there from 12/2-7/11 and the 2nd night at around 10:30pm the maid woke us up vacuming the room next door. I had to get us and ask her to stop. To many kids in the casinos, We had a non-smoking room and I could smell smoke all the time. The room was nice, but I wish they had a coffe pot because beverages are way overpriced. Marilyn

Reviews.Title: “amazing value”
Reviews.Author: patandbin
Reviews.Content: We are travelling by RV and wanted to stay on the strip in Las Vegas. We heard that if you stay Mon-Thurs in some hotels, its chaeper than staying at an RV park. We stayed at Circus circus as they had lots of safe parking for our RV and it cost $33/per night, all up, incl taxes, resort fee etc. It was awesome, clean room, nice hot bath, very friendly staff...couldnt fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Stay any where but here”
Reviews.Author: Cshan
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the worst hotels in Vegas. Its dirty, smokey, full of up charges, "resort fees" over priced, crappy restaurants. The customer service was horrible, I'll never stay there again. The snap shot looks like this: We checked in on Friday night at midnight, there was a 25 minute wait to get to reception, the elevator on the way up to our room was filled with debris, the same debris that was STILL there on Sunday morning.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good place”
Reviews.Author: mhickman184
Reviews.Content: This was an alright place. We only stayed one night on our way through town. The downside is that it isn't in the middle of the strip. It takes quite a hike to get to where all the action is.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Room, but a bit depressing”
Reviews.Author: MarcoMaciel
Reviews.Content: clean room, clean sheet , fair price, but has no minibar, no coffeemaker, however the hotel environment it's bit depressing, decoration very old with giant scary clowns, reminded a scary movie of the 70s, despite having good price, I wont come back , very bad atmosphere. If you look a fair price with good room, If you will be drunk and don't care about the atmosphere, it will be okay, Otherwise, look for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dont waste your money”
Reviews.Author: tpj1Moncton
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at CircusCircus as part of an expedia package. We had never been to Las Vegas and because it said it was on the strip I thought it was ok. It is at the bottom and quite a hike to where the action is. The hotel itself is very low and budget. Every time you enter the hotel there are people trying to sell you timeshare and tickets.....very annoying. We arrived and checked in after 20 hours traveling. When we arrived we thought oh well it's not that bad. The room had been recently renovated. BUT when I went to use the washroom the toilet has dirty and had vomit in it. Hubby called the front desk and they sent someone up to clean it and give us a new room. Well room 2 looked ok but had carpet staples and pumpkin seeds on the floor. I wonder if they clean??? The tv did not work. At this point I am in tears we finally get to room number 3 where we stay for the week. The ice machine on the floor was broken for 6 days despite daily calls to front desk reporting it. For all our troubles we got a 2:1 buffet coupon. Please spend the extra and stay at a decent hotel. Read the reviews and believe them!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty & Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Raj77
Reviews.Content: If you have less budget then don't read my comments, else this is not a hotel to stay at. The reception is so noisy, crowded, poorly managed and dirty. After spending 5 nights in a five star hotel I could not bear this hotel. This hotel is very poorly managed. The carpets were very dirty, it looked as if there has been no maintenance work. Rooms Average in size, but not at all comfortable. Room was not Centrally AC, a separate old fashioned AC was installed next to the window. Casino The air was not fresh, you could smell the smoke of cigarettes. Location This is the worst part, it is far from the Strip. I remember paying $15-20 by taxi. Strip is the limelight of Vegas, you would love to stay near the Strip. There is hardly any excitement near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Health dept should look into West Bar”
Reviews.Author: A425a
