Reviews.Content: At the west bar on 12/1 at about 545pm and saw bartender use his bottle opener to help reach a dirty ashtray that someone just left. He them put it in his pocket without washing it. Was about to order a beer but I'd rather not have my bottle poet Ed with that dirty opener. Then he wipes ashtray clean with. Napkin and never washed his hands. !! Gross!

Reviews.Title: “lets face it has seen better days ... bottom end”
Reviews.Author: fitzfamily255118
Reviews.Content: stayed recently with family and rooms are ok but stench of smoke and alcohol in downstairs area was a turn off. Also location isnt great at bottom end of strip Very loud banging noises kept us awake all night at weekends when they have the overnight Fright night at the Dome Families would be better off in a motel off the strip

Reviews.Title: “Its for kids even though vegas isnt”
Reviews.Author: Chris F
Reviews.Content: First let me say I understand people want to bring there kids on vacation but to Vegas whos nickname is sin city Now Circus Circus. The view was crap we had the dome and nothing else. Second the security was crap. They had a green walkway for people under 21 to get around and signs that said Anyone under 21 should stay on green walkway. But kids went into the area in front of cops who did nothing. Also I just turned 21 and only one person who wasnt even a cop or security asked if I was 21 and I thanked him. Circus Circus has to beef up security. The hotel room was not half bad at least better than motel 6

Reviews.Title: “Fun only for the kids”
Reviews.Author: Baddboyy82
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal, regret taking advantage of it. 3 night stay fri-mon. Just me and the wife; no kids. Checkin took 45 minutes to get to the staff. Room was a delux in the new-ish west tower; it was decent enough. Casino was filled with screaming kids that I couldn't help but trip over (literally) and non English speaking people seemingly just loitering in the walkways. It was like a maze trying to get through the sea of tourists taking pictures and clogging the walkways The class of guests was similar to that at a cheap trailer park; the staff was rude on multiple occasions and one "manager" called me a liar when I complained about something her staff told me. After the first hour there it was clear this is only a place to sleep, and hated everything about it. Spend a few more bucks to go somewhere else. On a side note, why do people bring newborns and small children to Vegas?

Reviews.Title: “Its a DUMP!!!”
Reviews.Author: sandrafin
Reviews.Content: Terrible hotel, rooms were disgraceful, stank of smoke even though non smoking, we most have picked the worst hotel on the strip, well won't say it was actually on the strip, as it was at the bottom of it, had a very long walk to see the decent hotels on the strip!!! The entertainment was ok, good for kids, but the whole place just stank, the sheets and towels were ancient too!!!! Never again, people you would be better off paying a bit etc and stay somewhere decent!!

Reviews.Title: “love this place”
Reviews.Author: lsvitenko
Reviews.Content: We had such a great time at Circus Circus! The kids had so much to do and the restaurant is the best. I highly recommend Circus Circus.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel for Kids”
Reviews.Author: tomsk21
Reviews.Content: A trip to Vegas for a group of friends to celebrate a 50th birthday, the trip was a budget booking flight and hotel. This hotel is really showing its age, I stayed on the 22nd floor. The room was large enough (two queen beds) but a bit on the grubby side, the walls had "picture frame" marks where the wall was covered by a picture and the dirt around it remianed. Not nice! The linen and bathroom towels were all very good and clean / bright. There was no mini bar (not a big deal for me) and the TV was an old wide screen CRT with a barely watchable picture. Do not eat at the breakfast buffet, you WILL be dissapointed. Rather walk a couple of hundred yards out of the front entrance over the road to the "Pepper Mill" Very good food, though in true American style far too big portions. We ate in the "Seak House" restaurant one evening, apparently voted best steak restaurant in Vegas for over 20 years, I suspect those 20 were quite a while ago, while the service was good the lighting was so dim I fealt a little uncomfortable. The steak (I had a New York strip) was ok but had the "air" of tenderising agents about it, far too soft if you know what I mean and boy do they know how to charge for it. best given a wide birth IMO. Back to the rooms unfortunately (for me) this hotel claims to cater for kids in a big way, not well enough! It would seem they would rather run up and down the corridor screaming (quite literally) well into the early hours of the morning whilst their parents are out gambling and such. I would rather pay an extra premium to stay in a more modern establishment.

Reviews.Title: “travel inn with a theme park inside”
Reviews.Author: iain t
Reviews.Content: this hotel is very basic but worth the money it charges if you get a deal. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to young revellers but more to young families wanting fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great sleep...good bargain!”
Reviews.Author: suncreeen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it was a GREAT deal in conjunction with an Allegiant Air flight. (About $40/night). Upon checkin we were immediately upgraded to a non smoking room on the 28th floor with a great view of the strip. The room was large, clean and comfortable with memory foam beds. All you need, really. Rooms were quiet at night...perhaps because this is a family hotel & they don't party at night. We used the discount tickets they handed us when we checked in for drinks and hor's d' oeuvres, had a few meals and drinks on the premises and used it as a very comfortable base for the rest of our visit to Vegas. This hotel made a great "Base". If you're looking for a destination hotel where you'll want to hang out all day. Look elsewhere and get your VISA card ready.

Reviews.Title: “West Tower Accommodations Okay-Salespeople Annoying”
Reviews.Author: NOLA4ever
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to spend our 32nd Anniversary in Vegas. We were dealing with a tight budget, so we choose this hotel for value. Accommodations were okay, but the lobby is quite annoying with all the salespeople trying to sell timeshares. Would have been more pleasant and peaceful without them.

Reviews.Title: “Great price/ quality”
Reviews.Author: JDJ2050
Reviews.Content: Enormous hotel. It took us 12 minutes to walk inside the hotel from our room to the frontdoor. This was never a problem because of the authentic atmosphere in the hotel. Every night when we came back to the hotel it felt more like home.

Reviews.Title: “Children's Day Out!!”
Reviews.Author: thegothicgoat
Reviews.Content: Going to Las Vegas is a dream come true for a honeymoon couple or for a bachelor or bachelorette party just before they solemnise their wedding vows. However, what do you do if you'are a family with a kid or worse....many kids?? Sounds like a nightmare doesn't it? This is where the Circus Circus Hotel and Casino comes to your rescue....unlike other hotels on the Strip in Las Vegas, the Circus Circus has a very 'family' atmosphere. Just like other big hotels in USA, this one too has a very welcoming lobby and a huge one at that. The rooms are very big and enough even for a family of four staying together. I would recommend this hotel mainly because of the fact that while the parents wish to sample or have a look at the slot machines and get a taste of the gambling tables, the kids can be left in the company of their hotel staff, who are ever helpful to accompany them and take them around the kiddies / games area. There are lots of games for the children, almost like a theme park where there attendants roaming around in the guise of clowns and make the kids feel special and occupied. I had the good fortune of living this experience and also winning a couple of games, where I also won a huge tiger soft toy as a prize! You can play as many games and as many times as you wish and you would wish that this little fairytale never ends. A good hotel on all counts and a definite memorable experience on all counts!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than anticipated but with a few flaws”
Reviews.Author: HolidayForUs
Reviews.Content: We were lucky and didn't have to wait long for our room keys as we were part of a tour group. Our room was in the West Tower, the windows were very dirty but the room was clean if a bit tired-looking (especially the carpet). There was no fridge. Our stay was for two nights. The room safe was closed and on arrival we requested it be opened, there was only one chair supplied and we asked for another. An engineer was promised but we never had the safe unlocked or the extra chairs from housekeeping. The room was cleaned and fresh towels were available on request but we didn't bother. The connecting door meant that noise from next-door’s conversations could be heard. Otherwise the corridors were quiet. Didn't get to see the Adventuredome as it was closed by 6pm for the Halloween nights, which were $30 for unlimited rides. Didn't see the circus acts as these only started at 11 a.m. and we headed out well before then. Didn't try the buffet due to the poor reports on TripAdvisor. Be wary of getting the show tickets in the box office in the foyer of the hotel, we actually paid more than the face value, certainly didn't seem to save us any money and the actual seats weren't allocated at the desk but on collection at the venue. We were near the back although the view was good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: cmehend
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because they had a great special online, 40% off all rooms and 2 free buffett passes during your stay. I read the reviews on line and had mixed feelings about staying there, but all of the reviews said to stay in the West Tower because it has been recently renovated and didn't smell of smoke. I booked this room type on line and after my booking, I didn't feel good about it because your confirmation doesn't state the type of room that you booked. If you do this to book your room with them, PRINT SCREEN, and save it for proof, I called their 1800 number and told them that I was concerned because my reservation didn't state the room type and they assured me that I would be given that room type. When we arrived, the line to check-in was quite long, we waited about 15 or 20 minutes. When we got to the counter, they asked for an ID, did a little typing, and handed us a map with Casino Tower circled and tried to send us on our way. I told them that I specifically reserved a West Tower room and I was told,"Sorry, we only have smoking and you asked for non-smoking", If I reserved a non-smoking room, then why didn't they have one reserved for me??? We were told there was nothing that they could do. When I told them that I wanted to stay in the West Tower because it had been renovated, she told me the Casino Tower had been also.. We we went up to our room, and as soon as you step off of the elevator, it smelled of smoke. The whole floor clearly hadn't been renovated (maybe in 1980). Old TV, very dark room, only one lamp and the light in the bathroom. It was clean enough, but old. Turns out, our free buffett passes were for one meal only, not what I thought when I booked the room. I guess, for the price, if you can handle the room condition and the smoke smell, it was ok. But, I will never book with them again because they clearly don't care about customer service. If they had tried to make it right, I would have been happier.

Reviews.Title: “Worked for us”
Reviews.Author: Jason S
Reviews.Content: We were here to see as much of Las Vegas as possible so spend very little time in the hotel other than to rest our feet and catch a few hours of sleep. Was hit up pretty hard trying to sell us more stuff and time shares. We did spend a little time in the shops, the activity center was pretty good and they give you a nice coupon book that give good discounts and some free things. We were surprised to get there and have a bunch of use fees to pay on top of the fees we already paid. The cleaning staff was very friendly and respectful. The were happy to help with several requests. I also liked that it is kind of on the end of strip so we either took the bus to the other end and walked back or just walked down the strip. Overall I would stay here again and actually wish we would have spent a little more time enjoying the space. We did watch several of the free circus acts and they were pretty good. The carnival area was really not all that exciting and a good portions of the games were not even open.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of kidsthe outlet centre is near by with bargains on branded clothes etc wellworth a look.Vegas is all you hear and mor”
Reviews.Author: 4kinloaded
Reviews.Content: Iconic hotel etc. End of strip. 20minute straight walk to centre..ie bellagio etc. Hotel was very busy. Ideal for families with kids etc. Huge indoor pleasure park to keep them amused and a couple of small swim pools. Bus stop right outside aporox $7 each for all day bus pass. Mcdonalds right next door. Daily circus acts but very busy so hard to get a look in. Shops and casinos inside. Book helicopter trips and car hire onsite. Mainly ate out but the best steak house in town is onside. Would recommend to freind with children or tight budget

Reviews.Title: “Adventuredome in Circus Circus”
Reviews.Author: David_Oli
Reviews.Content: Don´t go there if you want a clean, nice place. The "Adventuredome" is advertised as an all-familly, exciting place for kids. What you will really find is a cheap, dirty fair with some rides, a couple of games and not much more. The sign "This game/ride is temporarly out of order" is present in several rides It seems that long time ago it used to have some kind of "cave" ambiance but not any more. Now some walls are painted white, and the engravings that made it seem like "The Grand Canyon" now look like more scuffs and dents in the already-dirty walls In many areas the floor used to be painted, but due to traffic, paint is no more so you see just see plain cement. In a ride called "Canyon Blaster" there is a huge, slow climb. When you reach the summit, there is a colum in your right hand...¡crowded with chewing gum!!!!!! somebody must think that it is very funny because there is A LOT of chewing gum pasted there, and from long time ago. Do you really want to go to a place (park) which hails a column with chewed gum as an asset? Staff seems to be there just because thet want to reach payday.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: yogiabell
Reviews.Content: Other than the line to check in that had us queued for over 20 minutes, the hotel was lovely. Clean, nicer than expected, and on the larger size, and lots of freebies included (although the free midway game could have been more than one dart to try!!) The kids loved the roller coaster. Place was packed for the long veteran's day weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Very Reasonable Priced Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nickyaskey
Reviews.Content: Were were originally booked into the Older Section of the Hotel but did not realise at the Time however on arrival we were advised this by reception who upgraded us to the newer section at a very low price was well worth it. The rooms were large and Modern with TV. It was also very quiet. It took us hours just to get out of the Hotel it was such fun there were lots of Shops, The Wordls Largest Indoor Theme Park, A Circus, Lots of Restaurants and of course the Casino. It was right at the end of the strip however there was a bus stop right outside and you could of course walk the strip its more fun. Theres also a MCDONALDS right next door. Not 1 of the most upmarket hotels in Vegas but for the price it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Will Deffinatley go back!!”
Reviews.Author: Dawnylou89
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the circus circus in november for a short city break to vegas as we had not been before we wanted to go as cheap as possible. stayed in the west tower room 18841 which was lovely and modern bathroom was fab size and the bed well this was the comfiest i have ever slept in and the pillows was to die for!! we had a few meals in the hotel buffett as this was really good value for money all you can eat and drink for £6.40 ish so that set us up for the day, first day we got up really early and did the strip yes the hotel is at the top end of the strip but you will need your walking shoes as we did the whole strip and back in 8 hours (this was going in hotels and taking lots of photos and doing madame taussads ) then dropped the shopping off and out again the rooms in the hotel are literally a base, we then took ourselfs upto the Las vegas sign which you can walk to just past mandalay bay another 10-15 min walk but they where filming when we got there, so couldnt get anywhere near, would advise you to go to the tix4tonight booths for any show tickets as these are really cheap (we didnt see any as penn and teller were on vaction!) Go to Shark Reef in Mandalay bay as this is fab and also the cheesecake factory in ceasars couldnt get in as the que was massive but you can by these, Deffinatley also recomend going upto freemont street and seeing the light show as this is fab to say this is old vegas they still no how to do things!! Also go up the straosphere this was about $16pp but this takes you up to take lots of photos which is a deffinate must to see the strip with all the lights, if your thinking about doing the grand canyon book this before you go as there is alot of street promoters around and you really dont no what you are getting we booked ours through viator with sundance helicopters and they where fantastic the trip was amazing once in a lifetime oppurtunity loved every minute. we also went to the North Las vegas mall wich is sooooo much cheaper then buying from the strip shops!! clinque makeup is mega cheap!!! also my fave shop was pandora! in the miracle mile shopping centre as what you pay over here is that in dollars but with the tax inclucded but you can also get exclusive to Las vegas charms just ask them about these! all in all had the most fantastic trip of a lifetime would go again and use this hotel with out a doubt any questions just ask!.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: indocelyn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Circus Circus hotel and enjoyed it. The room was big, clean and not too noisy. The decoration looked a bit old but we were there only to sleep so we weren't bothered!! The view wasn't too bad but could have been better. The buffet for lunch, dinenr and breakfast was very good!! We had lots of choice and it was good quality!!!

Reviews.Title: “Another great trip”
Reviews.Author: Guy K
Reviews.Content: This was my second year to stay at Circus Circus Las Vegas. Like last year, was very clean, the housekeeping staff did an excellent job. Checking in, that little bit of wait that was expected. The staff of Circus Circus Las Vegas is truly top shelf quality personnel. The room was clean and comfortable, and very reasonably priced. On my next vacation I will be staying at Circus Circus.

Reviews.Title: “Bit disappointing”
Reviews.Author: bettermandave
Reviews.Content: We took my daughter for her first trip to America and were really excited about seeing all the Glim and Glam that vegas offers again. However when we entered the hotel reception our hearts sunk. It was dull drab and to be quite honest looked a bit dirty. Never the less we checked in and made our way to the rooms. Whilst the rooms were an OK size the state of the rooms matched reception. Additionally we found ourselves overlooking the airconditioning unit at the back of the hotel and had to endure the constant whine of the unit 24/7. My daughter however not having been before thought everything was very nice, I suppose it is what you are used to. As it was christmas week the hotel was heaving with children of all ages to the extent that we had to walk across the casino floors to avoid being constanly bumped and bashed by the kids. Still we knew it was a family hotel so I suppose we can't really complain. On the plus side the facilities and cafe/restaurants were quite acceptable and we found the staff generally friendly and helpful and prices were reasonable. The casino was ok but the slots were a little behind the times and as my wife likes her slots we found ourselves in the centre strip hotels most of the time meaning we spent over $250 in cab fares despite walking for England. On reflection I do not think I will go to this hotel again unless I am looking for a cheap trip. For anyone thinking of booking the hotel I would suggest that it may be better to spend a few more $'s and stay neared the centre of the strip unless you are prepared to do a lot of walking and accept what for Vegas is a sub standard hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: finnie2
Reviews.Content: Years ago when we had little ones, we stayed at this hotel in both the "Manor" rooms (not impressed) and the "Skyrise" tower (much better). With a couple days to fill on this trip, we tried the Skyrise again. Perhaps we got lucky, but it worked out for us. Our room was nonsmoking, quiet, has considerably updated furniture and carpeting since we were last there, was cleaned well and all the employees we encountered were friendly. As mentioned in other reviews, it is a very affordable option and we didn't mind the walk up to the Encore, Wynn, Venetian area. It is a big complex and perhaps a bit of a hike for some people to get from the room out to the strip, through crowds when the hotel is busy. The pool area is ok, nothing fancy. There is an $8 daily resort fee which includes internet.

Reviews.Title: “Room was dirty, stunk and looked aged”
Reviews.Author: Rolland S
Reviews.Content: I went on 11/11/11. I will be fair and say this was a last minute booking "the day of travel". I used priceline and I don't recall being asked if I wanted smoking or non-smoking and in turn I was given a smoking room. It smelled awful in the entire floor and the room. I felt like I couldn't get any "good air". There was food, candy, crumb, debris underneath and around the edges of the bed, especially by the night stand. There was debris and candy sucker sticks in the a/c air outlet vent. There was hair and crumbs in the bed sheets and the white under side of the top bedspread quilt was turning brown. The bathroom was the best part of the room and was "ok" with the exception of no bath tub (just a stand up shower) and an 80's shower head that looked like it'd seen better days. The shower drain was stopped up and so the water went about 4 inches high and remained there during showering. The pros were that the room looked nice when you didn't look for details. Nice big entertainment center and the tv worked. I got a quiet night's sleep when I wasn't disturbed by the stink of smoke and I tried to ignore the dirty bed. I denied room service (they offered) replacing the sheets etc.. as it was late and I was too tired to go through all that. Aside from that the room just looked like it'd been abused by kids as this is a "family hotel". It did have a great indoor theme park, so its a good place to go if you have control over which type of room you get, but if you don't and use something like priceline then you are pretty much s.o.l.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Standby”
Reviews.Author: karenlrite
Reviews.Content: This is probably the 6th time we have stayed at Circus Circus. I have stayed and tried to stay at other hotels but this is the one I still come back to when we want an affordable room, when our favorite is sold out. I like staying in the manor because of the price and they only have 2 floors so it is easy to park near your room and not have to drag your bags too far. It is a bit of a walk from the action, but that isn't a bad thing. We requested an adjoining room with my parents when booking but they didn't have one for us when we checked in. We were on the same floor, but on the other side of the elevators at least 15 rooms away. Not bad, but not what we had hoped for. We stayed in the tower attached to the parking garage this time and found it convienient. Not too far via the promonad from the action, but we never felt as if we were in a slummy room. They had new furnishings, and the room was clean. There were two safes in the room, but one was locked when we got there and I never could get it to open. The second safe worked just fine. The casino games were a bit of a bust, no real winners. We used to go to Slots O Fun to play 21 but the have replaced all of the gaming tables with vidio 21 tables. Not the same. My new name for it is "Not So Fun" We did play the slots there but it was dissapointing. I won't be going back to Slots O Fun.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong at 40$/night”
Reviews.Author: habs2611
Reviews.Content: I was pleased with Hotel, ok it is nothing like those Hotel/Casinos on the other end of the strip but for 40$/night, you cannot ask for better. The room was alright with an old 20" TV but I was only in the room to sleep, which worked for me. If you go to Vegas to party and stay for cheap money, Circus Circus is your best bet. The restaurant downstairs, Rock & Rita's, pretend to be 24H, but only the bus bar is, don't try to eat in the actual restaurant becasue it is closed at night. Also, I have rarely seen service that slow.

Reviews.Title: “Complaining pays off- make sure you stay in the west tower”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte S
Reviews.Content: On checking in we were given a smoking room in the skyrise tower. It was disgusting, very dated, and the smell of stale nicotine was overwhelming. On closer inspection of the room we realised the window was almost hanging off the wall. There was a two inch gap between the wall and the window frame. We went back to check in desk and we were upgraded to a west tower room, and given all the benefits the hotel had to offer without paying the resort fee. After getting to our new room which was very nice, massive super king bed and a large bathroom, we explored the hotel. The adventure dome was great and much better value than the rides at the stratosphere. The breakfast buffet was great but i would recommend avoiding the buffet for dinner as the garden grill is 100 times better. Rock 'n' Ritas bus bar is great as the staff are friedly and have a great knowledge of cocktails and flairing. Overall the hotel had so much to offer and i don't understand the negative reviews because the problems we had were resolved almost immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: Rose S
Reviews.Content: For our first trip to Vegas we decided to stay at circus circus over the Excalibur. Big mistake. It is dingy, smelly and the atmosphere is just not there and to make matters worse you couldn't walk a foot without being bothered by someone wanting you to sign up for some time share crap. It got to a point we thought about making up a sign that said no we are not interested! After walking the strip and seeing what other hotels had to offer if we could do it all over again circus circus would never have been an option.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: MichaelJBeggs
Reviews.Content: This place is cheap so don't expect much. This whole end of the strip is a little crummy. Way too many kids for my tastes. It was my first time in Vegas and I learned my lesson. If you want to stay on the strip for cheap this may be your place. Personally, I will spend the extra cash and head into the heart of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Best spot for kids”
Reviews.Author: lizinrb
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a girlfriend trip to Vegas for a couple days. We stayed at Circus Circus because it was so much cheaper than other places on the strip. It was a little inconvenient for us but I could see that it would be great for families with kids. You can get to the buffet without having to walk right through the casino. The guys passing out flyers with all but naked women on them that are everywhere on the strip are nowhere to be found at CC. The Adventuredome and circus acts looked like a lot of fun for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Do not even consider staying in the Manor E rooms.”
Reviews.Author: ANRR
Reviews.Content: Our last day in Vegas ended later than we had intended and instead of driving back home to 29 Palms, CA through the desolate Mojave desert in the dark with two small children, I called a dozen places trying to find a room that wouldn't cost a small fortune and landed upon Circus Circus. We were desperate and had to act on it as it was only getting later and later. The desk lady told us all they had left were manor rooms, which were set up like a motel but not to worry, they were safe and had been recently refurbished. Ha! I sincerely hope who ever did any refurbishing was not compensated. It looked like they had sat 2 new chairs in a room that was otherwise my age (30ish). Check in was friendly and quick but I felt a little duped with the whole refurbished room thing. It had been a stressful last few hours trying to find a decent place and I was quite upset with the condition the room was actually in. We had to make the best of it and make sure our kids were fine. Parking was well lit though I wouldn't walk out there by myself. Entrance into the Manor buildings are room key slot controlled so there is no access to the rooms from the outside of the building which made me feel a tiny bit better. The room was dingy, dark, very worn and seemingly neglected. Peeling, splattered, and stained walls. Disgusting carpet. And a bathroom that belongs at a backwoods truck stop. I was hesitant to let my kids even on the floor to walk. The toilet sprayed everytime flushed. The light switch was loose. The sockets were loose and faulty. Just, bad and dangerous. The ac unit was loudly on and off all night. I would have preferred it to be on all night as the walls are paper thin and I could hear the men next door talking and making other.....noises. Thank god we had a small box fan to drown all that out. I will say the beds were fairly comfortable and the pillows were nice. The sheets and towels were clean and there was ample room to hang clothes in the ridiculously large entertainment center. There was also a cooler to keep my babies milk cold so that was a plus. Otherwise, don't do it!! The tower rooms might be a far cry, I don't know. But the manor rooms look like something where dirty business takes place.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: ryleery07
Reviews.Content: My partner and i took our seven year old boy with us and it was the perfect hotel for,him, but saying that if i go back to vegas without him i would still stay here! It has a very safe, homely feel to it compared to some of the larger main hotels on the strip, which i found very cold and to lack atmosphere, although they are very pleasing to the eye! Check in was five minutes, and our room was 33rd floor of west tower, rooms where spotless and cleaned like clockwork every day. The beds and pillows where amazing, every holiday i have been on, im always looking foward to coming home and getting into,my own bed, but i could have easily stayed in that bed for another week! Room was spacious and airy and never smelt of smoke! The reception is a little dated but the helpful staff make up for that, the buffett breakfast was delish and the casinos had a really good atmosphere with a great mix of people having fun! The midway for the kids is really good, my little man was in heaven, the circus acts where good and the adventure dome an added bonus. We went out to other hotels but i could not wait to get back to our own hotel, as i found some of the larger ones to feel more like a shopping mall than a hotel and the position of them in the hustle and bustle at night time can be a bit manic. My only negative for this hotel, is i feel the pool area is not large enough for the number of guests staying in the hotel, but that is a minor negative and i will definately be staying at circus circus again. I had a fabulous week here and glad i didnt let the negative reviews put me off booking it. Excellent value for money and friendly warm hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good to stay if you have kids!”
Reviews.Author: Netballer09
Reviews.Content: This hotel was good for families with kids as there was a lot for the kids to do. The rooms were avaerage. Couldn't complain...they were clean and comfortable. The price was good for us. Rock and Rita's was a great bar for good music, and great atmosphere! The cocktail waiters put on a great show! Our kids loved Adventuredome and Midway.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: plfcowgirlval
Reviews.Content: This hotel was part of a package deal and I was very apprehensive due to all the bad reviews it got. Boy was I surprised! We were there in the beginning of November, from Wednesday to Saturday. The hotel was very clean, the restaurants were nice, and there were minimum children. We stayed in the South Tower and the room was beautiful. Yes the hotel is old and not yet remodeled with the "bling" people apparently want but that was the only reason I could find for all the bad reviews. Maybe parts of this hotel are terrible, but I didn't see it. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: Gurudesh
Reviews.Content: Hotel is average. Needs to maintained properly. Good for the price you pay. Will not stay there again. If you are travelling with kids, this place is worth considering since it has circus and kid friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: Yonitt
Reviews.Content: We found an amazing deal through expedia for 30$ a night at the circus circus. the room was nice and clean, very comfortable beds but the walk to the room from the lobby was pretty long -we stayed in the skyrise tower. In the hotel there is a huge area with games and prizes and a free circus show every hour. Also, a pizza place and a buffet on the lobby floor and a block away from Dennys which is open 24 hours a day. We visited the hotel a few days before Halloween and so there were very life like zombies wandering the halls...my children (5 and 8 years old) were freaked out by this especially when one of them started following us around.. the hotel isnt walking distance from the strip if you have little kids but there is a bus that stops in front of the hotel to take you there (7$ a person -under 5 ride free) all in all very good service - had a great time! (minus the zombies...)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: Iamsupersweet
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a recent Las Vegas trip for te Sema show and I must say it is one of the best stay I ever had in Vegas! Our room was upgraded to The west casino tower and the view of the strip is just awesome. Tho' I don't like their buffet since they only have a couple choices of dishes. But the West side Deli sandwiches are all good! The room was clean and maintained. Staff are respectful and friendly! Thanks circus circus for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “good deal”
Reviews.Author: girl54
Reviews.Content: A great deal for the dollar. Rooms are older but very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Conference Location and Fun”
Reviews.Author: ally_sun_jax
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference and the room, meals, and conference rates are very affordable compared to some of the "nicer" hotels on the strip. There is plenty of entertainment, dining, and shopping without ever leaving the hotel. You can find expensive and inexpensive places to eat. Of course you have the casinos for entertainment, but there is also an indoor amusement park (Adventuredome) and a nightly acrobat show if that's your thing. The conference rooms were comfortable and convenient. The banquet staff did a great job with our catered meals and end-of-conference banquet. The only downer is that there are no coffee pots in the rooms. I don't know if this is a Vegas thing or Circus Circus thing, but I wish they would change this. There are plenty of places to buy coffee in the hotel, but my fave choice was McDonalds for decent taste and price.

Reviews.Title: “Fright Dome 2011”
Reviews.Author: mickeymousemobile
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Circus Circus Sept 2011, to attend the Halloween fright dome. Haunted houses were done well. But lack of any staff at hotel knowing perticulars of the event IE: where you purchase tickets, what days and times, how much etc. was very poorly planned. The advertised venue on the ticket wasn't all up and running IE: the 3D Elvira and Dracula movies not opened, no explanation why, even when asked. Also they had a 13th floor haunted tour but it did not start the same weekend/day fright dome started. We flew a long way hoping to experience both, but were not able as the floor tour did not start until the Sat and the dome opened the Thursday. Overall the hotel was fine no real problems there.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: melissa d
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Circus Circus Hotel was average. The hotel rooms were clean and good size. I would not recommend staying at this hotel if you do not want to be near children. There were tons of kids!!! The indoor amusement park was alright, nothing to brag about. The food choices at this location were not tempting either. We basically just slept here and for the money we saved compared to other hotels it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Cheaper Rate”
Reviews.Author: Hellbuck
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed with Circus Circus. This was my first trip to Vegas. I was on business and chose the Circus Circus based on the amenities listed in their web site. The main casino was dark and gloomy compared to newer hotels. The service was average at best. The dealers in the casino were irritable. The front desk was not pleasant. The buffet quality was poor. The selection was very limited. At breakfast the pancakes and waffles were cold. At dinner the salad bar selection was sparse. The mashed potato and macaroni and cheese tasted awful. The fried shrimp was of lower quality than fast food. Probably the worst buffet I have had. The location was 2-3 miles from the main area of the strip. Next time I will pay a few extra bucks for a better location and better quality.

Reviews.Title: “Good price good service”
Reviews.Author: momig
Reviews.Content: We had a really good time in the circus circus. The price is cheap. Location is great and they have free circus show

Reviews.Title: “For the money...”
Reviews.Author: hannah w
Reviews.Content: This is a good place to stay for the money, I couldn't believe how big the resort was we only stayed for two nights then went to The Stratosphere, such a nicer hotel! I would stay again if I could get it for the same price $20 per night though.

Reviews.Title: “Sema 2011”
Reviews.Author: Buffman51
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good choice for the money and if you have kids. I had the tower room 11718. Very noise due to the fans on the roof and no view to speak of. You hear the toilets flush all night along with the showers. I will stay somewhere else next time for some quiet time at night.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money but needs modernization”
Reviews.Author: santu71182
Reviews.Content: If you are planning a trip to Vegas with a tight budget this is a place to try out. Location is 3/5 and ambiance is 2.5/5. The hotel has a nice casino and some good shows to kill time. Bungee jumping is also something you can try. The rooms are decent with fair room service. Sometimes the noise level is high but that may be due to the renovation works. Parking is easily available. Food seems to be costly so better try to get your food from the strip. The staff are nice and can guide you to get the best out of Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: karenkarenn
Reviews.Content: We have been there three times this year and all three times have been flawless. Our rooms were clean, the beds where soft and there wasn't an incident. They provided a few places to hang out for free in Las Vegas and it was helpfull. Very nice staff

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Money”
Reviews.Author: melrose5
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a five night stay in Circus Circus, the hotel is tired and dated, but we paid very little for our accommodation and although it is a little walk from the strip, it was very good value for money. I did look at paying extra to stay at another hotel after reading some of the reviews on trip advisor, but I am glad I saved my money, overall I would say if you want cheap and adequate, Circus Circus is the hotel for you. The rooms were a little dated, but were cleaned every day and were more than adequate for our needs, after all when in Vegas most of the time you are only sleeping in the room anyway.! The walls are a bit thin and you can hear next door talking, but at the end of it, the hotel is now quite old compared to some on the main strip and sound insulation probably wasnt so good when Circus Circus was built.! . During our stay we went to see Lion King and managed to get a 30% discount on tickets, using the code in the hotel brochure in our room, it worked out cheaper than the ticket booths along the strip. We rung the front desk a couple of times with queries which were answered politely and without any problem at all. Overall we enjoyed our stay at Circus Circus and it you want to stay in Vegas on a very cheap budget, this hotel will do just fine for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, reasonable prices”
Reviews.Author: pahmed
Reviews.Content: very nice large hotel, dinner buffet is very good. It is not in the busy place at the strip, it is not a small distance till u arrive to the busy area by walking. it will take about 20 min walking in a quite area. If u have a cra, there will b no problem.prices are good. Front office staff are very helpfull. They upgraded us to a beter room in the tower overlooking the strip complimentry.

Reviews.Title: “CHEAP HOTEL CHEAP AMENITIES”
Reviews.Author: krp901
Reviews.Content: while circus circus are great with kids , the las vegas experience has really passed me by...the room we stayed in was good size but the hair dryer overheated and thought would start a fire ...pulled in my cellphone charger and the plug came out of the walls...my only complaint is they need to update their rooms but otherwise the staff did a good job answered any questions you wanted asked, but, if i was going to stay in a good motel id pick the excalibur or monte carlo...i doubt i will ever go back to las vegas because i think they have overbuilt the strip...i can remember u could walk the strip easily but now its a mess

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: David P
Reviews.Content: Positives: Quick check-in and friendly staff, good parking, and incredibly comfy beds. Good size rooms. Adjoining rooms were provided on request (but book early) and the rooms are pretty spacious. Negatives: Despite recent refurbishments (and as noted the beds were awesome), the room smells really bad. I think it is mainly smoke related, even though our rooms were non-smoking I think the smell has hung on and pervades the whole hotel. We felt like we smoked a packet a day for each night we stayed. It was a shame that there was no fridge - we could have used one and I did think they were standard but will know next time. The other pity was that a key reason for going to Circus Circus was the in-house fun park but it closed for refurbishments on the second day we were there. Quite frustrating, particularly as we were not informed of this in advance. All said and done we paid very little for our stay at the Hotel, so we got what we paid for. Had the fun park been open we probably would have been more positive but the rooms really smell so bad it's not funny. Would I stay there again? No. But you have to balance it all out and if I want a better place to stay I have to pay more. Fair enough. I know the buffet has been mentioned - we don't go for buffets, too many chances for things to go wrong. There were plenty of other food options in Circus Circus or nearby - take them or take your chances!

Reviews.Title: “Food poisoning”
Reviews.Author: Angela P
Reviews.Content: We did not stay at this hotel, but on Friday October 21, 2011, we decided to have dinner at the Buffet. Ten minutes after we left, in the middle of the strip, I blacked out, my husband stopped a cab and took me to the Hospital. Who knows how many people got sick the same day. For us was the first and the last visit to Circus Circus.

Reviews.Title: “Do not listen to negative reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: krista h
Reviews.Content: This was my first ever time in Vegas and boy did I enjoy it!. A friend and i stayed for 7 nights at circus circus. Check in time was about 10 minutes. Our room was large and spacious. The bed was the most comfortable bed I have EVER slept in. The pillows were so soft, its amazing I ever got out of there to experience Vegas at all! Other reviews on here talk about the smoking in the casino and dirty rooms. Yes there is smoking but so is everywhere in Vegas. I didnt find the room dirty, the maid came every day and made up everything. The casino itself is dated but who cares? I wasnt in the hotel long enough during the day to worry about decor, got up in the morning and stayed out doing touristy things for the day and evening. The only thing I did find was we would get lost getting back to our room. The casino outlay downstairs is very confusing so we didnt know which way was which but overall i found the staff friendly, food brilliant, shopping good, circus acts excellent... I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here. Very dirty. Carpets, chairs are filthy. You will have an allergy attack here because the carpet and the fur”
Reviews.Author: mashimaromari
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here. Very dirty. Carpets, chairs are filthy. You will have an allergy attack here because the carpet and furnitures are dirty and stained with who knows what.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised...”
Reviews.Author: Valentine777
Reviews.Content: First off, let me say that I was reading all of the reviews about this hotel on Trip Advisor before I left on my trip. I saw some good reviews, but I was kind of worried about about all of the negative reviews. Let me say now that I have no idea what some people are thinking. A friend of mine from work and I stayed at the Circus Circus from Sept 19-23. When we arrived, we were greeted warmly and we waited not more than ten minutes to check in. We had both reserved rooms in the Casino tower, not the best rooms we could have, but we thought it'd be good enough. When we got to the check in agent, we had excellent customer service from her (and I regret now not getting her name so I could put the praise to a person) and we found that both my friend's room and mine had been upgraded to the West Tower for no charge. Yes, there's a resort fee. But I didn't mind paying it when we received our special offers from the hotel, and mixed in with the discount we got on our shows from the Tix4Tonight people.The West Tower rooms were fantastic. I highly recommend them. While I didn't get much of a view from my room, I wasn't staying in the room for the view. The beds were soft, the bathroom was clean, and I was ready to call it good. The Tix4Tonight should be the place to go to get your show tickets. We got our Blue Man Group (front row center!) for almost half off. And the next night we saw Mystere (Not as good as Ka) for almost half off too. I know I saw the Price is Right show for at least half off. And it's located right in the lobby. Plenty of places to eat and shop right in the hotel. As far as the casino aspect goes, plenty of cheap table games and slots. I was a fan of getting breakfast in the morning and then setting down at the three dollar blackjack table and waking up to back to back 21s. ;) As far having two many kids around, I didn't see all that many. Yes there were some but it's a kid's themed hotel. My room was always quiet, so who cared what they did? Bottom Line, I was pleasantly surprised at the all around experience at the Circus Circus. And I will definately come back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “lovely holiday”
Reviews.Author: karensmith33
Reviews.Content: Just back from a brill 2 week holiday in vegas. Stayed at Circus Circus the reviews made me worry about going to this hotel. But i was very impressed it was not as bad as i thought it was going to be. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. Check in was very speedy. The food was nice. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and always a great experience.”
Reviews.Author: Mikkkey
Reviews.Content: Love staying at circus circus, would not go any where else. They have a great staff, alwyas friendly and ready to assit. Its great to have everything you need in one place, easy and convenient. The options of the room types are great, depending on your needs. Overall experience, excellent and fun. Will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Alright if you have kids”
Reviews.Author: TammyNaturally
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Circus Circus last month was OK. After looking at alot of other hotels in the area, I would try somewhere else next time. STRENGTHS: Good if you have kids as there is 'Adventureland'which, although it is a rip off, its entertaining. Unfortunately it only opens at 10am and most kids are awake well before that! Also when we mentioned it was our first time in Vegas, they gave us a room with a great view of the strip. Also just across the strip and up a little is the most amazing mexican place called Tacos El Gordo- AMAZING!!! CHEAP!!! TASTY!!! Havent had anything like it. Lastly the buffet is open til 10pm and after a huge day with the kids checking out the after sunset displays, it was great value for money. WEAKNESSES: The decor is old, even the waiting area is dingy, dark and a little foreboding. The bizarre set up of lifts and car parking leaves you lost most times you need to go to your room. It is really difficult to get here using public transport at the moment as there isnt alot near it.

Reviews.Title: “Low Price with good fun”
Reviews.Author: Ashok M
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Circus circus for three nights for a conference. It has four major wings and i stayed in the Skyrise wing just above the convention rooms. Rooms are large in size with minimal furnishing. No coffee maker and Tube type TV. capets are old and do not give clean look. It has several eating places which included a Buffe restaurent. Buffe was good and reasonably priced . You can also see real circus act. and has adventuredrome. Wifi is provided in the room but did not function properly. However the price which I paid for the room was so low ( About Us $ 35 including resort fees) that one can not complain. Overall Good value for money and a fun place.You can avail senior citizen discount if you are above 62.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, dated and dirty. Sorry, not for me”
Reviews.Author: EastbourneFamilyFour
Reviews.Content: We visited Circus Circus as we promised our girls (8 and 10) they could visit the Adventuredome which they actually quite enjoyed. At $27 a wristband there we're about 6 rides they wanted to do so all in all quite good value compared to fairground prices. we visited when it opened so it was empty and they had no queues to wait in. However, I would imagine if you visited at night it is probably really busy which would go some way to hiding how dirty and dated it is. On walking around the hotel we found it dirty and dated and probably the smokiest hotel we have been in throughout Vegas. The act that was on in the Circus tent was very good once you got in through the mass of pushchairs and kids. Don't get me wrong I love kids but this was too much even for me. Anyway, really sorry but this isn't for me. It reminded me of Blackpool in 1978, in fact I would have rather been in Blackpool. if you are visiting Vegas with kids only stay here is you want to eat at McDonalds every day or queue in long lines for the buffet and make sure you like other people's kids - lots of them.

Reviews.Title: “Family madness”
Reviews.Author: coconess
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights. check in was fast. my room (1150, casino main tower) was ok. noticed sheets weren't clean had to call room service to replace. shower pressure was good. Bathroom sink had a slow drain. Toilet scared me when flushing it because of the strange sound. There is a lot of smoking at this hotel. I requested a non smoking room but as soon as I walked into my room, all I smelled was smoke. In the lobby there are a lot of families and young children. As a single young lady I didn't feel this catered to single people. The buffet (breakfast) was great! I ate dinner and lunch outside the hotel on the strip. I recommend Flavors buffet at Harrah's hotel and casino. Great food! Mac King and Nate Burton comedy show is great! Don't buy tickets off the street from solicitors. You can get them free from local hotels & stores. promotors are on the street passing out tickets but make sure they are free. Nevada's tax rate is 8.5% Keep that in mind when shopping. Go with someone fun who doesn't complain. There's plenty to do, can be overwhelming without an itinerary. Bring comfortable walking shoes (Clarks is a good brand), water, sun block, sunglasses, plenty of money and you'll have fun! Be sure to get on the guest list and reserve early!

Reviews.Title: “Sorry didnt like this much at all.”
Reviews.Author: Jeni D
Reviews.Content: I found that it was out of the action well away from all the other good hotels and events. It is very cheap which is great but because of this seems to attact a rather rough crowd. The smoke walking through the casino to get in and out was unbearable. We were not happy here and moved down the strip to a nicer hotel after only 2 nights. We also found that the airconditioner cut in and out quite loudly all night which made it hard to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Dated but acceptable”
Reviews.Author: Carguy71
Reviews.Content: First trip to Vegas with four friends for a guys weekened getaway. Circus Circus is certainly one of the more dated 'mega resorts' in Las Vegas, and it shows. That said, the rooms were clean and comfortable. Food & drink at the hotel were disappointing - below average at best. And, the jello shots at the pool bar (I don't know why we ever thought that would be a good idea) had mold growing on them - certainly NOT the quick 'kick' we were expecting.

Reviews.Title: “good value but dated”
Reviews.Author: rob-cumbria
Reviews.Content: stayed there for & days & thought was great value but with value comes a price which was the interiour after the entrance was a bit dated & shabby . the food was great & the entertainment limited but in vegas you dont stay in your hotel so thats what we did , in general the rooms were clean & tidy & its grat value for money if your a bit short , good distance to the strip & a short walk to the stratospher & the biggest tourist shop which is stocked full of tourist junk which im sure every 1 buys .... all in alll a nice place but could do with carpets & paint

Reviews.Title: “A great time, best value in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Dorothy M
Reviews.Content: Circus circus is excellent, we stayed 5 nights, excellent service & a large comfortable room. They have excellent places to eat & shop. I think theie valet service is the best in Las Vegas. The beverage servers are so friendly & prompt. All staff greet you with a smile. My room was cleaned to perfection daily. We ate at the Garden Grill & Rock & Rita's the food was excellent and the service great. I have stayed at other places on the strip, but Circus Circus rates a 10+ for me and my family.

Reviews.Title: “MUCH BETTER THAN ANTICIPATED...”
Reviews.Author: flyingsteve_10
Reviews.Content: i stayed at circus-circus in late september while attending a military reunion which was to be held at the hotel as well. our member who organized the event, chose it for the price advantage--with the idea that holding down costs would make attendance possible for more of our group. i'd checked the place out a few months before, and honestly, wasn't that excited about the prospect of staying there. as one of the oldest properties on the 'strip,' it was a bit 'tired.' however, wanting the convenience of being near our activities, i booked a room. i must say...it was a PLEASANT SURPRISE. the room was clean, larger than expected, and was properly serviced. the rate we got was very favorable, both for the weeknights, and weekend nights. (usually a big premiun in l.v.) food on the property was reasonably good, plentiful, and reasonable. the 'fun book' issued at check-in had some good coupons in it, and i took a class given by a pit boss on the art of shooting 'craps,' which was entertaining, and proved to be beneficial later. while many couples come to las vegas for excitement or a romantic getaway...people with children should really give circus-circus a try... not only are there live circus acts but there's a fun midway and lots of kid-friendly stuff. although the hotel is located in an area of the strip not in close proximity to many other attractions, shopping, etc...the money you'll save staying here will surely open up some other opportunities for you. give it a try...you might be pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Taking kids to Vegas? Accept no other!”
Reviews.Author: jenjah0212
Reviews.Content: Circus Circus was a great weekend getaway for me, my husband and our 6 year old daughter. So much to do we never even had to leave. Where else can you get a beautiful room with plenty of places to eat, fun shops casino games for the grown ups, midway games for the kids, circus acts, pool, and an amusement park. So much to do I need another weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Didnt stay here but looks old”
Reviews.Author: joee5
Reviews.Content: While we visited Las Vegas, we decided that it would be cool for my daughters to see the acrobats and circus preformers overhead. Well, on 2 seperate occasions we ventured there and saw nothing. Not one performer or circus act. However, being that we went in October we did visit the 13th floor halloween attraction which was just absolutely amazing and scared the crap out of both my daughters. The admission price was $19.99 but if you get a coupon from one of teh employees dressed in a costume you save $5 bucks off each admission. I highly recommend visiting this attraction for the scare factor is extreme. This attraction saved my rating from a 2 star and bumped it up to a 3. While walking through the casino both times I have to honestly say it just looks and feels and smells old. I personally wouldnt want to stay here nevermind eat here just by my observation alone. To each his own. On a plus side the valet parking service was extremely fast.

Reviews.Title: “An aging hotel needing some major renewal work done; adequate for majority of us.”
Reviews.Author: pkphilip
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd time in Vegas, we stayed at NYNY (south of the strip) last time and it was an amazing experience. This time, we wanted something on the north side and our Alaska Air package included this hotel. Needless to say, it wasn't the best, we've been to the worst motels, and Circus Circus was adequate for our needs. Who stays at the hotel room in Vegas?? To start things off, we rented a car. The first complaint I had with the hotel is the cracked/broken roadways in and around the hotel. There weren't any clear signs for valet or self-park until I was inside the hotel parking lot. There were 2 separate garages in Circus Circus, and there weren't a sign at all about the Skyrise tower parking without driving to the KOA campground. It was a 3pm Sunday, the check-in wasn't long. Since we prepaid for everything, the check-in lady even offered us some choices (possibly due to the request in ahead of time we wanted a newer room with less stink). We were offered the West Tower or Skyrise Tower. I wanted to stay away from the main casino, therefore I picked the Skyrise Tower. We were given good instruction and a map, the walk from the main lobby to the Skyrise Tower is a long one, but it is about the same in any hotels in Vegas anyways. The casino definitely smell old, but not stinky. It just smelled exactly like the older hotels in the old downtown Vegas (Fremont St.). We were given a room on the 28th floor (tower has 29 floors). My gf and I were pleased about the strip view. The room was clean, it had the basic like TV, phone, 2 queen beds, a chair. The bathroom was the bad one: faucet handle was striped and the faucet in the shower leaked a little. No big deal for us, we live in an apartment that is 10 times worst than this! We just don't use the washing basin. We left a note to housekeeping the next day and I hope they do attend to it. Because the Skyrise tower is on the other side of the hotel, there were fewer traffic/people there. There were a few slot machines there and surprisingly there was security guards roaming around pretty much all the time. I feel safer there already! We occasionally we heard people screaming from the Adventure Dome during Fright Dome. In the morning there were trucks backing in, the beep sound might be an annoyance. Overall amenities were simply old, AC is on the noisy side but works. Linen sheets were old and had holes in them. TV were 27" CRTs. Towels smelled like bleach and feels like sandpaper. On the bright side, pillows are amazingly comfortable and we slept extremely well during our 3 nights stay. Free wifi is also good too. We walked by the restaurants inside the hotel, they didn't look that good even-though we were given a coupon book. I couldn't comment on the quality of the food. We are self-served people so I couldn't comment on the staff other than the check-in lady. To summarize, if you are looking at just a place to crash with all the basics, Circus Circus Skyrise tower is a good choice. If you are looking at a resort that you will be planning to stay and play there, go somewhere else. Circus Circus is definitely old, it feels like a place waiting to be torn down.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: jadagreen
Reviews.Content: This hotel was trash! We stayed in the refurbished west tower, the room was nice enough. A lot smaller than the photos on their website would have you think. We were supposed to have kids eat for free, when I enquired about this I was given dinner vouchers for the evening buffet for 3 nights when we were staying for 4. Above the show ticket counter there was a tv screen previewing shows you could buy tickets for including a burlesque show which showed topless dancers with only their nipples blurred, my 10 year old pointed it out and said it was disgusting. I thought with the theme of the hotel and the amount of families staying there that was inappropriate. The whole hotel stinks of cigarette smoke and after spending any time there all our clothes and hair smelt like it too. The circus show was 2 guys flipping each other around for 10 mins on a little stage, they were talented but it was hardly the circus we expected. They were ripping the hotels road up outside at night so needed ear plugs to sleep, not sound proof at all could hear people walking and talking in the hallway and room next door. This hotel is very tired, dark any gloomy. Don't think you're getting a bargain because it's cheap... The people are rude and the hotel is trash. If you do decide to stay definitely choose the refurbished west tower.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: brwniepoints
Reviews.Content: The price was good, everyone was helpful with ideas and directions for places to see/do. The Midway there is loads of fun, even for adults. Everyone there was having a blast, people of all ages enjoying being big kids. The room was exactly what I thought it'd be- a clean comfortable room. We had no problems with smells, except for the standard cigarette smell that pervades all of Las Vegas strip - clean oxygen in my non smoking room though! Heater and A/C worked great, shower head and pressure was relaxing, not any window view to speak of. The only problem I had was that even though I had reserved a king size non smoking, they had to give me a 2 queen nonsmoking or king smoking. When I reminded her of the reservation, she said that that was a request but they gave no gaurantees, it was more of a suggestion. I was only there to sleep and refresh so didn't mind. Will be fine with staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “S - Hole”
Reviews.Author: shellback89
Reviews.Content: Ok people say " you get what you pay for" well that's not so true. The hallways were really stinky. The room a non smoking room smelled as bad as the casino. The a/c was iffy either it was super cold or muggy. The pool.. well one of the pools was closed and the sun doesn't reach the pool deck til about 1p. The tower and dome block the sun from the pool so its pretty cold til the sun lights it up. I will NOT stat here again!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best choices if you have younger kids”
Reviews.Author: ABTravelDine
Reviews.Content: Circus Circus Las Vegas boasts of being the most kid friendly hotel in Las Vegas. With its big top attitude and its indoor amusement park it very well may be. The beauty of this particular hotel doesn’t lie so much in its size or even the circus like atmosphere. The charm lies in the fact that it was something new and relatively untried along the Vegas strip. Rather than build to suit the gamblers they were hoping to attract, this particular hotel was wise enough to offer something new and untried by appealing to families with children rather than solely to gamblers. The gamble seems to be paying off in a city that is known for both its hits and its misses. Other hotels and casinos are also working to cultivate the family friendly image that Circus Circus has basically proven. Not only did this hotel build The Adventuredome Theme Park they also decided to make accommodations even more family friendly by accommodating RVs at the Circusland RV Park. This offers a great place for families to stay that might not otherwise grace the theme park, hotel, or the casino. Don’t forget that there is a casino involved and that is the primary purpose of this gigantic hotel, resort, and theme park. The casino makes the expense of building it all very much worthwhile and brings in big business of its own each and every day. In grand Vegas style there is also the requisite onsite shopping and of course full service of wedding options in addition to a wedding chapel and banquet facilities in which to hold the reception of your dreams. The shopping at Circus Circus offers everything from ultra exclusive boutique shops and salons to stores such as Under $10 and the trading Post, which offers fad jewelry and other kid friendly gifts. This hotel has a somewhat unique concept that sets it apart from the many others along Vegas’ strip. If you are traveling to Vegas with the family I very much recommend at least checking them out and comparing prices and packages with the other hotels and resorts in the area. Keep in mind that comps are like money in the bank particularly when they involve food or activities that you were planning to do even without the comps. So you may be able to negotiate a much better deal even if you’re paying a couple more dollars a night by having free parking, complimentary meals, or tickets to events, shows, or attractions. Now we’re on to my favorite part of the discussion. Dining options. Circus Circus does not disappoint when it comes to offering variety to its guests. In addition to The Steakhouse, there is The Garden Grill, Mexitallia, Pink Pony, Circus Buffet, Pizzeria, Westside Deli, and Barista Café. The food offerings accommodate varying budgets and familial needs by offering some kid friendly dining choices to visitors and guests as well. The good news however is that if these restaurants aren’t appealing to you there is another hotel, casino, or restaurant next door that has different fare to offer. If you are looking for a great place to stay in Las Vegas along with the family there are very few hotels that will offer the overall environment of fun and wonder that you will find at Circus Circus. In addition to the wonderful rooms, the great food, the casino, and The Adventuredome Theme Park you will find that the shows here are as kid friendly and entertaining for the entire family as the atmosphere in general. This is a great vacation destination anywhere. Considering the fact that it is in Las Vegas and it is very nearly the perfect vacation retreat for those with children.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: ocarle5
Reviews.Content: When I checked in, they've sent me to these Manor Buildings which are located across the street. I didn't know they were part of the hotel. They are like a motel complex within the hotel very far from the main lobby. They were smelly and we had a concern with security in that area since a fight broke out right in front of us in the parking. It wasn't what I expected.

Reviews.Title: “BETTER THAN THE FLAMINGO”
Reviews.Author: Steve C
Reviews.Content: I think the cleanliness of CC is better than the Flamingo, although the Flamingo is more centrally located on the strip. I experienced a funky smell at the Flamingo room I had, but CC was clean and that's the most important thing in a Vegas hotel room where all you do is sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Not good without kids”
Reviews.Author: Hulkamaniac1981
Reviews.Content: Other than having on site daycare with the amusement park. This casino hotel is not the greatest to stay at. It's usually among the cheapest for vacation packages for a reason. The locaton sucks, if you are travelling by bus because being in the middle of the strip the bus is usually full when it arrives and you got to just keep waiting. Coming from freemont or the strip is always the same story. This is among the most profitable casionos in Vegas. How so you ask... because the payout on machines is among the lowest. Don't let the age of the building sucker you into old style of gambling and payouts. The buffet is large, however it surrounds itself with amusement park style food. Deep fried everything. The pool is heated and open year round unlike many others. I think for me it was the location that killed it. Don't think I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Half good Half Evil”
Reviews.Author: Shary S
Reviews.Content: I thought I could ignore the bad signs that lead me to walk around this massive property without any sense of direction and the long check in line, the very confusing labyrinth way to get from my room to the outside, the dollar that was stolen from the soda vending machine, the ridiculous round about directions to get to the pool but I can not ignore the fact that either housekeeping or another staff person entered my room and stole money, my credit card and my metro pass from my room. I made a report and it is currently being "investigated." I have stayed in many, many hotels and have never had property stolen from my room. I read previous reviews that warned about theft at Circus Circus but learned by experience so BEWARE! The good things from the stay was: the cheap eateries across the street: Denny's, the food court at the Riviera, McDonald's The 7plus dollar cab ride from the Venetian The passport with the freebies they give you in the beginning (all though you actually pay for it with the 7.95 resort fee) The cheap drinks at garden grill If my stuff did not get stolen I would have recommended the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for cheap clean room”
Reviews.Author: dbusafr
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for cheap clean and refurbished room this is a perfect hotel. I had a deal of $25 per night. However forget about spending time in the hotel casino or try the restaurant. But with such good deal on the accommodation it is worth taking a taxi and spending in more luxurious restaurant/ casino ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Good value for spending the night on the road”
Reviews.Author: SRDad
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here before, so knew pretty much what to expect. Arrived on a Sunday afternoon, parking area around the check in door was jammed. Usual. Got our rooms, nothing unexpected. Everything in Vegas is geared to get you into the casino, so the rooms aren't decked out. TV was fine, rooms were fine, beds fine. We had two rooms, one room the air conditioner wasn't working right, but those staying in that room didn't want it too cold. There was a problem with the showers though - they were GREAT! I don't know if someone took out the flow limiters or not, but they were full stream, great showers. I didn't say anything because I didn't want to ruin it for the next guests. The water ride in the Adventuredome wasn't running, but otherwise had a good time. Lots of road construction around there though, getting into and out of was a test of driving skills. It worked for us, stopping over on our way to SoCal.

Reviews.Title: “What a big place!”
Reviews.Author: gerard1012
Reviews.Content: Good hotel to stay the night after arrival from Europe or prior to flying back home. It's huge and the rooms are decent and spacious. Wouldn't like to spend more nights in this sleeping- and funfactory. Try to memorize exactly where your room is situated. It´s so easy to get lost. We did and we were sooooo tired.

Reviews.Title: “a good night sleep”
Reviews.Author: Arthe
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Saturday night after midnight. The check-in was slow. There were more employees than customers but they had more urgent things to do than check us in. After a flight and so late in the night, waiting about 30 minutes, when there were only 5 families checking in, is not appreciated! Going from the lobby to our room was very fast and the parking wasn't too far. The room was clean with comfy beds and pillows. We didn't ear any noise and had a very good night. The shower was hot and the towels fluffy. The check-out consisted of dropping our keys in a special box, very convenient and fast. The parking was free. We got a booklet with deals on various activities in the hotel and even some free rides, that was a great surprise. The adventure dome opens at 10am but the rides start a bit later. Some attractions were closed during the day because of the Halloween special at night. So, we sadly couldn't try the laser tag. The midway games open at 11am and we left before that. We were a bit disappointed that the circus shows did not start at ten. The adventure dome makes it a great place to stay if you have kids, although it can absolutely not compare to a theme park or attraction park. It is at the end of the strip which could be a problem if you intend to walk to other places. Even the little Venice is far. If you can get the incredible prices during the week, it will be an even better value.

Reviews.Title: “14th floor”
Reviews.Author: vic_fernandes7
Reviews.Content: Old style rooms, clean and comfy. Check-in and out bit slow, watch out for the extra resort fee payable direct to the hotel. Was very cold out during our stay 12c during the day about 4c in the eveining after sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, but a long way from the action”
Reviews.Author: PJW1970
Reviews.Content: Someone else booked our accomm at Circus Circus, and if we'd have known the layout of 'The Strip' and Vegas, we definitely would have stayed up the other end of town. While Circus Circus was clean and the rooms were okay, it is quite old and needs refurbishing. You have to walk a loooong way from reception to your rooms, and you do this walking through the casino, shops and a theme park. With 3 young kids, this was a bit intimidating. Our major concern was that there was nothing stopping people in the casino from getting access to the lifts and the hotel rooms. We had an interconnecting room near the lift doors, so it was often noisy. The hotel had plenty of facilities (McDonalds downstairs), but we wouldn't stay there again. The theme park is old, and having just come from Disneyland it was a real let down. Our advice would be to spend a bit more and stay closer to the main action on The Strip, allowing you closer access to the shops, shows and the attractions at the other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Carriej107
Reviews.Content: We have been 2 Vegas many times, never have we had an experience like this, the bathroom had someone elses hair in the sink, the rm smelled bad, was told we would have a view of the strip, we had a view of the other tower. Had trouble finding our room, we asked for help and were suppose 2 have someone take us 2 our rm and when we got 2 the elevator he told us where 2 go, we then got lost again because they have really crappy directions and map 4 there establishment. We are very dis-pleased and we will never return 2 this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the hassle”
Reviews.Author: Shaharke
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the hotel at 7:00 pm without a reservation, and were offered a room at the Manor building for 96$ (+ resort fee + tax) only to find out that the same room, reserved online (in their website), would have cost us 46$!!! The room itself was totally average and had really thin walls. The hotel is crowded, noisy and the staff looked apathic.

Reviews.Title: “Worst three nights of my life”
Reviews.Author: mattf99
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Manor room at Circus Circus thinking that the room would at least be decent given that it's a strip hotel. Unfortunately, the room we were in had a faucet in the bathroom that leaked loudly all night long, the room was not sound proof at all, it was hard to get hot water in the shower, and our room was only cleaned once out of three nights. Even then they didn't make the bad. We barely slept at all the entire trip.

Reviews.Title: “Its like Bognor x 1000! Great if you can embrace the cheese”
Reviews.Author: glvs
Reviews.Content: This is the biggest hotel I've ever stayed in and like everything in vegas, was a little insane. The room in the casino tower was massive and clean. The hotel itself has everything you would want and would be great for families. It is however a little tired and the bellagio it is not but it was cheap and worth what we paid. There is free parking and wifi. Location wise its towards the north end of the strip. You can walk to the more central hotels, perhaps 2 miles to Caesars and is safe. The bus which runs 24 hours along the strip and into down town also stops right outside the hotel. If your expecting opulence and class this is not the hotel for you but if you want somewhere cheap, clean with lots if flashing lights you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: rmourar
Reviews.Content: Good hotel without any luxuries. Comfortable beds, clean bathroom and nice view from the high floors on the west tower. It lacks a frigobar, but the room is spacious and looks well maintained. The cleaning of the room itself is not spectacular but it doesn't taint the experience. In short it's a nice hotel if you're not looking to spend too much.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: JMadrid10
