Reviews.Content: We were not expecting much out of the Tower rooms, and that is exactly what we got. If you visit Las Vegas like we do, the only time spent in the room is to sleep and clean up. Circus Circus is a great deal for that. We spend most of our time away from the hotel room out seeing the many Las Vegas attractions, dragging back to our room in the wee hours of the mourning, only to wake up, clean up and off again. The room was clean and all worked well. If one is looking for luxury, Circus Circus is not for you! If you are looking for reasonable accommidations, Circus Circus is a great deal and the buffet is outstanding which comes with room.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable place to stay in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Pinkmartini88
Reviews.Content: Most of the hotels in Las Vegas are pretty expensive especially those which are located in the busy town area. Circus Circus hotel was just located slightly out of the busy town area. Prices are definitely much affordable as compared to the other hotels such as MGM, Treasure Island etc. The room are rather spacious for 4 adults with 2 double sharing beds. The toilets are clean and spacious as well. The staff are OK. If you are looking for a cheap getaway in Las Vegas, you can consider staying in Circus Circus. So far, no bad experiences with the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the price!”
Reviews.Author: JustinFree08
Reviews.Content: The rooms in manor are not as nice as th tower rooms. If you book here pay a little more for the tower rooms. If you just want a cheap get away then this is not a bad choice. The hotel does have a resort fee of $7.95 per night which is less than most hotels on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Missing item from the room”
Reviews.Author: Pre P
Reviews.Content: My ipod got stolen from the room and found out door lock did not working properly, even door were shut and pull to secure, just lift handle up and push door were open without keycard. Hotel decline any responsible said this is NV law.

Reviews.Title: “Rude, dumpy, dirty, uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: C G
Reviews.Content: Sometimes you get a great deal, and sometimes you get what you pay for. This was definitely the latter. Check-in took forever, our reservation was messed up, the employees were rude, the room (supposedly remodeled and new) was dumpy and dirty, the water pressure didn't work, the sheets and towels smelled like they hadn't been washed, the beds were lumpy, the air conditioner was loud enough to wake us up when it kicked on during the night, the sewer line was leaking a horrible smell at the time we were there, and I haven't even addressed the lightbulbs hanging out of sockets with wires everywhere. My 4yo son enjoyed the Midway section, except for the fact that only half the arcade games actually worked and the circus performers failed most of their stunts. The new promenade by the Skyrise Tower is full of mall-style kiosks, and you can't even walk through it (a requirement to access Adventuredome, restaurants, casinos, etc.) without being harassed by salespeople. Circus Circus is not even in walking distance of a hotel that DOESN'T stink. Do yourself a favor and stay at the Excalibur -- it's comparably priced, much cleaner, family-friendly, with a better location and the service is first-rate.

Reviews.Title: “OK - won't stay again though”
Reviews.Author: Stephen H
Reviews.Content: The reason CC got a 3* and not a 1 or 2 is because of the price we paid - we wanted budget and we got it. Went with a mate and we paid about $350 between us for 5 nights. However, on check in we asked if breakfast was included (of course not for $350) but they ended up giving it to us which saved us $15 a day each - great blag!. However the buffet was rubbish but it was free so used it! As for the room - good sizes, but they absolutely stank of stale smoke. When I got back to the UK my wife thought I had been smoking as my clothes (ones I didn't wear and were clean) had to be washed as they inherited my room smell. Seriously it is bad. However, after the 2nd day we didn't notice as the hotel smells the same so we got used to it! We used hotel as a base and went to others every night to get out of this hole. Kids were not an issue for us, they were not allowed in casino, and kept themselves to the adventuredome so cant complain. I definately would not stay at this hotel again, how anyone can say they would never stay anywhere else is beyond me apart from maybe they have not stayed anywhere else in vegas. I have now done MGM Signature, Luxor and Mandalay Bay (all with wife so wanted to do it in style), but CC is really a hole compared to these places, but of course costs more money. As for its location don't believe anyone when they say its convienient. It is the most INconvienient hotel on the strip (along with the Riveira). 25mins walk from the Monorail, at least a $15 taxi to get to the next nearest hotel, but the deuce is located outside. Didnt use it as could not bear standing in 100 degree heat waiting for it, and the money we saved staying at CC meant we could taxi everywhere we wanted. I thought the swimming pool was quite good though, had a bar, and not too crowded but we did go at 9am every morning before most were out of bed so dont know how busy it got later on. Please, if you have the money upgrade to a better hotel, if you are on a budget, and dont want the glitz and glamour of what vegas is all about then CC is for you. In hindsight I wished a paid more to be at a nicer hotel, and more central to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good stay”
Reviews.Author: Christine V
Reviews.Content: This is about the 5th time I've stayed at Circus Circus but unfortunately it will be my last. I had problems at check in, then the room I was given didn't have a safe key, I waited a couple of hours for someone from engineering to come and solve the problem but apparently I was meant to be informed that they wouldn't be coming, so it was a waste of time. I was given another room only to discover it hadn't been cleaned. A helpful housekeeping supervisor eventually found me a room, I had to go down twice and pick up new keys and it was a fair hike. The room was clean but very jaded. The casino was the same, compared with other hotels on the Strip the gaming machines were pretty outdated. My next visit will be in 2013 and I will probably stay at the Imperial Palace or Casino Royale.

Reviews.Title: “A memorable experience”
Reviews.Author: Tyler J
Reviews.Content: This hotel is recommended if you're bringing your kids. There are games, playgrounds and a theme park in the hotel floor for a respectable price. However, I must mention the rooms aren't top class but should accommodate basic stay. The location is located a good margin away the Vegas Strip but maintains a good walking distance to other landmarks. The casino floor is spacious and player-friendly but the overall atmosphere is overshadowed by cheap construction and materials.

Reviews.Title: “Wont stay any where else in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Angela D
Reviews.Content: We love this hote! For the price and location it is one of the best. They have great customer service. It is kind of smelly from the smoke but any of the hotels you stay at are going to have that as you are allowed to smoke in the casinos which are usually attatched to the hotels. I have stayed in the tower which is awesome and in its side hotel which the beds in those rooms were bad but for the price it was good. You are right off the end of the strip so its easy to plan your trip. We love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vegas Hotel for Families!”
Reviews.Author: Helen P
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind a bunch of little kids running around, this is the place to go, especially if you plan to go with kids. There are two areas the kids can venture to, while adults can still enjoy the slots and tables at night. One area is a small amusement park with roller coasters and rides. Another area are the carnival games and free circus shows every half hour. The kids will always have something to do. In addition, the carnival games are inexpensive and fairly easy to win prizes so your kids will come home with souvenirs!

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maryj99
Reviews.Content: Just an average hotel. I was looking for an inexpensive hotel in Vegas, and the rates were good, but i was disappointed in the location. I had stayed at Circus Circus many times many years ago, and knew what the hotel was like. Like a motel. Not a luxury hotel. But I did not realize how things have changed on the Las Vegas strip, and you really want to stay at the other end of the strip. Next time I will pay more for the better location near the main attractions .

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: a_mariaCornwall
Reviews.Content: Was really worried after reading all the awful reviews on here, but if it's too late & you are reading this after you've booked then do not despair, it's not that bad! But if you have not booked yet I would go somewhere else. The smell of smoke as the worse thing about the Hotel the moment the hotel doors open the smell hit's you, musky, dirty old smelly carpet, but as soon as you enter hotel room that smell's goes & luckily Air-con fires up after you open your door. Location is not the best either but it is very easy to get around on the buses they stop directly outside the Hotel & very reasonably priced half price for the kid's too & the Drivers are very helpful if you let them know where you want to go they go out of their way to help you. Coming from the UK our packages are really expensive & we made the most of our stay here we had 10 day's me with 3 kids ages 9 & 11 yr old twins & my friend with her's age 5 & 11, we went away for a 3 day trip to Grand Canyon & Page Az to do the raft trip & was glad we saved the money on Hotel & could do all this wonderful stuff that there is to do in Vegas, do not let everyone put you off if you need to save money & have booked this Hotel we had an amazing time here, oh yeh & the Adventure Dome in the Hotel was a horrible noisy place but very good value & the kid's loved it, If I could afford it I would probably book my flight's independantly & Hotel online direct with them & if possible I would choose the Bellagio it's amazing. Vegas is amazing have fun ;)

Reviews.Title: “Tried to be frugal and regretted it!”
Reviews.Author: edaao
Reviews.Content: We booked a vacation package to Vegas which included staying at the Circus Circus hotel. We figured we'd rather spend our money "playing" than on our hotel room. I will say that everything was "fine" but nothing was "good." There were a lot of people hauling coolers into the hotel for their meals (they were obviously being very frugal!) and to me it just felt cheap. We ended up leaving the hotel to do just about everything in Vegas so we ended up paying for cabs, buses, etc. a lot because it was 100 degrees and a long way to the nice hotels! The food at Rock and Rita's was akin to a Denny's (we only had breakfast there) and the food at the buffet was AWFUL, I mean terrible! The fruit was canned and tasted like metal, and the food being served in the buffet (scrambled eggs, scrambled sausage) looked like it had also come from a can. We ate the rest of our meals at other hotels. The pool looked like a pool you would find at a cheap apartment building (and it overlooks a campground). Basically cement, with a pool, and cheap chairs. No umbrellas, no bar, no nothing. We walked to it and turned around, never even got in it. I forgot my flat iron so I went to the beauty salon in the hotel. The lady told me she would charge me $125 to wash and blowdry my hair. Since there were two ladies (that didn't look like they really even knew how to do hair based on their own styles) just sitting there chatting...not another customer in sight, I declined their offer and did my own hair. The next day I went to the Wynn/Encore's beauty salon which was BEAUTIFUL, exactly what you'd expect at a Vegas salon and got that same service for $75 and looked amazing. (I also got my makeup done for another $75 and totally recommend it). I have never looked better! My husband's eyes just about popped out of his head! So, I think we learned that although we like to get deals, this one was not worth it. Next time we will go a more upscale hotel for our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Circus circus was just ok.”
Reviews.Author: JCSTL
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip to Vegas so we were looking for a deal. We stayed at Circus Circus which was ok. Our room wasn't in the main casino area, it was building C which was like a hotel/motel environment. One nice thing was that the bus picked up right in front of the hotel and would take you to the strip or to Fremont street. Overall our stat was ok, but our overall trip was off the chain.

Reviews.Title: “Room 310 & 264”
Reviews.Author: Beverley1955
Reviews.Content: On arrival I was told 264 a smoking room was the last room available. No consideration was given to protesting having asthma. It smelt like an ashtray and I had to take my inhaler. The next day they did move me. I was so pleased I did not consider looking at the view from my window as I assumed it was over looking a part of the casino roof. To my horror beyond the window lattice work bricks, block my escape entirely. If a fire had taken place my only route out was the bedroom door. In the UK this would not pass planning permission. My room was clean and the breakfast was good value for money. The inside of the hotel is very shabby. However this experience was like being in a third world country.

Reviews.Title: “when the fam met the city that never sleeps”
Reviews.Author: justtandy
Reviews.Content: Although the pool was just average.. there was a lot of activities onsite.. from juggling to arcades the kids had days of activities.. Plus we stayed there labor day weekend for 5 days for less that $300 even with that ridiculous resort fee everyone now charges..

Reviews.Title: “not secure”
Reviews.Author: neha r
Reviews.Content: Our laptops and cell chargers has been stolen from the hotel room....It happened in the last day after we return to our room we found our things missing...we were surprised how it can happen and than a security officer came took pictures and note down the details of the incident....It actualy happened the day before we checked out..we are not happy with the hotel managements response they were not willing to help us and simply said as mentioned in disclaimer they are not responsible for any lost particles. I understand that but atleast they should show some willingness to help us...and i think they might have security cameras outside to check who entered the room between these hours of the incident....we really booked the hotel with great hope . Now i am scared to visit any place and feeling insecure...It is true that they had lockers to keep the precious thing safely but i dont think its big enough for laptops...we are generally cautious about golds/cash but who might know our these things would be stolen.....so what .should we carry laptops in the strip while walking feeling really frustrating....

Reviews.Title: “Unless you have small children, DO NOT STAY HERE.”
Reviews.Author: DEFireFighter
Reviews.Content: The Circus Circus hotel has very cheap rooms, at a very large cost to the visitor. We traveled with a small group who had special requested to be either in rooms next to each other or close to one another which was initially done for us. After our first night my girlfriend found a cockroach in our bathroom, when I went to make sure she wasn't just seeing something I saw another one! We called the desk right away and initially were told that we would have to leave the room for 3-6 hours while they spray. After some arguing with the desk they told us we had to be moved to the 29th floor and away from our group and had to be placed from a king bed into 2 queen beds. To say I was frustrated is an understatement. After we tore through our bags to make sure no bugs had stowed away in our stuff we moved rooms, this required us to change elevators twice to get to the new floor with an ok view of the strip through very, very dirty windows. The hotel its self is nothing to write home about, its kept mostly clean but not that great. The slots and tables were never ever full, the games were very old. The shopping in the casino and hotel are only useful if you are 10 years old or working the streets at night. The distance from the actual strip, where the rest of the major casino's and hotels are located, is much to far to walk and required a cab, $10 average to get to the Treasure Island, or the monorail that is about 3/4 a mile away from the hotel and is $28 for three days of riding. If you plan on doing a lot of stuff on the strip don't stay here because the walking and cab costs will eliminate the saving of staying at this horrible hotel rather then paying for one on the lower end of the strip. I will say this hotel seems to be catered to kids with the Adventure Dome and Circus show, very small scale, they do each day. The Adventure Dome had more closed rides then it had open and we never saw it very packed with anyone. All in all, no one in our group will ever stay at, visit, recommend or even talk about this hotel and casino again and I hope anyone who reads this review will choose elsewhere and have a better stay then we did.

Reviews.Title: “Looking a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: andyackland
Reviews.Content: The whole place is looking very tired but it would be a good family hotel as there is so much for kids to do and watch

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: sashokchat
Reviews.Content: The hotel is big and rooms are big with big beds. The show is kinda in a small space, but you can watch it from all angles either from the bottom or on the seats. Great buffet and nice food.

Reviews.Title: “DIRTY DIRTY DIRTY”
Reviews.Author: Sheishaburger
Reviews.Content: We had a few hours to kill before we went to a show at a neighboring hotel. We decided to go visit Circus Circus - it was so dirty. Don't think a major facelift would help this place. The slot machines still gave out coin - never seen that anywhere else. The games were dirty and old and dated - more like a side show carnival. If I had booked a hotel on line and went down to see this place I would have turned around and walked back to the airport to get out of there. Thank God we didn't stay here only went for a visit. We took pictures of every casino/hotel we visited but I wouldn't even take a pic of this place.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you can”
Reviews.Author: kingjkhan
Reviews.Content: Old poorly maintained place. It took almost an hour to checkin. Horrible service. No amenities. We were in the Annexe which is really bad. If at all you need to stay there try to stay in the main towers.

Reviews.Title: “Ehh..Got stuck in elevator!”
Reviews.Author: Uofachick44
Reviews.Content: For the price of the hotel we couldnt complain. $20.00 a night plus the resort fee. Plus got 2 comp buffets each day. Only down was the hallways smelt horrible! We got stuck in an elevator (for not too long) on the 23rd floor. Pretty scary experience! For a quick, cheap place to stay it wasnt too bad!

Reviews.Title: “Looking for quality, stay elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: ksmarriedcouple
Reviews.Content: After booking our room 6 months in advance upon checking in we we were told we would be put in a diffrent room for 1 night because they were over booked in that level of room. That's ok, but they tried sticking 4 of us in a queen bed with a roll away. The sheets had cigerett holes, the hallway had a rrom service tray that sat there the entire week we were there. Our water was shut off for 6 hours without warning. The so called bar shut down at 10pm. The only positive thing about this place was the pizzaria. The food there was great the rest of this place sucks!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the pice”
Reviews.Author: colobordrbuny18
Reviews.Content: We came to Vegas for the first time for a wedding and decided to stay here. We were very quickly checked in (although the front desk woman gave us an attitude because we didn't understand something they were saying) and quickly went to our room on the 33rd floor. The room was much bigger then I was expecting and loved the beds! We went downstairs and started exploring, we could have spent out whole vacation without leaving the hotel. The amusement park was fun and not crowded, the little circus they have was neat and the food was pretty good. The only things I didn't like was there was no way to get out of the hotel without walking through a cloud of smoke and I wished there tram service was still working because of the size of the hotel. Would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with lots of things to do”
Reviews.Author: 60grami
Reviews.Content: we had a great time at circus circus. fun things to do. nice big room and the iguana restaurant was very resonable and the food was very good

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was less than expectation!”
Reviews.Author: WDWLuvr
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Circus Circus hotel during a weekend in Vegas. We had never stayed there and wanted to try it out. We knew it was no Luxor or Golden Nugget, but we had no idea what we were really getting into... and it wasn't even the kids that bothered us! Upon check in, we were sent to our room on the 32nd floor, where we found a room with unmade beds and trash all over the place. We went back down to the lobby and they tried to "upgrade" us to a lesser quality room in a different tower ( only know since I had fully researched all the room types). I mentioned I wanted to stay in the West Tower, which was the nicer tower, so he sent us to the room next to the dirty room we were previously assigned to. This room was cleaned, but in no way would I say it was nicer. The carpets were really worn and besides the bed, the rest of the room looked grungy. Bed was clean, sheets were clean, and the bed was comfy! The towels in the bathroom were nice, but were brand new so weren't very effective and left white linty stuff all over us. yuck. The Adventure Dome was disappointing, The roller coaster was cool, arcades were ok. Never saw their special show nor any other circus events, as I thought they offered. Where was the Circus at Circus Circus! Casino was decent. 24 Hr restaurant was closed nightly and the bar next to it was so obnoxious I didn't feel like ordering food there. How could you eat or drink with that many drunk people slamming margarita shaker containers upside down on the bar! not to mention all the sticky stuff on the bar counter that was left after that! After all this, I don't know that we will be coming back to this property after this stay. Hooters Hotel and Casino was nicer than this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money! Not a bad hotel ....”
Reviews.Author: sanman249
Reviews.Content: Let's put things into perspective. A room at this hotel during non-peak months can be booked for as low as $25/ night! Yes, the hotel is old. Yes, the bathrooms need rework. Yes, the rooms need new furniture and linens. But for such a low price, this hotel on the famous Las Vegas strip is a steal. Save the money for shows and gambling! Circus Circus is a pretty big hotel. Many stores and restaurants. There is even a little amusement park! If you are trying to get a cheap room in Vegas. Go for Circus Circus! At prices lower than motels, this hotel gives you GREAT value for money!

Reviews.Title: “worked for us”
Reviews.Author: wicked33
Reviews.Content: Stayed at circus circus in january. The rooms were very nice, check in was quick and friendly, and the kids loved the rides and games. The only negatives were the food was bad, so we didn't eat there, and alot of the arcade games were broken. For 20 bucks a night i'll stay there anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great except when the elevator didnt work”
Reviews.Author: FuntimesFlorida
Reviews.Content: Elevator was down 1 Am & had to walk 28 flights of stairs downnnnnn thats a long way but had to be in a meeting.Touraments actually! :(((((( .......Good when you find your way around cuz of the lay out add ons over the yrs its a little confusing. Loved the pplaces to eat and lots of fun too. the slots paid of well for me. Cell phone services wasnt so good! Stay in the towers not the manor rooms they are older.We had close parking too.

Reviews.Title: “very crowded”
Reviews.Author: zigotechnologiesinc
Reviews.Content: Have a lot of patience, not much for children over 12 to do. Rides and games are for little ones.

Reviews.Title: “So, so.”
Reviews.Author: visete
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a few days in August. I must say that, although the hotel has a great name, it's really losing prestige. The rooms are, usually without much luxury, all with carpet floor. Located a bit on the top of the 'Strip', just in front of a Riviera hotel under construction. If you can book rooms in the 'Tower', do it, cause it's a newer area and comfortable to rest. The pools are ok, but with excess of foam in the jacuzzi. The casino area, either. Many slot where you'll probably lose your money We found an offer that included accommodation + free breakfast buffet, which it was, by far, the hotel's best thing. Cheap as many hotels in LV. We would go back again if they reform an old hotel like Circus, circus.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad!!”
Reviews.Author: AJS123
Reviews.Content: We just spent four nights in the WEST TOWER at Circus Circus. After a lot of horror stories, we were suprised to find a nice, clean, smoke free room in one of the older hotels on the strip. I understand the Casino Tower is a few dollars cheaper, but smoky and old... Stay in the west !! .. Lots of construction around here is the main concern. Drive carefully!

Reviews.Title: “Blackpool on Steroids!”
Reviews.Author: roycalvin
Reviews.Content: After long trip driving our RV with 5 of us accross California and having never been to Vegas before we were looking forward to spending a few days at Circus Circus. Unfortunately we were very disappointed, the hotel was old and in need of a lot of renovation. There were far too many guests with not enough staff. The queue at check in needed to be seen to be believed! For a US hotel the rooms were very basic and old fashioned and we even had to pay 50 Cents every time we needed to use the room safe! All the amenities in the hotel were very expensive including the food and drink and we could not do any gambling as the kids could not stop or watch you on the gambling floors. The in house theme park did go down well with the kids and the prices worked out okay if you used the vouchers you were given at check in. For better and cheaper food for breakfast use the iHop just up the strip great value for money. The free Wi-Fi worked very well and was probably the best value for money on the stay!

Reviews.Title: “It's a 3-Star Hotel so Expect it! So much fun for everyone!”
Reviews.Author: UrbanRedTag
Reviews.Content: One cannot complain about a 3-star resort if one does his/her research, as I did prior to booking. Since this trip was all about a 9-year-old's birthday weekend (who loves 5-star hotels), I took a chance here. As stated, do your research before booking hotels anywhere and don't complain otherwise. The West Tower was Circus Circus' "top-of-the-line" so that's where we stayed. Honestly, the room was bigger than expected, but I certainly didn't expect carpets to be shampooed or windows to be clean, and that's what we got. There's no refrigerator or microwave in the room and a quasi-functioning hair dryer. I think that the drains need to pumped, as well. I knew ahead of time not to expect a 5-star resort, so I really can't complain about anything. Customer Service: Top notch from Bellhops, lobby staff to casino, Adventuredome, shops and restaurants. The staff is not trying to hard, yet they are extremely accommodating for all your needs. West Tower: Not the manor (too many complaints about this because people don't research the rooms and get stuck with these motel style rooms). Connected to everything...Promenade with shops, Adventuredome, casino areas, restaurants, Midway Circus area, cafe, elevators, escalators. Restaurants: A little variety of everything all over the hotel. From Seattle so need espresso blends, which are on main level hotel cafe and Krispy Kreme. Casinos: Since I was not here to gamble, didn't do it, but they are all over the main level of the hotel in different areas. Children can pass through walkway areas marked by carpeting lines. Caution! Smoking everywhere in the casino areas. Adventuredome: Even just leaving another Disneyworld trip, we found this indoor amusement park full of fun for everyone. There are kiddie rides, thrill rides, in-between rides, arcade games, carnival games with prizes to be won and little snack stands along the way. The Adventuredome is air conditioned so enjoy the thrills in comfort. Shops: So many Las Vegas souvenir and general items at inexpensive prices. Note...sales tax of 8+% is added. But, everything is so cheap that it's hard to tell that you pay sales tax. There's even a salon if you need a quick mani or pedi, or even your hair styled. Elevators & Escalators: Enough to get you to where you are going. There are at least 2 dedicated elevators for certain floor levels so as not to overload the rides. If you try to catch one at peak hours of check-in or check-out, there may be a small wait time. Overall: The resort is huge, as with all major resorts along the Strip. We didn't have time to utilize one of the 2 pools, but they are there. If you need everything for everyone of all ages in a family, this is the place for fun and adventure.

Reviews.Title: “DIS-GUS-TING!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jesantinez
Reviews.Content: Disclaimer - We did not stay here (thank God) - but passed through to relive a bit of nostalgia from our childhoods. Circus Circus used to be THE place for kids! Upon first entering the parking areas we were shocked by the large number of smarmy, dirty looking people loitering in the parking lots! The hotel looks worn from the outside, but it is miles better than the sight that greets you once you enter this pit. Filthy, smelly, nasty!! The clientele are the roughest looking crowd I've ever seen and it was so filthy and trashy that we seriously expected to see tagging and graffiti all over the building. (instead, for some reason, there are shoe prints all over the walls.) I can't describe how completely disappointed we were! I am not really sure how some of these people can say that they enjoyed their stays here and found the hotel to be "nice and clean". I was under the impression that every hotel on the strip keep the common areas beautiful - or at least presentable - to lure folks to the casinos, restaurants, etc. All we did was watch one circus act, distribute a round of hand sanitizer and get the heck out of there! We found it dark, depressing, dirty and a little scary - akin to walking through a third world country - seriously! Circus Circus - clean up your act, this place is a disgrace.

Reviews.Title: “Huge, Confusing, but a nice place!”
Reviews.Author: RazzyRazzy
Reviews.Content: CircusCircus is a fair priced hotel and casino. It takes about 20 minutes to walk from the hotel to Tresure Island and Mirage Hotel. So it is a bit far from the most crowded part of the strip. The hotel is a bit worn out, but with the low price I think it is okay. The room was very spacious and the bed was a kingkingking size.

Reviews.Title: “CAN I GET A BEER PLEASE!?!?”
Reviews.Author: andIaintNobody
Reviews.Content: The kids loved it. The midway acts, the Adventure dome and the kids little mini-casino where tickets are exchanged for prizes. Great for budding young gamblers, complete with tour through smokey adult casino-its the only way to midway. For adults not so good. The casinos have no one ever near the slots to serve free drinks. No bartenders to be found, and the one i did find ordered me to go sit down at machine and wait. I ended up just buying my beers so i could enjoy my gambling exper ience. OH and the discount book is just hype, nothing in there but ads disquised as coupons. Rip off! And if i stay at your hotel i shouldnt have to extra for all day passes for kids to ride your lame rides.

Reviews.Title: “Long walk to the rest of the strip. Good room for the rate.”
Reviews.Author: katys862
Reviews.Content: Circus Circus is one of the last hotels on the strip, so its quite a walk to the other fancier hotels. We spent next to nothing on the room and it was average so no complaints there. I was worried that with the amusement park inside it would be crazy inside but it wasn't too bad. We were there in early May during the week, so weekends might be a different story. We did win the most on their slots vs other casino slots.

Reviews.Title: “IT NEEDS MAJOR FIX UP”
Reviews.Author: DRMIKE69
Reviews.Content: We booked a non-smoking room & got stuck with smoked room it smell bad even with the a/c turn on at max, the food at the buffet was not good i've tried better buffets.... the people are friendly is the good thing, but they need to do a major fix up...

Reviews.Title: “Suprised, Two Resort Charges ?”
Reviews.Author: rose524
Reviews.Content: I booked and paid for my son Andrew a 6 night stay on line. He told me when he got there he was charged a $54 dollar RESORT CHARGE when he checked in and a $54 dollar RESORT CHARGE when he was leaving? That should have been mentioned up front. Booked from Hotel.com. Never again. Hotel itself was OK, but could have stayed in a better one for extra charges

Reviews.Title: “Solid Circus Circus Experience”
Reviews.Author: dudemax
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel but this is my first review. I like Cirucs Cirucs. I like the fact that it's reasonably priced and the rooms are just fine for my not so high maintenance tastes. My rate was about $65 through Hotels.com. They do slap on an $8 resort fee. Oh well parking is free. The room was very clean and comfortable. The AC worked great. There were plenty of clean towels. The staff from the reservations to the front desk to the valet and houskeeping were all friendly and efficient. I like the promenade walkway with the different shops. I enjoyed a nice cold frozen yogurt. I like the 21 games at the casino and also enjoyed the Sportbook too. The bars are pretty chill. They have bartenders that juggle bottles at one of the bars. That was kind of cool to watch. It was so hot outside (107) that I never let the hotel or casino for very long. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “An old beauty--great for family trips”
Reviews.Author: Nellsh75
Reviews.Content: Circus Circus remains the one genuine family resort on the Strip, and we had a quality 4-day stay. Rooms are old, but ours was clean, and service was helpful throughout. Hotel staff would actively assist us and others in the corridors, as navigating the property can be tough at first (it was built in successive additions and can seem like a maze the first day or two) I don't know why you'd come here without kids (although many seem to, likely for ultra-cheap rooms), but I saw many young adults around in addition to the throngs of families with young kids. For adults, there's a full-service casino, beer pong, live rock music, and poker tourneys going on. Our little ones had a superb time--the roller coaster and other rides are great (I recommend the all-day pass), as are the carnival-style midway games and circus acts. I spent a pocket of quarters on throw-back video games, reliving my childhood love of Donkey Kong, Galaga, Centipede, etc. I really don't like the "resort fee" for all MGM properties. It's a hidden, mandatory charge, covering things that other hotels (more simply and honestly) build into their nightly room rate. The gym is hard to find and small, but has all the basics. Buffet is nothing special, but cheap and much better than fast food. Overall, it's great to have a Strip property this cheap that's so fun for kids. We loved it and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Good value!”
Reviews.Author: Venuz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel the last week of July, 2011. We had a nice stay although it was extremely crowded. The only aspect that I didn't like was the resort fee I had to pay. They give you a "passport" booklet which is really a coupon booklet. The coupons weren't all that useful to us. Some coupons you can get elsewhere for fee. To me it was a waste of money. Other than that, transportation is great, rooms were clean, staff is friendly. Wall to wall people, though. Can't complain, the price was right. If you're going to tour the Grand Canyon, the tour company picks you up from there. Overall we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “What u pay is what u get, Okay rooms”
Reviews.Author: sam2066
Reviews.Content: Ok, so i had a two night stay at this location, the price itself was very reasonable, but its location sucks, first its north of the heart of las vegas "strip", somewhat of a walk to where all the excitement and hype is happening.. the rooms itself are fairly large, both king and two queen size beds.. stayed here with friends.. the decor is pretty old fashion sorta motel look alike? Very small old tv's 13" inch.. my room's outside view sucked, was facing the backside, where all the ac system is, not good ;( The restooms are big but simple, the hotel itself smells like pure cigar, sorta reminds me of the old dowtown hotels in vegas.. overall what u pay is what u get, but if quality and fanciness is not what ur looking for then this places is it, for the price.. Overal quality: fair Price wise: Good!!

Reviews.Title: “We really liked it alot!!!”
Reviews.Author: lovePR57
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at this hotel we stayed in the West Towers because we read that they were more updated than the others. It wasn't the most elaborate room but it was clean and very roomy. The beds were very very comfortable and clean!!!. The two ladies behind the help desk were the BEST!!!! they went out of their way for us. I loved the hotel too because you didn't need to walk very far to get to the street. I know there are some hotels that are so big that is takes 1 hour to get to the main street. It is at the end of the strip but it's on a bus line you can catch right in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “MGM...............you should be ashamed.”
Reviews.Author: LBeasor
Reviews.Content: Hotel and casino need a COMPLETE face lift. Circus Circus is not at the same caliber other MGM hotels we have stayed at. Room had wallpaper falling off, bathroom has embedded dirt on the floors, carpet was disgusting. No in room coffee. Very disappointed with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Most Fun and Best Value!”
Reviews.Author: bovine27
Reviews.Content: Loved every minute of our stay at CC. Arrived 6:45pm on Friday 8/19/11. Valet parking was fast and people were very nice. Stood in line only 5 minutes or less at the check in counter. Took only 5 more minutes to check in. Had booked the West Tower and all said and done only costs $106 including the resort fee and tax for one night. Booked the room through our travel agent. Room was on the 30th floor. Room 30805. Perfect room! Clean and didn't smell like smoke. Very large bathroom. Two beds and safe included. Hit the Adventuredome first. Our son loved it. At check in they gave us two premium ride tickets free. That was nice cause each ticket is valued at $8. Played just about all the midway games. My son won several large prizes. Glad we brought an extra suitcase. Then went to the midway above the casino. Even more fun there! So much to do. Hours of fun. Before we knew it 10:30pm came and we hadn't eaten. So we stopped in at Rockin Ritas for some nachos. Their late night menu doesn't have a very good selection but it's easy and fast. The music from the bar area is great and can be heard throughout the restuarant part but is not too loud. Drinks are very strong at just about any bar throughout the property. Had a big CC margarita glass for $10 and refills $5. So strong! They definitely don't cheat you. Next morning I walked over to Slots A Fun. I use to have a blast here but not this time. Guess early morning is not the time to go. The slot tickets wouldn't work in the cash out machines and cashier was closed. Had to go back to the cashier in the CC to cash out. So just played there a little while. Just gave them my money. Didn't do any good on penny slots. This property was so much fun. Great for families and a wonderful value.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: S M
Reviews.Content: When we checked into the hotel, we discovered hidden "resort fees". Although I asked about any hidden fees, taxes, etc. before I booked the hotel, this was a surprise. I couldn't back out of my reservations without a fee as well. That night, at 2 am, housecleaning began vacuuming the room next door. When I went over to ask him to stop, he just stared at me. I called the front desk, and they told me there was nothing they could do, that she can't control thin walls or if "some guests are light sleepers". I went down to the front desk (which is a good five minute walk from the manor rooms), and the supervisor did kindly upgrade us. Additionally, the toilets don't flush all the time ("bad pressure") they said. There were no amenities--no coffee in the rooms and it a long walk to the nearest expensive coffee. I would never use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A steal for a hotel on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Codered11
Reviews.Content: This was mine and my girlfriends first trip to Vegas and we were trying to do it on a budget. We nervously booked Circus Circus as part of our package it was so inexpensive - even though we saw some very harsh reviews of the establishment. We were very pleasantly surprised when we arrived at the hotel. Although a little dated, it was very clean. Staff was helpful. We arrived late at night so we didn't find the long check lines that others complained of but we did notice long check lines at the hotel later as we were out and about but that seemed to be true of just about all the hotels. We had a king room in the Casino tower and it was HUGE! Very clean, serviced daily. We found the buffet to be edible but not great. The Adventure Dome was fun but between it and the midway I could see parents dropping quite a bit of dough there. We enjoyed the Casino although it wasn't our favorite - the staff for the players club was very helpful. There is a bus stop just outside the Casino, making access to the entire Strip very convenient. We did not notice a smokey smell that others mentioned but we did have an adjoining room with some noisy neighbors but that was not really the hotels fault. I would suggest to them to get rid of those doors. Yes there are lots of kids but it's a family resort- if you can't tolerate the kids I would suggest simply spending your days at other venues. The staff is good about keeping youngsters out of the gambling areas. If you're trying to do Vegas on a budget, this is definitely the hotel I would recommend. If I could make one suggestion to the hotel it would be to designate one tower of the hotel as family-friendly and reserve the rest for adults.

Reviews.Title: “old hotell, lost glory”
Reviews.Author: littlekimms
Reviews.Content: the hotel has a very onest name for vegas:circus it is obvious it's very old. it has nothing to do with much modern hotels the rooms are big, the beds cofortable, yet in a nonsmocking room, it smelled like smoke the personelle isn't very friendly and helpful, yet you can spend two days in the hotel wthout being bored the adventure [ark is great for children, the pools are too small the food is ok for usa, but for european standars it's very lousy. i wouldn't go there the second time, for no reason

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Trip For Family With Kids!!”
Reviews.Author: Kevin T
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews on tripadvisor, and with what I read, I planned the greatest trip for my family! We reserved adjoining rooms in the West Tower for two nights. Very clean rooms (we checked in early). Check in was not a long wait, as I have read. That might be because I did it before 3:00. Everyone who I talked to, except for one bellhop, was very courteous. And when you stay at the West Tower, you are just up the elevator from the Adventuredome. Adventuredome was awesome! We got discount tickets when we reserved the room (make sure you do this when you register) and the park was really inexpensive. Not only the Adventuredome, you can go across the hotel to the circus and midway games. We never had to leave the hotel for the two days (except for kosher food). Parking was acceptable. The rooms were affordable, clean, quiet, and the beds were comfortable. We also got discount tickets to the Lion King at Mandalay Bay. Bottom line, I was cautious about reserving rooms at this hotel. But if you stay in the recently renovated West Tower, it's a fabulous deal for a family. My kids are 1, 4, and 9. They all had a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: MitchPGoldCoast
Reviews.Content: Every time we go back to Vegas, we always go to Circus Circus. It has everything you need all in one, food, theme park and shops. There is a mcdonalds near the arcade and an indoor Theme Park just upstairs.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Luke G
Reviews.Content: From the second I walked up to check in it was bad, And it went down hill from there. My group had booked 6 rooms for 8 days. We booked and payed in full 6+ weeks in advance. We were told the rooms were going to all be on the same floor and they were not, we were hit with a $79 per room charge for complimentary (i always thought complimentary meant no charge) wifi and other service (it was called a resort fee). I asked to speak to a manager and she told me she was one and she would not get her boss. our rooms were on 3 different floors, the carpet was crusty (I had to walk around my room in shoes) the staff was very rude and unwilling to help in any way. Do not stay here if you have any other choice. I was also charged to have a fridge in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families I am sure, but just acceptable for couples”
Reviews.Author: kpcharlier
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal online ($55/night) so decided to move from the Ramada Inn but I wish we had stayed put. It is such a large complex (we stayed in one of the manor buildings which are separate from the main building) that it is a 10 minute walk from our room just to get a sandwich inside the casino ($9.50 for bagel sandwich, chips and drink). The check-in was the most offensive thing about the hotel. We lucked out and got there at 11:30 so it 'only' took 15 minutes, but after that, the line went all the way through the lobby and guests waited over an hour (standing, with kids running around everywhere). The pools were so crowded all day that you almost couldn't get in them. We had swum every day at the Ramada and never did once here. No free breakfast and you owe an $8 resort fee every night on top of room price plus tax. It is very noisy and the hallways are narrow, so when families with strollers are walking through, it is a very slow, intense process. Wifi worked well in our room. There are lots of shops and 'stuff' to buy. There is a fitness room that is decent. No fine dining available. $5 blackjack tables. Won't go back, not my style.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I had read!!”
Reviews.Author: Beamerleafs
Reviews.Content: After reviewing many hotels on the strip, we decided to stay at Circus Circus. It didn't take long to realize that this was the place to take your children. There was no end of things for kids to do and we are considering coming back with our young son next year. While there was a lot of kids staying at the hotel, it didn't bother us. We ate at Rock n Rita's a couple of times and the food was great and well priced. We did change our room at the start of our visit only because it was our anniversary and I thought my wife deserved a better room then the one I booked. The hotel accommodated us at a small charge to a room that was a huge upgrade and a great view. Overall this is a great place to stay for a first trip to Las Vegas for the price. We are coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus Hotel great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: darylcarren
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Circus Circus for our wedding and honeymoon July 26th, 2011. The rooms were very clean and nice and the bed was great! We had heard that check in was usually slow, but we did not have a problem at all, we were completely checked in within 10 mins. During the day the hotel is packed with kids everywhere, but once we were up in our room, it was very quiet and since we were gone during the day most all the time this was not a problem. This is a very good hotel, especially for the price. We would recommend it for families or anybody wanting a nice clean room on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “far and decadent”
Reviews.Author: RifkaRM
Reviews.Content: I don´t recommend it to anyone to stay here. There are so many hotels in Vegas, from every price, that there is no reason to stay at the end of the strip, in this dark gloomy kind of freaky (but not freaky enough to be interesting) place. The food is bad, the rooms are smelly though the beds are nice, the service is awful and even some of the guests are spooky.. you really just want to get out of there but everything is somewhat far. So save on the cabs and stay in the middle of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if possible!”
Reviews.Author: Mrs Robbo
Reviews.Content: The final 'resting' place following a wonderful Leger Holidays Tour of the West Coast of the U.S.A. Arriving on Veterans Day, the hotel was overrun with children who were not kept under control. Took about an hour to check in, by which time the reception staff were pretty fed up. Room was adequate and clean, but a far cry from the more palatial Venetian, Mirage & Bellagio. The whole place had an air of dinginess & darkness about it. Even with the circus theme it felt far from 'exciting'. Was situated right at the end of the strip, so taxis needed to enjoy Las Vegas fully. Would recommend going for a more central better class hotel if you can, especially couples of 35+ (unless you have young children who are 'into' circuses'. We were unable to upgrade, but would suggest you do if you can.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL DUMP”
Reviews.Author: sundeela
Reviews.Content: This is the worst place ever to stay. From the moment of arrival it was a disaster. When checking in we asked for a room with a view of the strip. The lady said she did not have a clue which way the room was facing but we could go and take a look. We did and the room was facing a wall and over the generators. We immediately went back down and got someone at the front desk. We were given another room and she also did not know whether it was a view of the strip. We went up again and no view of the strip, but this time it was facing the side street. A refrigerator was requested for my mother's medicine. It took 3 hours for housekeeping to bring it. We called them about 5 times and the front desk twice. Housekeeping had no phone etiquette and just downright ignorant. The next day housekeeping apparently prefer working in the evening because we were out of the room all day until late afternoon and the room was still not cleaned. The next day housekeeping changed the pillow cases but not the sheets. We were suspicious that the sheets were not changed the previous day so we intentionally put a ink pen mark on the sheets and what do you know we had the same sheets. We called about this and it took 2 hours for them to come with sheets that were damp. I called and spoke to a supervisor and she asked me what was that I wanted her to do - I would think a supervisor would know to send some sheets that are dry!!! She told me she would put it in the computer for them to clean and vacuum daily. They did not vacuum the room. Let me also add - we got stuck in the elevator. This was the worst stay we have ever had. I suppose the rooms are extremely cheap becaue that is the only way they are able to lure people in.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: n w
Reviews.Content: I would never go back nor recommend to anyone. Location poor, site cheap/low class. If they're going for that sleazy circus circuit feel, they nailed it. Was booked for 4 days, and checked in but knew before we even got to our room, that we wouldn't be staying. Dark, dirty, Loud, clients yelling across lobby, people lying on furniture, horrible pool layout, no wash clothes available/only towels and not enough. Tiny box TV with lousy reception and broken remote, Multiple request to front desk for assistance. If you're looking for a Resort Vacation in Vegas don't get lured in by the cheap prices - You get what you pay for!! Checked out after 1 day and that was 1 too many!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Mike L
Reviews.Content: Well i would call this place the Walmart of hotels in Vegas cheap and dirty and i mean dirty. Wouldn't recommend that your pets stay at this dump, staines and cigarette burns on the rugs. No sodas in the vending machines and it ate my money. Food was horrible for the extra money upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “We had a pleasant stay at this value for money hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Holidays_addict
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel past midnight and the check-in counter had a queue of about 8 people, which we expected via the tripadvisor's reviews. It took about 20 mins to get to our turn and the gentleman who served us was polite and efficient. Our check-in was completed within 5 mins. When we got to the room, there was a note at the door informing us that water supply would be interrupted between 1am and 5am for maintenance. We had no problems washing up before going to bed. We woke up the next morning to find that the water pressure in the shower was very slow. We called the reception and was informed that it would take another 1 hour before the water could be restored. But they offered to our room. We decided not to move and instead went for breakfast. The water supply was restore when we returned from the hotel. Btw, we had a room at the Casino Tower. It had a king-size bed and a lounge area, very spacious, and a lot bigger than expected. The bed was comfortable. The only complaint we had was the air-conditioning which seemed to be turned off in the middle of the night and wouldn't turn back on. We had to wake up to switch it back on again. One tip is do not accept any room at the Casino tower on the 3rd floor. It is the corridor that links the hotel tower to the adventure dome. So there's a lot of human traffic throughout the day. We were on the 7th floor and it was very quiet at night and we had no problems sleeping. I like the convenience of the Ticket4tonight booth located at the lobby, where we could get last minute tickets for same day shows. As we rented a car throughout our 4-day stay at the hotel, we parked at the self-parking garage. It was located next to the hotel lobby. We always try to park at Level 3 where there is a bridge connected to Advanture Dome. So, we didn't have to walk through the casino to get to our room. Circus Circus is located north of the strip, which is great as its not as busy as the middle strip. It was easy to get in and out of the hotel in the car. We used Industrial Road behind the Hotel to get to I-15 to get to the strip to avoid the traffic conjection. We also drove out to Hoover Dam without having to drive throught the strip. The steak at the Steak House was delicious!!! It was pricy ($120 including tips) for 2 steak entrees and 2 glasses of house wine, but well worth a splurge!!! The medium rare tenderloin steak I ordered was char-grilled to perfection. Yummy!!! Circus Circus is a family oriented hotel. So expect a lot of kids everywhere. Overall, we had a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Did not stay in hotel but loved the kids' game section!”
Reviews.Author: adventurefish
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in Vegas for a few weeks this summer (not at this hotel) and the highlight for my 12 and 9 year old boys was Circus Circus. We didn't even go to the dome with the overpriced rides. We just went to the gaming floor for kids -- like an amusement park/carnival. We went several times and each time left with stuffed animals (that we had to ship home!!) ha! The games themselves are cheap -- most only $1 or fifty cents. They're not impossible to win, either. This is a first for us as we have been to many theme parks where they charge $5 for one "try" at a carnival game and it's rigged to be impossible to win. For $1 you don't care as much and are shocked to win some!!!!! It was great entertainment for kids and the intermittent circus acts also held their attention. I can't comment on the hotel or casino at all....we only tried the carnival game floor. But this I can recommend highly if you have school aged kids and are looking for some old fashioned fun at decent prices. Even if your kid can't win a prize, you can win one for him/her. Everyone leaves happy.

Reviews.Title: “A tired and dated hotel - but incredibly cheap”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyM73
Reviews.Content: We were on a budget so when we saw some of the deals for this hotel we jumped at it. It was a very chaotic environment and cleanliness was very poor. I would recommend this hotel only if you have plans to spend almost no time at the room or resort. I dare say you could find a cleaner and cheaper motel!

Reviews.Title: “old time hotel”
Reviews.Author: oldbenny
Reviews.Content: older hotel on the strip and it shows , we stayed here for 4 nights but found it dated and in need of an upgrade rooms where clean and staff ok , took over half an hour to book in very loud and smokey in the casino area not good if you are a non smoker like us parking was ok but very dirty rubbish flying about ,.and alot of homeless persons around the hotel begging made us feel unsafe outside would not go there again not what we where expecting only one circus act in the midway area loads of cheap slot games for the kids ....

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough”
Reviews.Author: jonesanaya
Reviews.Content: I booked my trip through vegas.com and the cheapest option was circus circus, only after did I read some pretty negative reviews. Having been and come back, I would like to tell you it wasn't that bad. That isn't a huge endorsement, I know, but it was cheap, the staff I dealt with her friendly and helpful. We didn't have any security problems, room change requests for noisy neighbors were rendered quickly. The rooms were of average size, the furniture older and in some cases superficially damaged. I was surprised to find that the beds were awesome. Nothing pretty to look at, but it all served its purpose. We locked some of our important things in the safe, but we never had a problem with things going missing, or even things out of place. The casino was smokey, but they all are. The place was packed full of families and children. The elevators to the hotel rooms were not well placed for getting to the strip, and so we were forced to wade through a sea of children and a smokey casino floor to leave the hotel. The pool was small with little shade, but it appeared clean. All in all, I am happy with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it but a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: ststephens97
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 mid week nights-very good value. Apart from the place being away from the main part of the strip i cant really understand the negative reviews-a very entertaining place, rooms better than i expected. Check in took a bit longer than i would have liked-got there at 10pm Monday evening an waited nearly 30 mins and then had to locate the car park. Overall would recommend but would probably stay somewhere a bit more central and modern like NewYork NewYork in future.

Reviews.Title: “THE NIGHTMARE AT THE CIRCUS...”
Reviews.Author: Luna H
Reviews.Content: The ONLY way you would accept this hotel is if you have literally lived in a trailer for all of your life. We booked this hotel for A WEEK as a family vacation. We brought two children, aged 20 and 18. We read some negative reviews about it online, but we could not believe that a hotel could actually be THAT BAD! WE LEFT AFTER ONLY 2 DAYS... We booked for the Luxor for the remaining days. BEST DECISION WE MADE! WHAT A DIFFERENCE- HEAVEN AND HELL! (We loved the Luxor and had a great time). Most of the people who come to this hotel are from trailer parks, and MOST PEOPLE HERE ARE NOT GUESTS. It is extremely claustrophobic with very inconvenient environment to walk through. The structure to get to your room and facilities was very unpractical and difficult to get to. More importantly, there are MANY children in the way who are OUT OF CONTROL and UNSUPERVISED, to the point were they are crawling on the floors. You can hardly move because of the crowds of people, who stand in the middle of the hallways for no reason. Security-wise, ANYONE COULD JUST GET IN THE HOTEL ROOM HALLWAYS... The POOL HAD NO SECURITY & NON-GUESTS COULD JUST WALK TO THE POOL. ANYONE AT ALL COULD GET IN HERE. The pool was also the ugliest hotel pool I have ever been to. Just a water hole in cement. It is definitely worth it to spend a couple hundred more and go to a DIFFERENT HOTEL! (South of Circus Circus and Riviera). There is no air conditioning in the room hallways, which is extremely disrespectful to us paying guests. Do not even CONSIDER staying at this hotel, or you will be very, very sorry for your mistake...

Reviews.Title: “Time for a Makeover Circus Circus!”
Reviews.Author: bmxmom14
Reviews.Content: Rooms are due for a remodel. Checkin was fast and friendly, even at 3 AM! Bars inside are $$$$. $10 for 2 bottled domestics. Go next door to Slots o Fun for cheap beer and drinks. Cocktail Waitresses are ok, however there was one extremely rude one! Reserved Casino Tower room and received a West Tower room, no explanation for change. Nothing walking distance close except the Riviera across the street. Cold buffet food. Rude housekeeping employee.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, not great”
Reviews.Author: hondzyyk
Reviews.Content: I don't really gamble so used this only as a hotel. The room was reasonably clean and bed was comfy. Aircon worked fine. Had a room with decent view which was apreciated, A booklet of coupons was a nice touch too. Had to wait for a while both while checking in and out. All in all I'd have no problem staying again if I get the same deal on price.

Reviews.Title: “Maintenance man walked into our room uninvited and unnanounced at midnight!”
Reviews.Author: Mbr_jn
Reviews.Content: Stench, stains on carpet and comforters, raisins on floor, sink drained DIRECTLY onto the floor, had to walk a mike with luggage and baby to get to front lobby from parking garage, but the best part was the maintenance man walking into our room unannounced at midnight to fix the sink we hadn't called about yet!!! Do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: jogzi
Reviews.Content: We had a swell time here. The hotel has this huge fun center in the dome at the back. We tried as many games as possible at cheaper than Vegas price. Lots of perks there too for free. My wife said hey let's just spend the whole weekend here but I replieed meet me in rancho when the fun is over...... The rooms are clean. Not at the center of vegas attractions though but we still had a blast!!!

Reviews.Title: “you can still have fun at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ARCADE82
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 4 nights in july 2011 and we were not disappointed it may be an old hotel but is still swinging and busier than most . good value. rockin ritas is a good restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Value for the money”
Reviews.Author: guiste
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2nd week of July 2011. You could tell school was out since I'd say 25% of casino population were kids. Public areas of the casino were quite noisey and a bit crowded as a result, but casino tower rooms were quiet enough for a good night's sleep. A convenient "deuce" (city) bus stop about 450 feet from the main entrance made getting around Vegas by bus easy enough and a bargain if you buy the 7-day pass at the special weekly rate. The kids should be expected since the circus portion of the casino and the "adventure dome" is a great and fun attraction for them. I didn't see any kids who didn't look like they were having a great time. The security folks do a good job of keeping them out of the gambling areas of the casino. Slots were reasonably loose and the table games well-staffed. Table limits were mixed and it wasn't hard to find a table where the minimum bet fit your budget. The room was comfortable and clean. Shower was difficult to adjust water temp. until I figured out the secret is to take a shower in the evenings, not in the AM when most folks seem to. Water drained slowly from the bathroom sink, so I reported that to the maid who saw to it maintenance folks came up and fixed it while I was away the same day I reported it. I'd recommend folks who are bothered by the childrens' presence to stay there when kids are in school. West tower and casino towers are convenient to the main portion of the casino. The others are a long walk and (I've heard) not so well maintained. Plenty of places to eat at Circus-Circus and prices are good for a strip hotel. Go in Fall and Winter when kids are in school and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “still the same as years ago.”
Reviews.Author: ThePrincess87
Reviews.Content: circus circus never changed. it was an average hotel back in the days and it still is today. there's cheap food in the casino and unless you're saying in the main building the rooms are hard to get to in the vegas heat. its not a bad room but it has the old and slightly dirty feel to it. be sure to tip the bellhops well! they're nice guys who don't make a lot and are so sweet about taking everything to the rooms in the crazy heat.

Reviews.Title: “for the price with kids..i'd stay again”
Reviews.Author: heebs77
Reviews.Content: Very very busy hotel.....but for $40/night with kids, and the value in free stuff, i'd recommend staying here again-just book the upgraded/deluxe west tower rooms.... The Valet guys are great, all customer service was great...it was just extremely busy with kids...I have kids, and it was busy.....LOL Will take them back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Would have chose somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: Cheipie
Reviews.Content: The resort fee first is crap nothing is free with the coupon book except 2 ride tickets, pretty sure that is to get you in there everything else you have to buy something to use them. They say a free chips and salsa that is with a purchase of a drink. After partying all day we come back and about 10:15 pm someone knocks on the door ready to work on are toilet, are you kidding me we were trying to sleep why not come anytime in the afternoon. And no way without walking thru all kinds of sales crap to get out to the strip like 20 to 25 minutes one way. Will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “not as bad as i thought”
Reviews.Author: lauragibson100
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean and friendly however in heels can seem to be a bit of a walk from entrance to room. Clean towels and room made up everyday would reccomend for the price however next time i go will stay more central on the strip

Reviews.Title: “VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: RK67
Reviews.Content: Good neat & clean room at very cheap rate.good staff .I will come again to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good rate, decent room; casino nothing great, but location is convenient to Strip and downtown”
Reviews.Author: RoadTripRoger
Reviews.Content: We paid about $140 (including "resort fee") for a room in the West Tower with two queen size beds. The room was fine -- clean with comfy beds, good water pressure and hot water, good wireless connection. TV had about 35 channels. Yes, the hotel was crowded and there were lots and lots of kids, but once we were in the room you'd never know it. I agree the casino is a little tired, but we didn't much time there except for sleeping. It was a very good price for a location right on the Strip and within easy reach of the newer casinos to the south and downtown casinos to the north.

Reviews.Title: “NOT worth it whatsoever!”
Reviews.Author: vivalamadi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Circus Circus the night of July 31, 2011 in between stints of driving to the Grand Canyon. We were greeted by the valet parking area closing just as we pulled up and were forced to park in a parking garage FAR from the hotel entrance. As we were carrying our large amount of luggage to the doors we had to weave in and out of people who use the hotel parking area as a sort of shortcut onto the Vegas Strip. Once we got into the lobby the first thing we noticed was the dark, dingy environment. Children were rolling around on the carpets and running rampant without adult supervision. The line to check in was over an hour long. After having checked in we had to wait around 10 minutes for an elevator to our room that was in the supposed 'nicest wing' of the hotel. The room itself wasn't too bad but was absolutely freezing when we got inside. There were dirty footprints on the ceiling of the room (how someone managed that, we werent sure). When we made our reservation we asked for a roll away bed to be in the room when we arrived, which it wasnt. We had to go back downstairs to a desk and ask them to send it up. We picked the Circus Circus because of the rides and kid-specific activities but when the kids saw how crappy the place was, they preferred to sit in the room and watch TV all night. If you are just looking for a one night stay along the way to another destination, save your money and go off-strip. An off-strip Super 8 would be cheaper and more sanitary than this dump. If your destination IS Vegas, spring for a nicer/cleaner hotel with much better customer service.

Reviews.Title: “don't see what everyone is complaining about”
Reviews.Author: dareeds1
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at a nice place. I previously managed travel programs for major cooperations; so I know luxury accomodations. I also have made the mistake of booking trash. The rooms were basic, yes, but clean and cool; after the hot days and Vegas nights. Other than not being able to find the third pool, we had no issues. My kids had a blast. The food in the restaurants was very good; go for the all you can eat prime rib at the Garden Grill or dine and Rock & Rita's(Tara is great). Is the place crowded, sure. it is the only real family place in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: CrystalDuncan
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic resort for the entire family. The Adventure Dome was AWESOME! The Canyon Blaster, Disc "O and the Sling Shot were some of my favorites. The Sponge Bob 4D show was also a blast! I could have shopped all day in this hotel, as it was massive and selection of restaurants were very diverse. I previously read that the "Steak House" was voted best of Las Vegas for over 20 years and recently named by Zagat for 2011 as Top Steak House in Las Vegas, so we decided to dine there. The menu prices range from $30.00 to $100.00 a plate. I had the Rib eye. The steak was dry aged, cooked to perfection and well worth the price. The service was first class and the atmosphere was quiet and relaxing. Our servers friendly attitude and extensive knowledge of the menu made the experience just as enjoyable as the food. Our drinks were never less than half full and the homemade blue cheese dressing was to die for. I would recommend this resort, as well as this restaurant to all of my friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Flwerwlf
Reviews.Content: When we got here are keys didn't work for the room. We had to get security to let us in. Called the front desk to have them bring us keys and to fix the safe. Hour later safe is fixed still no keys. They also forgot to give us the free kids buffet vouchers. Bathroom had hair all in the shower. Resturants were awful!

Reviews.Title: “Run down, Overcrowded and staff arrogant!!”
Reviews.Author: Macall75
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend arrived in July for 11 nights at circus circus, we got dropped off by arrogant shuttle driver first from airport after our 11 hour flight from Ireland, at the back entrance of the hotel, nonone there to help us with our bags, lobby looked bit shabby and quite dark, we got into the queue which wasn't too bad, but was little confusing,even the guy next to me didn't know where to go, but finally we were called away to the other side of the check in desk, staff were pleasant enough at checking in, gave us a map of the place as it's really big, and you need it to find your room, needed to pay 8 dollars a night for resort fee, it gets you free wifi and use of the pool, but I dont know why they say these things are free when there not, finally got to room dragging behind us are huge cases through this smoky overcrowded casino trying to dodge everyone, lifts are as slow as hell too, upon entering our room first thing I noticed was wrong room, we ordered a king bed in casino tower, instead we got 2 double beds with an adjoining family room, could hear people easily next door, room is a good size and beds are comfy that's the only positive, no coffee making facility either, tv absolute crap, nothing on it except ads that sell you Vegas and the casino, not even a good film on or anything, view also terrible, looking over the circus dome that's about it, with loud noise coming from the air conditioning fans from the casino floor, so didn't complain much about this as I thought wouldn't be in room much, the hotel seems to cater mostly for families, kids would get a lot of entertainment here with circus free acts and adventure dome but it wasn't really for us, we spent our first couple of days in casino as was raining when we first got there, so were kinda trapped, we eat in rock and ritas a few times, which wasn't bad, but wasn't great either, they have no upscale restaurants just family places and cheesy bartenders who think they are class, there was no atmosphere at all in the bars, the entertainment for couples are young girls/guys is non existent, my advice just go to different casino, when girlfriend took ill during holiday, we had to get her wheelchair on her return, we were out of the casino for few days, we had to organise with casino getting a wheelchair first, very unhelpful staff when we got there again, I had to run inside to get wheelchair and they told me to bring it straight back as says different company deals with wheelchairs, no one there to give me a hand at all, very bad customer service, they were more interested in getting as many people checked in a possible as could see it was quite busy, anyway they made me pay another 40 dollars to rent the wheel chair which I honestly think is disgusting, woman on bell desk also looked at me like i,d two heads as if i was creating a problem for her, had to spend most of time in our room after that, with no room service, and having to go down to casino to order food every night, also don't go near shops in casino they are an absolute rip off, go to supermarket to get booze, water etc, they charge nearly 5 dollars for bottle of water and 7 dollars for a beer, joke!! When we had to leave our hotel we had to ask reception was there any possibility of staying on a few extra days, they were gona put us in a west tower with crazy prices, and woman on phone was very rude to girlfriend about it she just hung up. Anyway this hotel is an experience I just want to forget and definitely to not recommend this hotel, unless you want to be treated badly, arrogant staff, filthy hotel, and overpriced bars and shops. Not for me anyway, just so glad to be home in Ireland to some proper service!

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: PenelopeKtravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Circus Circus the last week of July. We were a bit hesitant at first because of previous reviews. Overall, it was ok. The hotel room was very basic. We stayed in the Casino tower. Two queen beds in a smoking room ( we had requested non-smoking), sufficient linens, everything thing just looked really tired. There was mildew on each of the shower rings and the shower was dripping non stop before we even arrived. Maintenance was friendly and fixed it quickly. There was something sticky on the carpet gum, syrup, pop ????? Which drove me crazy but we never called to the front desk otherwise we would have had wait and show them exactly where it was. All the staff were very friendly and very grateful for the tip we left for housekeeping. After checking in and unpacking we headed down to the main floor and we were overwhelmed by the masses of people. Tons of families with multiple children everywhere. The tourists here just plow through you. No excuse me, or holding the door open they just keep walking. Very cuthroat. The kids were walking through the casinos - they were not allowed to loiter near machines. The buffets were ok. Obviously not gourmet. We we lucky enough to receive the Kids eat free coupons which we used for breakfast everyday. Saved us a bit of money. The buffet does have a great drink station with milk, juice, coffee and pop included in the buffet price. My sons 12 and 8 enjoyed the midway the most. It was 25 cents to 50 cents for the electronic games or $1 or $2 for the carnival games. Half the price of the games at Excalibur. We didn't go to the adventure dome. Check out was fast. Be wary of all those people who ask you how long you are staying or if you would like a free show. They are trying to sell you a time share. Very very aggressive. I think they were the worst part of the trip. Annoying!!! Even the guys on the strip handing out the nudie cards weren't that annoying. Our last night there, the fire alarm went off at 3am!! When we went down to the front desk in the morning and asked what it was. The front desk girl says "I don't know, I wasn't here" ????? When we left Circus Circus we took the shuttle bus. It was 28$ or 7$ each for the four of us. We gave the driver $30 and he just put it in his pocket and didn't even ask us if we wanted change. He then says airport, takes your stuff off and drives away. Most shuttle bus drivers ask which airline so they can drop you at the closet door. Not this guy. Plus the shuttle was burning hot inside. We should have taken a cab. Circus Circus is fine, if you are just looking for a place to put your head down. It is old, smoky and dark inside with kids everywhere and kind of a rough crowd. However, for the price point it served us just fine and you can't beat the value. The next time, for us we will be staying at the Venetian or Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at Circus Circus”
Reviews.Author: pecogg
Reviews.Content: Our party of five booked two rooms in late July 2011, for a two night stay, in the West Tower. Check in lines were a bit long, but the staff was great and accommodating. The rooms were a great value, especially for the price. The beds were comfortable, the location was good, and the rooms were clean - that's about all we can ask for when staying in a hotel. The restaurant we ate at, the Garden Grill, I think, was fantastic, although a little pricey.
