We were pleasantly surprised at how much we enjoyed our stay there and look forward to returning in the future. I would not hesitate to book a room in the West Tower (can't speak to any of the other sorts of rooms there).

Reviews.Title: “Helpless staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelL0ver69
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Circus Circus Hotel for 2 nights in July 2011. There was a long line to check in and as mentioned in other reviews, the lobby was very crowded and noisy with children running everywhere. When I got checked in, to get to the room, we had to get the lobby elevator to the second floor, walk through all the shopping, food and amusement area, then through the casino to get another elevator to our floor. We were in the skyrise tower. When we got back to the hotel that night, we accidently left the car lights on so the next morning of course the car wouldn't start. We went to several different hotel workers who always directed us to another person in the hotel to see if anyone had any booster cables. The last person we were told to see was the valet parking staff. The lady working there said that they had cables but they were locked up and pointed out a man for us to ask. When we asked him he said they didn't have any. When I told him that the lady said they were locked up, he just bluntly said well we don't do that type of work. As for the room itself, it was nice and clean but no fridge. Shower didn't have good water pressure and they don't give out any hand towels. Food was expensive compared to other hotels in the same area.I wouldn't stay here again if I ever go back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Sensibly priced one-night stay”
Reviews.Author: Kayenne
Reviews.Content: We stayed with 2 children for one night after returning from the Grand Canyon, in a West Tower room, which was clean but perhaps a little tired in its decor, with slightly shabby bedding. The kids enjoyed the Adventuredome - we saw the Spongebob 4D show (a huge hit). This is a noisy, boisterous hotel and it is harder to escape the casino side of things than in the Cosmopolitan (where we stayed when we initially arrived in Vegas). Disappointingly the fuel cap from our hire car was stolen overnight. I'm not sure whether or not this would have happened in the valet parking area, but it didn't endear us to our fellow guests. I wouldn't recommend it for a longer stay, but it was useful for a one-night stopover.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a filthy hole!”
Reviews.Author: Nick12469
Reviews.Content: We checked in and checked out immediately upon entering our room. The furniture was broken. The carpet was old, stained and filthy. They placed us in a part of the facility that isn't even attached to the hotel and was "under renovation." The view, a tractor trailer parked next to the window. And the walls are paper thin so you hear everything down the hall. The entry to the hotel looks like it was remodeled in the 70's. Everything is worn-out, old and dirty looking. And the other customers looked as disbelievingly appalled as we were. Not to mention that the hotel is on the ghetto end of the strip nowhere near the shows and entertainment. Anyone who voluntarily stays in this pit is crazy. STAY AWAY FROM CIRCUS CIRCUS!

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth”
Reviews.Author: ragsthetraveler
Reviews.Content: U may get cheaper deals or some offers such as show tickets with this hotel, but ull regret for choosing this one. I felt some of the motels I stayed are better hygienic and cleaner than this one. The Bed, sheets & towels were stinking and the towels are awful. we used to hate to come to room, but some how we managed it. Its better to spend few more bucks to stay in better hotels.

Reviews.Title: “It is exactly what the name implies”
Reviews.Author: mariygerman
Reviews.Content: Circus, Circus is a circus with a circus. This makes it a good place for families with kids and a great place for families on a budget with kids. We just stayed there for 9 nights in july 2011. Here are observations and updates to comment areas from previous reviews: Yes, it is crowded, lots of kids running around, they will bump into you from time to time, unless your children are angels this is normal kid in crowd behavior. Check in was 5 minutes, short line, friendly staff, but a few minutes after we chicked in the line was quite long. Tip: as check in time varies greatly have one parent deal with taxi and luggage and the other head straight for check in. Rooms: We were in the West tower, rooms were remodelled (you can tell by the granite backsplash in the shower laid over the original wallpaper) room did not smell like cigarettes, was made up each day was perfectly acceptable Tip: We were in a room adjoined by a door to another sound travels via the crack below the door, to deaden the sound we put the quilted and a n extra pillow to cover the crack and this reduced the sound completely. Food: The buffet is convenient and inexpensive but bland food. Tip: if you eat here stick to things that are hard to screw up: The carving station, turkey especially, corn, and mashed potatoes with gravy. Pasta as with all buffet pasta is insipid. Amenities: Adventuredome was an absolute blast for my 8 year old, if you have a child who just reached 48 inches they will not want to leave this place. there are $4 and $5 off coupons at other hotels for adventure (sponge bob ride at excalibur for one) using one of these it's $22 for hte whole day a great value. Tip: go at 10AM weekedays when it opens and it is empty you can do all the premium rides in an hour, this is less than it takes to ride 1 ride at disney world! and these rides are funner! Midway: the carnival area was super fun for both my 6 and 8 year old Tip: there is a dart game for $1 where any child under 12 automatically wins a stuffed animal my kids went home with about a dozen stuffed animals as a result. Circus: There is a schedule of the circus acts for hte week on the 2nd floor by the stage , acts performed promptly as scheduled to large crowds, the acts were fun and free. Those saying they did not see any acts the whole week were simply too lazy to follow the schedule. Gym: it is small but functional with weight machines and cardiovascular, it appears they have waived the gym fee they used to have as you know longer require a special key to get into the gym. Gambling: I was a first time player of texas hold'em and the games which get going around 10:30 AM were great. a good mix of tourists, regulars who knew each other and were very friendly and very helpful friendly staff. It is small stakes poker that I played for serious gamblers you may want to go elsewhere. Some floors not have their own ice machine if this is a big deal for you ask to be on a floor with an ice machine. elevator wait times vary. Tip: if lobby is crowded to go up just go up the escalator to floor 2. press down, go to the lobby then up to your floor. The RTC bus is a good value if you plan on going back and forth from the strip more than 1 time in a day. Have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Not to bad”
Reviews.Author: Pinkteeth
Reviews.Content: Not bad but not great. service wasn't great. food was horrible and the hotel was full of children not that I dislike them just don't want to be surrounded 24/7 all screaming shouting and crying!!! Would not return.

Reviews.Title: “children, children, everywhere!!”
Reviews.Author: MrsKaydee
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 day stay at Circus Circus in Vegas. First of all, let me say that the room was beautiful, newly remodeled, and spotlessly clean. The staff is courteous but very, very slow. Check-in took 20 minutes after we got to the counter! The lobby is dark and shabby looking. Looks like it hasn't been updated in years. This hotel caters to families ( I didn't know this when I booked) so the entire place is full of families with multiple children. There were kids everywhere at all times of the day and night. There is a domed amusement park attached to the hotel so it's wonderful if you have kids but maybe not the place for you if you don't want constant noise and crowds. At first I was put off by the constant crowds but after I got used to it I realized it was nice that there was such a family-friendly place in Vegas. So if you are looking for a quiet, romantic getaway, I'd suggest you stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for our Vegas experience”
Reviews.Author: Rosh1888
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here, the hotel is huge and suits all ages. The rooms were big, clean and comfortable. It is a bit of a walk to the main strip but the bus runs daily and you can buy an all day ticket at a great price. The book of coupons they give when you check in is great too! The restaurant we ate in was the only complaint we had of the holiday, it took ages for the waitress to come and take out order and we weren't the only ones who had this issue. Apart from that I would recommend it to anyone.... from casions to circus acts.... an adventure dome to carnival games....circus circus ticked all the boxes for us!!!

Reviews.Title: “Return to CC”
Reviews.Author: thebakes1959
Reviews.Content: Circus is a MGM property that, while aging, is under costannt remodling to improve the atmosphere at the hotel...newer restaurants,bar areas,sports book mixes with old stuff,pizzaria,buffet,quite well...will go back and soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Vegas on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Nightyhawk
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Circus a few times . It may be one of the oldest of the strip hotels and it shows by being a bit tired but it does supply everything needed for a resonable stay in Vegas .The rooms have everything needed and once you are inside noise is not a problem. The manor rooms are a good place to stay and are of the same standard as the main hotel tower rooms but the buildings do look a little like bunkers but who cares it's a bed I haven't used the Adventure dome as i don't have kids but from the smiles i have seen on the kids face's makes me think it's fun also from 11am till late they have a circus act up in the medway every hour.The food from all the resturants is of a good standard. if you want to have a flutter on the tables without breaking your budget the Slots o fun which is just outside the front door has $2 blackjack tables. There is a Duce bus stop right outside for easy travel up and down the strip. All in all the hotel may be older than dirt but value for money wise it can't be beaten it give's you a base on the strip without being too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “West Tower Rooms are the BEST! The rest?? They can keep it!”
Reviews.Author: joneea
Reviews.Content: I visited Circus Circus at the end of June 2011. I reserved through a travel website in a "regular" room. Upgraded at the front desk for $20 more per night. Arrived on a Tuesday. The wait to check-in was more than any other hotel on the strip that I've stayed in. While walking through lobby on the Friday and Saturday, the check-in was practically out the door! There needs to be a better system for check in. The West Tower Rooms were great! Upgraded, clean. I've decided that I will not visit vegas again on the weekend and stay at this hotel. There was not any parking available on Saturday!!!! That was the greatest disapointment. We also visited the pool. It's located right across the street. This is definitely not a luxury hotel, but, staying in the west tower for the price was great! Wi-fi is included with the resort fee. I knew about the resort fee prior to checking in.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel little positives - go else, spend more where you'll get better!”
Reviews.Author: vagabonds13
Reviews.Content: We ended a vacation out west at Vegas. We were looking for an affordable place to stay with two kids under ten. This was a low cost hotel in Vegas compared to others on the strip so I did not expect a five star experience. But I expected a clean, cared for hotel and room that we could relax at after sight seeing in Vegas during the day. When we arrive there were no towels in our room and after spending time at the Hoover Dam we wanted to shower. It took three calls and several hours to finally get them. We were told we had a “very nice room,” but it was a typical two queen bed hotel room and not much space. They do not have suites for a family of four which was disappointing. The carpet had several stains on it. The bath tub drain was clogged and even though we call every day it was never fixed. When we took showers the water would suddenly turn very hot and then get cold and then back to hot. We could hear the family in the room next to us when they returned at 11:00pm – thin walls. We had hoped that after a day sight seeing in Vegas it would be fun to relax by the pool but the pool was small, dirty and had too much chlorine. I like to work out but after seeing the exercise room I skipped my workouts and just ran outside. My kids did enjoy the Adventure Dome and the all day pass was a good deal if you want to spend your time watching you kids wait in line for rides. You have to go on four rides to get your money’s worth. We spent about two and half hours there. Did not like the “floor pushers.” Even after we turned one down and she was walking away another one who had been watching approached us. It is on the far end of the stripe’s main attractions so we bought all day bus passes to ride up and down the strip. There is a place to pick up the bus and buy your tickets right out side. At least at the buffet the kids ate free with two paying adults. If you are looking for a budget hotel on the stripe, don’t plan on spending much time in your room; don’t care about the enmities the hotel has to offer this could be your place. We plan on spending a bit more to get more next time we are in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “nasty bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: Danspeanut
Reviews.Content: Disclaimer--we did not stay here--only visited the casino. Circus circus has gone downhill in the 18 months since I was last in vegas. Surly valet parking attendant (and only one at 11pm on a Saturday is not enough!), disgusting bathrooms (seriously, USED feminine hygene products spilling out of the one bathroom stall--and not just one piece), trash and cigarettes everywhere. Unfriendly casino dealers. I actually won a little and still I needed to come on here and leave a negative review. Don't bother.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location & Value for money”
Reviews.Author: sandeeppratima
Reviews.Content: Circus Circus Hotel , Las Vegas Well appointed rooms, responsive staff, Good meals. Food Vouchers can be used for either Breakfast or Lunch or Dinner. Most convenient location on the strip. Bus Stop just outside the Hotel. Problem Areas. Takes ages to Check-in. The Management must find ways and means to speed up the Check-in procedure. Imagine you have reached there after a 17 hour journey from India and it takes over an hour and a half to Check-in. That is killing. Prepaid Travel Visa Cards are not honoured. Watch out when you pay in Cash. Must take a receipt and also the final Bill. I checked in at 2.30 a.m. in the morning. Was asked to pay a resort tax of about 55 Dollars or so. Paid in Cash since the lady at the Reception did not accept pre-paid Visa Card. Took my keys and went on to Crash in my room. On the last day, I asked for the Resort Fee Receipt which I had not collected earlier. Was told that there was no record of payment of 55 USD. I could not believe it. I was also told that that Resort fee had been waived off by the Lady who checked me in and I was not reqd to pay anything. Inference - Resort Fee waived off, Money pocketed by the concernred Staff. Reconfirmed this from another Staff member of the Hotel. So, if it is Cash, just watch out.

Reviews.Title: “Ancient”
Reviews.Author: Vacation817
Reviews.Content: This is my second time in Vegas. I stayed at Caesar Palace the first time so this place was a serious downgrade. Its in serious need of a renovation. The hotel is dirty, old and overpopulated. Everyone who works here looks depressed. When I booked, I didn't know it was going to be manor lodge until arrival. I refused to stay there and they offered me an actual room in the hotel at extra charge. Please spend spend another $40 or so and get yourself a nicer treat. Find a place that's closer to central strip. I didn't even feel like I was in vegas upon arrival. If the ugly redheaded stepchild went to vegas, they most likely would lock her up here.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Mmozer999
Reviews.Content: They didn't tell me I would be staying in the manor rooms. You have to walk to them outside. I felt like it was a motel more than a hotel. I asked if they had anything else and they said they were all booked. The is no room service, not even a coffee pot in the room. I don't understand how this is a 3*** hotel. Never again....

Reviews.Title: “A bit dated. Quite a walk to strip”
Reviews.Author: tanya123-11
Reviews.Content: The hotel was bit dated although we understand that it is being refurbished. Rooms were functional at best. No tea/coffee facilities and no fridge. Pool area very congested. Compared to the standard of other hotels this one was quite mediocre. We wouldn't return to be honest.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but I'd recommend paying the extra to stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: HolidayAddict0506
Reviews.Content: 2nd time to Vegas in a year. Really enjoyed it! Hotel is cheap and cheerful, it's an older building etc so not as fancy as some of the other places on the strip. It is out of the way of the other hotels but there are plenty of buses although they are that full I'd rather just walk. If I were to go back I'd stay more central possible around the Flamingo. All in all it was good value for money, less that £700 each inc flights for 10 days. We stayed in the Manor building so the main building may be better but due to the time we went that was our only choice, April is very busy.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely massive!”
Reviews.Author: beachlover30
Reviews.Content: LOVED Las Vegas. Until you've been you will never believe it! We don't gamble but the sheer size and opulence of the place is breath taking. We did a night walking tour which took us inside each hotel. WOW! The Balargio fountains are something else. The Circus Cicus is vast. We were in the first tower and had a great room. Quiet at night. Large bathroom. Two enormous beds with high quality bedding and mattresses. Would stay again if we could afford it. I wish! The only down side is the noise of the ringing of the slot machines. You can't get away from it when in communal areas. REALLY slow service and VERY expensive in cafes in hotel. Saw a show, The Motown One at Planet Hollywood. Went to the box office for tickets and paid 120 quid. COMPLETE rip off. DIABOLICAL show in a theatre that is no bigger than my lounge and lasted for one hour. Complained my head off after but they didn't want to know. AVOID!!

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus fun for all.”
Reviews.Author: LaredoROSE
Reviews.Content: This was the third time we visited Circus Circus and everytime we have come to this hotel things are about expectation. We were given an upgrade and stayed in the West Tower and had a beautiful view of the strip. Our children (ages: 14, 9, 6 &4) enjoyed the shops, the Peter Piper floor ( they called the Midway this way because of all the games, and rides on that floor.), The Adventuredome and above all the Rock & Ritas Restaurant. Everyone we know asked why take them to Vegas but there is a lot to do there. We visited a Chocolate Factory, went on a Train ride, enjoyed Lake Mead, the Hoover Dam, and many more attractions. So much FUN FOR ALL!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort, quite basic hotel rooms”
Reviews.Author: Chloeleaning
Reviews.Content: Really very cheap rooms which was great for us. It had all the basics, however our room did reek of smoke and we didnt have enough towels but the staff were lovely, the resort is brilliant, esspecially for kids. There are 2 pools with loads of loungers which is good. It your able bodied and not wanting to spend tooo much circus circus is a great base, right at the end of the strip so you can walk the whole strip, however if you want to be right in the centre of vegas it would probably be dissapointing.

Reviews.Title: “Fun for a family trip, and budget friendly!”
Reviews.Author: sunnsandseeker
Reviews.Content: I have been a guest here on several visits. The first time was when our sons were on spring break from middle school. The casino floor is pretty ordinary, but it's nice to remain in the same venue as your teen kids, which is easy since there is a free midway area with kid friendly entertainment (think magicians, and tight rope walkers) as well as the adventure dome with carnival rides that will appeal to kids and teens. The hotel rooms are clean, yet quite dated, but most people don't spend much time in the room anyway. My boys have been to the pool area and reported it was fine, but I have no first hand experience with it myself. Overall, if you have kids and are on a budget, I would highly recommend this location!

Reviews.Title: “Prepaid for hotel / could not get refund / left anyway / Paid for MGM”
Reviews.Author: jeninohio
Reviews.Content: Late last year I got an aboslutely amazing deal to las vegas from cleveland. Under $500 for two adults, flight and hotel - 4 nights. Hotel was circus circus. When we got there the casino was dark, which i think is unusual for vegas. Check in was long. Asked for upgrade. Told there would be extra charge. Got to room and was shocked. I realize I got a unheard of rate but i couldn't believe it. The room felt dirty. Beds uncomfortable. Bathrooms just old. Tried to get my husband to leave that night but it was late and we stayed for one night. In morning went to front desk to tell them that we were checking out because we were unsatisfied with the room and they could care less. They didn't even ask why. Ended up at the MGM-awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bb24680
Reviews.Content: I read all these reviews and can not understand why they complain about kids.. Its Circus Circus .. its a kids playground. I stayed 5 days in the sunrise tower, great room and very very clean. Personell are very friendly and very helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a nice, pleasant stay is Las Vegas. Casino is quick to serve the free drinks to anyone playing and very nice. I plan on going back in September and will stay at the Circus Circus. Oh buy the way, a short walk to the Sahara you can catch the monarail... and after a few Circus Circus buffets a short walk is good.. ha ha

Reviews.Title: “Total Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: MichiganFootballMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Circus Circus the week of July 4-8 2011. Our room was in the Casino Tower. We chose this hotel not such because of the price but because we brought our 17 and 15 year old sons and thought it might provide them some entertainment while my husband and I enjoyed the casino. The room price was a nice incentive but....remember what you have always been told...you get what you pay for. The room was horrible. I've seen better at a cheap motel. The furniture was banged up and broken and sparse to say the least. The beds were comfy I'll give them that but considering the over-all condition of things I was worried they were probably not very clean. There were no towels in our room at check in and it took several calls to get any. We also had no shampoo (thankfully I brought some). There was a dead, bloody bird right outside our window and that was the extent of our view. The rest of it was the roof of the casino and all the air conditioners. There was no cell phone reception unless we leaned over the window and considering that it's the 20th century, perhaps more than 2 electrical outlets might be nice. None of us could ever charge our phones!! The buffet was sub-par. We have better chain buffets here in Michigan. We were accidentally over charged for an additional person, then they took that off and recharged our credit card not taking into account that it takes 72 hrs to remove a charge so we had 2 charges for dinner on our c.c the whole time we were there. Thankfully we had enough to cover it. Had we been asked we'd have paid cash for the meal. It was difficult to find anyone in the entire place whose 1st language was English. 90% of the staff were Hispanic. Those who weren't, were Asian. Everyone seemed sad and sullen, especially in the Adventuredome. What a bunch of sorry looking folks. The Adventuredome was a total disappointment. Nothing but a carnival you could find in any small town with a few rides that I wasn't too sure were safe considering the over all state of things. It was jam packed with kids who seemed to have no supervision. We were run into constantly. The clientele of the entire place was pretty rough. Our kids ere bored and annoyed most of the time. You'd think kids would have more sense than to plow into my 6'2" 200 lb linemen son, but no one seemed to have any respect for anyone's personal space. The pools were small and jam packed with little kids. While the life guards were quick to tell two Asian women that they had to get out of the pool since they weren't wearing swimsuits (the women looked like they had no idea what the life guard said and they also looked as if perhaps they were dressed appropriately for their culture) they were totally nonchalant about the puddle of vomit that we all saw a child produce on the edge of the cement near the water. A life guard came over and dropped a towel on it and walked away. At that point we left since we'd already been kicked twice by out of control kids who we couldn't ask to be more careful since they didn't speak English, and since the pool had a strange smell. The casino was pretty fun. It wasn't jammed pack and we did alright. Being novices to casinos we don't have much to compare it to but we did enjoy ourselves. Everything was way over priced in the shops ($8 for 2 2-liters of soda!) but for the most part the staff in them was pleasant. The Circus act we saw was a girl "stretching". That was about it. We never once, the whole week ever see one clown. Perhaps owing to the low cost of the rooms, the clientele of the hotel seemed kind of sketchy As a family of middle class, midwestern folks, we felt really out of place. We waited a long time for this trip and were all really excited. I guess we were pretty naive and should have listened to the people that warned us to pay more and stay somewhere else. Unfortunately, we feel our stay at Circus Circus was total disappointment and had we not decided to just make the best of it, it would have ruined our entire trip.

Reviews.Title: “Economical no Frill Hotel on the Las Vegas strip”
Reviews.Author: DelhiGlobeTrotter
Reviews.Content: Circus Circus is one of the initial hotels on the strip. Travelled here with family during our recent vacations to US. We stayed on the Westside skyrise tower. Though it is quite frustrating reaching the tower for which one needs to first go one level up from the reception, then travel through a long maze of shops to reach another elevator which takes you to your floor on the skyrise tower, however, still given the price at which you get the room, must say is a steal. We just paid $28 per night plus another $8.50 for resort charges. The rooms are comfortable though they are no frill rooms. The hotel is towards one corner of the strip which does act as a negative but buses and taxis are easily available. The Adventuredome at the hotel is a funpark which our kids enjoyed and we literally had to force them out of the adventuredome in the night.

Reviews.Title: “Good place.”
Reviews.Author: xuloza
Reviews.Content: Overall, it's a good hotel, clean and with good service, great staff, good room. Definitively would come back.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and we we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: JGPARSHALL
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights and 4 days and the hotel was in the right area on the strip and the food was great and the price range just right for our trip to Las Vegas and the rooms were a nice size with a full bath tub very well kept up and we will be back soon to stay and play at Circus Circus real soon!! ( If you want your dollar to go all the way you must stay here!! )

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for familys and low budgets”
Reviews.Author: Maria_Takarai
Reviews.Content: The service was great and everyone was very nice and caring. The room was clean, in a good state and the hotel casino and shops are a grat place to take a walk and enjoy with your family or by yourself, avoid the buffet though, its the most horrible thing I have ever eaten, other restaurants are very good My main complain woud be that the room are so far away from the hotel entrance from the street, so after a day of shopping and walking around its a pain having to get across the whole main building just to get to the rigth elevator

Reviews.Title: “Cool and cheap”
Reviews.Author: Licia_Miao
Reviews.Content: It's a lil too big and messy. It's hard to find your way in and out the hotel. The shuttles that go up and down the strip are expensive and the casino is small. It's cool, but you can find much cooler hotels in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Blocky1963
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 weeks at Circus Circus, I admit i was a little apprehensive after reading some of the reviews on the hotel, but I could not fault it, I had a room in the Sky tower, it was large, comfortable and very clean. Yes the hotel was always busy, but it is a family hotel and may be you had to wait a couple of minutes for a elevator on some days but that was mainly due to the numbers cheking in and out; I found all the staff very helpful and friendly, there is a wide choice of places to eat within the hotel all of which i found were of a very good quality and very reasonable. Would I go back? yes I had a great time Brackley- UK

Reviews.Title: “had a blast without overspending!”
Reviews.Author: day64
Reviews.Content: i recently visited las vegas with my son and 2 friends. we had a blast. we stayed at circus circus, a great place for a teenager, especially with a mc donalds inside! lol. eating on the strip can be pricey. we found we got more for our money, eating at the buffet. i liked the family environment. it was clean, the food was great, with a diverse selection. even comfort food like pizza and corn dogs for the kids! our room was clean and spacious. all of the staff were friendly and helpful. it's location to everything else was perfect. we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there”
Reviews.Author: Murphysonustour
Reviews.Content: Please don't do it to yourself,whatever the price.Shockingly run,overcrowded,dirty and smelly.Too far from the strip and the monorail.We slept here only,when awake we couldn't wait to get out.Knowing what we now know we would stay at the Hilton,off Strip,so quieter,but has a Monorail stop so quick,comfortable,cheap access to town.

Reviews.Title: “25th Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: vac1017
Reviews.Content: Spent the week, booked airfare and hotel last fall, only chose this hotel because my husband was born in Las Vegas, we met and married there, took young children to Circus Circus years ago. The hotel staff was great and it was clean; however lines were long both at check in and every time we rode an elevator. Lots of families as would be expected. If we go back it will only be to take grandkids, otherwise would prefer to stay off the strip. Ate at the Garden Grill one night to have Prime Rib ($15.99), shared a $6 dinner salad as the meal did not come with soup or salad, and $5 each for half glass of house wine. Food was okay, service decent. The place was not crowded and the atmosphere was nice, but could have probably had a better meal for the price and venue. The buffet one night was good, all food well prepared, but a little over priced at $14.99 for dinner (not the buffet we remember from 20 years ago where the selection was much larger and the price a little more reasonable) No coffee pot in the room and no room service available until 11:00 am, so we bought a coffee pot and cups in order to have coffee when we woke up. Left the coffee pot behind - hope somebody gets some use out of it. The bed was very comfortable, so that is a plus. We are not into gambling but the one evening we went down to the casino floor to play some slots we waited 15 minutes before a waitress came to ask about a drink order. 15 minutes later we left before those two light beers arrived. Not a bad experience, but we will likely not go back other than for a day with kids in tow.

Reviews.Title: “too smelly”
Reviews.Author: wendy080
Reviews.Content: good somewhere else this is a rough place to stay many times we have stayed in Las Vegas and this time bad choice of Hotel. when you fly from Australia its a long way and then you have a hotel that smells and kids are all out of control carpets are bad someone needs to read this and clean the Circus circus so people can start to enjoy the facilities

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Barbara255329
Reviews.Content: How disappointing!! This is the second time we have stayed at Circus Circus - the first time was about 15 years ago. There used to be a circus happening constantly throughout the day but now you get a 10 show every hour. After queuing up for over 1/2 hour you do expect to see something more than that. The accommodations are somewhat in need of refurbishment as well due to wear and tear. My leg bled from a scratch during the night and so I left the bed turned down for housekeeping to see that the bed was soiled but when we returned to the room - I still had the same sheets and kept them for the entire visit of 4 nights. Not good enough!

Reviews.Title: “Ew avoid.”
Reviews.Author: cdycdy
Reviews.Content: This place is old and tired and just biding its time until it is imploded -- likely after Vegas recovers from the recession. It has tiny rooms that are smelly and dirty, the carpet everywhere is trashy and trashed. The parking lot is not safe and the elevators for it are completely trashed. Avoid!! It's got the attached amusement park but you can just visit that while staying somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay with your children so much to do and see!!”
Reviews.Author: jcanales75
Reviews.Content: great prices and a nice place to stay had a wonderful time and so did the kids got home and was ready to plan our next trip back!

Reviews.Title: “Stolen Rim from Parking lot!!!”
Reviews.Author: qtprincezz
Reviews.Content: My horrible experience at Circus Circus: on Monday night I parked my vehicle at the Circus Circus parking lot, and Tuesday morning I realized my vehicle was missing one of the RIMS!!! I was in complete shock. I immediately notified security. To my surprise they did absolutely NOTHING!!! They would not help me put on spare tire!! They would not help me locate a tire store!! They would not help at all. The security department did nothing to help me. I don’t know how to change I tire, I am a female!!! OMG!!!!! This hotel sucks... They couldn’t even give me a number to a tow truck service, nothing! I am disappointed in the way they ignored my situation at this cheap hotel. Since I could not move my vehicle I was forced to stay at the hotel until my father came from Orange County to help me. They say they have cameras in the parking structure, but it’s obvious that no one is doing their job at the security booths... And to top it off, the security people gave me attitude. DO NOT STAY HERE…

Reviews.Title: “Kind of unique,but basically for kids!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lkimgdoo
Reviews.Content: The hotel experience wasn't bad. Checkin was 10 minutes and service was fine. Crowds were huge with mainly kids in attendance. The cheap price for rooms made this a unique situation for people with kids. Garden grill cafe food was good, but rock and rites was horrriibbbllleee!!!!

Reviews.Title: “"Kids Loved it"”
Reviews.Author: Eroshi
Reviews.Content: The Check-in line takes too long, after a long drive there to be standing inline for another 30-40minutes with kids was killing. Unlimited Buffet Food spread was lovely, we really enjoyed every meal. Rooms are Good we got fairly good view from 15th Floor. The Dome was the Best - the kids enjoyed all the big & small rides. But some machines were broken like Helicopter ride, etc. Shops were also very exiting except for the Tatoo Shop which promised a 30 days duration of a Temporary tatoo & we purchased a $50 tatoo which didnt even last a week I think you shud not have such shops in your premises as they spoil your name. Its not as if we can go all the way back to Vegas to get a refund. That was a real Rip-Off. Oveall we had a good stay with many special memories & some unpleasant memories (Tatoo Shop) which we would share with our friends.

Reviews.Title: “well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: mikepong
Reviews.Content: My son and I had a great stay at C2. We enjoyed a clean and comfortable room in the Casino Tower. We loved the free wifi and plenty of TV channels. The TV was not a flat screen, but big deal... We had fun at the Adventuredome and on the Midway. He bought an all-day pass and spent most of the day in the laser tag arena, meeting new friends. The Canyon Blast roller coaster and the Inverter are two premium rides that rival the best at any theme park. We ate at Rock and Roxy's and were served with more food than we could eat. Free parking is plentiful and finding the elevator to your room is a task the first time, but so are all the hotel elevators in Vegas. The check-in line was long on Monday, June 20 at about 6 p.m. but C2 had all their counters open. What I feared would be a wait, was a 25-minute process. It went quickly as well talked with other families in line. C2 is quite family friendly. A McDonald's with regular McDonald's prices is located along the Midway and opened early and closed late. We were quite happy with our stay in room 1423.

Reviews.Title: “Far exceeded our expectation”
Reviews.Author: RPAPKPMP
Reviews.Content: We were in two minds whether to book at Circus Circus having read the previous reviews but were plesently surprised. For the price we paid the rooms were a good size, clean, had free wi-fi and were serviced daily. Only real downside was a noisy air con system. It is a very busy place and would not really want to be there at a weekend but it was great for the kids. Loads of vouchers for discounts were given on arrival, food areas were fine and entertainment was great. This is not a 4* hotel but for what you pay and what you get it well worth a visit. We would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely brilliant love to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: Twinny791
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few years ago and thought it was excellent. Rooms were spacious and very clean. Staff were great and could'nt do enough for you. Absolutely brilliant love to go back! X

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Clodypr
Reviews.Content: Its just an old hotel but not bad At all. And is a Great place for Kids!

Reviews.Title: “Its not that bad!”
Reviews.Author: jmdg2405
Reviews.Content: So after reading all the reviews on circus circus I was actually dreading staying in the hotel. We arrived, reception was huge and pleasant. The queues to check in were not but after seeing the other hotel lobbys this seemed to be the case everywhere. Receptionist was very polite and courteous and explained everythin brilliantly and how to get to the room as the hotel is pretty big. The only thing at first I wasn't 2 happy about was a 7 dollar phone use fee but it worked out gd as we had to phone to confirm excursions and it would have been a lot more expensive. Our room was in the main building the casino is huge, after seeing the other hotels it could maybe do with a little updating in there but there is nothing wrong with it and there was constantly keeping it clean and tidy always hoovering, I never saw that in the other hotels I must admit. When we got to the room(964)I couldn't believe how nice it was after reading the reviews it was really spacious and clean. The decor was a little old fashioned but that was the style it looked recently decorated. Had a massive comfy bed, tv, plenty of drawer storage, an open closet area and a large bathroom with hairdryer, bath, shower and again clean!housekeeping were in everyday, beds changed what looked like everyday, we saw them cleaning another room a few times and they were very precise even down to hoovering the mattresses! Definately no quarms on the cleanliness at all! When we first saw the pool area we were really surprised 2 big pools and 2 spas. Lots of sun loungers. Towel hire. Drinks and snacks bar. And plenty of life guards. We constantly saw management telling people to get out of the pool if they were fully clothed, they did not stand for it at all. They regarded safety really high too. The only downside was the pools were always really busy and with how many children were there it was noisy but this is not a disaster. After sneaking a peek at other hotels the pool was admittedly not as visully appealling as theirs but was perfectly adequate. We only ate at one restaurant in the hotel which was rock and ritas and that was only for breakfast. The breakfast was really good, service could have on the first couple of times been better but it did improve. The only reason I would stay at another hotel next time is because of the location, you could walk to the other end of the strip which we did everyday but you will get a lot of blisters! If I was to go again I think I would stay at the mirage due to location and the pool looked fab.

Reviews.Title: “Shockingly Filthy! Rated as #1 for kids- no way! Avoid the lure of inexpensive rooms at all costs.”
Reviews.Author: PickyGypsy
Reviews.Content: We were passing through Vegas during a cross country trip and decided to stay a few nights to have some family fun. I did a search for the "best Vegas hotels for kids" and Circus Circus was rated #1. I have always heard that it was a fun, activity filled "resort" and was so excited for my girls to get a break from travelling. On the CC website, there was a "special" running that included a massive coupon book ($150 of savings) and standard room rates of approx $35/night. I was a bit concerned about the low cost but since we were able to select our room online AND because the hotel is so well-known and on the strip, we figured that it should be a decent place. We went ahead and booked 3 nights. When we arrived, I was pretty disappointed that it was so far from the actual "strip" but it was easy to find and somewhat open compared to other hotels that I've stayed at center-strip. The first issue was check-in. There were only 2 representatives but a massive line of guests waiting to check in. It felt like airport security and my husband was in line for more than 45 mins. Once he got keys, we made our way to the "Manor Lodge" even though I had specifically requested a different room. I didn't know that the hotel had a KOA on the property or that they had separate buildings (Manor) from the main casino. That's where we were. I don't know if the regular rooms are better, but avoid the Manor rooms completely. These buildings have parking right next to them, which is nice, but they are situated away from everything except a small outdoor pool. There is security around the complex, but it still felt shady. Once we got into the building, I was knocked out by the odor of stale pizza, vomit, alcohol, smoke and who-knows what else. In order to get to our room, we had to navigate a dark, low-clearance hallway that was strewn with pizza boxes and bags of fast-food garbage that seemed to be placed outside he majority of the doors. It was fun fighting with my 2-yr old who naturally assumed that we were at some kind of buffet, haha. But I wasn't concerned about her tantrum because the hall was also filled with various noises: screaming kids, fighting drunk couples, people having sex (from what it sounded like), and many of the doors were wide open. My 12 year old started crying and begged us to leave after passing one room that had a large man in his underwear (dirty tighty whities-classic!) who was holding a beer in one hand while chasing a naked toddler around the room, screaming obscenities because the kid was crying. The remaining 4-6 children and 2 other adults were randomly sprawled around the room, paying no attention whatsoever. This was before we even made it to our room, we were forced to stand in front of the open door because the hallway was blocked by a group of drunk, loud and confused international travelers who were trying to figure out where they were. Our room was stinky, dirty and bare. We had an old tube TV (not really important), 2 queen beds with minimal bedding, a night stand, and a view of the parking lot and a highway. The AC made the room damp and brought out the smoke smell (this was supposedly non-smoking). People were smoking all through the building, I'm a smoker but don't smoke indoors and never around children, it was like being in a bar restroom. The floors were littered with what looked like wet toilet paper and didn't appear to have been vaccumed in awhile. There was mold and mildew throughout- ceilings, walls, corners of bathroom and tub. The bathtub faucet was dripping so fast that it seemed like it was on. Half a roll of toilet paper, one washcloth, one towel, no hand soap...I've stayed in all kinds of hotels and motels over the years-good and bad- but I've never not been able to wash my hands. The bedding had obvious mascara and lipstick marks on sheets and pillows, as well as what appeared to be urine. Everything in the room looked dirty. The only thing that kept us from losing our sanity was reading through the coupon book...haha. There was nothing of value in it, things like : free small cup of coffee with a purchase of a dozen donuts, buy 2 entrees and get a free well drink...stuff like that. Needless to say, the decor is beyond dated which really isn't something that I normally care about-I look for clean, safe and comfy- but the old, tattered and abused wall coverings/furnishings do nothing more than accentuate the filth. As I end this warning/review, I want to clarify that I'm an average, mid-30's, upper middle woman who has spent my entire adult life in the military-I've travelled a lot, lived in tents for 12-13 months at a time and am not that demanding when it comes to lodging...I even spent a significant portion of my mil career inspecting and procuring food/lodging for mil members while deployed and travelling through developing nations. Circus Circus Manor lodging is not even close to what I would expect to find on the Las Vegas strip. After a few hours of torture, we called the front desk to say we were checking out early. They were accommodating and friendly but had already charged our card for the 3 day stay. We had that fixed, hopefully it sticks, and booked a room at MGM Grand for about $100/night. Pretty good deal, I've stayed there for a few conferences and they're great and affordable. Overall, this was a sad, disappointing experience and I would strongly recommend not bringing small children to stay....they touch everything!

Reviews.Title: “Should have stayed elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: jems4
Reviews.Content: We were told our kids (14 & 12) would love Circus Circus because of the indoor amusement park. Well, our room was ok, clean enough but after visiting other hotels such as Excalibur we wished we had stayed at one at the other end of the strip where it was a bit more upmarket and more to do. As soon as you get off the lift at Circus Circus you are hit by a waft of smoke. Didn't really notice this at other hotels/casinos as much. We would love to visit Vegas again. Even in the 5 days we had still didn't get to see everything but wouldn't stay here again, but the old saying "you get what you pay for" is very true here.

Reviews.Title: “"Completely gross pool experience!"”
Reviews.Author: nansisabe
Reviews.Content: What completely turned me off was the pool experience. I went down to enjoy the pool and spa with my kids and another group where allowed to be in the pool almost fully clothed in street clothes, the kicker was when they got out 2 of the guest still had socks on and the socks where filthy, they had been walking around in them, GROSS!! No one from the pool staff told them anything?! The group would go back and forth from the pool to the spa and no one said anything. At the end they took there socks off and just left them there on a lounge chair and left, completely grossed me out. I would not go into the pool or spa after that. I will only to back to enjoy the adventuredome and will not be getting a room here.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as we expected”
Reviews.Author: NatHardman
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on here about Circus Circus, we were a bit worried about what to expect. We arrived at about 10.30am and were told that check in wasn't until 2pm but we were able to leave our cases at the bell desk, so we went to the buffet for breakfast and had a look around. When we returned to check in, there was a small line, we had to wait for about 10 mins. The staff on the check in desk all seemed to be bored and quite rude and took a really long time to do everything and we had to pay a resort fee on top of what we had already paid for the rooms, which we weren't told about until we arrived there. The room was huge and really clean, a bit dated, but we didn't mind- we were in Vegas- who stays in their room apart from to sleep? There were loads of kids and noise around, but we did expect that anyway so that didn't bother us, as soon as we shut our room door, we weren't disturbed by any noise. The casino is quite far down the main strip, you could walk it if you really wanted to or there is a bus that stops right outside Slots'o'Fun next door. It's $20 for 3 days and it takes 5 mins to get you right to the middle of the strip. We were really pleased we had found that bus, you can hop on and off as much as you like while the ticket is valid and it runs 24 hours every 10 mins or so. If you want somewhere cheap and clean to stay in Vegas we would definitely recommend Circus Circus. It's not as bad as you would expect!

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not the best”
Reviews.Author: Yod2003
Reviews.Content: If u are on a tight budget it's fine. Didn't really spend much time at the hotel. It's quite far north end on strip. The amount we spent on cabs could upgrade to a nicer hotel in better location. Ambience in hotel casino not the best - Dark with low ceilings. Kinda old except we stayed in west tower room which was a renovated room and quite decent. Staff were pleasant and helpful. Personally I'd stay somewhere else if I went to Vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - stayed in main room and was great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Brenny1234
Reviews.Content: While it is a distance from the swank casinos the deuce bus made it all good - so if you want to save money - book online

Reviews.Title: “Will pay extra to stay somewhere better next time.”
Reviews.Author: Nod069
Reviews.Content: Casino really caters to families with kids but is very smokey. Booked a non-smoking room but none left on arrival. Room reeked of smoke, a/c filters were clogged with dust, stains and graffiti on furniture and it just felt grubby. Moved to non-smoking room next day which was much better. Casino is located a good walk from the action of the strip but transport is cheap and easy to catch. Beds were good and service ok but next time I'm staying at Treasure Island :) that place is cool.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the action”
Reviews.Author: TACCooke
Reviews.Content: Older casino complex at the northern end of the strip and really too far away from the fun/action. Room was clean, large and very quiet, serviced daily, food cheap but would stay in the middle of the strip next time. Bus stop out the front.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: MabTF
Reviews.Content: I arrived to check in around 5:30pm or so. There was a line, but with plenty of representatives available, the wait wasn't long. Upon checking in, you are provided with a layout of the hotel, which proves to be very helpful to newcomers. My room was located on the 27th floor, in the West Tower. *Note: If you want to check out later than 11am, the hotel offers the option for a fee, which is perfect for anyone with a late flight.* Now back to the room - It looked great, the bed was incredibly comfortable. I did encounter some noise disturbances on the second night around 2am, though. It sounded like a plumbing issue, which lasted about 15 minutes. Despite that, I would have to say that the hotel was a great value. I especially liked Midway, the games and circus acts were a lot of fun. Another thing I appreciated was the fact that the bell desk can take care of your luggage in case you want to browse around after you've checked out, as long as you pick it up at the end of the day. There are plenty of souvenir shops located within the hotel that offer reasonably priced items. Definitely try the pizza as well as the burgers at Rock & Rita's. As others have mentioned, if you're going to stay mainly on the strip, take The Deuce. If you want to do more shopping, there is The Downtown & Strip Express. Overall, I would book a room at the Circus Circus anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: mcquigge
Reviews.Content: We had no problems with staying at this hotel!! Great family things to do, NOT JUST FOR ADULTS! Clean and very organized. Really liked the Valet parking, they were extremely courteous. We stayed on the 34th floor, strip side. Amazing night views of all the lights.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: grandmabs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my son's wedding. The staff was friendly. The room was roomy and clean. It was on the strip walking distance to several tourist attractions. My least favorite thing was it was old.

Reviews.Title: “Circus indeed”
Reviews.Author: Keti73
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Las Vegas Circus Circus hotel for one night only on our way to Death Valley. This is an enormous place, I booked it online the night before and having not visited Las Vegas before I had no idea whether the location would be any good. It is a bit further from all the main hotels such as Belaggio etc so you'll need to take a bus to get you further along the strip. The room was somewhat tired looking and quite oldfashioned but had everything you need i.e. comfy bed and hot shower. There is wi-fi available in the room but you have to pay for it, I think it was about $5 or so, not sure exactly. It took a while to check in as there was a long queue but the lady that checked us in was extremely friendly and gave us some tips where to go and how to get there which we appreciated. I think location could have been better, it's not too far away but Las Vegas gets to busy in the evening and the traffic on the strip was awful so what would have probably been a rather short bus journey to all the main hotels/attractions turned into 45 minute trip. Although I have to say the female bus driver was hillarious, bossing people around, telling them where they can or can't stand etc so I think the comical value of that was worth the money we paid for the bus ticket. If I was to stay in Las Vegas again I would probably go for a slightly more central hotel but I guess I would have to pay more for it.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!! Where do I start?”
Reviews.Author: Juggernautron1
Reviews.Content: So, took my wife, 12 year old son and 7 year old daughter to Circus Circus. Valet was fine and check-in was fine. I actually had no problem with the resort fee which included wireless internet, coupons, etc. We stayed Thursday-Sunday, checking in Thursday at 2:00 p.m. celebrating my son's 12th birthday. It went downhill from there. Stayed in the West Tower on the 35th floor. Room was so dusty, I mean, really dusty and dated. TV didn't work and that was important because the kids were going to watch pay for view in the evening when my wife and I were downstairs together. Took forever to get that working. Now for the big complaint. We all did not sleep well. Couldn't figure out why. Then I see my daughter and see mucus in here eyes and nose. She blows her nose and black and red crap came out. Same thing happened to my son, wife and myself. We thought it might be an adjustment to the climate, but we're from southern California and it's honestly not that different. So, we chalked it off to an aberration, until the same thing happened on Saturday morning. My daughter was the only one struggling with her health at this point and while she tried to be a trooper, it was obvious that when we were at Adventuredome (the only good part about the trip) she was clearly not herself. We stayed June 2nd-June 5th and as of today (June 9th) she is still having nasal problems that she never had before. Even took her to the doctor who said that she was definitely exposed to some horrible air conditions. Not a big shock there. Well that's the big one, I'll give a synopsis on the other negatives. Some college kids checked in next to us Friday night and made horrible fraternity type nose till 4:00-5:00 a.m. What the hell are they doing at Circus Circus? Food was pedestrian at best, I mean I was a grunt in the Army and the buffet was barely edible. Player's Club? Horrible. I've stayed at the Sahara, Excalibur, Las Vegas Hilton, Tropicana, Luxor, Monte Carlo and the Riviera and Circus Circus players club is a joke. I played video blackjack at an average of $2 a hand. Probably played a 1200-1500 hands over 3 days, plus my wife at the nickel slots and you know what the cash reward was? $3.00. I gambled half the time at the Sahara and got like $35 cash reward when it was all said and done. So I took the food credit of $21 and went to the buffet Sunday morning before the drive home. They said I couldn't use the kids eat free and my $21 food credit at the same time. I told them was a crappy trip this was and if they ever want me back, they better accept both. Manager came, was rude, unapologetic and said, you can use one or the other, then walked away to leave me with the cashier. My wife looked at me and just laughed because that's all we could do. Minor things like a pool across the street, 40 minutes to checkout and 20 minutes for valet to bring our car around are like I said, minor. So, my daughter is on antibiotics and I'm still seething about what a horrible experience that place was. My advice, if you have a family, stay at the nearby Las Vegas Hilton, which is great value and walk your kids to Adventuredome and see a couple circus acts. That's the only thing they have going for them.

Reviews.Title: “rip off”
Reviews.Author: Chrissy0927
Reviews.Content: Was on a family vacation to Vegas and stopped in Circus Circus to see the circus and was very disappointed. The so called circus consisted of only one lady and her ribbon. The show lasted less than ten minutes. Also the shops throughout are a scam. Prices are not posted and the owners quote whatever price they want. I thought Circus Circus was supposed to be more of a family entertainment place however I will not be returning and would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Mere Circus of casinos”
Reviews.Author: amkibu
Reviews.Content: Not so great place to stay in Las Vegas. Very poor service. There are much much better places on Las Vegas strip for the same price The sleep quality and service is very poor. The faulty alarm was ringing in the midnight and when we called them to fix it, they did so after a long time and finally charged us for the service during checkout. Casino is good as expected, there is also a Circus show that they have everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as I thought it was going to be!”
Reviews.Author: JD2Honey
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the other reviews on Tripadvisor i was not looking forward to staying at Circus Circus but i was surprised when i arrived. We were allocated a room in the West Tower which was really clean, had lots of space and two huge queen sized beds! The hotel is located at one end of the strip beside the rivera and it is a long walk to the next hotel on the strip but we did not see an issue with this as we used the Deuce bus to travel everywhere. There is a stop directly outside slots of fun which is a couple mins walk from circus circus and it was $20 for a 3 day pass and the buses run 24/7. I would stay at circus circus again as it was really good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Front Desk Service”
Reviews.Author: XCDavid
Reviews.Content: I arrived at hotel at 10:30PM and the line waiting for checking in was outrageous!!!! When I called the front desk to check whether the wi-fi is free, the guy there hang up my phone out of no reason!!! It sucks! Won't go there again!

Reviews.Title: “It was good till we saw others”
Reviews.Author: Raggy420
Reviews.Content: pretty decent hotel, all the amenities you can think of. great staff, OK rooms, HUGE hotel, but old one. Located right on the strip. Pretty economical. But if you compare it to other hotels on the strip, then you have to look down may be. On the whole 4 stars to the hotel. By the way, great shows of circus. amazing for kids.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: DaveyChuck
Reviews.Content: Circus Circus is a perfectly good hotel and always a bargain. The location on the North end of the Strip is not perfect, but if you want to stay at Bally's....well...stay at Bally's! The rooms were perfectly fine, above average with all the amenities that you need. Plenty to do there, but the place is crawling with kids, so be advised! If you want an R-rated weekend, book one of the "sexy" hotels on the South Strip instead. However, it's hard to beat $25 bucks a night. Keep in mind that the place is huge, just like most of the Vegas resorts so it seems to take forever to get to your room. The best way to get around is on foot, but remember that distances are further than they look. There is a bus, the Deuce, but it's slow and pretty awful. You're better off taking the Tram (catch it behind the Sahara) with a 3-day pass or taking quick cab rides. You're on vacation. Spring for a cab! CC rooms are practically free, so don't be so cheap! Check in was quick and efficient. Most of the restaurants are mall quality. Pool is very crowded, so if a luxurious sunbath is important to you, go to Mandalay Bay or the Hard Rock instead.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Family Accomadation In Veges”
Reviews.Author: Welshy71
Reviews.Content: If your looking for somewhere to sleep with a little extra Circus Circus could be for you. Upon arrival after staying at Mandalay Bay it was a Big Step Back But.......... hang on this Hotel doest claim to be Manadalay Bay so...... Lets rate it on its own wright. This Hotel is on the strip in good location to the bus or a solid stroll to the attractions, The Adverture Dome is great value for the kids 3d movies, roller coasters and much much more but it does need a good clean! The free circus acts every hour are great and the arcade section always provides a winner of soft toys etc The pool is small and needs updating but at least you can find a deck chair, Food adds Subway, Mcdonalds, Krispy Cream Dounuts etc at this to the reasonably priced buffets, A little tip from experiance re accomadation if ur taking a family spend a little extra and get a connecting room as adult time is always good. For price value this could allow you to go to lots of shows and enjoy the Veges experiance

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: fruitykate97
Reviews.Content: First off when checking in they made us pay a extra 8 dollars for something that we didnt even want. Then the lady at the front desk mumbled and would not speak up when ask over and over again. So , because of that we had to ask 4 different people on where to go. Then when we got to the room there was no coffee maker, the remote was not to be found, and the bathtub stopper wasn't working. To get to your room you had to walk through smoking if you wanted non-smoking. The only good thing about our stay was the ex-marine security guard who assisted us in recovering our phones. If you wanted my advice dont stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with the smell of smoke...”
Reviews.Author: gojennygoRomegeorgia
Reviews.Content: Lobby and Casino area was awful if you are not a SMOKER...... It was very bad.. We went in different hotels while there to visit and non of them smelled like Circus Circus.... If you were a smoker you would be in HEAVEN..... I will say our NON smoking room was fine, large, nice bed and no smell..

Reviews.Title: “Great price, decent location, worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: Tapestrys30
Reviews.Content: I decided to bring my daughter to Vegas for her Senior trip, I looked into many different hotels on the strip (we definately wanted to stay ON the strip) and this one WON. Yes it is a bit older than some of the other hotels (not the oldest by far) and it's not in the CENTER of the strip but price won over everything. I found a deal on this one for HALF PRICE per night! We stayed here for 6 nights for just under $ 400. I must say being our first time to Vegas I thought we could "walk" easily up and down the strip to and from our hotel but we quickly learned TAKE THE BUS its a lot further than it looks! You can buy 24 hr bus passes for like $ 12 trust me its worth every penny. The adventure dome was fun for an hour or so, but not too many rides for older kids to last all day and at a price of $ 24 per person for an all day pass you would LIKE for it to last longer than about 2 hours, GREAT for younger kids though! I found the variety of places to eat was nice and decent prices right in the hotel (didn't have to venture out to look for much of anything). However I did think that $ 20 for a dozen donuts & 2 small milks was high but maybe that's just me! Overall the price & location won out on this, the rooms were failry well kept considering the age of the hotel, we stayed in the Highrise Tower which has been updated more than the rest of the hotel (worth the little extra price) and our elevators came right down to the adventuredome floor. We took a day excursion to LA and the tour bus picked us up RIGHT outside the doors "under the big clown". The only problem I had with this hotel is the location of the pools, not easily accessed at ALL from most of the room locations and warning if you don't want to be around a lot of kids DON'T stay here; after all it has a built in amusement park its catered to KIDS and YES there were quite a few of them there! Other than that I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Should have stayed at Motel 6 Tropicana the whole time in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jay34144
Reviews.Content: Took 45 min to check in, stale smokey smell to lobby and down stairs. Room was nice, but got took a long walk to get there.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotels ever”
Reviews.Author: Alida24
Reviews.Content: This is a horrible place. The manor rooms appear to be in what looks like concrete airline hangars and away from the main hotel. Probably a good reason for this. The rooms and corridors stank of cigarette smoke, stairwells dirty, fight erupted in the room next door, everythign in the room bolted down. Could not move the el cheapo alarm clock....obviously theft is a problem here. Can't say there is anything good to say about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Met our needs exactly”
Reviews.Author: AliWiseman
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in Sahara and the Strat before we knew the location of CC and were happy with it. The deuce service is excellent and as we were up and about every day before 10am, so the bus was busy, but not crowded. Upgraded our reservations to the west tower and were not disappointed with the room. Living in Holland on water meters, baths are something that happen to other people so I was glad to be able to just lay down and soak. Have to say that the shampoo made my hair feel great... if it had masked the grey I would've bulk ordered some for home! As it happened we managed to get a little sun burn so were careful not to go far for a 24 hour period, but, this too was fine. Local pub in the Riviera across the road gave us beers and a decent meal, and the Subway did a great breakfast 2 days running til we were more mobile! Wifi is included in the resort fee.. which is a real boon. Aided us enormously! The two pools we saw were not busy while we were there, and to be fair, I rarely noticed kids either outside or in the hotel. I also never noticed and smell/ issues with decor! There is a snobbery about some of the people who write about CC in reviews. They think you have to spend a minimum $60 a night and the thought of a bus appears to terrify them. If these things do bother you, then fair enough, go stay somewhere else. For myself, and the wife, we thought it was ideal, and would stay here again without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, good service, would go back there”
Reviews.Author: valdon27
Reviews.Content: After booking this trip I read some pretty bad reviews for circus circus so was apprehensive about going there. Check in staff were friendly and very helpful, stayed in the Skyrise Tower, a bit of a trek from main lobby but not a problem. Room was nice and clean and bed was extremely comfortable, housekeeping came in everyday to change towels and soap etc, food was good and the buffet was very reasonable. Also on the casino floor never had to wait long for a cocktail waitress which is more than I can say about some more upmarket hotels further down the strip. If you want a reasonably priced hotel which is on the strip albeit at the start of the strip, I would choose this hotel. Although we did not spend a great deal of time in our room, there was never any problems with noise etc but we were on the 26th floor. All in all a very enjoyable trip.

Reviews.Title: “West Tower Room was comfortable”
Reviews.Author: roxy1947
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Circus Circus May 16-20. Our stay was part of Southwest Vacations which linked airline travel and hotel together. My husband and I were comfortable in our West Tower room. The bed was comfortable though the bed linens weren't of great quality. The air conditioning was very quiet and worked well. We asked for a non smoking room and got it. The flat screen T.V. was nice to have. I had no trouble using WiFi in the room (it is part of your daily hotel fee). The bathroom was much bigger than I expected with plenty of hot water. The housekeepers kept the room very clean. I brought my own travel size coffee maker. Everyone we dealt with at CC was pleasant and helpful. The strip view from out window wasn't much too look at as the area around CC is mostly unfinished construction projects. The location of CC is not great. You will be walking a lot but you can also buy tickets on the Deuce bus. A ticket station can be located outside Slots of Fun right by CC. We spent little time at CC and preferred to go elsewhere on the strip for shows and meals. We only ate one meal at CC. The first night we ate in the The Garden Grill. The food was good and also reasonably priced. Our service was very good in the restaurant. We wouldn't stay at CC on our next visit as we prefer a nicer place and are willing to pay more to get it. As this was part of a package we opted not to change to a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel.. Do not deserve even 2 stars”
Reviews.Author: kyag
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in about 100 different starred hotel in entire USA. This is so far the worst hotel in the entire USA. Wait in line to get a room: 50 minutes. Asking to select Rooms option: No rooms can be assigned based on the traveler's need, whatever is available, will give. Room location: outside of hotel, 10 mins walk outside the hotel from registration desk. Room Amenity: free internet (Only good thing) everything else is bad. dark. dirty. about 30 years old building!! Noisy... House keeping forget to put body lotion in the room. when called kept in wait for 5 mins. then lady answered in Mexican accent that no body lotion for rooms. when talked to supervisor, replied that will be sending someone to check that. wait time 1 hour. I would not recommend this hotel to any one who wants to enjoy stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “the hotel was fine ...except”
Reviews.Author: beezzneezz1
Reviews.Content: we found this hotel ok, you get what you pay for i suppose , the room was big and clean , i couldnt fault it until bed time, the elivators kept me up all nite as our room was next to them and coz its vagas its 24/7, hubby didnt here a thing , i had to go sleep in sis in laws room ....but apart from that it was all good .

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for reasonably price”
Reviews.Author: stated
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice especially with kids, there are lot of arcade game and rides. We got West tower hotel rooms which are renovated. So make sure when you book the hotel you ask for West tower rooms. Ride are good for kids and reasonably priced. Only issues is it is far from street and a cab will cost you $15-$20 if you want to go to strip. Restaurant at hotel are reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for & located at the end of the strip.”
Reviews.Author: GothicTz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok. I had to pay $15 for a taxi to drive me to the other end of the strip to shop then another $15 back to Circus Circus. One thing is that the restraunt across the street called The Peppermill is close and yummy. This place was ok for us to sleep at but wasn't what I was expecting. That is ok though because Vegas was still fun!

Reviews.Title: “West Tower Room - Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: TNGal08
Reviews.Content: I had found a package vacation special online at MGM properties that I could not pass up - unfortunately to make it worth our while we had to stay at Circus Circus, so I was very reluctant. I've been visiting Vegas for 30 years at least 2 times a year and have never stayed at this property since I did not have a very good impression. Not any more! With the Sahara closing this is one of the oldest properties left in Vegas so it is a bit worn in the common areas, but if you have this in mind it really is not too bad and a very good value. When we arrived on Wednesday afternoon the check-in line looked very long so I was prepared to wait quite a while - NOT! The staff was fast and friendly and it took about 20 minutes to get a room assignment. I did ask if there were any "updated" rooms available (since I'd read many reviews and this seemed to be the best bet) and was given one in the West Tower. Very large and clean Queen room with marble desk/tabletops, flat screen TV, marble tub surround and sink tops. Only negative is we were in a room with an a adjoining door (no insulation between = no sound barrier) and our neighbors were partying at all hours....not the hotels fault. I didn't run much $$ through the machines here but I did get a players club card and the comps seemed to be fairly generous, at least in comparison to other "strip" properties. My friend used comps every day of our stay in the various restaurants and I'd say unless you have comps to use go elsewhere for your meals. Just one example is breakfast at Rockin' Rita's: 3 pancakes (my friend asked what else comes with this for $8.99 and the smart alec response was "syrup" - REALLY??) and coffee (comes in a carafe for one at $2.95) totaled over $12 with tax. The Westside Deli was reasonably priced and had good food but they only had one person taking orders and then preparing the order.....long line every time.

Reviews.Title: “Better then expected”
Reviews.Author: Sasso74
Reviews.Content: The rooms were better than expected and comfortable. The staff were nice and comps were great - much better than the harrah's/ MGM hotels. Location a bit out of the way. The pool was just average. Stay away form the buffet - terrible!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pink-princess-1981
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my sister in january, this was my first time in las vegas. I stayed here for 5 nights. Once we arrived at the hotel there was about a 20 minute wait to check in, the staff were friendly. Our room was on the 34th floor i think and was quiet large. the decor was fine the beds were comfy and it was clean. The hotel casino was fine not that i gamble but the circus acts were a bit boring. I have booked to go back in June with my bf but we are staying in the tropicana this time. I would stay at this hotel again though as it offers good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel - renovation needed”
Reviews.Author: AGranini
Reviews.Content: In my opinion the circus circus needs to be renovated. The rooms look like the time has been stopped in the 70ties. My dad had to call someone twice to get the drain in the shower fixed. It was all plugged up. The beds were comfortable though, which made one sleep good. The windows were dirty, so sadly you couldn't really enjoy the view. Sorry circus circus... but we won't stay with you the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Insulted!!”
Reviews.Author: VistaRosie
Reviews.Content: We arrived and were checking in. We were in line for 20 min. I checked in and took kids straight to room to get are bathing suits on. We went to the 3rd floor to the pool. The pool is as big as the one i have at home. Nothing great. Then we went for lunch at ROCK & RITAS. we were trated rudely. We got are food after several other people. We got a check and i sighned it but are room number and gave tip. After that we went out to check everything out. We got to hotel at 12am and straight to sleep. in the morning i noticed i had a message it was ROCK & RITAS. I had to go pay bill because i had stolen food. and i should know that and they needed me asap. what the hell if i has stolen food why would i leave room number sig and tip. Stupid lady. I was so mad. she is calling me a thief. I went to the manager they were supposed to get back to me that day. They never called. The next day i was leaving and i called because i didnt want to leave with out problem being solved. They said she is under investigation. What does that mean. are they calling CSI? They still expected me to pay bill. I dont think so. Nobody calls me a thief and just gets a slap in the hand, Food was not great either thats why they give you a coupon.

Reviews.Title: “Been to Vegas lots, first stay at Circus Circus”
Reviews.Author: ConradB
Reviews.Content: ... Didn't know what to expect.. Tower room was large. Some furniture dated, but clean and comfortable bed and pillows. Pool was not really what I would have expected. No drink service. On ground level with traffic driving by. Lot's of kids It was overall good and would stay again

Reviews.Title: “West wing - the way to go...”
Reviews.Author: ostan14
Reviews.Content: Okay, let's not beat about the bush. This is not a great hotel. It has seen better days, it is pretty shabby, and not well kept. Some of the guests are, shall we say, "different". Part of the casino area reeks of smoke. The lines to check in seem to be permanently long. The location is at the wrong end of the strip. The general area is slightly seedy.
