But...... you can make it work. It is very good value, and it is absolutely essential that you pay the extra ten dollars at check in and upgrade to the west wing. There you will find a fairly decent room, comfy beds, newly refurbished and not far off the quality of the room we stayed in earlier in the week at the MGM Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Best cheap hotel I've seen”
Reviews.Author: SeahowksFan
Reviews.Content: The rate was so cheap for my stay ($25/night base) that I went to Circus Circus with little expectation and was very pleasantly surprised. The room in Casino tower was just as described, very clean, non-smoking, good housekeeping service, friendly staff everywhere. Not much for view but not looking into other hotel rooms either. Location was central between strip and Freemont - $12 by cab or take the $7/day bus to either the far end of the strip or to downtown. Good rollercoast and free ride came with the room. Good steakhouse. Pool is not fancy but it is there and you can go to the other hotels for their pools and ambiance anyway. Can't beat the price and there was no hidden catch after all!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - not a bad word to say”
Reviews.Author: MarcusG86
Reviews.Content: After spending $28 each night for a crumby LA hostel, I was amazed at the value for money I got for the $35 per night at Circus Circus! I stayed in the Casino Tower and had a nice sized room with a TV, big bed, nice bathroom and I had a view of the Stratosphere away from the Strip so there was no noise. I got to Las Vegas with no map or research of where to go or what to do, but luckily they have magazines and pamphlets of everything you need to know on the desk. They also give you a booklet of vouchers to use including free rides at the mini theme park, money off food and free gambling lessons. On the ground floor they have desks where you can book Grand Canyon tours, tickets to shows, phone cards and stamps so they have everything you need under one roof. The restaurants and shop within Circus Circus are pricey, but there a couple of supermarkets across the road so you can take food back to your room to eat, but for lunch/dinner I walked down the road to The Fashion Show where they have lots of fast food places (including salad bars – they’re not all unhealthy!) which is probably the cheapest place to eat on the Strip. The maids clean your room to a really high standard and the staff are helpful and polite. They have shuttle buses every half hour to take people to the airport so you don’t have to worry about a thing! To get to Circus Circus from the airport, you just ask for a shuttle bus which drops people off along the strip and only costs $7!! Circus Circus may be further up the strip away from the main attractions like The Bellagio or Treasure Island, but I consider this to be something positive because they have bright lights and music playing until really late down that end, so it was nice to be able to leave it all behind and go back to my quiet hotel room. I would definitely go back to Circus Circus again because it’s so cheap and you get real value for money! I haven’t really got a bad word to say about it.

Reviews.Title: “better than my expectation”
Reviews.Author: junglyhh
Reviews.Content: I have been to Las Vegas two times before and Circus Circus gave me the impression of a mixture of kindergarten and smoking paradise. I was on a business trip this time and all other hotels on the strip for that weekend were way too expensive for my reimboursement budget so I had no other choices except may be Sahara or Travelodge. Actually it's better than my expectation. Room is clean, TV is old but at least it works, bathroom is of moderate size. There is no smell of cheap air fresheners in the room. The hotel is a little bit far away from the center of the strip, but I think it's still better than Mandalay Bay or Luxor, let alone the Stratosphere. Anyway, you come to Vegas for either gambling or other funs, not staying in hotel room and watch a 18-inch tv.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible horrible”
Reviews.Author: rperus
Reviews.Content: Ugly, dirty, bad service... better pay more bucks for a nicer hotel

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus Fun, Slots of Fun NO FUN”
Reviews.Author: RetiredIBEW
Reviews.Content: We stayed in West Tower 30th floor, room was large, clean and well kept. The flat panel tv was wall mounted so best viewed in front on bed. Adventuredome was fun for our 14 year old grand daughter. Lots of kids, better to walk thru casino. We ate at Buffet, was ok, good selection for lunch althought some ants in our salads. There was never a line to get in which I can remember it was always a long wait, don't know why alot of people in the casino. Circus Circus is alot of fun if you have kids, if not go some where else. Slots of Fun used to be a spot I would always visit, but they have change mgt or something its just not fun or exciting anymore. Went to bar to play video poker and ordered a Coors Light and was told could only comp Bud or charge me $2.75 for the Coors after a few minutes I went across the street to Rivera and found it to be quite fun, where I spent the next 4 hours. I tried Slots of Fun the next day but still drab, boreing nothing happening, so I done with Slots of No Fun

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: byvette
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Circus Circus April 15-April 18. Arrived at 10:00 PM. Check in line was very long, but went very quickly. At first impression I thought it might be a 2 hr. wait, but only took about 30 mins. Had room in casino tower. Very modern with very comfortable bed. Ate at the Circus buffet for breakfast which had a great variety for only $12.99. Ate dinner at The Garden Grill Restaurant , had all you eat pork ribs for $14.99, plus my daughter had the all you can eat prime ribs for $14.99. Both were excellent. Even though it was at the far end of the srtip, we just got the duce bus, which for $7 you can ride all day up and down the strip. You can catch it right outside the main entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus lives up to it's name”
Reviews.Author: alexp3953
Reviews.Content: We were traveling from the Grand Canyon to Las Vegas, when we realized we would be arriving late, we called the hotel to alert them. The rooms were pre-paid. We connected to the hotel, pressed the button for reservations/front desk and were given another number to call to talk to a person. We dialed that number and it was a Fax machine, we double checked the number and it was a FAX machine. We arrived at 12:30am - there were at least 60 people in line to check in - it was Wednesday night. There were TWO people working the desk. Eventually there were up to 5, and at 2:45am we walked in our room. There was ONE Bellman on duty - we needed a wheelchair, he did his best to make himself available, and was very pleasant. The next day it took 45 minutes to get our car from Valet parking - there were 3 people working. I did not spend one more dime in the hotel - we ate elsewhere and got out of there as quick as we could. The staff was great - they were terribly overworked. Management of these good people was incredibly poor - and the guests suffered -

Reviews.Title: “on the strip”
Reviews.Author: happychap99
Reviews.Content: the hotel is the bottem edge of the strip and not handy for looking around the other hotels which is a good way of spending time not money as all the hotels are worth a visit and well worth seeing vegas is not the place it used to be now that it is run by greedy corporations there is a bus stop outside and a 24 hour pass is cheap but can be slow

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, definitely not the worst!”
Reviews.Author: MsPotts
Reviews.Content: We made a last minute decision to stop in Las Vegas on our way back from California and called the day before arriving to book a room. They were excellent about the short notice. Upon arriving, we had no issues with checking in and were taken to our room almost immediately. The only issue we had was that we could not get adjoining rooms and therefore had to get two separate rooms to accomodate 2 adults and 4 kids. The rooms aren't large, and are very old looking. If you're looking for glitz and glamour, this is not it! The tv did not work (not a good thing with 4 kids) but when we called down they were quick to send maintenance up to remove the broken tv and replace it with a new one. We were told at that time that there were still rooms not renovated and these happened to be a couple of them. Fair enough considering such short notice that we didn't get the best rooms. All of the staff was super nice and quick to try to accomodate with any requests. The circus itself was okay for the kids and there were several games for kids similar to those you'd find at Chuck E. Cheese (pay to play - win tickets- cash tickets in for small prizes). The pool closed very early and we couldn't use it at all, which disappointed the kids. Not really walking distance to anything, especially with kids in tow. So we ended up driving the strip instead of walking it so that the kids could see all the lights and hotels and what not. Casino was okay.. i'm not much of a gambler so i can't comment too much on that. It's definitely nothing fancy though, so if you're expecting something like what you see on tv.. this is not the place for you! Overall, for the amount of time we were there, and for the fact that we had kids with us, this hotel is worth the price. If you don't have kids with you, i recommend booking at another hotel. Oh! and don't expect your kids too sleep much while here.. this really is the city that never sleeps and all of us seemed to really lose track of time while there!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for Kids”
Reviews.Author: Sanjay78
Reviews.Content: This a good hotel if you have kids as there is in house circus, food is cheap, room rates are very affordable, it is situated on the strip so quite convenient . It's a very large hotel I believe about 3000 rooms hence its just like an automated machine, no such thing as personal service as its always busy. They offer good meal deals for children

Reviews.Title: “family friendly”
Reviews.Author: jfp1711
Reviews.Content: Not too bad overall. This hotel casino is at the old end of the strip. In saying this we found that we saw more of the strip staying here, as once you are halfway down the strip you might as well keep going. The restaurants are quite good. This is a very family friendly hotel so you will have to get used to seeing family's everywhere. This is the second time that we have stayed here and it wont be the last. For the amount of time that you will actually spend in you hotel room, this location is excellent value for money. I had found that the staff were excellent and very helpful. The kids have alot of fun in the adventure-dome

Reviews.Title: “honest review”
Reviews.Author: mikriVictoria
Reviews.Content: I did not like Circus Circus at all! I will accept blame though as I always state that one should do their homework before booking a hotel. I had reservations about this hotel even before I booked and I should have gone with my gut and asked friends and family and I really should've heeded reviews of this hotel on trip advisor. I'll start with the lobby - yuck! So busy and old looking and yes I totally agree with everyone it stunk like smoke. We had to wait in a huge line up that took about 45 minutes to check in. The lady at reception was very friendly. Our room was not in the west tower, probably a mistake, it was in the skyline tower, we looked over the huge pink dome that I think housed the roller coaster, so not much of a view. The bed was comfortable, a little soft though but whatever. The room was really old and tired, it was clean though. While I understand that Circus Circus maybe caters to families I was shocked to hear children and I mean 'little children' running up and down the hallways till 5 a.m.!!!! What's up with that! I realize you're in Vegas but what in the world are little kids doing up all night! We don't gamble so I can't comment on that. We had dinner in the Garden cafe? I think that was the name. Long line up to eat but the food was pretty good. We tried to walk the strip- again our fault at not being more prepared - Circus Circus is north on the strip and you have to walk forever before you get into the midst of things. When we first arrived at Circus Circus it coloured my view of Vegas quite badly but after walking through some of the nicer hotels - i.e. Treasure Island, The Mirage etc. etc I think our one night visit would have more enjoyable if I had gone with my gut and spent a little more money on one of the nicer more centrally located hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Spend the money on a nicer hotel mid-strip.”
Reviews.Author: lisa_b26
Reviews.Content: Ok, I am not terribly picky about where I stay. My boyfriend and I tend to have a backpacker mentality when we're abroad. However, with Vegas, it is completely worthwhile to spend more on a centrally-located hotel. We got a room on the West Tower, which was a nice room. They upgraded us for free, which was lovely. The bed was super comfortable. The upsides stop there. It did take 45 minutes to check-in, which we expected based off other reviews. The biggest downsides were: 1. It felt like walking through Wal-Mart every time we had to walk through the casino. 2. It was too challenging to get to main attractions on the strip. We got a bus pass, which helped some, but you are dealing with trying to squeeze on or have busses pass you if they're too full. It would have been a much more enjoyable trip had we stayed in a central location and could easily access our room when we got wiped out. Not worth the deal we got.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: sunrai
Reviews.Content: Got to the Circus Circus and was knocked over by the smokey smell immediately. Had to wait at least an hour in the check in line and made the mistake of taking my son to the lobby toilet where there were people smoking in the toilet.... Disgusting! The room was very old with smoke burns in the curtains and the next morning there was no water to shower or brush our teeth. After calling reception they said they had an emergency and the water will be off until 3 in the afternoon. I had a do not disturb sign on the door so room service called and asked if I wanted the room servicing. After I said no an Asian guy knocked on the door very loudly and none stop and asked if I wanted the room servicing. I asked if he could read the do not disturb sign and he looked at me like I was out of space. I could go on and on about unclean sheets and more smoke everywhere but I'm sure you get the point. Nothing in the room... Not a biscuit or water or kettle or anything. If you are gonna make the effort to go to Vegas the most exuberant city in the USA, just pay a few more dollars and stay somewhere nice. I've stay at a number of hotels on the strip and thought this would be great for the kids. You won't regret spending a few dollars more for some great memories.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the Buck!”
Reviews.Author: don7seas
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a little dated and one pool was being repaired. Rooms in west tower were clean and non smoking. 7th floor had no view to speak of and the hotel offered to move me up, I was not there to view the strip anyway. Staff was nice and food was good. All and all if your looking upscale, you will be disapointed. If your there to gamble and have a good time you cant go wrong. West Tower sits over the main checkin and there is no smoke smell witch is nice. Check-in is a breeze if you call ahead for express check-in 1 to 2 hrs before arrival.

Reviews.Title: “worst ever”
Reviews.Author: Doggerm
Reviews.Content: Stay away from this place, spend a couple extra bucks and go somewhere else,,We booked and were supposed to get king rooms ,we ended up in one of the manor rooms,,,3rd floor, the hallways were hot and musty, they rooms were basically a bed and some furniture thrown together, chipped and broken,,mattress was old and lumpy. altough the front of the hotel was on "the Strip" the manors are almost a two block walk just to get to the strip, it is also on the very north end of the strip and is very inconvenient to go see the sights, There is no coffee pot , or anything for that matter in the room,,, when we checked in we practically begged to be moved, the receptionist just laughed, and told us they woudl notify us if any rooms came available,, never heard boo from anyone, The casino and lobby is dark and dingy and smell of cigarettes permeates everything, everywhere, I stay at alot of hotels and i didnt think that the worst place ive ever stayed would be in Las vegas.. please , reconsider. This was my second visit to Vegas, and i was looking forward to having a great time in a great city,,

Reviews.Title: “Good value but get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: hiccup166
Reviews.Content: at first we were given a room which already had people in it! the room was about a 10min journey to get to so we had to travel all the way back again and after 2 flights thats the last thing we wanted to do. we were then upgraded to a really nice, large, clean room. cant complain about the room at all. breakfast was good, staff were friendly. the hotel is a bit run down but it has everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “If your taking your kids to Vegas, just go over the hill to Disneyland!”
Reviews.Author: dancarter98
Reviews.Content: If your planning a trip to vegas to rest and have fun, don't stay at circus circus. If you are determined to take your kids to vegas, by all means stay at circus circus. I hadn't been for over twenty years. The whole town is different. Kids, and time share salespeople, were definately a huge bummer on our trip. The rooms were pretty shabby. No coffee pot, get up, stumble down to lobby, pay six fifty for two plain coffee's. It's like they are afraid they're gonna not get your last cent. When you come into from outside, your greeted by a warm person welcoming you to circus circus, offering you all kinds of free stuff. after wasting some of your time, you find they are just the slimiest of people trying sell you a time share. Sunshine was wonderful, cheap travel, accomodations sucked! I went there to promote, www.cumagainstore.com, and there were a lot of people to talk to, but lots of kids!

Reviews.Title: “For Price, very good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ooldaa
Reviews.Content: We stay in Hotel 2 nights and we payed 80 Dollars, it was great. Room was big, nice and clean, bathroom also. The Problem was just one hour waiting on check in and location on Las Vegas Blv. Its 1 mile (m more) far from major hotels (Belagio, Paris, ...)

Reviews.Title: “Good for the kids...”
Reviews.Author: rayandgabby
Reviews.Content: If your taking the kids along, id recomend the place just because its pretty much the only place really geared towards kids in vegas. Otherwise, id say look elsewhere because having a bunch of kids runninf around is probably not what you are looking for in a vegas trip. As far as the rooms, the tower rooms are not bad, but the bungalow type ones are actually pretty dirty..its on yhe far north strip and there is a decent amount of attraction in walking distance, but to me the center and the south strip is cooler overall. Anyways, I guess you get what you pay for, but personally if im on a budget, id prefer hooters. Different strokes for different folks though.

Reviews.Title: “pack extra clothes, in case they get thrown away”
Reviews.Author: joeyandsandi
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at night and check in went smooth, but when we got to our rooms (we had 2) they were dirty. I don't me just dirty I mean they had not been cleaned for the day, beds were not made towels on the floor....Called the front desk and the upgraded us to the other tower outside of the room being clean I could not tell a differance. The nexy day we had some smelly cloths and since the chepo hotel did not have a 50 cent laundry bag we used a trash bag. when we left we put the "DO NOT DISTURB" sign out so our dirty cloths would not be messed with.Well, I guess the maids can't read because they came in and cleaned our room and in the process through out the dirty cloths. So after a 3 week "investigation" we were told that they were not responsible. We also got the all day buffett, you are better off getting the Rio/Planet Hollywood 24 hour Buffett pass those were WAY better than circus circus. The best thing about the circus circus was the 1/2 price show tickets booth. Since we can find those at other places we will never stay or reccomend the circus circus

Reviews.Title: “This plase needs to be torn down!”
Reviews.Author: jumperusa
Reviews.Content: First of all when we checked in we were offfered only smoking room! As we specifically requested nonsmoking.( they policy: they guaranty rate but not a room type! So it means they don't care about your health)! Finally after arguing we were given room with a window to the other wall and pipes! Yes, our view was with little or no day light! Another thing TV did not work, they decided to replace it and worked on it till 1am!!! No coffee makers, no fridge, not enough power outlets( we hat just one outlet next to the TV! So, how I have to charge cell phone, video camera, plug in computer??? Anyway, if I knew it will be like this-newer stayed at this place!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad stay overall...”
Reviews.Author: SJB1280
Reviews.Content: As the rest of the reviews say, Circus Circus is dated, and a bit of a trek from the 'central' strip area, but at the end of the day the rooms are clean and spacious and the price is right. One thing I will mention is the check-in process. We queued up for 45 minutes (and this was on a Tuesday arvo). Once we got our room key, we found that the room was a smoking queen, when we specifically asked for non-smoking king. They were quick to react when we told them about the mix-up, but again we were given the exact same room on a different floor. This process went on for a total of three times before eventually getting the right room. So my advice would be - prepare for a long check-in process. Be sure to confirm with the check-in desk that the room you're getting is the room you wanted. And be prepared for a short trek to the central strip area.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: bridgelanc
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome! The staff werer pleasant, the restaurants were plentiful with great prices, our view was georgeous and we can't wait to return next year!

Reviews.Title: “Bargain - not the best in Vegas but still an amazing experience!”
Reviews.Author: emk2603
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Circus Circus in September 2010 and loved it. We stayed in one of the standard rooms, paid around £17.00 per night (for the both of us) and loved it. The rooms are large and comfortable, and we had a view of the whole Vegas Strip from our window. The beds are so comfortable (they feel like you're sleeping on a huge marshmallow!!) and we found the whole hotel to be very clean. The pool isn't huge but is fine and clean, and a complete sun-trap. The staff were very friendly and helpful. In the casino they offer lessons for people who haven't gambled before which we really enjoyed and found very useful. In the reception area there is a discounted ticket booth which we found very reasonably priced - we got last minute tickets for Penn and Teller for around $40 each and got our seats upgraded when we arrived at the show so ended up only 8 rows from the front. The only downside I would say we found is that the circus acts aren't out of this world - they very much seem to be aimed at children / familes. All in all we loved it, even though we didn't use all the hotel's facilities it was a great base for seeing the rest of Vegas. I'd recommend staying here - while hotels such as the Bellagio etc are gorgeous they are very expensive to stay in. We wandered in and out of all the hotels anyway to explore while we were there!

Reviews.Title: “This place is a crap hole!”
Reviews.Author: nwracer78
Reviews.Content: Blood stain on bed. Downgraded us to a smoking room that had dead and live cockroaches! I will never stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “After reading the reviews I expected the worse but actually had a fabulous time!!”
Reviews.Author: smartiepants617
Reviews.Content: I booked this vacation as part of a Southwest Vacation deal after reading some decent reviews on their site. I booked the vacation and flight at an excellent rate but was a little nervous after reading some of the reviews here. I expected the worse but was actually dazzled. First off let me say to never judge unless you actually experience it yourself. Check in was smooth sailing we barely waited 15 minutes. They do charge a resort fee which I already knew from reading some of the other reviews. Part of that entailed free Wi-Fi which could be testy at times was nice...some of the resorts charged an additonal fee for this service. I had read that the West tower had the best room and that part is accurate. Very comfortable king bed and decent showers. Our room had a flat screen tv and also had a hair dryer and iron and ironing board. Maid service came daily and always had our room cleaned before 3. It is a little down on the strip but not too much of a walk. We enjoyed the exercise. The casinos were a little dated but still nice too play. They have a really nice artist who does beautiful sketches. Rock and Ritas had excellent burgers and very decent prices. Overall I would love to stay here again. In my opinion if you are going in expecting the Bellagio......then stay at the Bellagio. Circus Circus is a class A resort casino all in its own!

Reviews.Title: “Really not that Bad!!!”
Reviews.Author: Alaskanwhites
Reviews.Content: My 12 year old daughter and I came to Vegas just for 2 days at the beginning of March. When we arrived there was a short line to check in. When it was our turn, the clerk was very nice and I requested a room on a high floor with 2 beds and he gave us the 27th floor facing to the South to view the strip. He was very nice and took care of us. Even though the only complaint my daughter had was the old TV, we enjoyed our two nights there. Valet parking is the way to go, since it is free everywhere, just give the valet person a dollar and you are all set. Check out was fast and the room was pretty clean. I will take my daughter there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and safe - good internet connection but a little dated.”
Reviews.Author: royinspain
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 week for the Con Expo - great room in the sky tower part - very clean and comfortable Casino was OK although some croupiers were a little unfriendly. good choice at breakfast but avoid the Mexican / Italian restaurant - unless you like vomit for dinner. Would go back as rates were good - a little far from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, fantastic view, weird odor.”
Reviews.Author: adnilnosnhoj
Reviews.Content: We booked our room at Circus Circus at the last moment and over all was very pleased we did so. I remember going there as a young child back in the early 70's so staying there over night was like living childhood dream. the room we had was a smoking room, on what I presume is a floor set aside for smokers but it wasn't the smell of lingering smoke that I noticed. I really can't put my finger on what that very peculiar odor was and my husband suggests that it may just be from the age of the building itself. It's not a horrible smell, but its far from pleasant. Anyway, perhaps had we been there more than one night we could have gotten used to the odor and would have stopped noticing it every time we stepped out into the hallway. Other than that, and the very snide, rude and down right catty female peddlers standing across from the Adventure Dome, this place is just right for a family visiting Las Vegas. I would like to mention how much fun the midway was for my young boys and myself. As I mentioned, I came here as a child myself and spent many hours in the midway above the casino. They have made it even more fun from what I remember with much more for children to do with or without their parents tagging along. This reason alone is enough for me to want to come back to Circus Circus at least one more time with my kids and then perhaps someday with my grandkids.

Reviews.Title: “decent stay”
Reviews.Author: Daisygirl00
Reviews.Content: this is the first time I have stayed at Circus Circus and was really worried about the reviews. we stayed in the Skyrise tower. the room was a bit dated but clean and had a great view. it was very quiet in the room even through the hotel was really booked up. great for kids. I have always stayed mid strip so this was really quite far up the strip for me. for the value it was definitely worth it. would have been more fun if there were other hotels in the area other than Sahara and Riviera. stay away from Rock and Rita's though, had a really bad meal. other than that we were happy with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “love the circus”
Reviews.Author: girlinvegas
Reviews.Content: we have been staying at the Circus every time we are in Vegas. since 2001 we go twice a year, the staff are the best, rooms comfortable and "CLEAN"!!! never miss dinner at the Steak House. easy to get around. would not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus...well the room was nice”
Reviews.Author: kickstartmyheart7
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3/15-3/19 in the west tower. The room was clean and very large. Things were updated, new tv, clean sheets, towels and so on. There were minor things like a cabinet door missing off the dresser which took me a few hours to notice. The room smelled clean, the mattress was new and comfortable and the bathroom was well kept. All in all...it's a great deal for the price. As for the rest of the hotel... Well, the casino does have loose slots so that's cool. The whole place needs an update. The food was OK. Thank God there is a Subway at slots of fun! If you are looking for decent coffee, the best you will find is in the buffet and that is iffy at best. Otherwise you have to trek down the strip to find a starbucks or someplace that will sell coffee that doesn't taste like water. The first day we walked down to the middle of the strip which wore our feet out. Taking the bus is a good deal $7 for a 24hr pass. It takes you all the way to the other side of the strip and even to fremont street. Back to circus circus... The pool was like a pool you see at a KOA RV park. Small...and a bit ghetto. The second pool was closed, and appeared to be under construction. It is by far the smokiest casino on the strip. The salon is a joke..I walked by and it was an old hotel room converted into a dank little salon that appeared to be as old as the hotel. The gym is two old connecting hotel rooms with work out equipment like you would see at a janky apartment complex although it was CLEAN! The midway games were fun as was the adventure dome. If you are looking for a relaxing trip, stay someplace a little more expensive. You'll be closer to good food, better prices for the food and your room will likely have a coffee maker :)

Reviews.Title: “could of been better.”
Reviews.Author: ludyjavi
Reviews.Content: just got back from this hotel and i was not very happy upon arrival.i paid 90 dollars for a room that was like a block away from the main tower or casino tower the rooms were disgusting the wallpaper was coming off and the ceiling had water marks all over and there were dirty towel in the room.this was on the manor buildings i would not recommend this rooms to my worse enemy,STAY AWAY from this buildings.after three hours of talking to hotel supervisors and hotels.com reps.we finally got a room at the casino tower after been told that there were no rooms available at this building.

Reviews.Title: “We were worried... but NOT a problem! :)”
Reviews.Author: TeamCooper8
Reviews.Content: We have been told countless times not to stay at Circus, Circus, so we were worried, but to be honest it was in our budget to stay there, so we thought well hopefully it won't be to bad. We had not one problem! great staff, great room, but we also have teenagers as well as a younger set of triplets. So for us, family wise, it was a terrfic place to stay! My kids loved the adventure dome, and my husband and i loved the casnios! we were there 2 nights, and wanted to go back, but were unable to buget it at the end of the trip, we will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Butlins in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: saltysnowbird
Reviews.Content: Good value, but you get what you pay for in life. This hotel is way past it's best. Spend a little extra elsewhere and you will save in taxi fares alone to cover the cost of getting back and forth to the Strip. If you have a rental Car and intend to spend most of your time sightseeing outside Vegas, it should make a cheap base. Otherwise steer clear, it certainly didn't meet our moderate expectations

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: padsmom1220
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Circus Circus for 8 nights while in Las Vegas. This was our first trip to Vegas and was very impressed. If you are looking for affordable rates...... this is the place to stay. Everyone was very friendly and willing to help. The food at the Buffet, Garden Grill and Rockin Ritas was fabulous. We will defintely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: MyselfYourself
Reviews.Content: Thumbs up to Circus Circus. Great value stay in a comfortable hotel environment. Recommend for the budget conscious traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Low price, don't expect 5 star.”
Reviews.Author: Ders73
Reviews.Content: After reading so many reivews of Circus CIrcus on here, I was worried about how our time there was going to be. I was pleasently surprised. We had a great deal (less than $25 a night) and weren't planning on spending all our time there. If your expecting top end service and amenities, then you will be disappointed. This is an older property and therefore not as amazing as the newer ones down strip. I assume there must be updated parts of the hotel and non-updated parts. Our rooms were in the Skyrise Tower and were newly remodeled. New showers, toilets, furniture...the room was clean and when we left a note (and a tip) that the shower drained slow, it was fixed the next day. We used our coupons for free drinks, and ate one meal at the Garden Grill and were happy with it. We gambled, and enjoyed the lower table limits. The circus acts were enjoyable (and free). There are a lot of kids there, so it that bothers you, you won't enjoy this property. I don't understand the hatred of Circus Circus. I guess some people have had poor rooms and others have had to high of expectations for a low price property. We were able to spend 4 nights on the cheap which allowed us more $$$ for shows and gambling at other properties. I guess I also went in with such low expectations that I was pleasantly surprised. Maybe there are other properties that are just as cheap and are newer, if that is the case, people may like them better. (I kept trying to find the "terrible odors and smells" that people on here were talking about, I never found them)

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: jimmyjames1238
Reviews.Content: Went with the wife and 15 year old daughter with the intention of letting my daughter have one last childhood fling with all the plentiful and free kid stuff. A great experience at a discount price. The adventuredome was great for the kid, as was the constant free circus acts as well the discounted amenities through the check in discount booklet. Parking easy and plentiful, rooms okay, food okay, tourist shops plentiful, pool and hot tub basic but fine for March weather ( daughter was approached a number of times at the pool as she is 5,9 and looks older). Walked across the street to the Rivera five times a day for dollar mixed drinks and poached their tennis courts. Also security never questioned daughter at the slots at Circus Circus. Rather than pay inflated rental price at strip location walked 5 minutes to Sarah Blvd. took a 5 minute bus ride to Enterprise and rented a car for weekentd for $30.00 and drove to hoover dam and around strip saving hundreds. Do not go if you hate kids. Craig Dobson Ottawa

Reviews.Title: “Tatty - old - shabby smelly - awful!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: stefi2
Reviews.Content: If you have found your way to this review then take my advice and choose another hotel!!! It will be worth paying the extra money. This hotel is shabby it smells awful, our sheets had holes in them, toilet was cracked, carpets and corridors were shabby, it's dark dingy and full of smoke. Location is at the end of the strip surrounded by an abandoned building site and waste ground and that was the 'lovely view' we were greeted with. Disappointment doesn't come near to how we felt and if we would have moved out if we had been able to. Never ever again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “horrible”
Reviews.Author: Aroundtheglobe18
Reviews.Content: maybe a nice place for familys but not for me. The rooms are not what I would call nice. The hole place is noisy and completely overcrowded. Definetely a waste of holiday. I cannot recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for....”
Reviews.Author: rmcdonald41
Reviews.Content: Pros: Cheap Located near the Las Vegas Strip Cons: Needs some serious renovations Filthy rooms (Stained sheets, Dusty, Stained shower/tub) Paid for a Non-Smoking Room but was definitely a smoking room Bad service (Front desk rarely answers the phone, Guest services lacked organization in finding the appropriate room I requested. I was promised a room which included a whirl pool, told to return to the hotel at 2pm (check in time), once I arrived at the front desk inquiring about the upgrade, no request was in the system. That was the last straw so my girlfriend and I left immediately and headed to Treasure Island....

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel In the World”
Reviews.Author: Ztriptaker
Reviews.Content: Where do you start? Parking a nightmare, Construction, Rude at Check-In, Elevators broken, Smoke Infested Rooms and Casino and wall to wall children. Honestly, just save yourself the frustration and STAY AWAY!!!!!!! There are tons of other places for the same price on and off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “you'll get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Middlemoosh
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 5 day trip for my boyfriends birthday and stayed at the Circus Circus. When we arrived there was a small queue for check in, but plenty of staff so we didn't have to wait too long. Asked for a non-smoking room, which when we entered the room had clearly had heavy smokers in - really yellow walls/ceiling, paper peeling off and smelt really bad. This was in the Skyrise Tower and the room (and corridors) were in dire need of redecoration, really outdated and dirty. I called the reception to complain and ask to change rooms and spoke to an extremely rude member of staff who told me there's nothing wrong with the room! We ended up having to pay an extra $10 a night to upgrade - which isn't much, and the new room (In the West Tower) was so much better! Much more modern, clean, smelt better and had a better view of the strip as well. The hotel itself (The promenade, shops, casino and reception areas) all seemed quite shabby and dark and did have a bit of a smell about it. However, we figured we wouldn't be spending much time there other than to sleep so it wasn't a problem. The hotel is situated quite a long way from the new, more modern end of the strip, but that could be seen as an advantage as its quite quiet at night time. We got a 3 day bus pass for $20 - which is unlimited travel on the Deuce for those days - this meant we could get to either end of the strip really easily from the Hotel and there's bus stops either side of the street right outside - better than paying for expensive taxis, which we found tried to rip us off by going down the freeway instead of the Strip to and from the airport! Overall, if we visited again, we would stay somewhere else, but only because there's not much around the hotel restaurant wise - other than McDonalds, Dennys and the Peppermill and would have preferred a bit more choice - which there's an abundance of down the the other end near the Miracle Mile mall etc.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: scomal
Reviews.Content: we found our stay here overall a bit disappointing. the rooms were nice and clean and big enough. The hotel itself is very outdated so you get what you pay for. the food in the buffet was a big disappointment. and being at the end of the strip its either start walking or hang around for the bus. Thats why i say you do get what you pay for. If you've got a family on a budget then this is for you, if you want to be more central to the strip then this is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL I HAVE EVER STAYED AT”
Reviews.Author: gbrinlee
Reviews.Content: when we arrrived at the hotel and walked in the door we were met with a nasty smell that smelled like old nasty gym shoes.as we walked to the check in station i notcied that the bell staff was standing there watching people carry there luggage and us included.we checked and the bell staff once again was watching people carry there luggage to there rooms.whe we got to our room my wife notcied that the bathrrom floor was dirty.we went ahead and left the room to enjoy our stay in vegas.we we returned to the room later that night my wife cleaned the bathroom floor in order for us to take a shower.after our shower when we trying to sleep the walls are so thin that you could here the guests in the next room using the restroom.also to have so many kids activitys right next to the casion part whewre the lids have to walk through the casion to get to there place to play is not riight to have from newborns to 16 yr old kids being in the casino with all the smoke and drinking and all the drinks that were left by people that did not finish them these drinks were left in easwy acess to underage children

Reviews.Title: “OK for something cheap and with children?”
Reviews.Author: ckellyuk
Reviews.Content: The reception staff were very friendly when we arrived. The hotel was booked as part of a package to New York. Would have booked something more central to Vegas as it rained! and cost us $10/$15 dollers each time we wanted to go to the central strip by taxi. If it was summer prob not a problem as we could have walked. The hotel smells a little sweaty, but you soon adapt to it. Is a little smokey too, but I think that's due everywhere in england not being smoky anymore. Great massage place to get your feet worked on great value for money and opposite was a bar in happy hour with cocktails. The theme park looked like it would be great for the kids, but didn't really interest us. Would I go back prob not, but more to do with the location and I would rather stay somewhere that is more modern and up to date.

Reviews.Title: “We were robbed.”
Reviews.Author: Laptopless
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Circus Circus because we were looking for a cheap place to stay while in Vegas and it offered a great deal. On our second night there, we came back after a night of gambling to find our room had been broken into and both our laptops were taken along with my friends backpack, ipod and some other small items. We had tried to put our laptops in the safe, but they didn't fit. Apparently our door didn't lock properly. We called the police and risk management and both seemed to have been dancing around the issue and nothing ever got resolved. They really didn't make any effort to help us. Overall, it would have been cheaper for us to stay in the more expensive hotels because now we need to replace our laptops .Make sure you check your door, even if it sounds like it is locked. Aside from our laptops being stolen, if I was to go again, I would stay at a hotel closer to the middle of the strip because getting down to all the other hotels and back took up a lot of time.

Reviews.Title: “smokey”
Reviews.Author: Englandtravelgal
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located near the end of the strip. The lobby smelt alot like a bathroom and cigarettes,nice,Checking in was a breeze and we were taken to our room in the west tower. The corridors also smelt like cigarettes and so did the room (and we got a non smoking room!) The room was big, the view was ok, the TV was big, and there was alot of space. The bathroom was ok, there was quite alot of dust in the vents and the lighting was ok. most of the hotel stank of bathrooms and cigarettes, the casino was huge and the adventurdome was good, we found that it was cheaper to buy the all day pass.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Dawson107516
Reviews.Content: This hotel was terrible! The hotel was dirty and unkept. The lobby/casinos/stores in circus circus stunk like BO and smoke. We had to pay more money to upgrade our room which was terrible anyway. Very dirty. Holes in the sheets. Stains on the curtains and carpets. No coffee maker or fridge. On the door, it has two different stickers reminding you to lock your doors at night. One local told us that that is where the meth heads and heroin addicts hang out. People staying there were pretty scary looking and trashy too. It was too far away from the strip. Nothing about this hotel was good. You can find a hotel that is closer to the strip for a similar price. I'd pay more for something clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for low budget!”
Reviews.Author: shane89uk
Reviews.Content: Me and some friends stopped here at Circus Circus and found the hotel brilliant, we didnt expect much for the price we'd paid. The rooms were clean, and the food was nice especially the steak house they have. Only downside is the hotels location, its a small walk to the center of the strip but that was no drama. I would recommend this hotel to anyone whos main concern lies in the nightlife and atmosphere of Las Vegas and not the niceties of a hotel. If your after a luxury hotel id suggest Encore or the Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Head West”
Reviews.Author: papilover84
Reviews.Content: We Stayed in the West Tower on the 35th Floor Overlooking The Strip. Room was very large and well stocked we had plenty of towels/soap. The beds were very comfortable. Room was serviced each day, The Housekeepers move quickly and got everything cleaned. Valet Parking was easy, this is a complimentary service so remember to keep a few singles in your pocket and out of the slots for the valets. Beware of ATM Fees, If you are driving there is a Wells, B of A, & Chase if you make a left onto Sahara, saves you 6 bucks (2 hands of blackjack) Buffet was the worst in Vegas Pizza Place tasted great but I woke up with Cramps 2 Hours Later (management refunded thank you) Rock and Ritas Was The best place to Drink on the Strip Buy 1 Get 1 (ask for a Red Devil) We will definitely return to Circus Circus ( Free slot play for returning guests would be great)

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: NewburyParkRonquillo
Reviews.Content: no coffee pot in room, cockroaches in bathroom.I had to move to another room the second night after I was told on the phone I could stay in the same room I just had to pay for it before 11:00 am. I went down immedietly.Iwas told it was going to be an easy move from the 29th floor to the 17th floor in the skyline tower because I had to move my elderly parents belongings by myself. It was horrible move.I had to switch elevators to get to the 17th floor.I made 6 trips. I forgot my Dads cane in the first room which was never found.

Reviews.Title: “Do not say here if you do not have children!”
Reviews.Author: Craftymunchies
Reviews.Content: The bed was like sleeping on a cloud, but the rest of the room outdated. To far down the strip for a young couple traveling without children. Stayed at CP one night this trip and will make that choice or another in the future. If you have kids and want to go to the strip then this hotel may be for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, but a bit farther from the center strip than I expected.”
Reviews.Author: suprlonghorn
Reviews.Content: I went on this trip with friends that wanted the most inexpensive rooms, so in that aspect, Circus Circus was a winner. The location was a bit further from the center strip (Paris, Caesar's, Bellagio) than I expected. The check-in process took a while due to the lines, but they opened up more stations. Overall, the rooms were pretty modern and clean...we got what we paid for..in a good way!

Reviews.Title: “Did Not Dissapoint.”
Reviews.Author: strawberryshtc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Circus Circus from the 12th to the 16th. I found the hotel room to be in great condition. I book my trip using travelocity and was able to upgrade to a deluxe king in the west tower I think, whatever the tower is with the newer rooms. The upgrade only cost like 20 bucks extra. I recommend it! I stayed on the 33rd floor, it was quite and clean. I thought the casino was nice. It was clean, lots cocktail girls. I didnt eat at any of the restaurants but I did get coffee and doughnuts from the Krispy Kreme. That was cool. There were LOTS of food and drink specials. Loved the slots-o-fun. All employees were helpful. The only negatives were my room did not have a remote to the t.v, check in took a while even thought it was around 1am, didnt win anything at the Circus Circus slots, the casino was a bit smoky. I did walk from circus circus to the more busier parts of the strip that can take a few minutes and its tiring but great exercise. However there are bus stops right outside that will take you to freemont street ;) and back towards the strip, Heres some tips, When taking the bus from freemont street be sure to get on the duece and not the express, the express does not stop at circus circus. Be sure to purchase your bus tickets at the stand at the bus stop because the drivers prefer you to do it that way,it makes boarding quicker.If you are a drinker pay attention to the drink specials the resorts and casinos offer. There were also 2 for 1 specials for food and drinks all over the place. Oh and the time share people are everywhere so watch out! I would go back I thought it was a great value for the cash I spent.

Reviews.Title: “As they say, you get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: andysgrl
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to Vegas on a Saturday night since we had that whole week ahead off. By Sunday morning we were driving and on our way (I will never drive to Vegas again BTW, it's not that much cheaper than flying and I'm still tired from that trip 2 years later). We settled for Circus Circus because it was cheap (like $40/night) of course those cheap rooms are in the old tower not the new and remodeled area. The room was old, it smelled, the blow dryer was broken (but someone fixed it right away) the carpet stained. But like I told my husband, we only used the room to sleep in after being out and about in Vegas. We didn't go to the Circus Circus pool or restaurants, we went into the Fun Land or whatever it's called twice and that was fun actually. The casino in this place is a joke, the wait staff was pretty much non-existant. So, would we stay there again? Probably but most likely we will pay a little extra to stay at a nicer place closer to the action.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service”
Reviews.Author: Pookie007
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Circus Circus for a 4 night get away. We were looking to get away for cheap and this hotel sure is cheap. I do understand you get what you pay for, but if that's the case we over paid. When we pulled up for valet it took 30 minutes to be helped with our bags. It was a Sunday afternoon so I expected it to take a bit long but not that long. We eventually arrived at the front desk and we were greeted by a stand offish women who didn't say much and just tossed our keys on the counter.The room was nice we booked an upgrade and that seemed to be perfect except for the shower head which had hard water deposits on it and it kind of just trickled out water. The 2nd day of our trip we decided to visit Rockin Rita's which was a mistake. I ordered the chili dog and my boyfriend ordered the burger. He loved his burger but when I got my meal it was cold as if it were sitting there waiting for his burger to be done. The waitress was rude and didn't seem to care. We only got a refill once and to even get that we had to ask. Later on in the night the fire alarm went off at 2:30 am and we called down to the front desk but couldn't get an answer. So we packed our things and began to head down the hall to the stairs eventually the announced that it was ok and we could return to our rooms so my boyfriend and I headed back and called down to the front desk just to make sure. We didn't get any comps or discounts or even an apology when we complained about the situation. All in all it was a crappy trip. I have never had a problem with MGM hotels but I may reconsider that after this fiasco.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Gingerjean85
Reviews.Content: Have just come bk from a 5 night stay in circus circus with my mum and we were both very happy with the hotel. We knew it wouldn't be 5 star luxury as you get for what you pay for. The room was comfy and spacious. We didn't find it too overcrowded with families until Friday and Saturday when they have there big turnover days. The only restaurant we used was the garden grill and we had no complaints. We seemed to like the location as it was away from the hustle and crowds at the south end of the strip. Hey this is Vegas, you don't go to spend all your time in your hotel room! The adventure dome and midway arcade was great fun as well as the slot machines! The only flaw was that we got lost trying to find our hotel room and a couple of the staff pointed us in the wrong direction until a nice security guard personally took us to our room. All in all we had a great time in Vegas, a great stay in circus circus and would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “good for the price”
Reviews.Author: linzii2
Reviews.Content: cannot complain for the price we paid, free wifi and room was spacious and clean. stay in west wing of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NOT GREAT”
Reviews.Author: kitchenercouple
Reviews.Content: Stayed at This hotel the first of Feb. Wow does this place need work. My room had the door split at lock on bathroom. Carpets old and they stink. The staff were not great and good luck trying to get a drink while sitting at the slots. I would tip whenever anyone gave me service but still terrible service. Machines were tight and never seen anyone win more than 100 dollars after playing for 3 days straight. The comps sucked. Would never

Reviews.Title: “For $25/night not too bad.”
Reviews.Author: Jasmineo84
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night as we were on a road trip and got into Las Vegas a day early. I would normally never look at this hotel however it was $25 for a night. The rooms were clean, had wifi & free parking. The draw-backs were that we were in the sky tower which is quite a hike to the strip and the casino is fairly ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Great fun”
Reviews.Author: Luland
Reviews.Content: I am 65 and stayed in Circus Circus for a week during a second visit to Vegas with my daughter. The room was big and had spotless bed linen and lots of fluffy white towels which were changed daily. Lots of shampoos and soaps were replenished daily. We had a great view of the strip from our window. The location is perfect with a bus stop just outside to go down the Strip or down town. But the best part were the bar staff in Rock and Rita's. We had great fun with friendly and amazing flair barmen and lots of cowboys in the bar (we were there for the Rodeo finals). To sum up: the price is right, the rooms are great and the place is fun. I will definitely stay there again and would pick the same week again.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality for the cheap price.”
Reviews.Author: ilovebeachesandsun85
Reviews.Content: Pros - good location on the strip, we could easily walk to all the hot spots on the strip. Our room was renovated and comfortable. It has a kitschy kind of charm to it. The indoor amusement park was fun. The pool was clean and refreshing - not luxurious or beautiful by any means. Cons - service was terrible. When we checked into our room at 7pm the room was still DIRTY from the people who checked out before us. We phoned the front desk and they apologized and said they would send somebody to clean it right away. We went out for supper and fun and returned at 2am to find out room still was not cleaned. We phoned the front desk again and they sent somebody up...30 minutes later. The next day our room wasn't cleaned - but we didn't complain because at least it was our own mess, not somebody elses. Conclusion - I would stay there again because it is cheap and is in a good location. I prefer something a bit more classy...but when in Vegas we rarely stay in the room anyway...just use it as a place to catch a few Z's and shower. We talked to other people in our group and nobody else had a dirty room situation - I think it was just our luck lol.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location on a budget !”
Reviews.Author: KeithLucy
Reviews.Content: Clean Comfortable and friendly staff. On the strip and excellent value although slightly out of the main action. More of a family hotel with a lot of younger kids but not overly noisey and the casino was great fun till the early hours ! Excellent Dry Cleaning service if you're on the move. We were given vouchers offering discounts on some of the facilities and restrauants in the complex but be careful of hidden costs on arrival if you book through promotional websites. Would definitely stay there again and keep our money for the gambling and shows!

Reviews.Title: “Worked as the rooms were large, but bad otherwise”
Reviews.Author: ReshmaBudhia
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for the CES show. Wasn't all that bad but there's really nothing in the hotel besides huge rooms. Location was very inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel, but too far down on strip”
Reviews.Author: littletiger_11
Reviews.Content: No problems with hotel, clean, good service from the staff and the Rocks n Ritas had good breakfast. Good value, but overall would not stay again because it is way too far down on the strip and the buses do not come by as quickly as anticipated!

Reviews.Title: “Resort Fee, what resort did we pay for”
Reviews.Author: wolfcall2
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas for the day but got tired from all the walking, still had a 2 hour trip back to RV Park so decided to stay overnight. The quoted me a $39 dollar a night price which was quite good, but after they included the "Resort Fee" and tax it totaled $51. OK I thought I can live with this but why would they charge a resort fee when the pool was closed and adventure dome closed 45 after check-in at 6:30pm. Just what were we paying the resort fee for. The Pizza Parlor charged a service fee for take out. My thoughts were this $39 room was going to cost us nothing but money. But it gets worse, after returning to our room about 7pm we found a note saying that the water would be turned off for maintenance work at 1:00 am and would be back on at 5 am. Lovely, but would live with it. Unfortunately at 7:30 am we still had no hot water, so were unable to even shower. Just packed up and left. We have stayed previously at this hotel but will probably pass another opportunity to pay for nothing but a hard bed. Most hotels we have stayed in have extra pillows in the closed, this one didn't. I requested a couple of pillows from room service which they did supply but in the middle of the night so woke us up when delivering them.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews of this place is wrong”
Reviews.Author: Lovelyme34
Reviews.Content: For some reason or another the reviews are wrong I been to circus circus many many times and never had a complaint if you stay in west tower the rooms are nice now the manor room is outdated now the adventure dome and midway are good for kids and kids at heart I never encounter none of the issues that other people wrote and I go there at least once every 3 months

Reviews.Title: “Got what I expected out of the hotel, but was quoted wrong price.”
Reviews.Author: soDisappointed75
Reviews.Content: I knew that the hotel was not going to be the nicest and that it was at the end of the strip so a little isolated from the rest. I stayed for a seminar, told them I was only staying Friday night. Whoever booked the reservation gave me the Thursday night rate, so it was a surprise when I was charged $95 instead of the $50 I was quoted. Come to find out the rate was supposed to be $75. There were tiles missing from the bathroom, the towel rack was on the floor, and the wallpaper was peeling off of my "newly renovated room." I could have booked online for $25, but thought for another $25 I would get a brand new room. So, I paid $75 for a $25 room, person at checkout and the customer service reps could have cared less, they sent me an apology letter.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: Twosome_11
Reviews.Content: After booking our trip, I then read the hotel reviews, and none were very good. However, check-in was effortless, the room was in the Skyrise Tower, and very nice. No coffee maker was my only complaint. Staff everywhere very friendly. Lots of walking to get around the hotel, but that is true in any of them, they are all so big. Enjoyed the 20 minute or so walk down to the middle of the strip...it was welcome exercise and a chance to see all the hotels from the outside. Restaurants served enormous helpings at every meal, so we left a lot of food untouched. Lots of kids in this hotel because of the attractions, but didn't bother me too much

Reviews.Title: “staff not so great and helpful. I won't go back”
Reviews.Author: Arcoiris12
Reviews.Content: I went there because I've read the reviews and it was Ok, I spent 2 night there and it was enough. I could hear everything the people next to my room were talking so imagine that! in Vegas that could mean that they were awake ´til late during night time, to fall sleep it took me awhile. The staff was kind of rude, not helpful at all!!! The room was ok nothing wow but that's what you get for a resanoble price. The Deuce (bus to take to everywhere that cost 7USD for 24 hrs. ride) doesn´t really have a good schedule, everytime I ride it I had to wait at least for 30 minutes to catch it and there were people waiting for longer, so if you cannot walk to get where everything really is on the strip then it is not a very convinient hotel...for those that likes or can walk, it is at least 15 minutes walk to get for example to the tresure island hotel. Internet works ok, not really fast but it was free so no much to complain about it. In my opinion it is an OK hotel but I don´t like rude people and noisy rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Unless you're desperate to go to Las Vegas we wouldn't go near the place.”
Reviews.Author: blueridgelover517
Reviews.Content: Circus Circus was included in a package holiday but after spending just one night we left and checked into the MGM. The hotel was dark and dank and the thing that stuck out in our minds was the terrible smell everywhere. So much so that I would have never eaten anything in this hotel. We read bad reviews before we went but decided to form our own opinions. Circus Circus hotel and casino should be pulled down.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value - surpassed expectations!”
Reviews.Author: mchic2008
Reviews.Content: This hotel really did surpass all of my expectations. I wasn't expecting much especially due to the low price of the room. We booked a room in the skyline tower (the cheapest) and we couldn't believe the value for money. The room was very spacious with a good view of the Las Vegas strip. The bed was very comfortable, the room was clean, and the bathroom was also large. The staff were all very friendly (although I did get sick of being hassled to enter into timeshare presentations) and both the hotel and casino areas were clean and well maintained. The only negative aspect is the distance of the hotel location to the main part of the Las Vegas strip but if you don't mind walking this is not a problem. We were so impressed with the hotel we stayed on another few nights it really is great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A DUMP”
Reviews.Author: jibjabber
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel, with a reservation for Circus Circus. We were given a room at their DUMP dormatory behind the hotel. There were at least 50 people trying to check in, with only 2 (TWO) people working the front desk. We had to cross a street to get to our cell. The room stank, there was no remote control, the furniture was worse that you could imagine, a jail cell would have been as comperable. The front desk supervisor was a complete jerk, and the whole experience was disgusting. For $40 more, we could have stayed at Luxor. What was I thinking?!? Stay far away from this delapodated dump.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you have kids but rough around the edges”
Reviews.Author: OwahooEd
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night during the holiday weekend for about $50. Didn’t have any problems checking in but they do have an 800 number for express check-in if you prepay your stay. I really want to give this place 3.5 stars because of nostalgia. It is not as bad as some of the reviews on here say. Yes, it’s an older building and they could do more to maintain some of the exterior (e.g. graffiti in the parking lots and dirty windows). But if you have kids and/or on a budget, you can’t really go wrong with Circus Circus. Come in with the right mind set and don’t expect Bellagio opulence. You’ll have more fun if you do. Other things to keep in mind: -Most Vegas hotels now charge a resort fee in addition to your nightly rate. Circus Circus at least has one of the cheaper ones at about $8 per night which includes two free Adventuredome rides, two free drinks, and free wireless internet. -Stay in the West Tower rooms. I have not seen the other rooms but these rooms are considered an upgrade. I was satisfied with the contemporary feel of the room – granite countertops on everything, modern décor, and still relatively plush carpet. Plus the elevators to the West Tower were near the check-in lobby and valet. Short walks to most of the eateries. -There are families and kids of all ages throughout. This could be a positive or negative depending on what you want from your Vegas vacation. So expect some noise, strollers, and kids running around the common areas. -Midway and Adventuredome have some good diversions for kids & kids at heart – free circus acts; midway games (most are only $1); thrill rides; and 3-D movies. You can leave your older kids here while you hit the casino. Most of my first memories of Las Vegas involved Circus Circus. It still provides a fun place to take your kids while in town and value for your dollar. Still, a nice remodel would do it some good.

Reviews.Title: “Great VIP host- terrible bed”
Reviews.Author: Zenamacn12
Reviews.Content: Stayed there Jan 14-16. Excellent hotel. great staff especially the vip host. Can't remember her name but was very helpful. Got a complimentary upgrade to a suite. Was beautiful except for the bed! There was a king size poster bed with a queen size mattress. Kept banging the side of the frame getting in and out of the bed. You practically fell out of the bed if you got to close to the side. Have stayed there many times so this was the first issue I had with their beds. They have the best steak house out there.

Reviews.Title: “SCABIES”
Reviews.Author: Felix153
Reviews.Content: My family (husband, wife, three kids) stayed here 21 Dec - 30 Dec. The big news is that I caught scabies from this place! I noticed three little bubble/pimple looking bumps/bites on my arm the morning after our first night in the room. I didn't think too much about it though. Then the next morning I noticed more bumps/bites and then everyday afterwards. I suspected bedbugs and did some research on line and used that information to search the beds. I didn't find anything and thought well maybe it is a spider or mosquito in the room. One week after our trip I began to itch like I have never itched in my life. I saw a doctor and was diagnosed with scabies. These little suckers live under the top layer of your skin and it takes 2 to 6 weeks before a person notices the severe burning and itching caused from their burrowing into your skin and laying of eggs. As soon as I knew that I had scabies I retraced my whereabouts by two weeks and I was at Circus Circus with these weird bumps popping up on my arms and hands every morning. I immediately called the hotel and asked to speak to a manager. The first manager that I spoke with was in charge of booking rooms. I explained what had happened and was told that I would need to talk to Risk Management but that no one was there so I would need to call back the next day. This surprised me since that meant whoever was staying in those three rooms that me and my family occupied stood a chance of picking up scabies that night. So anyway, I called Risk Management the next day, informed them of my situation and they told me that I would need to contact security to fill out a security incident form. I told the lady that I wasn't after a free room or any payback for my horrible experience and was simply calling so that something could be done to eliminate the problem to happen to someone else. Once she realized that I didn't want anything in return she said "Thanks, we will look into it". If I had to guess about it, the issue never made it past her hanging up the phone. Looking around the hotel it is pretty evident that it is pretty old and dirty. The place smells like an ashtray. It was my mistake for even staying there but I was attracted to the fun things that they have for kids and the cheaper price. For what you will have to spend on topical creams, lotions, sprays, and the terror that scabies bring from here on out I will be paying extra to stay someplace that does a better job at cleaning their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Worse than a vomit soaked fraternity house!”
Reviews.Author: BizTraveler011
Reviews.Content: This is by far the worst hotel I have every stayed in. I was amazed at the level of noise, fighting in adjacent rooms, and overall pathetic condition of the entire property - particularly the rooms. I was in Las Vegas for CES, and unfortunately, unable to find another accommodation due to overbooking at most of the hotels in the city. If I would have know how bad this property was, I would have stayed somewhere well outside the city limits and drove to the conference every day. if you are a business traveler, sleep in your rental car before staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - just make sure you stay in a tower room!”
Reviews.Author: Copey302
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value for money. We loved it here, however i can understand some of the bad reviews because if you stay in one of the older Manor rooms they are a little dated... We stayed in one of these and although it was clean and did the job (plus nice view of the stratosphere from the window!) it was a little dated. We would definately go back but we would stay in one of the newer Tower rooms. The pool area was fine - not huge but we liked it. Location isnt perfect because you are down one end of the strip but on the plus side the shuttle bus that goes up and down the strip is always empty when it gets to you! Location didnt spoil it for us because you just do a little more walking, however being in the centre would have been an advantage. Dont be too put off by the bad reviews - if you are on a budget this hotel is fine. Loads of restaurants inside and lots of free enternainment. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bring earplugs and a lot of patience”
Reviews.Author: calvin43
Reviews.Content: After a very long day (Southwest lost our luggage and our flight was delayed), we arrived at CC at about midnight. It took 30 minutes to get through the line. I complained about that to the staff member checking us in. She said, "That's not bad, it's usually 45 minutes." To check in to a hotel at midnight?!? They should have had more staff to handle this. Our room was in a separate building that I think was built out of papier-mâché. There was constant noise from the room above (I think they were playing soccer), the rooms next to ours and from the hallway. The heater was very loud and cycled on and off, making sleeping very difficult. I tried to catch up that day, but the maids were carrying on right outside my door and talking very loudly. I slept a grand total of 4 hours in the first 24 hours of my trip. A trip to Walgreens got me some Sominex and, more importantly, earplugs. Slept very well that night and actually checked out the rest of the place the next day. The Circus was even cheesier than I expected and a lot of it was just generic Vegas. Maybe I was just cranky. Checkout was better than check in, but it was still a bit annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Could Not Have Been Worse”
Reviews.Author: Snowman128
Reviews.Content: I have never been in a more disgusting hotel in my life. When we 1st got there we were told that our room was over in the manor buildings & we had to go outside for a 5 minute walk to the Manor buildings. When we go to the building there 3 security guards in the building breaking up a fight - they told us not to worry to they had it under control (yea right). We were in the B building & the outside doors that are suppose to be secured are not. Once in the room we found it dirty, & it smelled awful. It appeared the room hadn't been cleaned in weeks. The bathtub & sink wouldn't even drain. I travel often & I can honestly say I have never been in a more disgusting place in my life - I wouldn't allow my dog to sleep here. On top of all of this you will find a staff that is extremely rude & could care less about their customers. Do yourself a favor & spend a few extra $ to stay someplace else

Reviews.Title: “A lovely few nights”
Reviews.Author: MrsFilsonian
Reviews.Content: I found this to be a pleasant and very friendly hotel, helpful staff, yes it was busy but doesn't that show popularity? My husband and I married here in the hotel chapel and had a lovely few days. Ok it's not Bellagio or Ceasers palace but for $35 a night it's well worth the stay. Clean, fun, plenty of food options, great bar staff. It's right at the end of the strip but with the Deuce bus it doesn't really matter. I'd gladly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great staff will stay again”
Reviews.Author: Joanne87_10
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at circus circus and even though it was one of the cheaper hotels, we found the hotel was above standards. The food was great and the rooms were really clean, as a young a lively group we found the hotel location to be quite adequate for partying with a short walk to night clubs on the strip, The leisure activities at the hotel seem very well suited for children and the hotel buffet was amazing value for money.

Reviews.Title: “sould be removed from the strip”
Reviews.Author: Nate_2011Vegas
Reviews.Content: I made a point to check out all the casino's/hotel's located on the strip and Circus Circus was byfar the worst on the strip. I can't speak for the rooms because I did not stay at CC, but the rest of the building is so unmantanied a really smells horrible aswell. The only bonus i can see for Circus Circus is the carnival for children, (you can always stay somewhere else and go to amusment park!)

Reviews.Title: “Fun for kids and great value”
Reviews.Author: SwedishSafari
Reviews.Content: Although built in 1968, Circus Circus has been kept up and is a great place to stay. It had great shopping for the kids, lots to do, and a friendly staff. The rides and games were a lot of fun. The internet worked well, and the value was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, not clean, poor amenities”
Reviews.Author: Soulsurfer3
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the valet. I drove to Vegas, I pulled in and the valet greeted me by telling me that I pulled in too quickly. There was no bellhop to help with baggage. The line to check in was 30 minutes long. If you're placed in the east tower it's another 5 minute walk and up two elevators. The first room I was placed in was a smoking room even though I specifically asked for non-smoking. It took two phones calls and 40 minutes of waiting to be moved. In the second room, I noticed the alarm clock and light were unplugged (this was also the case in the first room). When I pulled out the nightstand to plug them in, I saw a plate of leftover food behind it. I then called the manager to explain which took another five minutes of waiting. She offered to remove the "resort fee," which is unstated but charged to everyone upon checkin. $7/night. The alarm clock's face in the second room was broken. Not convinced that it will actually work. The TV's are tiny. And there's no room service. A water bottle from the hall vending machine is $3. So far, can't really find anything good about this.

Reviews.Title: “Was pleasantly surprised....exceeded by expectations!”
Reviews.Author: MonopolySlots
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights with husband & 3 kids. Sadly no adjoining rooms, but were only a couple of doors away from each other. Rooms were ok, a bit dated but clean and comfortable. Ideal for children at this casino with the large Adventuredome!! Our kids had a super time in there. There's the Midway which is full of fairground games and YOU DO WIN...lots in fact! We can home with lots of toys and you can also which tickets which you exchange for gifts..done well there too!! The kids loved the entertainment of the artists too!! Didn't know what to expect as hubby and me normally stay at the south end of the Strip and stay at MGM. We had briefly visited this casino a couple of years ago but never thought I would stay in it. As we took this kids this time I was more than happy with the place and would stay there with them again. This is mainly aimed at kids......never seen so many!! lol!!

Reviews.Title: “unbelievably horrible”
Reviews.Author: tourifik
Reviews.Content: the rooms are unbelievably filthy and noisy. the caino and hotel staff are rude. when security was contacted to report loud party above our room, they simply stated "that's the way it is in Vegas" and did nothing.

Reviews.Title: “DON`T !!!!”
Reviews.Author: VegasLover5
Reviews.Content: Very dissapointed with the whole place. Arrived at around 5pm, 100 or so people massed in reception, some asleep on ruck sacks kids running wild 10 reception desk points and only 3-4 staff at their position. The hotel / Casino look very dated, however we went into the Tower part of the hotel, may be better than The Manor Room building where we stayed,incidently the building we stayed in had a stromg musty smell and the doors to the street did not lock shut, felt very unsecure. One saving grace to the hotel is the Steakhouse within the main building, this was exceptional, both food and service, would recommend a visit there even if you are not staying at Circus Circus.
