Adventure Dome felt just like a cheap funfair with cheap attractions and stalls, was far too busy and hectic, although we expected Vegas to be busy, this was the most overcrowded of all the places we visited. Will neve stay there again, very very budget !

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful?”
Reviews.Author: scousemouse
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights on a tour, first impression on entering, a drab and quite dimly lit lobby and hoards of people milling about waiting to be checked in. Luckily our check in had been done for us and we were up off to our room in the West Tower within a few minutes. Having read the reviews, I was a little dubious but found the 30th floor west facing room adequate, clean, reasonably spacious and while not the best view in Vegas, an open aspect looking over the freeway towards the distant mountains. They don't encourage you to linger in your room, no coffee maker, refrigerator or microwave and a faulty hairdrier. Circus Circus is an enormous hotel with shopping outlets, a variety of eating places and a vast casino with a low ceiling which is quite claustrophobic compared to some of the hotels we visited, but we were not there to gamble but to see the sights. We ate in on one night in the buffet and found it quite reasonable and breakfast at Rock & Rita's was fine and had friendly service. We also ate once at Peppermill, just across the road from the front entrance and found a pleasant atmosphere, subtly lit, tasteful and with generous portions. In the time we were there the Adventure Dome was never open, a great disappointment. Ticket office in the lobby is useful and can save quite a lot of money. Situated at the north end of Las Vegas Boulevard we found it an uninspiring and hot walk to the main, vibrant part of the strip and quite a long way to walk back from Luxor and Mandalay Bay at the southern end of the strip, although there is a bus stop outside. Overall impression, cheap and cheerful, an adequate place to stay if you just want somewhere to sleep. Main likes - Beautiful hotels such as The Belagio. Classic car exhibition at the Imperial Hotel Main dislike - running the gauntlet of touts soliciting on the strip which we found totally unacceptable, something must be done about this.

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus Is GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: djdromusic
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Circus Circus every time we have been to Las Vegas, it's convenient to the rest of the strip and to downtown. While it may be aging it's doing so gracefully. If you're expecting The Mirage, Bellagio or any of the other multi billion dollar monoliths that are now destroying Las Vegas, then it won't be for you, but if you are expecting to spend a pleasant trip without going bust, Circus Circus is the place to be. Friendly staff and things for every family member to do make this a great value. My only complaint are the timeshare salespeople that endlessly annoy you, but just about every casino on the strip has them.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: regandg
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we decided to upgrade to a "newer" room in the West Tower for $10 more per night. After getting to our room we couldn't help but wonder what the older rooms looked liked because the 'newer" room was VERY outdated, , stained sofa, stained carpet, stained shower curtain. The room was hot as hell and no matter how low we turned the air down, it never cooled down during our entire 4 night stay. No coffee pot, refrigerator or microwaves available..... Positives: The bed in the room is very soft (which was a plus for me) , and although there were nasty old stains all over the place the room was clean. Fun, reasonably priced place to stay if you are traveling with kids, but otherwise we will stay elsewhere on our next visit. Also, there is nice restaurant across the street at the Riveria called Kady's Coffee Shop- A MUST TRY! $12.99 T-Bone steak dinner, that is delicious!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT DEAL”
Reviews.Author: brightsunshine8
Reviews.Content: Our 2 nights stay at the Skyrise Tower in a room with 2 queen beds were a pleasant one. Beds were comfortable. Rooms were very clean eventhough the room's design already outdated. Will be great if they have a coffee maker or a microwave rather than an ironing board.

Reviews.Title: “Bet you would have better choices!”
Reviews.Author: mudmao
Reviews.Content: Took quite some time to check in and check out as they were only a few staff at front desk. Then needed to walk some distance to the Skyrise Tower. The room basically had nothing - no coffee machine, fridge, etc. Even the hair dryer was broken down. Well, you got what you paid for. Could consider if you just need a cheap place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Tired Hotel/Casino”
Reviews.Author: Llewelyn37
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Las Vegas. Circus Circus had adequate bedroom facilities- a stitch here or there - a replacement for worn chair covers would help. Staff at reception were excellent as were the room staff. But, the dark cavernous low roofrf gaming rooms we had to pass through to get out onto 'The Strip' were not congenial and compared with other 'resorts' we strolled through were definitely sub-standard.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: BandBAdventures
Reviews.Content: The only thing this had worth the money was the beds,very comfortable,other than that very plain room,no coffee maker in room or free coffee in the lobby.They want you to pay $3.00 for a cup of coffee,but they sure had a iron and ironing board.How many people you know uses a iron on vacation compared to a coffee maker.It is on the north end of the strip.We did make money in their casino,left Vegas $110.00 richer.

Reviews.Title: “Ntot a good safe place for kids!”
Reviews.Author: kcmowendy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because we have so many kids and wanted everyone to have fun but while we were there it had rained and the adventuredome was leaking all over the ground! Very unsafe for children they had towels laid down on the floor awhere anyone could trip and fall on them which is what my happened my 8 year old fell and busted his knee cut it and briused it please thinking about your childrens saftey in this hotel before getting a room here

Reviews.Title: “Fun at the Aging Circus Circus Vegas”
Reviews.Author: fed2res
Reviews.Content: Despite the tape on the hallway carpet, my gilrfriend and I found our third floor Skyrise Tower room at Circus Circus Las Vegas to be in very good condition during our 5-night stay in November 2010. It was during Veterans Day weekend but the rates were extremely low and the hot tubs/ pools were open and really a great treat after a few hours of daily casino action. While this property is showing its age, MGM has put money into renovating much of the casino floor and those who like sports betting will be pleasantly surprised by the attractiveness of the new surroundings. But - while the Sports Book was much friendlier than in past trips - we wouldn't recommend the nearby Rockin' Ritas - a terribly noisy and overhyped place to eat that isn't worth the attention. Overall - the slots were easier than in past trips and the staff seemed more responsive to customers than before. Sure this isn't a classy joint - but the tower rooms are worthy of consideration.

Reviews.Title: “OMG, what a miserable dump”
Reviews.Author: RoxieCat2007
Reviews.Content: The old saying "its too good to be true" applies to this place. We booked here because of the low rate; down and dirty rate for a down and dirty hotel. Run down, smelly, low life clientelle, classless food and beverage venues and a pathetic casino all in evidence here. We had a prepaid reservation that was not refundable. We couldn't stay here, just had to walk out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: bb24680
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 days at Circus Circus and found it very nice.. Sure it an older hotel, but very clean. Yes, there are lots of kids at times, but what would you excect with a name like Circus Circus. Check in was a breeze, room was big and bed VERY confortable. Short walk to the Monirail System and bus picked up right outside the property. Personnel were excellent, everyone was nice, polite and very helpful. I have stayed at many of the other hotels on the strip (MGM, LUXOR, CEASERS, and others) but for the vaule.. this is the hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Just returned”
Reviews.Author: kev7629
Reviews.Content: Just been to Vagas stayed at Circus Circus. Great value. Just one small complaint was the smell out side the buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value, get what you paid”
Reviews.Author: EmilyLiu7
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Skyrise tower for 4 days. The room was spacious and clean, but no microwave or fridge. The first two days the service was good, but they didn't clean our room on the third day. There is a parking lot in the tower, no need to walk through the casino. The buffet was just ok, the kid eats free with paying adults. Overall this is a valued place, the promotion price is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: chelly29
Reviews.Content: 1 day ago - Fire alarm went off at midnight and I called the service desk they hung up on me as I tried to get answers I kept calling back everyone was in a panic then the elevators would not respond I called back apparently three floors were going off and people were scared all the people on my floor tried to leave by stairs because they got through and they told then to evacuate but they did not tell anyone else!so I heard all that packed and ran out of there and checked out they REFUSED to give me and others a refund because they say that happens all the time and we check out at midnight which technically is the following day and does not apply the check out people were RUDE and did not help any of the people who were freaking out! I will NEVER go there or recommended it to anyone! Day one tried the buffet...it was horrible and my inlaws and I got sick..

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Fairywren8
Reviews.Content: On vacation from Australia, travelled with my husband and 3 children, ages 2, 9 and 13. The lobby was musty smelling and reception staff quite abrupt. Room was okay, clean, nothing special. Had the buffet one morning, but was horrible, would not eat here again. Casino staff rude, and one bar girl tried to chat up my husband, even though he told her he was married. Very skanky!

Reviews.Title: “Love the atmosphere, kids ARE NOT a problem”
Reviews.Author: Carmania
Reviews.Content: Was a bit worried about staying after reading some reviews here about the kids - I'm not big on rowdy kids - but this isn't a problem except in the concourse areas, but hey it's a hotel for kids after all. Loved the circus theme to my room. Walls weren't paper thin. My gripe was that my room overlooked the Adventuredome and I stayed here in the lead up to Halloween. The Adventuredome had some Halloween thing on and all night until 12pm you could here this chainsaw noise coming from the Adventuredome. However I got around this by leaving the room until that time - good excuse to gamble! Just beware if you plan on staying there around that time of the year. Rock N Rita's was a great place to eat - they had a good $5 menu after 11pm. And the room came with a bunch of vouchers for cheap drinks and stuff. I had read reviews of security being an issue and I can vouch for this. I had bought a new handbag in Vegas and switched over bags. I'd left my old bag out on the table with the side zipper closed. When I got back to my room that evening the side zipper was open. Mmmm. I was lucky I'm not the sort of person that leaves valuables unlocked. Always lock your valuables/cash before you leave your room, even if it's in your luggage with a padlock on it, it doesn't matter where you go. I'd stayed at Trump Tower on my previous stay in Vegas and while that was plush, I had so much more fun at Circus Circus.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good but...”
Reviews.Author: ocping
Reviews.Content: Location (2) - Located at edge of Las Vegas Strip Rooms (4) - Big and clean rooms Service (3) - Front desk was overloaded, long queue Amenities (5) - Restaurant was very big; large selection available - WiFi available for free

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & value for money!!”
Reviews.Author: gizzyNottinghamshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the circus circus for 10 days!! loved it! Yes its not as fancy as some of the other hotels on the strip but you dont get ripped off! went in the slots of fun attached to the hotel for a couple of drinks most nights before heading off up the strip as you could get a bottle of bud and a glass of wine for $6 whereas some of the hotels wanted $25 for the same..The beds were the comfiest ive ever slept in on a holiday and the bed was huge, nice size room ,nice bathroom, aircon,hairdryer. iron & ironing board ,room safe for a small charge every time you used it... towels changed and room cleaned every day..the buffet in the hotel was lovely or a choice of restaurants available! It is more one end of the strip but its not really a problem if you are ok walking or you can get a deuce bus for $7 for a 24 hour pass and you can hop on and hop off !! All in all loved vegas its a fab fun place and we also got married there, recommend chapel of the flowers if you get maried!! would deffinately stay at the circus circus again even though its not as modern as some of the other hotels but it has everything you need and you dont spend that much time in your hotel anyway!! oh & the weather was fab too it was in the 90's everyday and it was October!! Try this hotel because some people moan about anything , we loved it !! The gran canyon trip is also amazing this is a must if you go i dont like flying or heights but wouldnt have missed it for the world.

Reviews.Title: “Good family-oriented hotel, some traps - but they're avoidable”
Reviews.Author: housemouse77
Reviews.Content: We chose Circus Circus for travelling with small kids. It's a great value hotel, booked online with 24 cancellation, the rooms wereupgraded to Tower rooms upon check in. Overall outdted decor, but nice ad clean rooms, friendly staff, lots to do with kids. On the lowlights - check in was long with lots of people (~4pm), lots of people in the hotel overall, and it's impossible to get on the elevator at 11am (checkout time) if you stay i n the Tower. But great for kids and unbeatable value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price for a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SambobUK
Reviews.Content: Well we were very pleasantly surprised with this hotel as we had been expecting budget accomodation as we booked through the now defunct Monster Travel. We stayed in the Skyrise Towers, massive room, 2 queen beds, lovely big bathroom with hot water and clean towels every day. Kids would love it as plenty going on. Get the vouchers on display everywhere and try out the cocktails at Rock and Ritas. (We needed the energy cocktails to keep us going as contstantly on the go in Vegas.) Just be wary late at night, as my friend was accosted by two women in the lift offering their services on the way back to his room!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful holiday!!!”
Reviews.Author: Eyez12
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a two week stay at Circus Circus, after reading lots of negative reviews I was dreading staying at the hotel. Oh how we are so pleased we stayed there. Despite the reviews the hotel staff were lovely!, we even got a free room upgrade when we asked, they were cheerful and helpful too! The hotel is very clean and of a good basic standard. The room was clean and comfortable with use of a free T.V, iron and board, safe and hair dryer (yes, all free!) The hotel had lots of different eating areas, such as Mcdonalds, Steakhouses, pizza's etc, but the all you can eat buffet was of exeptional value (they do this for breakfast, lunch and dinner) it was also very clean, they follow good hygiene procedures. My husband and I went without children and enjoyed what the hotel had to offer, but if we had children this would have been the place for them to stay, all the children we seen in the hotel were having a wonderful time. The only little thing I found to be a pain is that the free circus acts were shown one at a time with a 30 minutes interval between each act? however they were entertaining, plus there's lots of fair ground games to keep everyone entertained until the next showing. The only thing that you need to be aware of in ALL the hotels, is the information points trying to give you free show tickets, basically they are some sort of time share schemes, trying to get you to sign up to giving up so many of your holiday hours to go through rubbish, time wasting time share info ( they don't tell you this when they get you to sign, it's all in the small print that they convieniently skip over) just be firm and say no thank you and that you know all about it and your not interested, It's not a big issue tho. If you are booking to see shows and to go on trips don't book with your holiday company, in the hotel there is a box office called Tix for less, they are also scattered around the Las Vegas strip and they sell all of the show tickets half price, these Box offices are safe to use, we booked all of our shows with them and saved lots of money in doing so. We will be returning to Circus Circus again, it's great value for money and has left us with fond holiday memories. Mrs Tonks Birmingham England United Kingdom

Reviews.Title: “I love circus circus.........”
Reviews.Author: ilove2travel2588
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at circus circus since my first trip to Las Vegas,Nvsince i was 7 years old and now in 22 years old.I love this hotel great price.The hotel is not like the others such as the Wynn,Encore,Rio,Monte Carlo.But its grerat hotel for the price.We arrived almost two hours before check it and they let us check in early free of charge.Also the night before we left we called down to the front desk and asked about late check out because out fight left vegas late we was told that we would be charged late check out fee and that we will have to go down to the front desk and pay the fee once we got down to the desk the nice youg men have us late check out for free.The only problem i have about this hotel is that is a lil further down on the strip but the duece bus do pick you and drop you off in the front of the hotel.Also make sure you stay in the towers and NOT THE MANOR TOWERS from what i seen on saw on here i dont think i would like to stay there because its on sepreate part of the hotel.I would recommend this hotel to someone who is on budget or if you have childern this would be great place.It have a indoor them park n free circus acts as a 22 year old male i really enjoyed the FREE cotton candy and the clown show.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised - would definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: kushta
Reviews.Content: We didn't want to spend much on our hotel, so we would have more for entertainment. We had a room in the West Tower and were very happy with it. The room was very spacious, well decorated, and comfortable. I expect an average Motel 6 kind of room, but we way above that. Nice bedding and pillows. Don't get excited about the pool or workout room, but others fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT VALUE,FUN TIME BY ALL!!!”
Reviews.Author: rocker26
Reviews.Content: My son and I spent 4 nights in November. The room was clean and well located. My bed had no pillows upon arrival,and there was no soap or shampoo in the bathroom. However,a phone call to housekeeping had it pleasantly rectified in less than 20 minutes. ALL of the staff on site were pleasant,polite and helpful. We found a very cost effective deal staying at Circus Circus,and expectations were more than met. Would not hesitate to stay here again. My son and I will always have good memories of our stay at Circus Circus.

Reviews.Title: “TOO OLD TO COMPETE W/ NEWER PLACES”
Reviews.Author: kenji98
Reviews.Content: it's old looking and is too far away from many attractions. I'm not thrilled witht heir casino--it's old--and cheap--if you'r on a gambling junket this is fine to lay down your head

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Pandora42
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on Circus Circus, we were not sure what to expect. The reception area/lobby was a little shabby and not well lit, but the rooms themselves were spacious and had clean linen. It was not possible to make drinks in the room. We overlooked a flat roof, some building work and the Trump Tower, and we accessed the room from a lift in close proximity to the casino. The buffet restaurant offered a huge selection of hot and cold food, and it was good value for the money, especially their 'all day wristband'. We caught some of the splendid circus acts but did not use the casino although we walked through several times to one of the exits. If you need somewhere to stay for a few days to explore the sights of Las Vegas, this could well be the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: gypseygirl
Reviews.Content: we had a late flight so we thought we would book a cheap hotel for the first night of our weeks stay in vegas, our room was a good size but not very clean there were dirty black hairs on bathroom floor,the hotel itself is very chaotic everything seemed to be chucked into a small spacel,i would say that its mainly geared for children,i was so glad to check out and enjoy my remaining 6 days at caesars,(now thats what i call a hotel )check out my review

Reviews.Title: “I would never stay in this busy, dingy hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: Basia124
Reviews.Content: I booked online for one night from saturday to sunday, on Expedia.... Called a day before to find out if i can check in early they said around 3p.m if i would come earlier there might be a charge. We got there 2:45p.m. I checked in we were given a Manor room off on the RV side away from the Circus Circus towers.... far to walk, the room was worn out, and noisy at night... someone ran through the halls at 3:40a.m and woke us up... we woke up again when someone was taking a shower at 6a.m. it sounded like there was maintanance being done... what a uncomfortable place... When I checked out next morning I asked the lady at the desk why did we get such a crappy room for the price I paid she said if you book 2 parties thats what you get manor rooms, next time to co to Circus circus website and book... Heck no never will come back anymore.... yuk....

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back”
Reviews.Author: Lissy G
Reviews.Content: Last weekend, I spent a night at Circus Circus. I was looking for an inexpensive place to stay and figured I'd give Circus Circus a shot based on the reviews I read on Trip Advisor. The reviews were mixed, but I thought a 2 - 2.5 star hotel would suffice for one night...and it did...however, I don't plan on going back. The check-in process was extremely slow despite the fact that it was only noon (check in is about 2 or 3pm). The good news, however, is that we weren't charged an early check-in fee, which I understand some people have been charged. It is clear that the hotel is in need of some refurbishing, but my real problem is the fact that the room could've been much cleaner. The headboard on one of the beds, the door, as well as the curtains, were visibly dirty.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad, the ugly...”
Reviews.Author: mderaba
Reviews.Content: Okay, if it weren't for an extremely good package deal we got from a Discover America deal on this hotel, we would never have stayed here, and I must admit, the bad reviews scared me. But, we only stayed here one of the three nights in our package--intentionally--because we had a timeshare week exchange at the Grandview Resort for the rest of the week. We flew in on a Saturday night red eye from the East Coast, and checked into Circus Circus at midnight. We had only a few minutes wait in the check-in line. The lobby and front entrance of the hotel are very drab and dimly lit. The carpeting looks like it has been worn out over two decades in the lobby. There were also a ton of kids and older teens hanging out at that hour, mainly due to the Halloween week "Fright Dome" in the Adventuredome attraction, which I gather is pretty popular in Vegas. We didn't take this tour, but it looked like fun if you're into that spooky/scary stuff. Anyway, our room was in the West Tower, and it was perfectly fine. It was clean and spacious but certainly not the fanciest. It had a nice flatscreen TV. The view was great of the strip, facing the old downtown area. The best thing about this room was the bed! It was a nice king-size bed with the best mattress and pillows and sheets. Of course, we were tired after our flight, but I definitely slept like a baby, and this bed was far better than the one at the Grandview. We ate in the buffet the next day as two all-day passes were included in our package. We were pleasantly surprised at the quality and selection. We had brunch and dinner there. The food was fresh and at the correct temperature. The dessert selection was great. We also ate at THE Steakhouse on a subsequent night with a coupon. This is absolutely the BEST steak we have ever had! Melt in your mouth filet mignon. The service was superb. We also tore an ad out of the Vegas magazine from the room and had a pretty good bottle of wine with our meal at no extra cost. The mashed potatoes were fabulous, so was the salad and vegetable (asparagus with bernaise sauce), and the Bananas Foster for dessert was out of this world. The classic elegant atmosphere in this restaurant belies the rest of the hotel, which overall I would describe as sort of tawdry and seedy, but entertaining nonetheless. We aren't big gamblers but tried the video poker machines to no avail. In fact, this was the worst place for our meager gambling the whole week, and we actually had the best wins at Bellagio, the complete opposite in terms of quality hotel from Circus Circus. But we did enjoy our stay here, and we had free drink coupons from the Fun Book at Rock n Rita's bar, where the bartender was entertaining and talented. There were big crowds here during the weekend, but it really thinned out by Monday when we returned to use some more coupons. All in all, I would say that this place is not nearly as bad as the reviews make it sound, if your expectations aren't set too high, but it also is definitely outdated and kind of drab overall. The West Tower rooms are fine, though. We didn't use the pools, nor did we see the Manor Rooms, and I don't think I would want to use or stay in either from what I saw from the outside. The place is geared towards those with children, and it appears to be a real bargain. We did see one of the free circus acts and strolled the Midway area, which would certainly entertain the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here !”
Reviews.Author: gteresa
Reviews.Content: This must be one of the worst hotels in Las Vegas. It is a truely dreadful grim place and has no redeeming features, it is not even in a good location. Lots of other great places to stay ,so look for somewhere else and enjoy a great holiday .Book The Beatles Love show its brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: marianne-mackinnon
Reviews.Content: Hotel and room clean. Not a particularly good location at the end of the 'Strip' would like to have been in the middle of strip. We got robbed in the middle of the night while we were sleeping in our room. Hotel staff investigated it and then told us they are not taking responsibility for what happened, basically did not want to know. Obviously an 'inside' job as who else could have access to your room at 3am and get in so easily. Disappointed that no one got caught for doing this to us.

Reviews.Title: “CHEAP CHEARFULL GOOD VALUE”
Reviews.Author: derekjanice56
Reviews.Content: far end of the strip ideal for the light show at freemont st , hotel is a bit old fashoned but good value for money food good also,main post office is in the streetat the rear of hotel ideal to post those cards back home.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Ideal location, great value, and super clean.”
Reviews.Author: Dee123456789
Reviews.Content: Our first time in Vegas was awesome, Circus Circus was perfect for us. Brilliant room with a great view of the strip. With a deuce stop just opposite, when we didn't feel like a stroll we could just hop on for a really reasonable price. Breakfast was superb and the entertainment was an added extra. The dazzling lights of Vegas are a must for anyone, and the Circus Circus is as good a hotel as any for a comfortable stay. Jenny and Dee recommend it. Viva Las Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: whomever
Reviews.Content: i booked a cheap room through expedia but they had no record of it- others had the same problem at checkin, so be sure to bring your reservation papers. the manor rooms were close so they upgraded me to a tower room.i asked for ma high floor and they put me on the top floor with a great view of the strip. the room was very clean and nice. there was some noise from compressors on the roof but generally it was a quiet room to sleep in. there were only 10 tv channels. heater didn't work the first night. overall it was a good deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good atmosphere but smoky and very unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MalcolmC
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Circus Circus but it was not as good as the previous stay. On check in the staff were very cold and unfriendly, never spoke even when asked a question, failed to give us the guest coupon book. The waitresses in and around the casino were also gruff, unfriendly and never smiled. Compared to other hotels and casinos in Las Vegas the staff were easily the worst and the casino easily the smokiest. The room was very good and very clean. However, we do realise that we get what we pay for and we wanted a cheap stay on the strip and overall it was a good stay. If we were to go again we would probably stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was a real disappointment and not up to the standard we expected”
Reviews.Author: katieladybird
Reviews.Content: After staying at the stratusphere hotel on our last visit to Las Vegas,which was good, Circus Circus hotel was a big let down. We had to queue for ages to check in and then after being charged resort fees for goodness knows what, we were handed a map and pointed in the direction of our room, which was at the other end of the hotel and a fair distance away. We had to struggle with our luggage as there was no one to assist us and it was difficult to locate our rooms.As we are both oap's we were exhausted by the time we reached our room which was dismal and drab.The view was over the concrete rooftops of the other parts of the hotel and was depressing. The staff were not helpful or interested in our enquiries about our return airport transport .and we had to queue again for ages to check out. It was altogether depressing.

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional, unfriendly staffs and dirty hotel.”
Reviews.Author: paradise1975
Reviews.Content: Staff-1. Very rude and need some service training. I asked for a wheelchair and directed to the belldesk. There is 2 black girl sitting down and I was standing and look at me, instead of them saying "May I help you". They waited for me until I said "Where can I rent a wheelchair". And she said you ask him pointed to the bellboy standing. Instead of saying "Mr. Bellman can you assist this gst for a wheelchair". 2. Front desk-friendly but not accommodating. We arrived at noon but since too early there is a charge of $10 each room to check in early even if room is available. Until I mentioned that i stayed with them before and we also have 2 young kids that need to sleep, when I said that then she decided to give it for free. If I did not say anything she probably don't care. But thanks to Amanda anyway for her kindness. 3. Room is very filthy and stinks specially carpet in the hallway, mildew in the tub, toilet won't flush properly and AC not cool enough. I guess that's what you get for the price of $25. But nothing compares to Ballys we have a price of $29 but a larger and clean room. I won't come back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME experience at Circus Circus!”
Reviews.Author: motherofthegroom22
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our extended family and friends who came in for my son's wedding (at a chapel down the street). We thoroughly enjoyed the Midway with our granddaughter and her teenaged uncle, LOVED the food at Rockin Ritas and highly recommend the Garden Grill as well. All the staff we encountered were extremely friendly and helpful. The casino was not nearly as smoky as some others on the strip. The 13th floor haunted house actors were wonderful when we were trying to get our bride "to the chapel on time" and even allowed their ghoulish elevator man to take us down in the "special" elevator when we needed to get some last minute things for the bride. Rooms were clean and quiet and the shops were reasonably priced. We will definitely plan another trip and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A good deal for the no frills budget traveler.”
Reviews.Author: athomeinthepines
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a high end Las Vegas hotel experience, this is not the hotel for you. If you are looking for VALUE, however, the Circus Circus is a good place to stay to save your money for other activities. Most of the negative review of this property seem to want to compare it to high end Vegas hotels, and this is an unfair comparison. Yes, Circus Circus is outdated. Yes, the furniture is somewhat worn and tired. The rooms, however, as spacious and the hotel is on (the end) of the Strip so you can walk or take a cab or shuttle to other places in the city.. There are plenty of on site eating and shopping venues, not to mention the Adventuredome. In particular I hear people complain about Rock and Rita's, but I found the food there excellent (steak one night and a chili burger the next) and if you stick to the two for one deals or the 9.99 menu its quite reasonable. All in all, the hotel is a deal (I paid about 30 per night), but you must remember its pretty much a budget hotel by Vegas standards. If you want glitz and glamour go elsehwere, but if you want a clean room at a budget rate this is a solid place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would definatley go back to this hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: GeorginanCraig
Reviews.Content: Well where do i start? First of all after reading some of the reviews on here i was abit optmistic about this hotel especcially as we were getting married in Vegas aswell. Whe we got there, there was no check in queue at all and when we was told that our rooms wasnt togeather (we requested this as the mother in law was coming to babysit lol) we were upgraded free of charge to the west tower rooms (we had already upgraded to a tower but the west tower are by far the best). Our rooms was spacious and clean and didnt smell of smoke (what alot of people complain about on here). The rooms were conjoining rooms and were just what we needed. There are plenty of resturants and places to go in this hotel inc mcdonalds perfect for the kids. The circus acts are good and definatly go and see the bartenders at rock and ritas (Fab Fab Fab!!) Overall i would recommend this hotel to everyone wanting to go to vegas. With or without children!! Location of the hotel is good as its a 20 min walk to the main strip and by the stratosphere and the riviera. The only thing i will mention is that as we were taking an infant youd think they would put a cot in our room but they didnt and it wasnt untill we requested one we were told we had to pay $120 for the week!! What a joke (child friendly and all that) Apart from that everything was great!!! Go there and have a fab time!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to it's name - Get a tower room.”
Reviews.Author: nirvanaqween
Reviews.Content: The hotel is alright but it really is a circus inside. There were a lot of people here milling around, half of which looked drugged up. It seems to be the hot spot for 20-30 year olds looking to stay cheap and have a good time despite the circus theme. There were tons of security guards in the morning which had me kind of worried. It's very easy to find, and easy to park. Pros: The hotel is huge. The parking is free for guests..and everyone else - so you can end up parking pretty far. There are PLENTY of choices to eat and shop. The adventure dome was campy and expensive and we did not venture in to check it out further but other people seemed to be enjoying it. We were given a coupon book which included free drinks, free games, and all sorts of other goodies to enjoy, we should of taken advantage of it but we were leaving upon check out and checked in nearly 3am after 14 hours of driving. The beds were very comfortable, the room was pretty clean. It's vegas so we expected burned everything, and stains around as all hotels have them. Check in & out was a breeze. The bathroom was huge, and water was hot - thankful for that! Cons: It took us nearly 25 minutes to get down from the 10th floor using the elevator. We had over 100 lbs of luggage with us that was nearly impossible to bring down the stairs. We had to actually take the elevator up to go down. If they stopped on our floor they were packed with people, and it ended up being very frustrating. Make sure you give yourself PLENTY of time to get down to check out, visit the casino, etc if you are planning on using the elevators. Tips: Make sure to book a tower room. From what I hear they are the best, newest and most comfortable of rooms. I am glad we did.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cheap and family friendly”
Reviews.Author: fivecrazypups
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms were very clean. There were lots of kids around and quite a few activities kids could do while at the hotel. The casino was great and we actually won a few times. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The downside is how far away from the rest of the Las Vegas strip the hotel is located.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you have children”
Reviews.Author: bchamlet
Reviews.Content: I went to Las Vegas for some relaxation, but didn't get much at Circus Circus. I realize that it's a vamily-friendly hotel, but I didn't realize that, for example, I couldn't have a coffeemaker in my room because the hotel no longer supplied them, citing possible injury to children. As a person with difficulty walking, I found the corridors very long; in fact, I changed my room after one night because the walk from the elevator was so long. to its credit, the hotel gave me no trouble relocating to a more suitable room, and even refunded me when my electric toothbrush was lost in transit. On my next trip to Vegas, I think I'll choose a more adult hotel!

Reviews.Title: “SuperCouple's Review on Circus Circus”
Reviews.Author: TravelinSuperCouple
Reviews.Content: Umm, No. As a couple with no children in tow on this trip, this just wasn't "couple" oriented type of feeling for a casino. Actually, I was uncomfortable being in a gambling, drinking environment and then seeing children running around. Now from a childs point of view, I bet this is the best place in the Vegas for them.

Reviews.Title: “I will never go back to that hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gourou99
Reviews.Content: I was directed to the Manor residence, a deceptive name, for a cheap motel located behind the hotel, accross the street in a hudge parking. I had to walk almost 15 min from the main hotel entrance to my room. The service was bad, I could not talk to nobody to complaint about my room. The pool is ordinary and the drink expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain”
Reviews.Author: NewcastleDazza
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights with my kids. M ain reason for staying here was all the things for the kids to do which were great. $20 for an all day pass to the them e park and no lines for anything - kids had a ball. Room was big with quite a nice view and very clean. Not badly situated - probably 20 minute walk to Treasure Island and main part of the strip. $30 a night - you won't get any better value than that.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the price, but a bit of a circus in there!”
Reviews.Author: radiohigh
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here a night. We arrived just after 3 and had to wait in a long line to check in. After 20 minutes of waiting, we were finally serviced and then given a map to find our room. We found the search for our room to be a bit annoying. The hotel is massive! Which is understandable, it being a casino/theme park, but nevertheless a maze to find anything. Our room was spacious and clean. Our view was decent. The bed was super comfortable, however, the morning my fiance and I woke up, we found a long, black hair on my pillow case. Gross! The maids need to double check that sort of thing. I would advise future guests to bring their own shampoo/conditioner/body wash. The soap given in the bathroom left mine and my fiance's skin sooo dry and scummy feeling. The "conditioning" shampoo also felt like soap in my hair! One other complaint I have is that the housekeeper that morning seemed so eager to get us out of the room so he could clean. We were woken up at 9:00am by the housekeeper, who then came back four additional times within 20 minutes, knocking on our door and attempting to open it. We yelled at him every time to come back later but the man simply could not wait! Check out time was at 11 but we felt so rushed by this guy that we wound up leaving the room before 10. Talk about rude and impatient! Aside from that, the location was ideal. The room was to our standards - well priced. It was an average stay. I wouldn't expect anything outstanding from Circus Circus. Although I am not opposed to staying here again, there are plenty of other hotels to choose from with similar standards, if not better. I won't rule out Circus Circus, however, I will probably try another hotel the next time I am in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting hotel~ wouldn't stay again if it was free!”
Reviews.Author: Emajin
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your precious money! There was decayed food wrappers behind the nightstand, iron burn marks on the carpet, and a huge chunk of wood missing from the dresser. As I drove into Vegas, I called for directions and was told, "just keep coming to the end of the strip". This wasn't helpful... After being transferred to Reservations, I was told that I did NOT get the room I booked in the "renovated West Tower". Upon arrival, I DID GET the room, only to discover that it was horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Yo do get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: boydel
Reviews.Content: Stayed hear a few years ago (just writing the review now), and looking at more recent reviews, it seems nothing has changed at Circus Circus. Except the cost of everything. The hotel is I understand, the oldest on the strip and it showed then. There are 2 ways at looking at Circus Circus. If you have been to L.V. before and want to do all the things you didn't do first time, this is a perfectly adequate base. If you are going for the first time and want all the glitz, stay somewhere else or you might be disappointed. Rooms are genuinely fine, but always look for upgrades (usually free - if you smile nicely). It is at the end of the strip, which is about 4 miles long. The tram thing was $1.60 when we went, but seems to have shot up in price, as with the buffet breakfast/lunch/dinners - $7.99, 12.99 & 15.99 then. (with an exchange rate of near $2 to £1). But I understand from friends and reviews on here, that has long gone. L.V. is now very expensive. But is still the most fun you can have with yer pants on. MUST go to the Canyon. It is just indescribeable. You'll see. MUST also go to P.F. Changs for a chinkey, and the Cheescake Factory for the meal of your life. Must go the Freemont Street for the night time light show. It's bonkers. Just an observation, but is seems most of the less kind reviews come from Americans themselves. It seems that their demands and expectations are far higher than those of the British tourists and will argue the toss over a speck of dust. "No Wi-fi connection"!!! Really, you are on holiday in Las Vegas. Just take your brain out, leave it in the drawer beside you bed and enjoy the mind-blowing experience. That's all Las Vegas is there for. If you think you're not going to like Las Vegas, you'll probably hate it. If you think you're gonna like it, you'll probably love every minute of it. We did, 3 times.

Reviews.Title: “Old, tired, time to pull the place down!!!”
Reviews.Author: rice80
Reviews.Content: Rooms poor and run down. Resort fee overpriced as lots of things closed during the week. Layout of the place is crazy. The pools location is poor, it's cold and needs rebuilding. Casino is old dark and smells. Price is too high for location and quality. Knock it down!!!

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: kimberley2006
Reviews.Content: I would compare this hotel on the same level as a Travelodge - basic no frills but you're not paying for anything more than this. We stayed in the Manor rooms which are over the road from the main casino & tower rooms. The room was very large and included features like 2 double beds, tv, iron & ironing board & hair dryer. The only thing was it didn't have a safety deposit box in the room, for this you need to find the cashier in the centre of the casino and store or your valuables here, which is a bit inconvenient for accessing your stash of money etc when the room is far away from the casino. Apart from that though it was clean and cheap so no complaints. Imagine it would be ideal for families with kids as in the hotel is a circus show and theme park as well as good value buffets and also a good basic pool area. Location-wise though it is quite far away from action which seems to be further south of on the strip around paris & bellagio. Taxis are expensive mainly due to the fact that you are stuck in traffic to get down the strip and the shuttle bus that runs is often rammed so worse because your stuck in the traffic all this time. Walking is your best option but is around 2 miles! Would definitely go back to vegas again but next time would stop at a hotel further south on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if you prefer to spent your money somewhere else than hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Materio
Reviews.Content: The Circus Circus is located in the north part of the strip. If you do not need luxurious room but comfortable bedroom like us, this hotel is suitable for you. The room was clean and quiet if you leave the windows close and if you are high enough in the tower, floor 7 or more. The hotel have a good and cheap buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Cheesily cheap or cheaply cheesy!”
Reviews.Author: Rakeshtak
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stopped here whilst in Las Vegas from the Uk. We wanted somewhere cheap and cheesy and this fit the bill. The hotel check in had a queue but the staff were efficient. This hotel is located near the end of the strip but far enough from downtown. The casino had thousands of slot machines and lots of tables. There are a variety of shops on site too and all types of food. This does seem more family oriented. Our room was well equipped with tv and free wifi, but no coffee facilities and a stale smell. We didn't expect it at the bargain price. If you want somewhere cheap, cheery with free parking and basic facilites away from the main hustle and bustle in Vegas, I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy and unclean”
Reviews.Author: midwesternfamily_10
Reviews.Content: The rooms and Casino in general were very dirty and not very well maintained

Reviews.Title: “had a blast”
Reviews.Author: racing5555
Reviews.Content: We had a blast first time in Vegas . We dont have small children but if you do and go to Vegas, this is the place to stay, We enjoyed but it was for children.

Reviews.Title: “OK But Not Special”
Reviews.Author: Pnut169
Reviews.Content: I didn't realize that the "manor" rooms aren't located in the main building but are in 5 separate buildings near the RV park at Circus Circus. This was aggravating to find out when we arrived very late (2am) and were tired and just wanted to fall into bed. Instead we had to try to find the manors and, of course, we had parked in the main parking garage which is not at all close to the manors which have their own outdoor parking. Traipsing about at 2am didn't make me very happy but once we got to our room it was fairly large and clean. Also, in the morning the housekeeper had a habit of knocking as she was opening the door then when she found the room occupied letting the door slam. We even witnessed her doing this to neighboring rooms with do not disturb signs out. This was the least expensive room we found for this weekend and it was adequate, though not anything special.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay for the money”
Reviews.Author: tlc111
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Circus Circus for 12 days with my husband and teen son. We made the reservation as a part of a package through Travelocity. It was VERY affordable and great for what we needed. We just needed a clean decent place to have as our homebase while we showed our son what was available "out west". The room wasn't high-end by any means, but it was nice and clean, staff was great and we got it for a great price. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a family trip where "hanging out at the hotel room" isn't at the top of the list.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap!”
Reviews.Author: ParksyMelb
Reviews.Content: Circus Circus is not the flashiest or newest joint on the strip, but its functional, popular and cheap. The Casino is colourful and lively with free circus acts. The complex has all you need for a no frills budget traveller to Vegas, with dining options galore and access to everything. If you want to be on the strip, but dont mind a stroll or short bus ride to the action of Caesers, Ballagia, et al, you're in the right spot. I recomend to budget travellers, backpackers, and those that cant afford to glitz of the flashier casinos/hotels.

Reviews.Title: “circus circus- get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: MIssMouseHelensburgh
Reviews.Content: before taking our USA trip we read a few reviews on trip adviser & other sites about this hotel & were a bit apprehensive! However when we arrived we thought it was fine for the money ( we paid about $19 per night!) The fact that we had to carry our own bags was fine for us but older or infirm visitors may have liked a porter. A couple of minor annoyances were: the room safe required money every time it was opened ( only 50 cents but that can add up!), there was no fridge in the room ( this actually seems to be quite common in America for some bizarre reason!) & there was a $1 per day charge for local phone calls -- get this--- EVEN IF YOU DONT MAKE ANY!!. This DID annoy me as I do not like to be charged for something I dont use or get! Why not just increase the room rate $1 per day? Overall tho the room was clean, & fairly quiet & for the money good value.- we couldnt get over how expensive everything is in US! the hotel was built in the 1960's & so is a bit "tired" We went for a couple of small beers in one of the hotel bars when we arrived & nearly fell off our seats when we were charged over $11. This is into French ski resort price league! Personally we wouldnt rush back to Las Vegas as we thought it was all a bit false & tacky ( similar to Dubai!) If you arent a keen gambler, then just go for 2 or 3 days 7 do the Hoover dam & Grand canyon trips they are well worth seeing. There ARE shows but they tend to be very expensive for the top names.

Reviews.Title: “The staff is very rude (especially Alma...”
Reviews.Author: Dodgegirl2010
Reviews.Content: The staff is very rude (especially Alma). My husband and I were supposed to get a king size bed and they gave us two double beds, when I called to get the room changed, they said they could change it until someone checked outthe following morning. I'm happy they were willing to change the room but they were extremely rude about it. Also when I called to confirm my room a week before my trip hey said I was getting a king! Don't know why those b*tches gave away my room. I will NEVER stay here again or recommend it to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect for family with young children”
Reviews.Author: liuliu2011
Reviews.Content: we stayed in Circus Circus for 3 days last Christmas. It is really a good place for children. we travelled there with our 5 year old son. He loves those wonderful circus performance in the hotel. We spent one evening in the hotel. We can enjoy the circus once every hour. And those performances are different at different time. So you can play the games around and come back at the scheduled time. I will recommend it to the family with children. Your children will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Love Circus Circus!!!”
Reviews.Author: Appleblossom40
Reviews.Content: I had a great time. The room was clean and very comfortable. The bathroom was large and clean. I did notice no fan in the bathroom, but when traveling alone, not an issue. The cleaning staff and front desk folks are a pleasure. The casino is fun and full of life! All in all, a great vacation for one or a family!! I'm going again!

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: boogags
Reviews.Content: Nothing was to much for the staff from the cleaner to receptionist everyone wasfriendly and polite. The rooms were spacious, clean and welcoming with every thing you could need. We were at the north end of the strip with a bus stop just outside and one on the opposite side of the road going south of the strip running every 12-15 mins what more could you ask. It was not to noisy and had shops galore from friut to jewellery and any thing in between. Would go again and stay at Circus Circus. THANK YOU ALL.

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus is a nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Travelingalot
Reviews.Content: I read some not-so-nice reviews on here so wondered what it would be like at Circus Circus. No need to worry. My friends and I were very happy with the place in every way. We couldn't find much to complain about. It lacked a coffee pot (I don't drink coffee though) and they had no hand towels, just washcloths and bath towels. The soap didn't lather well. On the other hand, the place was clean, with a great view of Vegas from our Skyrise Tower room. We could even see people jumping off the stratosphere from the room! The beds slanted a bit toward each other but were otherwise OK. I wish the TV had the weather channel but it didn't. The restaurants were good. We felt safe and slept good. It was quiet there too. I was afraid of bedbugs but there weren't any to be seen by any of us in the group that went there. I would go again to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel if you want a cheap hotel at the...”
Reviews.Author: sdp84
Reviews.Content: Ok hotel if you want a cheap hotel at the strip with casino.We thought it was too far from the "center" of the strip.NeXT time we will pay more for a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: rain4th
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week, arriving on 27th Sept. We were on the 31st floor and the room was very nice and clean. We also stayed here for a few days in 07, and found the hotel very clean then as well.Location wasn't bad as we like to walk and a couple of times we took the bus. We never heard a sound coming from inside the hotel while in the room...it was nice and quiet.Value and service was excellent as were the buffet meals we had. My only complaint, as with other hotels in LV, is being pestered to buy into time shares.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap fun in vegas”
Reviews.Author: Glitter32
Reviews.Content: We were lucky to find this hotel last minute and our room cost us all of 16 pounds per night for the room. The room is spacious, the kingsize bed is beyond comfortable and rooms are clean and quiet. Theres ironing board, safe, everything you need in the room (although tea and coffee making facilities would be nice!). Towels and toiletries are restocked when needed. Because it is such a huge hotel it does take quite a while to get from your room to the entrance. Theres a Aventure Dome theme park in the hotel, a circus with free acts to watch, plus endless arcades, and fairground games, plus of course the Casino itself. Slots of Fun is a smaller casino linked to hotel where you can get cheap drinks and $2 hotdogs. Staff are friendly helpful and courteous. Other reviews have marked it down for location but regardless of where your hotel is, you need a bus to get up and down the strip which is just $7 for 24 hours. Avoid motels of a similar price as they will not be on strip and you will prob spend a fortune on taxis as bus only runs on the strips nor do they have the amenties that CIrcus Circus has. Overall very good, would recommend

Reviews.Title: “nothing special”
Reviews.Author: vegas12330
Reviews.Content: we have been to vegas 8 times and booked this very very last min. Infact it was 48hrs before we went. It was on the strip and we got what we paid for. It really is nothing special. The staff give the feeling that they cannot be bothered with you. These inc check in bell desk and housekeeping. To be honest its such a busy holiday and we only wanted it as a place to sleep. So if you want no more than that you will be fine. The rooms was okay and the linen was spotlessly clean, however the bathroom was not the best and the cleaning through the week was not the best. Wouldn't rush to book it again but the plus is its on the strip!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good, inexpensive place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: jeff19701
Reviews.Content: Flew in and stayed one night and coupled room stay with the Variety Show package. Inexpensive and filled the bill for a short stay! The Hotel is getting a little tired and worn, but seems to be well maintained. No complaints about the room as it was clean and roomy. A very "busy" hotel and you actually feel like you are staying in a carnival! Don't know that I would like it for an extended stay, but I am sure kids would love it! Good if you are on a buget and want a decent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: JulesMilll
Reviews.Content: We had stayed in Circus Circus on our last trip to Las Vegas which was 10 years ago, and opted for this hotel as the price was crazy for the rooms and we knew what to expect. It did not disappoint. We had a West Tower Room on the very top floor which was huge and had great views, even though it was not overlooking the strip. The buffet there is the usual fare, but there are so many different places to eat in Las Vegas this never usually causes a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice, big clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: rousieee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as it was the cheapest hotel we could find on the strip, and wanted to treat ourselves as it was our anniversary. We're on a budget so weren't expecting much, but the rooms are huge, clean, and the bathroom is as big as some other hotel rooms we've stayed in!!! I would highly recommend staying here, the value for money is fantastic. The circus acts that go on in the hotel aren;t non stop, but we saw some of the most unbelievable performances, they start about 11am and finish just before 12.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VACATION”
Reviews.Author: michelleharrison1980
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took the kids to Las Vegas for vacation. We had a wonderful time. From check in to check out was a great experience. The valet staff were very polite. The check in desk was fast and friendly. The bellman was funny. Our rooms were in the west tower. Very spacious. The adventure dome was a lot of fun for us and the kids. Buffet food was OK but could be better. The pools are small for such a big hotel but the lifeguards were very friendly and attentive to the guests. I saw one of them jump in to help a little boy. Pat on the back for his quickness. We ate at Rock N Ritas which was very good. The bartenders put on a great show. We broke about even on the machines. We will definitely come back. Reading the reviews on this site may not always be right. I saw quite a few bad ones but did not experience anything bad during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: murphstar
Reviews.Content: Vegas is coming down with hotels and Casino's Circus Circus is a good hotel, the only problem for us was that it was a right bit down the strip....... so we spend most of our time up at other hotel and casino's e.g. Plant Hollywood, Bellagio, Ceasars etc!! But there is a bus which runs up and down the strip 24hrs a day for $7 a day and lasts you 24hrs from the moment you get on it which is very good!! Circus Circus is a nice hotel and would have no problems telling people to stay here, only thing for me is that its near the bottom of the strip other than that is a good place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for family trip on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Joyfulmoonrise
Reviews.Content: Although some warned us that Circus Circus was not a good hotel we decided that it fit our budget and made our reservations. At check in they were friendly and fast. We stayed in the West Tower on the 34th floor. The room was okay and had a very nice view of the mountains, especially early in the morning. Circus Circus is great for a family with kids. We loved the Adventure Dome and circus acts. We did like the Buffett special of $25 dollars for all day excess. Breakfast was great but dinner not so much. Rita Rocks was fantastic and had good food and a cool atmosphere. We enjoyed all of the shops but did not like the fact that it was so far down the strip. My only other complaint was that the headboards had not been cleaned and the shower curtain was a little dirty. The only rude service we received was from Krispy Kreme employees.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant, if your staying on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: jackiexbx
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel if you are staying on a budget, staff really friendly and helpful. The hotel is right at the top of the strip so is quite a walk away, the monorail is at the Sahara right at the bottom of the strip and stops at all the hotels along the strip so it worthwhile using the monorail. The hotel is massive, we were at the back of the hotel so it was quite a walk away to the front, but apart from that it was a goo hotel! If you plan on going to the Grand Canyon go with maverick tours they were brilliant, they picked us up from the hotel and the helicopter tour was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as other reviews would have me believe”
Reviews.Author: mrmipps
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Vegas following a change at Newark airport, it was around 2000 by the time we cleared customs, we took a shuttle bus to the hotel (Grey Line) it cost $24 return for two of us, and we had no problems with the return pick up. Booking in at the hotel was fast and efficient and we where charged $5 per night room charge to cover as many local calls an in house calls as we made, I didn’t plan on making any but still had to pay. The room was large and clean with a view directly facing the Stratosphere and the distant hills and the RV park, much better than I had expected after reading lots of negative reviews. We never spent any time in the hotel or used any of its facilities (apart from Krispy Crème) their doughnuts and coffee were good. There was a lot of families with children of all ages around the place as we noticed on leaving and returning to our room. The room we had was in a tower on the 19th floor and very quiet, we had no problems in getting lifts up and down and found the hotel to be clean and tidy throughout. It could do with a face lift and is a little tired looking but for the price its what I expected. In general I would say it was a good and cheap place to stay but a little far from the centre of the strip but we managed to walk it no problems, we also used to Duece to ride up to Freemont street and also used the Monorail (this was excellent). Would I stay there again, probably not having seen some of the other more opulent hotels, I would go for the MGM or Mirage just for the convenience. Also we are None smokers and got a none smoking room and it had no smell of smoke.. We stayed for 5 nights from the 7 to 11 September.

Reviews.Title: “It's Worth the Money!”
Reviews.Author: dellst2410
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife are really enjoying this hotel. It's away from the busy main strip making our driving a lot easier in and out of the hotel. Staff is very friendly. Another nice thing about this hotel is we didn't have to walk miles from the parkade to the hotel. Very economical and worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: ClareJ_10
Reviews.Content: Just come back from 2 weeks at Circus Circus. For what we paid (which was a bargain) I cannot fault this hotel. It is on the strip although a bit of a walk from the centre. We were automatically upgraded to a West Tower room which was clean and comfortable. Didn't have to pay the resort fee or the phone fee. Staff were friendly and helpful, when checking in we were shown through to the V.I.P check in area to save us from queueing (the queue wasnt very long anyway). The only thing that was annoying was the timeshare reps (but they were in every hotel). I fully recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: Jimbo078
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is a known dump the staff are not service minded at all. In fact they are down right rude. Not everyone was bad of course . Do yourself a favor and stay far far away. You won't be sorry you did.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daveeboy007
Reviews.Content: After all the negative reviews that I had read about this hotel, I must admit that I was a bit worried about what I would find. Lets put a few honest facts on the table Circus Circus is a bit dated but perfectly adequate with attentive staff which we could not fault and our room on floor 18 (non smoking) was spotless,being cleaned with fresh bedding daily. One day when were feeling a bit under the weather we even had a room call asking if we would like housekeeping later in the day. All in all the hotel is fine as most american hotels are,and yes there are kids ,after all we were all kids one time and it does have a fun fair. By the way my wife and myself stayed for 14 nights and we only got back today but felt very strongly about some of the averse comments we had read. We are both pensioners and loved our stay at Circus Circus. Please dont believe the negative comments. Theres an old saying you get what you pay for and if you can afford Bellagio prices for 14 night good luck but we can't, so dont knock this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.....”
Reviews.Author: Nottsgirl87
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Circus Circus over 4th July Weekend. It was very busy, but to be fair the staff took charge of things fairly well. The hotel was ok but our room was non smoking and yet it constantly stank of smoke. It seemed like it was coming from the bathroom and the smell was there for our entire stay. Most of the people staying there seemed to be familys with children so if you want to stay somewhere with no kids running around this is not the place! The plus side of the hotel was that the room was a good size and it wasnt nosiy at night. At the end of the day you get what you pay for. The hotel was ok but nothing more than average, but considering the price i paided i cant grumble too much. I wouldnt stay here again and would pick one of the many nicer hotels on the strip - some of which are not that much more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Choose another place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kutiepi89
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived late after a long flight, very tired. We had booked our flight, hotel and car on priceline. All were paid in full. Upon arrival, we went to the checkin counter, waited in line, and at last spoke to the lady for our room key. She was very nice and no issue there. However, she immediately told us of a quote "mandatory" coupon book we had to purchase for $20.00 or $25.00. Hid I not been so tired I would have had the energy to complain. So we paid the money. We got to the room. The beds were aweful for sleeping! Absolutely awful. Called for Room Service, no room service. It was loud and noisy. Never will I stay there again. Having lived in Las Vegas about 13 years ago, I have fond memories which included Circus Circus. Those memories are erased now.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: shasha192000
Reviews.Content: I loved the fact that some of resturants stayed open late. That there was more than one entertainment area for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, with surprises of both kinds.”
Reviews.Author: Travelcelt_10
Reviews.Content: My initial impression of this hotel was ok. The lobby and check-in was quite smart. Our connected rooms in the West Tower were spacious and adequate and certainly compared quite favourably with those we stayed in at the San Francisco Hilton. Indeed, our UK travel agent offered the Hilton Hotel, Las Vegas as a same-price alternative. Internet Access is free. Excellent. Then we went looking for somewhere to eat. We passed very numerous stalls selling low-budget souvenirs and found the pizzeria. It ws too late for anything else, but we were staggered that this was an order at the till affair. I had to pay cash as apparently a passport was needed to use my Amex card (in the room safe) and no fruit juice was available for the children. Only carbonated drinks could be ordered, although (I give no added marks for this) you get a free refill for your Sprite/Coke/whatever. I went up to the room and brought down bottled water. I could be snobby about everything else, but it became clear pretty quickly that this was the budget hotel for the Strip and looking back, it was cheap. Unfortunately, following breakfast the next morning, we did not avail ourselves of any further culinary cost-savings. I am reluctant to slate Circus Circus as it clearly opens up the Las Vegas Strip to large numbers of visitors who might have to stay elsewhere and why shouldn't they join the fun? I did buy a cheap T-shirt and key fob there and so will just say (just about recommending it by the skin of its teeth) Viva Circus Circus!

Reviews.Title: “beyond just helpful went out on a limb”
Reviews.Author: dotv10
Reviews.Content: we have used this hotel for the last ten years at the last count 14 times this year was a bit special as we were going for 28 days 4 days before our holiday we had a bad fire at our house and 3 neighbours houses we were so stressed when we got to circus circus we couldnt sleep due to a lot of noise the first and second night my husband explained to one of the managers what we had went through before we got there he moved us right away to a suite we explained we were there for 28 days it was no problem we could stay the whole time for nothing extra to pay it was a haven for us to recover i can never be able to thank them enough we will be back next year everyone was so good the cleaners were fantastic i would advise anyone thinking of going to las vegas use circus circus its the best

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE 4 MONEY - NOT THE BEST BUT DOES THE JOB”
Reviews.Author: Beckyf1984
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at Circus Circus as part of a package deal before we moved onto Seattle. I read the reviews on here before I came and was instantly put off. It's really not as bad as people make out. If you expect 5* don't come here but if like us your going o be out and about all day and it's just a place to sleep then its more than fine. We don't have children but if you do, this in my opinion is the only hotel in Vegas that caters for them. The staff were friendly and the room was clean. We ate in the buffett twice (once for breakfast and once for dinner) and had no complaints. This hotel is no MGM grand or Plaza but if you want budget then it's the best your going to get. I would stay here again but make sure you are in the Tower rooms and not Manor rooms is the only advice I can give. Also it is walking distance to the Stratasphere and there is a bus stop straight outside the hotel that takes you up and down the strip for $7 for a 24 hour pass.

Reviews.Title: “No Smilng Clowns at this circus”
Reviews.Author: Supportsrv
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a one night stay at Circus Circus in Las Vegas. What an awful time!! First, they put us in a room in the manor, the card key system for the exterior building wasn't working. So we had to wait for security to get in the first time. When we returned to our room at 2 am, no security guard could be found. We tried all three of the external house phone and found not one worked. Finally, someone inside walked by and let us in. Our non smoking room smelled like an ash tray, now all clothes have to be washed. The bed had no blanlet, carpet was really stained, haair dryer didn't work and to top it all off there was no "Do Not Distrub Sign" so house cleaning was knocking on our door at 8:45 am in Las Vegas. Give me a break. The service at the bar and deli was awful, slow and the employees were never helpful only rude. Never stay at Circus Cirucs.

Reviews.Title: “Still good value”
Reviews.Author: bedhead02
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at Circus Circus in March 2010. It was my third visit to Vegas and third stay at Circus Circus. I enjoyed it, yet again. The rooms are cleaned daily with fresh towels every day. Bedlinen is changed when you leave the request card on the bed. The buffet has a wide selection of food and is very popular. I said in my previous reviews of Circus Circus, that it's at the far end of the strip, so a bus ride or a walk is needed to get to the centre of the strip and that this is not the most modern hotel, but for what you pay, it's very good value for money. If you're planning on staying in your hotel for your entire stay in Las Vegas, then I'd suggest paying a lot more money to stay somewhere else. But most people generally use their hotel room for the basic, sleeping and showering. I have found all the staff to be friendly and helpful. I have stayed in the Main Tower and the West Tower. The West Tower is a little bit more expensive but it's worth it. We are planning another trip to Vegas in December and we will stay at Circus Circus again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun for the Kids, but not the best”
Reviews.Author: mickij3
Reviews.Content: We went to Las Vegas to visit with family and decided to stay a few nights on the strip. I had my sons with me, one of whom was celebrating his 5th birthday so where else do you stay but Circus Circus! The rooms were fine enough but we had a very slow drain so the bathtub became extremely gross from standing water. We went out for the day and when we got back, late, the drain was unclogged but the tub had not been cleaned. I mean filthy gross tub scum everywhere. I called for housekeeping and it took almost an hour for them to come clean it. Not happy about that! Also, I understand them not wanting guests to hang out in the room, but to NOT have ANY kids channels such as Disney or Nick was very annoying! Of course, go spend money in the hotel/casino, but don't leave my kids bored when we ARE in the room, not cool! The hotel is clearly older (decor, no flat screens, dvd/cd, etc.) than its newer neighbors, but overall we had a good time. The free coupon booklet helped with food and games, so definitely a plus. Would I stay there again, probably not. Would I recommend for families on a budget, yes.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: Family2010Uk
Reviews.Content: Good value for money and as we had children with us between the age of 17 to 4 it was useful to have the theme park within the hotel. We picked this hotel after reviewing the previous comments. The rooms we had were in the main hotel. The only thing I would like the hotel to consider is that they should not charge for the theme park if you are a paying guest and staying in the hotel. Also they need to review the room charges for incidentals, as most guests are not using the internet facility. I would certainly stay in this hotel again if travelling with children, otherwise I would pick a hotel in the main strip as this was right at the end of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: Santa99705
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews here we booked a 2 night stay here. Traveling with our 8yr. old & 15yr. old we wanted to stay at a kid friendly hotel in Vegas. This is a great place to stay with kids in Vegas. We stayed in the main tower. The room was nice, clean, and it was nice to be close to everything in the casino. Adventureland was on the same floor as us. McDonald's was just a walk away. My daughter loved the free acts that go on through out the day. The midway was some good family fun. All the staff are very helpful and friendly. I would stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Sarahstone
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend, we are both 21 year old, went on a trip around america stopping at different destinations, new york & then las vegas so we wanted to do it as cheaply as possible, that is why we picked the circus circus! I want to give the most honest review that i possibly can becuase i dont think its fair when people give a misleading review on hotels, and i have stayed at many as i travel a lot! The circus circus is a very dated hotel in las vegas, it is on the old side of the strip and is a good 15-20 minute walk up the strip to get to the where some of the action is happening, and where all the new modern hotels are. But there is a bus outside the hotel that runs quite often but you seem to find youself fighting to get on the busy as its always packed! The hotel is big, it has many little shops, bagel bars, Pizza restaurant, an italian restuarant, which i cannot comment on because it was closed when we were at the hotel. Upstairs in the hotel there was a mcdonals which i found very handy, didnt even have to leave the hotel for a quick lunch! There is a donut stand which sells lovely donuts too, its a bit hard to believe that there was so many food shops & shops all going on inside a hotel! Our rooms were very big! we each got a king size bed and the bathroom was nice and big too, the rooms were clean, but the only thing is that its just 'dated'. If i was to tour around america again or if you dont care where you stay you just want somewhere cheap then stay at the circus circus, but if this is a special occasion like your wedding i would highly reccomend just spending a bit more cash and stayin in a newer hotel, further up the strip! There is circus acts going on all day in the hotel was are quite funny, but only for so long! There is also a theme park which the rides you do have to pay for, but most of them were closed when we were there. There are 2 pools, and a small bubbly heated pool, only thing is when you are laid there sunbathing it doesnt feel very private because the pool is surrounded by the hotel carpark! Overall, you get what you pay for in las vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Listen to Bad Reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: subtlechaos
