Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Circus Circus hotel for one week and was surprised at how great it was since we had read such negative reviews here Found the staff the be friendly and helpful and as it was in september kids were minimal The food at the buffet was alot better than people make out on here and great value for money!! We had a room in the West Tower and was very pleased with what we got. It was clean and always filled to the brim with toiletries. The bed was more comfortable than people make out and slept soundly each night Location was never an issue for us as the bus stopped just outside and was cheap to use. If you want to get up and down the strip the bus is by far the better option anyway as walking would take alot longer than you realise! Enjoyed every moment of our stay thats why we booked again for two weeks same hotel this september Dont believe all that you read here and make sure you get a west tower room. Some people obviously set their expectations far too high for the money they are willing to pay. Circus circus is immense fun!

Reviews.Title: “GHETTO”
Reviews.Author: swabo01
Reviews.Content: What a complete dump. We went through Orbitz and got a good rate on this Hotel. We thought it was a major Hotel on the strip. Well, it is on the old end of the strip by Sahara and a total dump. Where do I begin. We parked and were told to go to the third floor and take the escalator. Well, the escalator was broken and no one seemed to care. We carried our luggage down a story and a half of steps. We arrived at a less then impressive front lobby where we checked in. We were charged an additional 26.00 for room incidentals, when I asked what that was I was told internet. Didn't matter if I brought a laptop or not, I was paying for their wifi. We then ( and this is truly my favorite part) proceeded to be told our room was a block and a half away. We exited the hotel front entry, walked through a busy garage, crossed Las Vegas Blvd and went half a block down to our building with our luggage. We then went in what looked like a college dormitory. We walked down the halls with lots of room doors open and people running in and out of other rooms. It was filled with smoke and dirt. We arrived at our room which sported a dirty sixties motif. It was in a word DISGUSTING. I will say that we take responsiblity for this debacle. We thought we were getting a good rate because of the slowing down of vacationers due to the recession. Our bad. We just got rooked into a very very ghetto hotel. If you get a great rate on Circus Circus bypass the temptation. It is not a good deal. Unless you don't mind staying it what looks like a bug infested rowdy, non-english speaking party ghetto hotel.

Reviews.Title: “More like a Dungeon”
Reviews.Author: Roxemgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is cheap. Pay cheap you get cheap. I traveled alone for the weekend to do a competition show. I didn't want to go all out so I stayed there since the 4th night was free. It was funny because every time I told people I was staying at that hotel they talked negatively about it and I hadn't even checked in yet. Well they were right. I felt like I was staying in gloomy dungeon. If I ever go back to Vegas with my family I will take them to a cleaner nicer hotel like the Wynn.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect !”
Reviews.Author: cngzhnzkn
Reviews.Content: that was great part of my trip. we stayed in Circus Circus Hotel and we're so glad. everythin's great. if i go to Vegas again, i can stay Circus Circus...

Reviews.Title: “Best for travel with kids”
Reviews.Author: Davone70
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel out of all the hotels in Las vegus because it has the theme park and very good value rate. Good thing we did it was nice and clean hotel , the kids age 8and 10 loves the theme park and the pool . The only thing we did`t like about this hotel is the long long walk from the room to the front of the hotel and the smell of smokes, otherwise it was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Boooooo... two thumbs down!”
Reviews.Author: asabs79
Reviews.Content: Usually we stay at Riviera for our conf. However this year we figured we would try something different and stayed across the way. I booked the room on Expedia and upgraded. We arrived late and the room we were in, was not the room we booked. THe room was AWFUL! It was by far the worst room I have ever stayed in. DIRTY & OLD & Smelly! The sheets were stained and the mattress was like a board! We went on a tour the next day around 5 am so we had to wait til later that day to arrange a new room. The woman at the front desk argued with me as to why I didn't call yesterday. All I wanted was an upgrade, whether I had to pay or not. She continued to argue with me, when I told her about three times, I wanted out of the gross room and would pay for a better one. I paid the extra $20, even though I already did this on Expedia... but they have no records because it was booked through Expedia and the receipt just says... Tower room. (they are all tower room). The new room was a thousand times better but I was still bummed about the experience. The food was not good either. We ate at all the places at this hotel and it was mediocre. It was definitely family friendly as there were thousands of children running and screaming. The price is good, but it is better to spend more, than stay in this crapper of a hotel. And the coupon book that they give you... works no where. We tried to get the free drinks and the bartender refused at two locations. And they were all out of the football beer mugs. If you have bunches of kids and want a place that they can run a muck and no one would notice... make your reservation. The nicest (only nice person) was the check out woman. She was very kind and pleasant to deal with.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: peabean0906
Reviews.Content: After travelling in cheap motels on the California coast for 3 weeks we were excited to finish our travles in a hotel in Vegas.....Upon arrival we were given a room over the road from the hotel called Manor Rooms. This room was dirty, stains on the sheets and up the walls and a dirty bathroom. Also after being typically English and not complaining the following morning I awoke to be completely covered in bites from what I can only assume were bed bugs. Cheap rooms for a reason and I would certainly not recommend staying there to anyone, pay a little extra for somewhere else or stay in a motel slightly off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “So so stay”
Reviews.Author: RedGirl81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a 7 day trip with 6 other friends. Was very apprehensive about the stay after reading the reviews. I would say that if you are not keen on lots of children don't stay here as no matter what time of day it is there are hoards of them! Not really a problem for us as we didn't spend much time in the hotel itself. On arrival the check in was quite quick but as expected the room was a bit dire, the shower head pointed to the wall and had to be propped up with the flannel, the room was definitely in need of updating. Despite it being a non smoking room it smelt very strongly of stale smoke. Everything in the room was just shabby due to careless people and high foot fall no doubt. The room was also very dark as no ceiling lights. Just in need of a major update and lick of paint. We decided to upgrade to the west tower as it was relatively cheap to do so and they are the nicer rooms that are shown on the hotel website. This room was much better, air con nice and quiet, strip view and although still chunks missing and cracks in various pieces of furniture much better. The beds were also much more comfortable although cigarette holes in the bedding each time it was changed and iron burns on the blankets, again just careless people previously but in a better hotel wouldn't have been re-used. Room still smelt of smoke but this did wear off towards the end of our stay. Did try the buffet for breakfast and there was a big choice and everything was OK. Is at one end of the strip but an easy walk to shopping mall and the Wynn, Encore and much needed air con to the rest of the strip! Will definitely be returning to Vegas but not to this hotel. Ideal if you have children but little too shabby for me even with the upgrade and the staff weren't always friendly.

Reviews.Title: “The name says it all - Circus”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Gogirl
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and a good size for myself, my mom and my 2 girls. The beds are comfortable and sleep really well. It was very peaceful and quiet on our floor every night. The cleaning staff came everyday and were very thorough. They were so thorough they took 2 items of clothing w/ them when they changed the sheets on our first morning there. Don't get me wrong, I'm really glad they change the sheets daily, but with them they took a cherished navy blue t-shirt - a stark contrast to the white sheets! Anyway, none of the ladies speak english (ok, maybe one or two) but it was near impossible to speak w/ them about my lost item. I ended up going to the front desk (which always has a long line - will say more about that later), but a concierge helped me find a manager who was kind and assured me that I would be reimbursed for my shirt. They did just that on the day before we left. But here's a word of warning - DO NOT LEAVE ANYTHING ON THE BEDS WHEN YOU LEAVE THE ROOM. YOU WILL NEVER SEE IT AGAIN! Turns out they send all of their linen to be laundered off-site which also does laundry for other hotels in the area, so retrieving anything is like finding a needle in a haystack. They have a lost and found, which I bisited, but to no avail. This is a huge property and as LV is buzzing w/ tourists all year round, and the city never sleeps, there is a constant parade of people through this lobby and main floor at all hours of the day and night. Expect long lines at c/in and c/out times. When we c/in it was late at night on a Tuesday. The lines creep slowly and the lobby is full of uncomfortable and worn out parents w/ kids who run amok b/c they are either tired or restless and hungry from travelling. This is fine for families w/ young children who have alot of patience. If you have teens, they may enjoy the in-house amusement park - Adventuredome. My kids weren't fazed by it. We live near Six Flags over GA, so that's what they are used to. Around peak c/in time it's a good idea to stay away from the lobby and elevators. The elevator corridor was so jam packed one day, I couldn't get close enough to see the doors. I also noticed their breakfast buffet usually has long lines also, so if you plan to go there for breakfast - get up early! They've got a nice fitness center, but you must get a card key from the front desk each day you want to use it. The key you use the first day will not be good on the following day. They deactivate them. We enjoyed the pool (although the trek to get to it is quite a journey), the casino was okay (didn't win anything), and we didn't try the restaurants. The location is great. You can pretty much walk down the strip to where ever you want to go. We went off-site for our meals. We especially enjoyed the dinner buffet at the Hilton and breakfast at Coco's in the Palace Station. Don't miss the Fremont Street Experience. There's alot of shops and casinos there and the video show is charming. Wear comfortable shoes, it encompasses several city blocks. Avoid the long lines in the lobby at all costs - it's not pleasant. Some kind soul told us that we could c/out over the phone from our room. We took advantage of that and it's a good thing b/c our last day was no different than any other. Weekdays and weekend days, there is always a long wait. The staff is courteous, but the wait is tortuous. Another good feature is the show ticket counter. They sell tickets to the Vegas shows at discounted prices. The free internet was also a great amenity. We stayed at this hotel b/c we got a great deal. So i would recommend it for that and for people w/ small children w/ the temperment to deal w/ crowds. Otherwise, I would recommend some place else for couples looking for a nice romantic getaway..I'm pretty sure even the people who work there would say this is not the ideal place for that.

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus - Avoid at all costs. It's a Zoo.”
Reviews.Author: SPOntario
Reviews.Content: Circus Circus is a terrible hotel. We checked in at midnight after a long drive and had a one hour wait in line at check in. Others in line had already checked in but had been given wrong rooms, non-operating keys ,etc. and had to line up again to straighten out the mess. We stayed in the west tower in a "renovated room." I'd hate to see the rooms that hadn't been renovated. It was hard to look at the garish decor. I"m guessing that the filthy, dreary rooms are designed to force you out to gamble in an equally filthy and dreary casino. It was supposed to be a non-smoking room but reeked of smoke and other foul smells piped in through the ventilation system. The bathroom smelled like mouldy running shoes - probably coming from the vent which was caked in dust. and appeared to be growing things. We had a nice view to the west but the window had smudge marks on it from probably the last fifty guests. It was so disgusting that we cleaned it ourselves. The carpet "base board" was peeling away from the walls. There were hairs on the sheets, gum wrappers on the floor and stains on some of the "clean" towels. The carpets throughout the hotel and in the rooms are filthy. A built up filth that you know will never come out. It's one of those hotels where you feel like undergoing a de-lousing once you're free and clear from the place. The rooms in the west tower are all connected to at least one adjoining room by a poorly sealed, thin door so you share your neighbour's smells and noise. (Nice for families wanting adjoining rooms I suppose.) The staff were absolutely useless and their answer to everything was, "I'm sorry, there is nothing we can do." The location is poor being at one end of the strip about a mile and a half away from the majority of other hotel casinos like the Flamingo and the Bellagio. So count on a long walk, an expensive taxi ride or a hot crammed bus ride to escape the zoo they call Circus Circus. I suppose there are some who will be attracted by the cheap rates but I say avoid it at all costs.It's a hole!

Reviews.Title: “Hoopla!”
Reviews.Author: complexx
Reviews.Content: Fun with children, but also great for adults, has a full in door theme park and circus, as well as a candy shop >w< (Not a good idea if clowns scare you.)

Reviews.Title: “Just Great!”
Reviews.Author: Celly84
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Circus Circus Hotel In Las Vegas. I thought it was a great experience because the location was just Fabulous! There was an Amusement Park called "Adventure Dome", there was a Casino, A shopping Place and Circus Acts all in the second floor! The rooms were great, the rooms were very clean the maid did a very good job! There was a swimming pool.(but it was too hot to go inside because it was a outdoor swimming pool so you would get sunburned.

Reviews.Title: “suprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: charlie1973
Reviews.Content: after reading some very bad reports here i thought id stick up for circus circus, We chose it as it was on the strip and prices were very good. We may have got lucky with the room but mine was clean (garish decor but its suposed to be a circus) .i hear there are refurbed blocks and some that are old, so ask ... Aircon and bathroom all fine and even the buffet which is slated usually was quite ok. For the price compared to other hotels on strip i have stayed in this was great! Im not a gambler so casino is a mystery to me but overall entertainments are fun. Its places like circus circus and other themed hotels that make vegas. The new bland mega hotels going up now are taking away the fun and glamour, long live the circus!!

Reviews.Title: “OK for 1 night for the kids”
Reviews.Author: SnoopySF88
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rundown, event the Midway games needed a face lift. Our kids liked the games. The room was under 30$.

Reviews.Title: “i would never go there again!”
Reviews.Author: Robinluver
Reviews.Content: The theme park was really fun and i love how it has like a little city inside the hote, also the top part which had carnival gamesl! now for the bad things. The hotel is in a horrible location, we had to walk forever to get to the main street, our air conditioner broke we had to move rooms, the room smelled like cigars and it was non smoking, the pool was dirty, the casino was huge and at the entrance and whenever my daughter would pass she would get in trouble and they would tell her she was too young and she was only trying to get to the room, the staff are rude, check in took like 20 minutes, the hotel is childish and ugly, the food is average, the hotel is big so it takes a while to find your room, it was super crowded, the elevator broke... and more We only spent a day in the hotel out of the 2 weeks we were there. We should've stayed at Caesar Palace. DO NOT go to this hotel unless you just go for the theme park and dont spend much time there, and are willing to wait for horrible service.

Reviews.Title: “Very down at the heels.”
Reviews.Author: IzzyKY
Reviews.Content: I wish we had stayed at another hotel. We thought this hotel would be the most kid friendly & they do have the indoor amusement park, however there are other hotels with much nicer accomodations for about the same money & are just as kid friendly. So sorry we stayed here. Too far from everything & just very rundown. I know they must have paid for this hotel quite some time ago since it is so old, but it really needs some serious upkeep!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely horrible, unsanitary rooms and unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: pfalor
Reviews.Content: I need to start by saying I've stayed in Circus Circus in prior years and have never been as shocked and terrified as I was during this most recent stay. Prior visits I would have given a rating of 3 or so - it's a cheap hotel, and you get what you pay for. This most recent trip in July, however, has changed my mind about the hotel and I will NEVER enter the building again. When I arrived on July 29, I was initially impressed - the check-in process was quick and streamlined - an improvement from prior visits. When I got to my room, the visit quickly went downhill. On the surface, the room looked clean until I started noticing all of the dried red spots on the floor - yep, it was a blood trail that led to the door and back to the window. I finally confirmed it was blood when I saw all of the dried blood on the window glass itself and streaking down the doorway. I can ALMOST forgive blood on the carpet - that could be tricky to clean between guests, but on the door and window?!? So at this point, I'm grossed out but not entirely angry with the hotel. Accidents happen and I needed to get down to my conference anyways. When I got back to my room a few hours later, I pulled off the top comforter of the bed and found the pool of dried blood on the top sheet and velux blanket. This is when I decided something needed to be done. I called the front desk and was put on hold for about 10 minutes. Finally someone answered and sounded annoyed that I was bothered by the blood - she really acted like this wasn't out of the ordinary. When I asked if anything could be done about it, she responded "Like what?" - I said to start with, I could get a new room. She responded that there were no rooms available at that time of night but she could TRY to get me in another room tomorrow. Out of frustration, I asked if I could at least get some new sheets and blanket and she said she'd page housekeeping. Two hours later, housekeeping hadn't arrived, I was exhausted, and threw the blankets/sheets in the hallway and just went to bed. The next morning, I went down to speak with a manager who was far from helpful or friendly. They said they could look for a new room for me but couldn't make any guarantees. I went over to the conference and came back to the hotel early afternoon to check. Much to my disbelief, my room hadn't even been cleaned! By the end of day 2, they hadn't replaced the sheets or blanket - housekeeping didn't even come to my room. Beyond frustrated, I decided to accept defeat and sleep on my sheetless, blanketless bed. Fortunately I only had 1 more night left in this hotel of misery, so I just dealt with it. To ice the cake, on the morning of checkout, only 1 of the hotel's 4 elevators were operating, so after waiting 30 minutes for the elevator, I just walked down the 10 flights of stairs to make the trip end.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: helegoed
Reviews.Content: When we arrived there, we struggled to find a parking spot in their overcrowded garage. When we finally made it to the lobby trying to check in, it felt like I was at the bloody airport, it was so extremely busy. The elevator is like a sauna. The room isn’t that bad, their TV is really small though. And the elevator buttons were off without getting fixed. However, why will I not stay here again?? The hotel is really old and falling apart, it’s really crowded, and is filled with disgusting rode hard smokers, and every time you take a step there is a kid at your feet. You can barely walk around!!! Yes I know you can smoke at most hotels there, but this one is the worst!!! We could smell the smoke in our NON Smoking room. Also stay away from the buffet there.. It’s really greasy and really poor. If you do (by some misfortune) happen to stay here, eat across the street at the WORLD BUFFET at the Riviera. It’s about the same price and really 10 times better and way less crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable but not recommended.”
Reviews.Author: brainradio
Reviews.Content: We aren't overly picky, however this hotel does need an overhaul. It is old and tough to get around but that really wasnt the issue. The room itself was messy with food stains on the walls and windows and they appear to be understaffed ans it was very hard to get anything extra including room service after midnight. It is on the north side of the strip so it is a good walk or a bus ride to the major attraction which was ok. There were TONS of kids in this hotel. The indoor ammusement park was in good condition and well maintained. The pool is small and crowded. Find another hotel to swim at. My bad service story... We god to our room at midnight and found a note stating that the water would be shut off overnight. We had to get up for a flight at 4:00AM so i called the desk to have them send up a couple bottles of water for the morning clean-up etc. They refused stating they do not provide this level of service and suggested we could store water in the bath tub. I spoke to the manager and got a simular answer. Overall Circus Circus is affordable, but you get slightly less than what you pay for here.

Reviews.Title: “Horribale Expericence yea circus circus is an circus act..a joke”
Reviews.Author: VENNUMLAWS2010
Reviews.Content: This was by far the worst hotel ive ever stayed in all off Las vegas ..I have experienced better service and quality at a few of the smaller motels there..Circus Circus should really be ashamed of the service and facility..oh and did i mention there were bed bugs ...ugh..my son loved adventuredome,,however i felt they were a little rude. and dont be fooled by the rooms tower,west or sunrise they all look like crap and there is no cable tv false advertisement.. the whole facility smelles lika mountians of ols smoke..i will never bring my children there again..

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad experience, but I wouldn't stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: CrisiManley
Reviews.Content: We didn't have a horrible experience at Circus Circus, but I definitely would not stay here again. First of all, the hotel is located at the very end of the strip. It is really out of the way compared to most of the hotels and attractions that one goes to Vegas to see. The hotel is starting to look quite run down compared to all of the other hotels on the strip as well. The old saying, "you get what you pay for," definitely applies to Circus Circus. There were some very questionable, dark red stains on the floor and lamp in our room. My husband commented that it looked like a clown may have been murdered in our room. The hotel also had problems with the alarm system going off throughout the middle of the night. If you are bringing your children to Vegas, this is the hotel for you. There are circus shows every hour or so on the Midway. There is a great carnival/fair style Midway where your children can spend all of your money trying to win cheap prizes. I actually enjoyed the Midway more than anything else at the hotel. The biggest plus to Circus Circus is that it is located next to Slots of Fun. If you are cheap (like me), you can get in on $2 Blackjack tables. The downside is that it smells like a mixture of Subway (the restaurant is next door) and an old roller skate.

Reviews.Title: “Worth upgrading from manor rooms to tower rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Meegzi
Reviews.Content: Checking in was a nightmare - this place really is a circus. We had to drag all our luggage out in the heat over the road all the way to the manor rooms by the RV park only to walk in to shabby rooms that looked like a very cheap hotel. There were no restaurants or facilities in the manor rooms area you had to walk in the heat back over to the main hotel to get anything other than a vending machine item. The front desk were very unhelpful with anything we needed help with - we had to ask to see the manager a few times to actually get anywhere with any questions we had. We upgraded to a west tower room for around $30 extra a night. This made such a difference the rooms were lovely and had a really great view. Would only recommend this hotel if you are not staying in the ratty manor rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Like a movie set”
Reviews.Author: annam85
Reviews.Content: I love Vegas and I love this hotel. It's the cheapest on the strip and provides large, clean, comfortable rooms. The hotel in general, in comparison to others on the Strip, is, admittedly slightly dated but the atmosphere is great, especially if you are travelling with kids. The free circus acts are impressive and are open to guests and visitors. Adventuredome and the entrance are excellent. The hotel looks like a movie set (like much of Vegas) and there is always something to see. There is a handy monorail to take lazy people from the back to the front of the hotel; this was actually quite fun to ride. Food wise, Americans serve a lot of food!! Not the tastiest or the best quality in Circus Circus, but the buffet is well presented and extremely good value. We never felt the need to have lunch, we just relied on the extensive morning and evening buffet fix. If you get bored of Circus Circus, the Riviera (just across the street) provides a (slight) change of scenery. I’ve stayed at this hotel a couple of times now and wouldn’t hesitate to come back for any occasion.

Reviews.Title: “the only casino that doesn't send any thing to you after your stay”
Reviews.Author: 34731Patriots
Reviews.Content: you are the only casino that has not sent anything in the mail after a stay. i have been to many casinos downtown and the strip and they always have sent something. i spend a lotof money and sometimes i dont,but a least everyone else has sent free room nights.reduced room nights and buffet or meal vouchers. not you. do you have to spend millions at your place to receive offers thomas r. jones west palm beach fl 33415

Reviews.Title: “Best fun for kids”
Reviews.Author: minklem
Reviews.Content: Circus circus hotel is best if you are travelling with kids to vegas!! It has big arcade with all kind of new games and attractions.They also have indoor amusement park which is great. So according to me its the best for kids!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but getting old”
Reviews.Author: mark2600
Reviews.Content: Given the rate the hotel was OK but don't expect much more then basic accomodation. We were not impressed by the spring beds and the breakfast buffet remembered me of campus restaurants but other then that the rooms were OK and the kids enjoyed the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Remember, you get exactly what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: mskelbj
Reviews.Content: Circus Circus offers great rates for those of us that travel on a budget. However, you really do get what you pay for...so when you pay 21.95 for a room, please don't expect the staff working at the desk or in the restuarants to be courtesy, the carpets in the rooms to be clean or to sleep in a room free of tiny red ants. However, to the credit of management, every effort was made to fix each situation. Including a refund of five day resort fee to replace the toothbrushes that were covered in ants, an upgrade to a main tower room(still dirty carpets!) and complimentary buffett for 8. Bottom line, pay an extra $20 or so and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor service”
Reviews.Author: kdm2201
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so big and so cheap that you shouldn't expect much. The room was a little larger than most and mostly clean but the service was really horrible. It is also so far from the main strip that you need to plan a way to get around, which is easy to do. The pool is very pathetic.

Reviews.Title: “My last stay at Circus Circus”
Reviews.Author: SuperTeacher2
Reviews.Content: My main reason for staying at Circus Circus was quick access to the Adventuredome. Having my 12, 14, and 15 year boys with me meant that I would need to keep them entertained without cramping their style. Circus Circus seemed like the place for us since I felt comfortable letting them go the Adventuredome on their own as long as I was in the same hotel and could easily check up on them. In early June I went online and booked a 2 night stay in the west tower. The website listed the west tower rooms as having been recently renovated, and the website pictures depicted a decent looking room. So at 12:30 pm on Wednesday July 21 we showed up at Circus Circus with a carload of stuff (we're staying in Vegas at 3 different hotels over a 12 day span) only to find that Valet parking was full and we would have to carry our things into the hotel without any assistance. Once we found a parking spot in garage 2 (a good 5 minute walk to the check -in desk) I grabbed as much as I could from our car and stood in the check-in line while my boys made another 2 trips to the car to bring all of our things into the hotel. The check-in line was quite long and only 4 check-in clerks (but about 15 EMPTY check-in stations!) were on hand to check people in. After waiting about 30 minutes in the check in line, we were given our key to our west tower room on the 16th floor. Upon entering our room I noticed that the curtains were closed and thus it was quite dark. At the time I thought that it was weird, but I now believe that it was done intentionally so that the stains on the carpet and chair wouldn't be noticed. And believe me-there were ALOT of stains. The worst was the bathroom. It looked liked somebody was dying their hair and splattered dark brown dye all over the walls. Even the word "disgusting" is an understatement. We decided to suck it up and just try to stay in the room as little as possible. I realize that Circus Circus is a family-oriented hotel, however I was amazed at all of the families that had babies with them. I felt bad for all of those parents that were trying to navigate through the smokey, packed hotel and casino with a baby stroller. However, is Las Vegas really a place that you want to bring an infant to? Getting around Circus Circus is hard enough without having a stroller! The place is seriously packed from about 10 am to 10 pm. In summation I would have to say that this was the last time I will ever stay at Circus Circus again. The fact that they charge more for the "newly renovated" west tower rooms is a joke and only makes me wonder about how bad the other rooms are,

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and we had a lot of fun”
Reviews.Author: Wildman_Aussie
Reviews.Content: I get really tired of all the blah blah blah bad comments from people that have payed $22 per night for a hotel in Las vegas and expect 5 star service and 5 star rooms. Read some of the other comments and you will see what I mean HELLO - you are paying $22 per night!!! We stayed at CC 3 times over 2 weeks and loved it. Yes check-in is a nightmare. With prices so low (even during peak season) it was running at 100% and there are a lot of rooms so every room was being turned over every day = lots of people checking in The layout of the hotel sucks too. But you will quickly find your way around. Getting lost is part of the fun as you will find stuff that you otherwise wouldnt have found anyway. We had 3 rooms in 2 towers during our visits and none of them really had a view to die for. We considered the expensive rooms which we virtually double the price of our cheaper rooms but couldnt really justify it (one of our party had one and it was nicer but we put the money towards meals and fun stuff instead) The hourly circus shows are great. They only run for 5 min or so but they have some top notch performers!!! The kids love this place. So much to do and see. The pool was OK too. Again low expectations and you will be happy. The adventure dome was great fun. Lots of fun to be had. Make sure you use the vouchers from the discount book you get on checkin! Great range of restaurants to choose from. Keep an eye out for the sprukers and you will pick up some discount vouchers which make them even better value. Again if you dont expect 5 start service and you will be fine. I think it is great that CC is offering these great value rooms as it makes LV so more accessible for people that might not otherwise be able to afford it!. The place is busy and it feels alive. My sister was staying at Mirage an dyes it was very fancy but it completely lacked the atmosphere that CC offered (but cost $250 per night) The rooms are a little old and a little tired and yes the air conditioner might make a little noise but please find another hotel on the strip in las vegas for $22 per night and tell me where - I dont think it is there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a "User Friendly" Place”
Reviews.Author: traveler160097
Reviews.Content: Never having been to Las Vegas before, we made reservations at Circus Circus for 2 nights following a beautiful trip to Yosemite, Sequoia and Death Valley. We picked C C because we were traveling with our 15 year old son and wanted something "kid friendly". We had a tower room which was reasonably clean. The nightmare part is trying to find parking in the garage, and trying to find your way around the property. Much of the place looks run down. Our son enjoyed the rides in the Adventuredome, but the rest was disappointing. We set out to find the pool, and after poor directions from several employees, gave up upon encountering yet another low ceilinged, dirty corridor, leading to yet another slow, dirty, hot elevator. We stayed one night instead of two, as the thought of staying another night was revolting. Granted, part of the issue may be that we're just not the Vegas type, but I've got to believe there are nicer properties out there, where a person can find their way around without a map or a GPS when roaming the corridors. We were given an inadequate property map at check in, but it was unhelpful. Note: If you're traveling by car and used to storing some food in the fridge-there is no in-room fridge or microwave. Staff was just civil-certainly no warm welcomes here! We couldn't leave fast enough!

Reviews.Title: “Ill keep this short. The hotel is well...”
Reviews.Author: kilo0tango
Reviews.Content: Ill keep this short. The hotel is well worth the money. I read a lot of reviews where people complained about everything so I was apprehensive about staying here but it is great. Our room reservation did get messed up but the front desk was very helpful and they took care of the problem. They also gave us some extra coupons for the trouble. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nothing more”
Reviews.Author: Peter140
Reviews.Content: Rooms where not of the highest standard. Broken toilet and a shower you couldnt trust, both were fixec promptly when i told the personnel. Employees where quite serviceminded and polite. Do not recommend this hotel unless you want to spend your money on other things than hotel room. Casino was ok, barely. Breakfast ok. The Steak House was nice though.

Reviews.Title: “Was a good cheap introduction to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Been_seen_done_it_al
Reviews.Content: Its ion the strip, its great for families! Really thats about it - if you are looking for the Vegas experience I wouldn't say here - its cheesey, cheap and a little run down. You can always find good deals in Vegas on teh strip hotels, but if you are looking for a cheap first time in Vegas this is ok. Afterall you are not in yoru room very much in Vegas anyhow. Its definately not the MGM or the Belagio - but it did for a bed for a few nights with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaKaren
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms in the supposed newly upgraded towers. I don't know when they were upgraded but it didn't appear to have been recently. The bathroom door wouldn't close all the way, wallpaper was coming off the walls in the bathroom and the sleeping room, the carpet was so stained, the outside windows were filthy (although I don't know how they' be able to clean windows so far up), there were condom wrappers and layers of dust under the bed and behind the headboard. We ate at the Garden Grill in the hotel and the food was NOT GOOD. The prices were high which would indicate high quality food but the food was very low quality although the portions were large. One in our party had spaghetti and even that wasn't good. How can you ruin spaghetti? The Garden Grill restaurant was way TOO cold and made us want to scarf our food just to get out before we froze. The first time we stayed here, we ate at the all you can eat buffet and discovered the food had much to be desired (despite the higher price at the time) and our second trip here confirmed that you should not eat at Circus Circus.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Jodublin
Reviews.Content: We brought my Mom to Las Vegas for her 60th Birthday in November. We live in Ireland so it was a long trip. We stayed in The Manor. The queue for Check in was long but it moved eventually. The rooms were basic but clean and tidy. The decor was old fashioned but the room was looked ok. Housekeeping came every day and the room was cleaned to a good standard. If I was staying again in Circus Circus I would stay in the towers as the rooms are nicer. Having said that we had no problems with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: ByWalk
Reviews.Content: Circus Circus is a very good hotel to stay in Vegas for budget travellers. Its located right on the Strip. I think its room rates are the most affordable than any property on the strip. This is basically a no frills hotel with affordable rates. The rooms are clean and spacious though the staff is average. The room rent do not include any meals.There are eating joints (McDonalds etc.) surrounding this hotel , so you can manage there. The bus stop is in front of the hotel which is very useful for moving on the Strip. I do not gamble so cannot comment upon its casino. Free shows in this hotel is Circus and its a must watch. The show starts in every one and half hour. Kids would really love that. Have a happy stay at Circus Circus , las vegas. Cheers , By Walk

Reviews.Title: “dont stay here if you plAn on having a nice time in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: cl1642
Reviews.Content: wehad to be moved to 3 different rooms due to mix-ups, cleanliness, broken a/c, clogged sink, burnt out lightbulbs, and housekeeping takes it upon themselves to turn off your a/c in 110 weather when u leave your room! One of the women who runs an arcade game was rude and tossed prizes to my 2 kids! we tried talking to several diffrent managers in the hotel, our compensation was a buy one get one free arcade game!!!! we were treated like we were trying to con them! DONT STAY AT THIS HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the bed bugs bite...”
Reviews.Author: mirbear
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Circus Circus the night of June 27. The customer service was awful we asked for a crib when we reserved the room and when we checked in at 9 pm. We didnt get it til 12:45 am... after we called for it several times. i had even explained to them that my son hs epilepsy, g-tube and really needs his rest. My husband had grabbed a hotel towel to wipe his mouth after brushing his teeth and didn't because the towel was disguisting... To top it all off Monday after checking out my daughter Lexi showed me some bug bites. I had never seen this type of bite but I wasn't worried. Lexi kept complaining about them all day long. They turned out being bed bugs that they brought home with them... I had to pay for an exterminator, doctor's visit, and some ointments. I am very upset about the whole situation. I had stayed at Circus Circus in the past and had always had a good experience. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again will I stay here”
Reviews.Author: treetop5600
Reviews.Content: As soon as my wife and I walked through the door we could smell a musty smell. The first room we got was dirty (not vacuumed and furniture had stains- what I could only guess). Second room was cleaner, but mattress was so worn or old that laying near the edge generated a slope that would put you on the floor. We set the AC to the highest setting, yet the hallway was cooler than the room when we returned to the room later that evening. Carpeting was wrinkled, torn and thread-bare in spots in hallway and lobby. This is an old hotel that has obviously not been maintained well. During the rest of our 3 day stay we inspected other hotels to see where we would stay in the future. We did not find one other hotel as worn down as Circus Circus. When you check out, most places will ask how your stay was or was everything satisfactory. Not here. That tells you something. They either already know the answer or they just don't care.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing's free In Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: MoNate77
Reviews.Content: Rock & Ritas sucks! Upon Check in my wife and sister in law and our 9 childeren recieved "Kids Eat Free" coupons at th new bar and restuarant Rock&Ritas, we also got buy one get one free drinks. The whiskey was watered down and the kids didn't free. our bill was $268, The burgers are better at Carls Jr, much cheaper too! The only Upside to this place is the Adventure Dome, TAKE THIS ADVICE, Stay somewhere else, eat at hooters, then take your kids to the Adventure Dome. I'll never stay at circus circus again!

Reviews.Title: “You need a good luck to get a clean room! Bad customer service!”
Reviews.Author: meili1123
Reviews.Content: Last year, we booked 2 rooms at Circus Circus Las Vegas through Vegas.com. On that day, we arrived at Circus Circus arount 2pm. We got rooms in 20 minutes after standing in check-in line, however, both rooms were so disappointed with bad smell and soaking wet carpet! I called front desk but they didn’t do anything to help us, so I had to leave 5 kids and their grand mom in the room and took 15 minutes to run to the front desk for help. I told the front desk staff that we reserved a non-smoking room, but got a room with strong smoking smell. They told me they can’t control guests smoking in the room. They gave me another 2 rooms, however, these 2 rooms were also have strong smoking smell. It took me another 30 minutes to run to the front desk and ask for room switch again. This time they told me they can’t switch us to any other rooms, because we have switch rooms once and it will increase the cost for cleaning the room. What?! They kept on give me the terrible rooms and reject to gave us non-smoking rooms! This is not fair! After running back and forth for almost an hour, I was very very mad when I heard them say this!! I tried to argue with the staff in the front desk, but they just don’t care!! Finally, I asked them to call manager to talk with me. Here comes the even worse staff!! The manager told me, “IF YOU ARE NOT HAPPY, YOU SHOULD GO TO STAY AT OTHER HOTEL!!” I couldn’t believe what I have heard!! With 5 kids and an senior in such a hot weather, it’s not easy for me. That’s why I made a reservation before going to Las Vegas!! I said, “Kicking out of the unsatisfied customers is what you do for customer service? Shame on you!! What your name? Please write it down, because I am going to send a letter to the hotel headquarter!” After he wrote down his name, I kept on saying, “I am very disappointed that circus circus treats their loyal customers! We came here almost every other years for the past 6 years, and this time I am totally disappointed! I told my kids that we will never come back to Circus Circus again! Maybe your hotel won’t be broken if we’ve never come, however, I will write my story in every review website! I am very disappointed!~” After hearing what I just said, he didn’t apologize, but upgrade our rooms in the nearest West Tower. However, the first 2 rooms he gave me were un-cleaned! What a shame! I had to run to the front desk again. The fun thing is he was very surprised that he told me, “The computer shows the rooms were cleaned!” Hello! There must be some problems going on between room service and front desk customer service!! Such a terrible management!! This time he gave me another 2 upgarded rooms and even sent some lady to go with me to check the rooms!! Don’t believer me? Search yourself, man! Finally, after 2 hours of hassle, we got the rooms which is stay-able! I was so tired!

Reviews.Title: “Old Rooms Showing their Age... Kids GALORE...”
Reviews.Author: boB M
Reviews.Content: This place is more a discount Vegas casino for people with kids. It's got a very cheap motel feel to the rooms. Though my room was very spacious. The place is very confusing to get around as there's building after building which are marked, but with all the casino lights you can easily miss the markings. Parking can be pretty atrocious! My bed had a blanket with cigarette burns even though it was a non-smoking room. The mattresses were below average in quality. The drapes were old and one was broken & missing the pull rod. There weren't many outlets near the beds for CPAP or other devices. Shower had great pressure but the tub drain didn't drain well so you ended up standing in water. The TV is SMALL. Internet access is speedy enough (In the skyline tower anyway). The restaurants are fairly good-Cheap all-you-can-eat prime rib at the Garden Grill was pretty amazing. If you're a single or couple without kids I wouldn't recommend this place. It's just full of kids and not really that comfortable. The elevators sometimes had a LONG wait.

Reviews.Title: “bad staff”
Reviews.Author: cricheson
Reviews.Content: fist of all as i was checking in, the staff never greeted me instead all i got was an empty glare. when i asked what i needed to check in, she told me in a disgusted mannor, well you should allready know that. Like i was a mind reader or something. so i decided to wing it and gaver both my ID and credit card and again i got chewed out because the room was prepaid and my credit card was not needed. however when she checked us in, she wanted my card back which i allready handed her, for incidental charges. so it goes on when i finally got checked in i had difficulty finding my room so i went to the information desk and they sent me to the wrong tower took me another 30 mins just to find it. at this time i was wishing i was somewhere else. overall the hotel is quite ok but they really need better staff.

Reviews.Title: “Well past it's sell by date”
Reviews.Author: EnglandTanky
Reviews.Content: Very sad and old, rooms are clean but that is about all you could say in it's favour. Corridors are dirty and gloomy and rooms are very out dated, with missing bulbs and plugs etc. Rumoured to be closing soon, cannot close soon enough in my view. Leave it alone.

Reviews.Title: “Third time I've returned”
Reviews.Author: MAB1974
Reviews.Content: Rooms are great, but it is the valuefor money that I retuned for. However, this time, I also stayed further down the strip in one of the newer hotels. If you book these in advance they are better value for money than my truste Circus Circus. Not sure I'd stay here again unless I was on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Check-out a 'circus' at Circus Circus”
Reviews.Author: indfo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very ordinary compared to the hotels around on the strip. But it surely is value for money. The hotel smells a little of smoke all around, but the non-smoking rooms are quite fresh. I landed in early and much before the check-in time. They were not too courteous and asked me to come in later after handing over some reservation slip. They were unable to trace my reservation slip when I went in again at the check-in time. Eventually managed to check-in after paying lot of tips (demanded) around which felt more like a bribe! I picked the Manor rooms and they were huge and airy. For a 25$ price per night its more than value for money :) The casino inside is average. Most of them are 1c slots. Some circus shows are great and even better that they are free! To reach the manor rooms its a long long walk though the casino and the circus area. If the hotel is not a pre-paid reservation, then ensure you dedicate 1 hour to do your checkout! Even at 3 in the night I saw huge 10-15 people queue to checkout!!! I was really happy I never had to stand in that queue! All said about the hotel, the biggest negative is that its totally at the end of the strip and if you are not on your own in terms of travel (car/bike) you will end up lot of time waiting for a bus or spend insane on taxis!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: bowseywowsey
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel four times this year and I love it. Admittedly its not the best hotel on the strip but the staff are friendly the services are great, I love the $3 slot machines (especially if I win) and the reward scheme is great I got three free nights and lots of free meals on my stay. The lobby needs updating and other than the tower rooms the rooms are dark and need updating but they are clean and the maids are very helpful, polite and clean. If you want a cheap hotel in a relaxed atmosphere this is the place to stay, I have also stayed with my teenage children and they love the hotel midway. I have stayed at other hotels on the strip previously but always go back to circus circus due to the relaxed atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Our e-Ltr of Thanks to Circus Circus head of promotions”
Reviews.Author: iamjewelsmom
Reviews.Content: Mr. Hutchins, My husband and I wanted to write and extend our thanks for a wonderful stay at your Circus Circus property, June 11-14, 2010. We were already planning a trip to Las Vegas in June to attend a bridge club tournament at the Riviera and when we received in the mail a complimentary three-night stay room offer and generous comp free play at Circus Circus. It had been some time since we've been to Circus Circus, and we had never stayed at your property before. It's to be noted that friends of ours received comp rooms at the Sahara (for two nights) as did we, however, having stayed at the Sahara before, my husband and I opted for Circus Circus instead. It was more than apparent we made the right choice. When we called to book our room, the customer service rep. was polite and considerate. We requested a smoke- free quiet room... away from busy corridors, elevators and ice machines. They set us up at the farthest end of a hallway on the 22nd floor which was perfect. The wait at Circus Circus' registration was 20 minutes, but the counter person said we were VIP guests and could have stood in the shorter line had we wanted to. The sign posting for "check out" and "VIP" check in appeared to be the same line, so we were reluctant to stand in it and then have to return to the 20 minute line as well (lessons learned for next time). We were pleased to see that our accommodations were modern, beautifully decorated, clean and comfortable. The only issue we had was the room was still being cleaned when we checked in (between 5pm - 6pm). We would like to acknowledge the customer service support we received from Mimi Arrigoni at the Players' Club. It was excellent! She took the time to explain to us the new comp system (and its benefits) and even came out from behind the counter to illustrate how to download our points to a machine. She patiently answered all our questions and encouraged us to return to talk with her if we encountered any difficulties. This level of customer service far exceeded expectations and encourages us to return again to Circus Circus. We were delighted to see generous food comp points on our card as well. We enjoyed eating at least five times over our stay at your various on-site restaurants, all of which were above average in quality, selection, and service. Our bridge partners, on the other hand, were not happy with their dated accommodations at the Sahara [e.g., & dreary room, bad view, low water pressure, small 19" wide-back TV that couldn't be seen from across the room, lights that didn't work, etc.]. We waited with them while they checked in at the Sahara. Their line was 35 minutes long, and when the keycard didn't work in the room door, they were instructed by the bell boy to stand back in the line to resolve the problem. I addition, their generic comp offers had so many limitations on them, the one coupon they attempted to use took three visits to the players club and still they did not get the comp promised. Our only concern with the Circus Circus property was the access from the parking garage / gaming level to the "mall level" (near the amusement park). It was not handicap accessible. We noticed many elderly guests struggling to maneuver the steps from the lower gaming area to the store/vendor/eatery area. This area did have additional steps to one side (along a wall) that could and should be modified to add a wheelchair ramp. Again, thank you for sending us the complimentary stay offer. We welcome any further offers and will surely want to visit Circus Circus again in the future. Regards, The Mundts, Los Alamos NM

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: MEXTRIPS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at CC from April 25-29 after we booked for Tower King Room 4th Night Free. We payed only usd 20 per night and the room was clean but small, NO bathtub. Last year CC didn't charge us the resort (?) fee but this year they did charge us usd 5.25 per night per room at the check out without warning us at the check in moment. We didn't use Internet access or did any Phone calls or get any Welcome amenities. This is our Last time we book with CC because there are several much better options for a few dollars more.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, Would definately come back.”
Reviews.Author: superfrijolote
Reviews.Content: After reading the horror stories from people who obviously think that $30 bucks will get them a luxury suite at the Palazzo, I was very nervous about the package that I had already purchased thru Southwest Vacations. I was pleasantly surprised that this place is not the horrible resort that people complain about. The free circus acts are very entertaining. The casino is clean. There are parts of the resort that are dated but for the most part this place is ideal for families looking for a bargain. Our room is in the West Tower and I have no complaints. It is clean, air conditioned, flat screen TV, two queen beds, and has clean towels. This resort is geared towards families with children so there are a lot of kids but that is to be expected. I would not recommend staying in the Manor due to its location to the rest of the facilities. The Manor also looks quite run down. All in all, this has been a great week for our family at Circus Circus and I would definately come back.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Tiana21
Reviews.Content: Check in was long and irritating! To make up for this we received a free room upgrade to the west tower so that helped. Room was clean and comfortable. West tower is newly renovated. The carpet and also the furniture could use a deep cleaning. Comforter on the bed was dirty and had a long string of blond hair on it! yuck. This is a mixed review because not everything was bad. I won about five hundred bucks so that was awesome! We stayed from 6/15-6/19 and won money everyday. has a really good payout in the casino. One thing I hated was being stalked by the staff and asked if I wanted to receive free gifts to listen to future vacation presentations! Im on vacation so of course that annoyed me and my husband! Save your money before you eat at the buffet. Food isnt that great and I think you could find better. The hotel is at the end of the strip so if you want to be in the middle of the action dont stay here. This is a great place for kids but I think it needs some serious maintenance and upgrades! Would I stay at Circus again......absolutely NOT! great price but in the end you pay the price and you get what you pay for. A couple of extra dollars and you could stay at a much better hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A Great base to explore a wild city that never sleeps”
Reviews.Author: Charles235
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Vegas as part of a 3 centre holiday with Virgin, and what a good start to the best holiday ever. We had heard good and bad reports of circus circus, but found it to be totally suitable for our needs, after all we only used the room to sleep in. The rooms were lovely and clean and big, the hotel itself a bit of a maze and not as plush as others on the strip, but we soon found our way around, and with the bus stopping right outside slots of fun which is joined onto the hotel, it is a great base. Don't do what we did and walk the first day, everything looks a lot closer than what it is, and when you reach a hotel, it can take another quarter an hour to walk inside, we were knackered and should have had the 3day pass for the bus from the start which worked out cheaper than the 6 dollars daily, get your ticket from the machine by the bus stop before boarding as the bus doesn't always take cash. We had planned exactly what we were going to do before we went which saved a lot of time as we wanted to see as much as we could in four days, we bought the "American Casino Guide" from Amazon around £10 and went through all the free money off vouchers. "We used one to see the festival show at Balleys saving us 112 dollars for the best seats and what a show, a traditional Las Vegas show with dancers in large feathered headresses, i would certainly recommend it. We booked the Grand Canyon helicopter tour with Sundance Helicopters before we left the UK, we found an offer on the internet and they confirmed pick up time with us at reception when we arrived, a must, we were picked up in a limo landed in the canyon and had a champagne picnic. Vegas is mad and unreal, but somewhere everyone should visit in a lifetime, one advice I would give is wear comfortable walking shoes, you will need them.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place in Las Vegas for Stay with Kids”
Reviews.Author: Vibhu96
Reviews.Content: Ideal location at the end of the strip. Convention centre is at the walking distance. Multiple reastaurant ,Shops and relaxation options. Good Value for money. Long Quee for check in at the peak time. Circus events and multiple casions are the main attraction of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Sandeep108
Reviews.Content: Everything seemed fine on their website. I also checked tripadvisor and it generally had a fair rating. The rates seemed too good to be true - and alas they were. I simply did not like it. I chose it mostly since we were together as a family and I thought the kids would enjoy it. But it is simply too crowded (worse than the strip even). They gave us rooms in the Skyrise Tower and one simply has to walk miles to get anywhere within the hotel or to the strip. It is at one end of the strip so if you don't have a car, you really have to walk a lot. The rooms were ok, normal hotel rooms, but they faced out into the utility area and as a result the entire day and night the noise level was absolutely terrible. It was like sleeping with a vacuum cleaner running all the time!!! Out of 4 lamps in the room, 3 did not work! We had to wait an hour before somebody came and fixed 1 with a promise of getting the other 2 fixed, which did not happen. Since we did an early check-in, I immediately asked for other rooms to which they said the entire hotel was full? The swimming pool was also quite pathetic. Since we were there for only a day or two, we just sort of put up with it. The food joints in the hotel were also quite terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Fine!”
Reviews.Author: Honeyjj
Reviews.Content: We were put off this hotel before we stayed but it really was fine. The rooms are very big, and every 45 minutes there are circus acts performing in the casino which is great. Lots of kids around but you don't have to stay in your hotel anyway its just a bed for the night. We were put in one of the blocks behind the hotel which was quite a walk so maybe request a room in the tower when checking in. Overall I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away at any cost.”
Reviews.Author: EmmaCabs
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here on the last part of our holiday. We had previously been in San Francisco and LA. Circus Circus is quite possibly the worst hotel I have ever stayed in (and i've been on a few cheap 18-30 holidays!). The stench as soon as you walk in is overwhelming and continues throughout the whole hotel. Originally we were placed in a 'manor' room. I cannot describe how horrible this room was; stained shower curtains, brown stained towels...i could go on. We complained about this and got moved to another room in the Skyrise Tower at an expense of $50. Basically we were moved to the same room but 20 floors up minus a fridge and working a/c. We persevered with this room, with the faulty a/c, with the smell, rubbish view, lack of fridge and terrible tv. The rest of the hotel appears to be provided to rip off its customers. The restaurants contained within in are way over-priced for the food they are providing as are the tatty shops and bars. We wouldn't have minded paying the price if you were getting a good service. From start to finish this hotel was a nightmare I would not recommend it to anyone not even my worst enemy. During our trip we visited downtown las vegas and the stratosphere etc (which are further up the strip) and even these hotels appeared far superior to Circus Circus and didnt smell like they hadn't been cleaned in 100 years! If you are unfortunate enough to have to stay here be prepared to pay for the safe in your room and a 15 minute walk negotiating prams and thousands of screaming children before you reach the entrance. Also the hotel, which has two enormous towers of rooms, provides two pools. Not two large pools, two medium sized pools surrounded by a road with no privacy what-so-ever. So much so that on one ocassion there was a 'peeping tom' looking through the fence at poeple bathing. Before visiting I read the reviews and thought oh it can't be that bad, but it is. Hopefully this review makes your mind up!

Reviews.Title: “OK Stay”
Reviews.Author: niftyfifty44876
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for-and I was looking for value and I got that and then some. The Hotel needs some major, major renovations. Our room was clean and comfortable and the service was excellent. All employees were great. However, the hawking going on as you walk anywhere in the hotel is terrible. I don't want to have hand lotion squeezed on my hands, be hassled for show tickets, or asked if I want free coupons to their bar. In fact, get rid of this stuff altogether! I hate being hassled. The carnival midway was the same experience for my boys, hawking and being offered free stuff. They just wanted to play games and have fun. The first evening we arrived the elevators has two juice bottles thrown in them and the floor of the elevator was so dirty it looked as if PIg Pen from the Peanuts comic strip had visited. Each elevator we got on was extremely dirty too. The towels in the bathrooms were old and tattered-ick. I don't expect the ritz for the price we paid but I do expect towels without holes. Avoid this place if you can afford to.

Reviews.Title: “With that Price, it is OK”
Reviews.Author: MapleLeafsfanforever
Reviews.Content: Just spent a few nights in Circus Circus. The hotel is getting old and needs lots of upgrades. But I got a deal on web for $23 CAD per night. So with that price, the hotel is OK. If you get a good deal in other newer hotels, I will suggest you to go for those newer hotels

Reviews.Title: “It's nothing to shout about”
Reviews.Author: nathan-rachel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for night on our way to Grand Canyon. We got upgraded for free to a deluxe room which was nice and big, view of a brick wall from the window, but we did get a free upgrade so I'm not complaining about that. The hotel is quiet far away from everywhere else on the strip and I found there was loads of kids here (why on earth you would take kids to Vegas is beyond me). It looked a bit old and tired, but it was good for the price. Some good value restaurants inside but we didn't eat there. I wouldn't go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job”
Reviews.Author: Lillaa28
Reviews.Content: Not a bad place to stay at all, we made the mistake of not thinking to ask for a non smoking floor so had a night in a very bad stale cigarette smelling room, next day asked at reception for a change and they were more than happy to comply.

Reviews.Title: “$ 40 Per Night”
Reviews.Author: rmsons
Reviews.Content: Its steal very nice to stay in in $ 40 per night really its steal

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus”
Reviews.Author: Tacpatriot
Reviews.Content: Check-in went well. There was a paper straw wrapper on the floor going into the bathroom, very tiny black curly hairs on the toilet seat, the light did not work and there was not a safe in the room. They said that they just started taking the safes out and would move me to another room if they had one. My stuff was stored with the casino cashier except for the computer that I value. I booked the room with the safe to store my computer. Staff was moving about quickly cleaning rooms and the front desk did tell me that twenty five groups were coming in with people and that Circus Circus was totally booked for the weekend. I was told that a privacy sign on the door would keep housekeeping from calling me about cleaning, but was later told otherwise when I contacted the front desk housekeeping and told them no calls. There was a line at the Cashier cage without an exit (June 11th) and people had to squeeze by and make contact with others. I had my big bag and did not want to bump or be bumped so I took the little rail down as two or three people thought it was a good idea until the lady started giving a gentleman behind me a difficult inquisition. The gentleman said that it made the most sense to have an entrance and exit but the lady acted like it was the end of the world in a civil way. I thought the single Cashier cage lady was not a reflection of the other polite and hospitable workers that I had previously met at the cage. Circus Circus is like a large compound with some 3744 rooms or so. I am not in the Towers but the manor which has had a lot of people go through it. People in the next room were jovial and quietly carrying on until around ten and then the floor was asleep. Security patrolled the grounds with good numbers. All the staff appeared to be very hospitable and polite. The towers might be a option if I stay here again. I was riding on the bus and some people staying at Circus Circus stated that someone identified themselves as the manager and needed their credit card information as their card did not process. The guests said that they gave their information over the phone and started seeing various charges. The charges were for AllState, T-Mobile, a domestic flight and others. The guest said that the management was doing everything that they could with law enforcement. The staff here is pretty nice and the place is such a surprise due to the amount of business that goes on within this semi-contained resort.

Reviews.Title: “If you really want to go to Vegas don't stay at Circus Circus”
Reviews.Author: Candletravels
Reviews.Content: After being really excited about our first trip to Vegas checking into Circus Circus bought us back down to earth with a bump. We weren't expecting pure luxury but this hotel really is like a naff holiday camp with 3000+ bedrooms dumped on the top. Check in was ok, the service received was at the level you expect from a check out in your local supermarket but it was reasonably fast and we were ushered off to our room fairly quickly. Having read other reviews we knew that our "Manor room" was not likely to impress but it's fair to say it was one of the most depressing hotel rooms we've stayed in. Positives - the room was big and acceptably clean but the negatives were that all the furniture was in a really bad state of repair, both the fridge and air had to be turned off at night because of the noise and the view from our window was a bush. The corridors and lobby area smelt of years and years of cigarette smoke and this gave such a bad first impression. The poor cleaning staff were vacuuming on a daily basis but I think the only thing worth doing with the carpet was burning it. We braved a few of the restaurants in the hotel but only at times when we were too tired to go out or it was too hot to venture outdoors. The pizza place was fine, the Market Grill was ok, service a bit hit and miss but the food was ok. The buffet however was simply awful, I knew we weren’t off to a great start when we had to follow a lady carrying flag to be seated but the entire restaurant area smelt of wet dog and the food tasteless and overcooked. Couldn't get out of there quickly enough. If your looking for some of the Vegas sparkle, don't expect to find it at Circus Circus.

Reviews.Title: “For the money, perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Sarah818
Reviews.Content: We are travelling the US on a budget and this Casino is perfect for that. Located on the Strip, with a quick Deuce bus down to the other Casinos (although we had a few long waits). We booked a motel room but luckily got comped a tower room, which was much nicer and had everything we needed. The restaurants are again fine. We didn't try the famous steakhouse due to the price, but everything else filled us up and was reasonable. The Casino itself is catered to families, with circus acts playing everyday. If we went back, we would probably save a bit more to stay somewhere a bit more plush, but for the money conscience this is great.

Reviews.Title: “entertaining”
Reviews.Author: bntlav25
Reviews.Content: my nieces loved the fun and the joy rides. they could not get over the excitement of endless games and entertainment, the kiddie shows, the kiddie rides and the food after all the fun. the hotel is worth recommending for families with children, you will get your money´s worth just watching the kids get the fun of their life.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Andyrobot
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel 10 times now, I recommend the west tower rooms and if possible go during the week when there are less people and the rates are cheaper. There is a lot of choice in Vegas, but this one fits into my budget perfectly and meets my expectations .Don't forget you want the West Tower rooms.

Reviews.Title: “For value Circus Circus does it for me!”
Reviews.Author: TravelMacLondon
Reviews.Content: Given my daughter and her boyfriend were staying just down the road in the Wynn, which is a luxury hotel on the strip, then I was able to compare what I was getting in terms of quality, service, location and overall value for money, against what they were getting. So lets get things straight Circus Circus does not sell itself as being a high end luxury hotel nor does it set out to compete with these high end hotels situated down the strip but that does not mean you lose out on everything. I stayed in a West Tower Deluxe King size room and it was fine. The room was clean and large and the staff were friendly and very helpful. The room was cleaned every day. Just make a note that you do not book a manor room which is basically a motel type lodge building away from the main hotel, and then there is the West Tower rooms (where I stayed), which are at the back of Circus Circus so a 5 min walk from the lobby to the main street, or there is the main tower rooms which are in the middle of the resort complex approx 2 mins from the main street. Some people have reported extended wait times to check in. I think this is all to do with timing and whether you get there just before a large crowd arrives to check in ahead of you or you arrive at the hotel during a quiet time. I got there with only 3 people in front of me and was checked in within 10 mins. I pre-paid for my stay so could also use the express check out service, so there was no time wasted in leaving. The Hotel is brash and yes a bit chessie but that's how it portrays itself, any hotel with a clown neon sign, and in door theme park and a puts on live circus acts has to be bright, noisey and full of large groups of families staying there. To be honest I only used my room to sleep in and used the local coffee shop to buy soft drinks and a few snacks as most of the time I was out and about. The hotel decor does look a bit lived in but not shabby. The bottom line is if you are looking to visit Vegas but are on a limited budget, then Circus Circus might fit the bill. It sits at the top end of the Northern strip, with the Encore & Wynn Hotels about 500 mtrs down the strip, Treasure Islands (TI) a bit further and then the main resort Hotels in the heart of the strip are about a 10 min cab ride away or if it's not roasting at 40c then a good 20 mins walk. I cannot comment on the food at the Hotel as I tended to eat out, but dont expect top 5 star selection, but there is a deli, a fast food counter, a steak house, pizza place and the main buffet restaurant. I cannot recall a separate bar but there places dotted around selling beers and drinks, plus a couple of news agent type shops. As an aside I brought half price tickets to see a show for a Saturday night performance from the Hotel 1/2 price ticket counter and the seats were fine and I saved about $40 a ticket over normal box office prices. So would I stay there again, then on a limited budget the answer is yes, as Circus Circus represents very good value for money, but if money was not an issue then I would go for a more luxury style hotel nearer the centre of the strip. To put things in perspective, in Circus Circus I paid about $8 for a cocktail in a plastic cup, in the Wynn it cost me $20 in a nice glass goblet, so you get what you pay for. I hope this review will help you decide!

Reviews.Title: “Bargain value hotel, dont take too seriously!”
Reviews.Author: lightweightkat
Reviews.Content: As one of the older hotels, Circus, Circus cannot be compared to the new flashier hotels on the strip. You get what you pay for here. We found a cheap last minute deal and booked it a week before going, stayed 4 days, 5 nights, for £500 including flights. Check in was very quick, we were given alternative room options as we had no choice when we booked, ended up in a tower room, which was huge with a partial view of the strip, decor in the room and bathroom may have looked a bit tired and dated but we only used the room to sleep and shower and change. I f you want pretty wallpaper etc pay alot more and book into one of the newer hotels. Very family friendly, numerous places to eat, all looked alot cheaper than other buffets on the strip, we only had Room service Pizza, v.good. A McDonalds next door too. The Adventuredome was mainly for families with children, at a push teenagers, (not people 25-28 like us!) so if your expecting Alton Towers, dont bother going but go on the 3 rides at the Stratosphere, v.scary and spectacular views. A Deuce Bus stop outside slots a fun next door, $3 one way trip, $7 for 24hours, $15 for 3 days, get a ticket from the machines at the bus stop, easier than carrying cash. Stops outside most hotels, avoid the ace bus, that has limited stops and is only single decker, was always full. Avoid the bus between 11-2, always full and security at each bus stop to stop pushing and over crowding, get a cab and tell them not to go down the strip but the back roads as its quicker, about $10 to the mandaley bay at the other end. Book trips either before you go or ring the companies direct, dont use the tour desks they add on between $65-150 on the price acting as a middle man, we booked a helicopter ride over lake mead, hoover dam and the grand canyon for $220 per person, with Papillon Grand Canyon Helicopters, or there other name, Grand Canyon Fun Trips very professional, excellant servcice, picked up from our hotel in comfortable mini bus taken to theire own air strip, weighed upon check in and assigned helicopter with two other couples, this trip was spectacular, pilot was very informative, Grand Canyon was amazing, best way to see it in my opinion. Pick up the voucher booklets and guides from inside the taxis or in the hotel foyers and look though you save loads with the couypons and offers in these. If you want to see a show, see either O at The Bellagio or Love The Beatles at The Mirage,ht eonly words for them both are Spectacular, amazing, wonderful! we payed the higher prices because we wanted good seats and they were amazing seats, for both though I wouldnt have wanted to have sat in the first 8 rows as your too near the stage and dont get the full effect, we sat on row k for The Beatles and J for 'O', excellant seats with the best views! Breathtaking! Gamble at the Bellagio, we loved it in there and you get free drinks when you are at a table or slots for a while, just tip the waitress and she will come back more often. Take I.d if you look under 25 they will ask you for either alcohol or gambling, my partner is 28 and does look his age and he got asked so take I.d so you dont get turned away. If your going in the summer months, be warned its getting hotter. on 4th June it was 120 F in the day, 103 F at 6pm, but take layers though, it may be hot outside but inside ht ehotels, casinos and shops the air con is artic! Overall, Circus, Circus was a great base just for sleeping, you do get what you pay for. Vegas was amazing and would definately go back, we saw alot but didnt see everything, we missed hte Fremont experience and downtown becasue we couldnt fit it all in.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: aldahal
