Reviews.Content: The hotel is dated and forlorn compared to its newer (but much pricier) nieghbors. The room in the SkyRise Tower was average at best...in need of some deep cleaning as the wall behind nightstand was splattered with dried Coke or (?). Service....mediocre...had to call room service TWICE to get clean towels that were not replaced during room makeup.Furniture well worn...probably all orginal from its mid-80's date of opening. A small tube-type TV (thought they were all at the Goodwill by now). The hotel buffet was OK for breakfast, but not worth 10 bucks. On a positive side....the best in town for kid's entertainment with the AdvertureDome which can entertain a kid for a whole day, then the circus acts and midway above the casino floor is good for another 1/2 day..then you got 2 swimming pools. The parking garage on the east is really conveniently located to the SkyRise Tower. Good in-and-out access. Kids all over the place but that what you would expect at at hotel named Circus Circus,

Reviews.Title: “A Lot Better Than Expected!!”
Reviews.Author: treb2007
Reviews.Content: we booked this way back in July 2009...after that we then read up on the reviews on here, suffice to say there are a lot of people with mega-high expectations and unrealistic views of what is value for money, we were left expecting the worst.. Big surprise though, this hotel was generally good, obviously not a "Mirage or MGM Grand" but it was great for what we paid (which was £662 per person for 7 nights). Rooms of a decent size, clean, maid service daily, really comfortable beds, free ice machine on every floor and is a good enough base for daily excursions, granted a little bit far along the strip for older travellers and people who are not fans of walking (take comfortable shoes...you'll need them lol). With regard to the strip, What a place...Fountains at Bellagio, Volcano at Mirage, the awesomeness that is New York, New York...it all comes together once night falls and the neons come on, although the idiots with the porn cards peddling women gets tired after 5 mins haha...overall it is a definite must see place and Circus Circus provides exactly what you pay for, a place to stay. P.S. the Grand Canyon excursion is great, we went to the West Rim and the place is awe-inspiring!!

Reviews.Title: “Impersonal and inadequate quality of room and service”
Reviews.Author: DaveB21
Reviews.Content: We had a reservation for the 1st June 2010. After 20 hours travelling we arrived at 8.30pm and checked in. In our room No 77 3707 we found that there were no towels and the carpet still had the remains of the previous occupant’s snacks on as it had not been vacuumed. We contacted House Keeping by ‘phone at 8.55pm and again at 9.20pm. Although assured towels would be sent, these requests brought no response and I had to go down to talk with Reception staff. They had no success in discovering why the towels had not been delivered because House keeping were now apparently closed. I was assured that the matter had been logged which the front desk seemed to think was a satisfactory response. I did not want the matter logged. I wanted towels! They could offer no time scale as to when the towels would be delivered and seemed mildly irritated that I demanded to know. Only after I asked for a different room if they couldn’t complete the servicing of the present one, which would have caused them additional administration work, did they make some calls and promised that towels were on the way immediately. Immediately turned out to be 15 minutes later. Finally, at nearly 10.30 towels arrived – only an incomplete set but sufficient for us to have a long overdue shower. We gave up on the dirty carpet! No-one seemed at all interested in solving the problems and no staff member ever thought to offer an apology. We gave up on our plan to visit the casino after all the delays. How can that be good business for Circus Circus? When we checked out the following morning I found an additional resort charge that was not listed at the time of booking. It was explained as covering various free offers and facilities like wi-fi and telephone and only started in March (I booked last September). I was then given, too late to be of any use, an explanation voucher booklet that I should have been given when I checked in! There was no way to make a complaint at the time and, though we were directed to their website, there is no email contact address offered there either. They clearly don't want to hear from you. Verdict - this juggernaut hotel operation is too big to be interested in its customers. It just wants to process you and move on to the next customer. The surroundings may be plush but the rooms are tired. Don't bother - you would get better service from a cheap motel. David Bexley

Reviews.Title: “The most kid friendly place in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: 16gauge
Reviews.Content: My wife and I Love to go to Vegas. Over X-mas break we decided to take the kids with us for once. We chose Circus Circus because it is one of the few places in Vegas that is still "kid friendly". As a child, I remember a family vacation that had a Vegas stop (we stayed in the campground behind Circus Circus). Thirty years later, the place is pretty much like I remembered it from my childhood. The still have the midway level located above the casino. The Midway is a place where the kids can play video & carnival games while you are down below on the casino floor. There are still circus & trapeze acts there also. The hotel/casino is clean & well maintained, though dated compared to most of the new strip establishments. Being one of the only places in Vegas that welcomes visitors with children, there are alot of kids everywhere. This should be obvious to anyone considering Circus Circus. If you do not want to be around kids, go somewhere else. Circus Circus is on the north end of the strip, away from the "action" of the mid strip area. The Deuce bus has a stop right in front of Slots of Fun (next door) for easy transportation to the rest of the strip & Downtown. The 5 acre adventure dome kept our 12 & 14 year olds occupied for an entire day - they wanted to go back for a 2nd day. While the kids were in the Adventuredome, I found a table of double-deck black jack that had reasonable rules. There is also a McDonalds next to Slots of Fun that has a dollar menu for a quick bite that does not break your budget. If you are thinking of taking the kids to Vegas, Circus Circus is pretty much your only real option. It is quite affordable also.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: mitsu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for fee as we won a free trip. The hotel itself is older but is very cool. They have a theme park and clowns on the upper level. The rooms were clean but very basic and not fancy like he newer hotels. I noticed that it was very smokey compaired to the other hotels. It was a bit further down the strip but was only a 10 dollar cab ride to the end of the strip. A great cheap hotel for someone who spent all day out and about and only came to sleep. We toured Hoover Dam which was great. Vegas was a great trip to see all different kinds of things.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again but NOT in the Manor rooms”
Reviews.Author: leannemagee
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Las Vegas quite late at night and got a taxi from the very long que outside the airport. When we arrived we were greeted by a very unfriendly receptionist who asked us for a credit card (without looking at us at all) as a deposit, we explained we didnt have 1 she then said we would have to pay $7 as a deposit for our stay lol. We knew we were staying in the manor rooms which were located accross the road from the main hotel. She gave us our key and we proceeded across the road to our room. As it was late at night and down the bottom of the strip i was a bit worried walking accross with all our luggage. We finally got over to our small building, through the security door (on the floor above the security door there was an open area with a railing- almost like a balcony, no doors or window, which kind of defeted the purpose of the security door if u ask me) up the weird stairs and down the corridor to our room. We entered the room, which was ok :-S the wall safe said to enter a quarter for it to work, but someone had pulled the back of it off and it obviously didnt work. I went to go in2 the bathroom to which there was no door attached!! We returned to the reception to a fella who was very helpful, he transferred us to another room. We returned to the new room they had given us (in the same building) and the bathroom door was not attached in this room either. I returned to reception again to the same fella to whom i explaned that the bathroom door was not attached here either. He apologised and phoned to find out why this had happened, apparently they had been painting the doors and forgot to put them back on again!! He transferred us to a room in the west tower, which was much much better and felt so much more secure. The manor rooms were too out of the way and i didnt feel comfortable leaving my luggage there. Location Having been to Las Vegas before i found the location a little out of the way, tho it was quite close to the fashion show mall. There is also a duce stop right outside the hotel's casino entrance. Buffet We tried the buffet in the hotel around breakfast/lunch time, we were not impressed, it was not to the same standard as the other buffets we had ate in along the strip. Adventuredome We went into the adventuredome once as it was closing the day after for the rest of our saty, it was ok, kinda got lost in it lol! i would recommend staying in this hotel again but only if you stay in the west tower or skyrise tower!!

Reviews.Title: “hmmmm....”
Reviews.Author: Burlkitty
Reviews.Content: My Mom just got back from Circus Circus. She said that the room wasn't bad but she came back with come kind of bug bites on her neck!! Also said that the carpets in the casino were really dirty and it was smokey all the time....

Reviews.Title: “Not Good! Shoulda listend to the warnings”
Reviews.Author: martinodella
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Circus Circus yesterday. First impressions last a long time. The check in clerk wouldn't even look me in the eye and she wouldn't give me any information about the hotel. She tried to walk away and I had to call her back to the desk and say "hey, can you tell me a little something about this place, I have never been to Vegas or Circus Circus" She said "all you need to know is in your coupon book" and she walked away. But that's not all. I found out today she charged me twice for my stay. I called them up this morning and they are giving me partial money back talking about they have to charge me resort fees cause they hadn't originally done so. Then the manager of guest relations had the nerve to say "i SHOULD HAVE COMPLAINED WHEN i WAS THERE INSTEAD OF GOING HOME AND THINKING ABOUT AND CALLING BACK TO THEM TODAY". what kind of crap is that????????? When I was there I did notice I was short some money and I "DID' call them from my room and ask had they charged me extra. They said NO!!! So they give me some weak apology letter and one night free stay on their terms; ie. black out dates, must purchase an additional night at regular rate.. ect.. BULL CRAP.. I'm gonna go to the top with my complaint.. I was in Las Vegas short of money cause they had charged me twice and blame me for not complaining til today..

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here twice now - not a bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: skanky_j
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I'm really cheap and have stayed here twice now because it's one of the cheapest on the strip. A few things about it... 1. Check-in/Check-out: Took a long time. And even though we checked in past 1am the staff was very friendly checking us in. The luggage check guys were also very friendly and were joking around with eachother which was entertaining. 2. The Rooms: No complaints; you get what you paid for. Had two beds, a little closet, working tv, desk, 2 chairs. They were clean and big enough for two - four people. They were a little tacky and out dated but it didn't really bother me. The first time we stayed it did take quite a trek to get to our room but we didn't mind - again, for the amount of money we paid we didn't expect much. Second time we stayed, our room was much closer to where we would leave and return to the hotel so we go lucky the second time. 3. Pool: Only ventured down here once. It wasn't very impressive, a little small for the amount of people that were there, a lot of kids running around 4. Staff: The staff were all very friendly to us. I have read other reviews that have stated the opposite but we had no problems at all. Guess it depends who is working when you stay here? Room service staff were VERY nice...said goodmorning everytime we ran into them when we were leaving for the day; always smiling. 5. Location: it's really far away from the other hotels: If you don't like walking I would recommend staying somewhere closer to the middle of the strip bc Circus Circus is pertty far away. You also walk past some empty spaces so it's not like you have anything to look at as you make your way up the strip. 6. Extras: Buffet was not worth the money; A LOT of kids running around - but what do you expect from a hotel with a circus theme?; Adventure Dome is good for kids but not so much adults; same with arcade upstairs - was fun for about 5 minutes but with so many kids you start to feel old real quick; casino is not very big but it's good for some late night gambling before bed; free circus acts were actually pretty impressive - would recommend checking them out since they are free; visit Slots'o'Fun next door - it smells really bad but it has cheap drinks and cheap games and has a fun young atmosphere

Reviews.Title: “not the best but ok, would pay more next time to stay somewhere better.”
Reviews.Author: smithy65
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Circus Circus by taking the shuttle bus from the airport. We were dropped off at the side entrance where the hotel reception is located. Check in took about 20 mins . On arrival the hotel appeared to be a little tired and in need of a bit of freshening up. It was apparent that in it's time it had been a fabulous hotel. We were allocated a room in the sky tower on the 18th floor. Lifts were quick and slightly confusing as not all of them went to the same floors. On arrival to our room we were surprised at the size of the room. It was very large and clean. The huge king size bed was comfortable. The bath was very low and appeared to be quite small. There were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room which took me back a bit as i thought that it would be standard practice as we are led to believe that the Americans are a nation of coffee drinkers. The hotel has what is known as the Medway and this is a floor dedicated to children where various funfair games can be found, a Mc Donald's and a variety of free circus acts throughout the day. There is a large dome downstairs that contains quite a few fun fair rides, roller coaster etc . There are various shops and stalls dotted throughout the hotel. The corridors are massive and very long and it can take even the quickest walker at least 20-30 mins to get from their room to the front entrance. There are quite a few places to eat in the hotel but i did not use them so cannot comment on the food quality. Meal times smelt a bit greasy which made me feel a bit queasy as i walked through which is why i did not try them. We did not have a strip view but was not disappointed at night when all the lights were on. We could see the Stratosphere and towards Fremont Street. There was a main casino and slots o fun which had more slots and a few gaming tables. The hotel was not as nice as the ones on the main part of the strip and the services offered was not as good as others offered elsewhere but i think this is reflected in the price. I am a firm believer of you get what you pay for. Over all this hotel makes a good base for travelling about and is more geared for families which is not apparent in the other hotels available. Personally I do not think Las Vegas is a place for children in general as there are quite a few porn leaflets and lots of advertising dotted about. (not in hotel but on the streets.) Las Vegas is as advertised and very much so an adults playground. Unique Qualities: Hotel is geared up with the family in mind. Circus acts run daily at no extra charge. Hotel has the largest indoor theme park in America. scams When we were sitting drinking coffee on the boulevard we were approached a few times by people who claimed they were stranded and needed to get home, i just need $17 to get home etc. One claimed he was not a bum he had a home but needed fuses for his very large camper van to get home. He rattled his keys and said $10 should see him right. Things to do. The fountains at the Bellagio are special. When I first watched them I found it to be quite a touching experience. I never imagined that water could be so beautiful. As this is a free activity it should not be missed by anyone. grand canyon I booked this trip before travelling from the UK online. It was a really good day out from start to finish. The coach guide was superb and gave a lot of information on the way to the Canyon. The coach was very comfortable and the whole booking experience was easy and hassle free. The Grand Canyon was awesome. The 2 1/2 mile walk around the rim was easy and disabled friendly. Everyone visiting Las Vegas should try and get to the Canyon as it is a special site to take in and one i will not forget. The coach trip was very long but well worth the effort. There are easier and quicker ways to get there but it was nice learning about all the places along the way on the coach. The IMAX film was ok. It was nothing special but added to the day. lake mead dinner cruise The Lake Mead dinner cruise was a really good excursion. Booked from the UK before travel we were thrilled with the service we received from both the tour operators and our cruise hosts. We had a night time photo stop at the Dam. The meal was tasty and well prepared. It was one of my favourite trips although i did enjoy them all. volcano at the mirage The free show at the Mirage hotel is one to watch. there are shows nightly on the hour from 8 till midnight. I was not sure what to expect but was not disappointed. the fremont street experience. The Fremont Street experience is just what it say's on the tin, an experience. We had a really nice time at Fremont Street. The light show is really good and the Queen tribute had people dancing in the street. There was a live band playing which encouraged people to take part and various stalls and shops selling all sorts of different things. A good place to view the show if you can get a seat is The Vue. It is a bar above one of the casinos at the start of Fremont Street. The beer was not bad either at $1. Another freebie not to miss. hoover dam The Hoover Dam trip is good for anyone who is interested in the creating of modern day wonders. The Hoover dam is an interesting place to visit if the history and the making interests you. If this this not your thing i do not think a tour specific to the dam will interest you. If you go to the Grand Canyon or Lake Mead you will probably find yourself having a photo stop here which will be enough for most people. Our tour coach to the Grand Canyon played a DVD on the history of the dam. laughlin We booked this tour before we went to Vegas from the UK online. It cost next to nothing $7.50 each. we were picked up from hotel before 8am and got back about 6.30pm. It was about 2 hours to Laughlin which is a town situated on the Colarado river. We were given a very good buffet lunch voucher on arrival to be used in the Colarado Belle casino. It was excellent and included free with unlimited soft drinks. To buy the lunch was more expensive than the whole inclusive trip cost us. We went on a boat along part of the river which was nice. The whole day was really nice and well worth the money. i would highly recommend this trip to anyone. we used allLasvegastours for all our trips and found them to be very efficient and good.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as reviews say!!”
Reviews.Author: JGGLeeds
Reviews.Content: Despite initial concerns after reading tripadvisor reviews of circus circus, it definitely was not as bad as I expected. Granted if I had the money, the Wyn/Encore/Bellagio would have been my number 1 choice, but this budget package through expedia provided cheap and confortable accommodation. Granted the hotel seems a bit away from the buzz of the central strip but a 30 min stroll up the strip brings you to the heart of it all. Our room was upgraded (without requesting) to the tower block 23rd floor and it was spacious, clean with all the facilities we required. I would recommend using it as a base only. The food restaurants are nothing to write home about and there are kids aboubd inthe lobby as very family orientated-very Mexican/Hispanic/Japanese groups. The shops will make you laugh after seeing what is on offer elsewhere but if you want a budget hotel which we found to be very clean and helpful- espec the guys on the car rental in the lobby- circus circus is right up your street.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: b_rose_22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Circus Circus hotel on April 12th 2010. The staff were very friendly and I found them to be very helpful. However, when I had checked into my room The room looked more like a motel room. The T.V. was small, the alarm clock was screwed to the night stand and the safety box was broken. The bathtub looked like it had not been cleaned. I found hair and a lid from a razor in the drain. I laid down on the bed and I had springs digging into my back. The day I had checked out of the hotel which was on April 14th I had developed a rash on my body. I had also noticed that it looked like I had been bitten. I guess you get what you pay for.‎

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EXPERIENCE EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: bulldog48657
Reviews.Content: Had bed bugs in the bed!!! Adventuredome was closed the entire time and never was told that it would be. rooms were filthy!!! Had my cell phone stolen while I was there.Asked for extra pillows and recieved them two days later. the pool closed at 6pm without notice.TV only picked up three stations, did not work properly. AND CIRCUS CIRCUS HAS YET TO RESPOND TO MY CUSTOMER SURVEY THAT I FILLED OUT!!! They simply want your money and DON'T CARE ABOUT THE CUSTOMER!!! My teens will never go back to Las Vegas due to this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: DunkmanEdmonton
Reviews.Content: Circus circus is a cheaper priced hotel. Paid total of $40 (including taxes) for one night. Stayed at the Skyrise tower and the room was clean and bright. Bathroom had bathtub with shower. A bit outdated. There were lots of young families around the hotel. Very suitable for families. More things for children to do. Location is on the north side of the strip and farther away from the action. The Deuce bus was convenient, but slow since it had to pick up many people. There is a $5 resort fee per night. Includes free local call, free wireless internet. A lot of Vegas hotels are charging this fee these days and Circus circus seems to be on the lower end price wise. You get what you pay for. The price is one of the cheapest on the strip. If you mainly need a cleaner place to rest and sleep and want to spend most of the time enjoying Vegas, this is the place ot be.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times! Better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: Car-Dee-Ness
Reviews.Content: When my wife booked our room a few months ago, I was concerned since I had read alot of negative reviews -place not being clean, unpleasant, unfriendly and the worst one: you get what you pay for. I'm glad to report that it was none of the above. Upon arriving to our room, the smell of fresh linen was a nice surprise, the room was cozy and very clean. No bed bugs, no stains on the carpets. My only complain -if any- was the TV ( it was small and outdated.) The internet service was included in the resort fee and we took advantage of that. Our teens enjoyed the Adventuredome -I lost count on how many times they got on the roller coaster all I know is that we got our money's worth. If you are visiting Las Vegas and you have teenagers, stay at Circus Circus.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and uncheerful”
Reviews.Author: minkysmum
Reviews.Content: My husband had stayed here before with his dad and brother in 2002 and quite liked the hotel so we decided to go back there for our wedding,and as we had 2 kids we thought it would be even better as it,s meant to be a family orientated hotel.Needless to say we were wrong.The check in desk was a total joke,a mile long queue and when we did get to the front the staff were rude,unhelpful and uncaring,to top it all off the lobby was boiling and everyone was feeling very grumpy by the time we got to our room.It took us forever to find our room,located on the 19th floor of the skyrise tower and when we did get there were disappointed to find no tea/coffee facilities and no fridge?in the middle of a desert?The kids put on the tv and it took ages to work and the channels were AWFUL,the worst selection we have EVER seen and to watch anything of interest it cost at least $7.99,also the tv unit which once had doors on it looked tatty and the doors had clearly been kicked off.The bed was absolutely awful,the springs were sticking out and needless to say for 5 nights we got virtually no sleep and had ALOT of aches and pains and also there was only one flat pillow each,when we asked the cleaners for more they said we couldn,t have any.there was only one bedside table between the 2 double beds,even though there was ample space for small ones on the other side of the beds.The air conditioning unit kept the room cool but sounded like a jet plane taking off right next to you and when we opened the window it either let no air in or the wind howled through it so it had to be shut anyway.I had left my wedding dress hanging on the rail(there is no proper wardrobe either)and we went out for the day,when we came back it was clear that someone had tried it on and also my teenage daugthers bridesmaid dress,needless to say you expect your things to be safe in a locked hotel room and for the staff not to touch them.Also the safe costs 50 cents EVERY time you unlock it,most places do the safe for free.The trek from the room to get anywhere is a joke tooAlso we tried the deuce bus and that is a joke too,the bus was VERY overcrowded and you end up standing in a cramped overheated bus it was not fun!.All in all we were very disappointed with circus circus,it was a big let down.We hope the rumours of it being knocked down and building a decent hotel in its place are true.

Reviews.Title: “NOT Worth paying $70 a night!”
Reviews.Author: Waltz_2010
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews for his hotel, most of it are negative.. people, believe it!! It's not worth paying $70 a night for this hotel! They put us on the manor rooms of the hotel! The rooms are so disappointing, the bed stinks, the carpet dirty, the shower, don't want to describe it. .. pay a little bit more and get a better hotel than this! believe me! i was so ashamed with my relatives who came here from another country seeing the awful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: SouthCarolina66
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Las Vegas and we learned that you get what you pay for. Some of the reviews were bad and some were good so I thought we would take the chance. Read the bad ones and believe it. Staff was rude, this goes for front desk, valet, bell hop, restaurant, casino, stores, amusements. Didn't meet anyone there for 5 days that was nice or helpful. Buffet was a waste of money. Got a non-smoking room with cigarette holes in the comforter and sheets (housekeeping had to see it, because the bed was turned down to show the holes). Area around the hotel gets very shady at night and wouldn't even leave my 15 year old in the hotel room by himself. Slots of fun is a joke. For about $50 more a night you can get a better room and location.

Reviews.Title: “Most wonderful & memorable experience”
Reviews.Author: shahpavan
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel and convinent to stay on the strip itself.. Good co-oprative staff to handle all ur need...

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: kittykitsune
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Circus Circus on a trip we took to just get away. We really enjoy Vegas and we're looking for the cheapest possible option - hence Circus Circus. The room was small and dark, but we didn't intend to spend too much time there so we didn't mind too much at first, but overall it was not impressive. I'd stay there again if we didn't have a daughter now, but I'd like to keep her in a room that seems cleaner and brighter. On the bright side, the casino crew was really friendly and we did happen to make a little money on the slots so there's an upside to our travel.

Reviews.Title: “stay somewhere else and pay a little extra”
Reviews.Author: straveller23
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend staying here, yes it is inexpensive but not worth it, this place is very old and need remodeling, repair, bed was very uncomfortable, construction was loud on site.

Reviews.Title: “100 times better than some reviwers !”
Reviews.Author: topharry123
Reviews.Content: This place was a place my wife stayed at as a kid, so we decided to book there. It was a cheap deal so I was skeptical, especially after reading some reviews. We have a room in the skyrise tower. It was a little walk from the street, but no more than 5 minutes and we were on floor 16 so can't really expect much else. The room was very clean and spacious, and everything worked just fine. There was plenty of storage and an ice machine on every floor. It was quiet during the night also. The casino was clean and the staff were relatively friendly. The shops were nice and there was lots to do. The only annoying thing was the staff that try to give you a "free" vacation for a couple of hours of your time. This got old very quickly, we got stopped 3 times by these people. The buffet was nothing special, but what do you expect for $13? There are better buffets in Vegas but you will pay a lot more for them. To me, it was worth the price but not a lot more. The Garden Grill was good, we went for the all you can eat prime rib for $12.99. The first slice was excellent, the second you could tell was an inferior quality peice of meat. Still prime rib, but probably a cheaper version. Still the first piece was big enough for most and was worth the money alone. The staff were very rushed in there but friendly. I broke a bottle of beer accidently and they replaced it for free even though it was my fault. There is a lot of variation in the casino and the games arcade is great for both kids and adults. The circus show is fun for both also. The games are reasonably priced. The adventure dome was also a great bit of fun, however be warned that it is only open Friday-Sunday. The hotel has a bus stop right outside to take you further up the strip or straight to downtown. Slots of fun is also next door which is a very small casino, but kind of nice. This hotel is at the end of the strip, but you can walk all the way up, it's only about 3-4 miles which is not too much if you want to spend the day checking out all the other hotels/casinos. All in all this was a great hotel for the price. It was tacky and a little outdated, but in a good way. We would deinitely stay their again. We have no kids, but if you do then this has to be the best place to stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “DONT EXPECT 5* QUALITY FOR 2* PRICES!!!”
Reviews.Author: rollingstone66
Reviews.Content: I think many of the reviews for Circus Circus are unfair in their criticism of this property. Granted, it has seen better days. The casino is a waste of time, the dealers have no mercy, no charm. Hardly any tables active at 2am... Dead casino. But the hotel was fine by me. Good base camp. Dont expect five star rooms for two star prices... It is one of the cheapest hotels in Vegas, so what do you expect? If you are lucky enough to have a room at the West Tower (which I did), you will get much more than you paid for. My room was clean, carpets were spotless. Room was quiet. I didnt use the safe coz I didnt have d two quarters they wanted to charge me (LOL!!!)... Shower was large. Water pressure was TOO strong... I dont understand why people keep ragging on the breakfast. I had worse at Casears, and I paid more there... For $10.49 at Circus Circus, (self service preferred), I had all d juice and cappucino I wanted... Bacon n pastry n fruits good enough for me. The spread was bigger at Caesars but it wasnt any better... The days of freshly squeezed OJ seem to be long gone... Overall, I got more than what I expected. Good value. The worse part of Circus Circus was the walk from the car park to my room.. 15 minutes through the maze of shops, slot machines and dazed and lost tourists... No more mega hotels for me next time in Vegas...

Reviews.Title: “Quick, Cheap Two Night Trip... Vegas Baybah!”
Reviews.Author: OmahaPorterhouse
Reviews.Content: It was my second time in Vegas in six months, and this time I was paying... so we decided to go as cheap as we could and still be on the strip... I'm sure that there MIGHT be a cheaper place to stay, but we looked pretty hard and couldn't find a cheaper place. Let me start out by saying this - there were a LOT of kids. I know some of you can handle it - but you know, there were a LOT of kids! That aside, the hotel was OK. I specifically asked for non-smoking, and was placed in a smokey pit of hell. I complained and they moved me right away. The second room was non-smoking and actually pretty nice. The beds are hard as they get, but that wasn't a deal breaker. The lack of a coffee maker is a SERIOUS BUMMER, but that's the scam in Vegas... be smart and spend 15 dollars on a cheap coffee maker at Walgreen's and save yourself some bucks... Just leave it behind, you'll still come out ahead if you like the coffee. The hotel's location is near the end of the strip, but close enough to get around if you don't mind walking or taking the bus (if you can afford a cab, you don't need Circus Circus). We did some craps work at the Grand Royale, which is pretty much mid-strip, and had a good time. You can do Vegas for pretty cheap, if you want to... the two night stay for Saturday and Sunday was about 140.00 - and I got the flight for 99 bucks one-way. VEGAS BABY! Make it happen on the cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Economic, but more a family place”
Reviews.Author: go2grl
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas in August of 2007 for 5 days and stayed at Circus Circus because we were on a budget and wanted to spend our money on food, shows, casinos, shopping, etc. We are 2 women, 36 and 43 at the time and the hotel/casino are older and meant more for families with younger children IMO. Our room was fine with no complaints; air conditioner worked, sheets and towels changed daily and clean ice in the ice machine. The pool area was lacking in atmosphere, but the pool itself was clean and cool, though a bit of a hike from our room. Mexitalia located in Circus Circus has some of the best fried calamari I've ever had with light breading with fresh parsley. Load up on the lemon and you are good to go. Casino is nothing great, but you can lose or win money there just as easily at any other place. The trapeze show and circus themes probably play well with younger kids. Make sure you budget a bit of extra money for cabs/shuttles/buses since the hotel is at the end of the strip and away from the more popular casinos and hotels you may want to visit. We walked from the hotel one morning and it took us about 45 minutes to get to the Bellagio. (BTW, completely worth the $30 for their buffet at the Bellagio) Overall, I would recommend this place if you don't really care about where you rest your head after a long day of enjoying the rest of Vegas which is exactly what we did. When you're asleep, which we didn't get a lot of since it is VEGAS, there's no difference between the $50 room or the $350 room.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and past it's best but great value for money.”
Reviews.Author: barfin
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here mid-week. Hotel is dated and tired; but clean and fantastic value for money. Plenty of places to eat, the hotel breakfast is wonderful. Our bill came to £34 sterling per night, cheaper than sleeping in a tent!!I It is located at one end of the strip but the duce buses are frequent and a day ticket costs peanuts.

Reviews.Title: “A comedy of errors!”
Reviews.Author: MissingSanDiego
Reviews.Content: My young daughter and I stayed at Circus Circus a few years back right before Christmas. The hotel had just undergone a huge multimillion dollar renovation so I was excited to see what it looked like! We arrived in a huge rainstorm and after we got settled I was looking out the window at the view when I noticed my feet were wet. I looked down and the carpet was soaked! I pulled the curtain back and all the new plaster had fallen off and it was actually raining into our room! I called down to the front desk and was told to bring our suitcases and come to the front desk and we could get a new room. This was not the easiest task with a 5 year old but we did it! We got a new room key and went back up again only to find the exact same thing in this room! This happened 2 more times until I was ready to scream! The last room I made the manager come with me and she and I went into the room only to find the bed occupied by a couple! We all screamed and left--thank God my daughter stayed with the luggage in the hall! Needless to say our stay was complimentary and we enjoyed ourselves a lot!

Reviews.Title: “Seen Better Days - Distgusting!”
Reviews.Author: dirtyriverdog
Reviews.Content: As we walked into the lobby of the casino, we instantly changed our minds. The decor was retro 70's that needed to be updated. The carpets and what furniture they had looked as if someone had played spilled soda and no one ever bothered to clean it. The children's games were nothing more than carnival games - the dust on these things was unacceptable. All it takes is a little deep cleaning over the years and a fresh coat of paint to make it presentable. It takes money to make money. Even the outside of the casino should tell one that this IS NOT THE PLACE!

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: rmh2251
Reviews.Content: Before going on our trip, I had read other reviews and was expecting the worst but was surprised to find it wasn't as bad to us as others had described it to be. We booked our room at a really good rate staying 6 nights in the skyrise tower. We arrived about 11:00 pm and only had to wait about 15 min to check in. The staff was very nice and polite. I had booked a king room but when we got there all they had was two queens. They offered to change our room the next day and made a note on our file but we decided to just keep our same room. The pillows were flat but we were immediately brought additional ones when we called housekeeping. The room had a good view and was very clean. It definitely isn't a high end hotel such as the Venitian or Ceasar's Palace but for the price what can you expect. The one negative is the location. It is a good walk to the main part of the strip. However, if you have a car, the other hotels offer free parking. If not, public transportation is not bad either. Be sure to park in the Skyrise parking if staying in this tower. Otherwise, it is a long walk to the tower elevators from the lobby. If staying in Circus Circus, you can expect a lot of children after all they do cater to children and teens unlike some of the other hotels. We didn't have any children but we felt really comfortable there and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Blackpool in Vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: Haze52
Reviews.Content: Was so excited at going to america and seeiing vegas and expected much more from the hotel..It was like living in blackppol prom...cheap tat and noise everywhere..felt very vulnerable fighting my way through crowds of folk to get to my room.Staff were non-existent and no info anywhere to be found on how to get to the strip.avoid it and move further into strip!!

Reviews.Title: “Should be demolished”
Reviews.Author: Charley12
Reviews.Content: On arrival we noticed an awful smell but thought it was the drains outside. Once inside the over crowded lobby the smell got worse. We had paid on line and they also took the whole amount again plus taxes saying it was policy and it was just holding and would not be taken off my account. They were lying it was taken off my account immediately. The bedroom was awful, dirty dingy only one tiny light bulb and smelt of urine. We asked to be moved but they refused so we asked to be checked out but again they wanted another amount to be held on holding just incase the first two amount were no covered. None of this made sense as all the amounts had been cleared on my credit card and it took 4 days for them to refund the whole amount. Do not book this hotel under any circumstance the whole thing needs demolishing it is truly disgusting. By the way we found out what the smell was, it was the buffet where everyone eats!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: sled_head67
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Circus Circus for the first time because we got a great deal on vegas.com. We were pleasantly surprised with our room on the 25th floor in the west tower. This tower has been upgraded and exceeded my expectations. The place has been geared for kids so expect them... I have stayed at the Imperial Palace in the past... Circus Circus beats it hands down in everyway other than location. We rented a car this trip so that was not a factor. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “enjoy the walk to the other resorts!”
Reviews.Author: RAmBLN
Reviews.Content: Desk staff was friendly. Housekeeping friendly. Information desk had no information to conferences at this location and for local activities and bus routes. CC offers restaurants that are seldom open. CC offers gaming instruction that is not available if there are tournaments that conflict. I enjoyed walking to most of the other resorts to give them my gaming and entertainment money. The room was satisfactory. The pool was sad. Will not return to CC. Compliments to desk staff Lily and Shelly. Compliments to Bartender Larry.

Reviews.Title: “Old Skool and Cheap”
Reviews.Author: Hydronly
Reviews.Content: This place is not bad considering they're one of the cheapest on the strip. I do agree that it's kinda old and could use some upgrades. This place was supposed to get the dynamite but since the economy going bad cheap places like these were doing pretty good again all of a sudden. So for as long as it lasts we can still enjoy this piece of old Las Vegas. My main reason to choose this hotel for few nights was because of the Fear and Loathing Las Vegas scenes that were recorded here and it also featured in a couple more movies. This place was one of the first casino's on the strip. This place is super kid friendly, they house the biggest indoor amusement park in the USA and kids will enjoy themselves there all day. The pool is pretty simple, and can get very crowded. Rooms are basic but clean. There's also plenty parking space, that won't be any problem in anywhere in Vegas really. Their buffet is bad tho, worst I had on the strip ever and I had quite a few. It's not expensive but for what you get it's bad. If you want a cheap buffet go to the Sahara on the other side of the street. They're known to have the cheapest buffet on the strip, and well its better then Circus buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average”
Reviews.Author: AB2007
Reviews.Content: After spending three nights here, I'd only really recommend Circus Circus to families on a (serious) budget. Like all Las Vegas hotels, it's vast but the place just had a depressing, run-down feel to it (even though it was completely refurnished not too long ago). It's 15 minute walk (dodging tacky souvenir stands clogging up all the corridors) from the rooms to the main exit/ entrance and, once outside, there's nowhere to go apart from the McDonald's next door. Bleak. Most of the action is happening a good 25-30 minutes walk further down the strip. Taxis are expensive in Vegas and they soon add up. Having said all this, we did get an incredibly good price for the place so... you get what you pay for. Would recommend it for the price if nothing else.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value, good hotel in Vegas for low price”
Reviews.Author: lulkada
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel a week before in a 10 % off offer, and we preferred to go during the weekdays, because the weekends are usually higher. For 66 dollars for the two nights, for two person with all cost and tax included was the best value U can find. The rooms are clean, and really spacious according to us, and to the European measures too. Big bed, nice and clean shower, cable Tv, wifi - though it wasn't the fastest. There are many things to see in Vegas, so you won't spend your hole day in the hotel, but if you have to it would be perfect for it too. The hotel has all amenities, it is a little town in a big city, like most of the Vegas Strip hotels. Everything is in really walking distance form here, so it is a good location. Go on weekdays and you will get the best deal in your life, I guess it is even cheaper than a motel, and looks way nicer.

Reviews.Title: “we got clowned..... happy birthday to me”
Reviews.Author: poshuan
Reviews.Content: this place was a mess dirty everywhere we went employees below avg on customer service. we checked into our rooms and the beds had dirty sheets on them and the comforters were in a trash bag in the room still the tv didnt work the outlets were all loose our tv didnt work the air kept cutting out. we called to voice our concerns and the rep wasnt very nice once we finally got to a point of trying to fix the prob she was gonna move us to a new room. we waited for our room we had to wait for a security guard to let us in the new room then go get new keys to our new room. we waited for our bags which the nallet lost and took over a hour to deliver once they found them, then the bell guy said sorry for the trouble held his hand out for a tip and when i didnt he shook his head and mumbled as he walked away. with all this we decided to try to make it work so we called back had them send a maid to make the beds and so on so she came did our sheet then said ill be right back and never came after 20 mins of waiting we looked to see her and didnt find her but did find oyr blankes and comforters on the dirty floor at our door so we had to make our own beds. we decided to stay after they wanted to charge us and extra $120 to upgrade to a better room not worth it with the troubles we already had having to haul the bags around ourselfs so we called and asked for a supervisor they didnt answer so we left a voicemail with our room number our names and cell numbers and 4 days of staying we werent returned a call. then today i called and asked for a email or someone to talk to i was told this is the only way to voice a concer or to wait til i get my stay survey that will be sent to my email in the next few days i was underwhelmed to say the least

Reviews.Title: “Horrible and Sloppy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: purple_lilly
Reviews.Content: I booked 4 nights at this hotel with my friends, for the same price, and the same room. When we tried to get rooms on the same floor, they wouldn't change it and wanted to charge me an upgrade fee. Later I saw that this was probably because they gave my friends a renovated room, and I had an old room. Then I found out that the room I got was a smoking room when I had requested a nonsmoking room, and it was on my itinerary as well. They said they had no rooms availabe for me to change to for hours later. Until I called again and complained to waive my resort fee because of this, which they did that and all of a sudden a room was available. Only this time, I found that the faucet on the tub was cracked and the water went in all directions, and the showerhead had no intensity control...very rough showers. On top of that, they have very cheap air conditioners in the casino with thick smoke everywhere...unlike other hotels I visited with deep conditioners. Overall...if you want to enjoy your stay, pay a little more for a better hotel than this. I wish I did!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but not cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Jaz3000
Reviews.Content: First time in Vegas and there are many better hotels with better facilities. Room in West Tower was fine but not very roomy for family of four, although only stayed 2 nights and used only for base. Is at the very end of Vegas Strip and a long walk to many hotels, although lots of shops/bars etc on route - can be tiring and hot. In main hotel receptions and casino/restaurant areas, very crowded with lots of families - some not very pleasant to be around, screaming at their children. As this is a cheap hotel compared to most in vegas, you get what you pay for. Didnt really come into contact with staff except for check in and check out and efficient enough but hotel too large to get a feel for staff/service.

Reviews.Title: “Competing well in a very competitive world of casino hotels”
Reviews.Author: Stillaccelerating
Reviews.Content: I arrived at 10.30am and they agreed to check me in immediately for an additional $10. As the room was really cheap anyway I considered this a good deal. Excellent large room on the 35th floor with fantastic views of Las Vegas and the distant mountains. Excellent hotel for children in a city that does not really cater for children. Amusement park within the hotel with big rides and a great 'as many rides as you want' day ticket - to suit all ages. Fairground type area with lots of fun games and prizes for children, but beware you are likely to finish up with a cuddly toy to try and squeeze into the suitcase. Good variety of catering outlets, free circus acts throughout the day and very friendly staff. I am not a gambler so cannot comment on the 'tables' but if you want to visit Las Vegas and you have children, this is the outstanding choice. The only downside is its location, which is on the main strip but a bit away from the big well known hotels.

Reviews.Title: “So very disappointed this time..”
Reviews.Author: wegrowhope
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Circus Circus once or twice a year for about 10 years now. Usually very good - not 5 star, but for the price, adequate. This time - TERRIBLE! I don't know if they are getting ready to implode it or what... the service was poor, NOBODY working there smiled or greeted me, 1/2 the restaurants were CLOSED, although they advertised them on all the billboards, and stands and even the reader board out front. Players "services" was dismal - again, no greeting, They just stared at you when you finally get through the endless line. Workers did not know the new "system" and after standing in line to get a pathetic little 25.00 comp, ( I had already spent 750.00) I was told to just use my players card at the remaining couple of restaurants. Then I stood in line at the resaturant and was told no , they don't take the card - only paper vouchers. Back to yet another line. I spent 1 and1/2 hours trying to get comp for breakfast - had to walk back from the 2 opposite sides of the casino due to inadequte training fo employees. (and clearly a lack of caring about customer service by management). I finally gave up and went to In n Out burger. I also received free slot play, however the specially marked machines that accepted it were not all working - about 1/2 of the ones I tried said "feature unavailable". Again to player "services" , stand in line, only to be told they didn't know why that was. I'm done there - after the excellent service and attitude I received at the casinos my friends were staying at, I won't be returning to Circus Circus again.

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus not that bad”
Reviews.Author: theretoseethesights
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, quiet, smoke free and a sense of security. The staff at the desk are friendly and security presence was approachable and friendly as well. Reading all the reivews prior to the trip, I was prepared to secure another hotel upon arrival as the reviews were not favorable. If you are looking for a place on the strip that is convenient and unbelievably affordable, Circus Circus is it.

Reviews.Title: “Not - Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: CruiseCoupleUtah
Reviews.Content: We stayed at another Hotel on the strip a week before for the same price and it was nothing like this Hotel. We decided to go to the Circus Circus since it was touted as "Family Friendly". Worst decision we have made yet in Vegas. Asked and was told we had adjoining rooms (important when you have a Grandma and lots of kids). Got to rooms and they were not adjoining. The AC unit did not work in in either of the rooms. Called for maintenance and they came to room quick to tell us that the AC units in the Manors do not work well and we should have booked in the tower. Rooms were very very dirty. Brown water on the ceilings (dripping), floors in bathroom were dirty, carpet dirty, windows caked in dirt on edges, walls had dust on them, smelled of dirt and dust. All the kids got coughs and we slept Hot in the rooms. Never again. Do not stay in the Manors. The price is tempting but the lack of rest is a bigger price if you have kids. The shows were fun to watch in the casino. So stay somewhere else and then go see the shows.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and friendly”
Reviews.Author: devils99
Reviews.Content: stayed here recently and found the staff very friendly giving advice regarding buses timetables,maps etc. We stayed in the skytower floor 29. Room was not spectacular, but wot can you expect for the price, but it was clean and large enough for 4 of us. Had no problem sleeping, didnt hear other rooms occupants or people in the corridor. The hotel was dark,bit like a UK haven site but didnt notice a smell. there were little children around, but it is a family hotel. My kids liked it for the adventuredome and found the souvenier shops, mcdonalds, krusty creme and convenience stores handy as they are on site. it is at the bottom of the strip, but i felt that way we got to see all of the strip by walking to the top (Mandalay Bay) and getting the bus back. THe only reasons i wouldnt go back is because it is too far down the strip and i wont be taking the children, so they wont need entertaining.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GO HERE FOR YOUR LIFE'S SAKE”
Reviews.Author: cloudwalker97
Reviews.Content: Oh... Where do I start. The whole place was smoky, dark, and there were little kids screaming everywhere. The carpeting in the rooms were outdated and stained. The bottom of the doors to the rooms looked like they were savagely chewn off by some small animal. Our non-smoking room smelt like someone has been smoking in it. There were timeshare people harrasing you everywhere. The staff were impatient and rude. The ONLY upside. The amusment park area is worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: WendyW2
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was just okay. Too outdated and tired. The hotel is too full of kids for me,

Reviews.Title: “Waste of money”
Reviews.Author: vlman
Reviews.Content: Horrible place to stay for a quality experience.

Reviews.Title: “an OK hotel, if you get a good deal, otherwise go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: stephandsimon
Reviews.Content: We booked from overseas, and arrived at Circus Circus halfway through a long trip. Loved Vegas, the hotel was ok. It did smell funny, I stayed there as a kid 25 years ago and had immediate dejavu for the smell, an odd combination of airlessness and smoke. Definitely one of the less classy places on the strip, especially as we were 'upgraded' to a disabled room in the main tower which was fine but faced away from the strip (no hotel in Vegas is honestly busy enough at present to justify putting guests in dodgy rooms) and was missing anywhere to put our luggage, it spent three nights on the floor in the bathroom which was a disabled friendly bathroom and therefore huge. Housekeeping steadfastly refused to take our leftover takeaway food despite it sitting beside the bin for the entire duration of the stay, it was too large to fit into the small bin but it had empty chinese food containers sticking out of the top, a bit of a giveaway. As a place to sleep its safe and cheap, some of the guys on the airport shuttle were locals (to Nevada anyway) and they apparently got the room for $ 22, a lot less than we paid but thats what happens when you book from overseas. There are much nicer places to stay but they cost a lot more, and the cheaper ones are less well placed, less comfortable or come with fewer amenities. If you came to vegas for a luxury break look elsewhere, if you need a place to crash get the best deal you can online and get through the lobby/casino before the smell sinks in. If they offer an upgrade to the disabled room its your choice. There is a pool around the back somewhere, and all the usual casino features, the kids fun park is good for the 4-11 year olds, and the Stratosphere (with several good rides) and the Sahara (rollercoaster) are the closest casinos'. Its a short walk to the monorail through the Sahara, and its not a bad walk up the strip (4miles, you are right at one end) especially at night. The casino is nothing much, try the Treasure Island or the Bellagio after the fountains, and definitely go down to Fremont street for the light show and the vibe, the casinos there are fun, some in our group thought they were better. Also vegas has outlet shopping with great deals, try the premium outlets, theres a diamond outlet.

Reviews.Title: “3rd World in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: clincher12
Reviews.Content: Walked in and was just appalled. I have stayed in some strange places but wow. I walked through the entire hotel and casino and could not believe it. Smelled, smoky, kids running everywhere, entire building is dated, carpet worn...etc. I did not even bother canceling my reservation. I just ate my losses and booked at the Luxor. Spend the extra $10 and stay at the Luxor. The Luxor is even close to all of the nicer casinos and compared to CC it is like staying in a suite at Aria. CC is in the middle of hell. Could not believe how crappy this place was. Unbelievable.

Reviews.Title: “Like a refugee camp without leaders”
Reviews.Author: poohbear98
Reviews.Content: We were absolutely disgusted and frustrated with the chaos that breeds from every corner of this place. The Front desk staff and managers are tin soldiers with attitiudes. They look right through you. No amount of money would make us come back and sleep there. The Adventure Dome is a good spot for young kids but that's about it. The entire hotel wreaks of smoke. You can't avoid it as you dart in and out of hundreds of fat loud people just to get from the elevator to your car. The room was clean but noisy. The Toilet wouldn't flush and a maintenance person showed up at 11 pm (we called it in at 9), left, then came back at midnight to replace the tank. I was sound asleep by the time he was done. They charge a $5 "resort fee" that includes High Speed Internet so technically, it's not free. Not to mention that we paid $90 for the night! Rip off. But even $50 would be too much.

Reviews.Title: “ok very old looking but cheep rude staff”
Reviews.Author: peterluv
Reviews.Content: the most rude croupiers ive ever come across dont argue with them they will not let you play on tables . i know this from experience , they need to review their staff their to old and look like they have had enough og workinh there try another hotel a bit more money but worth it

Reviews.Title: “if you paid more than $ 35 dollars a night you overpaid!!!”
Reviews.Author: ord1454
Reviews.Content: kids were everywhere, buffet was nasty, I was sick for 3 days afterwards, maid staightened up the bed, did not vacum or change towels in bathroom. still can't figure out why they even bothered.soap in bathroom smell like drain cleaner. casino drinks were watered down. cran vodka was kool-aid and something. other people in our party stayed in other rooms, said, ours in the tower, was 200% better but still nasty. this place makes the tropicana look 5 star, and its been here since the 70's too. out of 8 people in our party.... 8 said never again. it's not a circus it is a Jungle!!!!

Reviews.Title: “CIRCUS CIRCUS - GREAT TIME - GOOD VALUE”
Reviews.Author: DakTraveler
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at the Circus and we were very pleased. We stayed in the West Tower - king room - non smoking. Very clean, quiet and comfortable. This is a very large hotel so walking from one place to another can get you quite a bit of exercise. We ate at the buffet one evening and were very pleased with the quality and quantity of the food. Another evening we ate at the Garden restaurant and again were well pleased with the food and service. There are lots of children around but we like to watch them so no problem. I left my cell phone charger in the room and called when I got home and they are mailing it to me. Very helpful staff. All in all we enjoyed ourselves and will probably go back soon. DAKOTA TRAVELER

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Undisclosed Resort Fee”
Reviews.Author: caminowanderer53
Reviews.Content: The reviews that I read of this hotel were very mediocre. I stayed there anyway on Mar 24, 2010. I was pleasantly surprised that the room was spacious, clean and did not smell like smoke. The check in took 25 minutes which is, of course terrible, but seems to be common in Las Vegas. The most insulting thing was that although my room was prepaid via expedia, I had to pay a $5.50 "resort fee" on check in which included a pack of discount coupons..."free chips and salsa" at the bar....give me a break. I expalined that I was not interested in any of those coupons and did not wish to pay this previously undisclosed charge.....I was refused. Although this was not a lot of money, I felt that once a room is prepaid, the hotel has not right to unilateral add these kinds of charges. So, on principle I would never stay at at this hotel again because of this practice.

Reviews.Title: “SUCKED”
Reviews.Author: CarrieBennett67
Reviews.Content: the only reason we stayed here was for the kids... the adventure dome was CLOSED and so was the midway!!! They did not bother to tell us this when we made the reservations. It was a TOTAL let down for the kids. We took them to New York New York to play in the arcade there and ride the roller coaster... if we ever go back we will definitely NOT stay at Circus Circus.... Its not worth it...... the rooms were old smelling, and we stayed on the NEW side..... the windows you couldnt even see out of because of all the water stains that make them totally white....

Reviews.Title: “Never Stay Here- £1000 Worth Of Dollars Stolen From Our Room Whilst Sleeping!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hes123
Reviews.Content: NEVER AGAIN. Arrived exhausted after a day of travelling, so went to sleep at 7:30pm. My Mum woke me up in the middle of the night as she couldn't find her handbag. After searching around, we found our bags by the front of the room and walked in the bathroom to find the contents which our dollars were kept in ripped open and all the money gone. Immediately we contacted site security and they took an extended report and "upgraded" us to a better room (this was the only compromise for this horrific incident). We were referred to a department of the hotel called "Risk Management" and were ensured they'd update us as they investigated the incident. However, we didn't hear anything after 2 days so phoned them ourselves to be told the incident had been closed due to no entry on any keycards during 7:30pm-1am whilst we were asleep in our room and the money was taken. Also, convieniently the hotel claimed they didn't have CCTV down the corridors. Now, I assure you the door was definitely locked and even double-bolted. We went to the local police station and the police officer informed us that this is a regular occurence at Circus Circus and there are people with mastercards at the hotel who simply shouldn't have them. So for the rest of the holiday in Vegas we were wide awake at nights in fear that someone was going to enter our room and demand money. The thought of wakening up to someone else in our room going through our stuff and stealing is just sickening. For all we know, whoever stole from us could of been armed and it was simply disgusting the way the hotel simply dismissed the complaint and didn't provide any support whatsoever. The hotel itself was also equally as disgusting. It's overcrowded, stank and was seriously outdated. Stay away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great bang for the buck”
Reviews.Author: KennethL3
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers the comfort and fun of the Las Vegas strip without breaking your wallet. Fun for the whole family!

Reviews.Title: “Could have been worse..... I guess”
Reviews.Author: prncssangelchic
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 11pm.. Waited 1hr in line to check in.....only 4 people checking people in..... We finally got to the room at 1/4 to 11am and realized only one of our keys worked. The next day we got a new set and it was the same thing.... We only had three flat pillows and when we called the housekeeping number, nobody ever answered!!! I tried to find a housekeeper the next day on our floor and when i did she just told me to call the number and didn't speak english. I called the number again and got no answer. I have been a housekeeper myself and i would have gotten the customer a pillow or allowed her to take 1 towel off the cart to shower with.... Our room was so far away from everything and the discount book was a joke. Most things had to be redeemed somewhere else before the place to recieve the discount at... By the time we got to the main part of the strip we were too tired to do anything. The one day that we put the do not disturb sign out, housekeeping woke us up at 11am to ask when we were leaving!!!!! we still had another nights stay paid for and we had just gotten married the night before so we were extremely tired.... not staying here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel staffed with caring, helpful employees. You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: chiefd2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Circus Circus for 5 days in March 2010. Looking to save some money, we were attracted by the low weekly rates and the many places to eat listed on their website. However, once we arrived we discovered it's a much older hotel, with most of the resturants closed during the week to save labor costs. The rooms are very basic with low end bedding, TVs and furniture. Long lines at Check-In are caused by staffing shortages at the front desks. However, I was impressed with the positive attitude and helpful nature of most of the hotel staff. The front desk supervisors were directly involved to resolve a few minor issues with our room. Ms. Pamela Li, front desk supervisor was extremely helpful and conducted herself in a very polite, professional manner. She seemed to genuinely care about fixing our problems so we could enjoy our vacation. We had a great time in Las Vegas, but would not stay at CC in the future.

Reviews.Title: “There are better places to stay”
Reviews.Author: Milweiser
Reviews.Content: We choose Circus Circus because we were traveling to Las Vegas with our kids ages 4 and 6 and it would be their first visit to the city and we wold only be in town for a day. Knowing we had limited time it made sense to stay there so we could do some rides and the midway, and in that respect it was a good choice, but given other circumstances, I would stay elsewhere in the future.. Service: Upon arrival around 4pm on a Saturday there was a small line at checkin, maybe 6 families ahead of us. We moved through the line quickly and although we had reserved a room in the main tower we were placed in the Skyrise tower with amazing views of the north strip. It was an easy checkin, and the man that helped us was friendly and gave us some great info on things to check out with our kids. The Resort: I have been visiting this resort for 30 years and the biggest issue I have is the design when they added on. All the casinos in Vegas are fairly big, but most were designed that way. Circus Circus seems to just have buildings and parking structures dropped wherever there was room at the time so to walk from the Skyrise tower to the main midway is literally 10+ minutes. In addition since its mostly families you are dodging strollers, and one thing that comes with the low price is rude people which was a big issue for me. Our kids only went on a couple rides and I am glad we didn't buy an all day pass because the Adventuredome was packed and the lines were very long. Its probably better suited for older kids that are of age to roam around on their own. Since my kids are small and we accompanied them to the rides it was a tedious experience to say the least. The main midway and Circus acts really feel like they did in the 80's with a lot of the same games, however the crowd is more of a Chuck E Cheese with children that are not well behaved and are willing to step over the little kids to get to what they want. The staff however at the main midway were wonderful with the kids and the circus acts we saw (trapeze and acrobats) were awesome as always. The pool area is small, but I cam only speak to that from the view from my room, because the pools close at 5pm. Yep thats right, its Vegas, the city that never sleeps yet at a resort geared for kids who LOVE to swim, there was no pool open at 7pm when we wanted to take a dip. This for me is a deal breaker and probably one of the main reasons I will never stay at the hotel again. Rooms: We were in a room in the skyrise tower, is was large enough for our family, the carpet looked fairly new, there was granite in the bath area and it felt very clean. This was a typical room for a budget hotel in Vegas, and I have no complaints about our room with the exception of the beds. The pillows were thin, the blankets were thin and the beds were hard as rocks. The towels were fluffy soft but we only had three and when I called down for more, it took 2 hours to get them and buy then I didn't need them anymore. My suggestion is to call down for extra towels and pillows upon arrival. You do get a great funbook when you check in that includes free high speed Internet, two rides in the Dome, two midway games, free drinks and a few other things, so its not all bad, its just not all good. In summary, its still the same old Circus Circus, overrun by kids and people pushing strollers. If you have young kids and don't have a lot of time it will work, but honestly if you are going to be in Vegas for any amount of time I would stay at Excalibur where its still kid friendly and smack in the middle of a great group of hotels versus this one which is in the middle of nowhere and overrun by kids. Its a great place to visit for the day, but I don't know that I would ever stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: nixtrips
Reviews.Content: My kids had a blast. They spent a lot of time on the kiddy games. The shows were very child-friendly and at regular intervals. The trapeze artiste was simply amazing !! Will definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “fun for kids but didnt enjoy the dirty carpet and unmade bed”
Reviews.Author: whiteloops
Reviews.Content: When we came in it took about 40 mins to check in and when we finally got to the room our carpet was dirty and the bed was unmade without pillowcases. But after the stay was okay, but the bed made my back ache. My son enjoyed the amusement park on the second floor, and we also enjoyed the breakfast buffet that was pretty delicious. While checking out though we ended up having to walk down the steps (7 floors) because the elevator was soo backed up with people checking in and out. So the stay was good and bad at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: travelingaddict15
Reviews.Content: Although it is right at the end of the strip, this hotel is still in a really good location, as the strip is only a straight road and no matter where you stay you will always have to walk somewhere! The staff are very friendly and the hotel accommodates for everything (although there may be a charge for this haha!) The indoor casino is not as lavish as the others but no other hotel has circus acts dancing and performing above you while you gamble! I enjoyed staying here and would definitely recommend it to other travelers who like to look after their money, as it is amazing for value!

Reviews.Title: “More like a Zoo than a Circus!!”
Reviews.Author: lbouchard33
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Las Vegas (1st time was 10 yrs ago) and both times we stayed at Circus Circus. We checked in on a Monday night at 11pm. The check in line was extremely long and took us about 45 minutes before we were waited on. They were completely understaffed with only 3 clerks to check in a HUGE amount of people. This didn't seem to matter to the clerks, they didn't move any faster. Knowing that the West Tower rooms are the most up to date rooms, my goal was to get a room there. After a very long time searching through every possibility, the clerk offered us a suite with a jacuzzi tub (but only slept 2 and there were 4 of us) or we had to take a room in the main tower. He said that there were rooms in the West Tower that hadn't been cleaned, so there was nothing he could do. He considered this room in the main tower to be an upgrade from the original room they had us booked in. I said "we're not going to be overlooking a roof or something, are we?" he assured me that we were not. YEAH - RIGHT!!! The room was not only overlooking a nasty roof, but the carpets were stained, the bedding was stained, the lamp shade was torn and left that way..... need I say more? We slept there (I didn't sleep) that night and called to the front desk in the morning to request a room in the West Tower. I must say that they were very accommodating and after holding for a few minutes, came back to the line and said we have a room ready for you now in the West Tower. The room in the West Tower was SO much better than the first room we were in. Still, by all means, NOT an upscale place by any stretch of the imagination, but well worth the $30/night price tag. We had a rental car and actually liked staying on that end of the strip. It was much easier to get around in without being stuck in the strip traffic. The hotel lobby, shops, casinos, Adventure Dome, and all public areas of the hotel were clean and in good shape. However, like the title says, it was definitely more like a ZOO than a Circus!! There were mobs and mobs of people there.... obviously, for the same reason we were there... the price! We went into just about every other hotel there and never saw a check in line anything like at Circus Circus. Despite the fact that most of their rooms are disgusting and in desperate need of a complete overhaul, Circus Circus is busy raking in the $$$$.

Reviews.Title: “Worth 30/night for a week”
Reviews.Author: NjVacationer1
Reviews.Content: We booked this room primarily on the price, 30/night for five nights and wanted to stay somewhat on the strip. What can I say, you get what you pay for. Our stay included free internet and we check in at 10am without any fee and was quick. We just had to check our bags because the room wasn't ready. We get into the room. The air conditioning was not working. We called downstairs and sent someone and the unit was replaced. Room was clean but old( Stay in the West tower) but can't complain since we just stayed to sleep. Its Vegas, you spend your days walking from Hotel to Hotel. Lots of Kids roaming the casino and hotel looks like it did probably when it first opened. Many prostitutes hang out by the adventure down entrance during late hours as I was a approached a few times. Peoples seem to be trashy as in one incident when a couple were sitting down near the buffet and the guy was in the woman's lap while she was picking his teeth. Also, I would not spend a dime here on gambling and went over to Belaggio, Wynn, Paris, and Venetian. The pool area looks like it has the original pools from the 60s and was towards the back of the hotel and not nice at all. Only good thing about this hotel is slot-a-fun outside. Had 2 dollar hot dogs, beers, and margaritas. Would go over there to drink before hitting the clubs. This place is 10X worst than the oldest hotel in Atlantic City as I have stayed there(Resorts) If you want a place to sleep for 30/night and not expect much, then stay here. If you are looking for more of a luxurious vacation with more perks and nice restaurants and better location, I recommend staying at Aria or Vdara as they are the newest and not too expensive hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel to enertain Teenagers”
Reviews.Author: Msbizzy
Reviews.Content: Went with family stayed here thought because I was only 17 I couldn't do anything but My mom had got me and my cousins all day passes for rides and had a blast. While they went out gambling.

Reviews.Title: “The Big Top”
Reviews.Author: KoreyN
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, only down side was there were soo many kids runnin around.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Saiakita
Reviews.Content: we have stayed here 4 times now. Tried other hotels on the strip, but why pay more than you need to when all you need is a clean place to sleep and a shower? Looking quite dated now, but found rooms, reception, eateries and communal areas clean and tidy. We always do the $20 bill trick and get a complimentary upgrade each time. Rooms are large, with 2 queen beds, fridge,tv, safe and a large adequate bathroom. casino areas large and bright with plenty waitresses to bring you complimentary drinks. Buffet has lots of choice for adults and kids. steak house superb and garden cafe has lots of choice. Make sure you get comps card as we manage to get enough credit to pay for a weeks worth of Wi-Fi and a couple of nights accomodation too. 2 pool areas with whirlpool and snack bar for drinks and food. Location wise it's a bit of a walk to the rest of the strip, but for $7 you do get unlimited rides on the "Deuce", a bus service which runs 24 hours a day up and down the strip and to Freemont Street too. All in all, i would say that you get what you pay for, and at Circus Circus is a great place to stay for not a lot of money. Would definately recommend this hotel and we are going back for 10 days in May 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money...”
Reviews.Author: Dromomaniac
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in January and only paid US$25/night - so, believe me, we were not expecting much!
