We went for the cheapest room available as we weren't planning to spend any time in the room & wanted to get out & see all the sights. It turned out that we were upgraded to the building above reception & the room was lovely. It is newly and tastefully decorated with new beds, flat screen TV and marble bathroom. Very nice. The only thing we found to be dirty was the window - you could barely see through it! As for the rest of the hotel, it's kitsch, tacky and very Vegas - we loved it! It IS older, it IS tasteless and over the top, but that's just what we wanted - we couldn't walk through the place without smiling at the tackiness of it all! they were painting walls (HOT pink) and replacing carpet when we were there. We did the all day dining plan for 2 days that we were there 7 found it amazing value. I was concerned due, to the reviews here, that it would be dreadful, but it was great. baby bocconcini salad and the roasts were my favourite; the kids loved making their own softserve ice creams, my husband loved the pastas and the pastries - we all found thing that we loved & for the five of us, including tax, it came to US$90 - for breakfast, lunch, dinner, snacks, tea and coffee, fruit juices & sodas all day long. Excellent value. We'll definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for kids too”
Reviews.Author: Anacortes42
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel twice, one with friends and again with my kids. Though its not the most luxurious it was clean and the rooms are decent, the buffet is great, the kids loved it, the Adventure dome kept the kids busy for a little while and the carnival type games are fun. Didn't care for the cheap circus acts. Within walking distance to the Stratosphere, and if you want to walk the strip and see everything this is a good starting point.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: rookiecanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed from thursday feb25/2010 to march 1/2010 an the service was great!!!!! We needed extra pillows for our room they had them to our room within 20 mins We stayed in the west tower of circus circus an the room was all newly done It had dark chocolate furniture with marble tops,mintgreen duet covers on two queen size beds,big side chair ,.marble top side table .we had a a great stay at this hotel .we have been staying here for 6 years on the nascar weekend an have never had a bad time.P.S also found the price great !!!!

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: averagejoe77
Reviews.Content: I dont even know where to begin? lets start with the staff a bunch of rude to busy to do anything for you illegals.(meaning none of them spoke any english?) The lobby was a picture out of katrina a bunch of lost people everywhere kids running around unsupervised and the place stunk like the dump mixed with the urinal at the ball park!Then to make the whole horrible experience even worse the reason we came to this delapetated hotel was the adventuredoom, and when we booked our room we made it perfectly clear thats why we were staying there, it was shut down for routine maintenance, i dont have a problem with them working on it but when you book your room and specifically tell the person who's booking the room a employee of the hotel! Thats why your staying there and they tell you its all up and running then i find that pretty discusting, in an economy where people are barely making it and we plan a vacation to this place and we are treated like third class citizens than ya i find that pretty disapointing. So if your reading this and your trying to make your mind up to stay here, please heed my warning it will be very, very disapointing!!!!!!! We ended up going to the Royal Resort one block south and stayed it was an absoulute delight. everything was super clean and quiet and the staff were so nice and wanted to do anything they could to make your stay as best as they could.The rooms were absoulutely unbeleivablely clean and up to date with flat screens and balconies, it made our stay here in Las Vegas a lot better, so if your comoing here to Las Vegas and you want to go to the adventuredoom than take my advise and dont stay at circus circus stay somewhere close and walk to circus circus if you want quality for your money than beleive me Royal Resorts are well worth $10 dollars more a night!!!!!!! By the way we are locals and we have stayed all over Las Vegas and circus circus was and will remain the worst hotel i have ever set foot in my 40 years on this earth!!!!!!! Im just a concerned citizen that wants what i pay for, we all work way to hard to throw our money away on these hotels that think we dont have a choice, they think because theyre circus circus then people will put up with this kind of krap to stay there for the adventuredoom, well some of us are smarter than that. please beleive me i have 5 kids and they all love the circus and the rides and such but i care more for my kids than to put them in an environment where the staff could care less if its sanitary for my children. As disapointing as it is for my children we will never ever set foot in that discusting hotel again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “What do you expect for $47/night”
Reviews.Author: PhilnBec
Reviews.Content: We stayed the Circus Circus hotel for 4 nights and then added an additional 4 nights (however i wish we took advantage of the other hotels great rates). We are in the US for 5 months and have a pretty strict budget. Pretty much the title sums this place up. We paid $50/night for the newly upgraded West Tower rooms and they were fine. They are clean and modern and the beds were comfortable. There is no fridge and any of the rooms (unless you request one for $15/night) but they do now offer free wireless internet (its slow (~100k/sec). If you are coming with kids this would be a good place to stay. The Adventuredome is heaps of fun and there is circus shows on every 30mins from 10am - 12 midnight. However, the circus is full of smoke so if you care for your kids well being, i guess it would not be such a great place. The cheap rooms generally make everything else cheap around the place. The Cafe that is open was OK in price and the buffet is cheap also. Drinks are cheap at "slots of fun" so if you are looking for a stay in Vegas on a budget this is an OK place to spend it. However, all that "cheapness" results in cuts all over the place. There is never enough staff on the check in/out desk. There is generally only one bar maid at each bar. Pretty much when u finally get a drink, you join the line to get the next one. They go on about having 3 pools however only one was open (I assume to cut costs on heating and life guards at the others). They have this HAWKER alley where you have to walk from casino to casino that are forever asking you to buy their cheap crap. This is OK at first but wears thin after about 1 hour. The final nail in the coffin for me was when we asked to stay another 4 nights they made us move from the 33rd floor with a great view to the 9th floor with a view of the filthy roof of the casino. We spent most of the morning trudging around the casino from one room to another. When I complained no one apologised or even seemed to care. If it wasn't for my partner I would have checked out immediately. I would recommend that people take advantage of other hotels great rates. For example the Luxor (4 star) has a rate of $140 for 3 nights at the moment. If you stay for 6 nights its cheaper than Circus Circus anyway! To sum it all up. This place is OK but you get what you pay for. If u are happy with poor service throughout the hotel, stay here because its cheap and the rooms in the West Tower are decent. Don't expect anything more than this.

Reviews.Title: “Bette Midler here me come!!!!”
Reviews.Author: RhondaR9
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I went to see Bette, we were seated 2 rows from the stage, I could reach out and touch her...She did her Mermaid routine and Pink dolls. She sang her beautiful awesome songs, that made me cry. She was fantastic. My girls and I also rode the Monorail and toured Ceasars Palace, the Mirage and several other beautiful constructed hotels. I took my 2 grandbabies and they were so good while we were there. Spent one day in the pool and even in the pool you were still hot. Weather was around 90 degrees. It was a great trip. MEMORIES!!!!

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: debyasdan
Reviews.Content: cheap and cheerful !! basic accomodation but who cares when all you need is a hot shower and a bed?

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Renee1972
Reviews.Content: Took my kids to Vegas for their first family vacation. Was very impressed with Circus Circus. Rooms were very clean and although there were a lot of people at the casino, there was no noise in the hallways. I would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: sunshineangel19772
Reviews.Content: If you are on a budget its the place to stay. Its a basic hotel with basic rooms. Its very affordable and well worth the stay. I have stayed here several times with no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “IF YOU CAN AFFORD IT, STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE”
Reviews.Author: ssprig
Reviews.Content: our room was comfortable & clean but the hotel common areas & casinos were not clean. the food at the buffet was mostly deep fried & was so salty it caused me to be thirsty for the rest of the evening & nite. the main cafe is under construction so our 2nd choice was the garden cafe, & it was ok, altho not memorable. they do offer an all you can eat prime rib dinner, available every nite for $13.99. i suppose it is good value for the money, my husband enjoyed it several times, but i don't eat food that greasy, so it became a challenge for me to find something. all of the staff is friendly & helpful. along the common walkways of circus circus is what i called "hawkers row" .........a series of tiny vendor shops, all set up like mall sidewalk sale events set up........& these vendors are constantly calling out to you........ "EXCUSE ME MISS, WHERE ARE YOU FROM" "EXCUSE ME SIR, CAN I ASK YOU ONE QUESTION" as you try to get around within the hote & casino areas, this becomes annoying very early on. the area surrounding the hotel is very much in transition. when they imploded the stardust, (which was 2 properties down from circus circus) i expected that there would be a new casino in it's place, however the building was halted in the early stages of construction, i heard that the company went bankrupt. also, the corner directly north of circus circus houses another such abandoned project. this creates a huge void in the interest of this area. he strip doesn't really become interesting until you go quite a way south to the fashion mall corner. this is the point at which i would say you would be able to have some fun sight-seeing, going south from that corner. if you have children & are considering bringing them for some fun, i am sure that the kids do indeed have fune there, but be aware that this hotel is extremely smoke-filled. internet will cost an additional $15.00/day.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MichaelF7
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling with children then this Hotel will be good for you. It has a full size theme park in the hotel. Great entertainment for the entire family.

Reviews.Title: “When was the last time the carpets where cleaned?”
Reviews.Author: Cynsween
Reviews.Content: I booked online last minute and was able to get a room for under $150. I had been here 10 years ago for a wedding but had elected to stay in a nicer hotel. I read that they had remodeled and thought that I would give it try since I had my 17 and 2 year old with us. The room looked clean but the carpet was filthy. I wouldn't let my son take his white socks off which where black by the time we checked out the next day. There was black hair on the blanket and a make up stain on the top sheet. The fitted sheet had a blood stain on it, it had been washed but was stained, they should have thrown it out. The food in the buffet was barely edible, I have had better food in a school cafeteria. It was a very unpleasant stay. I wuld not make that mistake again.

Reviews.Title: “watch your stuff”
Reviews.Author: traveller6005
Reviews.Content: If not a bit dated (but fun) generally ok, while we were there, feb 2010 housekeeping (possibly ?) left the door to our room WIDE open (we left @ 09.00, returned 22.00) . Front desk didn't respond, neither did housekeeping (even though they suggested guest security was important, and they would investigate my complaint) with any acceptable explanation. Make your own mind up. Be warned

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay again for free”
Reviews.Author: ydnicMichigan
Reviews.Content: Where do I even start! I booked the Circus Circus through a vacation package with US Air. They listed the hotel as a 3 diamond..they are crazy. I went with my daughter and nephew on a 4 day get away. We booked 2 rooms with the package and were told the Skyrise tower was remodeled and has pillow top beds. My room was a complete disaster. The beds were older than I am ( and my daughter is old enough to gamble) , the sheets were stained with black stuff. My shower curtain had toothpaste smeared all over it. I moved the nightstand to plug in my cell phone and there was a pornographic magazine and a nasty rubber glove on the floor!! The window was so dirty I would not touch it to try to open it. My heat register was full of peanuts and would not turn on. My nephews room had no soap or shampoo and had the same old nasty beds. I called down stairs and they offered to change our rooms. When we went down to the other floor the hallway was party central. Adults running up and down the halls acting like idiots and the smell of pot was overwhelming. We decided to go off the property to eat and maybe find another place to stay. After several hours we came back and decided to spend one night there. The final straw was the ice machine didn't work. After a 10 minute walk we made it down to the check in desk and spoke with the manager. She upgraded us to a mini suite in another tower. The rooms were very large with nice beds, but still no 3 diamond. The windows were so old that I thought there was a heat vent on the floor, it was the wind blowing through the windows! My hair dryer did not work and my nephews television worked only if it wanted to. My faucet on the shower was so hard to turn off that I had to use both hands. I also had a family with a newborn next to me and could hear it crying. My nephews room had two large windows on either side, both with a view of a brick wall. No coffee pots in the rooms. The safe costs 50 cents every time you open it. The property is over run with little kids and you walk forever to get from one spot to another. There are sales people everywhere asking you to try something. I did not even attempt to eat there. I have stayed at several hotels (TI, Mirage, Terribles, Riviera and the Orleans) in Vegas and do not consider my self a picky person, but this hotel is way below my standards. Believe all the bad reviews and book somewhere else. I tried to look at the good reviews and give them a chance, I wish I would have listened to the bad.

Reviews.Title: “worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: tonyndave
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Circus Circus as it was the cheapest hotel we could find in Vegas. It was our first stay there and we didnt know what to expect. We booked Main Tower rooms which were modern and nice. A lot nicer than the rest of the hotel. If your going for the first time and only need a hotel to sleep in then Circus is for you. If you want to relax and make use of the resorts then go some where else like MGM! Its really is what you make of it! Dont expect super resort style. But worth the money

Reviews.Title: “FUN”
Reviews.Author: bmhare
Reviews.Content: Nice place especially if you have young children. We didnt really win there spending gads of cash but it was a fun family getaway for the most part.

Reviews.Title: “First Vegas Visit”
Reviews.Author: JoyceB3
Reviews.Content: We had a GREAT time! Went to see a few shows, did a lot of shopping, and even won a little at the games.

Reviews.Title: “fun time”
Reviews.Author: LatishaR
Reviews.Content: the indoor amusment park was fun,also the circus midway was cool if your planing to go in the summer i recommend that you make resevations or go on the internet to look for deals

Reviews.Title: “Very suprised on clean room, great price!”
Reviews.Author: nice27
Reviews.Content: i went with my fiance. we were both skeptical about booking with CC. friends had bad reviews like "dirty, falling apart, exc..". but i also did my research and saw many good online reviews. we didnt need anything super fancy,just basics, clean, comfy, good price & location. we wanted to spend more $$ on clubs and fun not on the room. I called in directly to book. Lisa was VERY helpful and HONEST about her which room to book. she said DO NOT book manor rooms. she informed me that the room i was booking had been remodeled and was alot nicer then the older rooms. i took her word and booked! (other rooms were in process of upgrades) we waited about 15 mins to get to counter for check in. which surprised us since the line was super long. they were very nice and offered to let us in our room even though we arrived very early. We stayed on the 16th floor of the west tower. Our room was very clean, no smoke smell, newer furniture and decor. nothing out of an aladdin movie lol. first thing i did...checked the bathroom..CLEAN! It was quiet and comfy..just what we wanted! the view was of the garage and mountains, but hey we didnt go to vegas to look out our window. house keeping was very prompt in bringing extra towels. our iron wasnt working so they brought a new one up right away. Ate once in the buffet, because the lines were always super long and the food wasnt the greatest, but hey it was cheap lol. the westside deli was actually very good, huge portions, couldnt finish our plates! we love food, so we tried alot of other places on the strip not just CC. overall, the food isnt top quality, but its worth the price! I didnt like that the rooms were way in the back and had to walk through everything to get to/from rooms/strip. The vendors didnt pressure us like some folks experienced. we said no they backed off. i didn't notice the "cigar room" smell alot of folks talked about, and im usually very sensitive to cig smoke. it was like any other casino. We headed out to walk the strip.CC is towards the end, it didnt seem that long, but it kind of caught up with me half way. but what else would you expect while walking for miles and drinking?! the housekeeping lady suggested we use the duece next time...BEST idea ever! cheaper than taxi, and the stops were at good locations unlike the Monorail. $5 for 24hours was a good deal! we took that thing everywhere! only bad part..no open containers of liquor..so just chug before you get on LOL even though the place is more focused on familes and kids, my fiance and i werent bothered by the screaming kids and familes. we just brushed it off. the adventure dome was actually fun! we enjoyed playing the carnival games and winning crap LOL it was worth the laughs! seemed like alot of parents dumped there kids there to hit the casino... overall, i would stay there again. for the price i wasnt expecting Bellagio service or rooms. but it also wasnt the nightmare people described. if you could ignore the kids and being towards the end of the strip...you'll enjoy it! just walk or duece! you're in vegas so have fun!!!

Reviews.Title: “It was good.”
Reviews.Author: AnthonyF3
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the new rooms. Costumer service was very good. inexpensive. I definitely recommend it, more so for families.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: c22b2v4
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Circus Circus for my Birthday party. The hotel is great value for money. It has everything you need under one roof. The rooms basic with 2 double beds in each room. We were on the 27th floor which had a great view of the strip and the lights of Vegas. The only thing that was disapointing was how far the pool was from the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “The WORST hotel I've ever stayed in...”
Reviews.Author: dewitthm
Reviews.Content: Dirty, disgusting, smelly...I would NEVER reccommend this to anyone. I felt like I needed a hepatitis shot after staying there!

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus”
Reviews.Author: adwiett
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice itself, however taking a trip from the casino to your hotel room and back down should not take an hour. There are not enough elevators for the amount of people who stay at the hotel. Also, it took us 2 hours to check-in in the middle of the night. I was not impressed at all and will never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at Circus Circus”
Reviews.Author: janeane_m
Reviews.Content: This hotel would be an excellent choice if you have children with you. However, just outside the hotel is NOT an appropriate area for kids. We had no children so we didn't spend much time in the hotel. The two meals we ate were average at best. The hotel service was poor. It was clean!

Reviews.Title: “on the strip, central, cheap, brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: chell3
Reviews.Content: very big,,,took a day to get used to the entrance. had a great deal on in november. we kept using the back entrance. rooms were comfortable. brilliant for kids because there is an adventure dome there and free circus acts everyday. this was my second time staying at this hotel, and if i was to visit again, i'd stay here. (Dublin)!!

Reviews.Title: “Great if you are looking for a cheap place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: ShannonS9
Reviews.Content: Circus Circus must be one of the oldest on the strip. I would have loved to stay at almost any other hotel on the strip but we were there for over a week and wanted a cheap place to stay. The room was like $35.00 a night. I was basic... no microwave, no mini fridge, no coffee maker. Beds were not exactly comfortable but I could hardly complain for how little we were paying. Linens were clean, room was clean, view was great, and we liked the buffet at Circus Circus more than we did the one at the much nicer Stratosphere! They have a Krispie Kreme, and some shopping. I would stay there again if were looking for cheap. If I had my choice I would have loved to stay at the Venetian!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: PassionRep
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Circus Circus in March of 2009 for Passion Parties Convention which was being held at the Hilton. I got a PHENOMENAL rate with one of their Deluxe Tower rooms that we basically a mini suite. The room was HUGE. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was cleaned every day and had a great closet/dressing area. The girls from my team would come to my room every morning for breakfast and we had more than enough room in my room for all of them. The room was away from everything and it was pretty quiet. I couldn't hear the neighbors next door. Occasionally I would hear someone out in the hall but not loudly enough to wake me up. I don't gamble. Therefor there is no reason to worry about me jumping to my death. So I loved that the room's windows opened enough for me to get some fresh air! The staff was pleasant and helpful. If I left the "Do Not Disturb" sign up on my door they did NOT clean my room. This may be something others take for granted but I have been in hotels before that just disregard this and clean the room anyway. Sometimes I don't want my room cleaned. Yes, the lobby and the casino are a bit run down compared to the other hotels on the strip. However, I'm also not paying through the nose to stay there, so I am more than happy to overlook it. I would rather pay $50 a night to stay here than pay $150 a night to stay somewhere else! I am NOT interested in paying almost as much as I do for my mortgage to stay somewhere for 1 week! When I'm in Vegas, I spend 90% of my time somewhere else. Who the hell needs to spend that much for a place to sleep? The only downside to the hotel was that not all of the elevators near the check in desk go to the same floors. So I got a bit lost but once I figured out how to maneuver them, I was fine. I'm staying there again at the end of February 2010 for Passion Parties Convention again! It's definitely a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus - not the Great Moscow Circus but still good value”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneMacca
Reviews.Content: The big top is showing her age after a few decades gracing the Strip. But staying with children at Circus Circus was relaxing and worthwhile. The circus acts upstairs are entertaining but the seating area is pretty small - get there ahead of time to get a seat. Also, the acts only last about 10 minutes then break for about 30. Still, they're free! The big shock was the check in line. We were lucky and got there just before the afternoon check in opened but within 15 minutes the queue was unbelieveable and stayed that way for over an hour. Try to be in the lobby early to check in. As for the rooms, they are fine - very comfortable and quiet. If you don't want to spend a packet and don't mind walking to see the best of the Strip, CC is a good choice but don't expect to use the pool in December. It's outdoor and closed for the season.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel too many kids”
Reviews.Author: LarellC
Reviews.Content: a great hotel nothing at all wrong with the service or hotel itself 100% satisfaction only thing i didn't like which is something that wont change is that it was too many kids running around unsupervised but since there is a theme park in the hotel i accepted

Reviews.Title: “Adventuredome a ripoff”
Reviews.Author: msdebagain
Reviews.Content: We paid 24.95 for one ticket so that my 16 yo could hang out all day at Adventuredome. After paying it, and going downstairs to gamble, my daughter calls me to tell me that most of the rides werent even open. 3 BIG rides were closed that day. There was no sign or anything around telling us that certain rides were closed. I've sent a letter to CC to hopefully get some of our money back. The people at Circus Circus seem like they'd rather be elsewhere. shame.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the Price”
Reviews.Author: spahkle19
Reviews.Content: A group of four girls went for a birthday weekend. Check in was a breeze, even though we arrived about an hour before "check-in" the front desk staff was super polite and asked me if we wanted a high or low room and was laughing and joking about the views from the room she picked for us. ( the view was of the Riv, but we were on the 29th floor) We stayed in the West Tower, which from what I hear was only recently renovated. The bedding and drapes don't quite match, but I wasn't there to critique the interior decorator, I was there to celebrate! The staff was great when we called down and asked for extra pillows and towels, and brought them up within half an hour of our request. They did shut off the water over night for maintanence, (which we forgot at 4 am) and when the toilet backed up, which was our own fault, the facilities staff was quick to come up and unclog it for us. The walls are a bit thin ,we could hear the kids next door watching TV, but thats why they make earplugs. :). The consierge service was great when we decided to buy tickets for the Luxor's Titanic exhibit and they got us discounted passes to the show. The Casino itself is super smoky, but I guess you just expect that in Vegas. The midway was fun, I won about 8 stuffed animals, did better there than I did at the slots! :) Its defintley an older hotel, and made more for families, but the beds are comfy (considering I arrived with a head cold and spent most of the first afternoon sleeping, it was as comfortable as one can be when they can't breathe:) ) and the price is reasonable. It is FAR north on the strip, luckily for us, one of the girls in our group was a local, so we had a car, so I can see the downside of it being so far north if your don't have your own transportation. Saw a peek at the "manor" house, not gonna lie, that skeeved me out. I wouldn't stay there...but the tower was nice for the price. :)

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus”
Reviews.Author: robind681966
Reviews.Content: Upgraded from a Manor room in the hotel to a suite .Newly updated with calming colors, nice bathroom and had a view of the strip

Reviews.Title: “6 days 5 nights beautiful”
Reviews.Author: ceddyced
Reviews.Content: we were on the 34 flr. lovely view over lookin the blvd. had a amazing time

Reviews.Title: “Smoke”
Reviews.Author: JasonD4
Reviews.Content: The Room was so full of Cigarette smoke I had a head ache for 2 days after

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: MardyLardy
Reviews.Content: Not the most convenient location on the strip, but great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: HollandBc
Reviews.Content: I stayed with friends in 2 rooms. It was ok. we stayed in small cabins beside the main hotel, and hallway carpet was dirty, but for the price was ok

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus”
Reviews.Author: JoyceB2
Reviews.Content: The hotel was run down, the staff unhelpful, and they had vendors in the hotel that harrassed you every time you when by them.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but clean”
Reviews.Author: CandanceE
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a wonderful indoor park with lots of rides, many places to eat, good breakfast buffet!

Reviews.Title: “Not central location.....”
Reviews.Author: BexBrebs
Reviews.Content: Hotel is just off the end of strip...other end of MGM. Our room was not in the actual hotel but in D block out the hotel and across the road. Room was fine...just unfornate was not in hotel...

Reviews.Title: “So very dirty”
Reviews.Author: Migmad01
Reviews.Content: Big rooms but so very dirty. Don't even think of taking your shoes off, the carpets are terrible!

Reviews.Title: “Circus, Circus: cough, cough”
Reviews.Author: Toni527
Reviews.Content: If you're not a smoker and don't like second hand smoke, stay out of here. We went across the street to the Riviera and the air was much clearer there. I've often heard the opinion that Las Vegas is better than Atlantic City. No way! In my opinion, it is a dirty depressing city with foul air.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Saints999
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location. Taxi to the strip quicker than walking Terry.

Reviews.Title: “hotel circus circus”
Reviews.Author: HermanT4
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel , super kitchen, relatively cheap, quality, quantity , hmmmm

Reviews.Title: “indoor street vendors”
Reviews.Author: tarts052
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Circus Circus several times, and after this last trip, I will not stay there again. On the pomenade deck (you have to walk through to get anywhere) there are always at least 4 pushy salesmen trying to get your attention to buy their crap. I don't mind that they are there, but they are down right annoying. I am on vacation, if I wanted to be hassled 3 to 4 times a day, I can just stay at work. Also, the West tower rooms are nice, but we were put in the skyrise tower and the beds were Super hard. Also, you have to pay 12 bucks a day to access WIFI internet.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed it, will be back.”
Reviews.Author: jerry4444
Reviews.Content: i enjoyed the hotel and its many shops. rooms offered good value and all day buffet 20.00 plus tax a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: ejgri3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in January 2010. We chose Circus Circus because it was the cheapest option on the strip. Best decision we could have made. Although the casino itself is a bit old and dated, and doesn't have the same level of opulence as the other places on the strip, the rooms were excellent and thats really all you can ask for. Comfortable beds and a good sized bathroom. One gripe I would have is the location. It takes a very long time to walk to the popular end of the strip (30-45mins) from the hotel, I would recommend either sturdy shoes or taking the las vegas deuce bus ($3 a ride) which goes right down the strip,

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned hotel compared to others in vegas!”
Reviews.Author: casey+jenny
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the circus circus after arriving in Vegas a night early, we didn't book and just arrived at the hotel and got a room at the front desk, was a long que and the reception area was packed with people! they offered us a room in the new part of the bullding at an amazing rate of what worked out to be around £30.00. I was quite shocked because the room was lovely! Very spacious! with a very Large bed and a huge bathroom!! The hotel in general was not bad but very dated! if you are after a bit of the old Vegas, then stay here because it is definatly that! Also lots to do in this hotel with the circus and the amument park inside the hotel for the kids! Also may resturants to choice from! The only let down of this hotel is how far away it is from the heart of the strip! Vegas is Huge anyway but becuase this hotel is quite a walk we could'nt make it back had to jump into a taxi! I would only recomend this hotel if you have kids and want to try to keep them entertained otherwise, if you want to be at the heart of it all try one of the other Many hotels!!

Reviews.Title: “Just fine....”
Reviews.Author: UKLasVegasLover
Reviews.Content: It was my first time to the States and as a UK resident i found it just perfect, there were no doubts what so ever about this hotel. Our first stay was fine and we had a great wide window with a brilliant view, the only bad point i must say is the pool is a little scatty and worn down! it was full of older people who have obviously over tanned. If going out for a fag on your own try and take someone, i was approached by alot of old men aswell as women asking me to work with them (prostututes) around the hotel area near all the restaurants. I didn't eat there much at all as the restaurants there are a bit pricey, however the buffet there is amazing! as a brit any food weather its greasy or not is brilliant, they had a wide range of different foods from savoury to muffins and pancakes and free re-fills, i think it costs about 20 dollas or less for breakfast, it certainly fills you up throughout the day! There is a few places around... opposite there is the Rivera which has a diner called Kadys and the portions there are just as good, and steaks the size of your head! In the hotel the beds very very comfy, i haven't had a goods night sleep in forever... the cleaner topped up our toiletries daily and gave us plenty! I heard some people do complain about smoking but its Vegas! what do you expect? you can smoke in every hotel so the smell will stick with you with your stay. I stayed in a non smoking room but in the corridors it did still smell of smoke but did not seep through the door. There is also a CVS shop which is a bit like a boots but way better just up from circus circus, google it before you go! its perfect to stash up on the little things such as drinks and crisps as-well as chocolates. At the stratosphere hotel just a 10 min walk away is another restaurant called Roxys which is a 50's diner with women doing hoolahoops and singing whilst you eat on roller-skates, this is defiantly good for kids who want to have fun whilst eating! i ordered a hotdog thinking it would be small as i wasn't that hungry and it was a foot long - be aware of the size of the portions they are HUGE! but worth the money. I had no problem with the hotel in all, within the room the tv channels were all fine and alot of you been framed american version was on so thats good for kids too as-well as adults. Oh another point try your best NOT to touch the rails on anything, i got around 300+ electric shocks from that hotel and every-other one, as vegas is so dry it does cause a hell of a lot of electricity so be aware and watch where you touch! all in all this isn't the best hotel to stay as it is far away from the strip! catch the deuce bus just outside as it stops outside each hotel and its around 3 dollas a day or 15 for 3 days, its worth getting this, i learnt this the hard way by using the monorail at the Sarah which was double the price plus a fair walk down back to circus circus which can really hurt your feet after a long day... oh remember to wear sensible shoes! i learnt the hard way by getting 11 blisters which caused me to have to walk on bare feet in nearly every hotel

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable they get away with serving such sub-par food”
Reviews.Author: aprildon6
Reviews.Content: We chose Circus Circus because of price and proximity to the trade show we were attending. The hallways of the hotel reeked of cigarette smoke and the room was okay. The most unbelievable thing was the extremely poor quality of the food. I am NOT a picky eater, but I couldn't bring myself to eat the chicken caesar salad I got from the "Barista Bagels and More". My partner got a sandwich and chips. Both his chips and my croutons were sopping wet soggy. Totally gross and inedible, especially for the price. I would recommend shopping for food at the convenience stores within the hotel, rather than eat at hotel restaurants. After this experience, we were afraid of the steak house food quality, so ended up eating an Auntie Anne's pretzel dog. That was the best thing we ate. Also, when I walk around the streets of Vegas, I expect to be solicited, but NOT when I'm trying to do business in the hotel. I was solicited by men and women working for the perfume shop, midway stands and massage place INSIDE the hotel. I know you get what you pay for, but this was really, really poor.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: travelboy447
Reviews.Content: I chose Circus Circus for the alleged "Kid Friendly Environment". Upon arriving at the Hotel, We Waited in line for over half an Hour to check in. Upon getting into our room, the smell of cigarette smoke was overwhelming. Room ceiling and Walls were stained from the Cigarette smoke, the Window had a 1 inch gap in the frame and there was either paper towel or toilet paper stuffed in the cracks and gaps around the window frame trying to keep the cold air out. I along with my wife and Three children stayed in two adjoining rooms for 4 nights and never had our rooms cleaned by staff, the only thing they did was exchange the bath towels. When walking around the Hotel and shops, employees would crowd you and try to force you to buy products and will not take "No" for an answer unless you are rude to get them away. The lines in the restaurants were ridiculous, most wait times were around an hour to be seated. The hotel itself is very dark and gloomy inside and the smell of cigarette smoke is overwhelming throughout and you will leave smelling like cigarettes. The Adventure dome is overpriced for what is offered and the staff running the rides are very rude and unprofessional. Almost all the children in the adventure dome were unsupervised by parents or staff. On one ride, a rider puked all over the ride and they did not shut it down and clean it until I had to make a complaint about it. My family and I toured several other hotel and Casino's while in Vegas, Circus Circus doesn't even compare to the competition regarding cleanliness, and Kid Friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Run Circus run”
Reviews.Author: Teresathomas
Reviews.Content: The check in clerk was fantastic but as far as the room, can you say black cob webs hanging overhead and the alternating hot cold shower was maddening. A child would not be safe in there. Overall I realize the hotel is older but the rooms can still be clean. Beware of room number 2103 in Manor B. Run fast!!!!

Reviews.Title: “bait and switch”
Reviews.Author: Bluelion137
Reviews.Content: booked the deluxe room That was newly re-redone ,sure maybe back in the 90s , blood on the bathroom walls the water pressure in the shower was high and low .the rug the the room was worn out. the beds were clean and soft had a good sleep. the astropark was never opened. bait and switch.. every time you went to the casino, someone tries to sell you something.. internet 12.00 a day $$$. more like jurcus circus

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelpangs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Circus Circus in September - October 2008 for a period of 3 days. This was my first visit to Las Vegas and did all my bookings online. Tripadvisor reviews were a great help, but at the same time the number of mixed reviews in here confused me a bit. We liked the budget of circus circus since we had decided that we wanted to spend our cash in the casinos. So that's how we decided to go for Circus Circus. The drive from LA to Vegas was totally exhausting, so we crashed the moment we reached Vegas. The hotel beat our expectations by a good margin (it is a massive hotel complex), the check-in line was long given the number of tourist buses coming in but the service at the front desk was quick and before i could park my car my wife was ready with the room keys. There are a number of shows and activities going on all the time and the hotel is right on the boulevard so you can walk to most casinos (but given the length of the boulevard it can be a very lengthy walk for some at the other end of the strip) The rooms were very good, comfortable and clean. We didn't order any room service so cant comment on that. I end my review here with just one comment for a first time traveller on a budget or for some one who is in las vegas to soak in the atmosphere - Book Circus circus, save the cash and use it in the casinos to test your luck.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for a great price”
Reviews.Author: whereisned
Reviews.Content: We had no complaints about this hotel, for the price you pay...it is everything you need. We had a refurbished West Tower room and the room was as nice as a 4 star property, without the extra's like a fridge and minibar. I'm sure you can live without these when there are drinks available right downstairs!! We found the hotel very clean, staff friendly and all the ammenties you could need. Fair enough, it was bust with families, but what do you expect with a hotel that has 3800 rooms? If you want quite, I don't think you should be in Vegas....or you need to be staying off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “3rd Time is not a charm”
Reviews.Author: apodasr
Reviews.Content: Is Circus Circus clean? not really, are the rooms new, nope, just new wall paper, new carpet, - were the sheets clean????nope - found what looked like my cat's hair ball the list goes on if you withdraw any funds out of the ATM there - your next transaction is "you are over your limit"...thus sending you to the cashier for a higher fee transaction is the food - no way - did the kids have fun in the dome - the first night 50% of the rides, games were closed, and this was Friday Night, on Sunday the rides were open, but for $8.00 a ride....! Yes we brought the wrist band, but still... the food in the dome was cold...the only reason we think the rides were open was because of a paid event, walking past any of the vendors was not pleasent...they step in your way, touch you to make you stop...too aggressive!!!! Internet access was $12.00 when you can have it free at other hotels cover youself up when you get in the shower - the spray was like a thousand pieces of sand hitting you at once - painful a few television stations, no kids stations and this place caters to children???? stay somewhere else and visit the rides for the day... not worth the cheap rates pools were shut down (all of them)

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but ok”
Reviews.Author: luvsthetravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is VERY cheap so it is bound to be a little bit nasty. At the end of the day though, I hope no one goes to Vegas to sit in their hotel room. If your looking at a more lavish stay, stay at the Bellagio or the Venetian. This hotel is also a decent walking distance to the middle of the strip. This hotel is fine and a little quirky....It's not the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheer but a bit out the way”
Reviews.Author: Pikes285
Reviews.Content: Ok, the Circus Circus is not the most glamourous hotel on the strip, but then if it was it wouldn't be the cheapest. And anyone booking the cheapest hotel out of dozens and expecting it to be anything special is deluded! It is a bit tired, but it was clean and liveable and what I expected. My actual main problem with it was that it is at the top of the strip and a bit out of the way to be honest, most of the other hotels you want to look around and some better night spots are much further down. Plus we were out in a Manor Room which were a right trek to the front of the hotel where taxis were. We ate in the Garden Restaurant (I think that is what is called) twice, was good value, good service and good food. We ate brekkie a couple of times in the cafe, food was ok, value good, service ok. My verdict would be, if you can afford it book somewhere in a better location like the MGM or NY NY, or if you want more from your hotel then somewhere to crash, look elsewhere. However, if you are on a budget, only need somewhere to rest your weary head and don't mind a trek to some of the good parts of the trip, then fill your boots - it is fantastic value. NB: there is a 24 hour bus with air con that runs from downtown Vegas, does the whole strip to the airport, is real good value and keeps the cost of getting up and down the strip right down. It does get busy though, and sometimes a bit irregular.

Reviews.Title: “Even with kids, there are better hotels on The Strip”
Reviews.Author: UnitedFansKent
Reviews.Content: Right, where do i start. Visiting for the new years eve celebrations its going to be busy but i never imagined that it was going to be manic ive never walked through a hotel dodging pushchairs and kids before, one kid even hitched a ride on my wifes suite case!!!!! Not enough staff to cope with check-in. Our room was ok in size but not very clean and the covers and sheets were dirty and torn. Carpet was thick with dust around the beds so wasnt cleaned properly. Bathroom was ok in size and clean. There was an awful smell when you walked passed the buffet, we didnt eat there and it also had huge queues. Smell of stale smoke almost everywhere. Midway circus acts we saw were poor. Not worth fighting for a seat to watch. Ive seen better street acts. Adventuredome ok , luckily we got 2 for price of 1 voucher as otherwise it wouldnt be good value. Breakfast at Baristo was ok so was a meal in the Garden Grill. The only really good thing about this hotel is The Steak House Restaurant. Its hard to believe that this wonderful little Restaurant is stuck in the middle of a grotty hotel. The steaks in there are beautiful and the service great (Thanks to Mitch) if i was them i would get a place somewhere else. We booked through Virgin who gave it 3 stars (i dont think so) I should have had a bet in the casino that they will be the next hotel torn down on the strip but i dont think they would have taken it.

Reviews.Title: “Shady hotel compared to other glamorous ones”
Reviews.Author: acatri
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel only because some friends booked their room at Circus, Circus, but would never stay here again. It is NOT because everything is horrible at this place, but because Vegas should be more glamorous! The hotel has an unfortunate position, too far from the main attractions of the Strip. Walking through the lobby and “casino” area I had a constant personal insecurity feeling. I am usually a solo traveler, thus my safety is crucial. The buffet was very sad, with no presentation or special items. Felt more like a college cafeteria. The room was large, but there are almost no amenities and offered us the surprise of a problematic toilette, that didn’t flush all the time. Carpet was bleached in certain places. The wall paper on the hallways is already pealing. The souvenir shops on sight look more like China Town with cheap and ugly merchandise. We will definitely never stay there again! If you are on a budget just research the internet. Landmark hotels always have good deals and overall better experience.

Reviews.Title: “It's a bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: yvonneCa
Reviews.Content: I don't recommend you to stay at this hotel because We were a guest their for the new yr and we got bit by a insect and the room was dirty the cleaning people didn't took the old sheets that they remove from the bed and the tub was clog up and they didn't clean the tub it was dirty with scum around the hole tub

Reviews.Title: “caugh caugh”
Reviews.Author: blondieblaxican
Reviews.Content: Sad thing is for the most part everone was nice to us! We arrived late, checked us right in. Stayed in the remodled west tower, not the most luxurious but very comfortable and accomadating. We frequent hotel/casinos annually, never have i experienced this level of second hand smoke! I write this as i am at home sick, because of sinus and respatory illness/irration as a result of this trip! I did read previous reviews regaurding this problem and disregaurded them thinking its a casino by God! NEVER have we experienced this level of unbelievably, unbearable second hand smoke! Until this establishment does something about smoke ventalation its a no go! My apologies to all the staff who work hard at making our stay commendable, as this is beyound your control.

Reviews.Title: “Family orientated hotel”
Reviews.Author: oeflyingkiwi
Reviews.Content: We stayed for New Years which of course was mental. Kids everywhere. We were put in the manor. Walls of rooms are very thin you can hear your neighbours talking. The bed had underlay just a sheet on top of the matress. The springs were deep tissue massaging ;-) Be very carefull if you use the phone we got charged for calling a 1800 number and also for calling reception which we found quite poor as our room was service was missed one day and we had to call for dry towels. We ate at 3 of the restaurants the only bad one was the pasta which was at the Mexican/Italian restaurant. The sauces were lacking flavour and seasoning. The pool and spa are outside so are of course unavailable during winter.

Reviews.Title: “How a Las Vegas holiday should be for UK Travellers - perfect!”
Reviews.Author: suzie83_broadway
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd trip to the amazing city of Las Vegas with my parents (although this was their 3rd time - lucky!) and 1st time staying at the Circus Circus Hotel. I had read many reviews and seen video footage of the hotel itself just to see how it favoured as we got an amazing deal with the hotel for the time of year we went (beginning of October). From the descriptions at first, we were a little worried, but once we got there there wasn't anything to be worried about. Apart from the little lack of cheer in the reception department on check-in, everyone else couldn't have been nicer! Being one of those guests who's easily pleased with even the tiniest details, I found this hotel fabulous! From the huge array of slot machines and games to choose from to the wide selection of places to eat. I LOVED the idea of getting a Krispy Kreme donut at 2am (open 24 hours and staff are absolutely lovely!). There were a couple of things I found odd. 1 was the safe in the bedrooms where you had to deposit a quarter each time you opened and closed the safe. This meant constantly having to make sure we had change ready. But, once we had gotten used to this system it was fine, but for next time I feel the safe's could be modernised with the key-pad systems for entry (I work in a hotel myself with this system and it does prove effective). Also the bath's in the bathroom were too low down to the ground. This does make it more difficult for people with knee problems (as my mum has) to get in and out of a low-ground bath. Again, once we were used to the surroundings we were fine. Another point was on check-in you are usually asked to present a credit-card to charge back any extras to the room. This did not happen and was an essential we were expecting, particularly to make phone calls from the room. It was my parents wedding anniversary during our stay and I had booked them a helicopter ride over the Las Vegas Strip and so had to phone the day before to confirm they were coming. When I went to use the phone thinking reception would answer and say I needed to produce a credit card, I had a particularly rude woman on the phone from the internal switchboard telling me I had not left a card at reception (I was aware of this and was prepared to say I'd go to reception to do this) and left me feeling like a complete idiot for doing something we weren't asked for on check-in! This is a daily part of my prodedures in the hotel where I work and it can be a disciplinary issue if you don't take a credit card and the guest leaves without paying! So, why the receptionist who checked me and my parents in didn't ask for a credit card I'll never know. Anyway, despite the little hiccups the holiday was wonderful (as I expected it to be lol). I wouldn't think twice about booking with this hotel again. The theme of the hotel was unusual but really worked for the city we were in (anything that isn't unusual in Vegas just isn't Vegas!) and the staff are very friendly and welcoming (well, apart from a few at reception). The Midway is great for kids as well, with the added advantage of having McDonalds on the same floor! The Adventuredome was a little disappointing in terms of modernised rides. Although I had been planning on going on the roller coaster, there was no clear path/signage for the queue so in the end I didn't bother. Perhaps this could be updated for any future riders! All in all, a great place to come and relax and for any families with kids it's a great place to spend quality time together riding the roller coaster, playing the Midway carnival style games and dining out. Also the casino is absolutely fantastic for gamers just beginning the Vegas style gambling or the experienced pro who can just hop on and off different machines scoring the jackpot. Particularly play the "Deal or No Deal" slot machine - 1 of my favourites and managed to win $40 on my last night! Can't wait for my next visit to Las Vegas and possibly again to Circus Circus!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Bergersbabe
Reviews.Content: My parents and I decided to travel to Las Vegas for a different Christmas this year and it was very different but I would highly recommend you try it at least once in your life! Brilliant!! Mum and Dad had both been to Vegas the previous year and stayed in Caesars Palace and were instantly disappointed with our hotel when we arrived. I on the other hand thought it to be clean, the check in was quick and the rooms were also clean and of a decent size. After seeing all the other hotels I now do understand their initial disappointment as all the other hotels are a lot more modern and this one could do with a revamp but as I said before, it was clean and the staff were friendly enough. This hotel is definitely one for the children, as the name suggests, and there were a lot of children about and at times it did feel a little claustrophobic. I would say that this hotel is not one for a romantic getaway or a luxury holiday as it was extremely busy and it's not really the sort of atmosphere that couples might prefer. Food wise we were eating in the buffet the first two days which was all you can eat, then we realised we could buy a bowl of cereal from the westside deli which was better value as we weren't really eating much in the buffet but the food there was fresh and we had no complaints. The lady running this was really nice and made us feel very welcome! Area wise Circus Circus is close to the Stratosphere and we walked to The Wynn (beautiful) which then leads onto the strip but it is a 15 minute walk whereas if you were staying in the actual strip, hotels are only 5 minutes apart. However in the grand scheme of things it isn't that bad if you don't mind a walk and we quite enjoyed walking our breakfast off! Taxis to the strip only cost $15 or so so we tended to walk there and get a taxi back. On the whole I don't think I would stay in this hotel again unless I was on a very tight budget but for the first time experience it did the job and if you do go to Las Vegas it's definitely worth a look - they have shows with acrobats and the theme inside is good with the nightime lights very good too!

Reviews.Title: “Bargain Hotel?”
Reviews.Author: dawgbro
Reviews.Content: I came to L.V. in hopes of drying out a little and maybe even getting some sunshine. Just trying to get out of the Seatle weather pattern for this time of year,(cool and wet). I wanted to see some shows and get some good food. Circus Circus was a bargain in comparison to other venues financially. After what seemed liked a long wait to get checked in and a surprise cash deposit requirement for the room telephone I finally got to my room. The front desk service was polite and nice. The extra deposit for the phone seemed like gouging to me though. The room was tidy & clean for the most part though a bit small. There was limited television available. A nice king-size bed in my room w/good pillows. Room had a good air conditioner which I used and it was effective. There was no view from my room window and the window did not open. Overall the room was pretty comfortable. The location for this hotel/casino is excellent. Near the northern end of the strip it seemed right in the middle of the downtown,(Freemont Street Experience), and access to the other venues on the strip. This hotel is a theme park and it obviously is an attraction for family's with kids. If you don't have the patience to be around kids for god's sake don't stay here. You could not walk through the hotel/casino without being bumped into or cut off. This tried my patience greatly. Too many baby strollers moving way too slowly. When you'd try to go around someone would jump right in front of you. Shoppers and people chatting clogged the narrow corridors of this venue. Choking off any right of way or easy passage. The buffet is something I would recommend that you do not do unless you like feeling like cattle. Long, long lines waiting for mediocre food. A complete waste of time. However, this venue does have other restaurants that serve good food but you do have to watch your times when you go. I would recommend The Steak House and The Garden Grill for food but depending on your timing you may have to wait a bit for these places too. I did venture out onto the strip for breakfast a few times and found a good, convenient restaurant across the street and down a block with no waiting and good food. Circus Circus has everything a traveller could ask for and then some... like all the hotel/casino's do on the strip. One could spend there entire stay inside the venue and never leave. It is one of the older venues and seems a bit dreary in comparison to other newer venues. The table games in the casino were only half open making it difficult to get a seat at a black jack table but if you're patient you can get on one in pretty short order. The acrobats in the Midway were very good too. Too many kids to enjoy the Adventure Dome but I'm not a kid. If I was I probably would love it. Nice looking roller coaster and water slide rides among many others. More like a carnival with too many booths to waste money on, throwing, tossing, shooting, etc...I didn't partake in only toured. Lots of souvenir shopping available. A very noisy hotel/casino.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: staxtics
Reviews.Content: The hotel was quite confusing to get around, you have to pass through the casino to get to the hotel lobby and some of the shop staffs don't even know where the lobby is. Check in was a breeze my room was located in the West tower. What i liked: There were shops, restaurants (also a McDonalds), carnival games, arcade, indoor theme park (AdventureDome). What i disliked: The buffet was very disappointing, very little choices and most of the food and desserts tasted horrible. I recommend going to Denny's which is further up from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “totally disappointed”
Reviews.Author: abhipapu
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 days in Circus circus before new year. The hotel and casino is a junkyard to say the least. I stayed in the west tower which is supposed to have better rooms. My disappointments are for the following reasons -- 1. The room service is available from 6 / 7 am up to 2 pm. After that you cannot get anything delivered to your room. 2. We ordered some French toasts in the morning (room service). The quality of the food was horrible. As an added bonus it was very pricey. Two plates of French toasts and a small pot of coffee did cost me more than 30 bucks whereas the same thing I got in another hotel for little over 20. 3. Room carpet looked horrible. 4. Quality of the bedding was poor. Every morning all of us had body ache. One may argue that in a cheap hotel that's what I should get. However I had much better experience with a cheaper hotel (Orleans as an example). 5. The shower is below par. 6. The maids do not clean everything. I saw some white stuff on our bed cover after we checked in. They did not care to pickup magazines / papers left on the floor. 7. The entire hotel has a weird layout. It is very big and due to the strange structure it is not very easy to get to one point from another. 8. The parking lot is very much crowded and like the structure of the entire hotel is confusing. 9. I dont know why so many people come to this place, probably because of the Adventure dome, but boy is this place crowded or what? You can collide with hundreds of people to go from your room to the parking lot. No other casino is even comparable to Circus Circus. As a result you will get all the hassle of a theme park in a hotel. 10. The food quality is bad in many restaurants of Casino e.g. Pizzeria (I guess that's the name) and definitely the buffet. In a nutshell do not be lured by the lower price of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the money, but rooms need refurbishing”
Reviews.Author: tntxfour
Reviews.Content: Took the kids to the amusement park for part of their Christmas. The park is great with a few things to keep in mind: We made the mistake of arriving on a Friday evening. Very long waits for the rides and huge crowds. (almost too many people in a confined space for safety reasons) Saturday morning was also very bad. Decided to go see the circus acts etc. Went back on Sunday morning. Great time! Very few people! The roller coaster which goes around and thought the park is amazing! Not terribly impressed with the Circus Circus buffet. For the price ($20 per person) there are much better places to eat in Vegas, Room was located on the 28th floor. Expect a 15 plus minute wait for the elevator up. The carpet was in really bad shape with lots of very warn spots and places where people had put out cigarrette butts etc. The one cushioned chair in the room was well stained. My only other issue with the room is the tv. When you turn it on, you get a menu with following choices: Local channels Adult Movies Fairly recent movies ($11) Taped tv shows (CSI etc. for $9 Circus (clown channel as my daughter called it) Only about 10 channels in all. Not cable by any means. Also, I wished they were more discrete about the adult movies. So to put it bluntly, I only paid around $55 per night, so I got a good deal, but you do get what you pay for. The management really needs to refurbish and recarpet the rooms if the rest of them are like the one we got.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best hotel i have stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Polish-pear
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the cheapest on the strip but not one of the best. Firstly the rooms are very comfortable and well decorated thye are also very large and the amount of shops and activities in the hotel are rather good but it is at the wrong end of the strip me and my family decided to walk to the other hotels and ride on the 'new york new york' rollercoaster which was very fun itself but it took about one hour to get to it and one more hour to get back, also it is lacking in staff to help you around the hotel and one night it took me and my family about an hour to find our room and when we asked a one of the shops they said they had no idea either. This hotel needs alot more improvments before my family returns!

Reviews.Title: “HAD FUN AND SAVED MONEY AT CIRCUS CIRCUS”
Reviews.Author: rpmorales3000
Reviews.Content: We have a tight budget , so paying 25.00 dollars a night did really help. The staff were very helpful and the rooms were very clean. The motel had an indoor amusement park( 25.00 adults and 15.00 kids all day pass ;). The motel had several reasturants you could eat at. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Thaw”
Reviews.Author: Seaflame
Reviews.Content: TERRIBLE!!! We were given this trip so were grateful to getaway to warm weather, HOWEVER... they really need to UPDATE!!! You could read the newspaper thru the sheets ARGHHH!!!!! Pillows like rocks, guess it's a good thing sleep wasn't a priority. We did however clean up on the slots, much better than anywhere else we played. So for gambling it's OK, food & lodging NO!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location for price, excellent restaurants, might ear noisy children”
Reviews.Author: guntown
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Vegas Circus Circus resorts from December 3rd to December 6th 2009. I was afraid after looking at bad comments but it turned out perfect. You have Very large rooms. They might be a bit outdated but in VEGAS you are in your room for a short sleep and that is about it. The only bad (very bad) thing I have to say is that rooms are not sound proof and so you will hear people walking around, CHILDREN screaming, running, the staff cleaning the other rooms around and we were lucky but I am sure you can ear couples playing the love game on top of your room or even on the sides. Or worst people might ear you....be quiet there are children around...:-) As for the food, we went at the buffet for 1 breakfast and 1 lunch and we were very very happy with all the choices. You can go healthy or not your choice. There is plenty of variety for beverages also. Also the pizzeria is great. Don’t order a large if you are only 2..:-) Unless you want a mid night snack when you come back at your room after your night of party. There are subways, MacDonald’s and plenty more 2 minutes from the hotel and all over VEGAS. CHECK IN: what I found a bit weird is that they charge 20$ for early check in so we left our luggage and went on the strip right away. CHECK OUT: very quick and nicely handled. LOCATION: You are about 5-10 minutes walk from the amazing Strip and about 10 minutes walk from the SAHARA and STRATOSPHÈRE resorts on the other side. It takes about 20 minutes on the taxi ride unless you get a private ride directly to your hotel for 50$ per person. The non-private ride (bus that contains 10-15 person) is around 25$ round-trip per person. Security safe: Another thing i found weird is that the security safe in your room cost 50 cents each time you open it. Another way for them to get to your money. PLANNING YOUR MONEY: I got that idea on a web site and it worked great for us and might save your trip. Put all your money on the bed. Decide how much you want to spend on food and drinks each day. PUT THAT MONEY IN ONE ENVELOPS PER DAY SEALED. Put them in safe What's left is for your gambling and shows. Split that amount in SEALED ENVELOPS 1 per day. Leave the hotel room with your daily envelops. You should have one for your meals and one for you gambling. NOTE that drinks are free when gambling. All you need to give are tips. (50 cents or 1$ per drink). We played blackjack so you often get a 50 cent chip for blackjacks and I used these to tip waitresses and dealers. Using that tip might save your money when you are drunk and think you will get rich since your are invincible.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: CiciChan
Reviews.Content: I love the bed there, gave me such good sleep (or may be i'm too tired after walking along the Strip) the buffee was really delicious. I highly recommend this hotel for student who are trying to find a place on the Strip with low price and good service.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC, FRIENDLY, LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: DaveyEssex_England
Reviews.Content: On arrival we decided to upgrade from the manor room we had booked at the rear of the hotel for a room in the west tower, only because we wanted a view of the strip from our window. We were charge $15 per night for the privalege and I think it was worth every penny (sorry, cent). The room was immaculate, clean and was tastefully decorated with a beautiful large window over looking the strip. There were pleasant shower / bath facilities and a flat screen television. There are ample restaurants on site with plenty of things for children to do, like the enormous adventuredome or world class circus acts. Although the main casino and shopping area is a little tired looking and in need of some care and attention, I would not let this put you off. I would definately stay here again without a doubt and we had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: bedhead02
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Circus Circus and it was as good this time round. The rooms are cleaned every day. The food in the hotel restraurant is nice and good value for money. The casino's not the newest of them all but it is perfectly acceptable. Some of the Circus acts are breath taking. The staff are friendly and helpful. Some would say it's too far from the strip, we say it's nice to get away from the hussle and bussle. We enjoyed our stay at Circus Circus and are planning on a third visit in March 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HospitalWorkers
Reviews.Content: needs a good overhaul decoration soooo old fashioned not very clean dont stay here if you dont like children over run with them !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty room with lack of privacy”
Reviews.Author: kevint23
Reviews.Content: I checked in and found trash on the floor and hair in the bathroom. Then I was taking a nap with my do not disturb sign on the door and the housekeeper just walks in and did not say who it was until I woke and said hey did not not see the sign she said they were doing a wellness check they go in the Do not disturb rooms to check I called to front desk then they sent the call to another and they did not care and the icing on the cake $12 per day for internet

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price for room, stay away from buffet”
Reviews.Author: kelfunk
Reviews.Content: The price was very good, and u get what you pay for. Rooms were surprisingly clean. I would recommend it to those looking to stay at a clean, no frills hotel for budget prices. Wireless was expensive at $12 per night. The food at the buffet was limited and tasted bad, go to McDonalds.

Reviews.Title: “It is cheap...and you feel pretty cheap staying here!”
Reviews.Author: Brighton_Claire
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the bag guy told us just to follow him "up the back way" as it was quicker (I found myself muttering, "I bet this doesn't happen at the Bellagio" as we went past the kitchens and stacks of dirty laundry!) - glad we did - the regular route to our room took 15 mins to get to front of the hotel! The good: the room was spacious, clean, then bedding perfectly adequate, there was aircon, a bath. It is apparently a good place to stay with children (perhaps they don't tolerate kids in other hotels? - although I wouldn't go to Vegas with kids). - Krispey Kremes for breakfast!!! You have to pass the stall to get out! Its cheap compared with UK. - They have hire car pick up from Hotel which was really convenient when we wanted to leave. - The bag boys were really nice - our only particular interaction with staff. The bad: If you go for the cheapest room, then realise that you will be a minimum 15 min walk from the exit (and we walk quick, and we're in our 20's!). You have to literally do an obstacle course of shops, stalls, ads, and then the casino. - Your at one end of the strip away from everything else - nothing is really walking distance, unless you like walking ages. - The food - we only had food at the little cafe on the way from rooms to exit (we were hungry from our long journey!), very over priced. What we got was ok though - just expensive. Top tip - I could have booked the Luxor or Exclibar for about £10 more a night when I went - I wish I had - much better location and amenities. I really would say this is your last resort on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: munchkin2001
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to Vegas, stayed at Circus Circus, and would recommend this hotel, we were on a room only rate however we had breakfast and dinner in the hotel which was excellent value and the food was great. Room were a good size and beds were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: robmnj
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the price. Staff was helpful, rooms were clean. It wasn't the Bellagio or the Wynn, but if you're looking for a nice hotel on the strip where you can bring the kids, Circus Circus is the place. The Adventuredome them park and the Midway are great places to entertain the kids. Only downside I could find was just like others, the wireless internet cost $11.99/24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Fun”
Reviews.Author: alyscully
Reviews.Content: They shows are fun, the games are fun, and the Adventure dome has some really fun rides. I have stayed at Circus Cirus each time I have been to Vegas. It is within a short walking distance of other casinos and the fashion mall. The buffet and steak house have great food for good prices.

Reviews.Title: “Funday @ Circus Circus”
Reviews.Author: Travellerseattle27
Reviews.Content: I have spent 2 days in Circus Circus hotel with my friends and really had fun time. Casinos, Shops , fun games all in the same hotel; Circus Circus Buffet for breakfast was really delicious. Overall it was great and memorable stay at Circus Circus.

Reviews.Title: “Dont be put off”
Reviews.Author: paulh29
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel several times and are going back at new year. The rooms are fine, the staff helpfull and it is ideal for kids. To be honest I would not eat at the buffet but that applies to most of the hotels on the strip, At the end of the day you get what you pay for, we think its a decent hotel

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good for what it was”
Reviews.Author: rachaelOz
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel in Vegas knowig it wouldn't be as exciting for us as it would beor my daughter, given the theme park and circus theme. She was extremely happy with it and would love to go back, so hope hat's a recommendation for peoplewith kids - 8 -14 ish. We booked connecting rooms in the West Towers the main benefit of staying there rather than somewhere more up market was we could easily afford 2 rooms for a few days instead of all sharing somewhere more expensive. The rooms were refurbished and above average, except for the carpets - bit worn, and should have been replaced when they did the rooms over. The casino and amenties downstiars (shopping, bars etc) were all pretty average. To explore the Strip and start at the other end where all the good hotels are, was a taxi trip for us up (about 20 US), and then we walked down - we ddi this every night we were in Vegas. Circus Circus was a good place to base youself from, and great for kids - the themepark and midway were excellent - but if you want something more adult and exciting, don't go here!

Reviews.Title: “Disaster”
Reviews.Author: arrioladi
Reviews.Content: My daughter and family stayed 4 nights at Circus, Circus in Las Vegas. It was a total disappoint from past experiences. Normal amenities i.e., refrig., Microwave cost extra per day, rooms not very clean, elevator broken, had to walk flight of stairs to get to room. Talked to desk receptionist and Supervisor you were very unprofessional and sympathic. Not "kid friendly" as advertised and family setting as in prior years and staff was very rude in some instances. I will not nor will we ever recommend a staff in the Circus, Circus Las Vegas. There were many families attending a Football tournament. Next year we will stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but...”
Reviews.Author: seasongood
Reviews.Content: Somewhat out of the way for being "on the strip". The price was right though and if you like clowns, well then you'll love this place. Room was pretty basic, if not dated. Room was quiet. Shower floor was uneven which felt somewhat odd... I don't know if I'd stay here again but in a pinch, it's not a bad choice for a Vegas hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Newly Renovated Rooms are Great!”
Reviews.Author: Littleminxy
Reviews.Content: We wanted something cheap for Vegas, as we were going to be running around all day and weren't planning on staying much in the hotel. However, I wanted to stay somewhere nice and not in a dump. I saw online that Circus Circus had a stay three nights get the fourth night free AND we could stay in the NEWLY renovated tower. I was skeptical up until the time when we opened the door to our room. The main lobby and casino are dark and dreary but when we got to our room - it was very nice. Modern furniture, art work, new bedding, armchair and flat screen tv. The room itself was huge! The view wasn't much - overlooking the back parking lot. The a/c barely ran --- it was a little sneeze of a breeze, however we left it on all day and it seemed to cool the room down. Our room was at the end of the hall so the noise was very minimal. We never heard our neighbors or the people above us - so that was a nice thing too. They also have an in room safe, which was a welcome addition. The Steakhouse Restaurant in the hotel/casino is not to be missed - exceptional service and well worth the money we spent. We went for our anniversary dinner. It was great. The rest of the dining options left much to be desired. There are no places to sit and read a book or enjoy a glass of wine while your partner plays the tables --- so if you want to relax you have to go to your room. Which was disappointing. It would be nice if they had some decent lounges. The casino as I said is dark and I felt a little claustrophobic in there. Other hotel/casinos were much more open/airy and didn't feel as constricting. Trying to find your way around was crazy. One man on the elevator said he had to go up two floors, get off and then walk down the hall to catch another elevator to get to where he was going. Trying to find the pool was impossible and the hours were even more ridiculous! It is about a 15 minute walk (if you're a walker) to go about 3/4 of a mile down the strip to the Fashion Show Mall area. It was fine for us. I would only recommend and stay at this hotel if you can reserve a room in the newly renovated section - the rest of the property leaves much to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: MissKS
Reviews.Content: Upgraded to a normal room (were allocated a motel) and everything was fine! Nothing special but nothing bad, just a nice cheap and cheerful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not for us.”
