The bed was large and comfortable and the room was big by UK standards. Our only gripe was that there was no tea/coffee making equipment in the room. However that was not really a problem as there was a 24 hour Krispy Kreme concession on the ground floor just across the corridor from our nearest lift, so I could get our morning hot drink there. We had no problems checking in, or out, and didn't have to queue as other people said they did. The breakfast buffet, at $10.49 a head, was good value and the food was fine. We had dinner there too the first night which was very little dearer ($14 I think) - but that wasn't so good. We also had a meal in The Garden Room which was fine and reasonably priced. Circus Circus is huge and it did take us a while to find our way around it - and all the slot machines were a bit of a shock, but no different from any other hotel in Vegas! There is a pool, tho' it takes a bit of finding - again it was fine. The main problem with the hotel is that is is actually quite a long way from the centre of the strip - we were also offered Excalibur, and that would have been a better choice as it's much nearer where all the action is. We took the mono-rail, which is a short walk from Circus Circus, to the top end at MGM and walked all the way back - a good long hike.

Reviews.Title: “loved circus circus”
Reviews.Author: lyndylou1
Reviews.Content: we stayed in november this year only two weeks ago, we had a ball, ok it needs a refurb but the atmosphere is fabulous and the food was fantastic, we loved it and will go back. asap. the jones and roberts manchester england

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 us the time”
Reviews.Author: LoveBug96
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here at the time due to it being the cheapest. It was my bf 1st time going to Vegas, but my 3thrd time. I stayed at the Fitz the 2nd time I went (in July 2007)and a Days Inn the 1st time I went (11yrs ago..LOL). The previous hotels which were in no way nice to my standards were WAY better than the room we got at Circus Circus. The bed felt as though it was nothing more than a box spring. The carpet was disgusting. Our view was decent but nothing I hoped for, for my bf to experience. The buffet was GROSS!!!!!!!! I have been reading a lot of the other reviews and WOW the rooms that other ppl got seem amazing compared to what we were given. Out of the 2 times previous to going to Vegas I had no idea about the whole upgrade thing!! I know silly me, that is what I get for not joining tripadvisor until just recently!! Anyways, we are going back to Vegas again this Feb 2009 and now I have more insight on it for us. Thank you all for all the input and pictures you put on here, it helps so much keep it up and when I return from my trip in 2009 I will for sure be uploading my pics to share with you all and my review of where we stay!! We are looking into staying at TI, or Bill's, or Harrah's, or Excaliber, or Luxor, I know lots of choices and we just haven't been able to decide all the way yet!! Circus Circus might be in there as well with our choices if of course we can book one of those newer rooms...LOL!! Well goodbye until next time I am on here to give you all a review!!

Reviews.Title: “Kids love it, not so much adults”
Reviews.Author: Yippiehoo
Reviews.Content: We came here for my 40th. The idea is great, but the hotel needs some work. We were "upgraded" to the West tower for free. The room was nice, but the beds were way too soft and springy. (not good on back and necks) Also, we had some blue stuff on the outside of our tub I found after taking a shower. I moved the curtain over to leave showing for maid. It was still there after they came. I called the desk and a maid and her supervisor came up. I wasn't mad, just a little grossed out wondering how long it had been there? We also had neighbors who partied all night and finally at 3:30 am I called front desk and they sent up security and they quieted down. The next night their alarm was going off so I called down and security came up again and turned it off. Unfortunately he only hit the snooze button! I was impressed by their response to both instances. The free shows were okay. The unicylcist was good and so were the 2 Vladimirs. The clowns needed help. They had "talent" but no character. We ate at the Garden Grill once, it was average. We asked the front desk if the restaruants were good and they said not really. McDonalds ( on 2nd floor) was good and had normal prices, which is great for a cheap meal! (cheap meals are hard to find in Vegas!) Next time I would stay further down the strip at the Bellagio or Mandalay. Take the Deuce bus if you come here, it is $5 for all day pass.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Good for Kids”
Reviews.Author: pgirl1
Reviews.Content: We had a great 3 night stay over Veteran's Day. Couldn't beat the price, $105 total for 3 nights. Booked the West Tower renovated room (don't book anything less). Nice room, definitely great for the price. Check in line was terrible but noticed a sign (after a few minutes) that said 1-800-5-NOWAIT. Called and was checked in over the phone, walked right up to the counter and received my key in less than 5 minutes. By passed a HUGE line. West Tower is easy access to valet area but a bit farther to the strip. Great place to stay if you have kids with you. We spent the day at the Adventure Dome with the kids and also visited the Midway for games and entertainment. Carnival games are only $1 to play and with 2 players you receive a prize. The kids had a great time. Krispy Kreme donughts on site as well as a clean, well run McDonalds in the Midway. Housekeeping did an excellent job (always tip the maid!0 Don't expect the Bellagio but if you go in with a reasonable mind set you will enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “fab”
Reviews.Author: doublesKent
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the circus circus hotel as we had a 6 year old with us from that point of view it was a great hotel for facilities although it is 40 yrs old this year the hotel definately needs a refurb.At the other end of the strip a bit further out but we didnt find this a problem as we jumped straight into a cab and it was very reasonable.A very safe and busy destination with lots to do for both couples and families.

Reviews.Title: “Depressing experience”
Reviews.Author: outofottawa
Reviews.Content: My family needed a place to stay for one night only as we were leaving early the next day. We chose Circus Circus for its proximity to the RV Rental Location where we were to pick up our RV the next day so we were not expecting or wanting much. Arriving at 23h00, we found the lobby to be filled with many, many families and their luggage. Some were asleep on the couches, others sprawled out. Not a pleasant welcome. Were these people waiting for a bus somewhere? I have no clue but it gave the lobby a "homeless shelter" feeling. We went to check-in where there was fortuantely no line. Our clerk noted that my credit card had a mildly faded signature. I offered photo ID (passport, driver's license etc.) to confirm that I was indeed the cardholder for this previously booked and prepaid room. The clerk informed me that photo ID is insufficient and that I should resign the card then and there. Gee, does this not preclude the reason for signing a card in the first place? I guess a fraud artist would never think of doing this. We proceeded to our room. One elevator did not work though it was not clearly marked or otherwise indicated as out of order. The doors on the (working) elevators close too quickly. My family barely got in before the doors closed. We are not slow walkers either. We went to our room which was ok for 23h00. It was not fancy but was clean enough. The bathroom was dated. The shower was weak. The overall feeling was, please renovate me. One problem was the curtains did not dim out the street lights entirely so if you need near darkness to sleep, watch out. I went down to the casino to unwind while my family went to sleep. Very old and dated as well. The place reminded me of old casino meets a shabby coney island. Very depressing. The staff were on the whole pleasant and receptive. Would I stay here again? I do not think so as there are equally reasonably priced places on the Strip that are superior. It was adequate enough for one night but we will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: chris-cambs-uk
Reviews.Content: from cambs uk stayed november 2008 read all reviews before going and had mixed views but arrived at airport in afternoon and taxi to hotel 23 dollers took us to reception at rear not at front as some people said. took about 15 mins to check in asked for view of strip given sky rise room with 2 double beds and a no smoking one as was given the choice, clean and well stocked with towels and on 29th floor. as there was only 2 of us we could not fault for the price. tried few of resturants and found good choice even the all you could eat steak dinner for 12 dollers and was asked if we wanted some more steak once we finished the first one. room cleaned every day with new towels and shampoos, safe charged 50 cents to use each time so did not mind, one doller a day for local calls used a few times to book shows, took trip to grand caynon by papelon tours by plane hele and boat with lunch included and only four of us in helecopter so had great time no faults. for being in seedy area as some reviews said only time i could see the mens clubs or areas of this nature was from hotel window on 29th floor and they were not on the strip these clubs, you get more people on the strip pestering you for time share or trying to give cards for certain phone numbers they were more annoying.. booked some shows back in uk before going with travelocity and did not have any problems when over there getting tickets of them when arrived. so overall we had a excellent 7 days and would go back to this hotel again for price and standards we had if people want more then go and pay a lot more at some of the other hotels on the strip, one othe point we liked about this hotel it was about in the middle as we walked to bottom end of strip from here and to fermont street in the other direction. hotel did run a airport bus we found out and cost 6 dollers each to go back to airport so not bad

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: holidaymother
Reviews.Content: circus circus las vegas .Great time. We have recently returned from Vegas and I was very anxious about this hotel after reading some of the reports. On arrival we were allocated a free upgrade to a room in the West Tower which overlooked the strip. The room contained 2 double beds a huge tele and a very clean bathroom. Extra coathangers were delivered in mintues and the service we received whilst there was amazing. The deuce bus which stops outside this hotel was a lifesaver as you can use it for 24 hours for 5 dollars .You certainly get your moneys worth as The Strip is 4 miles long. If you want to waste your money stay at one of the fancy hotels further down the strip where you will pay at least double the price for every thing. We cannot commend the staff at this hotel enough and would return here again without trepidation.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck”
Reviews.Author: Perthflourish
Reviews.Content: Do yourself a favour and beware. We had read in lots of places that this is the best place to stay with a family, but I think travel agents need to come and have a look. This may have been the place about 20 years ago, but not now. The hotel is old and run down in many areas, and needs upgrading ( or demolishing). The rooms themselves are OK, but all the other bad bits are overwhelming. Firstly taxis drop you at the Strip entrance, so you need to walk thru the casino, which is smoky, smelly and dingy. Had to wait in line for over half an hour to check in. We stayed in the Skyrise Tower, (thought it was recently upgraded, but it's not) , which meant we had to walk thru tacky, tacky arcade, with people selling all sorts of rubbish. Bathroom was smelly, beds are Ok, but not really up to modern day hotel standards, remote control didnt work, smoke detector was hanging from the ceiling. Internet at $11 per day extra, having the luxury of a phone (even without use) is $2 per room, costs $20 if you have an extended stay of ONE HOUR. Buffet is good, but always had to queue for around 15 minutes to get in. It's located at the far end of the strip. We wonder who exactly is posting positive reviews of this hotel?? Delighted to leave, wouldn't recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Circus Schmircus - no thanks”
Reviews.Author: BrisCaz
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by my travel agent and boy is she in some trouble when I get to see her. Like the previous reviewer I have to say it is a DUMP with a capital "D". I paid over the odds for this place as well (I found out that the rates are much much cheaper with lots ot travel packages ...but well you live and learn). So after lining up to check in for at least a half an hour I was given a room in the Skyline Tower that was just awful. I took one look at the bed and went "no way". I was able to upgrade - at $10 per night (where was the $5 a night upgrade one reviewer mentioned?)- to a room with a pillow top bed in the West Tower. It still was a very basic room - no door on the wardrobe (which couldnt really be called a wardrobe - just a hanging space - but there was only 5 coat hangers which made things a bit difficult). Very basic bathroom and toiletries very average. Trying to call down to reception was a nightmare - go through the choosing of numbers and then get put on hold for ages. They slug you $1 a day (mandatory) for unlimited local calls (of which I made none) and then the $10 a day for the upgrade. I had a fax come through that I had to pay $5 per page for and then of course there was the $11.95 a day Internet charge. I was not a happy camper at all. On top of all my woes, the walls were so thin I could hear the family next door quite clearly and it was very annoying when they came in late at night and woke me up and then of course they woke me up in the early morning too. After 3 days that family moved out and then even noiser peope moved in. I just HATED being here. The hotel is really too far away from the main hustle and bustle and you really need to take a cab to get anywhere. I totally believe the best kindness anyone can do to this place is bulldoze it down and start again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room in West Tower”
Reviews.Author: lilL81
Reviews.Content: We were lucky we read the reviews and booked us a king bed room in the newly renovated West Tower. I have to say for under $50 a night, our king bed west tower room is absolutely a five star indulgence. Hotel website had the picture of the room and what you see is what you get. Our bed and pillows are so comfortable, I don't even wanna get out of it. 42 inch LCD TV, but not many free TV channels. No wireless internet, but there were so much to do, I didn't even get a chance to turn on my laptop for our 2 night stay. If you are on a budget, remeber to get the visit las vegas guide, even the free shows will keep you occupied every day. We loved the circus show every half an hour. But don't miss the TI pirate ship, Rio dance gals, Bellagio fountain, MGM lion..lots to see even if you are on a budget. Circus buffet was the cheapest, but our buffet in Rio was the best. I will stay at Circus Circus again if I don't get a free TimeShare offer from any other hotel, afterall, this is the cheapest option on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Sucked In At The Circus”
Reviews.Author: justhym
Reviews.Content: THIS PLACE IS A DUMP, we had to go thru several rooms to get satisfied enough to at least stay on. Every corner you turn someone has their hand out...A complete milking in everything from the double the quoted room price to the 12 bucks to use the internet each day, no mail service and 5 bucks a pop to receive a fax. The place is old so the deterioration was explainable, the lack caring staff and general lack of enthusiasm makes the place a horror to have to go home to each evening, the cigarette smoke is so bad in the casino we couldnt gamble there, we had to gamble elsewhere. Lets face it with the face of vegas constantly changing it might be time for circus circus to do the dynamite thing and rebuild and move into the modern age. Oh the Buffet was okay not the best rated in vegas as they claim

Reviews.Title: “A real circus”
Reviews.Author: Tapie
Reviews.Content: Big big big hotel. The hotel has everything: a circus, a horror dome, an adventure dome, restaurants, shops, a swimming pool and of course casino's. Our room was very spacious with two large beds and a large bathroom. Everything was clean and although lots of rooms were occupied during our stay, we never heard our neighbours. The hotel is situated at the beginning of The Strip so it takes a walk to get to the other casion and hotel attractions at The Strip. But then you can always take a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit...Even better than the 1st!!”
Reviews.Author: donbon85
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel, and it was fabulous!!! Check in was quick, and after making a call to the hotel some weeks before to request conjoining rooms, they told me it would depend on the availability on the day. Lucky for us we got one. In the main tower on the 10th floor. We had a re-furbished room, which was very comfortable and very clean (it was very clean the 1st time anyway too) Hotel staff were great, and we always seemed to end up with the nicest (the staff that get the taxi's for you, are these doormen??) We did mile and miles of walking everyday, went to almost every hotel during our stay, saw most of the attractions, and walked to the sign (which seemed a lot closer this tme) An example of how great the staff were, one evening i had a fall in the Hotel room which resulted in me being taken to hospital to hve stitches, but the hotel staff were fab! They sent security to the room first to assess the damage, then the sherrif, the the paramedics. They knew we were messing around in the room, but not once did they judge us, nor did the paramedics. I recieved a letter from the hotel today passing on their best wishes in my recovery. Something i wasnt expecting at all. We flew with Virgin Atlantic, which i had done before, and have never been too keen on them anyway. But out outbound journey was horrendous!!! something you dont want at the start of your holiday. The service was terrible. We were served our 2 bitesize meals, but only once offered beverages after this. On a 10 hour flight i feel this is awful. When my friend found a hostess and asked for beverages he was told he had to wait until they had their break. I understand they need a break, but they were ALL on break at the same time, The hostesses werent even friendly either. Our return journey was much better. I have no other grumble what so ever about this holiday. But as i plan to return again in a couple of years, does anyone know of any other airlines that fly direct as i dont fancy flying with virgin again. Had a fab time!!! Will definalty go back and stay @ Circus Circus!!

Reviews.Title: “Viva Circus Circus!”
Reviews.Author: holibobin
Reviews.Content: Just back from a visit to Las Vegas Baby! Had a brilliant time and stayed at the Circus Circus, we had read some reviews warning us that there would be wall to wall children - not the case. There were certainly some kids there but no more that any other hotel we visited, we managed to get to the pool for a few hours a couple of days and the most kids in the pool at any of those times were 3. There are 2 pools, the one that doesnt have the bar was by far better, much quieter than the other and we walked round to the bar to get a drink in about 1 minute, there is also a nice jacuzzi too. The rooms were spacious, huge bathroom too, really clean too. Very confortable. The hotel itself is absolutely vast, it took us 10 minutes from the front entrance to get to our room, we got offered an upgrade to a west tower room for 5 dollars a night, take it if offered (we wished we had) it will cut your walk to your room in half, and the rooms there have just been re done. Lots of nice places to get something to eat in the hotel too, we ate breakfast everyday in the bagels and barista, lots of choice, cereals, fresh fruit, beautiful bagels and cream cheese (about 10 diffterent kinds of bagels) croissants, muffins ,sandwiches, really fresh. We also ate in the Garden Grill, good steak, italian food at reasonable prices. You can get a pitcher of frozen margarita for 10 dollars here. lovely! If you just want a quick snack, I recommend the Westside Deli, in the casino area where you get a giant footlong hotdog for 2.99. Just outside the hotel there is subway and mcdonalds too. You can catch the Duece bus right outside the hotel too, which will take you up and down the strip all day for 5 dollars, great to hop on and off of. You can also catch the Duece bus right along the other end of the strip to the factory outlets, great bargains there, Timberland, Converse, Adidas, Nike, Osh Kosh etc. Also, catch the Bellagio fountains, Brilliant.. Lastly, Have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Good fun”
Reviews.Author: bosseye
Reviews.Content: A nice Hotel. It must have been ok as my Wife and I got married in the hotel wedding chapel! We had a room in the apparently refurbished West Tower which was spacious, clean and comfortable. The hotel is situated at one end of the strip, so is ideally placed to venture out into Vegas. Parking is excellent, valet parking is technically free (although staff work for the tips), staff were helpful and cheerful. There is a large amount of restaurants/bars etc so food is never an issue, aside from the Casino there is a good amusement arcade, regular circus acts, a selection of shops (which are slightly pricey) and the indoor theme park complete with roller coasters, haunted house etc. I can definately reccommend the wedding chapel - a wonderful ceremony, very romantic and professional in a lovely setting. The staff were very friendly although they will try and rip you off shamelessly when it comes to buying photos of the wedding. The price of rooms is also extremely good - ours was around $60 a night inc taxes, which is spectacular value considering we paid double that for a bog standard comfort inn place a few days before. The only issue we had was that the hotel was extremely busy, particularly in the lobby meaning sometimes a 10 minute wait for a lift and long lines at the buffet and you do get pestered slightly walking to the exits by the shop/stall owners trying to sell you things. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “What a Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideScooter
Reviews.Content: Fabulous place to stay. Had a 3 night stay recently in 2 adjoining rooms in the Skyrise Tower. Mum & Dad in one room and 3 teenage kids in the other. Read a lot of ordinary reviews and wasn't sure what to expect. Must be a lot of grumpy and fussy people out there, it was absolutely fine. Not the newest hotel in Vegas but the rooms were clean, the showers worked fine and I slept like a log so nothing wrong with the beds! Great places to eat, lots of souvenir shops and the Midway circus and games area was great for the kids. If you want 5 star go somewhere else but we thought it was great

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: nzkelly
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the skyrise tower, on the very top floor. It wasn't very straightforward to navigate through the hotel without a map. The room was clean and tidy but reeked of smoke in the bathroom even though it was a non-smoking room. Check-in was slow and tedious. But on the plus side staff were helpful and accomodating. Buffet was value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: galinav
Reviews.Content: Horrible Hotel. Till the end of 2009, it not even on the Strip because there is a huge construction between Circus Circus and the main part of the Strip, so you need to drive anyway. The hotel itself is a joke: it's gloomy, stinky and does not have any "happy las vegas feel" whatsoever. I brought my in-laws there, and was very ashamed once we steped into the lobby. If you want to save some money - stay out of the Strip. For the same rate you can find much better deals. If you want to be on the Strip - stay in between Treasure Island and Bellagio (this is the only wlkable part now), but the prices are biting...

Reviews.Title: “Remember you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Mezzer
Reviews.Content: We got a cheap deal and noted the reviews so expected what you should expect for an older 3* hotel on The Strip. Our original room was not what we paid for as we did upgrade in an attempt to get one of their refurbished rooms in the West Tower. The older rooms and corridors have a musty smell and look very tired. I wouldn't want to stay in this part of the hotel. Staff immediately changed our room without any bother and we got a much nicer room only to find it had an adjorning door to another room with nightmare neighbours arguing through the night. In the morning without any fuss staff at reception, in particular Trina who should be noted for her helpfulness, reserved possibly one of the best rooms in the hotel for us. For the rest of the stay we were very satisfied. While a 3* hotel the room must of bordered on 4* if it weren't for a few little things. It is a hotel for families and much of the facilities were based on that theme but what we saw of them looked good and quite updated. If you want a romantic break - spend the money and go elsewhere. Like some areas of the hotel, the swimming pool needed some work. While the pools seemed clean the surrounding areas were not very attractive. Perhaps some plants and trees would look nice? At the end of the day, if you make sure you get a refurbished room in the West Tower then it is a quite adequate hotel. The Deuce bus stop is outside and takes you downtown or to the central area of The Strip and the posher hotels. Being that you can simply walk in and out the other hotels and there is so much to do, you need only sleep in your own hotel. Overall we had a great time in Vegas and while I would not stay in Circus Circus again prefering to go more upmarket (of course you would have to pay more) it did not mean our trip was any less enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “The best place for the kids”
Reviews.Author: Toronto_CanadaAnna08
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best for kids. Didn't like the casino. Some parts of the hotel the carpet stinks. from six elevetor only 3 worked. The buffet: Breakfast $11.00 was worth it. There is no discount for kids. Dinner we ate at the Paris Hotel $25.00 Buffet (recomeded) also there is fast food at Venitian (chines,Burgers etc.) Planet Hollywood have restaurants like sbaro, and Italian cusine cheap for $25 per person for full meal,

Reviews.Title: “check in needs improving”
Reviews.Author: Yeltzy
Reviews.Content: Rooms were a great size were in rooms near the adventure dome and pool,we thought the buffet had improved since we stopped there 3 years ago,maybe the hotel needs a little re-fit but overall not bad for the price you pay,all i would say it took us 1 1/2 hrs to check inn,yes i know the hotel has alot of rooms but when you see check in desks untended when the queue is very long just think it could be improved...

Reviews.Title: “Best deal on strip”
Reviews.Author: bayhung
Reviews.Content: excelent deal 2 nights, and 3rd night free. It cost me less than 100.00 dollars. SkyRise tower is not that bad, especially i only need a place to sleep

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: ArcadiaMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Circus Circus in the Skyrise tower room with a "view" (17th floor). The beds are very uncomfortable and housekeeping didn't clean our room. When we got back to our room around 6:30 pm I called housekeeping to come and clean the room and they never showed up. We stayed here in 2006 and what a big difference.

Reviews.Title: “great for families”
Reviews.Author: afruitbat
Reviews.Content: stayed there for a few days this sep. the standards isn't up yo ceasers or bellagio, etc. but then again it doesn't claim to be. if you are taking the kids to vegas, this is the place to stay. i found the staff very helpful, the room was clean and tidy. and the meals acceptable, not many faults really.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck!”
Reviews.Author: bridgesong
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for, so all we got was a basic-blah, 2 queen-bed room with clean sheets and towels. I wish we had spent a little more on a different place because this hotel/casino. has seen better days. It has become downright seedy, has NO redeeming ambiance, the carpeting is filthy. and there are NO coffee pots in the rooms. Thanks to trip advisor I read about the bus stop being out in front!! We wouldn't have been able to enjoy the strip without them... the busses were nicer and cleaner than the hotel! However, if you stay here be prepared to walk A LOT!! Check-in didn't take long, but the person who checked us in ,whose initials are MGM, told us our room was a suite (it wasn't) and that we'd have a lovely view of the strip (it actually looked over a roof top and the construction going on down the street). The baby next door didn't cry all night and our room didn't smell bad like some other areas of this property did. Like all the casinos on the strip, the drinks at the slot machines and tables are gratis. The cafeteria style breakfast was OK, but we didn't want to eat there again. Next time, I'll spend more money and will stay in a centrally located, newer, nicer place.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Decent for your money...”
Reviews.Author: bwright526
Reviews.Content: I arrived and got lost trying to find our room. This place is huge! I still never made it through the entire hotel. I figure for the price and the fact that I only slept there, it's a very good deal. You can walk to the center of the strip where all the excitement is (very long walk if you're not in shape). Or you can catch the Deuce. A double decker bus that runs 24 hours a day. A one way trip will cost you $2. A 24 hour pass is only $5 (Better Deal). The busses can get a little crowded and at night they will seem to take forever. If this happens, no bother, just take a cab! Anyway, back to the hotel. The food at the Casino Cafe is awesome. Huge portions. One order of something will probably feed 2 to 3 people. It can get a lil smoky because it's connected to the casino and people are allowed to smoke in the casino. So, don't get seated near the door of the restaurant. There's a $10 shop that has lovely jewelry and another one that has very nice souvenir gifts. I wanted to go to the store called "LYCNS-PL8S" or something like that. I never got around to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Good for what you pay”
Reviews.Author: Nikkid86
Reviews.Content: Circus Circus was just what id expected. I booked a West Tower Room which was newly decorated, and it was perfect for what we needed, it was clean, maid came everyday and got clean towels, and fresh linen whenever we wanted!! There was no sound out of the air con, the bathroom was clean, and there was a 32" flat screen tv!! Safe was free to use!! There was no kids in the hotel, but that is probably due to the time of year. Check-in took 5 mins, tho it was 1am, and check out took 5 mins, it was 7am!! The Duece bus stops right out side the hotel and takes u up the strip for $5 for a 24 hour ticket!! I would stay in the hotel again, just wouldn't eat in it, GROSS!!!!

Reviews.Title: “bargain”
Reviews.Author: karinkSalzburg
Reviews.Content: we arrived at circus circus not expecting a lot and it was actually quite nice. front desk staff was extremly friendly and helpful. room was big with two massive beds, a nice bathroom and very clean. the buffet in the evening wasnt great but ok...nothing special but than again for 12$ okay... the gambling there is perfect for young people and travellers as it is really really cheap and affortable. no pool unfortunatly. for that price???an absolut bargain :)

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and adequate”
Reviews.Author: clarecol007
Reviews.Content: Didn't book, just called at reception and got clean, quiet, comfortable room with 2 queens for $39 a night. Incredible value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Fear and Loathing in Circus Circus”
Reviews.Author: Lanegan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our first trip to Las Vegas. It was my choice being a Hunter S Thompson fan I wanted to stay in the hotel featured in the novel Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas. Let me start by saying the rooms are huge....but that's about all that is good about it. Checking in took at least an hour. Front desk staff were hopeless. When we did finally get to our room it stank. Changing rooms took another hour and we were allocated a less stinky room. We got used to the smell after a few days. The bed was hard and uncomfortable. We were there for ten days and I think housekeeping only changed our sheets and made up our room for four of those days. We had to physically chase them down for clean towels as contacting the front desk got us nowhere. The safe was broken and the air conditioner was very old and didn't work well. Very noisy day and night. Lots of comings and goings at all times of the night. Thin walls....I was kept awake by the man in the room next door snoring one night. Lots of ladies that you see on those cards they hand out on The Strip frequenting the hallways. We took another trip to Las Vegas September 08 and we didn't venture down that end of The Strip. Our Circus Circus stay was 18 months ago so they may have had some sort of refurbishment or upgrade since then. Even so I wouldn't stay there again....too far away from amenities. They didn't even have a Starbucks!

Reviews.Title: “Not great!!!!”
Reviews.Author: diddley00
Reviews.Content: booked for 3nts upgraded to a 3* not worth it! hotel smelt, room in main tower was the most basic i ever stayed in, not even a teas made! the beds were the lumoyest ever! wokr every 2hrs sore and had to turn!! made do cause it was only for 3nts

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience. More like a zoo than an circus”
Reviews.Author: ItravelAtlanta
Reviews.Content: First, there was a lower rate online but when you clicked "register" nothing happened so you HAD to call the hotel. When I got to the hotel, the lines were outrageous and unorganized. We got a AAA rate, but were not given the "deal" that was online and then even charged a "fee" for the telephone even though we never even touched it. The rooms were filthy and smelly. When we woke up, my kids and I all had bites on our arms and legs. I could go on and on about the sticky table and dirty cups at dinner inside the hotel, but I'll refrain to say that I will never stay there again. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Whats Happened Here???”
Reviews.Author: somobr
Reviews.Content: Well I have to say I was a little disappointed this time round. I have been to Vegas twice before and stayed at Circus Circus twice before, so I knew exactly what to expect - value for money. Yes its cheaper that all the other hotels and at the end of the strip, but we liked this. Recently renovated I can say nothing negative about the accommodation - room was clean, fresh, large, much more than value for money. Its the very unfriendly and unhelpfulness of the staff that would probably deter me from staying here again. It doesn't bother me that it is full of families at peak season, the great part about staying here is you sleep here then head off for the day.... but I just can't stand rude staff and a no can do attitude!!!! Not much more to say than great value for money as long as you don't need ANY help at all from the staff and lets be honest everyone has a question to ask the concierge at one point during your stay. I think this hotel has got too big for its boots and management may want to look at putting their staff on some customer service training

Reviews.Title: “Great Bed. Pool area needs work”
Reviews.Author: snugglesiniowa
Reviews.Content: I loved my king size bed in my room and, wish I could have bought it home. Shower pressure was the greatest in any hotel that I have ever had. Room was clean. The only problem with the room was the air conditioning was a little loud and many noise. I would stay at this hotel again if I was not planning to use the pool. The lifeguards did nothing and were text messaging there friends. If you are wanting a pool area that lifeguards enforce the rules, this hotel is not for you. But, if you are not going to swim, I would stay there again too.

Reviews.Title: “Bad location, and nightlife”
Reviews.Author: Garet_Jax
Reviews.Content: Stayed summer 2008, found the location not best suited to singles and parties looking to enjoy the nightlife of Vegas. Also the hotel itself does not contain much in the way of bars, and would be best suited to families. Even the restaurants are closed for large parts of the day. Staying here will result in lots of walking elsewhere, or waiting for buses!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Gal_27
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Circus Circus, arriving on July 29 and left on August 5th. I'll start with the positive notes: 1. Bedding and towels were clean. 2. The room was cheap. 3. The breakfast buffet was the best on the strip. 4. The Duece basically stops right in front of the Casino. 5. Nice variety of games including slots, poker and gambling available. 6. Loved the half-price ticket booth near the registration desk and the staff there was WONDERFUL! Here are the negatives: 1. The room was cheap because it was part of the "manor" rooms, which is 2 blocks _behind_ the casino! 2. The bathroom floor had tiny cuts and lacerations in the linoleum. The wallpaper had some discoloration. The bathtub backed up after being in the shower for more than 5 minutes. 3. Waiting 2 hours in line for registration is outrageous! Registration opened at 3:00 pm and I came back around 5:00pm. Even if I had come back around 10:00 pm, the line was STILL a 2 hour wait! 4. The casino is on the Northern part of the strip. It's so far away from everything else! Since they got rid of the Stardust, there are only 2 casinos nearby - the Riviera (across the street) & Slots o Fun. 5. Getting on the Duece was hellish at times. It was always packed with riders going southbound on the strip. 6. KIDS KIDS EVERYWHERE KIDS!!!!!!!!! They were running around, without parental supervision, acting like hooligans, and no one is around to make sure they are behaving! They have to walk on the casino floor to get to the Midway Area where the circus acts perform. I was hoping to go into a casino to get AWAY from the children! 7. Even though there are 2 pools, trying to get a chair near the pool is impossible. Circus Circus is an older casino and they have tried to make some renovations to update it. You honestly get what you pay for here and if you don't like children, this is _not_ the place for you! I will never stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the hype”
Reviews.Author: guidotpoplegend
Reviews.Content: This is for people like me who have booked Circus Circus and then read the horrible reviews: Stayed from 30/08 to 01/09 which was Labo(u)r Day weekend and so VERY busy. Lots of children so when walking through the hotel go through the gambling areas where they are not allowed. Longish line at check in but didn't take too long. Staff extremely polite and helpful. Stayed in the West tower and the room was perfect. Food is OK. Denny's is just down the road so I would say have breakfast there. There is no doubt that the old girl could do with a lick of paint but if you've saved your money by staying here then go and gamble in the Wynn which is 10-15 minutes walk away. Beautiful hotel. Try the champagne Sunday brunch. You won't want to eat again for a week. All in all a very enjoyable stay. Very difficult to fault.

Reviews.Title: “BIG DISAPPOINTMENT”
Reviews.Author: CoolGalChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed here Aug. 29th thru Sep 1st 2008. We were a little deceived by the lobby, which was nice and the shops/restaurants which were also nice. But when it came to the actual rooms, it was a big disappointment. There were cigarette burns on the Bedspread, which you could see was also very old by the visible fading. The first night, we had holes in our Sheets, and the 2nd night, there were tears in our sheets. At least they changed them, but that wasn’t saying much. The TV was very small and only had stations with old episodes of TV shows, no premium TV, unless you paid for it. Even a Motel 6, gives you HBO. Aside from the room issues, about ½ the elevators were down which caused people to have to take the stairs down on our last day. We were on floor 16. My husband also, had gotten his leg caught in one of the elevators when it didn’t automatically open when it “should” sense that someone or something is still in between the doors. A young girl had actually gotten her arm caught the previous day. When told about the problem, the only asked if my husband was hurt but didn’t ask which elevator it was, as if they didn’t care to fix it. Unless you’re looking for Motel quality, I would not recommend anyone staying here. It’s actually worth paying a little bit more per night to stay in the middle of the strip at a decent hotel. The shops/restaurants do not compare to the poor quality of the rooms. I WOULD NOT STAY HERE AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Too far from strip.”
Reviews.Author: ladybird09
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Vegas, weather fabulous, sights eye popping, we will go back next year. We stayed at the CIRCUS CIRCUS HOTEL, on advice from our travel agent, we where told that it was a central location to all the activities and attractions.........boy where we mislead. The hotel is at the end of the strip, the wrong end, too far away from the hustle and bustle, we had to pay 20 dollars in a taxi to get to MGM, LUXOR ETC. So most days we paid 60 dollars on taxis alone. The hotel is one of the oldest on the strip, and by the smell, id believe it. The staff where lovely, no complaints there, room was clean and basic, only thing with the room is, to use the safety deposit box, you have to put 50c into it everytime you open it. Got a bit annoying. The pool is tiny, maybe 8ft by 6ft, not good for a hoiday resort. The buffet made us ill, we tried it one day and i was on the loo and he was vomiting, so we gave it a go 2 days later, and we both where on the loo, our taxi driver told us, that most tourists who end up in the hospital are from Circus Circus OMG. I did see approx 2 ambulances daily leaving the hotel. So if its a cheap room you want, go there, if its location, food, sunbathing, shopping, stay in Mandalay, MGM, Ceasers, New york new york or venitian for pure luxury. Also for a fab spa....go to Wynn hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok...since we are only here for a short time”
Reviews.Author: Yooom
Reviews.Content: We've been traveling through the southwest for the past 2 weeks and are ending our vacation here before flying back home. This hotel is definitely on the dowdy side. The clock radio is stuck to the bedstand is totally gutted (like a car up on blocks). The elevator to the pool is almost scary and there is a general beat up feel to the place. However the space for the room and bathroom is generous enough and we got this place for its price and location on the north end of the strip (we're in the Skyrise Tower, 3rd floor, not a great view), If I ever find myself in Las Vegas, I'll try a different casino/hotel for more money.

Reviews.Title: “What a tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: seniorcitizens
Reviews.Content: We've been here in the past but we couldn't believe it. It really looks worn out We were in room 29825 thats the 29th floor of the newest tower. The hall carpeting is so worn there is hardly a design left. We were pleased to see this beautiful looking room, but..... little did we know. The mattresses are so soft, you actually slide off the edges, but.... The worse part is the bathroom, our sink had such loose faucets, my hubby said he was surprised it didn't blow off. The shower head leaked all directions and we never were able to shut off the water completely. But first of all, when we arrived, I noticed no handtowels so called housekeeping and a gal came up and gave us a pile of washcloths and said they were "all out" of hand towels. Wonder what they did for the pile of people checking in after us. If this was the best tower, imagine what you get in the worst one. We didn't try the restaurents, this is a casino but its probably one of the best stops for kids, cuz they were everywhere, screaming and running and bus loads of tourists with luggage piled everywhere (taking up the lobby and halls) Just general noise and confusion. Not a place for anyone wanting just a "nice" place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “circus circus”
Reviews.Author: leeseloo
Reviews.Content: we were worried about staying here after reading some dodgy reviews but we had an amazing time. check in quick, rooms easy to find, we had booked 3 together and they were all within 5 rooms of each other. our teens absolutely loved it! big rooms, lovely bathroom and clean. it is on the strip, a bit of a walk away from the new york new york end but all the hotel carparks are free so do what we did and drive to that end. it can get a bit hot to walk at times. saying that though treasure island and mirage are nearly next door! make sure you fit in the free shows on at the front of the hotels, the fountains at bellagio are breath taking. would definitely recommend this hotel to families, especially teens. the one thing we did find shocking is the amount of wee little kids up at 2 in the morning. there are some dodgy sights late evening up and down the strip and it felt uncomfortable at times walking around with my 2 teens, they enjoyed it though! don't do what we did and get lost in the venetian! it is like a small city in each of these hotels, we walked in to watch the gondolas and after an hour of walking ended up coming out of another hotel pretty much where we started!!! also make sure you visit the cheesecake factory in caesars palace, fantastic! but beware if you order appetizers as they don't do small portions!!

Reviews.Title: “Most Family Friendly Hotel on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: smile_karbear
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for part of our honeymoon and was quite pleased with the atmosphere. We consider it to be the most family friendly hotel on the strip. The room was clean and comfortable. The only problem was the long line waiting to check in.

Reviews.Title: “O K”
Reviews.Author: havecasego
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Vegas a week in Circus 3rd to 10th august. Stayed in Manor Wing expecting horror stories,but it was ok,cleaned every day,nice big beds,ice machine outside. Only ate there once to dear and food not much kop. Hardest part trying to get out of hotel,fat people everywhere,had my grandson with us and he dident go on any of the rides. Took 45 minutes to check in. Wouldent stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “STAY ON THE STRIP FOR AN OFF STRIP PRICE!”
Reviews.Author: Gooood1
Reviews.Content: Went to Vegas for nine days in July - arrived for crazeee July 4th! Having said that checking in was easy and our room was large and clean. The hotel is geared for families and unlike most of the other hotels on the strip there are kids everywhere. During our stay some teenagers moved in to the room next door and were very noisy and quite intimidating - the hotel security and help desk were fantastic we changed rooms within an hour to a quiet and much larger room. Circus Circus may be old and not have the finnesse of the newer resort hotels but it has everything that you need - in fact if you didnt want to leave for a week you really wouldnt have to there are loads of restaurants from fast food to a plush expensive steak house. The pool area is across a walkway behind the hotel and has two good sized pools and a bar and snack bar - good for a chill out - it was 42degrees so we only stayed at poolside for a couple of hours each day. Vegas is just fab and i will DEFINITELY be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value On The Strip”
Reviews.Author: AJDunsTew
Reviews.Content: Whilst this is easily the best value on the Strip we were anticipating at least a slight drop in standard from other Casino hotels we had stayed, this was not the case. Check-in was a doddle, unlike some the stories we had read, but it took no time at all. Especially a the cark par is so close to the check-in desk. One thing we did regret was not taking a room on one of the higher floors, we were on the 3rd. The receptionist said we would get a better view on the higher floors and we took this to mean a better view of the strip, but as we found out our view was blocked by a wall. On check-in you are given a variety of vouchers eg. two for one at the buffet, free gambling etc. We didn't use them all but the buffet was good, though have a short wait in the queue. The room was of the standard you would expect form the Las Vegas Strip, ample room and comfortable. Lots to do there but we were there only two night we didn't manage to llok at all the attraction on offer. Would have liked to have stayed a bit longer. Good base if you want see the North Strip. Short walk to the Stratasphere Tower, Treasure Island, Venitian. Also not too far from Freemont Street Experience, which is highly recommended, though you will need transport. Only regret is that we didn't stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “FILTHY & UNKEPT Property Burn it down or blow it up!”
Reviews.Author: circus111
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Manor rooms on first floor building 2 for a 7 night stay. Dirty rooms (we had 2) Foul sewer smell in room coming from tub drain (we had to keep water in the tub to stop the foul odor from coming up, light cord behind bed shorts out right next to mattress my children where sleeping on (extreme fire hazard danger), light bulbs continually burning out. If that wasn't enough, 2 days prior to leaving (we stayed for 7 days) our bathroom floor became wet, then wetter, then flooded. The flood of water was coming from the wall & was an issue upstairs of us with a broken pipe, or toilet issue. The wall in our bathroom had water bubbles HUGE ones, under the wallpaper & sheetrock. You could press on them and watch the water run out. Then the floor in our bathroom also had rotten mildew tile & carpet. I almost forgot to mention, the beds/sizes requested where not as they assured me they would be. Escalators & moving walkways where often not working for days at a time. Corridors & hallways where musky stinky smelly & the carpets where beyond gross. Casino area is outdated too, but the slot machines seemed to pay out a bit more than other casinos. On a positive note, all the housekeeping staff we dealt with where extremely kind & professional. The check in staff was very nice as well & check in time was timely. Would we ever stay again at this property? NO WAY! WHAT A DISASTER THIS STAY WAS~

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel, clean & friendly, suited our teenage boys well recommend”
Reviews.Author: BrendaCambridgeUk
Reviews.Content: I was worried about my booking as some reviews were not too good BUT we were so pleased we had chosen Circus Circus it wasnt too big was very clean food excellent. Had posh meal in their steakhouse that has won awards for last 11 years. rooms were excellent big comfy beds very quiet at night. we are so pleased we cannot praise the staff and hotel enough. Shame there is talk that it is being pulled down within next five years!

Reviews.Title: “No longer fits in with the current Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: stuey44
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Circus Circus in 2006 and was in a skyrise room, which was much nicer than the tower room I had this time. It is hard to tell if the rooms have been refurbished, as the decor is very dark, with carpets, bedding and lampshades being brown. The room was clean, just quite dark, the hotel overall is now nothing compared to the other hotels available in Vegas. Rumours have it that it may well be knocked down, and with Trump towers overlooking and a few others under construction next door it wont be there too much longer. The hallways and elavators are shabby, and the casino floor is dark and depressing with poor quality food on offer, the buffet seems very busy but I didnt enjoy it in 2006 and the hotel and gone downhill since then. The in room safe charges $0.50 each time you open it, and they charge $1 per night for the phone, even if you dont use it. I gave the pool a try, but could hardly see my feet at the bottom as the water was so cloudy, and the smell was very unpleasant and a member of my party had a unsettled stomach after taking a swim. I recommend that you avoid this hotel now, the walk back up the strip at night is not illuminated as construction is underway where the Stardust and Frontier used to be.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: newbride4708
Reviews.Content: We went to Las Vegas for our honeymoon july 2008 and stayed at the Circus Circus Hotel. It was a good hotel. We stayed on the 23rd floor, thank god for the lifts. Our room was very spacious with a king size bed and lots of storage fr our clothes and luggage etc. The bathroom was large too with a big mirror which took up the length of the bathroom, a bath and shower. If i was being picky the tap in the sink was quite tempermental and would often not turn off when we had used it so we just used the tap on the bath. The room was nicce and clean. All the staff that we dealt with were very nice. All i would say is that the marketing teams in the hotel and indeed each hotel were sometimes quite annoying and would keep offering you free gifts. Only they were not free and you had to go somewhere with a company and look at some resorts, we weren't keen or trustworthy to do that! Othe than that all the staff seemed friendly. We tried one of the restaurants in the hotel and it had a wide range on the menu. There were also plenty shops in the hotel. The buffet was ok, nothing special. The hotel was in an ok location but be prepared to walk and walk and walk. it took us at least 10 minutes to even get out of our hotel! but never mind its nice to walk around as theres lots to see. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated tower room lovely - Hotel & Casino are VERY tired”
Reviews.Author: drmarkh
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to stay in a renovated tower room. It was awesome - just fantastic!. However, the rest of Circus Circus is VERY tired and doesn't compare well to other places on the strip. Also the hotel is quite separated from the rest of the strip due to building & demolition work. The Casino is really old.

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus....It's like a Circus!”
Reviews.Author: Idaho4me
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 2 nights in the West Tower of Circus Circus on the Las Vegas Strip. We got the "nicer room" with the King size bed, shiny comforter, the works. Overall our stay there was less than satisfactory. First, you have to park what seems like MILES from your room. Just getting our luggage from our van and up to the 17th floor was EXHAUSTING! We were drained by the time we got it all up there. The elevators were a joke! The elevators are "split" meaning 4 of them go only to certain lower floors and the other 4 go to the upper floors. Confusing. There was almost always at least one elevator down (not working). This created a jam of people. This whole place was SOO CROWDED it was ridiculous. You couldn't walk anywhere without walking into a hundred people. Kids running everywhere (to be expected, I suppose considering the hotel theme) yelling. To me, this hotel and casino felt like an OLD (which it is) place with a new paint job! We tried playing slots of varying denominations and lost HUNDREDS of dollars. Not once, even getting a "teaser-win". Gone are the days of inexpensive dining, EVERYthing there was expensive! For Gaming, go downtown to Fremont Street, get off the Disney like strip! AVOID THIS PLACE unless you love crowds and hassles.

Reviews.Title: “Are you kidding me?”
Reviews.Author: iceberglettuce
Reviews.Content: While I parked the car, my pregnant wife followed a face-paced bell boy up to our room. After he threw our bags on the bed, my wife told him that she would be right down to the desk to give him a tip once I came back up with cash. The bell boy (who was about 50) then cussed my wife out, using every expletive he knew. When I got to the room, I found my wife in tears and on the phone to the bell captain. The Bell captain came up and gave us a coupon for the hotel’s buffet, saying that was where his authority ends and that we should talk to hotel management if we are unsatisfied. I went downstairs to talk to the manager. I told him what the bell boy called my wife. He says, “Why are you telling this to me?” I told him it was because he was the manager. “Hey, it’s between you and the bell captain.” I told him that we didn’t feel a coupon for a buffet where we weren’t going to eat was good enough. He insisted that this just wasn’t his problem. I told him that I couldn’t imagine a hotel manager not being concerned about his bell boy making threats against pregnant women. He shook his head at me like I was an absurd child. “I want my money back,” I finally said. “You’ll be checking out then?” he asked smugly. ”Yes, and please connect me to the Better Business Bureau,” I said, pointing to a phone. “Now hold on, sir,” he said. “We’re upgrading you to a bigger room, is that enough? You’re sitting here wanting to talk to the Better Business Bureau and I still don’t know what you’re complaining about, but we’ll upgrade you.” We took the upgrade because it was midnight and we’d been driving all day. But I barricaded the door and hardly slept all night, I was so worried about childish retribution. Never, EVER, stay there. It’s [-].

Reviews.Title: “What was, ain't no more”
Reviews.Author: Divecop3
Reviews.Content: Well, as with most of my reviews I have to say something positive. David, the clerk that checked us in was very polite, professional and a credit employee. Parking was free and convenient enough for me and my family. The whole concept of this worn out "theme" hotel demonstrates what any one that has been to a real circus lately knows. Circus' are not what they use to be and they all about the cash. Let's forget for a moment that this "theme" hotel has several casinos in it and that's why people go to Las Vegas. The AdventureDome is not meant for waiting parents or grandparents trying to show their grandchildren a good time. It is meant for buying a well priced "all-ride" braclet and letting the kids go crazy. Drop 'em and come back later or check with security for their whereabouts later. The main purpose that families come there is obvious in the name of the facility but do not get your hopes up. What you do want to do is get to the main circus level 1/2 before any shows on the small stage area as fast as you can. The acts come out 1 at a time, last less than 10 minutes then disappear until the next act 1/2 hour later. I guess they do that to have activities all-day long. The seating is horribly small and crowded. The buffet area is very crowded and more like a zoo. The Old-Town Buffet or the Golden Coral Buffet's have more options.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: HUNTINGPARTY
Reviews.Content: We'd read all the reviews on this site so weren't expecting much but we got a really good deal ($51 per night + tax & $50 on a gas card) and were only in Vegas for 3 nights at the start of the holiday so decided to risk it. Check in was OK. 2 long queues but about 5 or 6 staff moving people through. In fact the line looked longer than it really was due to the number of people who insisted on queuing up with their whole family. We deliberately booked a room in the main tower for the convenience rather than going for a refurbished room. Room was old, maybe a little tired but large with lots of room to put our luggage and it was clean. The beds were comfortable and the A/C worked well and wasn't too noisy. The bathroom was clean and functioning. The rest of the hotel was busy - extremely so at weekends - and there were a LOT of children, but then we were travelling with our own (14 & 16) so who am I to talk. The entertainment was good when it was there. We tried several times to see the circus acts but it was always too crowded or not on for an hour or something. The one act we did see was brilliant, if short (about 5 mins). Circus Circus is at the older end of the strip near the Sahara and at the moment is surrounded by building sites. In fact to get to any of the other themed hotels at the south end would require a 10 -15 minute walk at least. Given we were there in July it wasn't really walking weather. Unlike some of the hotels at the other end, the links with Circus Circus are not good. It does not link to other hotels and the tram is a long way away. We never managed the bus as we had a hire car and found it easier to drive. All in all a positive experience and a good introduction to Vegas. Would I stay here again? Probably not. I'm not a casino person and there are nicer places to stay off strip.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Kpthook
Reviews.Content: We just returned from staying at Circus Circus for a week. We booked through Expedia and thought we got a pretty good deal. As others have noted Circus Circus is an old property in need of a serious face lift. However, you also get what you pay for and this ain’t the Wynn more like Motel 6. We had a room in the Manor section. We stayed in building E. As others have said it is a hike to the main building. It would have been nice if the front desk had told us they have an inside bridge over to the Manor Buildings’ parking lot. The room was large and clean. There was a mini fridge and a basic TV with very few channels but we wern't here to watch TV. No frills. The people in housekeeping did a good job, there was plenty of hot water and water pressure, the a/c worked well and the ice machine was at the elevator landing. There was a nice size pool. We felt safe and there was a visual presence of security patrolling the area. Check in was fairly quick. I think it is dependent on the time of day, etc. One thing we learned nothing is complimentary, not breakfast, not internet (like $13 a day) and everything on the strip is pricey. There are a number of on site eateries but did not eat at any on the property so can’t comment on food quality. There is a small commissary on the property for getting basic food items and sundries. The Deuce (public transit) bus stop was right out front so that was convenient. All in all the experience was ok. It’s all relative to your expectations. We don’t gamble, we were there to see Vegas and Hoover Dam. For us it was inexpensive and it worked to lay our heads.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and nasty!”
Reviews.Author: Fiona59
Reviews.Content: We were booked into Circus Circus as part of a package with Virgin Holidays. I can't believe that they use such a grotty dump and I am glad to hear that it is scheduled to be knocked down soon. We were booked on a holiday that is unlikely to appeal to young families so I don't know why Virgin selected this hotel to be part of the package. There certainly wasn't much for our 2 teenagers (apart from Krispy Kreme donuts!) The rooms were smelly and dark and the towels were soiled. We changed one of our rooms but it wasn't much better. The public areas looked grubby and we didn't eat in the hotel because everything seemed so cheap and nasty so we didn't want to risk it. Fortunately we found lots to do in Las Vegas so we didn't spend much time in the hotel. The pool was awful and reached only via a long walk through gloomy corridors then a ride in a lft that sounded like it would break down any minute.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away unless you like being around hundreds and hundreds of kids!”
Reviews.Author: Turtle567
Reviews.Content: Check-in: Was horrible. I kid you not it was as if someone bused in a couple hundred babies, elementary aged, middle schooled aged and high school students to this hotel. We checked in around 10pm and we stood in line for about 45 minutes. For someone reason there were only 2 people checking in. There were other people behind the counter but they were just doing their own thing. They did not help to check in even when there was a line of 50 or more people waiting to check in. Finally when it was our turn. The man was very nice. He gave us a map of how to find our room. Boy his explanation - from where our actual room was - is crazy! Room: I am not joking we had to walk 20 minutes from the lobby to our room. We stayed in a Skyrise Room on the 17th floor. Actual room is 1711. Unlike other reviews I have read our room was very nice and we didn't have a problem with our room whatsoever. It was just the jungle of kids and casino and people that work there are are always trying to stop you and offer you free tickets to shows if you go see this resort for 3 hours out of the day. No freakin way will I ever put my family through that crap. Amenities: We never used the Adventure-Dome, We are a child free for the moment. My husband show the price, we read horror stories about staying in the Manor so we figured staying in the Skyrise Tower can't be that bad. We ate at the Pizza place in the hotel twice and we liked it both times. We avoided the buffet because it was always packed. We avoided all of the other eateries in the hotel because they were too over priced. No one was ever in them. Location: It's far from the strip. Which was ok for us. We basically rode the Deuce Bus there is a stop right outside the hotel. We were there for a week. The first 3 days it seemed to be ok to take the bus. It's double decker, and air conditioned. However as time went on and more and more people checked into hotels the bus stops became unbearable. At times we waiting in the hot 110 degree scorching heat for more then a hour and a half I thought we were going to die. At that point there are more then 50 people waiting to go on the bus. When a bus finally shows up it's already packed with people and maybe only 10 people can get on. It's not a fun experience. We did rent a car for 2 days. We traveled to Hover Dam, Red Rock and The Grand Canyon. We got a great deal through American Express only having to pay 22 dollars a day. When we turned that PT Cruiser back in ooh man we made a big mistake. I would recommend you rent a car the whole time you are there. Quirks: The maids didn't speak English. Sometimes when we came back to our room from being out and about the whole day the towels either did not smell clean or they had particles in them like they were not clean. This happened twice. When we arrived to our room. We wanted to test how they cleaned. We dropped something in the corner to see if they would pick it up or if they vacuumed over it. Nope it was never touched. When you sit on the bed you can feel the coils. However after sleeping on it. It was quite comfortable. No complaints. The TV didn't really have too many channels. We basically just watched CNN. Also ENGLISH is not the spoken language here. All throughout the trip we heard more chinese, spanish, french, italian, german and arabic then I've ever heard in my life. A couple of times we wondered where we were. Overall: I would recommend if you don't have kids don't stay here. If you do have kids still don't stay here. If your looking for something within the same price range opt to stay on or near Fremont Street. Fremont Street has the canopy of lights - awesome! It's shaded so you will not be in the hot sun. There is a Starbucks/ w outside sitting area. This area is where the Old School Vegas is. If I ever go back to visit this is where we will more then likely stay. Or if we can afford it will be stay at MGM. Hope this Helps Someone! Visited July 19 to the 25th from Florida

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Sarah028Uk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Circus Cicrus for 10 nights in April/May. Having read the reviews we opted for a tower room and also rang a month in advance and requested a recently refurbished room. When we arrived (4pm mid week) there was not a single person in the queue to check in, the lady was lovely and friendly and we were given a new room as requested. The room was great, very clean, spacious and with plasma tv and looked a lot more modern than we were expecting. During our stay there our room was always cleaned well and the staff were friendly. We booked show tickets from the hotel and the staff were very informative. We did find that the hotel was VERY busy at weekends and there were lots of children, that said we never waited long for an elevator back to the room and there was never any noise from adjoining rooms. All in all it is at the far end of the strip, but there is the deuce bus stop right outside, it is busy on weekends but is quiet in the rooms and if you have a new room then the price is perfect. My only slight complaint is the pool, it was hard to find and was via grotty parts of the hotel and when we got there it wasn't great but then we weren't there to lie out by the pool all day!!! If you want a cheaper option then go for it......but get a newer room!!!

Reviews.Title: “Kid's Paradise”
Reviews.Author: kshofer
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on this site and looking at some traveler's photos, I was a little worried about our stay. We had adjoining rooms which were in very good condition. Very comfortable beds and pillows. Our kids were disappointed that there wasn't more TV programming for them (Disney Channel or Nick), but who comes to Vegas to watch TV anyway? The Adventure Dome is a great value. We had coupons, so the wristbands were only $20 per child, per day (reg. $24). Our kids loved the rides, carnival games and video games. We even caught a trapeze act that was great. All in all, a great stay with our kids.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Variety of Slots - Definitely a Hotel for Families w/Children”
Reviews.Author: TheBuick
Reviews.Content: Casino - I must preface my review of the slots by stating I am old school with the exception of, I do like getting tickets rather than digging for coins. I love the slots at Circus Circus. They had all my old favorites as well as some new slots I have never played. Rooms - We had a room in the West Tower which I am told is newly renovated. They definitely smelled and looked new. We were there for a family reunion. A few of the rooms were starting to look worn, mine didn't. It is indeed a shame that some folks feel as though they can treat a hotel room shabbily (I'll bet their homes reflect this too). The beds were very comfortable and the bathrooms were very nice and very very clean. Some of the family had showers only. Hotel Lobby - Absolutely horrendous. Carpet was so filthy, I did not want to walk on it. Needless to say I quickly passed through when I had to. I guess they could care less as rumor has it, they will be gone within the next 2 years. Taken over by MGM - imploded and something fancier to replace it. They truly need help organizing their check in process. Very long lines. There's got to be a better way. Children - Everywhere. We had no problems with this as we had children for the family reunion also. They wore themselves out in the Adventuredome with the rides and at the Midway playing games and of course, supping at the golden arches. Food - Of course McDs was the most economical and tastes great. The "Casino Cafe" had excellent food and outstanding customer service. The "Buffet" was edible; however, great customer service. Circus Circus was the last hotel stay after 10 days in Vegas. Two nights were at the Golden Nugget downtown, four nights at Harrah's and last four nights at Circus Circus. If I had to rank the overall stay at the hotels: Harrah's, Circus Circus, and Golden Nugget in that order.

Reviews.Title: “Its a dump”
Reviews.Author: Cowboypilot
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a newly updated room, and It was nice. Once you get outside the room, it was awful. Crowed, shoulder to shoulder people. Elevator wait was very long, Line for everything was long, front desk, check in/out. Dark, dreary lobby. Room price was nice and that is probably why it was so crowed it brought in a large mix of people. I wanted an alcohol free daiquiri and it cost $14.95. I refused to pay for it. So they make up the low room cost with over priced drinks. Never hit a slot nor did I see one hit. The poker room was boring and poor crowd there too.

Reviews.Title: “pretty cool place”
Reviews.Author: travel_safely
Reviews.Content: A friend booked this room, so I had no say in the matter. It was my first trip to Vegas, so I was very excited. The check in took forever and there were a lot of kids, but I guess with a name like Circus Circus, that was to be expected. The indoor "big top" was fun and my friend stopped at the first machine she saw and put in $0.75 and won $300!! (I must admit I was jealous!) The room was nice and clean. Nothing extra fancy and it is an older resort, but no major complaints. The staff was very friendly. My friend and I left at different times because of our flights and the hotel was very nice about extending my check-out time. The front desk gave us a map to find our room which was NOT helpful. You almost need a tour guide to navigate through the hallways. Overall it was a pretty nice place. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families, not a bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: klandmw
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a great family hotel. It has a lot for the family. The restraunts are okay, the buffet is great, the shows are super fun. The indoor amusement park is really fun. It is a older hotel. It isnt as nice as the MGM but it is also 1/2 the price. It is a little dirtier then some of the other hotels, but like I said, it is a family hotel. If you want something really nice, then pay for it and stay at MGM. If you want a clean room and beds, that is a fun hotel, lots to do, aand you dont mind it being a little older then this a great way to have a little more spending money.

Reviews.Title: “Tower rooms probably good”
Reviews.Author: Viburnum
Reviews.Content: I concluded from reading the reviews that I should only stay in a tower room, and I was glad I did. The room, including the bathroom, was spacious and the furnishings were in good conditions. I don’t like that it was not easy to find the elevators to our tower. We had kids and luggage in tow, took a wrong bet on which elevator to ride, before going some winding hallways to the correct connecting elevator. I wished they had given better directions. I immediately missed staying in a small motel where you park right outside your room.

Reviews.Title: “No Extras in this place”
Reviews.Author: abbiandi
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay if you have kids with you but just be aware that there are charges for any extra's such as internet.. $12 per day.. Also you are charged a dollar a day for outgoing calls even if you don't use them... No breakfast included. It is a cheap place to stay.. We were in the Main tower and the beds were comfy and clean.. Toilets did plug up very easily.. We had no view other than a vent outside with garbage strewn around that people must have thrown out the window.. There was a light shining at our window all night so you seen that through the crack in the curtains.. It is an old hotel so no fridge, microwave or outside sink.. Was tough for the 4 of us to get going early on due to the bathroom having the mirror and lighting in it and sink. No exhaust fan so it fogged up very badly and everything was dripping wet.. No towels and took forever to get any.. Room lighting was terrible... Neighbors were very noisy through the walls.. It is the only Hotel in Vegas that you were not charged extra for your kids... Also the staff liked to leave the laundry and garbage carts in the hallways.. Took forever to book in as people all over the place.....

Reviews.Title: “Stayed from July 8th to the 11th, 2008. Not Bad at All!”
Reviews.Author: Sangies
Reviews.Content: This was the first time my husband and I were visiting Las Vegas. We stayed at Circus Circus. Getting to and from Circus Circus from McCarron International Airport. There are a number of shuttle buses located on the Westside of baggage claim, outside exits 7 to 13. We opted to use Bell Trans which cost us $11 US each for a return ticket. We made a few stops at other hotels along the way to drop off other travelers but reached hour hotel within a half and hour. I called 5 hours before on the day of our flight back and made a reservation for pick up to return to the airport and the driver was on time. No problems and I recommend the service after talking to other hotel guests who took a taxi which cost them around $30 just to get to the hotel from the airport. And the plus side is the shuttle drops you right off at your airline check in counter. Check In @ Circus Circus There was a long line to check in, we were there at 11am which was early but we were still allowed to check in early. Originally our reservation was for the Skyrise Towers, but I asked if we could upgrade to the West Towers (recently renovated) and it only cost us an extra $10 US a night. Really worth it. The room was nice, the carpet was new, had a king size bed, TV, ironing board, iron, hairdryer, in room safe. Although there was NO refrigerator in the room, there is an ice machine, pop and vending machine right near the elevators. The washroom was nice had marble shower and countertop the only complaint I had was the water pressure was very low. Had good air conditioning in the room. Just buy looking at the hotel and talking to other guests you definitely don’t want to stay in the Manor Suites. They do charge you a $1 a day phone charge for unlimited phone calls even if you don’t’ use the phone. Check out is at 11am and our return flight was at 930pm, so for an extra charge we took the late check out. $25 US for 1pm and $30 for 3pm. We stored our luggage right across from the check in desk at the bell hop for free, so we could spend the afternoon and evening on the strip until we need to be back for our shuttle pick up. Check out was easy and pretty painless. The Hotel The hotel itself was busy, lots of kids but we didn’t mind it. There is a theme park, McDonald’s several stores, Buffet restaurant, a 24 hour café, some free circus shows. The hotel was clean, staff were helpful, and we were pleasantly surprised at the hotel after reading some of the bad reviews. It’s not really that bad. It's what you make of it, and the truth of the matter is you don't stay in your room expect to sleep. There is an information desk and the staff were Tahiti Village shirts. Stay away from them, they are trying to sell you timeshare by offering you free tickets to a show. Opening line to us was “ Are you Married? Our response, “Yes.” They’re retort, “To each other?” We kind of got sick of hearing that and it wasn’t just at Circus Circus but at almost all the hotels we walked into. If your looking for discount show tickets there is a legitimate booth on the second floor that sell half price tickets to the various shows.
