Also if you pick up some coupon books or look online you can find two for one tickets to some shows. Getting Around The best way to get around is using the local bus. It’s called the Deuce which runs up and down the stip. One way is $2 and once you get off then you have to pay another $2 dollars. The best thing to do is to get an all day pass for $5 which is good for a 24 hour period. So we travelled up and down the strip for only $5 dollars, which was great because we could get off at a hotel we wanted to see and then get back on. During the day we did the sightseeing things and then were able to get on the bus to go back to our hotel to shower and freshen up before we headed out for a show or clubbing. It’s a double Decker bus and it’s great to see everything from the second floor. Plus you meet some great people on the bus and some of the bus drivers are so funny. You can even take the bus to Freemont Street were they have a laser and show from 10pm to 1am nightly. We even took the bus to the Premium outlet mall, You take the Deuce towards Freemont street, ask the bus driver which stop to get off on and take the local #108 bus to the mall all on the same bus pass. There is a shuttle that also takes you there for $15 one way but it’s cheaper to use the 24 hour bus pass. Once you are at the mall got to information and get a coupon book for some of the stores, make sure you pick up a map of the mall because there are coupons in there as well. We each bought a bottle of cologne and perfume from Perfumaina and saved $35 Us. We never took a taxi once. There is also a monorail but it’s $15 dollars one way and it only goes to and from certain hotels. Few Tips Buying water is expensive, unless you’re in the hotel gambling then drinks are free. There is a Walgreens within walking distance from CircusCircus. It’s across the street just north of the McDonalds. WATER is cheap there! Sometimes we paid almost $3 US for a small bottle on the strip or from a vending machine. There you can get 1.5 litre for a buck fifty. There is a Travelocity coupon book, I think I got if from the forum shops (http://www.vegas4locals.com/couponforumshops.html) which had a 2 for 1 coupon to the buffet at Planet Hollywood which saves you $26 US. The buffet was pretty good, also tired the MGM buffet which was also quite good. I printed a coupon online for Madame Tussauds Wax Museum. It was a 2 for 1 admission if you went after 7pm. Here’s the link for the coupon. http://www.destinationcoupons.com/nevada/Las_Vegas/Activity_Madame/Coupon.htm) One admission is $25. Good idea to print it off because I couldn’t find it anywhere locally. When we went there was hardly any line up and we had a great time. Make sure you look for the props you can wear next to the wax celebrities, like a robe next to Hugh Hefner, a wedding gown near George Clooney, basket ball with Shaq ect, ect. You can also find $4 dollar off coupons for the museum in the local coupon books. Casino Royal, was great margarita’s for 99 cents all day! Also you can play the Zaltar machine right outside the casino for fee and you get a ticket for $50 free slots. Just north of the Venetian, right across from the Mirage. You can check out this website and print off other coupons that you might use. Nice way to save some money, so you can spend it on other things like shopping!!! (http://vegas4locals.com/coupons.html) And don’t forget your sun screen, it was 45 C / 113 F on July 9th, 2008!!! Hot! Hot! Hot! The water at Walgreen’s and the 99 cent margarita’s at Royal Casino, come in really handy!! Hope this review helped you out!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a waste of money!”
Reviews.Author: sandytab
Reviews.Content: What a waste of my money. I am not a picky traveler, but if you can swing any extra money per night, go somewhere else. Rooms are ok, but plumbing is bad, pool is a disgrace and the food is greasy and expensive. The location is not a very good one either. Everything about this hotel says cheap and dirty.

Reviews.Title: “vegas or bust”
Reviews.Author: fatsdelight25
Reviews.Content: We thought at first this hotel would be a good family hotel.Working in a hotel as i do this particular hotel seems to have lost its first rule"the customer is always right". We entered the bedroom to find soiled towels and dirty cotton buds on the floor.I then asked two nights in a row for extra pillows to be told by a stern women you can only have one extra per room.We decieded to eat in the buffea i asked for a drink from the bar need i say anymore i am still waiting ................ To say this hotel is tired and ineed of a rebuild is to say this hotel should be next. I do not intend to return or recomend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great base in Vegas...great price!”
Reviews.Author: ST86
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i stayed in Circus Circus for 9 nights in June 08. I've been to Vegas before, staying in the Luxor and Caesars Palace, and knew not to expect anything great from Circus Circus. But, lets face it, you not in Vegas to spend time in your room, we basically showered and slept there..and for that its sufficient. We were in the Skyrise Tower, which wasnt newly renovated, but needs it. Although it was clean, roomy and not too noisy, and thats whats important. Ok, so the decor wasn't great - thats not going to affect my holiday! Although tried the buffet one morning as we were going straight to the pool - never again. Have to admit we never took the Deuce bus, though we seen them all the time. We walked alot and took the occasional taxi. Eat in the other hotels and their buffets - the Wynn for breakfast and Dinner is a must. And if you can eat in Trevi in Caesars and Canaletto in the Venetian - beautiful food and wine!!! When we go back in a couple of years we wont stay in Circus Circus, but we tried it, and it didnt dictate my holiday...we had a fab time - get out and see the rest of vegas!!!

Reviews.Title: “Small Motels are better than this [--] place”
Reviews.Author: getreview
Reviews.Content: rooms are unclean totally....bathroom was a [--]....the atmosphere was bad...won't suggest it for any kind of stay in vegas...not a worth to your money.... I would rate higher to small town motels better than this hotel....service is not good as well....

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids, but don't sleep or eat here”
Reviews.Author: joel1316
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Circus Circus via shuttle from the airport and the drop off area was pretty crowded with cars and other buses. It was a mad house just trying to get into the lobby, where I was greeted by a long line of people waiting to get checked in. Most of the desks were open, but the process was so slow? I’m sure the lines are long at other casino’s so just be ready to stand in a line before you get to kick off your shoes. Our room was pretty spacious and clean, but our comforters had tears in them that were sewed up. You would think that a Vegas casino could afford to donate damaged comforters instead of just repairing them and reusing them. We looked out of our window and we were disappointed as we did not have a view of anything, we were only able to see the run down buildings and roofs that make up Circus Circus, so we kept our curtains closed most of the time. Then we also noticed that we could hear a noise in our room? It sounded like we could hear the elevators, but we were too far from the elevators? I couldn’t figure out what the sound was? I thought it was just some maintenance that could be occurring at that time and didn’t think much of it as we were eager to visit Adventuredome with my son! The place is great for kids as they probably would not get bored as long as they had money in their pockets. We got back into our rooms later in the evening only to find that the “elevator” noise could still be heard?!?! We were so tired from traveling and seeing the various sights in Vegas that we just hit the beds and the noise didn’t bother us as my family and myself slept so deep that a fire alarm probably wouldn’t have woken us up. In the morning, I called the front desk to ask about the noise and I was rudely spoken to by a lady who was basically saying I was a liar and had no time for my complaints. I asked if some one could come up to hear the noise and she said that she would call me back. An hour later, no follow up call and no visit from maintenance or front desk? We were eager again to hit the Strip and I didn’t want to deal with another unfriendly person on the phone, so we left for the day. When we got back, no messages on the phone or anything? I guess front desk just blew me off completely? By this time, we were getting used to the noise, I didn’t want to deal with anyone anymore and our “vacation” was almost over, so we decided to just bear with the noise…. We tried the Circus Circus buffet as our stay came with a coupon for a buy one, get one free deal at the buffet. WARNING! ! ! Stay away from the buffet! That buffet was a joke! It was like waiting in line for food at a school cafeteria! We waited in a 30+ minute’s line, paid good money even with a coupon and the buffet could not even be described as a buffet! They had less than 10 items to select from and what entree was available was not that great. I warned you guys! Don’t eat at the Circus Circus buffet! Add a few more bucks and go to a better restaurant! I will admit that Circus Circus Las Vegas is great for families taking their kids along which is the category that I fit in, but I will not stay or eat in Circus Circus Las Vegas again!

Reviews.Title: “very satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: jerjerDublin_Ireland
Reviews.Content: We were searching for a decently priced hotel on the strip through Travelocityt and were a bit scared after reading some of the reviews, but I have to say I was pleasantly surprised by Circus Circus. Yes, the hotel is designed towards children, but you don't have to go to the shows if you don't want to! The casinos in the hotel are child free and great fun. Ok, we didn't win a fortune, but who does?? We had booked a Tower room and were given a West Tower room which was way above our expectations. A huge bed, flat screen TV, chair and desk, huge bathroom and very very clean. Our room service was excellent and accommodated our late getting up! The buffet restaurant was very busy but we only had dinner there once. We went to the Steak House which is in the Hotel Complex and were very happy with the steak we got!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed. Take your hard earned money and spend it elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: Louisville_Lady
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Vegas – so we didn’t know what to expect. What we can say for certain is that we will not be staying here again. Sure, it is a less expensive way to visit the city. But if you’re coming here for a getaway, choose elsewhere and splurge just a little more. This place is in serious need of an update. It is so un-Vegas-y it’s not funny. It’s probably not the worst place to stay, but I was unimpressed, to say the least. My honey and I were traveling with a friend. We’d booked two rooms. Do you think they had two rooms available? No. Somehow, only one room was booked. Luckily I had all our confirmation information (showing two rooms booked) and they were able to “squeeze us in” as though they were doing us a favor. This was not exactly the welcome we were looking for at roughly 3 AM our time after a long day at work and plane trip and ridiculous taxi ride to get there. Our rooms were so very basic. And the décor! Good, grief. I get “themed” – but come on. It was like 80’s themed circus, and again, I was unimpressed. The place itself was a circus as there were people everywhere. Since it’s at the end of the strip, it’s near no where you actually intend to visit. So we kept having to fork over money for a taxi to get anywhere anyway. Needless to say, we will be spending our hotel money elsewhere on our next trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: zak63
Reviews.Content: we stayed one night at circus circus , coming back from LAX. We booked via phone a standard room. When we reached the hotel ( queue was long but waiting time not longer than 20 min ), with 20USD more, we obtained to be upgraded in a brand new room in West tower, 31st floor. Realy nice and confortable. Clean , quiet, with beds in very good conditions . In total we spent 60USD ! We tested the buffet and it is good with a good choice. Attractive for Families with child because property offer a big covered fairground !

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place!”
Reviews.Author: popkid
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awesome! We stayed here for a week and we booked this hotel because it was cheap! The place is HUGE! The room was quite big too, and everything was clean. I expected the lifts to always be full as there were so many rooms but there was always one free. There's a big choice of places to eat in the hotel, 3 casinos, a circus and adventure dome. This hotel is near the end of the strip but theres a bus every 10mins that runs up and down the strip and the bus stop is right outside the hotel...although you can walk to the other hotels if you're feeling energetic. Also it's within walking distance of the main shopping centre near Treasure Island. Would definately go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok For A Few Nights...”
Reviews.Author: JMatthewsWales
Reviews.Content: The rooms in the main tower building are large and clean, well decorated and with aircon. The lifts were quick and no queuing. The hotel was busyish in the week, but at the weekend it was everyone for himself...it was like being in the middle of a football crowd....so be prepared. Kids love it. The buffets were good, go for it. Dont be so stupid as to get a taxi anywhere, in front of 'slostafun' there is a machine that sells allday tickets on the strip buses, that run from Freemont experience to Mandalay, the full length of the strip...every 15 mins. for 5 dollars per 24 hours.Ride as many times as you like. 3 days is enough in Vegas, it gets boring after that. Circus is ok for a few nights, dont be put off by the moaners, but be warned...its very busy .

Reviews.Title: “never again!”
Reviews.Author: Maria232
Reviews.Content: No matter what a great deal you may get offered do not put yourself through it. Very run down, grubby, extremely basic, food concessions/bars shut early and if it's designed for kids then pre book them a therapist for a few years time now to save the bother later on.

Reviews.Title: “Gross, would never stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: NYCWILDCAT
Reviews.Content: Never EVER stay in manor rooms. Old, dirty, bugs on floor, peeling wallpaper and to top it all off we got STUCK IN THE ELEVATOR! Were stranded in elevator in manor for about 20 min. After they got us out only said sorry and that was it. No compinsation for missed dinner reservations, NOTHING! Room had lovely view of construction which was loud and we noticed a drug deal go down in the hallway! Will NEVER EVER stay there again and will never recommend to other people.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid unless desperate”
Reviews.Author: Renny1956
Reviews.Content: OK so it's very Vegas in terms of being a themed hotel but sadly that's about as good as it gets. We were offered this hotel as part of a road trip around California and Vegas. At the time of booking it looked like a bit of a laugh. Sadly when you arrive the laughter stops. We were expecting a Vegas experience with an heavy twist of kitch. What we got was a badly run hotel that is seriously in need of money being spent on it. On arrival our first impression was of the 20 minute queue to check in. We then went to our room to discover that we had light bulbs not working and a noisy dripping tap in the bath. We asked for a new room and were given one straight away, great. The new room had 2 light bulbs not working but at least it was quiet. The general air of the hotel is of being run down. Very crowded and difficult to find your way about. The bars seemed to close early, very early for Vegas. Despite the fact that it is on the Strip be careful as it is at the far end from all of the recent developments with a long walk to get to them. And in the Vegas heat a 15 minute walk will feel twice that length. All in all not an experience I would repeat or recommend to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, if you stay in the main building”
Reviews.Author: LuvinTn
Reviews.Content: If you stay in the main hotel building, which is VERY expensive, then the hotel is ok. It's got a lot of neat things in the hotel, lots of restaurants, the casino is great, but the little buildings behind the main hotel are small and yuck! I stayed with my aunt, she booked it and for the money it was ok considering how much the other hotels in town cost. However, her husband came late that night and went to the office to get the room number ( we had checked in way before that and no one had cell phones at the time) they told him his name was not on the room so they wouldn't give him the info. I get that for safety reasons, but my aunt told them when she checked in that her husband was coming later to get the other key. Also, he said to the check in people to call her room and check and see if it was ok to give him the room number and key. They said no, so he couldn't stay with us. That stunk.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, vegas fab!”
Reviews.Author: DerryFloridagirl
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and i went to vegas as part of a twin centre holiday in the usa. i decided to stay at circus circus as it was one of the cheaper options, upon arriving at the hotel i was impressed by the overall decor and the attention of the reception staff. we had 2 rooms in the skyrise tower, both rooms were very clean and in good condition. there are about 6 restaurants at the hotel, we ate in 3 of them and the food was excellent and very reasonably priced. the casino was great, loved the slots, and the hotel offers free lessons on many games like craps, roullette and poker. hotel is easy walking distance to everything the strip has to offer but if you dont want to walk get a taxi outside to the main part of the strip for about $10-15 including tip. there is a 24hr dennys and walgreens right across the street which comes in handy. overall had an amzing time in vegas, circus circus was great, had everything you need!!! natasha

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus the most terrible hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: gedultfamily
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the worst ever hotel i ever stayed in.POOR OR NO CUSTOMER SERVICE.Myself and my wife waited one and half hours to check in.We then finnally made it to our room carrying our own luggage room was big, fixtures in the room where old.Then my wife noticed that the air con was not working she rang room service to asked how to operate the unit they in turn told her that "LOOK FOR THE INSTRUCTIONS MAM"and put the phone down.Absolutely terrible i would advise any travelling to vegas dont stay at this hotel rather pay extra. ANGELO

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was great but check in takes forever!”
Reviews.Author: airheaded
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a great price for a motel on the strip then this is the place. Location is excellent and rooms are above average in my opinion. I would have gave this review a 5 star rating except for check in. We waited in line for almost 2 hrs to check in. After a long flight the last thing we wanted was to stand for that long. They only had 2 people doing the check in and there was a line of over 50 to 70 people checking in. Each time we exited or entered the hotel during our stay it was the same situation as we noticed the long lines and people waiting to check in. . You would think they would want to get you right in so you could start droping your money into there casino. If your planning a trip here be prepared for a long wait getting in. But once your checked in the hotel is great. There is plenty to do and service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Trailer Trash”
Reviews.Author: meic86
Reviews.Content: My partner, friends and I stayed in this awful hotel which advised was on the strip. Once we got there we where advised we had to back out through the car park over to where the RV park was to get to our hotel room which was meant to be a 3 star room, ( I would hate to imangine the 2 star room ). After a good 20 min walk we got to our hotel room, not much to be desired. Cold, old and smelt foul. Along with these treats allthough I know I am in vegas and alcohol is a pre-requisite we didn't pay for trailer trash drunks abusing each other very loudly right outside our room at 4am in the morning !! The room was at the end of the strip which was a $17 cab rideto middle of the strip or a very long walk. Overall I would of spent the extra $$ for Ballys.

Reviews.Title: “Repulsive and Frusterating....”
Reviews.Author: holidaze83
Reviews.Content: Check-in seemed fine, we waited about a half hour. The hotel is old, our room was dark. Only one elevator worked the entire time, so it took us about 20 minutes to get to our room on a good day, no hot water, towels were dirty and when clean ones were brought, smelled burnt. The room smelled musty, could hear EVERYTHING through the walls, and it's a little isolated from everything else. I guess for the price you can't complain too much, but it would have been nice to have hot water and an elevator that actually worked! I personally would not stay here again, and don't recommend it until they fix it up a little bit! yuck.

Reviews.Title: “clowns”
Reviews.Author: horseandbarge
Reviews.Content: what a dump...never again staff are rude service non existant...had my camera stolen in casino ...staff were of no help....could or would not assist even with a report in order claim insurance...ohhhhhh horrible place

Reviews.Title: “manor rooms are a no go”
Reviews.Author: byln
Reviews.Content: we booked two nights in may on expedia, requesting specifically a tower room, having checked out the reviews here. we were given a manor room, and my partner who was checking in didnt say anything. when i discovered in horror the room later, i knew something somewhere had gone wrong. our booking confirmation said tower room. so we called front desk but they said they couldnt do a thing because they were fully booked. we were only moved into the tower room for our 2nd night. while i appreciate that housekeeping has been doing their utmost best to ensure that the manor rooms are clean, honestly, the manor rooms remain a turn off. theyre old, and dingy (though clean) and only lit with yellow light. Everything is aging - from the bed, sofa, tv, bathtub, toilet whatnot. and the mattress was sagged with our weight! oh well. the tower rooms on the other hand, were a delight. everything nice and new. great bed - plush and comfortable, plasma tv, and nicely done up toilet. It was really great value for the price we were paying on a thursday/friday night. unfortunately, circus circus doesnt seem to keep up their end of the bargain, and their front desk honestly, quite useless. while we were there also, their adventuredome theme park was quite sadly empty. but we liked the fact that there were non smoking blackjack tables, even if the furniture were aging (Also) and the decor dated. location wise, circus is a little south, though you can walk to wynn easily. i would have prefered to stay smack in the middle of the strip though. we would come back for the tower rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing great”
Reviews.Author: angiemarie55
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel during the annual AOA convention. The hotel was very reasonable priced. It was one of the cheapest hotels on the Strip. Our convention was held at the Hilton, which was located across the street, so it was a very good location for our event. However, the hotel is rundown and the rooms and casino need a lot of improvement. It was clean, but had a bad smell and the carpet and walls had stains on them. The beds were also very uncomfortable. This hotel could definately benefit from a remodel. Keep in mind that it is at the far end of the Strip as well, so it is a walk to the shops and most of the nicer attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty impressed”
Reviews.Author: billybclubbin
Reviews.Content: West tower room was very nice- Bed decent, 32 inch plasma tv. Pool area- had a motel feel to it...? Long lines at check in...even @ midnight on a tues....? U should see the lines @ 3 pm.....YAOW!!!!!!!!! My friend also booked a tower room, and they tried to stick him in a manor room...the cheap motel room they have that are scheduled to be demolished soon. They made him stay one night in there & didn't even offer him anything for the inconvenience- If I hadn't spoke up for him @ the front desk, they were actually gonna make him spend 7 nights in the manor room- Even though he paid for a week in the tower room. Circus Circus has sign up everywhere advertising $3 Blackjack...Good luck finding it- I looked all over......... The best part of Circus Circus is it is right next door to Slots of Fun. They offer $1, $3, and $5 Blackjack

Reviews.Title: “Old, Funny Noise, Stench, Bad Experience - CirCus Circus Main Tower”
Reviews.Author: Robin-Sngapore
Reviews.Content: There are mixed and contradicting reviews on Circus Circus hotels. The main reason is that those who enjoyed it stayed at the refurbished West Tower while those who crinched and complained are those who stayed at the Main Tower. I am one of those who stayed at the Main Tower. Here are my reviews and I will NEVER go back to Circus Circus Hotel- Main Tower again as it was the WORSE hotel that I have ever stayed. Lighting of hotel- The hotel is unusually dark which creates the errie feeing. In addition, the hotel room lightings is so dark that I could not even have my usual bedtime reading. If I am not wrong, there are only 2 or 3 orange lights in the bedroom. I do not understand the concept of the dark lightings from the main hotel lobby, walkway, corridors and hotel rooms. Is Circus meant to be dark? Noise from Lift- I stayed at room 817 at the main tower which is very close to the lift lobby, On the first evening, my wife and I heard noises. My wife thought it was the roller coaster rides from the adventure dome while I thought it was people pushing heavy trolley from the upper floor. However, it happened again on the second evening stay and we were sure it was not the roller coater rides as the adventure dome closed at 6pm. After much investigations, we realised that the noises arose from the lift moving up and down. It was so noisy that it sounded like a roller coaster rides or noise created by porter pushing heavy trolley constantly. Hotel room stench- The hotel room has a stench which could have been arisen from its outdated, old and dirty looking carpet. Breakfast Buffet Opening Hour- The Cafe opens only at 7am!! Many Guests have to have their breakfast early in order to start their itinerary of the day early. For my case, I had to meet the froup at 0745 hrs and how on earth can I enjoy the most important meal of the day in less than 30 mins. I reach the cafe early at 0645 hrs as advised by the Tour Leader. By the time I reached the Cafe, there was already at least 30 guests in the queue. I started my breakfast at only 0715 hrs by the time I got into the cafe and settled down. I had to rush through the breakfast and meet the group at 0745hrs. The hotel cafe should open at 0600 hrs like what most international do. Safety of Hotel- when I took the lift up to the hotel room, I had a feeling of walking in a maze. As such, I am extrremely apprehensive if there will be a fire breakout as I do not see clear exit signs and route being guided. Worst of all, the corridors of the hotel rooms are dark. Water Taps- The water tap of the bathtub could not be closed completely. This happened to my friends who are staying at other rooms as well. In summary, avoid staying at the Main Tower. Go for the West Tower which has been refurbished.

Reviews.Title: “I can't beleive I actually stayed here.”
Reviews.Author: krystennicole
Reviews.Content: My friend booked this room for our 1st night in Vegas. She wanted cheap. She also thought that this hotel was closer on the strip than it was. I asked her to cancel it so we could re-book somewhere else as I've only heard bad things about this hotel. She couldn't cancel because she purchased the stay at an online discount site that did not allow cancellations. We stayed in Bldg A-across the street from main tower. Building needs to just be torn down. Rooms were clean, but everything was extremely old and worn. We did have hot water and plenty of towels. Plus there was a fridge in our room. But the entire time I did not feel safe near the hotel. It was only 3 girls and we seen a lot of creepy people around.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad AT ALL for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Millyj
Reviews.Content: I've been to Las Vegas numerous times as I live in LA and not once have I stayed at CC until now. I came with some family and was pleasantly surprised. We didn't have any reservations so as soon as we drove into Vegas we just called hotels to see what was available at a decent price. We decided on CC at the last minute and I don't know if it was because we were driving towards the end of the strip or what but we parked and went to the front desk and booked a room for the best price I’ve ever paid on the strip, especially with the amenities it offered as well as it being a casino with good restaurants. We ended up in the updated part of the hotel. Nice beds, flat screen TV, updated and modern, I was pleasantly surprised as I expected something less. Stay here, they have wonderful food and good shows. You can catch a taxi anywhere up the strip, we will be coming back. We stayed on the 8th floor in the West Tower. New rooms are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: vckyj
Reviews.Content: I was worried about staying in the circus circus after reading the reviews on it. However i found the room to be really nice and clean the bed was very comfortable and the carpets were very clean also. I was very pleased with the room overall. Istayed on the 34th floor of the west tower, i had heard the west tower rooms had been refurbished from the 19th floor upwards and it is true. The steakhouse in the circus circus is a must and not too expensive. The only yhing about circus circus is that is abit far from the other hotels,however i would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Use the safe ... for your contraceptive pills!!!”
Reviews.Author: LC79
Reviews.Content: We had 2 weeks in Vegas staying at Circus Circus. When we arrived there was about a 45 minute queue to check in, a lot of the check in desks were closed even though it was the middle of the day. Room was fine (no fridge unfortunately), nice view towards the Strip. On our first morning we went to the front desk around 8am to get directions to the nearest monorail stop, one customer left the counter (of which there were 2 members of staff operating) so I went up to it and waited, waited whilst she continued typing ... for about 5 minutes without any acknowledgement of my waiting, she carried on typing for a few more minutes and then proceeded to ask the other member of staff for a phone number and then dialled it, by this time we gave up and found it ourselves (either the Hilton stop or the Sahara one are about the same distance). Bed was made daily, towels have to be left on the floor or over the bath to be changed, leaving them on the side doesn't work. We had been there a week when one night I took my pill and the next night they were simply gone, we never found them and can only assume that as medicines, hayfever/allergy/painkiller type stuff is all reasonably expensive there was a demand for them. As per our previous experience we didn't bother reporting it! The Adventuredome was good, it is well worth spending the extra on getting a wristband for just under $25 as the rides can be quite costly when paid for seperately. The water ride had been closed a lot of the time but was open on the Friday night we went. The ticket paying machines can be quite good, we won jackpot on a few and returned with quite a lot of toys from the exchange stalls. We didn't get around to eating at The Steakhouse but from what we hear it is very good. Circus Circus is a good base but if I was going back I would be enclined to stay at the other end of The Strip, mayby at Excalibur as it was not much more expensive and you are a lot closer to most things. Lots of machines in the 3 casinos although the juggling 1c slots often provided extra money for the day. If you are going as a couple or family beware of the people stopping you everywhere and I mean everywhere (in casinos, in the street, in the malls etc) offering free show tickets and gambling money etc. Obviously it's a timeshare thing and eventually we gave in a went when we had a free afternoon. It only took 2 hours and they will try to persuade you but some other people had been there for nearly 5 hours. We didn't get around to validating the show tickets and the gambling money is jackpot only promo machines so trying to lose $300 gets a bit boring! If you can find reps (which we did encounter) that will offer you any cash to do what you want with then go with that. Circus Circus was a decent hotel for the money, somewhat dated and from all acounts it will be ripped down in the next couple of years anyway so doubt they will be revamping it. Lots of shops and eateries, the Casino Cafe has very nice food and I think is open 24hrs. When we went it got to 108 degrees so make sure you always have a drink with you!

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SparklinDiamond
Reviews.Content: I LOVED this hotel. It had everything from souvenir shops to a circus and theme park! The theme park is great, it has a log flume, rollercoaster and everything desired from an indoor theme park! Fantastic! The circus was great fun too! They even have fun fair style games. These were great entertainment and I even won a few times! :D The steak house was great too. Lovely food! The breakfast buffets were brilliant!!!! :D The rooms were standard but we found nothing wrong with them and after all you're only sleeping in them! They had wireless internet available and cable tv to watch. They have tower rooms, manor rooms and an RV park. It's all good! I would recommend going here!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in vegas”
Reviews.Author: sazzbear
Reviews.Content: "Manor house" part of this hotel is the worst hotel I have stayed at. bad service, hot water wasn't working for half the day in the winter time, a long way from the hotel itself. No redeeming features.

Reviews.Title: “You Can Always Book At C~C, As The Vacancy Sign Is Always Lit.”
Reviews.Author: Gone~Walkabout~Man
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Circus~Circus numerous times over the last 25 years. Mostly, because, you can always book a room here one a moments notice. The hotel is middle-of-the-road. I'd say two and a half stars to three stars. They have a large handicap parking area in their parking garage. The front desk check-in procedures are rediculous, long, long wait lines, mostly because they book airplanes loads and bus loads of foreign visitors, and their seems to be a language problem at check-in time, with visitor/guests and front desk personel. As the saying goes: "This'll do in a pinch."

Reviews.Title: “Cant complain”
Reviews.Author: jocka
Reviews.Content: "This is what the Nazis would be doing if they'd won the war, this is the Fourth Reich..." Anyhoo, I found it realy good value and location seemed good as I managed to walk the length of the strip - Circus Circus to Mandalay and back no problem at all. I had no problems whatsoever with check in and check out, I guess its luck of the draw with that. I heard the Manor Rooms were a bit dingy so I went for the deluxe room in the West Tower which was absolutely fine, huge bed, new bathroom, plazma tv etc. I would stay here again, why not? Its cheap and close enough to the action, go for the West Tower and you'l be fine. The only thing I'd avoid is that damned Circus Circus tv channel - that thing will warp your mind no matter what state its in...

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: betty_travelsUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the "Manor rooms" which were located across the road from the main hotel. They were the cheapest and evidently there was a reason for this. Was about a 10-15 minute walk from the front entrance of the hotel, ending with having to leave the lovely air conditioned hotel to treck across a car park to the motel-esque buildings. Room was ok, not the cleanest or in the best condition. Safe had no door on it. Was large with two double beds just a bit worn out. Hotel was not in the best location the two hotels which were next to it along the strip were closed and being rebuilt when we were there so was about 20 minute walk to any attraction in one direction and about 15 minutes to the Strasphere in the other direction. Might be better if had a mode of transport other than feet. Was very reasonable and it became evident you get what you pay for. Some ok places to eat and lots of shops, facilities were plentiful. Pool was nice, good little cash machine looking machines which provided internet access. Serivce not the best but given the size was inevitabley inpersonal. Would reccommend if the budget is tight but otherwise would try for somewhere further along the strip. Was very much a fun artificial feeling hotel lacking in any real class or dedication to its customers.

Reviews.Title: “Implode please”
Reviews.Author: gamsman
Reviews.Content: What a terrible place. Not real helpfull staff. The concierge has not even heard of Qantas?? Food garbage! I ate outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful updated West Tower Rooms”
Reviews.Author: ksvegaslover7
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Circus Circus in the West tower before a few times so we knew what to expect, however this trip blew those expectation out of the water! After being Spoiled at THE Hotel and Mandalay Bay the last few trips I wasn't really wanting to stay at Circus until I received an offer from them for their Newly renovated West Tower rooms($44.95 a night with 1 night free). After seeing the pictures of the new rooms we decided to go ahead and save the money and stay here. Check In was fast, if you have their players club you can use the north check in desks--we had no wait at 2pm where the normal lines were huge. We got a room on the 20th floor, walking off the elevators we realized this wasn't the old Circus we had stayed at before, the hallways and carpet were updated with modern colors and artwork. We got to our room and were very surprised at how nice the newly renovated rooms were. Very modern patterns and colors, flat panel TV, dark wood desk, night stands and dresser all with granite tops. There also was a chair and round ottoman. The bed was very comfortable--not too soft but not too hard. The room can be dark or light, whichever you prefer as their are 4 lamps along with the standard room lights. Great upgrade from the old West Tower rooms and a Steal for Avg of $35/night! I would compare these rooms to the rooms at MGM, Planet Hollywood and even the standard Mandalay Bay rooms. I defiantly would say these rooms were much better than the rooms at NY NY, Monte Carlo and Luxor. The bathroom was the same as the old rooms just with updated wall paper and art but still everything was clean and fresh! No problems! As for those who have made complaints on here about the walking distance from the rooms to the casino, obviously you haven't stayed at any other properties on the strip--They ALL are a long walk from the rooms to the casinos. Yes there are more children here than most other strip hotels but really it didn't bother us that much--neither of us like children especially on vacation. Circus is North so if you don't rent a car like us you will be in for a long walk or need to use the bus to get to the center of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “rusty round the edges”
Reviews.Author: SheffieldTopjoiner
Reviews.Content: stopped 5 nights here after stopping here 5 years ago.well what a dissapointment.rooms very dated now.food at the buffet poor and not much to chose from.and now for the best one coming down in lift from 12th floor got trapped in lift for 40 minutes.pressed emergency button in lift when it stopped and nobody came after 25 minutes rang 911 from inside lift and they took 15 minutes to come and price the doors open and lift us out as we were stuck between floors.have heard they are pulling hotel down in a couple of years cant come fast enough.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ian T
Reviews.Content: If you want an old, outdated and dirty place to stay where the employees all have attitudes and there are thousands of kids running around then this is the place for you! We were advised to stay at the Circus Circus by a travel agent in our hometown in the UK. Obviously, they had never been to Vegas! It was dirty and noisy (even by Vegas standards). I accept that it is directed towards the younger crowd which is fine...but it is still a casino. The carpets were dirty and bunched up in places, the food in the different restaurants was poor (except the strawberry cake in the cafe which was great!). If you don't want to be around kids 24/7 then I'd advise against this hotel... The main advantage of the Circus Circus is that it is probably the cheapest on the strip and that means you get families of 5, 6, 7 who couldn't afford to stay at the better casinos....that makes it unattractive for those without families. Just to be fair...went into the Circus Circus during our last visit in April 2008. It had't changed...if anything it was worse.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: benjaminbrown
Reviews.Content: If you want the ultimate tacky Vegas trip then this is the hotel for you. This is an older hotel than most of them on the strip. The rooms were big and clean. The pool area could do with a lot of upgrading and unless you are with kids then Adventure Land is a bit disappointing. I would say that this is about as far out on the strip as you would want to go although there is a bus that runs up and down all the time with a $5 fee all day.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best!!!”
Reviews.Author: the_gamekeeper
Reviews.Content: Booked for a cheap week last year,i've been to Vegas before and knew that the Circus Circus wasn't the best and after staying a week i wasn't wrong! The rooms are pretty dated,there were problems with the bathroom as it smelled pretty bad and its huge size and the fact we had a top floor room meant it took about 10-15 mins to get to our room,which got quite annoying after a while. As for the location,if you're going Vegas for the first time its a good 20-30 min walk to the main attractions on the strip. Not bady priced but there are better offers out there.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: sheshai
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vegas, and after reading the other reviews I was a little worried about staying here, after stepping through the doors I was put at ease. The place is wonderful with detailed pillars and beautiful artwork. We were in line no longer then 10 minutes. They were more than happy to put my travel companions and I on the same floor. When we got to our room I was very relieved. The rooms were beautifully decorated, very spacious and very clean. It is a tad far down the strip from the action but very centrally located to get to Freemont Street. The deuce bus service will get you anywhere you want to go on the strip in 10 to 20 mintues, which makes anywhere you stay close to the action. The only downfall was that the hotel is quite large so the elevators can be confusing at times, also the pool was a tad awkward to find. Other than that I would say it was an awesome place to stay for a first trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Pa5santillan
Reviews.Content: I was so scared to arrive at this hotel after reading all the negative reviews. I was so happy that we didn't cancel. Had a wonderful time. The hotel is not a 5 star but it is definatly well worth staying, especially if you are on a budget or if you want to use the extra money on other things. Check-In was less than 15 minutes. Our room was in the West Tower and it was GREAT!!!! I have traveled alot and have stayed in all types of room and this room was really nice. Modern decor with a flat screen TV. Bed was extremely comfortable. The hotel is on the strip and yes you have to walk to get to other casino/hotels but you have to do that all over Vegas. What's the big deal. Employees were soooo nice to us. Never had a problem. The place is really, really BIG. Who cares, after a couple of minutes walking around you learn how to get around to where you want to go. All the casinos/hotels in Vegas are huge. You bound to get lost but that's when you have the most fun...We will go back to Circus Circus anytime..

Reviews.Title: “On Par with Reviews on this site”
Reviews.Author: travelbugss
Reviews.Content: We had our travel agent book out Vegas accomm for our 3 nights and our instructions was not too spend too much as we wanted to have a really nice place in Hawaii after we left Vegas. We were booked in at Circus Circus, then read the reviews on this site and basicaly expected the worse. Check in was fine, yes the room was a little hard to find and had to go via a gaming floor, but that was ok really. Room was clean and comfortable. Our sink was blocked but I rang up and someone was around in 5 mins and it was all fixed - no more problems. Yes its old and in need of a re-make, but I guess you get what you pay for at the end of the day. Did not see "kids everywhere" as other reviews had mentioned. Were a bit anoyed by the third day with people selling things at stalls in the hallways walking to your room and asking you to check out what they were offering etc.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: buck bowers
Reviews.Content: We chose this place primarily because we brought along our six year old son. The picture in my mind of this place after reading so many reviews on TripAdvisor was that of a huge, dirty state fair with a hotel attached. Boy was my image wrong! This is a neat place. Yeah, it's big and spread out and it's not a 5 star property, but it's much nicer than I expected. And if you can get a renovated room, it's a great value. This place has several good restaurants, fast food and amenities perfect for kids. Our son was in heaven with The Midway and Adventuredome, and we had fun too. Regarding our room--after reading a large number of reviews about this place, we decided to book a Tower room. If you book online and want the cheapest price, you will get a Manor room, which is separate from the main hotel. To confirm other reviews, we did have to wait in line to check in. We waited in line a long time, so our expectations were confirmed. Once we got to the counter, we simply asked the clerk if we could be put in the West Tower, as high as possible with a view of the strip. I was just hoping it would be really renovated (not just repainted). To our pleasant surprise, it was a wonderful, completely renovated room. It had that pleasant, freshly renovated smell to it. It had a large flat screen TV, granite tabletops on the furnishings, and a good view of the strip. The beds were extra thick and very comfortable too. Several reviews told of no coffee makers in the rooms. The renovated rooms have them now. The pool was a bit awkward to get to, but the water was warm and towels were provided at no extra charge. We rented a car, which I would recommend. It's pretty cheap if you book online. We did it primarily because we wanted to drive to Valley of Fire State Park. I'm very glad we did that. Only about an hour and a half from Vegas, you can see beautiful red rock formations. Beware getting around some parts of the strip with so much construction going on. As for parking around the hotel, the parking garage is so big, we found that parking outside made it easier for us to find our car! In summary, we loved this place and would love staying here again. Our advice: pay for a west tower room when booking and request the 9th floor or higher. As of the time of our stay, floors 9 to the ground level were still being renovated.

Reviews.Title: “So bad they named it twice”
Reviews.Author: Domearooney
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's cheap. Yes, it's old. Yes, it's in desperate need of refurbishment. But that doesn't excuse the absolutely terrible, moody, rude, unsmiling staff, the simply undigestible food on sale at the majority of the hotel's 'food' establishments and the spirit crushing banality of the place. I would only recommend staying at Circus Circus if you positively have to because you have no other option, or you are carrying out a dare that upon it's completion will make you a very rich man. As a health warning - the acres of polyester carpets may lead to severe static electricity shocks from any metal object that you touch - so be prepared with some rubber soled shoes.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad But I Wouldn't Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: tobeginwith
Reviews.Content: 3 of us got an air/hotel package here for a weekend. It was great since we had an 11 yr old with us but the Skytower rooms where we stayed are a bit tired and drab, ala Travelodge; the West Tower rooms are a definite step up so try and stay there. If you are not traveling with the kiddies definitely stay somewhere else. The hotel is on the spare, less fabulous north end of the strip and you'll be doing a lot of walking if you want to see the rest of the glitzier hotels. I strongly recommend taking the city bus outside of the adjacent Lots of Slots if you wanna see the strip. A one day pass is $5 and well worth it. Skip the over-priced monorail. Anyway, back to my hotel review. I would probably opt for the Riviera Hotel across the street from CC. They have the same low prices and there's a noticeable step up in quality plus they have a great courtyard pool. CC is just a bit too run down by comparison and it takes a loooong time to simply get out of the hotel since the rooms are far away from the entrance. Oh my achin' feet!

Reviews.Title: “Another big impersonal hotel hassle.”
Reviews.Author: stephanie01966
Reviews.Content: We booked ahead to get the best rate on the (newly decorated)tower rooms. Our flight arrived after midnight, so it was very late by the time we arrived at the hotel. There was no line at the front desk, so we were checked right in. We went up to our room but the keys would not work. This happened three times, so finally I asked to be moved to another room, and to be upgraded for the hassle. There were no upgrades available for that night, so the desk clerk moved us to a room in the other tower, (where the un-remodeled rooms are $10 less per night,) and promised that we would be upgraded the next day. In the morning we called to find out about changing rooms. We were told to leave our bags with the bell desk (a $1.00 tip per bag each way,) and they would book our new room while we were out. When we came back later on, we did not have a new room. After waiting in line, the clerk gave us the keys to our "upgraded" room, (another re-decorated room right across from the original room from the night before.) No amount of explaining would convince him that we were supposed to be in that type of room to begin with. 1) We stayed one night in a room $10 less than the one we paid for. 2) It cost us $10 in tips to leave our luggage at the bell desk. 3) It was a hassle to get our new room the next day, and the promised upgrade never materialized. The way I figure it, because of the hotel's mistake, it cost me about $20 more to stay there than it should have. I considered asking them to refund me the $10 room difference and the baggage tip cost, but I was on vacation, and I just didn't feel like another hassle, so I walked away from it.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: insomniac06
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here as we were on a budget and it was recommended to us by the travel agent. I was panicking about the hotel due to it's reviews here on Trip Advisor. We had paid for a tower room but on checking in, because neither of us had turned 21 yet, they said we could only stay in the manor rooms. This was disappointing as it was across the street and completely separate from the main hotel area. We found the reception staff to be very rude with bad attidude-we still haven't got our money back for having to stay in the manor rooms (we paid extra for a tower room). Our initial impression of the manor room was that it smelt strongly of smoke and we got the feeling that the rooms hadn't been cleaned properly from the previous guests. It is a cheap hotel and of course weren't expecting luxury, but we atleast expected a clean room! A good thing about the room was it's size. It was large and very accomodation for two people. The tv worked well with lots of different channels and the bathroom, luckily, was spotless. Another good thing was that the air conditioning worked well. Our fridge didn't work which was a major inconvience due to the sweltering August weather! We called to address the problem but nothing was ever done about it. There appeared to be a 24 hour security guard at the entrance of the manor room site, I liked this as the area seemed 'out of the way' and not as busy as the hotel area. We didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel but I got the impression that it was great for families. There were many different amusement rides, arcades etc which would certainly keep a child entertained for hours! We walked to the center of the strip which took about an hour (this would probably be far shorter if you weren't distracted by all the hotels along the way and stopping for water at every store in sight!) The location is at the north end of the strip, which makes it more seculded than other hotels such as; Mirage, Paris, Bally's etc. I returned to Vegas for my 21st birthday and decided to stay at the New York-this was a much better experience and didn't cost a whole lot extra! I wouldn't stay at the Circus Circus again, I didn't really enjoy myself at the hotel and Vegas has so much more to offer. If you are considering staying here I would recommend to avoid the manor rooms and opt for a tower room, or even better, stay at a hotel with a more central location:)

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad, not that great, it was OK”
Reviews.Author: retrofitz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Circus Circus for 2 nights in April 2008 - Me, wife and 2 kids. It's certainly not one of the glitzy hotels, was in a bit of disrepair (scary elevators), but not a bad place to stay. Some things that might be helpful to know: The pool closes at 5PM in the non-summer months and is difficult to find and get to. Wireless internet has a daily fee ($12 I think). Check in time is 2PM so if you get there before 2 the room may not be clean (ours was not cleaned until 4PM). There is a good variety of restaurants and shops right in the hotel. If you bring kids there are kid friendly shows in at least 2 places (Adventure Dome and Main Casino Midway). You can walk down the strip from the hotel but its a long hike past vacant, under construction properties. No coffee machines in the rooms. If you are looking for an upscale experience you'd be better of at one of the other hotels, but if you're looking for an inexpensive place to lay down and play slots Circus Circus is worth a try.

Reviews.Title: “good value rooms if you stay in the tower”
Reviews.Author: popeadventure
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel for 4 nights as part of our Virgin Golden Triangle tour, Checking in was easy and quick and the few members of staff we had contact with were helpful and polite. This hotel is HUGE with over 3000 rooms and it takes you ages to get from your room to the front of the bulding. We had a room on the 28th floor of the Skytower and had fantastic views of the strip, there is a huge building site next door but this didnt bother us with any noise or mess. Our room was comfortable and clean,towels and bedding changed daily and when we rang housekeeping for more pillows they arrived in minutes. The main areas in the hotel are a bit tired and dated and we didnt like the fact that the whole area smelt of smoke,even though smoking was only allowed in the gaming areas we saw people walking around all the areas smoking. We walked round the adventure dome and were not impressed, the rides were expensive so we didnt bother going in again. The pool area is small but we managed to get sun loungers and there are plenty of pool towels for guests. We ate at the Dinner buffet 3 times and thought that it was excellent value, good food and plenty of choice. The hotel is at the very end of the strip but it is a cheap hotel so you dont expect it to be in the middle, we got day passes for $5 on the bus and rode them up and down all day with no problem, it is to far to walk up the strip especially if you have young children.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: dist1ump
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Circus Circus many times before. This time stood out for me. The room had peeling wallpaper. It looked like they uses taped so it would keep from peeling worse. The comforter had many cigarette burns in it. Since I was only staying 1 night I did not make a big issue of it but I wanted to share with others.

Reviews.Title: “You Get Exactly What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: TheSeasonedTraveler
Reviews.Content: Circus Circus is cheap, and you get what you pay for: 1) It is technically on strip, but everything you'll want to do on the strip is a very long hike from the hotel. Running back to your room while enjoying, say, the Luxor or Bellagio, requires walking several miles each direction. This is also the seedy end of the strip, so be careful walking back at night. You'll notice a point where you no longer see tourists walking amongst you as you get within a few blocks of the property. 2) The rooms are plain, but clean. The HVAC units are noiser than a jet engine. 3) The entire complex is tired and worn out, from the Casino to the "adventuredome." You look around and say, "I bet this was really nice in 1985." 4) The hotel attracts a very downmarket crowd. 5) The manor rooms are in worse shape than the towers, and you'll likely be stuck there if you book the lowest available rate. 6) The buffet is fairly inedible, and not any cheaper than some much better buffets elsewhere on the strip. 7) The sports book is a joke. Seriously bad. 8) Many of the slots still take coins, if that tells you anything about the age of the facility. You can find good deals elsewhere on the strip and have a much better experience than at this relic of a bygone day.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: Diloef
Reviews.Content: I was leary of Circus, Circus because of the mixed reviews it got but since we were traveling with the kids we decided to give it a try. I am so glad we did. While the hotel lobby and main casino area were always very busy, once you escaped that area it was quiet. We stayed in the main tower and our rooms were very nice, and clean. They gave us ajoining rooms which was very handy. Check in did have a line, but it went very fast and the desk clerk was very efficient and friendly. We got to the hotel at about 2:30 and expected to wait in line. There are A LOT of kids at Circus Circus, but that is what they cater too. My kids went to the adventure dome twice with all day passes and had a good time both trips. It gave my husband and I a chance to do some gambling. We ate several meals at the Casino Cafe and all of them were actually pretty good. The portions were very generous, and prices about average. The buffet on the other hand was not very good, we found enough to eat (the salads were actually quite good) so we weren't diappointed in our meal, just chose not to eat there again. We went to a show at the stratosphere that included their dinner buffet and that was awful, I mean simply not edible and most of us left there hungry, saying that even though the one at CC wasn't very good, at least we were full. I got a dozen donuts one morning from Krispy Kreme which was an affordable option, and convenient since it was right there in the hotel. The kids also ate at McD's which is also in the hotel. As for the gambling, we didn't do a lot at CC, but did got across the parking lot to Slots of Fun. I like the old type of slots where you put money in, pull the handle, and get money back rather than the kind that spits out slips of paper so slots of fun was more to my liking-and we came out ahead for the trip so who can complain about that. We did get roped into a time share thing upon arriving at CC but they gave us some very nice gifts (adventure dome passes and slot play for dh and I), and really the presentation was very entertaining and our salesman was very laid back and took no for an answer so I guess it was worth a couple hours of our time. The only real drawback to CC is the transportation cost to get anywhere. We did do a lot of walking, but also took taxis and the city bus. All things considered i would stay at Circus Circus again, especially if we were in Las vegas with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed but a few too many children”
Reviews.Author: debbiepoi
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Circus Circus in March 2008. We had very clean rooms and while we did enjoy our stay there were too many children running around. The late night breakfast special at the Casino Cafe was great for those extremely late evenings. Also, had a great dinner one night at the Garden Grill which was moderately priced. Had a great time at Slots of Fun right next door. We spent alot of time walking from Circus Circus to Sahara as we had friends there and did not feel really comfortable walking between the two. There was alot of graffiti and a much larger number of panhandlers than we have seen when we have stayed more towards the center of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Kids, Families at a value”
Reviews.Author: missionviejomex
Reviews.Content: Was worried after I read the reviews here. I think the reviews are a bit over done. My 7 year old son and I stayed 3 nights mid-week for $40 a night. We had a great time in the circus area for kids and the Adventure Dome. He loved the experience and didn't want to leave. Hotel: Clean room, no frills. It wasn't dirty or nasty as some have posted. I haven't been in 15 years and it appeared to me that they had a remodel of rooms and many areas around property. Great value with Family. Rest.: Average at best. Not terrible, but not good. Eat elsewhere. Try the Peppermill, which is caddy corner across the street. Great food, huge portions, cool place (they filmed Casino there). If you have kids, I recommend Circus Circus!

Reviews.Title: “not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: kaz9099
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews on the net, i was so nervous about staying in Circus Circus. But i have no idea what everyone is complaining about. We stayed for 9 nights in the main Casino tower in a mini king suite. The room was absolutly spotless. Cleaned everyday, was no funny smell, or dirty sheets/towels etc. When we arrived we had no towels in the bathroom. One quick call downstairs, and within minutes towels arrived in the room. Not a major issue. I did not notice the swarms of kids everyone keeps talking about. Yes, there were children, but its a circus themed casino. You are obviiously going to get kids there. We walked round the adventuredome a couple of times. Not the most exciting of places to see, but so what, everything is not going to be to everyones taste. We were in the hotel at night time, and morning time. All the rest of the time we were off exploring the rest of the strip. The main issue we probably had the the amount of static shocks we got of litterly everything. It got to the point that we were scared to press the button for the lift, as it gave out a proper shock where you could even see a bit of "lightening" coming out between the button and your finger whenever it was pressed. We ate at the steakhouse one night, and it is the best steakhouse ever. Definitly give it a try. Ate at the buffett, was a lot more plain, than the other hotels ones, but it was also a lot cheaper, but there was nothing wrong with the food at all. We checked into the hotel at about 8.30pm, we only queued for about half an hour, if even, and to check out, we checked out the day before as we had a very very early start the next day to go home. The woman at the desk was so nice, and friendly. Was all done in a matter of minutes. Give this hotel a go, but for the sake of only a few extra dollars, stay in a king suite. Worth the extra money!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money!”
Reviews.Author: tim_m
Reviews.Content: We last stayed 'upmarket' at the fabulous Caesar's Palace but wanted a more child-friendly situation this time. For £38 per night we had little expectation but got a great room in the main tower, spacious, clean and very comfortable. The situation is a bit away from the centre of the strip but buses & taxis make this no problem. The hotel sets out to be child-friendly and succeeds with lots to do and reasonable prices for the dome etc. Apart from the impersonal feel (three attempts to get a second bed installed all failed despite staff promising to deliver and giving us numbers to phone if all else failed - calls all unanswered), we have no complaints and would recommend as great value for money. The buffet was pretty good despite reservations we have seen in other reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad at All!-I'd Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: Retiredbarnqueen
Reviews.Content: We didn't have too much choice when we were 'given' Circus Circus as our hotel in Las Vegas. So the first thing I did was fire up Trip Advisor and was somewhat worried with the less than stellar reviews. So here is MY experience: We stayed in the Main Tower, 7th floor. Had a 'lovely' view of the back side of the top of some buildings, but have had the same experience at Harrahs-big deal. We had two queens which were pretty comfortable. Yes, the sheets aren't fitted, but it didn't ruin my day (or night) like some of the other reviewerslet on. For me, it was clean and had plenty of room for two people. Yep, a bit dark and dated, but I wasn't planning on spending a bunch of time there. I was there to see Vegas! The sink drained a bit slow, but for heaven's sake, I wasn't devastated by it! Check in was fine. I don't think we waited more than 5 or 6 min. to get our rooms. They do require you pay $1 per day for use of local phones. Big deal. Maids came in and replaced towels. That was good. I guess the other Towers are quite a ways from the front of the casino, so if that is a problem, request the main tower. If you want to be closest to the pool, request the Sunrise Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad”
Reviews.Author: CaptainJack88
Reviews.Content: Did it smell? A little, kind of like mothballs,but then again I was not expecting the Ritz after getting a $149.00 for 3 nights stay. My wife is cheap, so we book discount vacation/convention stays. We stayed in the Manor house by the pool. Noticed an obvious prostitute (gasp) but other than that, not to many unsavory types. There are a large number of children in the casino, I like kids, just not sure how appropiate Vegas is for small kids. Buffet was below average, then again it was cheap in price. I liked Slot-o-Fun next to the front door to the left, kinda trailer park like but I enjoy slumming from time to time,. The casino staff kept me with a drink in my hand, as most places will if you tip the staff. All in all a good experience for the price I paid..I was not expecting much, and that is what I received. Good luck

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: gliterchairs
Reviews.Content: I was nearly canceling my room after reading the reviews here, my partner and i both in our late 30s stayed for 1week. we stayed in the manor block A, ok the booking in took 10 mins, when we got to the manor the smell of old carpet hit us straight away. Once we went into our room it was perfect clean and no smell with working air condiction, we got clean bed linen and towels every day. The casino was not as glam as the bigger hotels but it was just as good we had a great laugh with all the staff and they were all friendly, we had steak meal at the steak house which was out of this world. the breckfast was great , The shops were ok but i went to the retail outlets for my bargins. The duce bus stops out side the hotel and takes you up and down the strip for 5 dollors all day long, taxi for 10 dollors to retail outlets, I read about kids in the hotel well there is kids but its the same in all hotels they were not bad when we stayed but there was a lot of them, but at the end of the day the kids are there with parents and not us, there was no kids running around. I hope this will be helpful to someone like myself that wanted to cancel, Rachel

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: teebeeo
Reviews.Content: check in was horrendous large ques and only two then three staff working. even though we had booked last year we were put in manor rooms which meant a long walk to the rooms after a long flight from uk. buffet was disgusting allthough breakfast in casino cafe was ok. No wardrobe in rooms just a rail with coathangers in a alcove and only two drawers very noisy, with people banging about above us and screaming kids in the room opposite. Loved Las Vegas but would never stay at Circus Circus again. C O Brien Manchester UK

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Casino”
Reviews.Author: mitchell916
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights before moving onto Planet Hollywood later in my trip and had a fine stay. The only problem I had with the actual hotel here was the lengthy line to check in (took around half an hour) but after that the stay was a pleasant one and everything we expected from a big Vegas hotel. The rooms are very clean and well laid out and with spacious Flatscreen TV’s. What makes this hotel different from the others is the circus area it has which has a variety of shows (view pictures) daily for all ages in the family as well circus games, video machines and its very own McDonald’s. If you don’t want McDonald’s then you have a well priced buffet restaurant in the hotel which has good deals on lunch and dinner. The location is a bit frustrating as it’s right down the end of the strip so it’s a bit of a walk to get into the real thick of things but there’s a set of shops close by if you want to buy cheap liquor which can ease the walk slightly ; ) if anything just jump in a cab and it will come to like $5 depending on traffic.

Reviews.Title: “good time!”
Reviews.Author: mcelhinneyrach
Reviews.Content: this was my second time here and i would still go back again. In vegas you pretty much only go to the room to sleep and this hotels excellent value!!! ROOMS - we stayed in the tower rooms, big comfy beds. Very quite at night so you dont get disturbed. Sky TV. FOOD - plenty of choice - dont go to mex-iltalia - not nice but the pizza place is nice. it's a child freindly hotel, theres a macdonalds, krispy cream and everything. we didn't eat much in the hotel this time though LOCATION - good, your on the strip which is the main thing, bring comfy shoes - theres alot of walking involved, we walked the strip every day going to the different casinos theres plenty right on your door step - vegas never sleeps, you can get what you want , when you want any time of day! MY TIPS FOR WHAT TO DO * go to freemont street t least one night * go to as many hotels as you can * Grand Canyon a must * see a show *have breakfast at Dennys (opposite the hotel) * shop at the las vegas outlet centre - get a cab from recrption VEGAS IS WICKED AND THIS IS A GOOD VALUE HOTEL AS A BASE FOR YOU TO GO AND HAVE FUN!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Diana515
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints. The buffet was wonderful. The beds were so comfortable, I fell asleep right away. The rooms were right upstairs from the casino and the little 24 hour store. I will stay at the Circus Circus next year, hopefully I can bring my grandkids this time. They has lots of activities for the kids....Diana, Pittsburgh PA

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: lon16
Reviews.Content: I was expecting much worse than I found on the basis of reviews. Stayed in a Tower Room and it was spacious and clean. Staff were all friendly and courteous - nothing particularly special but certainly not bad at all and would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price.”
Reviews.Author: northernlights2
Reviews.Content: Was very worried about staying here after reading the reviews, but took the advice from another review to ask for one of the new upgraded rooms. Definitely worth the extra ten dollars a night for an upgraded room. While in the room, the stay was fine, but once we left the room and walked into the casino area the quality of the hotel went down. We didn't stay in the hotel much because of this. It's far from the rest of the activity of the strip, you have to take a bus down. Definitely wouldn't stay again, but for the amount paid we couldn't really expect much more from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and very clean!”
Reviews.Author: Wagesbird
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 9 night stay and after reading the reviews for this hotel I have to say I was worried - I needn't of been though! The rooms were nicely decorated and exceptionally clean and the staff very helpful and friendly. We stayed in a 'Tower room' as I had heard the Manor rooms were quite a trek from the main casino. The lobby is looking a bit tired and the queue at the check in was the only problem we had - I never saw a short queue. This hotel is a bit of a distance from the main strip but the excellent 'Deuce' bus and mono rail soon sorts that problem out. It is jam packed with kids, so if you not keen - this is not the hotel for you!!! Don't be put off by the bad reviews you read, I found these to all be unjustified!!! I don't believe you can find a bad room on The Strip! We tried the Cirucs Circus Buffet and I have to say this was a dissapointment - I would not recommend this. The Garden Grill on the other hand was very good. All in all I would stay here again and would recommend it to others, especially people with children.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: travelmonterey
Reviews.Content: We did not enjoy our stay as much as we would have if we stayed in a nicer hotel in the middle of the strip. Plan on taking a taxi if you want to go anywhere. This hotel is in a bad area, did not feel safe walking around at night. The hotel smells of musty cigarette smoke, even the rooms. The rooms were okay and housekeeping was diligent in their daily rounds. Sheets came off the bed easily. TV only had a few channels and the TV is small. Long wait behind 40 other people during check in. Long walk to room from check in area. Ten minute waits for elevators. Tons of people pack the hallways of casino/midway area with kids running everywhere, although rooms were quiet. Pay a little extra to stay mid-strip. You will thank yourself for it.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: fightpiter
Reviews.Content: We had never stayed at this hotel on any of our previous trips, however we had gambled here and at Slots O Fun. As a result we were invited to stay for 4 nights free and also received some other things. The check in and out was great, they have a seperate counter for invited guests which I thought was great. The people were friendly and throughout our trip the staff was friendly. Now the bad, the room itself was comfortable and clean but the carpet had burns in it. When we ate at the coffee shop the service was extremely slow. Honestly, these are the biggest complaints that I had. We have stayed at Circus in Reno and I certainly prefer this one. This is an older hotel and it is starting to really show its age. However, with the easy room comps I would be more than happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It stinks.. grubby and tatty looking”
Reviews.Author: fubbs
Reviews.Content: Straight away the hotel had a funny smell about it.. I couldn't tell you what it was.. but a cross between poor people, diapers, smoking and greasy food. Qued an hour to book in.. room was a long way from reception, had to cross smokey casion rooms, static shocks when touching anything in the hotel from the horrible nylon carpets. Our room looked ok at first but the toilet didn't flush properly, bedding was horrible, sheets came off easily, requested more pillows, house keeping staff were prompt but unfriendly.. not even making eye contact. Had view over a building site (i know this isn't the hotels fault) And the TV reception was terrible. Tacky shops in the hotel. Nice staff in the cafe restaurant. Wouldn't stay again. Due to major building works around hotel circus circus seems miles away from the hub of the vegas strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the Value”
Reviews.Author: NEB810
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Las Vegas and stayed at the Circus Circus. Was kinda weary about it based on some of the reviews, but we found it to be a great place to stay. The check-in did have a line, but it seemed to go pretty fast. We stayed in one of the Tower rooms. It was clean and the bathroom was large. This motel is not a fancy as some of the motels on the strip, but if you want to stay in a nice cheaper place and save some money to gamble, this would be the place to stay. The atmosphere is more laid back. There were alot of children running around, but most of them where in and around the Adventuredome area, not the casino part. We ate at the Casino Cafe and had the $11.99 Prime Rib Dinner. It was Great. It was the best meal we had while in Las Vegas. We will be sure to eat there again next time. The hotel is off the strip and you will need to walk to get to the strip and the other attractions, but that wasnt a problem for us. We will plan to stay there again next time we go to Las Vegas. I think everyone complaining about this motel stayed in the Manor Rooms. We were originally booked for the Manor Rooms, but called and got an upgrade for about an extra $17.00 for all three nights. The Hotel was very good about the upgrade. We would suggest seeing the fountain show at the Bellagio, Eating at Margaritaville, the show at Treasure Island and be sure to go to Fremont Street. We had alot of fun on Fremont Street and wished we would have went earlier to spend more time down there.

Reviews.Title: “EEWWWWWWWWW Dont Stay Here!!”
Reviews.Author: mauikauipaui
Reviews.Content: OMG!! DO NOT STAY HERE!!!! This place is the worst hotel i have ever stayed at!!! Sure, the staff is nice, but this place is such a dump!! The only people that stay here are horny hillbillies that cant pay for anything better!! The pools are terrible!! The entire place smells like dead people! The rooms are dirty, small and stuffy!!! There is an amusement park in the middle of it!!!!! CAN YOU SAY CHEAP?? The dining here is terrible. JUST DONT DO IT!!!

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for....”
Reviews.Author: Pauldm21
