Reviews.Content: Stayed at Circus Circus in Oct 2006 and for what we payed, we didnt have any complaints at all about the hotel.... well apart from find 2 cockroaches crawling on our hotel room floor but the staff we're pretty good about that and moved us to a much nicer upgraded suite straight away! Its definately one of the cheaper hotels on the strip and its location and ageing look reflect that. Its right down the bottom end of the strip so its really about a 10minute walk to the central area where the best casinos are. The 'theme park' within the hotel is pretty rubbish and the whole place feels just a little bit tacky (even more so than everything else in vegas!). Having said all that, its probably the cheapest hotel on the strip and therefore offers value for money. Vegas is a special place though so if i was going again, I'd definately splash out that little bit extra to stay in one fo the better hotels!

Reviews.Title: “okay, but many problems”
Reviews.Author: HullGirl75
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the circus circus in 2005, our 2nd visit to las vegas, (we have been back twice since and to 2 different hotels). It is a very cheap strip hotel, a little further out than most but still within walking distance to the central strip area. However check in took 4 hours!!!! this was a saturday lunch time. Also it was so crowded in the casino and all halls with children and families eating pizza, crying, hanging around running around. It only gets worse nearer your room as people are strewn ACROSS THE CORRIDORS eating more pizza and shouting. people bang doors all nite long. As there is no security before the rooms or lifts there are rooms with 8 or so people staying in each one! There are many other strip hotels that are slightly more expensive but worth every penny. As we British know, its the flight that costs the most so pay the extra few quid for somewhere better. one plus point is the steakhouse, lovely.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Bhreagh50
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews of Circus Circus, it was with some trepidation that I made reservations to stay there. My son and I were meeting my parents, and they always stay there out of habit, and it didn't make sense to search for better lodging off the Strip. There are some very good deals at Circus Circus (and it seems all of Las Vegas) on Sunday thru Thursday, but the room rates just soar on weekends. Our visit was from Wednesday thru Saturday. We had a special promotion code for Wednesday and Thursday for $40 per night including tax with some freebies and coupons thrown in. But the rate for Friday night was close to $200! I didn't book that night, and instead reserved a room at the Motel 6 about 3 miles away, but even that was $100/night. As the date of our trip got closer, the room rate for Friday at Circus Circus started to drop, and a few days before leaving, I found a room for $85 including tax on Travelocity, so I snapped it up. We checked in late Wednesday night, and got "upgraded" to a newly renovated room in the West Tower. The room was large and bright, with new granite surfaces on the furniture and in the bathroom, and had a big wide-screen TV. The TV remote needed new batteries, so I called housekeeping and they brought me a new remote in about 15 minutes, even though it was past midnight. Because I had two reservations, I had to check out on Friday morning and then check in again on Friday afternoon. I had been told that I could get in line and see if I could keep my room another day, but we were taking a Hoover Dam bus tour, so I didn't have time to wait in line. We left our bags in my parents room, and went off on our day trip. On Friday evening, the check in line was so long that it wound around the corner by some of the concessions. I was fortunate that my parents had a room that I could hang out in, and that my reservation was prepaid. I was able to phone in my check in, and after an hour go wait in the check OUT line (about 15 minutes instead of a couple of hours) and pick up my room key. We were put into the West Tower again, but the room was smaller and dark, and had a regular TV. Even though it was a nonsmoking room on a nonsmoking floor, there was a definite, though not overpowering, odor of cigarette smoke, and a burn hole in the bedspread. However, the bathroom was clean and bright and had a granite counter. And the beds were comfortable. My parents had a very dark room also. If you're traveling by airplane, bring a couple of 100 watt lightbulbs. If you're traveling by car, bring a small desklamp. MIght as well bring a coffee-maker too, as there is no in-room coffee and room service ends at noon. If you are traveling with kids, I definitely recommend trying to get a room in the West Tower (instead of the Main Tower or the Skyrise Tower) because you don't have to walk thru any casinos to get to the Adventuredome (indoor theme park). You just step off the elevator, go around the corner, and you're there. A possible advantage to staying in the Skyrise Tower is that you're closer to the pool, but since the pool closes at 5 PM, we were never able to check it out. I was annoyed by all the nickel&diming with room charges, especially the phone. There was a $1/day phone charge plus it cost 75 cents to dial an 800 number. But they were up front about all these additional charges, and so I had no unexpected charges on my bill. Another annoyance was all the advertising for EZ check out on your room TV, but both times that I tried to use it, the system was unavailable, even though I was trying to use it during the allegedly available hours. In spite of the drawbacks, we enjoyed our stay. My son loved the Adventuredome, 24 hour Krispy Kreme, and the selection of family-oriented pay-per-view movies. I liked being able to return to our room for bathroom breaks and to get more money.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the Price- too many kids though.”
Reviews.Author: Vegasluv110202
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Circus Circus Feb 17-21, 2008. Our experience wasn’t a bad one, nor was it an overly great one either. We arrived in Vegas at 10:45pm, after traveling five hours from the east coast. We took the Grey Line shuttle to our hotel, and after hearing some horror stories about the shuttle, we were pleasantly surprised. The other passengers on our shuttle were all headed to hotels on the lower end of the strip as well, so the ride wasn’t too long with dropping others off. I think we made it to Circus in about 25 mins or so, and that was after dropping someone off at the Riviera across the street. When we arrived at Circus, the check in line was long and there were people everywhere in the lobby. The line moved rather quickly and before we knew it, we were up. Our only request at check- in was to get an upgraded/renovated room in one of the towers. The clerk helping us was very nice and was able to accommodate our request, which was in the west tower. We hiked our bags up to the room, and once inside noticed that the temp in the room was 80+ degrees. My husband tried to turn the AC unit on, and it wouldn’t work. We called down to the front desk, and they told us to come back down, and they would reassign us another room, they also apologized profusely. They offered to have a bellman come move our bags, but my husband declined and said we could take care of it on our own. Once back down to the front desk, they assigned us another room (deluxe suite) in the main casino tower on the top floor. The also gave us two comped meal vouchers for the restaurants at Circus. So….we hiked up to the room and opened the door, and to our surprise the bed wasn’t made. It wasn’t slept in; it was a new pillow top mattress and box spring, which must have just been delivered. So needless to say we called back down to the front desk and they apologized again and told us they would have housekeeping come up to make the bed. I wasn’t angry at this point (almost 1:30am), just overly tired and wanted to get some sleep. The room itself was very nice & huge. It had a king size bed, two marble top night stands with lamps, phone, and digital clock, a 42 inch television in an entertainment armoire (the stations at Circus suck, only about ten stations and three of which are hotel advertisements), a separate area with a desk/chair, loveseat, easy chair, round coffee table, and another marble top table w/lamp. The bathroom area was just inside the door off to the left. It had a foyer area first, where there were luggage racks to place your suitcases, and a coat rack to hang clothes as well. After walking through the foyer area, there was a dressing area with a marble top vanity w/stool, a huge wall mirror, another coat rack, and a safe to put valuables. The bathroom itself came next, and had a marble top sink area, huge mirror, commode, and tub/shower. The bathroom itself was just standard. We were hoping for a Jacuzzi style tub, to no avail. All in all the room was nice and we had an awesome view of the strip, and could see all the way to Mandalay Bay, which was especially nice at night to see all the lights of Vegas. The hotel itself was okay, not the nicest I have ever stayed in, but served its purpose. One complaint would be all the kids, even during the week. This isn’t the hotels fault in any way, especially given the hotel theme. My idea of Vegas is an adult get-away, and next time we will stay somewhere else where there wouldn’t be so many kids for the same price. We spent some time over at the Riviera across the street, and didn’t notice many kids there, if any at all. Circus casino was big, and had many slot machines, and table games, plus a poker room that my husband played in nightly. The dealers at the table games were not the friendliest we’ve ever come across. They appeared tired and grouchy and constantly talked about the foreign non-tippers. We experienced the same thing over at the Riviera as well, but not at any of the other casinos we gambled in, not even in Slots of Fun, which is a small casino owned by Circus. The attitude of the dealers at Circus and Riviera, pretty much turned us off. As far as restaurants at Circus, we were comped two meals and had heard horror stories about the food at Circus with the exception of the steak house, so we decided we would use the comps for breakfast one day at the Buffet and the second day at the Casino Café because we wanted steak at a restaurant downtown. The buffet was okay- definitely not like the RIO buffet, more like a Golden Corral or Cactus Willy type, but it was breakfast food, and it’s kind of hard to mess that up. They had a pretty good selection of hot foods, but a huge assortment of breads/pastries and fruit. The Casino Café was good. It had a quiet relaxed atmosphere and big comfy booths. We both ordered the Circus Scramble which was three scrambled eggs with cheese, onions, & peppers and came with hash browns, bacon or sausage, and Texas toast in your choice of white, wheat, or rye. The food was really good, and the presentation on the plate was nice too. The service was very fast and friendly. We would recommend this place for breakfast. I can’t guarantee that it’s the best value for what you get, as it was a little pricey but it was very nice at Circus. All in all, the hotel was a nice place to sleep & shower. I probably wouldn’t stay there again unless for some strange reason I decided to bring my kids to Vegas- which won’t happen for another 10-15 years though.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: allup01
Reviews.Content: We have just come back for 13 days in Vegas, the happiest place on earth. We were on a budget and knew that the Circus would deliever good quality accomodation for a reasonable price, something that has always been missing from European hotels. We were booked into the Manor rooms of the hotel which are separate from the main casino. As we do not have children, this was a massive relief. As you may be aware Circus Circus caters for children and the lower end of the economic scale. Saying this all of the ammenities are first class and work. Customer service was fantastic. we had a broken tap at 2am and the handyman was there within 10 minutes of it being reported! the casino has everything that opens and shuts, but the dining is very much on the lower end of the taste scale. but if you only ate in your own hotel you would miss the wonder of this great city. the bus stop is right outside the hotel and at $5.00 for a 24 hour ticket, you can not go wrong. although a walk to the Belagio (central strip) is only about 20-30 minutes. I would deffinately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KopGar
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights in Circus Circus on our way through the west coast of the States in December 2006. We booked on the internet and got a really good rate ($40 for the room per night). Check in was fine and the attendant kindly offered to bring our bags to our room. We were on the 23rd floor with a great view across the city and the room was spacious and very clean. We didn't spend too long in the casino as we wanted to explore the strip but it seemed like a pleasant, vibrant place. The restaurant near the wheel of fortune was reasonably priced and the food was excellent. The hourly acrobatic show was also a real treat. The only issue we had was the amount of unsupervised kids running about the place. This usually wouldn't bother us but when you're trying to relax in the bar with a beer it can be a bit irritating. Overall though, it was a nice place in a ideal location for the strip and we will definitely stay there again if we ever return to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: jellybeanalberta
Reviews.Content: My Sister From Ontario and Myself from Alberta planned our trip to vegas and stayed at the Circus Circus In January 2008. It was ahorrible experience as we did not know that we were to stay in a Manor that you had to go through the back and across the bus and parking area and across the St. and over by the KOA Then proceed to the two manors that were there and we were in Manor b . This is not very safe for us two ladies along side of anyone else as it is too dangerous for late at night, to be walking any where near there, Needless to say we will never stay there again, So please if you plan on staying there be sure to understand where you will be staying when you get there as they do not tell you this when you book your trip, Carol Rhindress Alberta Canada

Reviews.Title: “Won't go back!”
Reviews.Author: laenie
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend stay (3 nights) at Circus Circus, and wanted to write my review quickly. We had been to this hotel before about 10 years ago and I don't think it has been updated since our last stay. This time it was myself, husband and our 13 yr old daughter and I wouldn't recommend it for anyone with teens. The hotel lobby and main areas were in decent shape for an older hotel and I didn't notice the smoke in those areas as much as I remembered. The check in was slow and we waited about 30 mins in line, there were 4 or 5 families in front of us when we joined in. Our room was ready early and we were happy about that as our flight got in very early - 8:30 a.m. The room itself was on the 14th floor, down the corrider and one of the last on the hallway. The room: it was a nice size, with a area closet and a decent sized bathroom. The window was large and faced the adventure dome/parking lot. The carpet was worn, the walls were dirty, something of question was splashed on the wall leading to the bathroom. The lighting was dim and two lights weren't working, there was a smell of smoke throughout the room even though we had nonsmoking, the window was dirty and I didn't want to touch the curtains. Bedspreads were old and smelled, I took them off right away, only to find the blankets threadbare and holey!! The bathroom tiles were cracked, the tub dripped and we never had more than lukewarm water, no matter when we took a shower!! The tv offered barely anything in channels. Everything about the room suggested the hotel needs a major make-over. We ended up only sleeping at the hotel as the entire time we were there it was over run with families with many small children (nothing against families) we just found it hard to even walk from the minute you left the elevator as there were children and strollers everywhere! Our hall was over run with people sitting in the hall watching their children run up and down the corridors and we could hear all conversations around from other rooms as the walls/doors seemed very thin. Our daughter found nothing in the Adventure dome or main area of interest, although we did watch a few circus acts and they were ok for free entertainment. We made a huge mistake of eating at the buffet for lunch the first day, they had just changed over to lunch food and nothing we ate was of any flavor or appealing to look at. On our last day we did find the Cafe and were sorry we hadn't found it sooner as it was a nice meal. The servings were large and the food was diner-quality, not over priced and the wait staff quite pleasant. All in all the three of us wished we had spent the extra money and stayed at another hotel, which we will the next time we venture to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: LoveNatParks
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 3 nights at the Circus Circus. We arrived at 9AM and were allowed to check in even though it was early. I'm glad we were able to do so, because I think otherwise the lines can get pretty long. Our room was in building D of the manor lodge. It was spacious and clean, with a fridge in the room and a heater that worked well. We did only get two bath towels, which I thought was a little odd since the room can accommodate four guests, but since there were only two of us, it wasn't an issue. We did a lot of walking everyday, and at the end of the days of walking from one end of town to the other, the extra walk to the manor seemed even more daunting, and at times made me wish we would've stayed in one of the towers, but it really wasn't that bad. I imagine if we had a car it would've been much more convenient, as you can park practically right outside the building, and not have to trek to a parking garage or wait for the valet. We booked this hotel as part of a travel package, so for $30/night including a Friday night on the strip, this hotel was definitely a nice budget stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel,fantastic for kids”
Reviews.Author: foxylady1975
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with 3 kids and they loved it, so did we, i would stay again, but maybe we would try one a bit more central, lots and lots to do, all resturants was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere, anywhere else!!”
Reviews.Author: CoachDB
Reviews.Content: I need to start off by saying that this was my first trip to Las Vegas, and I do not ever want to come back. I only went because my son had a hockey tournament there, which was something I had to do. I loved the people we went with and the other hockey parents we met there. So, here are the good things about my trip. 1) The fellow parents we traveled with and the ones we met for the first time were great! I loved them. They were nice, friendly, and well organized. 2) The hotel that housed the ice arena the kids played at was great! The staff there was friendly, courteous, and very helpful. The rates there were cheaper than CircusCircus, for rooms and food. Now for the bad points of the trip, which is mostly about CircusCircus. 1) When we arrived, we followed the directions from the hotel. The directions were okay but the hard part was finding the actual hotel check-in. We saw signs for it but when we drove up, it stated that we could not stop there. Very confusing. 2) The line to check-in was horrendous! They only had two employees at registration, and the line was 30 people long. You need to be a saint for that kind of waiting period. 3) Trying to park was just as painful. We had to cross traffic, and there were no stop signs for right-of-way. Five minutes after getting there, we saw our first accident because of the lack of traffic safety. The signs into the parking were not clear nor was anyone really very interested in giving guidance. 4) Four people were staying in the room yet they only supplied us with three towels. When we asked for one more towel, we were told that they could not do that. They had already given us our limit for the day. Gee, I guess someone does not need a shower? We ended up getting one but with a little fight and hesitation. One of the towels in the room already smelled like food. It looked clean but had the smell of sitting in a kitchen for a few days. We also had to ask for toilet paper as well. We had a half a roll on the dispenser, and I guess they thought that was enough for the next three days. 5) I needed internet access, and was told that there was a $50.00 deposit plus a charge of $11.99 for only 24 hours of access. I have no complaint about the access charge but I do have to warn about the deposit fee. There is no hardware in the room, in case of theft or damage. My laptop is wi-fi capable, so there is no problem with cables. When we asked the manager about the deposit fee, she just claimed that all hotels do it but could not explain what the actual charge was for. I think the least she could do was supply a reason for bilking, I mean charging me. 6) There was no microwave in the room, the window wouldn't open, and the a/c took some work to turn on. The room was very stuffy so the a/c was on constantly. I like the cold but it would have been nice to be comfortable rather than cold all the time. We ended up using the express check-out, which wasn't that painful. I would recommend doing that or using the menu function on the tv. The less interaction with the staff the better. In truth, Las Vegas is not a family town. I would not recommend this for anyone with kids under 21. My daughter (10 years old)was reading a marquee about strippers, and what "activities they" can do. This was just from the freeway to the hotel. Another person in our group was handed a flier about strippers and prostitues, all with fully exposed pictures of their "talents" and where he could find them. This was done with the kids (12 and under) present. If pushed to make a decision, I would recommend another place for a vacation, or at least another hotel. The name CircusCircus fits them perfectly, as they run the business like a three ring circus. No customer service at all!!

Reviews.Title: “Eh, its ok, try something else first tho.”
Reviews.Author: tickerlock
Reviews.Content: Besides the fact that my room was a LONG ways from the check in and not even connected to the main "circus circus". Besides the fact the pool was emptied and NOT in service. Besides the fact that I couldn't find the work out facilities. Besides the fact it was 12.00 for 24 hours of wireless internet. The list just keeps getting bigger and bigger. I hadn't been to Circus Circus for about 30 years, I don't think a thing has been updated since then. Its very big, and does have a lot of rooms, but in the "manor b" building its just not too up to date and NOT worth another stay. On an average of 1 - 10, I'd give it a 2 maybe 2 1/2. Just not all that great. But then again, you get what you pay for. T

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mcl6485
Reviews.Content: I went and spent a few nights in Vegas with my aunt and uncle and they happened to be staying at Circus Circus. Yes it is aimed towards families and children but we had a great time. Everything you could need is already in the hotel. The room was very clean and had a great view. They also have the best steak restaurant in all of Las Vegas. I don't think I will ever stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad”
Reviews.Author: tagalong48
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 days in Vegas with 60 of our closest friends. We all stayed at the Circus Circus and none of us brought our children. All of us were in the Sky Tower on different floors. Out of the 30 rooms we booked only 2 couples had problems however with a call to the front desk, those problems were fixed by offering them a different room. Our room was on the 27th floor and was nice with a huge, clean bathroom. Some minor concerns I had was that they charge for wireless internet - $10.99 a day and it was a long walk to reach the Skyrise elevator (if I would stay here again, it would be in the Main tower – Elevators are centrally located in the main walkway). We stayed during the week and seen little to no children. Slots of fun is directly across the parking lot and was a blast with cheap drinks if you don’t wish to gamble. All and all, Circus Circus met our needs and our budget and it was not, by far, a nightmare as some reviews state. My advice would be: if you stay and have a problem with your room, simply ask for an upgrade or a different room. I found the staff very helpful and willing to please if they know there is a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Smell Smoke anyone?”
Reviews.Author: inspector05
Reviews.Content: We traveled up to check out Circus Circus on our stay and we were quite disappointed. Of all the casinos we walked into during the week we never really smelled smoke at all and we found it funny because in the information we read about Circus Circus they proclaimed to be part of some clean air exchange system, when as soon as we walked in the door it was the worst air we had breathed on our whole trip. Just don’t expect to be too wowed here.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: tsny2006
Reviews.Content: we have just come back from Circus Circus las vegas and had a wonderful time, we had read some bad reports about the hotel but we had no problems, there were hardly any children there and we read not to go if you didn't have children because they were everywhere, rooms were suppose to be terrible and to be honest we could not have had a better room we stayed in the skytower and the view was amazing looking out over las vegas and the mountains that surround it. the room was clean and tidy and sheets, bedding & towels replaced every day. there was a safe in the room which took two quarters the only thing not in the room was tea & coffee maker which was not a problem. Everyone was helpful & friendly & ready to help, they had a coffee shop with a big selection of dounuts & plenty of places to eat. overall we had an enjoyable stay and a wonderful time in vegas I would like to say don't always believe what you read make your mind up yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Jason_M_Ontario
Reviews.Content: When we chose to stay at the Circus Circus, it was because of the kid's activity center that was right in the hotel and we have a 5 year old. I later came to regret that decision somewhat. The check in process is terrible, with a dimly lit lobby with a unusual position for the check in desks which makes it difficult to find. The lobby looks run down with dirty carpeting and we were already feeling pretty let down. The room that was given to us was in the "Manor Wing." Manor Wing is nothing but a collection of run down rooms with tiny washrooms, and believe me when I tell you they are not worth staying in unless you are really desperate. Moreover, the phone was not working and the room safe (Pay per use) was not working either. We were so tired that we decided to accept it for that night. The next morning, we found that the Manor Wing is quite a walk from the reception and the casino. We were upgraded to a Tower room after complaining about our old room at the reception. That room was quite acceptable, spacious and all things worked for a change. The Adventure Dome, or the kid's area, is quite nice, practically busting with the sheer number of kids and their parents. Our 5 year old enjoyed it a lot and there were a variety of rides to choose from. But make no mistake, the common areas, walkways and lobbies of the hotel and the Adventure Dome are really *packed* at almost all times. It was a major hassle to navigate all the crowd and to get to to my room either from the Adventure Dome or the Casino. It was only at 8 am or earlier, that I found that I could stroll through the hotels lobbies and casino without being caught in a crowd. The location of the hotel is inconvenient, at the end of the strip. It cost us about $12 to get from there to MGM grand or Bellagio by taxi. The shuttle that plies on the strip (Deuce or something like that) is OK, but its timings are unreliable at times. One evening we decided to try it, we were waiting for about an hour. We decided to take a cab, again. The casino was OK for people who do not like to bet a lot. There are even slots that have a bet of 1 cent!! Blackjack table are always packed and difficult to get a spot. The liquor service was indifferent and certainly not fast (but free, nonetheless). I took my action to MGM Grand, where the service was excellent and the dealers were a lot more helpful than that at Circus Circus. And there was space at the tables. In my opinion, Circus Circus is not worth staying in. For a few more bucks ( if booked early) one can easily enjoy the Luxor or MGM Grand without getting into these petty hassles.

Reviews.Title: “A city within a hotel. Everything is here. Great for the family.”
Reviews.Author: Shazlex
Reviews.Content: Circus Circus is Huge. The first day my daughter said "We don't need to leave the hotel if we don't want as everything is here". Circus Circus is a great family hotel. In addition to the regular circus performances (every half hour), there is an indoor amusement park (The Adventuredome) with many rides for all age groups, 3 swimming pools, an amusement arcade, lots of shops (the kids loved the Houdini shop as they regularly demonstrated magic tricks), hairdressers, heaps of restaurants and of course the Casino plus more. The rooms were neat and clean and accommodated a family. We didn't spend much time in the rooms (except to sleep) as there is so much else to do and see. It is a great location on "The Strip" with buses directly outside if you don't want to walk. Kids are allowed to walk through the Casino (there is a carpeted path) but cannot stop or venture off the designated path. We were waiting for my husband to come out of the toilet and the security guard told us that we had to keep moving as kids (under 21?) cannot stop anywhere in the Casino area. There is so much to see and do in Las Vegas and the surrounding area. It doesn't matter if you don't gamble - we didn't. 5 days was not enough.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: italian_stallion21
Reviews.Content: I was surprised by my wife with a trip to Vegas for my birthday, and when I heard where we were staying I cringed, especially after reading some reviews. When we first got there I was surprised as it was much cleaner than I had expected, and my room was spotless. We stayed on the Skyrise side, and it was good for my first trip. It's a little down the strip but an easy walk (or bus if you're lazy) to anything else. It's definitely a family place as the kids are definitely everywhere there, which was one of the few things I didn't like. It is quite a bit older than the other casino's, but it's not really that big a deal. I probably wouldn't stay there again until I have kids and come to Vegas with them, but for the price you really can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: phil_the_ref
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a very good size and is good for families in perticular because of the attration park. The room was in good condition and the staff were very helpful despite a bit of a wait to check in. The food inside the hotel were nice and they were also very cheap for the amount you get. overall i think it was an enjoyable stay and would recomend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “It's not awful, but merely OK”
Reviews.Author: madmatthew
Reviews.Content: My company, on an economy kick, booked me into Circus Circus for the 2008 Consumer Electronics Show, and after reading some of the reviews here, I gotta tell you, I was ready for the Bates Motel. But what I found was a hotel that was remarkably... average. Just OK. Nothing special but not awful either. And for the price -- $139 -- you can even argue it's a good value, since it's technically on the Strip. I stayed in the Skyrise Tower. The room was small but clean, the decor pretty much a nightmare of pale pink, purple, green and red, with pictures of Cirque de Soleil style harlequins on the walls. The bed was nice and firm -- my back is very particular about mattresses, but I didn't have a problem at all during a four-night stay. The walls were indeed pretty thin -- one night I had a screaming infant next door, but covered it up by leaving the A/C fan on, which was about as loud as sitting in an airplane at 35,000 feet. Room service was fairly uninspired food and overpriced, which is pretty much the case at every hotel on the planet.. The public areas of the hotel are dated and a little dingy, the main casino with circus acts going on overhead simply weird. Didn't check out the pools or eat in the restaurants -- I was working 18 hour days. But this hotel is "bad" only in comparison to places like the Venetian or Wynn or Bellagio, which are $400 to $600 a night. Unless you're entertaining clients or honeymooning or on a special trip, why pay the big difference? The major drawback to Circus Circus is if you actually want to walk the strip, one of my favorite activities in Vegas -- the people watching is outstanding. It is WAAAY off on the far northern end of the strip -- they've torn down the Frontier and the Stardust, so all that's immediately south of Circus Circus are construction sites -- you're going to have to trudge two miles south before you see anything interesting, down by Treasure Island, then trudge two miles back when you're done.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: cymru84
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent a week in Las Vegas in November 2007 and enjoyed every minute of it. We had the impression from past reviews that Circus-Circus was a very child orientated hotel.................and it was but it did not spoil our experience of the resort! We're in our twenties (so not old at all!) and could not afford the Wynn or Bellagio so decided to go for the Circus Circus. The hotel is one of the largest in Las Vegas as we found out when checking in when we were given a map of how to get to our room which was through 2 casinos, up an escelator and up a lift! The room was comfortable and modern with the air con unit a bit noisy The hotel staff were very friendly and there are plenty of choices of food available. We had an amazing dinner at the award winning stake house and the bagel cafe was our stop for breakfast every morning. There are also plenty of activities on offer at the hotel including the indoor theme park and the circus acts that perform above the casino. We sat down and enjoyed the circus acts once and went on a couple of the rides in the theme park once, and we felt that was enough as we had much more to see in Vegas itself! Parents with children would love the activities on offer of course! It was a 20 - 30 minute walk to the centre of the Strip which we did on numerous occasions but the Deuce was very handy when it got too hot. One complaint we had was about the member of staff that sold trips to the grand canyon, hoover dam etc. We hadn't arranged any tours before arriving in Vegas but had decided that we wanted a helicopter trip to the Grand Canyon as friends had recommended it. But the member of staff was adamant that there was no availability of helicopter tours and only an 8 hour bus tour was possible!! We politely said 'Thanks, but no thanks' and found a booth selling helicopter tours in the centre of the Strip, no problem! Beware! I would be happy to stay at Circus Circus again but would be tempted do go for a hotel closer to the centre.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you know what you are getting”
Reviews.Author: cya
Reviews.Content: Had to attend a large convention in Las Vegas and didn't want to pay the jacked up pricing that occurs during the large conventions. Booked a package air and hotel special and stayed at Circus Circus. Having stayed there prior, we knew what we were getting and have no complaints. Pros: Price was good about $70 per night. Room was clean and reasonably updated. Nice bathroom, granite counter top, large walk in shower, newer towels. Room was OK noise wise, large bank of elevators so wait time was minimal. About a 20 minute walk to the convention center made it a good location for us. Good steakhouse within the hotel. Arcade upstairs and some cheap eats places. Cons: Like many of the Vegas hotels, the distance from the entrance from the strip to your room can be pretty far. It was about a 10 minute walk for us. Circus Circus due to its theme and pricing attracts familys, especially on weekends. Be prepared for kids and tourist types. It's a tacky Vegas Hotel for low rollers. Stay there if on a budget, or with a young family that would enjoy the circus theme.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, kid freindly!”
Reviews.Author: let-it-go2008
Reviews.Content: Circus Circus Las Vegas boasts of being the most kid friendly hotel in Las Vegas. With its big top attitude and its indoor amusement park it very well may be. In addition to being the most kid friendly hotel on the Las Vegas strip Circus Circus Hotel is also the fifth largest hotel in the world. Of course this is at the moment and that is subject to change at any time. The beauty of this particular hotel doesn't lie so much in its size or even the circus like atmosphere. The charm lies in the fact that it was something new and relatively untried along the Vegas strip. Rather than build to suit the gamblers they were hoping to attract, this particular hotel was wise enough to offer something new and untried by appealing to families with children rather than solely to gamblers. The gamble seems to be paying off in a city that is known for both its hits and its misses. Other hotels and casinos are also working to cultivate the family friendly image that Circus Circus has basically proven. Not only did this hotel build The Adventuredome Theme Park they also decided to make accommodations even more family friendly by accommodating RVs at the Circusland RV Park. This offers a great place for families to stay that might not otherwise grace the theme park, hotel, or the casino. Don't forget that there is a casino involved and that is the primary purpose of this gigantic hotel, resort, and theme park. The casino makes the expense of building it all very much worthwhile and brings in big business of its own each and every day. In grand Vegas style there is also the requisite onsite shopping and of course full service of wedding options in addition to a wedding chapel and banquet facilities in which to hold the reception of your dreams. The shopping at Circus Circus offers everything from ultra exclusive boutique shops and salons to stores such as Under $10 and the trading Post, which offers fad jewelry and other kid friendly gifts. This hotel has a somewhat unique concept that sets it apart from the many others along Vegas' strip. If you are traveling to Vegas with the family I very much recommend at least checking them out and comparing prices and packages with the other hotels and resorts in the area. Keep in mind that comps are like money in the bank particularly when they involve food or activities that you were planning to do even without the comps. So you may be able to negotiate a much better deal even if you're paying a couple more dollars a night by having free parking, complimentary meals, or tickets to events, shows, or attractions. Now we're on to my favorite part of the discussion. Dining options. Circus Circus does not disappoint when it comes to offering variety to its guests. In addition to The Steakhouse, there is The Garden Grill, Mexitallia, Pink Pony, Circus Buffet, Pizzeria, Westside Deli, and Barista Café. The food offerings accommodate varying budgets and familial needs by offering some kid friendly dining choices to visitors and guests as well. The good news however is that if these restaurants aren't appealing to you there is another hotel, casino, or restaurant next door that has different fare to offer. If you are looking for a great place to stay in Las Vegas along with the family there are very few hotels that will offer the overall environment of fun and wonder that you will find at Circus Circus. In addition to the wonderful rooms, the great food, the casino, and The Adventuredome Theme Park you will find that the shows here are as kid friendly and entertaining for the entire family as the atmosphere in general. This is a great vacation destination anywhere. Considering the fact that it is in Las Vegas and it is very nearly the perfect vacation retreat for those with children.

Reviews.Title: “Has Moved Out Of The Hotel - WOW! Amazing Budget Property PLASMA TV”
Reviews.Author: wuchowsa
Reviews.Content: The outside of Circus Circus looks exactly the way when I came here 20 years ago. Now, the inside has changed not a little but a lot. Currently staying in room 26814 (West Tower) and the room has been completely remodeled. In fact they are remodeling one floor every week from the top floor down (West Tower) They are done modeling from the 19th floor which makes staying between the 19th and the top floor an experience similar to mine. The staff here is super friendly here... although they do try to nickel and dime you. For example, the wireless interent is $12 per 24 hour period (and longer stays are not discounted). The business center charges $10 to print out a boarding pass. There is a $1 per day charge for telephone use (and that is even if you don't use it). The gym fee is $5 per day but again is very nice. In my honest opinion this is to be expected on a budget type property. I am guessing the average stay (ADR) is about $50 per night and with a completely updated room with a 32" plasma TV, very comfortable bed (its super soft) granite vanity in bathroom, and granite top on very piece of furniture including the desk, TV stand, night stand, and side tables... its really an excellent deal. The carpet is very expensive and has a soft but elegant and stylish circle pattern and in the bathroom there is real tile and even granite walls as the surround in the bathtub. The service here from the start has been excellent. Check-in was FAST at the VIP check-in. Had a plumbing issue which the tub was not draining fast enough and the two associates that came to the room was SUPER friendly and fixed the problem immediately. This place has changed for the better. When booking the reservation I called the hotel directly and given an awesome rate (FREE!) and was made sure that I got the updated rooms. I spoke to Greg (reservation specialist #88) at 800-343-3918 and everything was handled perfectly and as expected. Sorry, forgot to mention the shower heads in the bathrooms are really wonderful. It makes you feel like you’re in a spa. The only negative with the bathroom is that when the room next to you showers you can hear it. Did I mention that this hotel is almost completely sold out this week (CES convention) and service has remained top notch. I hope this review helps you with your future stays and if you have any questions please just let me know.

Reviews.Title: “Great on a budget but shop around....”
Reviews.Author: traveltodd32
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and when I travel I do my homework where I am going to stay. I love nice rooms and a hotel that is located within walking distance of everything and a nice gym to work out in. Well Circus Circus is just like its name....a three ring circus. The hotel was a great price for new years and we were upgraded to the Skytowers. The room was clean, nice and house keeping was right on top of things. Here it is listed: 1. The hotel is ALWAYS packed with kids, strollers, lower income folks that are pushing and wandering and bumping in to you. Its very noisey and confusing. 2. Your rooms are MILES from the check in desk. 3. Our room was clean and very well keep. The bed cover smelled dank and we requested a new one and she was right up with it within min. 4. The breakfeast buffet is very well stocked but get there early to avoid crowds. 5. The hotel is out of the way. Cabs to anywhere run $10, the bus is the way to go with a stop right in front of the hotel for $5 for a all day pass...ITS GREAT and there is no way to mess up....the bus only goes one way on the strip to luxor and on the other side from luxor to freedmont street 6. Look around at other hotels first....the circus in the sky...ugh...is very over rated...hard to see....hard to get to...and very very crowded. 7. The staff is very friendly and nice and very helpful 8. They have the top rated steak house on site...but very very over priced...go to the stratosphere and eat....VERY NICE $160 for 2 people the view and food unbeliveable! 9. BOOK ALL YOUR SHOWS AND DINNERS WELL IN ADVANCE! you can take the risk...they have a 1/2 off booth in front and back of the hotel....and the seats are ok if you like the balcony. 10 Book any car rentals prior to leaving....CARS ARE VERY EXPENSIVE if you get them from the hotels....$70 - $100 a day 11 Time shares try to sell you everytime you walk buy...RUN! 12. Look at the sahara, stratosphere or flamingo for cheaper deals and the flamingo is in the middle of the strip..you save on cabs and walking..... 13. To save $$ if your planning on seeing things in vegas go to vegas.com and review the hotels...also go to VEGAS CITY PASS and pay like $100 for a 3 day city pass to get discounts, $10 food coupon for planet hollywood and free entry to the hover damn and all the stuff on the strip..its woth checking out we loved it! GOOD LUCK and STAY AWAY FROM THE SLOTS.... :)

Reviews.Title: “nightmare on the strip”
Reviews.Author: yosf
Reviews.Content: Check in was ok, then it went down hill from there. The hallway leading to the room was dark & dingy & once inside the room was not much better. The room has the bare essentials but not much else. The walls were very thin so you could hear anyone walking up & down the hallway & could hear their conversations. Restaurants not very convient to the hotel lobby, you get your exercise just trying to get food. Hotel is not really near anywhere worth visiting so you either walk several miles or search for a taxi or bus. I have stayed at many hotels on & off the strip & this place was the worst. They need to just blow this place up & start over. it's just not worth remodeling.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas' Lousiest”
Reviews.Author: Jarlyko
Reviews.Content: Staying at Circus Circus was the worst part of going to Vegas for New Year's. The hotel was very dirty. The staff was very rude!! The bed linens were not clean. This hotel was so far from anything decent on the strip that ground transportation was needed to go anywhere and the taxis wouldn't even show up for the guests. I dreaded going back to the hotel when it was time to sleep. Luckily, it was Vegas and there was little reason to sleep. I wouldn't even recommend that my worst enemy stay at this hotel. What a disappointment!!! Las Vegas' Lousiest!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Manor rooms”
Reviews.Author: fatibg
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Circus Circus in the tower rooms previously and had a very pleasant stay but this time I booked a Manor room and it was terrible. They had plumbing issues and the toilet was terrible, room walls were thin so we could unfortunately hear the cell phone conversations in the neighboring rooms, everything was just barely acceptable. Though I really like the Circus circus hotel for their kid friendly attractions I would suggest you pay a little more and stay in the tower rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Stay at Circus Circus Again Even if it Were Free”
Reviews.Author: GatorBeth
Reviews.Content: We flew into Las Vegas at the beginning of our trip to the Grand Canyon. Since we have 2 small kids, we decided Circus Circus would be a great place to stay for 1 night. The rate was unbelieveable - $39 a night. What could go wrong, right? For starters, it is one of the farthest hotels from the airport. It took us an hour and a half to get down the strip to the hotel. Then, the wait to check in was 40 minutes. You try managing 2 kids under the age of 6 in a crowded hotel lobby for that long. I felt this was unreasonable, especially since I had made my reservations MONTHS in advance! The room was just OK - clean, but very basic. And even though it was a "non-smoking" room, it still smelled like smoke. The first thing the kids wanted to do was go to the pool. We went to the pool, and it was filthy. The water was discolored, trash and beer bottles littered the pool decks, and the lifeguards were not enforcing the swimsuits/swim diapers rule (you know, that basic idea that everyone has to be wearing proper swim attire - NOT JUST UNDERWEAR - and that toddlers should be in swim diapers.) We let our kids get in for a few minutes, but they weren't allowed to go under water. I tried to get a beer from the bar, and the female bartender was actually hostile. Mean, even. We finally decided that the pool was just too gross, so we left. We went to dinner at the Circus Circus buffet, assuming there would be some sort of entertainment for the kids. There wasn't. The food was mediocre at best, and it was very crowded. After dinner, we toured the grounds and found out that most of the cool stuff that Circus Circus advertises as being for the kids costs extra. And sometimes significantly extra. If we had bought the day passes to the "indoor amusement park", it would have cost our family more than our room! There were free circus acts every half hour, but there was very little seating and the crowds were huge. Most of the other attractions were rides and games that aslo cost extra. The next morning, we looked outside the window and saw that - surprise! - the pool area was closed and roped off with bright yellow hazard tape! UGH! Then the video check-out through the TV wasn't working, and the line to check out was huge. We ended up using the key drop box that took us 30 minutes to find. We also couldn't find a bellman or anyone to help with our bags, so we had to schlep them to the car ourselves. I was so disappointed and grossed out by Circus Circus that I wouldn't stay there again even if it were free. The rate is that low for a reason. Take my advice: spend $20 more a night and stay at the MGM Grand!

Reviews.Title: “Disgraceful Circus Circus”
Reviews.Author: JenBear2
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip to the USA. Our first stop was Las Vegas and the Circus Circus. Walking about 300+meters to our room, after requesting a non smoking room , we were confronted by a room with stale smoke and the foul odour of alcohol through ut the complex. Commenting on the non smoking room we were told by concierge they "can't help it if someone smoked". They gave us anther room with similar odour, though not quite so bad. I went back to concierge and advised them we had expected a 31/2 star room and these were the most disgusting room I'd ever been offered and were 1 star accomodation by Australian standards. He gave us an upgrade to a room immediately above the reception. This room was acceptable although no light switches worked, at least there was no odour, not so far to walk ,and about 3star accommodation. We have since heard they are going to pull Circus Circus down ..so this explains some of the poor standard. Also it seems they have to areas to stay...The Manor houses about a 300+meter walk away from main buiding and substandard, and the building housing the casino which is "just "acceptable .

Reviews.Title: “brilliant just a bit off the main strip but would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: macy-alex
Reviews.Content: i went to vegas in sept for my 40th birthday it was my first trip to vegas&wasent sure what to expect because id been told my someone that circus circus very dated&off the strip well just off the strip was true&yes in comparision to the main hotels on the strip it was dated but myself&my 22yr old son who came with me had a fabalous time there once we got used to the walk up to the main strip we were fine our room was spotless with everything we needed the hotel has everything in there you need food was excellent we had breakfast a few mornings in the buffet&the rest of the time in other restaurants in there we ate twice in the evening there&had beautiful steaks both times obviously as we were out most of the time on the main area of the strip we were naturally eating at other hotels but we found no fault with Circus Circus at all&would definately stay there again good value for money with everything we needed

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all my expectations!!”
Reviews.Author: hmchiswell56
Reviews.Content: just spent a week in the CC, we are getting married in Las Vegas in May 2008 and decided to go out there on a "reccy "trip to get it all sorted. We booked the CC as we are staying there when we get married as there will be 5 children with us and after doing some research decided that Circus Circus seems to be the most kid orientated hotel on the strip, I know the CC is quite old so expected it to be a bit "fraying" around the edges - NOT AT ALL!!! - the bedroom was large with lots of storage space, it was spotlessly clean as was the large bathroom. The public areas were all clean and bright and appears to be a kids paradise. The buffet breakfast was amazing for less that $10, it set us up for the day in fact some days we never had a bite until about 9pm. If I have one criticism it has to be about the pools, there are 2 but they both looked quite small and I am concerned that when we go back in May, when it will be hot, that the pools are not adequate for the size of the hotel. I would definately recomment the CC to anyone especially those with kids as there is more to do INSIDE the hotel than there is in the whole of Blackpool!!

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Break trip to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: SenseIntoDollars
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay through Hotwire and was placed in the Skyrise tower. Going to the Circus Circus website I found out I saved a total of $3.57 for a five night stay for the same dates, so in this case using Hotwire was not too effective. The room was on the 19th floor and was clean, quiet, well stocked, and nicely decorated. It had a great view of downtown, the Stratrosphere, and snow covered mountains. My only complaints were that Circus Circus is now somewhat remote with the Westward Ho, Stardust, and Frontier all dirt lots, and the days of cheap eats are definately over on the strip (the breakfast buffet is $9.99). Only the Riviera, Sahara, and Wynn's are relatively close, although you have to walk by vast construction projects to get to most of them. With all the high rise condos, the area is gettting a Honolulu feel. Something to think about is to walk toward the Hilton and using the Route 108 bus to downtown or the Sahara Road east bus to Boulder Highway, change to the 107 and hit Boulder Station, AZ Charlies, and Sams Town. Better meal deals and gambling to boot. Fare is $1.25 one way or $2.50 for an all day non-strip pass. You can use the Sams Town shuttle from the Riv for free, but then you are tied to their timetable. I stay here again, but only as a base to wander the strip, not to game. It is not the hotels fault, just the changing neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a Small Price”
Reviews.Author: sc_myinitial
Reviews.Content: My family and 3 other families stayed there on 24 to 28 Nov 2007 for 4 nights! 2 families booked the West Tower rooms & the other 2 booked the Main Casino Tower rooms under their "Be Adventurous 2007" Promotion! The West Tower rooms are nearer to the lobby and the Main Casino Tower rooms are in the Casino area! The rooms are with 2 Queen Beds and quite comfortable for us! The hotel also provides free Circus show at the Midway area & also the AdventureDome which our kids & adults alike had so much fun! Overall, i would say that this hotel is great for the price we paid!

Reviews.Title: “Love the circus circus”
Reviews.Author: kimmie1986
Reviews.Content: We stayed here between 10th september to 20th, arriving in vegas at 7pm in the evening and stepping outside into the heat of 25c was a bit of a shock coming from scotland where this is the hottest we have. got a taxi from the airport he scared the life out of us driving at 70 mph he took us the long way costing $30 a bit much for a 10 min ride. We arrived at the hotel at 8pm and reception was empty so check in was easy. got a room in the west tower on the 21st floor so no noise from the street.The room was lovely and spacious and clean. 2 double beds and a big bathroom so enough room for 3 sharing. we woke up in the morning and opened the curtains and were shocked at the view, there was a lovely view of the mountains that we didnt see at night. Hotel was at the end of strip which wasnt too bad when you got used to walking in the heat. Did visit the hotel pool but not very big but it was ok for what we wanted. The hotel is huge and it does take a while to get from your rooms to the front of the hotel. I didnt like the hotel at the weekend as i felt invaded by all the locals but once sunday had come it was quite again. We went to the adventure dome at the hotel and this was brilliant loved the rollercoaster and this was quiet during the week but busy at weekends. For food during the day we went to slots of fun next door for the lovely 99c hot dogs highly recommended, at night we ate in the garden grill almost everynight, the staff were very friendly especially our favorite waitress stacey. the baked potatoe that i had was huge and enough to fill you up. I would stay here again if i wasnt looking for luxuary but may stay some where more central like treasure island.

Reviews.Title: “ok if you have kids”
Reviews.Author: dunkindonut
Reviews.Content: this hotel would be great if you have kids if not avoid a bit dirty a bit dated and it takes 15 minutes to get from room to front of hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great value, very convenient”
Reviews.Author: JC40
Reviews.Content: No complaints at all - Circus Circus gave us spacious and comfortable accommodation at an excellent price. We found the rooms and communal areas clean, and hotel facilities excellent. Air conditioning was a tad noisy, but very effective. The pool area is not outstanding, and caught the wind whilst we were there, but was clean and well staffed. NB. We paid the small supplement to stay in the towers. I've read some negative reviews about the other rooms, but I think the better views you get from the towers is definitely worth the small extra charge. I've no idea about the quality of the other rooms, but we had no problems at all with the towers. We would most certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “loved las vegas”
Reviews.Author: layto
Reviews.Content: circus circus las vegas brilliant stayed 14/10/2007 for 4 nights After reading reviews was quite concerned but need'nt of worried. Went with my husband and 2 children age 16 and 13 and 10 friends for our 25th wedding anniversary . Checkin was good rooms excellent we stayed in the west tower staff couldnt be more helpfull children enjoyed it all must eat in the steak house restaurant excellent we had a great nite in there staff fantastic. Las vegas was awesome and hotels are amazing. We did the grand canyon helicopter flight which was out of this world.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe not everyone's Cup of Tea”
Reviews.Author: Coz-7
Reviews.Content: The Circus Circus is ok!!! Basically you are at the very end of the strip but that isn't really a problem, its only a 5 minute walk or you can get the buses that run every 6 minutes down the strip.... The hotel itself if very old and in need of a good clean up and re-paint I would say, its very family orientated so if your looking for luxury and peace this certainly isn't the place for you.... Our room on was on the 12th floor of the west wing, 12th floor wasn't a problem, the corridors are like mazes so finding your room initially can be a bit of a problem. The room was clean and spacious, the only problem I encountered was that the windows are sealed, you have air conditioning which you can control but to be honest I would have just liked to have opened the window!!!! They provide you with a tv, but don't be surprised when you turn it on as every other channel is the circus circus tv.... We only ate once at the hotel buffet which was in the morning, it was fine, lots on offer, from fried everything you could think of to fruit and yoghurt, etc - we didn't attempt the evening buffet as the amount of people in line was shocking!!! We ate at the pizzeria though which was lovely, everything was cooked fresh.... Overall I would recommend this hotel if you are on a budget, or have a family of small children as the theme park within the hotel seemed popular and also if you don't mind being just that little bit out......

Reviews.Title: “Circus Alright for the Price”
Reviews.Author: misterburns
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at CC this past weekend, November 23 and 24th. Yes, it's old, yes, it's not the best...but for the money, it's pretty good. I was actually surprised by the size of the room (we got a king bed on the 13th floor - yes the 13th- and no, nothing bad happened). We had a great view of the city. The shower kicked butt - you can't find showers like these anymore in hotels, the water pressure was awesome. The hotel is oddly designed and confusing to walk around, but was still decent and clean. Smoky, yes, but i've been in worse. Don't go there if you want to be away from kids - they have some adventureland place there and it was families galore. And the buffet was awful! But you can stay in your nice room, or go downstairs and eat at the other restaurants, or go gamble. And CC is kind of away from the heart of the city, so it's not terribly traffic-y outside. Plenty of free parking. If you are looking for a rather cheap place to stay, it's a pretty good deal.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: The Restaurant at the End of the Universe
Reviews.Title: “Needs to be Blown Up”
Reviews.Author: rubasim
Reviews.Content: Needs to be Blown Up Circus Circus is an extremely old and out of date hotel in the ghetto of the strip. We stayed in the manor rooms, which needed a considerable amount of work. You can hear peole walking down the halls and in the rooms next to you. This hotel definately meeds to be remodeled, starting over from the ground up. Other reviews were extremely inaccurate!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Tulip_Muncher
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Circus Circus for 5 nights in November. While the hotel is at the end of the strip, the Deuce stop is right outside so all locations along the strip and the outlet shops are easily accessible. We stayed in a main tower room which came with two double beds. The room was quite spacious and had plenty of room for luggage. The only downside to our stay was waiting 45 minutes in a queue to check in and that was at 1am in the morning. Overall, for the price we paid per night I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Construction”
Reviews.Author: doctorhash
Reviews.Content: Our first two nights at the Circus Circus we had some noise which woke us up a couple of times after midnight, we thoufght it was just noisy neighbors on the 27th floor above us. We were on the 26th floor, west tower. The next night the noise got a bit worse and kept us awake for a while but we were able to eventually get to sleep. The third night the noise got even worse, dragging noises, banging noises in the room above us and dust and ceiling particles falling in our faces and eyes as we layed in bed. So we finally complained and had to be moved to another room at 2 am in the morning. As it turns out they are renovating the entire 27th floor 24 hours a day/around the clock. The work crews were using a machine to grab on to the rug and rip it up from the halls and the rooms. Banging on the floors with hammers and scraping rug off from the floors with hand tools. I went upto the 27th floor and looked and yelled at the workers and asked them what the heck they thought they were doing making all this noise while people were trying to sleep. So after complaining we were moved down 1 floor to the 25th floor directly below our room on the 26th floor, and we could still hear them banging on pipes which travelled down though the walls. So we complained again, and were eventually moved up to the 35th floor (TOP) finally quiet. The worst of it is that travelocity is supose to warn you when there is construction at your hotel. What a joke, travelocity had no clue. What had happened is as the work crews worked from room to room they got closer and closer to our room on the 26th floor and eventually made it to the room over ours on the third night. The stupidity of the management allowing crews to work after midnight while people are trying to sleep is the worst part. And they really did not care, we had to talk to a manger to get anything done because the counter help is nothing but a bunch of polite trained monkeys. Even then we were treated like we were being a pain in the butt. We had to fight with travelocity to get them to get the hotel to Comp us for the two nights our sleep was interupted. Which they eventually did agree to do, we will see if it actually happens. They say they gurentee your entire vacation experience but when the chips are down they really fight you on it and don't want to stand behind it. They give you a hard time putting you on hold for 45 minutes at a time hoping you will get fed up and go away. I would not recomend either the Circus Circus Hotel Vegas or Travelocity for any of you future vacation plans.

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon....not here”
Reviews.Author: travelagent030307
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to go to Las Vegas for our honeymoon and stayed at Circus Circus. I have to say I was not impressed. I most likely will not stay there again.... There were too many kids around (to be expected I guess) and the rooms really needed updating....the beds squeeked and were not very comfortable. If you have never been to Vegas, you may not know that the Strip is almost 3 miles long....and you will walk a lot...I promise! Circus Circus is located at the very end of the Strip and if you want to get to any good entertainment...you are going to have to walk, unless you want to pay $15 for a 2 minute cab ride. You can catch the tram or a bus....but you still have to walk to get to those. We found Circus Circus so boring, we only slept there. We never ate there, never gambled there....just slept and showered. I also would not recommend wearing uncomfortable shoes. I wore flip flops one day and the sidewalks are so dirty that my flip flops threw dirt all over the back of my jeans and my feet were discusting at the end of the night. I LOVE Vegas, don't get me wrong....just not Circus Circus. I will never stay there again....and my advice would be to stay at a hotel in the middle of the strip...you will walk less each day to get to different places. MUST SEE: Madam Teuseau's Wax Museum. It was rediculous!

Reviews.Title: “Just Sucked”
Reviews.Author: maverick666
Reviews.Content: This place is nothing but a getto. The rooms are so dirty. There is just way too much noise in this place. We even had our wash basin cracked. There was a live wire in the bathroom. We decided to check out the very next day and took up a room at MGM. The strip is far away and you would need a taxi to travel. It is economical but if you are coming over to Las Vegas you might as well enjoy at a better place.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LIGHTS and ENTERTAINMENT”
Reviews.Author: my3gifts
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times in the past and always had a great experience. Vegas is so much fun! Last time we stayed here my daughter was still a toddler and was captivated by all the lights and sounds. The free circus preformance shows are a treat. All you can eat buffets are the best....

Reviews.Title: “Mixed stay at Circus Circus”
Reviews.Author: traveling-manaz
Reviews.Content: We had a mixed stay at this hotel and casino. Check in was very easy and fast. We got a great rate of a room. 35.99 a night. The elevators were acting funny that day and closed on me as I was boarding the elevator. Later on that day, my siter, mom, brother and I went to get strawberry pound cake. We got to the elevators and it shut on my brother and sister causing their pieces of cake to spill all over the floor. We informed an employee who said they were having problems with the elevators that day. The room was very nice. Two double beds. The room was clean and comfortable. We had a great view of some other casinos and an unparralled view of the stratosphere. Nice view for 35 dollars a night. The cleaning staff were prompt and friendly and did their job well. The area outside the hotel can be somewhat dingy. I am in vegas all the time visiting friends and I must say for a childrens themed hotel, they should clean the area up a bit. I would stay at Circus Circus again, but only if I couldn't find anything else reasonably priced. I have to say I was semi dissapointed with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved whole Vegas experience!!”
Reviews.Author: BandTNo1Trip
Reviews.Content: Depsite many negatvie reports on this hotel before our trip, I was very suprised at the hotel. Yes it's dated, yes it's full of kids (that is their main market), but it's clean and comfy. If you are going to Vegas you dont really intend on spending too much time in your hotel room do you? If I have any complaints at all about the hotel there would be 2 very small ones, the lifts are a challenge, but we soon learnt to get in no matter if it was going up and we wanted down. The other would be the swimming pool, this was a little small for the size of the hotel, but do you really go to Vegas to sit by a swimming pool all day? The hotel was in a good location and you had the choice of the Deuce bus or the Strip Trolley bus right outside the front door. We opted for the Trolley bus event though it is more money than the Deuce bus, but at least you could get on it when it arrived and not watch it go sailing past packed out! Overall the hotel was very pleasant the gambling experience was great and suited those of us that dont have bottomless pockets when it comes to the minimum bet. So thanks Circus Circus and see ya again next year - maybe I can win some money back!!

Reviews.Title: “Good on Budget”
Reviews.Author: AussieKathy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was good for the price. We stayed here for 8 nights. Rooms were clean. Bus stop directly across the road. My only complaint was the long walk back to Skyline Tower it's a good 10 minute walk from the bus stop. They had a few problems with their ice machines we had to go down to another floor for a few days but they soon had ours fixed. Pool area was also nice. I would stay here again but in one of the closer towers.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the money”
Reviews.Author: pedaldown
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family, both of my kids are under 10 and we were in Las Vegas visiting relatives. I saw some great rates on destinationcoupons.com and on travelape.com so we decided to stay there. I was surprised at how much we enjoyed it. The place is sort of old and dated, but the service was decent for what we paid and the rooms were a horrible shade of purple, but clean and roomy, I would stay there again. Kids had a great time in the theme park there called adventuredome.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: chichi1
Reviews.Content: We were a group of four women looking to have a great time in vegas on a low budget and we got just that. Yes this hotel is out dated compared to others, and yes there are alot of families, especially on the weekends. But overall we had a great stay at this hotel. The rooms were clean, the service good, staff friendly, and the waitresses were probably the best of all the casinos we had visited during our stay. The breakfast buffet was good and the Steakhouse was Fantastic! If your looking for a fancy hotel with fancy rooms and casino then this is not the place for you. But if you are looking for a clean place to sleep every night at a low rate, then there is nothing wrong with this hotel. And as to the location, it is at the end of the strip away from all the newer hotels, but you can ride the buses that go up and down the strip all day for $5.00/24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: egfromftl
Reviews.Content: For the location you can't beat the place - but I wouldn't want to spend any time just hanging around. It's not a pretty place, but the staff is nice and they have a cool shuttle service that will take you from the door of your RV to the Strip without having to walk.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & Cheerfull”
Reviews.Author: pinewood
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 night in October. We got there mid afternoon on a staurday and checked in straight away, only one couple in front of us. We were in the main tower so no walk to the lifts as they were right by the check in desk. The rooms were a decent size and spotlesley clean. They are basic with a tv, hairdryer, large comfy bed, shower etc. The room safe was coin opperated and had to put in 2 quarters evry time you opened it, but at least it was in our room. Its not in the middle of the main section of the strip, took us around 10 minutes to walk to the Wynn and possibly 30 minutes to New York New York, but used the duce bus evey, day only $5 for 24 hour hop on and of service. The casino itself was ok, lots of cheap tat to buy and a little dated. Didnt eat there so couldnt comment sorry. There are two dinners near by, peppermills and Dennys which were great and both had 24 hour menus. We wanted cheap and cheerfull and that s exactly what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Trailer Park - eeecchh”
Reviews.Author: PhTravelling_Guy
Reviews.Content: My room was in the trailer park trash section of the hotel. Those low-lying buildings a walk away from the hotel's main towers. Yeeeccchh. That's what I get for trying to be cheap. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Its Vegas, what do you expect?”
Reviews.Author: marsbar_540
Reviews.Content: its a hotel and its a cheap option for Vegas. its not the grandest of places and that shows in the price. However the room was clean and it served as some where to sleep. why pay loads for a room you dont intend on spending no time in? like all the other hotels on the strip you are only moments away from manys ways of gambling. Circus TV is funny for about 30 seconds, maybe 45 if your drunk. there are other tv channels thank your lucky socks. its cheap and clean enough thats about it.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced and clean”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarrior33
Reviews.Content: It had been over ten years since I had last stayed at Circus Circus. This was a last minute trip, and most of the other strip properties were either sold out, or had rooms starting at $199 per night! I stayed in a room at the Skyrise Tower (just off the Main / West tower...connected to main tower / casino with a second floor walkway). The rooms themselves were very clean and well maintained. It may have been renovated within the last 10 years, as the last time I was here the rooms did not have ceramic tile or marble showers in the bathroom. My only complaint in the room is that the mattresses could have been updated as they weren't overly comfortable (good enough for a few hours rest though). The casino itself is a bit dated, and a touch dingy, but no more than some of the other older strip properties (Imperial Palace, Riviera, Tropicana). The buffet was ok, though didn't contain any real specialty items. If you don't mind the fact that it is a bit further removed from most of the strip properties (about a half mile walk south to the Wynn, 1 mile to Treasure Island), and are just looking for somewhere clean and reasonably priced to lay your head, then this may be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yorkshire24
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel last month and would deffo go back, the hotel its 10mins from the main strip so get the Duece bus outside the hotel its only 5 dollas for 24hrs, the monorail is too far to walk. The hotel is just the right size, as some of the other hotels on the strip are just too big, here you can walk through the casino and not want to sit down for a rest like the other massive ones on the strip. The buffet for breakfast is good but we prefer the cafe for dinner. Would deffo go back. Dont forget to go to the half price ticket van opposite the hotel its well worth going there for discounts.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Kalisomer
Reviews.Content: At Circus Circus, you definatley get what you pay for. It is at the end of the strip and really not near a whole lot except for the Stratosphere. My husband and I stayed for 4 days on the promenade side of the hotel. There were a total of 6 elevators to get to our room, but I would say only about 2 worked. If you are trying to go down (we stayed on the 19th floor) it could take at least 15 minutes for an elevator to come. A few times we had to get on the elevator going up and ride up and then come back down. That was quicker most of the time. The rooms were a good side, the bed was kind of hard and there were three small pillows. The room served it's purpose - sleeping, showering, and changing. We knew we weren't going to spend tons of time there any way. There are A LOT of kids, which was too be expected. We at the Garden Grill two times. The food there was actually really good and had the breakfast buffett once. Again there you get what you pay for. If you are looking for a nice Sunday morning champange brunch go to the Hilton which is only about 5 minutes away (cab ride). They have lots of selection and it's only 18.99 per person. If you are looking for something fancy then Circus Circus is not the place for you at all. If you are looking for a clean place to sleep and shower for a good price then I would recommend it. I would say that I would try another hotel the next time that i go to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: StokePotter
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Circus Circus for 4 nights at the end of September. This was booked as part of a fly drive tour with Virgin Holidays. If you are looking for 5 star luxury, then this is not the hotel for you. However, based on the cost of the hotel, then this is of an acceptable standard. We had a smooth check-in which took only a few minutes and we were given a room in the Skyrise Tower on the 23rd floor. We had a good view of the Stratosphere and the city & countryside beyond. However, a word of warning here, especially if you are travelling with children - although we were on the 23rd floor, we could slide open the window wide enough to climb out onto the window shelf! We ate at 4 of the eateries: Barista Bagels, breakfast at the Circus Buffet, Garden Grill and the Steakhouse. The first 3 were of an acceptable standard.
