However, the Steakhouse was wonderful - it felt like eating in a 5-star hotel. The food and service were really good and I would definitely recommend it, if you want to splash out on a good meal. The location of Circus Circus is at the north end of the Strip and it is a long walk to the south end. However, we used the Deuce, the Trolley Bus and the Monorail at various times. The Deuce gets very busy, especially at night, so expect a long wait in the queue. In summary - if you are on a budget, then this is a good hotel in which to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: askssk
Reviews.Content: Dirty, disgusting and filled with the less desirable LA crowds. This is by far the worst hotel we’ve ever stayed at. They need to tear this place down and start over. The non smoking rooms smell as bad as a smoking room. Although the room wasn’t as bad as it could have been, it smelled and felt dirty. It did seem like the bathroom in our room had a recent makeover. Most of the staff we spoke to couldn’t assist us or answer our questions. The check-in process and parking are a joke. They make you drive around to the back of the hotel and then go up, back down and all through the hotel and casino just to get to the front desk. Can’t imagine why you can’t come through the hotel lobby like every other hotel! Worse, whomever designed the layout of the hotel and signage should be fired. The only positive thing in this entire hotel is The Steak House. It’s been rated #1 for decades and it was excellent. The high prices keep the “elements” out and it was peaceful and elegant. One of the main reasons we chose this hotel on our last night in Vegas was because of the Adventuredome. On a Saturday night they are usually open until midnight and we thought it would make our 6 year old daughter’s last night fun and memorable. Instead, the front desk informed us that it closes at 6 pm and turns into a Fright Dome. Very disappointing. We do not recommend this hotel to anyone. Pay a couple hundred more and stay in a nice hotel and casino!!

Reviews.Title: “alright, not bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: tizmig
Reviews.Content: Not vey bad at all. Please do not let the reviews scare you. Why spend triple the amount for a place you will only sleep. Huge clean room and big bathroom, maid service, room service , what else do you need?

Reviews.Title: “Room sharing and more excitement!”
Reviews.Author: SAJ1215
Reviews.Content: Budget hotel or not, I had experiences at this hotel which I hope will never be repeated! I received an invitation from the hotel for two free nights, so I called reservations since I was planning a trip to Las Vegas anyway. The reservations clerk was very nice and said she was booking me a tower room with a strip view and I should check in at the VIP desk. Sounded great! Particularly since I am definitely not a high roller. When I arrived for my stay, I went to the VIP desk where the clerk was typing. I stood there for three minutes before she even acknowledged my presence, even though I was the only other person in the room. She finished what she was doing, put her papers in an envelope, and then simply said, "Yes?" Not a good first impression to say the least. She had my reservation ready, handed me the packet and gave me instructions on getting to my room. I asked about the room key and she said it was in the packet already. It's a LONG walk to the room, but when I got up there, I opened my packet, and, of course, found no room keys. Again, I worked my way back down to the VIP desk where I was greeted with the same "go away - you're bothering me" display of attitude. When she finally acknowledged my presence and I told her I had no key to my room, her response was, "are you sure?" I didn't even respond, just gave her the packet she had given me. She then printed up two keys and said she didn't know how that could happen. No apology for my inconvenience, she just went back to her duties. When I finally got into my room, the smell was really bad. It was a stale or musty smell. When I opened the drapes, the strip view I was told would be booked was non-existant. I had not brought in my luggage at that point, but decided to take a shower and a short nap. The bed was like sleeping on straw, it was squeaky and terribly uncomfortable. I had some friends staying at another hotel and they invited me to come bunk with them for the night, which I did with great pleasure. When I came back the next afternoon, I noted a security guard and a man in the hallway near my room. I said hello and started to put my key in the door when the guard asked me if that was my room. He took my identification and verified with the front desk that it was my room. SURPRISE! I was informed that the man standing outside my room had actually spent the night in my room and that his personal belongings and luggage were still in there. I thought, "no way - I showered in there and the bed was messed up, why would his things be in there?" He told me that he had checked in around 9 p.m. the night before and was very tired when he got to the room. Yes, he noticed the bathroom had been used and that one of the beds had not been made, but he was tired and there were other towels and the other bed had not been slept in, so he used it. He thought housekeeping just had not gotten to the room. At some point the next day while he was out, the hotel discovered their mistake and disabled his key. He was waiting in the hallway for several hours for me to return so he could gain access to his belongings. Security would not let him in without my permission since the room was originally booked to me. My key had been disabled also, so the guard let him in with my permission and he rapidly gathered his things and left. I decided that I would do likewise. When I went to check out at the VIP desk, the young lady said there was no one there I could talk to at that time, but she would gladly give me a comment card. I was waiting for the valet to bring my car and running my experience through my mind when I noticed a car pull up a short distance from me and turned over to a man who was waiting. Bells went off in my head and I yelled to the valet as the car started to move, telling him I thought it was my vehicle (rental). He started yelling. "Sir, sir" as the car slowly began to pull away and the man stopped. The valet asked my name, checked his ticket, and apologized profusely as he had just given my car to someone else. Not only did Circus Circus put somebody else in my hotel room for the night, they were going to give my car away also. Too many other hotels in Vegas for me to stick around and see what else was going to happen. I did receive an apology from management at the hotel, subsequent to filing a complaint, offering me complimentary accommodations in the future, but doubt that I will take them up on it. I travel quite a bit and have never had an experience like this.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: PrincessBeer
Reviews.Content: Circus Circus is good value for money. It's not as glamourous and new as other hotels on the strip, but it's not as expensive either! We stayed in a Manor room, which was clean, comfortable, had all the facilitlies needed for our stay (two double beds, towels, tv, fridge, iron and ironing board) and was perfectly adequate for the amount of time we actually spent in our room! The smell of the room was a bit musty (smelled like old cigarettes), but not overpowering. The casino did smell heavily of cheap air freshner though, which was very unpleasant at times, so we tended to avoid walking though or going to the casino there. On the one night we did though, the drinks service by the slots was quick and efficient (obviously with tipping), so no complaints there! Check in and out was pretty fast. I paid the $1 per day phone fee in advance and didn't hand over my credit card details so didn't use the TV in room check-out service. As mentioned, we didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel or casino, just used it as a base to explore Las Vegas and the other casinos, so we didn't eat there (unless you count Krispy Kremes) or use the pool facilities. The Deuce bus stop is right outside (but is very busy) and it's a shortish walk to either the Sahara or Hilton for the Monorail. I'd recommend using the Sahara monorail stop as the walk back feels a little safer. The Sahara itself is also a pretty good value casino, with Blackjack and Poker tables with cheaper minimum bets than other more modern casinos. If you are looking for somewhere just to sleep and use as a base to explore then Circus Circus is good value. If you want the 'wow' factor or want to use more of the facilities like the pool, then I would pay a little more per night and move further down the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Pay a bit extra & stay somewhere else!!”
Reviews.Author: 5manor
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August for 3nights with 3 friends. Had originally planned on staying somewhere else but booked last minute so no real options left. Room itself was fine, good size and clean apart from the lack of towels and problems trying to get them. The hotel itself though is really in need of an overhaul, it has a dirty musty smell and just has a dirty feeling about it as oppossed to the other hotels on the strip, plus its at the far end of the strip so you end up having to get taxis everywhere. Definitely next time i go to vegas i'll pay that little bit extra and stay somewhere different!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dinkydoll
Reviews.Content: Myself and my 2 friends stayed at the Circus Circus hotel for 3 nights in July. For the price we paid, we were very impressed with our room, it was a great size, the beds were very comfortable, the bathroom was also very spacious and the bedroom and bathroom were spotless. We were on the 26th floor had a great view out towards the stratosphere hotel and pool area. The hotel itself was crazy but in a good way! Great fun with the adventure drome and the circus acts - lots to keep children entertained. There are loads of restuarants, snack areas, gift shops, bars and even a wedding chapel! Particularly recommend the all you can eat breakfast buffet! The only thing I would say is that it took us a good 15-20mins to get from our room to the reception area so be prepared! Also be prepared for a potentially long que at check in when you arrive. There is a small pool and snack bar area outside which we were happy enough with but wasnt the greatest to be honest. Location-wise the hotel is at the bottom end of the strip but there are plenty of taxis and a bus stop nearby. It's obviously not the fanciest of most modern of the vegas hotels but as somewhere to be based in vegas I really dont think it can be beaten for value.

Reviews.Title: “great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: the-rach
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Circus Circus last week (in the tower), very pleased. It was cheap, so we didn't expect luxury. The room was large, clean and comfortable. A few bits of peeling wallpaper in the halls, but no probs in the room itself. The hotel is huge, so be prepared to walk quite a way to get to the rooms, through the casino, and past the restaurants and theme park. I think this is just a Vegas thing though! Location was ok, a bit far from the rest of the strip, so we did a lot of walking. We knew this when we booked and I don't usually mind this, but with the weather over 100f, it was a bit of a problem. The buses were not good, they were completely overwhelmed. Not enough buses, too many people. It was rare that we got the first one that arrived, we usually had to wait for the next one. Great facilities in the hotel, I'd recommend the Garden Grill and the Barista was great for getting croissants and bagels for breakfast. The pool was nice too. . In general, a great place to stay in Vegas if you're on a budget. No complaints!

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is”
Reviews.Author: caberly
Reviews.Content: This hotel is no 5 star property, but the people that check in at rock bottom prices expecting even close to that are the ones that need to give their heads a shake. It is a budget accommodation and nothing more, and that is what I am looking for. It reminds me of the people that used to check into our hotel in Vancouver at a rate of around $60/night and then complain it doesn't have the amenities of the hotel across the street which is on average $300/night. Plus all the people that don't do research before taking a trip across the country or across the world that wind up in the manor rooms. What more to most people want for rates $40-$70/night. I see someone write that the casino was average and bland,and when they went down the street to the belagio,wynn,etc they got a WOW factor that they didn't get here, no really. When those hotels are on average $200-300/night without some kind of special deal what do you expect. I use it for a room to sleep and then go down the street and hang out elsewhere. I realize what it is when I check in. Don't whine when it winds up being exactly what it is, no more, no less.

Reviews.Title: “You Get Less Than What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: pathseeker
Reviews.Content: It's easy to see why most ratings are 1 or 2. Check in was a nightmare, our room was a quarter mile walk to the "manor", and it didn't smell good when we got there. Someone came by to ask how we were doing. We pointed out that the toilet had overflowed, wouldn't flush and had wet the bedroom carpet. She promised to have someone look at it right away. They never came. But we only stayed one night and left. Good luck to the next occupant. Its a shame that a fine old hotel is left like this. Guess its time for deep pockets to tear it down and build a new one. So it goes.

Reviews.Title: “Warning”
Reviews.Author: Together85
Reviews.Content: ***Warning***, Stay away from the Manor Rooms. We can not speak for the tower rooms. The age of the Hotel is very much showing. Very run down, no security to the building (manor rooms) anyone can walk in and no cameras. It's also very far from the main hotel, Long walk to get there. The TV got 3 stations one of which was The Circus Circus station, 3 lights did not work and the vent in the bathroom did not work. I called for 2 days to have them fixed, by our last night of 3 they came and fixed the lights and TV. Even the casino is showing it's age. Looks depressing. Our advice is to spend just a little more and stay at one of the newer casino's such as MGM Grand or New York NY.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and adequate”
Reviews.Author: snuffy_my_dog
Reviews.Content: Boy were we nervous booking this, so many bad reviews, but really - the price was fantastic and when we arrived we were in awe - we have nothing like this in Australia - NOTHING This place was awesome, massive. Our King size bedroom was massive and overlooking the Strip. West Tower is a newer section and worth paying a little extra for. The buffest restaurant was brilliant for breakfast and they have a krispy kreme and a McDonalds! We didn't even see the whole place or visit the indoor theme park as there is soooo much to do in Las Vegas, but we would come back to Circus Circus. It's not classy, its not the Belagio, but its cheap and for the budget traveller excellent. Its on the strip, right outside the bus stop and also close to Freemont St Experience. WOULD RECOMMEND!

Reviews.Title: “Gof for it!!”
Reviews.Author: TintinSouthYorkshire
Reviews.Content: A party of 6 of us stayed at Circus...and LOVED IT!! After reading the reviews we almost cancelled, but are glad we didn't. Only negative thing we would say is make sure you stay in the Tower. These rooms are large and have just been refurbished, they are great! Other rooms and hallways looked very old and smelt stale. Breakfast buffet was great, plenty to eat. So for the money don't be put off, we thought it was a great base for the Grand Canyon.

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus Stag Do”
Reviews.Author: sspclarke
Reviews.Content: We had a bargain... £370 for 5 nights and flight... staying at Circus Circus... although what we hadnt realised that we had the Manor Room.... This was a big no no and we complained as soon as we got there... we complained that it felt unsafe and that the room had no safe... We were then upgraded to the tower suite, this was much more acceptable.. the rooms were clean and comfortable... although we didnt sleep much at all!!! I had 12 hours sleep in 5 nights... painful. We all think that this was due to the oxygen they pump into the room to keep you awake so you gamble.... I would reccommend staying there if you are on a budget and of course if you have kids... it was clean nice accommodation and the buffett was reasonable... ENJOY

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Jax&Dave
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel as it was a good value option for Las Vegas whilst still being one of the larger hotels. Check in was quick and efficient. My room was in the Skyline Tower - a bit of a walk to get to but a good sized, clean and comfortable room. The hotel is one of the older ones and at the Northern end of the strip but good value for money if you want a cheaper non-luxury option . It is popular with families with so do expect lots of children. Only had the breakfast buffet but that was good value too - we eat at 9am and was quiet but by 10am there was a queue. There are two pools and the pool area is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: lwtua925
Reviews.Content: I went to Las Vegas for the first time in my life and I heard from some of my friends about Circus Circus in Las Vegas so I decided to book my hotel there. I was in Las Vegas on July 30th for 3 nights in a standard room located in the Manor buildings, which is in a separate building through which you have to exit the lobby and go to the other building which is on the other side of the street. The room itself was spacious. It was a room with two queen beds. There are no honor bar amenities, just an empty fridge to store your cool stuff. The location itself is very far than what I would think. Circus Circus is located on the strip but is far from when the action is which is down by the Mirage, Treasure Island area. Overall, I think that the hotel is fine for a place to sleep but don't expect too much out of it.

Reviews.Title: “Just So So”
Reviews.Author: CozyT
Reviews.Content: Circus Circus is truely a "CIRCUS". Kids are running around everywhere. There are signs all around stating the kids under 21 can not be in the casinos but they have to walk through the casino to get out the door! There is alot to do there, however, if you have kids. There is a McDonalds that kids love and the Adventure Dome is packed with games and rides. They could spend hours in there. While gambling though, we over heard some of the waitresses talking and they sounded pretty disgruntled. They did not seem to like their job at all and passed by customers clearing wanting a drink. Poor customer service!!!The rooms are big but the beds are low and hard. We only got 6 tv stations and 2 of them were the clown channels. The food was good, we liked the buffet and pizza. IF you go next door to Slots of Fun, you can get a huge hot dog for .99 cents. It's big enough for two to eat!

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus = Fun Fun for a family”
Reviews.Author: nighttalk
Reviews.Content: Circus Circus... a hotel, a theme park, a casino, an attraction, You decide. Definately not a new property but a mainstay on the strip. We took our 8yr old and stayed there 3 nights. Like the Flamingo the entrance is in the rear and you dont have to walk through the casino to get to the elevator. We stayed in the back tower... I cant remember what the name of it was but I liked the location of my room in relation to the door and Adventuredome. the rooms were clean but nothing really extra. At the time they were still on the older color scheme. We stayed clear of the buffet. Everyone from cab drivers to other casino employees said to go somewhere else for the buffet. Even with the word being out that the buffet was bad, there was a long line. We ate a few times at the little cafe restaurant that was open 24/7 and it was pretty good. The pyramid cafe at the Luxor is better. Please read my review about that place. The casino was good. The slots were not tight and we made money in the casino. Again it is a on older place but I like it. Be sure to play the very large dollar slot at the front. It pays pretty good. The attractions that give it the name Circus Circus were good. We played for a lond time in the Midway games at the from area on the second floor of the casino. The original circus acts over the casino have been converted to a 2nd floor attraction. They had continuous entertainment and my son and I sat there in enjoyed different non-repeating circus acts for most of the afternoon. They were not short on circus acts. The adventuredome was a great place to play as well. Please read my adventuredome review. My son was very entertained for more than one day. Overall the Circus Circus had plenty to do and see. I walked away with some winnings and had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Parents loathed it - son loved it”
Reviews.Author: schuski
Reviews.Content: There are only two reasons why you want to stay in Circus Circus: - you have children travelling with you and/or - you want to get a nice room with a good view for little money. The $80 a night bought us a big, clean room in the Skyrise Tower with a sweeping view of other hotels on the strip and the big construction site where the "Stardust" used to be. Our 8yo son spend most of the time in the Adventure Dome, a built-in indoor themepark with rollercoaster etc for $25 a day) which gave us the possibility to check out the other hotels. The price is reflected in somewhat outdated design, worn towels and unpleasant atmosphere. The buffet restaurant is good for breakfast and dinner. Avoid the Mexitalia at all costs. About the worst food I had in ages. Not only the dishes are plastic, the food as well.

Reviews.Title: “Could Only Stand the Place For About 45 minutes”
Reviews.Author: webgrl02
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I didn't stay here thankfully . We decided to visit a few of the casinos on the strip. We walked into the amusement park and wondered around there. There were kids running wild everywhere. We then decided to check out the casino and the midway. Kids were running along the paths of the casino just far enough out of the way to keep them from being in the 21 and up casino area. There were people everywhere. I am not usually claustrophobic but after about 45 minutes all we wanted was out of there. As my boyfriend said that place makes you reconsider if you want kids.

Reviews.Title: “Over price on weeken”
Reviews.Author: pimmy80
Reviews.Content: It was the first hotel I ever stayed in USA . First , not worth for the price I paid 250 Dollars on weeken . The smell of the room or even all of hotel to me like chemical spray . No flowers ,Long line of tourist on the weeken . Not nice service as I expected and the design of the hotel was very out of date . Anyway I will not stay here on the weeken :) Pim LA

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic place for children of all ages!”
Reviews.Author: plattapus
Reviews.Content: Like many of the posters, I was really worried about our stay at this hotel. I made our reservations before reading the comments and they really worried me. I almost called to book another more expensive hotel and I have to say, I'm so glad I didn't! I'm not sure what these other people are talking about, but we had a great time. We stayed in the Main Tower which was fine. Our room was large and had an aweful view of a wall out one window and the construction out the other but we weren't there to sit and look out the window all day. The beds were extremely uncomfortable and really low to the ground. They were spring mattresses and you felt every single one of them when you woke up the next morning in desperate need of a massage. The tv had very few channels anyone would want to watch, alot of them were circus circus channels that were stupid, but again...we weren't there to watch tv either. I do agree with the cigarette smells...they did bother me but I'm allergic to cig. smoke so I'm more sensitive than most. I noticed that other, newer (and nicer) hotels didn't have the stench that Circus Circus has. By now you're probably wondering why I said I'm glad we stayed because everything I wrote so far has been negative. The reason I'm glad we stayed can be summed up in two words...our kids. They were beside themselves with glee with all the fun stuff to do. The circus acts are really top-notch and are FREE! The only drawback is that they are so short...we wanted more! The adventure dome was where the kids had the most fun. They stayed in there for quite a while and played to their heart's content. So, if you have children, they will love this hotel. I have children ranging from 7 to 15 and they all were able to have fun. With that being said, if it were just me and my husband, I would never stay here. The drawbacks are many...it's miles away from the strip action with huge vacant lots on either side. There are children running around everywhere...duh! But, even though I'm a mom, I still hate parents who don't control their children. And Vegas seems to attract these types of parents by the droves. They bump into you without so much as an apology, they cut in front of you...it's ridiculous. Our entire stay at Circus Circus, I never met one staff person (including telephone reservationists) who was nice, helpful or basically in a good mood. They all seem to hate their job and you are their casualty should you have the misfortune of needing their assistance. We found the check-in line to be short. But, we were informed ahead of time to call the pre-register number which is supposed to make your wait much shorter. We also realized that there is a reason that your room is so cheap...if you want to do anything other than walk through their corridors, it costs you money. They even charge for drinks in the casinos. Actually, I take that back...the circus acts were free which was nice. We ate in the Casino Cafe and were pleasantly surprised that the food was actually pretty good. The prime rib was tasty and reasonably priced. The wait staff isn't all that great, especially the hostess trying to seat everyone. The Mexitalli Grill was okay...a bit overpriced for the quality but not too bad. All-in-all, we enjoyed our stay and the kids REALLY enjoyed theirs. It was great to do once, but like i said, we would definately try another hotel if we ever came back.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a miss if you want to avoid families!”
Reviews.Author: GarethM
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 9 nights in mid August this year. This hotel was booked through a travel agent as it proved to be the cheapest on offer. We were over for our honeymoon and had come from a lovely hotel in New York. Upon arriving at midnight on a Saturday night we met the dreaded check in queue (see other reviews), 45 mins later we reached the front. At this point the lady was very friendly and gave us an 'upgrade' to a Skyrise Tower room on the 27th floor. What she didn't tell us was that it would take 10-15 mins to reach their through a variety of escalators and elevators! Even at midnight we couldn't believe the number of children and families running wild! This continued throughout the holiday, it certainly isn't the best place for couples. Be prepared to walk a long way for the pool (two small but clean pools), lobby, restaurants and taxi rank. That said the room was clean and maid service very good, even if we had no towels the night we arrived. It is close to the Fashion Mall and is a good base to explore Las Vegas. We ate in the buffet for breakfast a few times and found it was good value, although certainly not the best buffet in Vegas. We both really enjoyed the Steakhouse and I thought they did one of the best steaks that we ate in our time out in the US.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!!”
Reviews.Author: ENLsDAD
Reviews.Content: First, the 3 star rating must be removed. We checked in at 2pm and requested a refrigerator which finally arrived at the room at 9:45pm along with the pillows (micro-pillows) we requested at the same time. The room was very stuffy and hot until we discovered a plastic bag was placed on the intake vent of the air conditioner. There were no covers on the electrical outlets/switches. Great place for finger to go fumbling at night to turn on a light. Can you say electrocution? We have slept on concrete that was softer than the bed we were in. The ice machine was not working on our floor. We had to go 3 floors up to get ice. There was no air conditioning in the hallways or elevators. The rest of the place was dirty. Filthy carpets, trash on the floor. There were signposts literally held together with duct tape. Although the staff was not rude, you could tell they did not care much about customer service. They also looked as if they were being tortured for being there. Will I recommend this establishment? Not a chance! Spend the extra money and stay at MGM, Bellagio, or the Venetian!

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: queotic
Reviews.Content: I booked an air/hotel package with Vegas.com for $330 a person from Thursday to Sunday. I had read the reviews and forums, so I knew this was an unpopular hotel, but I choose it because it was the second cheapest hotel on the site (Stratosphere was a few dollars per night cheaper, but Circus Circus is a bit closer to the Strip) and the 8pm check out. The room and bathroom were clean - and that's the only positive thing I can say about Circus Circus. The room smelled like extremely stale cigarrette smoke - so much, in fact, that I got a headache. The tub is so small that your shoulders are almost touching the wall and the shower curtain. The beds are hard and the WINDOWS are so dirty that you can barely see out of them at night (it's not really a problem during the day though). The TV is TINY and the channel selection is even smaller. I don't think they even had basic cable - just the network channels and 2 or 3 hotel channels. My flight was late, so I checked in after midnight. There were only about 5 or 6 ppl ahead of me, but it still took almost 30 minutes to check in. They have express check out on your room TV which you can access by pressing menu...unfortunately, my remote control didn't work, so I wasn't able to use that option. The hallways were clean, but there was a panel missing from the ceiling in front of my room. And to top it all off...the vending machine took our $2, but didn't give us a drink. We ended up taking all of our stuff to our parents' suite in Tahiti Village the next day. We didn't go back to Circus Circus until the last day of our trip and that's ONLY because check out at the other hotel was at 10am and our flight was at midnight, so we had half a day to kill. Would I ever recommend Circus Circus? I guess it depends on what you're going to Vegas for. I sent my parents out there for their 30th anniversary to renew their vows and surprised them by showing up with my siblings. Because this trip wasn't about us, I wanted to spend the least amount of money on our hotel and airfare. Considering that airfare alone can be over $400, $330 for airfare and hotel for 4 days was fantastic. BUT...if I was planning this trip again, I'd probably choose to stay at the Stratosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Good base”
Reviews.Author: chariot
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very big and slightly dated but had plenty of facilities. There is so much to see in Las Vegas we didn't spend that long in the hotel! Room was clean and spacious with a good view. there were lots of children but the clue is in the title - the theme park and circus are bound to attract children. We had no problems with noise once in our room. Good bus service up and down the strip so although hotel is at one end of the strip it was easy to get around. Also near to 'old' Las Vegas. Check in queue was slightly long but no longer than other hotels we saw. Check in staff weren't very friendly, other staff were.

Reviews.Title: “Not on par with other Las Vegas hotels”
Reviews.Author: PaulSN
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed in the hotel for two nights. After a long check-in process, they took our bags but did not deliver them to our room. After an hour, we had to call the front desk to get them delivered. We stayed in the Tower, which was a bit of a distance from the attractions. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. The pool is not very good, although the circus acts were entertaining. Save your money for the indoor rides, unless you have younger children (6-12). We ended up spending most of the time at other hotels in Las Vegas, as Circus Circus just had too many young children running around at all hours for our taste.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: jetsetgirl01
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Circus Circus on Sat night at 10.30pm and the queue for check-in was a mile long. Moved so slowly and by the time we got to the desk we just wanted our beds. Staff were very unfriendly and we said we had requested a tower room they said they couldnt help us nothing was told to them. Room itself was quite good size, big kingsize bed however quite outdated- if you're looking for fashion and elegance you wont get it in Circus Circus! Bathroom ok though showers were useless. Resturants in hotel were pretty average- for a family the buffet in the morning is good value at $10 for all you can eat. Casino Cafe is also nice for a sit-down meal though pricer. Dont expect any free drinks when playing slots or tables waitresses need pushed along in their buggys they are so slow! Overall a good budget hotel ideal for familys and large groups howeber for something more intimate and elegant I wont be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck”
Reviews.Author: kimmibenny
Reviews.Content: This might have been the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. Even though I had read many terrible reviews of Circus Circus, I figured that It couldn't be has bad as they said. Well, I was wrong. Front Desk personel were rude and unfriendly. You have to walk 15 mins to get from one spot to the next. The room were not fit for humans... dirty, disgusting and dingy. YOu could see the spring actually coming out of the beds!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not that nice!!”
Reviews.Author: BigSteveSheffield
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Circus Circus for a week, at the end of May. The hotel needs some work doing on it esspecially the rooms as they are very dated. Not bad if like us you are looking for a cheap place to stay. The nice hotel are located at the other end of the Strip. I think this hotels days are numbered.

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus ....a decent hotel especially for the money”
Reviews.Author: starkloud8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Circus Circus for 3 nights from Aug. 2nd-5th 2007. We had no problems checking in even though we arrived at the hotel at 9am and check in is at 2pm. Check in was easy and fast. We requested a non-smoking King room and that is exactly what we recieved. I have read some reviews on here about how terrible the rooms were but we did not have those problems. Our room was very clean. On Saturday there were many kids there running around and screaming. I would definately stay at the Circus Circus again. Nothing bad to report on this property.

Reviews.Title: “Very low class, you get what you pay for, and who pays for it”
Reviews.Author: Bob_Hob
Reviews.Content: OK, of COURSE you get what you pay for, but this was ridiculous. We checked in on Sunday afternoon. You stand in a Disney-ride like queue, ropes and bars, to check in. We were a bit unnerved, we'd reserved adjoining rooms, and they said "As long as the rooms are both on the same floor..." Some checking, they found adjoining. Whew. From there, the you get the who pays for it thing kicked in. We live in Vegas, and took the kids for a birthday extravaganza at the Adventuredome, so we figured we'd spend the night. We've been (of course) to CC to see the midway and eat at the steak house (VERY expensive, but VERY VERY worth it - best in town) and what-not, but never to spend the night. As we walked through the casino to the main tower (they have a new tower, main tower, the manor, and an RV park), we found ourselves being bumped, pushed, cut off, etc, by the lowest of low class people. Wouldn't be surprised if they flew into Vegas with live, carry-on chickens. Took the creaky elevator to our upper floor, and found two standard, Motel 5 1/2 rooms. Ours was dirty, the kids' was OK. The mattresses were the second worst I've ever seen. The wire springs were covered by the decorative fabric only - no padding at all. The TV is completely locked out - it was a reasonable one, with HD inputs and component inputs on the front, but no way to access the inputs to hook up a portable DVD player. If you're watching free movies in room, you aren't buying, gambling, or visiting the midway. There are also no kid's channels. Only PBS. No Disney, no Nick, no Cartoon Network. If the kids are watching free TV, they aren't buying a movie, or visiting the midway. We headed down to the pool - down the elevator, through the casino, up the escalator, past the adventure dome, shops, restaurants, etc, to the second casino, across a walkway, up an elevator, through the manor rooms, down an elevator, to a very full, very sweaty pool. Pool towels are provided there, two lifeguards. Two pools, a big one and one about 3/4 the size, and two jacuzzis, a big one and a very small one. Snack bar, bar bar, and lockers. Can't comment on the prices, but imagine they were up there, as was everything else. After, we went back, showered, headed down to eat. 20 years ago, the buffet at CC was 2.99, and clearly overpriced. Now, it's 12.99, and would still be overpriced at 2.99. No drinks service beyond "Go over there and get a drink" (but a good selection of sodas, juices, coffees), lots of fried food, and shrimp that hasn't been "de-veined". Doesn't even have chocolate syrup to put on your ice cream for desert. Tables scattered haphazzardly, with no set real set walkways inside the perimeter. Much more bumping. The midway is OK. It is actually acceptable as a destination. Lots of rip-off carnival games for a dollar each. Softball into the milk can, basketball into a hoop 1" bigger, those types of games. But still fun. They have cheesy circus acts 2x an hour (think every 55 minutes), but we passed two hours time with the very little ones while the bigger ones were on their own at the Adventuredome for $40. Not too bad. The Adventuredome is a "theme park" under a dome. The rides are tiny, and it consists of mostly arcades and midway games. The wrist bands are $24.95 per person, find a two-fer coupon if you can, or the casino gives a "fun book" with a $4 off coupon. The older kids had a lot of fun, played for hours on their wrist bands and $20 each. Check out is easy - the same little box that locks out the inputs is the movie/pay per view/view your account box. You can check out on on TV, which I would, because the same way check-in is set up with the ropes, so goes check out. And the line is even longer. Probably to find out why they were charged for local calls. As it turns out, there is a $1 surcharge, per day, for the honor of having a phone in your room, which isn't included, mentioned, or billed when you check in, so you have that last extra charge. So, all in all, our impression is you don't even really get what you pay for at $90/room/night and $15 for a buffet. You are better off staying elsewhere, and then going to the midway and Adventuredome if that's your gig.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: SJMcG
Reviews.Content: The hotel is huge and takes quite a while to travel between pl;aces - so ask for a room near the elevator and not too far from the ground floor! The rooms are clean and a good size. Our room had a good view of the Stratosphere and two comfortable beds The property is not the most modern of hotels and is slightly stuck in 1987- but it is a good hotel for families. There is a large theme park inside the hotel and a McDonalds and a live circus show every day. It is located towards the end of the strip and just about within walking distance of most things (ie, the other hotels, Fashion show mall etc). The food places, restaurants and cafes etc were quite good inside the hotel. A good all round, value for money hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: marysmiles
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights in Vegas, the 1st three being at Circus Circus. The following 4 nights we stayed at New York New York. We were so glad that we stayed at these hotels in this order, as it would have been horribly disappointing if it were the opposite. The nights spent at Circus Circus were free due to Tahiti Village's promotion of the mini vacation if you completed their time-share presentation. Circus Circus was extremely crowded. Lots of children, to be expected due to the theme of this hotel. Our room was located in the back tower which took us no less than 20 minutes to walk to from the lobby. The tram from the back tower is broken down (apparently for years now), so we had no choice but to walk through their entire hotel every time we wanted to go out. The water in the tub would not turn completely off, it ran constantly. The electric plug-in located in the bathroom sparked every time I plugged in my curling iron. The air conditioner was so loud that it was hard to sleep. I could go on, but i'll just sum it up saying this is one hotel we will never go back to, even on a free nights stay! We were very unhappy with our entire stay there. I will add one nice thing about the hotel, the circus act that they have is entertaining & free to watch. The buffett was average. Adding a note about the New York New York. Fabulous hotel. Great service, easy to get around, great restaurants, nice casino. I would love to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Not as much fun as the Circus”
Reviews.Author: helenearth
Reviews.Content: When I chose to visit Las Vegas there was a convention on, hotels were booked solid so for a couple of nights I ended up having no choice but to stay here. It was over priced considering how run down the place was. The room I stayed in was right at the back and the block I was in was in serious need of a face lift. The room was clean, but very dated. I didn't like the casino purely because it holds a lot of entertainment for children and not as much for adults. So if you're on holiday with the kids it may be an ok choice for you as Las Vegas doesn't really cater for children. The staff wern't particularly very helpful, but the casino did feature an amusement park at the top floor and decent shops. This is the point on the srip where I would turn around and walk back the other way. After this it gets quite run down and dodgy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a study of the commercial circus!”
Reviews.Author: Resmama
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights with my son on our trip around the US and I believe that Circus Circus was the perfect choice for us. It is a factory-like hotel, which I generally dislike, but somehow it suited Las Vegas - and the price we payed was absolutely right (although the economy of Las Vegas works in a rather special way, where you end up paying a lot for everything else but rooms and drinks...) Still, I would have hated to pay more for a room, since I really did not like Las Vegas. I have nothing to complain about when it comes to Circus Circus. We did not have any problems, rooms were clean, staff nice, pools fine, etc. We did not have a car, took the bus a few times, but ended up walking back and forth more or less everyday and night. It was not very far and felt safe, even for a single mother and her son. Therefore, if you are interested in going to Vegas for a study-trip, I would highly recommend Circus Circus, where you can spend some cheap days just watching the real circus of contemporary consumer culture. It is much better to spend money on a nice hotel in another city!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Purduegolf1
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that after reading some of the reviews of Circus Circus before i arrived, i was a little sceptical and definitely a lot worried. My husband and i booked this trip through a time share deal that he "won" on the radio. None the less, the accomadations were free and so off we went. We checked in late Thursday night (7/12) around 11:00PM. There were a few people in line, but there were also many people working the front desk check-in. It only took about 15 minutes or so to make it to the counter. While we were checking in, we were assigned a smoking room and i asked the gentleman at the counter just to verify that the room was non-smoking. He said it wasn't and without question, he put us in a different room. While he was booking the new room, someone else that was checking in booked the room first, so he then upgraded us to a suite on the 8th floor. I said great. Then i thought again and asked if the elevators were pretty quick-and he nodded and answered fairly quick. I was a little worried, but thought that a higher room might be more quiet. After check-in was complete, we were given directions to the correct elevator from parking garage #1 and went in search. After about 20 minutes, a couple trips up and down the elevator and once down the escalator, we finally found the elevator, not because the directions were wrong, but because it was definitely a little confusing with so many people walking around at midnight and so many different places to go. (You see, only level 3 has a walkway that takes you to the main building and then you have to take an escalator down to the casino floor.) But once we found the correct elevators, we went up to the 8th floor, all the way to the end of the hall and opened the door to a very spacious room. Very nice view of the Stratosphere at night. My true test of a hotel room is how comfy is the bed--and i must admit, we actually flipped the covers up at the end of the stay to see who made the mattress because it was more comfy than the one we sleep on at home. Since we hadn't eaten all night, we went in search of something to eat. Not being too familiar with the place and being that it was late, we didn't find much open. We saw McDonald's bads that people were carrying around, so we asked a family where they got it, and they said upstairs in the arcade but they thought that it was closed by now. So, we settled on some premade sandwiches from one of the convenience shops next to the main elevator-to our surprise, they were very good and big. Later in the stay, we did find a 24 hour cafe further down, but we never got to try it. The next morning, we woke up early for a morning tee time and joked that we should leave ourselves plenty of time just to find our way out to the parking garage to find the the car. But i must admit that after parking your car in the parking garage once, you get used to finding it and it isn't really a big deal to find it again. Plus, we found a more direct route to the 3rd floor walkway that didn't involve going through the casino. After golf, we returned to the hotel and grabbed a bit to eat at the Mexican place. Although we didn't have the Mexican food served in there, we did order the Meatball sub and Sausage and Pepper sub and found it to be a good size portion and very good. We also got the $3.00 margarita special which was very good. The food was a little pricy,b ut i guess that is what you get for convenience. After lunch, we finally started to drop a couple dollars into the casino. My game of choice is Blackjack and my husband's is Let It Ride. I plopped down at the Wheel of Madness Blackjack Table for about 2 hours and had fun with the other gamblers. We are not real high dollar gamblers, more just the type looking to put down $100 a day and try to win some back, if not, at least sit there for awhile. The table was a minimum of $5 which was just fine, I didn't really win anything, didn't really lose anything either. My husband, on the other hand, did much better than I. But, I have to admit, the cocktail service was rather slow. Think i only had 3 beers in 2 hours. The pattern for us stayed the same the next couple of days. Golf in the morning, gambling in the afternoon and eating at night. It involved us moving our car numerous times a day, and although it might have taken at times up to 20 minutes to find a parking spot, i don't think it was unreasonable. Only once did we have to park in the second parking garage and walk a longer distance. The night before we were checking out, we walked up to our room and our room key didn't work. Probably because it was demagnetised by my husband's phone...but a quick note-we were told to stand in the check out line, where there wasn't a single person and we would be next to be called and with a photo id, we could get another one. And that we did. When we got back to the room, the key worked fine and we started to pack. I then thought about checking out in the morning and trying to make our early tee time on time. I had my husband call down to the front desk and ask about check-out. They told us we could do an express check-out, which means leave a major credit card at the desk and just call down in the morning when you were leaving. Because we didn't have to pay for the room, i wasn't sure why we would have a bill, but it turns out that they charge a phone fee of $1 a day whether you use it or not. So, after our $3 was charged to the card, we called down just before lugging the last bag out the door we called down to the front desk to tell them that we were leaving and they said ok and our tv went off. They must have cut the power to the room somehow, but no worries, because we really were done and out the door. Overall, the entire stay at Circus Circus was enjoyable. Like i said, i was a little worried after reading some of the reviews online, i don't think i could really say anything bad other than i was really thirsty while gambling. The elevators all worked prompt, the room was clean and large, the casino didn't really smell like smoke (compared to others we were in), the parking situation was busy, but you have to expect that if you drive a car anywhere on the strip, the circus act was neat to watch at least once, the location is fine if you have a car (a little far away if you are walking, but not impossible) We didn't visit the pools or the adventure dome-although it looked pretty cool. The staff was very friendly, including the dealers. Of course, there were a lot of kids around the hotel-you are staying in a casino designed for family, but if you don't mind kids, you won't think twice. The kids really weren't in the casino area, and the one time we were walking throught the casino we did hear a security guard tell one family that the kids cannot be standing there-the family had a fit, but he was only doing his job. If you are staying at Circus Circus, don't expect the high end amenities you would receive at Caesars or the Wynn, but for the money (i understand it is pretty reasonable), i would recommend it to anyone and everyone. Our time in Vegas was short, but we will definitely be back again. Thanks a lot Circus Circus, you are a winner in our book.

Reviews.Title: “A Clowny Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sirgeneral69
Reviews.Content: Im a travel agent from Hawaii and i stayed at this hotel with my family over the 4th of July weekend.There were so many people staying at this hotel.I guess its because it is summer time and that the kids were out of school,its a holiday weekend,and more so its the only family oriented hotel.This hotel is good for the kids,not really for the adults.This hotel should have a real circus act inside the hotel.It would really make this hotel a circus circus.When i checked in,the person said she didnt have a non-smoking room that i requested several months ago.So she put us in a smoking room instead.The room smelled so bad i couldnt breathe.I thought i would have to go to the emergency room.They called me to say that they had another room available after being in the room for about couple of hours.Plus,the beds didnt have a comforter.The housekeeping for got it.Bathroom is spacious,but the tub is small.Not much tv stations.Rooms should be equip with mini frig and a micro.Circus buffet is good,but the only thing wrong is that they serve the same thing every nite.In conclusion,if i had to stay at this hotel again,they would have to give me a comp room.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yeojstl
Reviews.Content: This is absolutely the best hotel. I don't know why so many people on this site say it is dumpy. It is not. It was very clean,they had very friendly and helpful staff. Great restaurants and it's kid firendly. I noticed that people complain about the kids. They say they are annoying. I went there and they were fine. If you don't like kids then why stay at a kid friendly hotel. I love kids and i love Circus Circus. The rooms are nicely decorated and very clean. The restaurants have great food. It is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Howard_S_7
Reviews.Content: I was a solo traveler, celebrating my recent retirement. I booked a tour package with an airline and I calculate that I paid about $65 per night for the room. Scheduled to arrive at 1 PM, I did not arrive until 3 the next morning due to airline delays. The front desk staff deals with this routinely so check-in was quick and efficient. Getting to my room, however, was not. The route from the front desk to the Main Tower elevators is a maze through part of the casino (or so it seemed after being awake for 27 hours). The carpets in the corridors are in need of replacement, but that is true of 99 percent of the hotels in this country. The room itself was large and clean but its decoration was austere and dated. What impressed me was the quality of the construction. I didn't see a single crack in the walls. The ventilation system was quiet and easily handled the triple-digit-temperature afternoons. The bed was comfortable. On the negative side, there was no in-room coffee and the television left much to be desired. The choice of channels was very limited, and the "menu" function was inoperative, so the advertised in-room check-out service did not, in fact, exist. Management seemed to be dropping a subtle hint that it did not want me to be sitting in my room when I should be downstairs sitting at a slot machine. Circus Circus has an amusement park and a stage that presents a free show of circus acts (all be they second-rate acts), so it is a good place for families with children to stay in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “It was Fine”
Reviews.Author: dazz5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Circus Circus July 9-12. We were meeting my cousin from Bangkok and her family there. I was very worried about staying here after reading all the reviews. At this point in my life I can afford a nicer hotel and would have preferred to stay at a nicer hotel but my cousin had already booked her room at Circus Circus. I was expecting the worst but it was fine! Our room was in the Casino Tower. I paid to upgrade my room $20 extra a night. The room seemed clean. We weren't in it much. Unfortunately, Vegas allows construction 24 hours a day. That was happening outside our window of the strip. It wasn't so loud and I think I got used to it. It's fine for a cheap trip to Vegas. The only problem is we were constantly on the Deuce to get to the main strip. It is located North of the strip and not within walking distance, especially in 109 degree heat. I would recommend Circus Circus for those on a budget and with kids. Very kid friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Price”
Reviews.Author: champagne62
Reviews.Content: For the price I found this hotel to be comparable to other hotels. I was kind of hesitant after reading some of the reviews but our stay was excellent. We stayed in the Sky Tower and since we are both smokers it didn't bother us to walk through the casino. Our king room had plenty of room and was very clean. The restaurants were very nice and of course the casinos were very good too. I loved the location. We took the bus to go around the strip since it was so hot and it was great. There were too many children is the only drawback I had. I, personally, cannot figure out why anyone would pick Las Vegas as a vacation spot if they have children. For the price, this was an excellent hotel and would recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “. great value for money.... ( Carol , Glasgow,Scotland)”
Reviews.Author: CarolMGlasgow
Reviews.Content: What are all these people moaning about ???? we stayed here for 2 weeks 20th june - 4th July. it was great, no problems at all, 5 of us 2 adults, 3 teenagers, stayed in the skyrise tower, not too far from the pool level which was handy... the hotel overall is not one of the newest or the most modern, but as far as we are concerned we got what we paid for, the staff were helpful, rooms clean, shower great, clean towels and bed linen, what else are these people looking for? How do they live at home? must live very grand lives indeed !! we had a super time and have no complaints about this hotel, it was busy, and there are children around, but I think theres a clue in the name of the hotel and obviously this hotel is going to attract famiies. It had a great atmosphere and we would def go back... the steak House is amazing, champagne brunch was superb, highly reccomended.

Reviews.Title: “Circus of children....not for the adult”
Reviews.Author: diddleprincess
Reviews.Content: Some girls and I decided to take a well deserved trip to Las Vegas... It was a last minute decision and so we got a great deal at the Circus Circus hotel and Casino. I have been to Las Vegas many times before and have stayed at some prestigous hotels and some mediocore hotels as well. This particular hotel I would say was so-so....It is very child friendly and the is a ways from the middle of the strip. There is alot of construction in the area so your surrounded by 3 or 4 empty sites of nothing. It's not worth staying here unless you plan on spending alot of your time at the hotel... The checking in and out procedure was ridiculously slow as were the elevators which were out of commission every now and then throughout the day. The one elevator I refused to use after the inside door elevator not closing which left a gap between floors...There is some much needed maintenance that needs to be done to the elevators... They closed the pools down during the day one at a time to clean or something...and the weather was 111 degrees...could they not have done this when the pool area was due to be closed?? Overall the food was amazing, and the staff friendly...The buffet at this hotel was one of the best I had been too for food quality and the staff here very helpful. This is fairly ok hotel to stay at, just very child friendly.

Reviews.Title: “lots of families and kids”
Reviews.Author: travelbob1
Reviews.Content: This is one of the older Strip hotels. It is filled with lots of families and kids, propbably because of the indoor amusement park and arcade. The King bed room in the Manor -four buildings in the back - was clean and large enough for anothe K-bed. The area around the hotwel is undergoing new construction of hotels and is a good walking distance from the more populus south strip. Parking was convenient as was access to I-15.

Reviews.Title: “Rip Off”
Reviews.Author: craco
Reviews.Content: We usually stay there once or twice a year. This time, they said it would cost $11.99 per day for Internet access. They said all the hotels were like that, but that is a lie! They used to offer free dial up, and now it is wireless. Wireless is cheaper than dialup, even the fleabag motels offer it for free. They said we could use calling cards if we paid $1.00 per day for local telephone usage, another lie! They charge for toll free numbers! They sell phone cards, but you can't use them unless you pay for using toll free numbers.

Reviews.Title: “Swear not to stay there again”
Reviews.Author: PMV
Reviews.Content: Even if Circus Circus offers me a 3 night complementary stay i would not stay there again until its remodelled. The hotel absolutely stinks. MGM group is already having plans to remodel it. I ignored the advice of other people who in their posts have advised not to stay at Circus Circus. Right when you enter the smoke gets into your nose. I had selected the hotel only because i thought that even though we may find it boring but our kids would love it. We had fourteen days vacation in California and Vegas and at the end of the vacation my son said that of all our rooms and hotels the Circus Circus was the most lousiest. We stayed at Golden Nuggett on freemont street for one night and the kids loved that hotel better than Circus Circus. We had two rooms booked in the Casino tower thinking that the rooms would be better than the west tower, sky tower and manor. I was shocked to see the quality of the rooms. They say that the Casino tower rooms are facing the strip which is only half truth. Not all rooms in the Casino tower. We were given a room which was all the way back near the west tower. So to get down we used the west tower elevator than the casino tower. The entire hotel is so beaten down. If you pass through the casino you will surely feel all the smoke getting in to your nose and lungs. You can stay at other hotel and take your kids to Circus Circus for the free circus acts or wish to go to the adventure dome. The Circus acts are every hour and lasts for only 10 minutes. You may avoid the adventuredome if you have been to places like disneyland and universal studios. At the entrance of adventuredome the rides that you see really suck and seems too old. The restaurants at Circus Circus are worse too. The food at MexiItalia was horrible. At pizzeria they don't serve pizza by slices so if the kids want a cheese pizza then you have to order a whole pizza and it's expensive too. Their Valet parking service is also poor. Lot of times i would see only one or two people attending 10 to 12 cars so most of the time there is a wait. At the time of check-in expect atleast 30 minutes wait around noon.

Reviews.Title: “Second time at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sancho_p
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at Circus Circus in August 2006; my partner's sister and her family live in Henderson, some 20 minutes outside Vegas, but as this was my first trip to Vegas we wanted a Strip hotel. We booked it thanks to the very acceptable prices! When the eldest daughter announced that "oh, by the way, while we're holidaying in Vegas in April we'll be getting married too" frantic panic set in at home. We e-mailed the hotel and got our rooms booked ( four in all, for various members of the clan) We had our flights via Airtours - as they are direct to Vegas - but others came a variety of routes with varying changes. We picked up a hire car at McCaran - or, rather, at their hire car facility about a mile away. Drove to Circus Circus and valet parked the car (last time we parked it ourselves and couldn't remeber where we'd left it!!) Last time there we had joined the "One Club" - Circus Circus' loyalty card. On reaching the front desk, we noticed a One Club members' check in desk, so went straight to that, skipping the (not so big anyway) check in queue. We had asked for - and got - a 'high floor' non-smoking skyrise tower room. Perfectly comfortable, and I can say that I have never had a smoke-smelling room when asking for a non-smoking room. With the wedding, and the family just down the road, we weren't in the hotel much. That said, when there, we ate well, drank well ( for the reviewer who couldn't find a sit-down bar open after 2200, the large bar next to the Garden Grill seemed to be open 24/7 - we certainly sat there over a few drinks the day of the wedding until - at a rough guess - 3am) and gambled well. On my first visit, a blackjack dealer went to extraordinary lengths to 'show me the ropes'. Remembering his advice (thanks, Rick) I managed to (usually) come away from the tables ahead on the day. We've stayed there twice now, and are booked to return on October 2007, for two weeks. I don't return to places where I have had a bad experiece - the fact that i am returning for a third visit says it all.

Reviews.Title: “Caution”
Reviews.Author: abc123sch00lteacher
Reviews.Content: Myself and 3 children (ages 13-18) just returned from a 4 day stay at the Circus Circus. We stayed Sunday - Thursday. After reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, I was aware that there may be some problems, but because this place seemed like it is offered the most activities for children, I thought I would take a chance. Before booking a room, I read the reviews on Trip Advisor, and decided the best place to stay was in one of the tower rooms, so when booking online, I went directly to the hotel's website and booked a room in the main tower versus the manor rooms. Before our flight took off, I called the motel and spoke with someone at guest services to tell them that we would be arriving late - 7 pm, and didn't want to lose our room in the main tower. They assured me that 7 pm was not too late and there would be no problems. When we arrived at the motel, we parked in the garage next to the main tower, unpacked our car and made our way to the check in. We were ready for the long lines that we read about. It took 20 minutes to get to the front which I didn't think was too bad. Our person was friendly and seemed very fast, but THEN, he proceeded to give us directions to the Manor rooms! which as you may or may not be aware of are outside of the hotel and more like driving distance away. He proceeded to tell me that management needed to upgrade and downgrade other people's room, and that there were no other rooms left. After showing him my confirmation of a room in the main tower, telling him about the earlier phone call guaranteeing my room, and knowing how cheap the manor rooms are compared to the tower rooms, he discounted my room $30 and threw in some extra coupon booklets. I then insisted on a room in the main tower room for the rest of my stay, and he put a room on hold for me but told me to call the next day by noon. So off to the manor room, we went. Returning to the car, repacking all the luggage, etc. and driving there. My suggestion would be not to unload your car until after you know where you will be staying. The only nice things about the manor room were that we were able to park our car next to the front door and there was a refrigerator in the room. It smelled musty and just looked uncleaned. Other people's reviews about the noise air conditioners and thin walls were right, which made it difficult for sleeping. The next day we packed up our stuff and stopped at the information desk early in the morning to check on our new room as we were going to the Grand Canyon and would be gone all day. I was told that it was too early to get keys but there was a room in the main tower on hold for us. So we headed on our trip. On the way back, I decided to call and check on our room as it was going to be at least 9 pm before we returned. We were told that we were still in the manor! I insisted on speaking to someone else, and they said we would have a room in the main tower but not the one previously assigned. When we arrived at the hotel, we left our luggage in the car and went to check on where would be staying this time. We were given a room in the main tower, but before we made our way out of the motel, we were tracked down by the hotel clerk and said that there was something wrong with the room and needed to change our room again. FINALLY, we arrived in our new room. What a difference! The room was clean, nice view of downtown and a short elevator ride to the Adventuredome, shops, midway games, etc. The room didn't have a refrigerator which wasn't a problem for us, and it was much quieter. The rest of our stay was pleasant. The kids had fun. They enjoyed the game area over the main casino more, and it is next to a McDonalds and the Circus Acts. We ate twice for dinner at the Buffet, food was OK, but don't be surprised that you have to wait to get a table when half the place is empty. They insist on seating you. We tried to use the express checkout on the TV, but it didn't work, so called and had no problems. Overall, 3 out of 4 days were good. Would we stay here again? Maybe.

Reviews.Title: “be aware!”
Reviews.Author: funkypeep
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hotel last year for a few nights after we got married and i have to say we had a lovely time we had a west tower room it was bright spacious and very very clean! it seemed to have been refurbished everything in the room seemed spotless and clean, so we decided beacuse it was so nice last time we would book again for this year. as luck would have it we only booked for a 1 night stay and i am so glad we did! i did not know at the time but my sister had sent them an e mail asking could she arrange to have some champagne and flowers sent to our room but nobody could be bothered to e mail her back with a reply! that was the start of it we had to wait forever to book in at reception the queue was a mile long! after we got checked in we went to our room all i can say is what a let down i cant beleive we were in the same hotel! we had to walk a mile to find the right lifts for our tower they took forever to get to us when we got out on our floor the first thing to hit you was the semi peeling wallpaper and a very worn thread bare looking carpet our room was pokey and small the carpet was very very worn as were the bed clothes the chair at the side of the bed had a hole in it that looked like a burn hole, the wall paper was peeling up at the corners, and the bathroom dont even get me started on that! we had a problem with the shower draining and the loo was blocked i had phoned reception but no body came so my husband fixed it himself! the only thing the room had going for it was the fantastic view of the strip at night! the walls to the room were very thin and as we found out very late into the night we could hear every thing going on outside our room so we didnt get that much sleep, we thought we would take a look at the pool as we didnt the last time we stayed it is a small hole in the ground with water in it with a few trees around it and getting to it isnt much better the lift that takes you down to it is vile! this tower must be much older than the other tower and needs a total revamp! it has a great amusument park and great circus acts and a nice casino its just a shame that this tower block lets it down, i would have prefered no view and a nice room in the other tower if we had been staying for more than 1 night i have to say that there is no way i would have stayed in that room or that tower block! we could not wait to check out. when you book make sure you get a choice of tower and book the west one or you will be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “no plumbing for days”
Reviews.Author: trmaze70
Reviews.Content: wow not to bad for a hotel with a bunch of kids .But they lost all water pressure in the sky tower and it was a total lost from there .just be ready to have no water and no symphony from the management.

Reviews.Title: “Okay at Circus Circus”
Reviews.Author: Wobblyboot
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights with family of four at the hotel. We arrived late (around midnight) and check in was a breeze, the following morning though there were long ques. The rooms were average but it is what I expected for the price that I paid. The buffet resturant was good but get there early and the circus acts were great for the kids. Located on the North side of the strip it is a short walk to the major casinos in that area, but if you go to the south side take the car or monorail. If you have a car it is the better transport as car parking is free. The hotel could do with a fresh coat a paint but was good value for what I paid. Our time in Las Vegas was to see the sights and casinos and use the hotel for sleep and for that it is great.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean and efficient”
Reviews.Author: joetrident
Reviews.Content: Booked in here over the net for it's favourable rates and decent enough reviews on tripadvisor. Have to say checkin was quick and easy, very friendly banter with reception, clear directions ( with map ) to rooms. Room was clean, large by irish standards and non-smoking ( no smell of smoke either!!!! Bathroom likewise. Hotel is a good bit away from the main part of the strip but this is reflected in the price and we chose it because we were attending a convention in the centre across the road. There is a family atmosphere in here with the adventuredome and circus shows providing plenty ot keep the kids happy. Plenty of gambling also as you would expect. Food here is plentiful in the buffet if a lot too sweet for my liking! The steakhouse is as good as they say! All in all a good place to stay on a budget and does not warrant the degree of negativity present in some of the reviews here in my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected!”
Reviews.Author: Dottybug
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in the Skyrise Tower section of the Circus Circus Hotel. It was great because my daughter is vehemently opposed to smoking rooms and our whole tower was in a "green" or no smoking zone. You could smoke in the small casino in our tower near the elevators, but that was it. All the hallways, walkways, shops and restaurants were all non-smoking. Upon check-in, we encountered a problem, but it turned out for the better. We had originally reserved rooms in the West Tower because it was near the Midway, which we thought we would be frequenting with our children. When we were given our rooms however, they were in the Skyrise Tower. At first we were quite upset with the arrangement until we found out that the Skyrise Tower was right next to the Adventuredome, and as I said before, we were in the non-smoking section of the hotel. The rooms were very clean and very large! One party in our entourage had 6 suitcases and they were able to live comfortably in the room. There is a parking structure for this end of the hotel and if you park on the 3rd level, you walk straight into the casino area, which is right around the wall to the elevators. Very convenient for transporting luggage without having to use the valet. You still have to check-in at the main lobby near the West Tower, but check-out can be done on the TV in your room. Our rooms were also very convenient to the Adventuredome. We spent an entire day there, and it was so easy to return to the room to change after riding the Rim Runner, which gets you pretty wet. It's incredible that they have a full-on roller coaster there also! The children in our group, ages 3-11 all had things to do and rides to ride. For lunch we ate foot-long hotdogs from a place one floor down from the Adventuredome that was at a very good price. There are other pretty good places to eat near the Skyrise Towers. We ate a nice meal at the Garden Grill which was right next to the lobby of our tower, and also tried the Mexitalia restaurant located right next to that. The food at both places was decent. The Garden Grill is a sit-down, waitress served meal, while the Mexitalia is more of a fast food type where you order your meal at the counter and they call your number when it's ready. Our room had an old air conditioning unit which was quite loud and not very efficient at cooling our room. When I checked out the rooms of the other members of our party, I saw they had newer units which were a lot quieter and made the room a lot cooler. That was a minor problem though, and the room got cool enough for us. We just turned it off at night because it was noisy and we didn't need it, but I can see how that would be a big problem when the temps hit 100°+ in the summer. I'm sure the staff would have seen to it promptly had I complained because everybody was very friendly and courteous from the valet to the front desk to the waitresses to the maid. I would definitely stay at this hotel again, especially if I could specifically request the Skyrise Tower. It was a surprisingly pleasant experience staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel. No view. OK rooms.”
Reviews.Author: rajeet82
Reviews.Content: Paid $130 for / per room for a Sat night. Initially 1 (of the 2) rooms they gave was dirty - not cleaned from the previous occupant. We complained and they had it cleaned in the next hour. No apologies or discounts offered. Hotel was packed for a Sat night. Rooms were large and spacious though just bare furnishings. I am not a fussy sleaper but the beds and carpet could have been better. Parking was more atrocious with the garage elevator not working. Overall, I would say not worth $130/night for a Sat. I would rather come on a weekday and stay here for their $40 rate.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas on a budget”
Reviews.Author: finkfloydman
Reviews.Content: My family and I have just returned from a week's stay at the Circus Circus hotel. This was our fourth visit to Las Vegas and the fourth time we have stayed at this hotel. Our check-in was a breeze as there was no queue at all so we got to our rooms in double quick time. On this occasion we were given two rooms in the Skyrise tower on the third floor which proved to be a little bit of a disappointment. Because we were on a low floor we had absolutely no view from our windows. We were looking back at the roof of the Adventuredome. On our previous trips we had rooms high up in the West tower overlooking the strip. That said, our room was as usual very spacious with kingsize bed which was very comfortable. The air conditioning unit looked fairly new and was very powerful (compared with our previous rooms). The bathroom or rather shower room as there was no bath was again spacious with a giant shower cubicle. The shower was hot and the water powerful and we were supplied with clean fresh towels plus new toiletries every day. Our room was clean and tidy and at the end of the day it's simply somewhere to get your head down after a hectic day and night on the strip. Being on the third floor had a plus point as it was the main corridor to the swimming pool. On the downside it was very noisy with everybody passing your door to get too the pool. The weekend we arrived was the memorial day holiday and the hotel was packed with families. It did become a bit of a chore trying to get from one end of the hotel to the other. By Tuesday the hotel had quietened down a bit. Yes, the Circus Circus is a family orientated hotel hence the Adventuredome at the back and the circus acts, yes there are lots of kids but if you can live with that it's ok. Again as mentioned before, the hotel is located at the North end of the strip but it's still not too far away from the main attractions. There is also a plus point to being at the North end is that the bus the "deuce" when it comes along is invariably empty. It soons fills up as it works it's way along the strip. The bus stop is right outside the hotel. Tip - do buy a 24 hour pass for $5, great value. We had breakfast each morning in the casino cafe which was very tasty and good value for money.
