The only "duff" place to eat in the hotel is the buffet. THE Steak house is an absolute must. The Circus Circus casino is one of the cheapest places to gamble on the strip with $3 Blackjack. Although I have gambled in other casino's along the strip, for some reason I have always found the Circus the most fun casino to play in. Here is a tip for Brit's. In England I was getting $1.93 to the pound. On the strip at an exchange bureau in the Fashion show mall they were offering $2.07 (as of 30th May). Las Vegas is a crazy town and we absolutely love it, don't expect a relaxing holiday here. People say to me that you have to be a gambler to go to sin city, You don't. There is so much to see and do without having to gamble. I have had friends who have come to L.V. and not put a single dime in a slot machine but have still enjoyed themselves with all the other attractions. And don't forget the other great attractions outside of L.V. such as the Hoover dam, Grand canyon, Primm valley and the town of Laughlin just to mention a few. On summing up, the Circus Circus is no Bellagio or Venetian but if you want to spend megabucks on these hotels than go ahead. But if you want to do Las Vegas on a budget and save your money for more fun things then you cant go far wrong with the Circus Circus hotel. We are just looking forward to our next trip. On a final footnote - I had a nice little touch on our first night winning $1,181.00 playing video poker at the sports bar in the main casino plus free beers too. Deep joy! I booked our holiday using Expedia and flying direct with Virgin Atlantic. If I can give any help to anyone just drop me a line. Have fun.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: SharonScotland
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews about this hotel, i was a little bit worried however there was no need. Ok, so its not the fanciest hotel in Vegas but for £20 a night, can you really complain? The rooms were huge with 2 massive beds and a large well equiped bathroom and a fab view down the strip. There are more than enough facilities in the hotel with casinos, bars, restaurants, the fun park, shows, shops etc etc. Its very much a family hotel so there are many children but what do you expect from a hotel in the theme of a circus!! Overall it was clean, comfortable and more than adequate. The only thing that would maybe put me off returning to this hotel is that it is quite far up the strip away from many of the other big attractions. Now onto Vegas - WOW - there really is nowhere else like it. Amazing!!! Enjoy your trip x

Reviews.Title: “Good value but noisy”
Reviews.Author: MollyandOscar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Circus Circus for two nights in May 2007 and have mixed feelings about our stay. The hotel is at the north end of the strip so you are a reasonable walk away from some of the attractions but with the options of a regular bus service ('the deuce') or monorail it really doesn't take that long to get to the other hotels / casinos. We thought that given the hotels amenities (pool etc) it was excellent value for being on the strip, it's no Bellagio or Wynn but then you can still spend all your time in the other hotels and casinos and come back to your much cheaper room at Circus Circus. Our room was spacious, comfortable and the bathroom clean and modern, all in all we were very happy until later on the first evening. The room was connected to the next room by a locked interconnecting door and there was a two inch gap at the bottom of the door which meant we could hear everything from the room next door. Both nights our neighbours went out and left the TV on with the volume turned up high. This wasn't a problem until we were trying to get to sleep in the small hours of the morning and had to call security to go in and switch the TV off. Noise is to be expected in Vegas of course, everyone is out partying including ourselves but the paper thin walls and large gap between rooms really didn't help. If you stay here you will no doubt have a great stay as long as your neighbours aren't as inconsiderate as ours were. Our advice is to stay here but buy earplugs!

Reviews.Title: “Big big nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunshinebabe25
Reviews.Content: I really have to say I liked the hotel. The room was perfectly big and you could see the complete strip. We stayed in the tower and these rooms are a little bit more expensive. The bath was perfect and spotless and we had two king size beds. Perfect for us :-). The only negative points are, that it is quite difficult to find a parking, to find your room and to find back to the reception. The hotel is definitely too huge. By the way, I never heard any children, as written in the last reviews. They do have fantastic donats downstairs and the hotel is walking distance to all the big and expensive hotels on the strip. Therefore the Circus Circus hotel price is very cheap. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. The only negative points I can find is that the female persons at the check-in and check-out were very unfriendly. So better go and talk to the male one's. And reserve a taxi on your own, if you leave during night time. Reception tells you, that taxis will come every 10 minutes, but it is not true. We waiting for more than 1 hour and almost missed our fleight. Distance to the airport is about 20 minutes without traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't that bad...”
Reviews.Author: karen1136
Reviews.Content: After seeing some scary reviews, I was hesitant about staying here. The beds weren't the most comfortable, and it was far down the strip, but it was a cheap, clean place to stay. Gambling is cheap next door at Slots o'Fun ($1min and $3 min for blackjack!) and the Deuce bus will take you wherever you need to go on the strip for only $5/24 hours. We were pretty much only in our room for sleeping, so it was fine. We didn 't really even see that many kids. The Tahiti Village vendors were HORRIBLE here though, avoid them at all costs!! Annoying! Other than the mentioned things, check in and check out were smooth and easy. Wireless internet was $10.99/24 hours, the restaurants in the hotel I can't speak of, we ate other places. But, Slots o'fun next door has a fabulous 1/2 lb hot dog for 99 cents! :)

Reviews.Title: “Abysmal”
Reviews.Author: lovemybicycle
Reviews.Content: The whole place smells damp, dank and musty. The overwhelming stench of cigarettes upon entrance turned my stomach. The room wasn't horrible and the food was ok. I would not go back...ever.

Reviews.Title: “circus circus”
Reviews.Author: angiemc00
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was fab ! room was clean & comfortable could'nt really ask for more. The breakfast & dinner in hotel was nice, always something going on never a dull moment.

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus”
Reviews.Author: daddydawg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Circus Circus for about 5 days. We enjoyed our stay . The only rooms to get belong to the towers section. We had no problems with the hotel and we ate breakfast at the Pink Pony resturant, in the hotel. Although some times it took a while waiting, it was worth it. There was just me and my wife, both of us are over 50.

Reviews.Title: “better than feared don't be scared”
Reviews.Author: allipres
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 6 nights in april was scared by reviews at first but fears didnt become reality check in did take a while but it was a friday afternoon and last weekend of spring break check in fast no prob once finally at counter got room in west tower with view up the strip only room complaint was hot water in shower could ahve been better room always clean beds fine very spacious room ate in many places around hotel no issues staff very helpful no issues at all yeah hotel is fair way from main stripa ction but deuce busstop out the front and that was part of the fun adventure dome was fun for the kids rode coaster 3 times in a row on monday palce was empty but this did mean not all rides were open water slide closed for the week we were there so dont panic we had a grand time kids loved it we loved it ok may not stay there again but only because we would rather be up in middle of strip but if the price was right again we would go back served us well after all you only need a shower and bed in vegas as your never in

Reviews.Title: “Hated the place”
Reviews.Author: Yonkers_au
Reviews.Content: I was booked into Circus Circus for 2 nights. After arriving at hotel, I was promptly hearded to the check-in desk queue. After waiting 30 mins in line, I was given my room. When I got the the room, I found it was an adjoining room, there was absolutely no sound-proofing at all and could hear every conversation from the people in the next room. The room was also very outdated with faded furniture. The lounge chair and the desk had cigarette burns on them. You could not see out of the windows properly as they hadn't been cleaned for quite some time. I also had problems making phone calls. When I called the reception desk for assistance, I was promptly told that it wasn't their problem and was hung up on. The hotel is also quite a distance from the main strip. It's advised to wear comfortable walking shoes or to get a taxi. The best part of the hotel was checking out. As I was checking out at 5:30am it only took 3 mins. Overall, this is one of the worst experiences of any hotel I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, and perfectly good”
Reviews.Author: CB1978
Reviews.Content: Okay so it's not the ritz, but it's a great hotel. And if you're really on a budget they have a motor home part too, but the rooms in the main tower are perfectly reasonably priced and much nicer. The casino is not the best on the strip, but its fine. The hotel has plenty of shopping and food options and a cool amusement park bit if you get sick of losing your money on the slots and fancy winning a few teddy bears - it's supposed to be for the kids but it's great fun for adults too!! The rooms are lovely and the location is great - it's at the end of the strip, but it's not so far down that anywhere is inexcessable. Don't expect any bells and whistles but all the comfort and convenience of any half decent hotel. Best value on the strip I would say.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing wrong with this place!”
Reviews.Author: P&P1978
Reviews.Content: We booked two nights at Circus Circus to attend a convention. The priice was right and the location was ideal. We did NOT come to gamble nor were we on vacation. However, after looking at some of the negative reviews on Trip Advisor, we almost changed our reservations. We saw NOTHING negative here. There was a check in line (15 minutes), but the actual process was efficient and smooth. We had requested a non smoking room with a king bed. No problem! We had a room in the Skyrise tower, 18th floor. Although possibly someone had at one time smoked in the room (One cigarette a year ago would smell), the room was clean, the bath was clean and well equipped, and the bed was more than adequate. Everything worked. We read complaints about the elevators. Our longest wait was maybe 15 seconds. We read complaints about noise. There was NONE. Our room was as quiet as any place we have been. The hotel facilities, while definitely not 5 star, were excellent for the price. While we had only breakfast and a few bar drinks, the restaurants were NOT overpriced, and the food and service was as good as one would want. Many reviews complained about children. There were a few, but most were over 21. NEVER a problem. Our only complaint here had nothing to do with the hotel. By Nevada law, smoking was only allowed in the casino. It seemed that the only way in and out of this, and other hotels as well, was to go through the casino. It was difficult to hold my breath that long. Our experience was very positive. If by chance, you go and end up with an inferior room, simply ask for a better one. They do exist!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: tucsonrissa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Circus Circus during St. Patricks Day and had a really nice stay. The hotel is a bit on the older side but it never stops us from comming back. It is a great value for hotels on the strip. The room was very clean and hotel staff that we incountered were very pleasent. We highly recommend the The Steak House- a bit pricey but the most romantic dinner I have had in years. We are going back this month...

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Destiny0502
Reviews.Content: I heard some BAD things about CC right before leaving...so I was pleasantly surprised. The rooms were clean, the toilets worked just fine, and the staff was just as friendly as can be. We stayed in the West tower and loved our room location. The breakfast buffet wasn't great if you're a picky eater, they have a nice array of food, but it doesn't taste that great. The Steak House was awesome! Be prepared to spend $100 on the meal, but well worth it. Very friendly waiters and great steak!! No problems with check in or check out. They may be far down on the strip, but that's why you pay the great price. :) We are planning another trip to Vegas in August and we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: hoteldivaDallas
Reviews.Content: The tower rooms are nice & clean. Spacious bathroom. Neat hotel, value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: CWJB
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised after reading all the negative reviews. Sure this is not one of the most glamorous or extravagant of the casino hotels on the Strip but if you want that then you are going to pay double or even treble the room rate for a room further up the Strip in one of the newer hotels. We stayed in a standard room which had been recently renovated (new carpets and bed spread). Bathroom was clean with good shower over bath. Our aim was to find somewhere reasonable to sleep on the Strip since we were going to spend most of our awake time travelling to and experiencing all the major casinos/hotels in central Vegas. Circus Circus worked out perfectly for this purpose. We used the Deuce (bus) to travel up and down the strip. $5 a day for a 24hr pass and there is a stop directly outside Circus Circus. Depending on traffic it took about 30 - 45 minutes to go the length of the Strip from Cirus Circus right up to Mandalay Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Very unhappy never again”
Reviews.Author: TARA7
Reviews.Content: we stay in this hotel thinking to would be full of fun, there was my self and my daugther who is 13 ,check in was like being treated like cattle ,when we got up to our room the sheets where dirty and stains all over the head board off my bed (I didnt want to guess what it could have been). To look out the window was hard as there was so much dirt at it you could see out . We asked for a non smoking room but the room and whole hotel smelt like smoke . We also tryed the day spa for the foot spa it was like stepping back in the 60s it cost a $65 us dollars + she wanted a tip . It was the worst foot spa I have every had . I food in the Restaurant was not nice at all for the price we payed for . In the circe game place most of the games where closed down not sure why . We stay for only 2 night becasue I could stand it any long . would never go back to that place ...

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, but qualified.”
Reviews.Author: Paolo01
Reviews.Content: I read lots of reviews on this site and others before finally booking two days at Circus Circus. I have to say up front that I enjoyed my stay and would have no problem recommending the hotel to others who wanted a "Circus Circus" experience. I had no problems with check in. The desk seemed efficient enough and processed our early check in request with no problems. My room was a west tower room (16839 for those that can decipher those things.) The room itself was dated but comfortable (Still have texture coat ceilings). This particular room had two queen sized beds and overlooked the main big top which encloses the adventuredome. You also have a pool view. The bathroom was sufficient but dark. The shower had no light within it and with the curtain closed was very dark. The decor to the room was utilitarian. A bedside table, a phone and alarm clock bolted to that. A desk and chair. There is a safe in the closet. There is WiFi available through COX for a daily fee. There is no mini bar, but that is generally not critical to me. I did miss not having a phone at the desk. So all in all, the room is OK. Check out was very easy using express check out on through the TV. Here is where my problem is with Circus Circus. If you are not gambling or at adventuredome, there is nothing to do here after 2200. All I wanted to do was get a drink with my fiancé and maybe grab some hors d’œuvre. There is nothing available. There are a few bars in the casino with no real seating and no food options and terrible auto mixed drinks, but there in no bar within the casino that you can sit in and simply talk. The 24 hour cafe is available, but really nothing of the quality of a decent casino bar. I walked the casino and promenade floors a few times and asked several employees about food options, receiving only shrugs or apologies. There is no room service available after 12 noon. The only option for room delivery is the pizza parlor within the casino. I am not sure why there is no food offering really in the Circus Circus save for the cafe after 2200. The pool was fun. They are on the small side and again ageing, but sufficient. There is a bar by the pool which again has seen better days and lacks the ability to make real drinks, but it is sufficient and you can get cold beer (if you order before they run out.) There was a hot dog chef outside and there is a snack bar. The pool seemed open to the public as the locking gate was unlocked and seemed to be a thoroughfare of people coming to enjoy the pool. They may have been guests as well. I would stay in Circus Circus again if I wanted to show kids a great time for a day or two. I split my trip this time between Circus Circus and the Wynn (I am not comparing the two in the least. They are different hotel categories). I was ready for a change after two days, however, I enjoyed the two I spent and do believe the hotel is hitting its target audience. On the other hand I really think it is inexcusable to not have a sit down bar which serves at least hors d’œuvre after 2200 or room service. I really believe that for any other audience, there are better options that are more customer oriented.

Reviews.Title: “Was 'OK'”
Reviews.Author: vtcammie
Reviews.Content: Circus Circus is an affordable stay in Vegas. If you are not looking for many amenities and just want a bed to sleep in... Circus Circus is your place! Is a little walk from all the other casinos, so bring your sneakers. Room was clean, that's all that really matters!

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: spiceysam
Reviews.Content: Just returned from staying at Circus Circus and had a great time. Myself and 5 friends from the uk (between the ages 22-35) stayed here. We were a little worried after reading reviews. But we had nothing to worry about everything was fine. When booking in we were given lots of room options, we all had great views from the rooms (Strip & Stratosphere Hotel) The rooms were all very clean and the maids were great (we tipped $1 a day) The lifts were quite busy at morning and evening but didnt have to wait too long for the next one. The buffet restaurant is great value $11 for breakfast (£5.50 pp) Lots of choice eg. scrambled egg, bacon, sausage, corned beef hash, hash browns, french toast, pancakes, waffles, fruit, cereal, muffins, donuts, cakes etc Garden Grill for evening meal, prepare yourself they are massive meals. My partner and i would often share two starters for our meal (waffle fries and chilli & popcorn chicken) this would cost about $10 for both of us to eat and you get so much that we were full. The casinos are great in the hotel, any drink you want whilst playing eg. Corona, Bud, Vodka and mixer, water, pina colada, baileys etc from cocktail waitress just tip them a dollar note or chip and they will return with next drink within ten mins. You dont even have to be playing alot realy you could just sit at a 5c machine and they will ask you. Deuce bus stop outside hotel(slot of fun part of circus circus) this bus travells on the strip to every hotel, buy a $5 ticket and u can travel all day on any bus. Dont worry bout missing stop the bus driver has microphone and announces every stop. If possible try not to go out till later in the evening as this is when it is busy and alot more fun on table games, Often we would be going to bed at 1am and the hotel would just be getting busy. If you are goin try and go for more than a week, we went for 6 days and this was no way long enough, their is so much to see. Go and see the Bellagio Fountains (wow) Ceasers paalce, new york new york, paris etc You could spend a day in each one. For those of you who like shopping, shopping mall near wynn hotel (bus stop outside) its massive. Big catwalk in middle of mall, models showing clothes you can buy in mall. hope you find these tips usefull. Any questions im happy to help with

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: rollergirljoey
Reviews.Content: Massive, great hotel. We had a really good time. Free circus acts all night, free cocktails and beers on the slots, the adventure dome is such good fun and the day pass is great value - must have gone on the roller coaster bout 30 times in that day - no ques! Room was massive in the tower, looking over the Stratesphere. Wasn't too keen on the purple/green theme stretching out to th erooms as well, but the room condition was great. Hotel is at the north of the strip, but a short walk from all the other hotels and a great shopping mall. We had a really good time. If you do spend the night at this hotel, be sure to check out the sports bar by the slot machines, the staff are great and really made out stay! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: mshelluva
Reviews.Content: I wasn't really sure what to expect with all of the negative reviews I had read but I must say we had a wonderful time. I took my 10-year old son and 71-year old mother. My son loved having the arcade, circus and McDonald's right above the casino as did I . I could give him his independence as well as have him close enough to check up on him. Granted we were at the end of the strip but already knew that and was okay with it since I had my son. He also loved the indoor amusement park. The food to my mother and I was just okay even though my son loved it, but the experience as a whole was great and my son is already asking to go back. I felt I definitely got more than my money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Depressing Rooms and Dingy Halls”
Reviews.Author: callong
Reviews.Content: Old, tired and depressing hotel. We checked in because I was given a free room...we checked out a few hours later. Because I like to gamble, I thought I'd save on at least the room part, but couldn't stomach the place. There was mold on the bathroom wall in our room. The rooms looked like an old residence hotel you'd rent by the week in a run-down part of town. The clientele is definately "Wal Mart' shoppers. If you have kids then you probably have a reason for staying here, but if you don't and you're just looking to stay cheaply...check in with low expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pctravler
Reviews.Content: The kids loved staying here. We rented two rooms in the tower and I was supprised they were so nice.Each room had been updated.I am really surprised at the reviews here and I almost cancelled the reservation. I would stay here again.There are alot of kids running around and they tend to cater more toward families.However, we had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “good if you have kids”
Reviews.Author: Ellis40
Reviews.Content: There have been some bad reviews on here that I can't agree with but I would say don't stop here unless you have kids or want to be surrounded by them. I was with a 12yr old and a 10yr old and they loved it (the pool, the arcade and the amusement park), I will not stop here again unlss I am with children. However taking this on board, the rooms were excellent and clean, the checkin line was long but moved quickly but the rooms were a long way from checkin. The buffet is good for breakfast but didn't eat there at night so can't comment.

Reviews.Title: “This place needs to go”
Reviews.Author: smee3469
Reviews.Content: Because of the Halloween Holiday, we were limited with our hotel options... we ended up going with the Circus Circus because of price. I knew this wasn't going to be an ideal stay, but I just didn't know how bad... Rather than go into explicit detail, bottom line, the room wasn't cleaned when we went into the room (complete with the previous guests party "leftovers"). We complained (and showed pictures on our camera phone) to the manager, who then upgraded us to a king suite (which, frankly, wasn't much better or bigger than the average room). The hallways smelled of cigarette smoke, and there were kids EVERYWHERE. Just an awful, awful place. I see no redeeming qualities to this hotel whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: mastercoop
Reviews.Content: After reading so many negative reviews of CC Vegas, I was bit wary of what I would find. I must say that I was not unhappy at all. Sure, it is an older hotel but that is part of the charm. It is disheartening to see many of the older Vegas hotels being demolished because the history goes with them. CC is crowded during the day with many families (if you don't like children...don't go) all looking for fun of one type or another. It was a fairly good short vacation. Just for the record, I did not see a single roach (or any other insect for that matter) during the entire visit. The staff was wonderful and the room was clean and fresh (non-smoking). The only thing that would have helped was a coffee maker in the room. Oh, stayed in the skyrise tower, not manor. Great view!! Go ahead, give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: Joney-Blett
Reviews.Content: I was very worried when my in-laws told us that they had booked the Circus Circus for a short break in March (we had previously stayed at the Riviera and loved it). I read the reviews and was expecting (amongst other things) a smelly, dark, sticky, static, under-staffed hotel overrun by unsupervised children and staffed by crooks. I can categorically say that we experienced none of the problems listed in all the reviews from 2005 and 2006 that I read on Trip Advisor. I don't deny that it is a crowded hotel at the end of the Strip and has a lot of children staying - but come on, the clue is in the name? You're going to see a lot of children and you can tell before you go that it's at the end of the Strip. The rooms were clean and comfortable and well maintained - we had a problem with a light in our shower and a maintenance man was there to fix it practically before we'd put the phone down! The buffet was phenomenal, I have never seen such a range of food and it was always hot and beautifully presented. We do not gamble and come to Vegas for other reasons so I can't comment on the casino, but it was pretty busy from what we could see. Checking in and out was quick and efficient and we were able to extend our stay for the last day so that we kept our rooms for a small fee before we flew home. It's right to say that the hotel is quite old and is not the flashiest one on the Strip. You're not paying for that - you're paying for value for money, clean and comfortable rooms. I do think that people should tailor their expectations to what they pay for. I had no problem with Circus Circus at all - and my partner and I have travelled a lot in the US and Canada to varying standards of hotels.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Roeland Park, KS, a KC suburb
Reviews.Title: “Older hotel, but pretty good value”
Reviews.Author: Joan A
Reviews.Content: Good rates, older hotel but very clean and in good condition. Only problem was the elevators for the north tower were slow- it took us about 15 minutes for an elevator to come that wasn't full at 11 am- check out time.

Reviews.Title: “Well Past Its Day”
Reviews.Author: LabsTimesTwo
Reviews.Content: I can't say too many good things here. On the upside, the front desk was quick and helpful (unlike other reviews). I got in late the first night and slept (or rather didn't sleep) in a very smoky "non-smoking" room that was well past its prime. Carpet was old, bathroom was old, everything was old. The front desk did change me to another room the next night which was marginally better, as long as I aired it out all day. (I switched to the Monte Carlo Resort and Casino for the remainder of my stay, which was great.) The pool was actually empty -- no water at all. The property, unfortunately, is surrounded by empty lots and construction, and is far from the lively part of the Strip. It is old and worn, and is very much due for an upgrade. Perhaps it's still fun for the younger set (as in younger than 14), but with no pool.... I would not, at this time, recommend this hotel. Hopefully they have some future renovations in mind?

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: charl&paul
Reviews.Content: After staying in this hotel in May 2005, we can not understand all the negative reviews about this hotel. We stayed in the manor rooms, two adults, three children aged between 10 & 17, The rooms were cleaned to a high standard daily. The casino was cleaned at least twice a day from what we saw morning and night. The staff were very friendly and great facilities for the kids ours never got bored. We asked for a none smoking room and thats what we got to. the security at the hotel was very good and we felt very safe at all times in the hotel and grounds. Food in the buffet was very good. Casino wasnt too bad for paying out we had been to several that were tight payout machines. over all an excellent hotel and we would deffinatley stay there again. If you want a hotel that is child friendley then stay here we highly recomend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “We will never stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: lmdj
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in March of 2007. Our biggest complaint with this place is the time share people. We were hassled by them several times a day. They are at the front entrance, in the middle, and at the lobby entrance. VERY annoying to be stopped by these people. We visited several other hotels and casinos along the strip and were not approached by any time share people at all. Also, very crowded with lots of kids, especially on the weekend. Even at 2am, there are people pushing strollers and dragging their children around! We did not like the location, had to walk quite a distance to get to any nice shopping, shows, and other casinos and hotels. I would suggest buying a bus pass, $5 to ride for 24 hours. We were told our room was on a non-smoking floor, yet when we walked into our room we detected a stale smoke smell, as well as an ashtray on the desk. One good thing about this hotel is the steak house, it's a little pricy, but the meal was outstanding. We would go here again to eat at the steak house, but never again to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Circus Circus - not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Gonhols
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel. We had stayed in the Signature MGM and had a lovely stay and moved to Circus Circus to enjoy a cheaper stay and explore top end of strip. Don't is all I can say - its better to pay the slight extra and stay anywhere else. The rooms are tired, the casino and restaurants are tacky and the service was the worst - We got charged a $1 per room for local phone calls that we were not told about and when we tried to complain the receptionist Diana hung up on me! - she knew we were checking out and wanted to be quick and therefore would not chase the $1 - shame on the MGM brand - it does you no justice - oh and hire nicer staff!

Reviews.Title: “The Greatest Circus of them all”
Reviews.Author: BlazinsoulQ
Reviews.Content: I might as well tell you first of all Circus Circus is a wonderful place to stay with your children. You can actually let them run free and they have plenty to do to keep them busy. My wife and i went together without the children and we had a ball. We took part in the the circus show and even bought a one day ticket to the rides that are in the hotel. The rooms i must say were average but there wasn't much i can say bad about it. The one thing that i did not like was that they did not have cable, but who goes to Las Vegas to sit in there room. The check in and the check out was perfect and quick. And you can believe there was enough food. Mcdonalds for the kids, and many adult restaurants. I must say that if you are going there to gamble then you can enjoy your time there, but if you are going there to win. You need to travel by bus to Freedmont Street. Well that is about it enjoy your stay, because I did. Oh yea make sure that you ask for a room in one of the towers.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Circus”
Reviews.Author: tongoola
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Circus Circus in my late twenties and thought it was a bargain. Now in my mid-thirties, I stayed again last week and it was a nightmare. Forget fun surreality or kitsch value - the place is a just a weird dump. Not only is the physical plant in desperate need of updating but you have to fight your way through crowds of dead-eyed multi-generational families (and I meant that - somethimes it looks like three or four generations) to get anywhere in the maze of a place. People flog cheap crap at you from every direction. The cocktail waitresses look and talk like Lunch Lady Doris from the Simpsons. The vending machines steal your money and about a quarter of the elevators that went to my floor were working. The rooms themselves are fine. Average motel style, if run down, but nothing to make you run screaming. Cheap bedding, carpet, drapes, TV, etc. but could be worse. I didn't see any bugs. So the bottom line? If I was in my twenties and really wanted to party in Vegas I wouldn't hesitate. Or I suppose if I had children that I didn't care about being corrupted by exposure to a smelly, seedy, ugly den of sin and couldn't afford any better. Otherwise no chance. Never. Under no circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Been in better”
Reviews.Author: Steveigb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at CC this month and got what i expected. First things first. its cheaper to take a taxi from airport if there are more than 2 of you. Shuttle is $6 each where a taxi is $12-13 and much quicker. 1st impression is what other people have said, reception is dull and dosent give a good first impression. Check in seemed to take forever, only 2 people on desk and not very helpfull. A map would have helped when checking in to show you where to go to your rooms, as you can easily get lost untill you get your bearings. Rooms were dated and needed a lick of paint. Could hardly see out of window, god knows when they were last cleaned. Bottle tops were still under bed from last guests. Safe didn`t work, after numerous calls to reception and sat waiting for at least an hour, we gave up. Buffett was not up to much, and a little on the expensive side. Overall it was just a place to sleep and nothing else. If going again i would deffinatly stop somewhere else. Its located at the far end of the strip. Best option is to get a 24 hr $5 Deuce bus pass which allows you to travel up and down the the strip as you like, just hop on and off as you wish. It was worth the money just to listen to some of the story`s the drivers come out with. It also gets you to both outlet centres at the top and bottom end of LV.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Shabby Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth D
Reviews.Content: Overall, the hotel was run-down. Our room was reasonably clean, but the public areas (hallways, bathrooms, elevators, etc) were visibly dirty in the corners, hard-to-reach places, behind things, under things, and so on. The bed was very uncomfortable -- I could feel every spring through the thin mattress and threadbare sheets. I think the mattress had been in use since the 70s. The shower had almost no water pressure, and the water never got hot -- it was lukewarm at best. The sink, on the other hand, was very hot even on the coldest setting...so we drew our drinking water from the tub. Likewise, the hotel's outdoor hot tub was only mildly warm -- very disappointing, because I wanted to soak my feet after walking up and down the strip, and I couldn't do it in the bath tub since the bath water wasn't hot... In our 18-story tower, the ice machines on only TWO floors were in working order. What a pain in the butt. The good thing about Circus Circus is that it's on the strip, though it's at the far end. It's a long walk to Treasure Island, the Luxor, etc. It's walkable if you're in good shape and have comfortable shoes. If not, there's a bus stop very close, and for $5 you can ride the bus up and down the strip for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “No problems wit CCLV”
Reviews.Author: RN29
Reviews.Content: We arrived at around 2am. No wait for check in. Given the room keys, told both rooms were ns kings. Arrived to the first room, which was a ns double. No problem there because we actually needed a ns double and a ns king. The rooms were fine. They are your typical 3 star accomodations. The room decor is a little old, could use a little updating. But the room was clean. Video check out was a breeze and convient. Overall excellent value for only $57 bucks on a Sat night in vegas on the strip. Plus this was St. Patricks day and March Madness!! Not a complaint from me.

Reviews.Title: “I think it's super!”
Reviews.Author: karlio2020
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 3 nights in February 2007 and really enjoyed our experience, the staff were very polite and helpful. However, when checking in there was a bit of a queue, but once being served the service was speedy. The hotel room was more than large enough for two people, we had a room in the Skyrise Tower, which consisted of two double beds, of which we only used one. A large bathroom with a shower - which was more than adequate, the room was clean and spacious and well maintained. There was a coin operated safe in the room which I found most helpful. We only ate at the Circus Breakfast Buffet, but being from England and out first time in Vegas, we found this quite amazing and really good value for money and the food choice was pretty amazing, needless to say we put a little weight on! Ha! The location of the hotel wasn't really an issue for us as it seemed to be for some people it may take all of 10-15mins to reach the Venetian if that, and is quite accessible by bus! We also didn't have any issues with kids. Overall, super and we would stay again as we really enjoyed, this hotel is obviously a classic and deserves better reviews than its getting. Oh and most importantly... there's a 24hr Krispy Kreme.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than we expected.”
Reviews.Author: millerism
Reviews.Content: Just spent four nights at Circus Circus with a group of eight women (no kids along, thank you!) and after reading other reviews we were all pleasantly surprised. The staff were friendly and efficient, the rooms were clean, and because school was in session there were not too many stray children underfoot. We got plenty of free meals using slot card comps and had no complaints about quantity or quality. We liked the location because it was easy to take short bus trips to the north strip, the south strip or downtown. (The machine next door at Slots-A-Fun for buying daily bus passes was very convenient.) We did have one major complaint, but it's not likely to affect anyone else for a long time. We arrived on the day that the Stardust was being demolished next door, and being from Chicago knew nothing about it. The fireworks woke us at 2:30am. When the entire building shook we looked out our 34th floor window. There were sirens, explosions and hundreds of screaming people running away from huge clouds of smoke! We tried calling the switchboard but got no answer. When we got to the elevator the smoke alarms were going off followed by a recording saying that the "source of the problem was being investigated." Because it looked like a fire or a terrorist attack my 80 year-old mother wanted to start down the stairs, but we took a chance on the elevator. It was only at the ground floor that we found out what was really happenning. It was frightening and extremely stressful. With so many out-of-town visitors coming in that day, management should have had the forethought to advise people at check-in.

Reviews.Title: “las time i stayed here”
Reviews.Author: Klaas
Reviews.Content: we did a trip starts from vegas ends in vegas, spend most of the time in canyon land. we arrived at the orleans hotel, this is really great a great hotel, perfect service good food etc.. our last night we like to stay on the strip to walk around, and circus is a good place for that, room are ok, price is ok. I'm not in gambling so I like to stay in my room at night and my wife spend some time (and money) in the casino, but the TV stations are very (real bad) limited. We took a buffet breakfast that’s ok, the night meal we like to use the Casino restaurant, this is realy a bad place, the food is ok, not that good, but ok. Service is bad bad bad ! the only time I did not tip the waiter, it is not only the waiter it is the hole organisation in this restaurant, less people ?? I don’t know but it was a mess. So next time it will be starting at Orleans and ending in Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Jonno82
Reviews.Content: Same as many others who have had read about Circus Circus here before, I was VERY anxious about submitting my reservation to CC, but eventually I've decided to give it a go as my trip could not go as planned and I had to arrive Vegas one day early, being a Saturday, I don't want to spend too much money for hotel for that night as I have already planned out my stay. I've paid 100 dollars in total for Saturday night, and my experience had been quite pleasant! When I booked on the hotel's website, I've booked a non-smoking room with 2 queen beds in the west tower as many have had suggested, however, as I was travelling by myself, I've put in a request that I'd prefer a non-smoking King bed or if non-smoking rooms are not available, at least I want a King bed. I took a shuttle to CC after I arrived, first impression of the hotel is that it is a bit old and dark, but hey, did I mention it was only 100 bucks for Saturday?? Cynthia at check-in was quite funny, made a joke about my FCUK shirt and everybody had a good laugh, I got a room in the main tower, it was a non-smoking King, so I didn't really bother with trying to get into west tower. It only took 20minutes between queueing up and arrive into my room. When I entered my room, there weren't any horrible smell or traces of filth anywhere. It smelt like a normal non-smoking room! I was on the 9th floor, even I didn't get a room with strip view, I still can see the stratosphere tower from my window, which i was quite satisfied. The bed was reasonably clean and comfortable, shower was clean, everything was quite satisfying from my point based on the rate I've paid. However there were some rooms for improvement, as many others have mentioned, the walls were very thin and totally not sound proof, there were only a few child running, which didn't bother me at all, but the sound of showering from all rooms around me (including the floor above me) was quite annoying. The lighting for the hallway and lobby could have been brighter. Also the in-room safe costs you 50c every time you use it. The location wasn't a problem for me as I enjoy walking up and down the strip looking at the view and different hotels, it was great. Although people handing out little flyers for strippers were a bit annoying, but they are quite harmless, every now and then you'll encounter some crazy drunks that'll yell from their car etc etc, but it was all good. Overall I think CC is a good place to stay if you are travelling on a budget, otherwise, if you expect 5 star facility and service, here's a hint, stay at a 5 star hotel!!!! (which I did, I've then stayed at Bellagio and the Platinum for the rest of my stay, my review will be up very soon) As I'm still traveling, I hope to put up some photos I've taken at CC to show others my experience.

Reviews.Title: “would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: cjmm3
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Circus Circus for 3 nights in early December/2006. It is truely a run down/in need of updating in the hotel department. First of all the check in process was long-had trouble locating our reservation(we went there on a promotional deal from a previously visited timeshare presentation-airfare not included). I had called twice the week before to confirm this reservation and to request a room in the "tower" which I was assured by the reservation department. When we arrived we were told there were no regular rooms available in the tower! (did not want to stay in the older part after reading bad reviews). The only other tower option was to upgrade to a mini suite for an additional $100.00 for the three nights so we reluctantly agreed to this. The reservation person did ask if we minded room #666 which we agreed to as she stated this was the only one available. This was clearly a mistake once we arrived to our room! First of all our window looked directly across at another wallon the adjacent building and on the roof between these two buildings was what appeared to be a dead/decomposed rat! The window frame on the inside of the room was full of dead flies and other bugs from the window being opened(the only relief from the musty stale smoke oder that permiated the room-and we smoke!) We bought room deodorizer to spray the room. The wallpaper was peeling in some spots,the bed mattress was absolutely terrible(sagging,could feel the springs in spots),only gave 2 almost flat pillows,carpet stained and dirty appearing,and the cushioned headboard had several burn holes in it. On our last morning after showering what appeared to be a baby cockroach crawled out from behind a picture! The vendings machines didn't work properly and kept our money to get some chips and soda. Every time you went downstairs there were timeshare people located in two different locations hounding you-even if you just walked past them 2 minutes before! Another couple told us to tell them that you were leaving that day(that way they don't continue to pester you as long as there is no time to schedule an appointment). The buffet there was okay-nothing special-we used our points we earned from their players club to eat there three times so be sure to register for the players club there. Checkout was a long process due to very long lines and what appeared to be inadequately staffed reception area-took almost 25 minutes! The better part of our trip was the one day that we went to Red Rock Canyon early in the morning-got there at 6am when they opened and saw a very picturesque sunrise as we drove through the park-stopped and took pictures at several spots. Then on to Hoover Dam for the tour which was great and a stop at a couple of the local casinos on the way back to Las Vegas. Was glad we rented a car while we were there so we could do this.(got a great rate on a Priceline bid)

Reviews.Title: “Old and tired; lots of kids”
Reviews.Author: yukontraveler
Reviews.Content: This is out of the mainstream of current Vegas. Near the end of the strip, it is an aging and tired place. Lots of kids. Lots. The rooms are tired Holiday Inn-type rooms (at least in the Manor Rooms) with little of anything new. Old TV (mine did not work), a mini-fridge oddly stuck off in the corner, clock (bolted down), TV (bolted down), wireless internet only (but work fine), few electrical outlets, walls are thin and its a long walk outdoors across a parking lot to the main building(s). The bed was ok, linens were standard motel issue that had some life left, towels were standard motel thin white and bleached (heavily)accordingly. All the public areas have seen heavy use and better days. On the plus side - the room was cheap (for todays Vegas rates) and the buffett is still about $11 for lunch (again cheap for todays Vegas). Still, I can't help thinking I was on the fringe of everything. A cab is required to everywhere (except maybe McDonalds), and guys you can wear those hats back home in the neighborhood but clean it up a little when in town and as for the hotel management maybe you should add a decent bar. Overall; cheap place to crash, an ok place to take kids and not worry that they will break the artwork and they have reasonable cheap food but if you are looking for a nice getaway for two don't even go near it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it...”
Reviews.Author: gp7
Reviews.Content: Sure, the place is not luxurious...but what do you expect when you're paying so little? I went with a group of friends. We are all college students, so you can imagine our budget. We decided to stay at Circus Circus because it was cheap. Since we weren't gonna spend much time in our room, it didn't matter that it wasn't full of luxuries. The staff is great. They are always willing to help no matter how busy they are. A lot of people dislike Circus Circus because it is at the north end of the strip and all the popular attractions are at the south end. However, there is a double-decker bus named the Deuce that travels up and down the strip 24hrs a day and you can buy a 24hour pass for only $5. It is a great way to get around in Vegas. If you want a nice, economic hotel...stay at the Circus Circus.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service & buyer beware”
Reviews.Author: obvious_epiphanies
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Circus Circus before, found the hotel okay given the price. Decided to stay there again due to an on-line promotion. Made 2 separate reservations quoting the same on-line offer as we planned to stay in Vegas for a few days before heading South to Phoenix. Part of the on-line offer is free $ for slot machines. When I returned from Phoenix, we didn't get to stay in the hotel tower that I paid deposits for, plus we were given a room that hasn't been cleaned at all!! We have to lug our luggage all the way back and hoped to talk to the night supervisor about the issue. Unfortunately, he/she wasn't around, so we got our "help" from one of the front desk person. We told her what happened, instead of getting any form of apology, we were told that "it happens". Eventually we were given another room but not after she gave us the "take it or leave it attitude". What kind of service quality is that? Is there really a shortage of labour in Vegas? I travelled a lot and have not experienced attitude like this before. The next debacle was when I tried to claim the "free $ for the slot machines", I was told that they can't give it to me because they honored the offer the week before and they can only honor the next one in 30 days. However, nothing was stated on the website when I made my reservations. Nothing was printed on the voucher either, except that they have "Management reserve all rights". With that sentence, I guess they can put in whatever time restrictions they want. Well, I learned my lesson, when something seems too good to be true, it may very well be. BUYER BEWARE.

Reviews.Title: “Well - what more do you want!”
Reviews.Author: DarrenBailes
Reviews.Content: Ill start by saying, that if your going to Vegas and intend on spending that much time in your hotel, why are you bothering? The hotel charged us something like £25 a nite when we were there both times - and i feel they got ripped off. We went just after the million dollar refit and the rooms were fantastic - with a strip view, looking out onto vegas at night was tremendous. The rooms were huge and room service was excellent - the bathroom was bigger than some NYC hotel rooms Ive stayed in, and the shower was ace ( i like a good shower) The Steak House restaurant is easily the best I have ever been too - will huge portions for a tiny price. The staff were alright, just seemed rushed off their feet - but the place is always heaving so to be expected. If you want luxury, dont stay here. If you want a nice, clean, simple and stuipidly cheap place to stay - then this is your boy... People may say its at the wrong end of the strip, but with taxi's pulling up every second and helpful doorstaff, who cares??? Loved it and will always retun here

Reviews.Title: “What Do You Want For 30 Quid A Night?”
Reviews.Author: jools186
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at C C, ok its dated, the casino and check in have seen better days and yes , there's lots of kids there.(HELLO, the clue is in the hotel name!!!) On the advice of previous TA reviewers we requested a room in the West Tower which we had stayed in in 2006 which we were given with no fuss. Our room was fine' Lifts were fine, most of the staff were helpful even at really busy times.We didn't eat there as we had had done on our previous visit, not because there was anything wrong with the food ( The Steakhouse is superb.) but because there are a million and one other restaurants in Vegas to try. Check out the Peppermill, their burgers are awesome! OK the hotel is at the end of the Strip,but as long as you are able bodied it is within reasonable walking distance of some of the nicer hotels,(Wynn, Treasure Island, Mirage,Venetian) and the Fashion Show Mall. If you dont want to walk the buses run all day up and down the strip. So if you are on a budget and not expecting Bellagio service and style for around £30 a night, give CC a whirl, after all we only really used it as a base to wash and sleep in. There's far too much going on in Vegas to spend all your time sleeping and sunbathing.!! Just dont go there if you're a Moaning Minnie!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wont Ever Stay There Again.”
Reviews.Author: dawgpound550
Reviews.Content: this is a really old hotel and worse its a really poorly desgined hotel. if you get dropped off on the Vegas strip side, be prepared to walk a mile to get to the lobby because its on the opposite side of the hotel. The hotel lobby was crowded and we waited about 30 minutes in line. we got to our room which appearance wise was ok, but the tv was like a 13" and you only get selected channels ( we were there just before the NBA all star game and i wanted to watch TNT in our room but the channel was not available). The worst thing i think about the room is that the walls are really REALLY thin. you can pretty much hear everything going on around you. someone above us was coughing all night and our family members who stayed next door to us thought it was us!! when people walk, you can hear, when people talk, you can hear, when people go to the bathroom, you can hear. our bathroom shower leaked for some reason our toilet would "bubble up" every so often and give off a stench. on the positive, the buffet and other restaraunts in the hotel were'nt too bad, and the rides and games in adventuredome (i think thats what it was called) were actually pretty fun. this isnt enough though for me to ever stay there again. with so many hotels to choose from, ill go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cailinalainn1
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went to Las Vegas last April for the first time and stayed in Circus Circus. We had the most amazing trip, Las Vegas is without doubt one of the greatest cities in the world and we were more than hapy with our stay at this hotel, rooms were clean, air-contioned, more than adequate for 2 young girls and the price was extremely reasonable. The hotel is aimed at families with young kids but don't be put off we didn't experience the usual annoyances that come with a hotel full of kids, in fact we didn't really notice they were there! Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good room”
Reviews.Author: sixofone
Reviews.Content: What we needed was a clean, spacious and comfortable room for our stay in Vegas. And that's just what we got. The maid service was excellent too. We stayed in the West Tower, 6th floor. The only drawback was the long walk from our room to the front entrance of the hotel, via smoky casinos, negotiating what felt like hundreds of people in the fairly narrow walkways. But long walks seem to be the norm. The public areas all looked a bit tired, but I can't fault our room. Although the hotel is quite a long way up the Strip, there are regular buses from just outside, so no problem there.

Reviews.Title: “About what I expected”
Reviews.Author: DrNeil
Reviews.Content: my wife, daughter,mother in law, and I stayed at Circus Circus Las Vegas in early Feb 2007. I was attending a conference at the Hilton and thought it would be good to ha0==ve my daughter near some entertainment for herself. Check in was easy and they let us check in several hours early. The Hotel itself is about what I expected. A bit tired, but clean enough. It was loud at nights, with a lot of kids running the hallways. You could also hear showers from other rooms adjacent to us. Room service was only in the mornings from 6-noon - very lame. The beds were very soft and didn't allow me good rest. The Circus entertainment area for kids was pretty good and my daughter was happy. My wife had concerns on the casino floor, which were dismissed at first by the managers, but they eventually saw their error and gave us some comp at the Steak House in the Hotel. Excellent food and well worth the price! I doubt I would stay here again, it would be worth the extra money to stay elsewhere and have better service, a quieter facility, and a more secure environment.

Reviews.Title: “Won't go there again”
Reviews.Author: travelqueen73
Reviews.Content: It was affordable and the inside amusement park seemed like a good idea but the hotel, casino and location - gross, gross and scary. The pool was dirty, the place had a smell of mildew or something - won't EVER go back to that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was not bad.”
Reviews.Author: Pakaleka
Reviews.Content: It was not bad. It was not the hotel room from hell that we had been led to fear based on reviews here and on other web sites. The experience started with about a five-minute wait to check in; we arrived at about 11:30AM, and our room was available for us. The desk clerk was polite. All the elevators were working. The room was large; it was clean. The furnishings were not new. The bed was harder than I would have preferred. When we got up to the room, there were only two bath towels for the two of us (my wife and me). The room maid was in the hallway making up another room. She happily provided us with two extra towels and a shower cap, which was apparently not standard issue. The television worked fine, but there was a limited selection of channels. I guess the hotel owners in Las Vegas do not want you sitting in your room watching TV. There was no in-room coffee, as I expected, but I would have liked. The room on the 11th floor looked south over the demolition debris of the old Stardust casino/hotel. On Sunday that was no problem. On Monday a horn sounded loudly at 6:30AM, and the beeping of the excavators and trucks demolishing the Stardust started. And continued. We were in Las Vegas to meet family members. My sister was there for a convention. She and my mother were staying at Treasure Island. So we spent more of our time there, and little at Circus-Circus. We did go to the breakfast buffet at Circus-Circus and thought it was a good deal for the money. The food was OK, and there was plenty of it. We had gone to the buffet at the Mirage, which cost twice as much. The Mirage had a wide variety of foods besides breakfast, like roast meats, Mexican, Italian, Japanese etc. But it cost twice as much as Circus-Circus, and you can only eat so much. We had a drink at the bar at the Circus-Circus steakhouse. We went there to get away from the casino noise, and it was a nice respite. When originally making the reservation at Circus-Circus, I booked the room through the airline we flew to get there. The first night was about $150.00 the rest about $45.00 per night. This was in contrast with $250.00 per night every night at most of the newer Las Vegas Strip hotel/casinos and $850.00 per night available at Bellagio. My wife checked the Circus-Circus web site viewed the rooms online. She contacted them to get a better room. She was informed that, because I had booked through the airline, we could not upgrade. So she cancelled the airline booking and booked directly through the hotel. It cost a few dollars more per night ($54.00 per night for the weeknights), but felt it was worth it. We have no horror story to tell. We feel that you will be taken care of better if you reserve a room directly through the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: JRAManchester
Reviews.Content: We were dreading staying at this hotel after reading the reviews. Having stayed earlier in the year at the luxor I felt the circus circus had more facilities on site and more entertainment for the children. The staff were friendly the hotel was nice (admitidely not the best on the strip) but comfortable. The entertainment and dinning at this hotel is excellent and we are returning to this hotel again this year with 15 family members in Feb 2007 we enjoyed it that much. Family from Manchester, England

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: UkHead
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel ever!!!!!!!!!!! First impression as we walked in the hotel: Stained, dirty carpet. O.K., we can let that slide. We register and go to our Manor room. We walked into filth. The bed was a mess and there was trash all over the room. I called down to let the staff know about the situation. They offered to send someone to clean but I just wanted to leave because both of us were ready to throw-up. They sent us to another room where we were told security would be waiting to open our door. You would think that someone would have been embarrassed and would have taken care of this problem in a hurry. Instead it took three phone calls from the house phone and over a half hour wait before we were let in our room. Impressions as we walked to the fitness room: To call it a maze may be an understatement. O.K., we can let that slide. We could see down to the pools. Pristine, with clear blue water? More like mucky with a milky white consistency. At one point we were greeted by a few dead 1-inch cockroaches and the pleasant aroma of freshly spayed cockroach spray. In the fitness center the machine I wanted to use had its cable completely broken. The least they could have done was put an out of order sign on it. Other impressions: A struggle to get bath towels. Frustrated employees (the maid showed me her cart with no towels). Tons of rubbish outside the doors to the manors. Grimy elevators that scarcely worked. An incredible trek from the manors to the main building. Traveller's tip on saving a few bucks If you decide to stay at this dump to save a few bucks, be prepared. Read the all the reviews and know that they are real. On the other hand, you might be one of the small minority that actually enjoys the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus Is A Joke”
Reviews.Author: ramik
Reviews.Content: We had one bad experience after another. The maid used our toilet (#2) and did not flush. As strange as it may sound, she also took a nap in our bed while we were out for the day. The front desk did not care at all. The towels were stained yellow and had a bad smell. We were there for five days and never had a clean smelling white towel. How would you like that after washing your hair???? The problems went on throughout the trip. It was not a very pleasant experience. I would have checked out the first day if I was not with a group of other people. On the last day of the stay, I was missing two boxes and my coffee maker that I take with me. I asked the maid if she saw it and she insisted that she did'nt. I went down stairs to complain and of course they did not care. I went straight back up to my room and found what I was looking for outside my door. "And the maid said she did not take it". YEAH RIGHT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Circus Circus is just terrible and should not be in business.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: UrbanAngel5
Reviews.Content: Circus circus isn't a patch on the Bellagio or the Venetian or anything but it is still good and better value for money! The rooms are spacious and comfortable. Huge hotel of course and easy to get loss. Only problem we had was the gift shops etc don't open very early and they ALL close in the evening. Bit of a nuisance. Lots of hustle and bustle, it's like a small community. Not very relaxing and easy to feel lost but thats Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Mike_Thompson
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Las Vegas and we wanted to stay a little "budget" yet still on the strip so we chose the Circus. After reading other reviews I was pleasantly surprised to find that the place really wasn't that bad after all. To be fair, the hotel could use a serious make over but we found it more than adequate accommodation. The room was clean and we liked that we could use the RV park's laundry facilities which saved us a bit of $. The only thing we didn't really like was the location as it was a little too far up the strip for our liking. All in all though, if you are looking at accommodation and have a limited budget, don't be too put off as Circus Circus is fine. Oh yeah and .99c Heinekin at Slots of Fun next door!

Reviews.Title: “cheap and tacky but who cares!!!!”
Reviews.Author: who_de_man
Reviews.Content: we stayed there for 4 nights and paid the grand total of 5 packets of crisps and some chewed bubble gum - there is no-where on the strip that will cost you less!!!! if you are wanting luxury forget it, this place is most definitely not for you. However if you are like us, 5 lads on tour, then this is THE place. I think we had 3 rooms for 4 nights at around $40 per room per night - which is peanuts compared to most other places on the strip. We used Circus Circus for a base and spent all of our time elsewhere - mostly in the other casinos which i must say are fantastic, especially compared to this place!! The bell boys are top drawer, hardly ever waited for a cab. The main problem for me were the carpets - or at least i think it was the carpets. After walking anywhere within the hotel/casino for any period of time we seemed to become fully charged with static, i'm guessing due to the cheap carpets - so whenever we touched the metal bannisters or lift buttons we got an electric shock - which was entertaining at first, but the 'novelty' soon wore off!! oh yeah, and another thing, the cocktail waitresses are rank!!! no frills

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Frogberto
Reviews.Content: We have a one year old, and called around, and found Circus Circus cheaper than even Motel Six. Suprisingly, the staff were gracious, and the rooms were very nice. We didn't see much of the entertainment, but with low expectations, we were pleasantly surprised, especially considering the price.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Muffie79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Circus Circus this past month for a friends birthday. I wasn't looking forward to going to this hotel because all I could think of was tacky clowns everywhere, but to my surprise, there were no clowns in the hotel and everything was decorated very nicely. The casino downstairs was great and we stayed there and played most of the time. We also ate breakfast at the restaurant downstairs and it was one of the best meals I've ever had. The only complaint I had was that our beds weren't terribly comfortable, but they weren't too bad. The bathrooms were clean and the rooms were decorated tastefully. The lobby of the hotel is very pretty, with beautiful ceilings that reminded me of the sky. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is wanting a good deal with a fun atmosphere that is tasteful.

Reviews.Title: “Along for the ride”
Reviews.Author: cedargirl
Reviews.Content: Was asked to go to Las Vegas with girlfriends who got a buy one get one free offer. They decided on Circus Circus. Our rooms where connecting which came in handy. My room had no remote for the TV they had 2. There were no nobs on any of their lamps so they had to take a nob from mine to turn their lamps. My bed was the most uncomfortable bed I have ever slept on. There was a dirty washcloth in the shower when we arrived. Had breakfast at the buffett one morning and coffe shop another. Neither where anything to write home about. Location on the strip is poor. Would have spent more to be more centrally located. Only plus was when we came back from NYNY after watching the dueling pianos, I realized I had left a small shopping bag in the bar. The lady at the front desk called NYNY for me to help me find my lost bag.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the price”
Reviews.Author: mrtall
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights in mid-December 2006. The many many reviews down the line from here that criticize Circus Circus are mostly accurate: this place is old, surprisingly dark given its theme, and there are lots of children running around. But we paid $31 a night for a Sky Tower room -- how do you beat that? And the room was fine; basic but clean, with a bathroom that bordered on nice. The shower especially was good. My advice? Just sleep here, then drive over to Aladdin or MGM or one of the other more centrally-located hotels, leave your car there, and use that as your 'base' for the day. Worked beautifully for us.

Reviews.Title: “Only family hotel, with some ISSUES”
Reviews.Author: ladybugmomma
Reviews.Content: We booked with Circus Circus because (for the first time) we brought our kids with us. We also flew grandma in from out of state to visit the kids (and of course do some of her own gambling) and allow my husband and I a little occasional alone time in Vegas. The clerk was nice when I checked in. I mentioned to her that the rates had gone down $25 a nite. She had her supervisor approve an adjustment and I save $100 for the 4 days. Good thing, because I would have been bent out of shape paying the higher price for a run down hotel. She also asked me if I wanted a higher floor so that I could see the strip. I said "sure". The last time I was in Vegas, I stayed in the Paris hotel and was O.K with the higher floor. After checking in, we went across the street to the skyline tower. I was O.K. with the location of the parking garage & tower. No long walks. Then, my kids and I got in the elevator (while my husband grabbed more luggage) and couldn't get out on the 2nd floor. I hit door open. It didn't. We ended up going back up to floor 3, getting in another elevator, then back down to floor 2. I got out of the elevator, and immediately felt as if the building was unstable. I don't know if it was the carpet padding or what, but the flooring seemed unstable & uneven. I got in the room (maybe I was sensing something, because I hadn't read any of the reviews) and didn't want to reveal to the kids that I was scared to death to be up on the 23rd floor of this crappy hotel. I told my husband about my worries and he was O.K. changing to a lower floor. They (hotel staff) were nice enough to let me (us, our family) do this. Then grandma arrived, it was a horribly long walk from our room to the restaurants. It's not a good hotel for an older person. The false stone floor is very hard on the feet. We met other family members there (a couple were staying across the street @ the Riviera) and to our surprise, disgust, embarassment, and to my already newly found Circus Circus Anxieties, the fire alarms (a buzzer that sounded like a gibbons monkey and annoying flashing lights) went off for about 10 minutes. I kept expecting security to walk around and do "checks" and they didn't. I kept expecting for us to be evacuated and nothing happened. Everyone in the hotel, restaurant, staff and guests alike just ignored it and went about their business. It's as if they were used to false alarms. I expected to hear an announcement over the loud speaker "no need to worry guests, it is just a false alarm". AN APOLOGY, an ACKNOWLEDGEMENT, something! And it happened again, for a short period of time. It could have happened many times for all I know (we were gone during the day doing other things). I was happy to be on the third floor. Then, another elevator problem, the first one was garage elevator, this one was one of the elevators that took us up to our room. It wouldn't open. Then, one another occasion, our elevator stopped and an announcement came on "we are experiencing technical difficulties", but the door opened anyway. The hotel was freezing cold. We were there during a horrendous cold snap (it even snowed in Vegas), but that's no excuse for the casino floors to be ice cold. Our lights in the bathroom went out, yes they changed them on our requests. But, the bathroom also had mold on the ceiling because there were no exhaust fans. I could go on more, but why bother? I'm not sure if they cared (at the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “not the best choice”
Reviews.Author: mkako
Reviews.Content: We [me, husband and 2 kids, 7 & 9] stayed here in may 2006 for a week. It was the worst hotel we stayed in our USA trip The service was terrible, restaurants passable and this is not a kids hotel. It may have a circus and arcade but it is full of drunk single men esp at night. It smelled and looked old and grubby. We would never stay there again instead pay more and stay in one of the newer hotels down the strip as whole area cleaner and more family friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, gloomy, and poor service”
Reviews.Author: dj4242
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at Circus Circus but got a room at the Manor. People had smoked in the room although it was non smoking. Parts of the wall were coming off. The TV movies didn't work. The bathroom hadn't been well cleaned. This place is a disaster.

Reviews.Title: “Just Fine”
Reviews.Author: JeffSRapidCity
Reviews.Content: We just returned from three nights at the Circus. I will keep this short as some write quite long reviews. After reading all the negatives on this website, I was somewhat nervous with our choice to stay at the Circus Circus. We were well satisfied with everything at the Circus. Check in was slow but the room was large and clean. We asked for extra towels and pillow and received them promptly. There were children everywhere but we knew that when booking. We had no problems with noise at night. We did find the prices on food and gifts were a little cheaper than other casinos. We used the duce for transportation and were able to get anywhere we needed to go. We had the best meal of the trip at the 24 hour cafe at the Circus. We would stay at the Circus again if we decide to stay at that end of the strip. I don't understand why all the bad reviews. What do you expect for $40-50 dollars per night?

Reviews.Title: “circus circus not for adults”
Reviews.Author: Jane T
Reviews.Content: Have stayed several times at Circus Circus. Always have found that the rooms were comfortable and a very good value. We did some gambling there and we usually had our rooms comped. Our December and September stay in 2006 were very disappointing. They were installing carpeting and the traffic patterns were altered. It was very confusing, especially on weekends when there were so many hotel and casino guests, with too many children. We found that the food prices have increased a lot and the restaurants had poor service and the food was not good or only so-so. Service was generally fair, however it was very impersonal. The slots had fewer people than I have ever seen and they seemed to not pay out like our other experiences. Therefore, we went elsewhere. We do not ever plan on staying at Circus Circus again.

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus Stinks.”
Reviews.Author: JetSettingGal
Reviews.Content: We had a miserable stay at Circus. The woman who checked us in was very difficult to understand and she mumbled through the whole conversation. This is a LOW budget hotel... there were children every where. It's very smokey and the layout of the casino is bad. The hotel needs some serious updating and a good cleaning. Additionally, every time we used the elevator we had to wait at least 20 minutes... at one point there were 2 elevators broken and during check out time at 11am we would take the stairs from our room on the 26 floor to the 21 floor and catch the elevator there. The hotel is on the northern part of the strip and is located between vacant lots and the old Stardust Hotel that is about to be demolished. I will say our room was very clean and the maid service was excellent. Also, The Steakhouse is located inside Circus and is one of the best steakhouses I've ever eaten at. Only stay at Circus if you're looking for a cheap vacation with very few admenities.

Reviews.Title: “This is a value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: carinabramley
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from the 28th of December 2006 until the 2nd January 2007. I had read the previous reveiws on this website and was slightly worried about what i had let myself into, but upon arrival, i was very plesently surprised. We arrived at approx 2pm on the 28th, a busy period due to it being the last check in day of 2006, and we waited no longer than 10mins to check in, which went very smoothly and quick. We then ventured up to our room. Previous reviews had said that the rooms were miles from the lobby, but we got in an elevator and within 2 mins, we were opening the door to our twin double room. It was lovely, just like the photo had shown on the website we booked on (lastminute.com) It was large, clean and bright. The beds were larger than doubles, the bathroom huge and the closet space adequate enough. The only 2 things so far i can fault is that the lifts can take a while, and can break down (2 broke down while we were there but were fixed within an hour) and we needed more hangers and pillows. After freshening up, we ventured down into the hotel to find dinner, and ended up at the garden grill. It was amazing, the value for money was unreal. We had huge portions and the drinks were reasonable. Service couldnt be faulted and we were in and out within an hour. Okay, it is a family hotel, there were kids about, but if your moaning about all the kids running around, why the hell did you book the one hotel that is based on a family atmosphere? thats your own fault. If you dont like kids, simple, dont book this hotel! It wasnt that bad anyhow, if you wanted to get thru quick, head into the casino to get past all the crowds as children under 21 not allowed into them! We could not hear the people in the rooms next to us, the maid was very friendly and apart from having to ask for extra towls each day, it was great. Yes they do charge a $1 a day charge for the phone, but it states that when you book, so again, quit complaining, you agreed to do it when you paid, its not a small print item. Now, when it came to new years night itself, the place was heaving.
