The children were in their thousands, and for each child there was normally about 3 adults, so you can imagine how chaotic it was, but as it is the only family based hotel, i expected it and lived with it. We had to que for an hour and a half in the take out pizza place, but it was edible, the chefs were clearly rushed, and it could have been nicer, but what can you do, everywhere along the strip was the same from 5pm. Overall, this hotel is great, like i said, if you dont like lots of children, dont stay here. We walked into the centre of the strip each day and it took no more than 10mins, even with huge blisters on our feet, and getting a taxi from the hotel was easy as there are two areas to pick them up. the hotel lobby or the front of the hotel. The adventuredrome. It was ok, it was like i expected, tacky and completely based on kids! ther rides were good, even for a thrill seeker, the games were average carnival games and the stalls were cool. Little people would love it and its not expensive. The shops in the casino are great, they sell everything and again, its not expensive. Beware if you are from england and have a credit card as if you need money out, it only accepts the cards with the cirrus logo on, thankfully one of my cards did! and there is only 1 atm there, its in the lobby. Check out was quick and easy, took seconds to fill in the leaflet and pop it in the hole with the key. then we were gone. Taxi to/from hotel to airport cost approx $12 then a tip on top, so rather reasonable i thought. One thing i will not fault the hotel on is its care for the residents. One of my party get very very sick and needed a doctor, within 30mins there was one there, and he made her better and she was ok to fly and the next day was up and about again, but do make sure you have health insurance for the USA as it cost $600 for the injection and medicine. I loved it here, and would not mind staying here again, i cant understand what everyone is complaining about. Its lovely! if you have any questions on it, dont hesitate to contact me as a genuine uk traveller at carina.bramley at btinternet dot com (take out spaces and change at and dot to the relevant symbols!) Have a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Crap Hole”
Reviews.Author: viva5
Reviews.Content: Avoid this place it stinks, old wore out hole. Nothing was good. wore out escaladers, crappy staff. rooms were discusting. terrible casino layout. I've had better in Jail!!

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus Horrible”
Reviews.Author: kailuan
Reviews.Content: This place is a horrible. as a world traveler who mistaken booked this room its far below the travel lodge. Its rooms are dated , musty and stink.

Reviews.Title: “Not for honeymooners!!”
Reviews.Author: ryanlimk
Reviews.Content: Myself and my new husband booked this hotel for our honeymoon and i will tell you its not a place for couples. There were kids running up and down the hotel like mad and the walls were like paper thin and we were stuck next door to a very loud family and we could hear everything. The hotel was clean at least but very basic, didn't like the food that much and the queues were crazy"but i suppose it was peak seasion", all in all we had a fab honeymoon, but just be warned if your looking for a romantic time a bit of peace and quiet don't stay in circus circus!!

Reviews.Title: “Great cheap place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: elspeth251963
Reviews.Content: The West Tower rooms are very nice and clean. Maid service was great and they were more then happy to change the sheets when requested. Plenty of clean towels everyday. Large rooms huge bathrooms and a great view of the strip. While there were lots of children, because it is Circus Circus, we did not see any unattended children and they were not running wildly thru the hotel. All the staff was more then helpful and made the stay much less stressfull. Short walk to all the bigger hotels and casino's and lots of things to see and do. The food was better then average with little or no wait time to be seated. The only complaint I have is that while walking thru the hotel and even down the street there are people who try to sell you time shares and sightseeing tours. You can't walk 20 feet anywhere in Vegas without someone trying to sell you something. All in all, if we ever went back to Las Vegas I wouldn't mind staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be staying there again”
Reviews.Author: Akrat
Reviews.Content: First off, Circus Circus is towards the end of the strip where the older hotels are. The area around the hotel consists mostly of buildings that are marked for demolition, so it is a fair distance to walk to further down the strip to some of the nicer casinos. The food at most of the restaurants is overpriced and bland. We received a coupon for buy one/get one free at the buffet which made it a fair deal, but we would have been angry to have to pay full price. McDonald's was the best deal in the casino. Our room was on the top floor of the West tower, which has been remodeled recently. There was miscellaneous items in some of the corners from previous occupants and the wall safe was a joke where you had to pay money every time that you needed to lock it. We could easily hear the activities of the occupants in the room next door. The most annoying portion of the entire trip was that Circus Circus allows time-share sales people to harass their guests with four stations located throughout the hotel. It was common for us to have to brush off three sales people every time that we would leave our room, and some of them didn't simply take no for an answer. We went during Halloween/SEMA, and their Frightdome was interesting, but not worth the 25 dollars per person that we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid This Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: sm235
Reviews.Content: Dear god... the check in was like waiting in line at the carnival... 45 min, lines about 50 deep. We got stuck in their ghetto project housing... motel 6 type bunkers 1/2 mile from check in, with paper thin walls. Seriously low rent, swamped with complete families... typical 5-12 ppl per family all with screaming kids. If you value your sanity avoid this place like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value good experience”
Reviews.Author: donegal32
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Manor rooms at Circus Circus for 4 nights and were very pleasantly surprised considering all the negative reviews. We arrived in the early evening and check in was quick & efficient. The Manor rooms are separate from the main hotel complex but there is a walkway inside that takes you almost all the way though it did take us a day or so to locate it! The room was non-smoking and was very fresh and clean with a very comfortable bed. The bathroom was spotless cleaned every day with fresh towels provided daily and the sheets were changed during our stay. I can't really comment on the restaurants or the pool as we ate elsewhere and did not manage to have a swim but there was a good atmosphere at the hotel with the added attraction of free circus acts. Check out again went very smoothly despite our doing our best to confuse the receptionist she kept her patience. I also stayed for a night at the Luxor Hotel which was 5 times the price per night but did not compare. We are from Ireland and I think that it would be very difficult to find a hotel room anywhere in Ireland for the equivalent of $40 per night and definitely not of this quality.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Visser
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two nights in April 2006. It was not expensive. We got more than we expected. A large room with anything we needed. And it was clean. The staff was friendly but they were very busy. The hotel is very large. We could not find the reception anymore. After we had checked out we could not find our car too. In the hotel we had a lot of fun. The circus was great, a lot of gambling machines and a lot of shops. The food was okay. Not the best we had but for the price it was good. You can take what you want. The next time we go to Vegas we probably will stay again in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Freaky1
Reviews.Content: There is nothing wrong with this hotel other than I found the bed to be alittle hard & the walls alittle thin. The food at all the restraunts we tried was great! It is on the far end of the strip but we didn't mind the walking ...

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shelbali
Reviews.Content: I was worried about staying at Circus, Circus after reading the reviews here but it really was a nice hotel. We stayed in the West Tower which has recently been refurbished and this was evident. The carpet, decorations and furnishings were all immaculate and smelled new. The room was a decent size and the bathroom was very spacious. Despite the quality of the hotel room I would not stay here again for several reasons. Circus Circus is one of the older hotels and is located to the North of the Strip. This means it's a damn good walk from most of the attractions and other hotels. If you take into consideration the sheer size of the hotels themselves, including the casino's it takes forever to go anwhere. We estimated that it took between 10-15 minutes to get out of our hotel!! The restaurant level is HUGE with around about 6 eateries to chose from, not including shops and kiosks selling and advertising various things. The hotel was very busy and the casino was jammed with people, this added to the time it took to exit the hotel. One good thing about this was that I'm sure I've lost weight after walking a million miles everyday! :o) The staff weren't anything special and while they weren't rude, they certainly weren't as friendly as most hotel staff I've encountered during my many stays in the USA. That said I did call housekeeping to report a faulty tap in our bathroom and they fixed it almost right away, so that was good service. I realise that all the major hotels on Las Vegas Blvd make their money from casinos and that's why they're built BIG, but if I had to go back again (and I probably wouldn't) I'd stay just mid-way down, or off the strip in a smaller hotel. You'd save yourself a lot of time doing this.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel...good value”
Reviews.Author: Kieran27
Reviews.Content: Good hotel.....so much to do. Caters for all sorts of age groups. Food hall & casino were great. Rooms were cleaned every day with fresh towels daily. Staff were firendly in the hotel. 1 complaint & it could just be a coincidence but on our last night (a friend had won 6000 over 3 nights on the same roulette table) 2 of the floor managers seemed to be interested in getting us to leave the table at all costs and became quite rude which disappointed us as other than this it had been a great holiday for us.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best hotel”
Reviews.Author: Swerty
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed at this hotel for 7 nights. On the first day we arrived around 1:30pm and my god the check-in took around 45 minutes they had 2 staff members working behind the check-in counter who by the way were so rude, and whilst in the line people smoking away having no respect for the people who don''t smoke, after finally getting out of there we went to our room which was clean but very old. The hot water worked if you have a shower very early in the morning you are guaranteed hot water any time after 8am though all we got was cold water!! 1 other problem were the lifts, 1 day it took around 10 mins to finally come and then we had to go up to go back down!!! Personally i won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok place for traveling sports teams!!”
Reviews.Author: Baseball_Kids
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our baseball team on October 26-29th. We booked for the Manor but they didn't put the team in the same Manor building. They scattered us among the A-E Manor buildings. We stayed in Manor bulding E. The ice machine wasn't working so you had to go the Manor building D. One of the pools had yellow security tape around the pool so it wasn't usable. Our room had the beds made daily but they did a poor job cleaning. There was an oreo cookie under the tv console when we got there and it was there when we left after three days! The rooms are noisy so if you stay near the busted ice machine, you'd hear it rumble every 20 minutes. There is no coffee machine or microwave in the room to make snacks for teenagers when they get hungry at midnight. There were lots of other sports teams staying here so it seems to be destination for teams. The security door for Manor building E had black duct tape holding the lock together on Thursday and red duct tape on Friday. It wasn't secure. You just needed to push the door and it opened. Pro: Location (It was near the baseball field.) Con: Old, run down, dirty, security door didn't work, pool was broken, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, good price.”
Reviews.Author: LittleLynn
Reviews.Content: Most of Circus Circus is in need of updating but, the rooms were better than I expected, very smart and with very comfy beds. Rent a fridge from the hotel, it's worth it to have cool drinks handy. Buffet breakfast had enormous choice. Although hotel is on the strip, it's on the far end so, plan your day well or you will end up going up and down the strip at random. Hotel is great for children and teenagers because of the rides and amusements. Pool was a bit of a let down, not much room around it and certainly not a relaxing area. I would use this hotel again just for the rooms and good prices.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: bob ashdown
Reviews.Content: We had a good two-night experience at Circus Circus. We arrived early, and had no trouble registering. The clerk recommended a 19th floor room which was clean, comfortable, spacious, and quiet. Circus Circus is located among older hotels/casinos at the northern end of the Strip. The area around the hotel, therefore, is less congested than the southern end of the Strip where the newer hotels are located. We also found cheaper drinks ($1.25 for a 16 oz margarita or 20 oz draft beer) as well as less expensive food at this end of the Strip. We walked to the southern area, but a city bus (you can get a daily pass for $5) also is available making it easy to get up and down the Strip. Circus Circus is a family hotel with lots of kids having a great time. As grandparents, we kind of enjoy the kids but younger couples might not. We selfed-parked in Lot #1, which was a short walk to the registration desk area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a family stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: GulfSider
Reviews.Content: Our room on the 9th floor of the main tower was clean and very spacious. The kids had a ball with the games and the adventure dome. Casino had some loose slots but it was hard to find a cocktail waitress which was my biggest complaint. The place becomes very full and busy on the weekends but it is amazingly quiet during the week. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “circus circus - pantomime pantomime!!”
Reviews.Author: happybuuni
Reviews.Content: After reading several bad reviews of Circus Circus we were a little apprehenive about our forthcoming stay there. On arrival we were summoned over to the check in by a lady who looked like she'd rather be anywhere else. We had a party of 13 requiring 5 rooms, we had booked our trip through a travel agaent so all should have been fine. Not to be.. after 1 hour and 20 mins we were told they only had a booking for 4 rooms so we were told they could do nothing for us we must go away and call whoever we booked with. We had been travelling for 17 hours and had no means to make a call to our company in UK especially when In Uk time it was 4 am! After complaining to the manager they agreed to phone the company for us, they went behind a wall and pretended to phone. Tara its fixed you may go to your rooms... We stayed in the sky tower on the 3rd floor - avoid this at all costs!! The window overlooks the roof of the hotel where there are large generator which A, block out the light and B, sound like a bus is sitting at your window with the engine running! After complaining to the hotel we moved to the 23rd floor which was much better, however we had to endure a night of trying to sleep before we could move. Apart from these gripes the hotel was ok, we found it clean, everything did what it said on the tin, tv was rubbish but if you go LV to watch TV you need to have a word with yourself. its a good place to go for your first trip to LV. Just don't expect the whole "miss you already" over friendly american approach- the majority of staff in Circus Circus seemed like they had been there too long, were tired, hostile, rude and in need of a lesson in customer service. All in all it was ok value for money, and because its in Vegas were you only need to sleep in your hotel they can get away with it. Hope this helps

Reviews.Title: “IT WAS AVERAGE, NOTHING SPECIAL.”
Reviews.Author: mondragon692
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself stood at the circus circus from september 14th through the 17th. I'll try to stay on track with the hotel itself in this review. When we arrived we were dropped off at the front of the casino (shuttle driver was not very polite for reasons unkown) when there is a shuttle drop off right near the check in desk. so therefore we had to walk through the whole casino pulling and carrying luggage like we were playing follow the leader and scavenger hunt. we were lucky to have gotten an early check in at 1230 when check in wasnt till 2 or 3. the hotel is a bit old and the elevators kind of stick, i mean you get in and the doors shut but no buttons work so you just sit in the elevator for about 3 minutes till the button to open the door decides to work, no floor buttons worked during that time. this happened twice during our stay.. there were no children running around the room floors. we stood in the tower. the view was the roofs of the other parts of the casino. the bathtub is narrow while the bathroom is spacious. large counter area. the room had iron/ironing board as well. cool. the tv stations are lame, mostly vegas advertisement channels and a circus circus channel with some clown detectives. no music channels or movie channels. you cannot hook up a dvd player or vcr to the tv either in case. now everything in the room is bolted down, even the mismatching lamps with no light bulbs. the ones with lightbulbs had some electrical shorts. im sure nobody will steal the lamps and take them as carry on. other than that we were not in the room but to sleep and thats it. its not bad if you just need to sleep there and want to stay on that end of the strip. otherwise you can bus it on the Duece for 5.00 for the whole day, but be prepared it may take an hour to get where your going. we give it a 2.5 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “It was Ok”
Reviews.Author: andyuk7116
Reviews.Content: I must Say after having read a lot of poor reviews on the circus circus i and my wife never had a problem with the stay, We flew in from london checked in immediately (no wait) straight to the room , no view went to the desk new room immediately no problem, Breakfast in the buffet very nice thankyou , yup the hotels dated but are you really there to holiday or just look to criticise and get refunds , compensation, discounts etc etc...... Give it a try i found it ok....... cya andy

Reviews.Title: “A great start”
Reviews.Author: bp_uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Circus Circus for one week during April to celebrate my girlfiends 21st. We booked the holiday with virgin, and chose it simply because it offered the best value. The stratosphere was cheaper, but after walking there, we realised how far off the strip it is. We had a good time there, the room was huge, clean and well maintained. Air conditioning could have had a bit more oomph, but other than that very good. My biggest complaint was that there was a lot of children. I know its a family resort, but it does get a bit frustrating after a while. However, a quick trip to the bar or gaming floor solved that (no minors of course). We tried most of the resteraunts there, and all were very good. The steak house was fantastic, with an excellent choice and would recomend it. The breakfast buffet was plentyfull and inexpensive, and filled you up for the day. Oh, and who could forget the Pink Pony - the best place for that drunken hamburger at 4am! We couldnt get over how energetic and happy the staff were at that hour! If you have kids, the circus is perfect. So much for them to do, and a family friendly atmosphere too. However, those without kids, or those who get frustrated by screaming kids everywhere, stay away. We loved Vegas so much we have already booked to go back, but this time its for my birthday, and I got to choose the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “great price for the strip”
Reviews.Author: dillojs
Reviews.Content: Circus Circus is at the older end of the strip which is why its one of the cheapest on the strip but the rooms are large/clean and casino/bar etc: is really cheap good value. As long as your up for walking if not theres the strip trolley and a bus which runs 24hours up and down the strip so the location on the strip does not really matter. Def a must with a tight budget gives you more to spend on food/drink and gambling ! very friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “ok, if you are on a budget”
Reviews.Author: travelhonie
Reviews.Content: if you are a backpacker on a budget (as i was) then this is a fine option - rooms are basic but spacious and adequate and the casino is fun with a themepark area and circus acts as you would expect. Hotel is based at the end of the strip and if you can afford it you might want to go to one of the other hotels to get more of the 'vegas' treatment and feel. not a bad place. queue to check in was about an hour which was horrendous.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: RC11
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vegas and we booked with Circus Circus because it had the best rates. Prior to going to Vegas I noticed reviews online which initially made me regret having made the reservations. Those reviews were not favorable of this hotel. After arriving I found the accomodations to be some of the finest I have ever utilized. I have stayed at Sheraton's and J.W. Marriott's and did not find their service or presentation to be any finer than this hotel. The hotel employee's were extremely friendly and helpful in making our stay enjoyable. I will definitely stay at Circus Circus again when I visit Las Vegas. Richard Caldwell Portsmouth, Ohio

Reviews.Title: “A Bit of a Circus”
Reviews.Author: Beentheredonit
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. We went for the Manor Rooms for budgetary reasons. Check in is round the back, luckily the cabbie knew this. Check in took about 10 minutes. The staff were polite but not over friendly, fine. The rooms were across the road and through a car park, about 500 yards. The room was clean and had everything there, but they don't supply coffee making facilities. This I assume is to get you out of your rooms and down into the casino where the Dinky Donut place is and is as far as I am concerned unacceptable and mean. If you do venture into the casino you'll be hard pressed to find an exit sign. They want you in there. Tough. I would recommend the shoe-shine man near the check in. There were less kids about than I expected. Didn't go to the Adventuredome as we only used the place as a base. We did catch one circus act which involved two very serious looking guys balancing, which was interesting. The buffet was ok and reasonably priced, the apple pie was super. If I ever go to Vegas again I will stay elsewhere, probably at Terribles which was good.

Reviews.Title: “ok for budget”
Reviews.Author: loved1
Reviews.Content: overall the place was good. stayed in the manor rooms which is about 100 m across the road from the main casino and about 20m to the pool. The first night we stayed we had a room right next to the ice machine, then requested to move and got a room much more quiet - there were no problems with moving rooms. the room was good, clean and tidy. the location of the hotel is almost at the end of the strip. they have the strip trolley and buses that leave almost right outside the hotel so you can get off and on, which saves alot of time walking in the heat. Walking through the casino is an experience - it smells of smoke and isnt the cleanest. Overall i would recommend this if you are on a budget, but next time i would stay closer to the middle of the strip - which is where everything happens.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at Circus Circus...”
Reviews.Author: cecilschick
Reviews.Content: Needed a place to stay overnight at the last moment. Ended up getting there late so I got into the Vegas Strip traffic. I didn't know that the rooms were located across from the casino. I didn't know where the parking was. All I found was the valet parking in front. I didn't see any signs up close where I turn onto Circus Circus road to show me where self parking was. I took me an hour & a half just to find the parking plus I had a friend helping me & still couldn't find it. So first timers, turn onto Circus Circus and just GO STRAIGHT AHEAD, keep going straight under the monorail track & you'll see the parking area finally on your left. Follow the sign from the front that says registration. I don't want anyone to have trouble like I did. As for the check in, it was very quick but the clerk chose not to tell me that there's an automatic $1.00 charge for the convenience of having a phone to use. You get charged whether you use the phone or not. So beware of this also. Read your receipt before you sign it at check in, be sure of what they put on there because at any other hotel or motel I've stayed at previously, I ONLY was charged if I made a call, this is the first time I've ever been charged regardless. I asked the front desk about it from viewing it on the tv screen the next day & they said it was, quote, explained to me at check in, I said no it was not, that I thought it was included in the $25 deposit for incidentals, the clerk then said that is only for cash paying customers only. He got persnippety with me & sarcastic & said, quote, well it's only a dollar for one night but I'll take it off anyway. The room was less than expected, I got spoiled at Santa Clarita Motel the 2 nights before. This room was a letdown. The bathroom was VERY tiny. I had to either straddle the toilet or step to the other side wall to shut the door. The toilet faces the door & is right behind it so if someone accidentally opened it--it didn't lock--I'd get smacked in the face w/the door. The shower/tub was narrow. The curtain was typical plain & thick plastic, it kept wanting to stick to me when the shower was on--ewwww. They provided soap, shampoo, & lotion. The a/c was on a timer but it worked although it took doing to figure out how to make it work. The good thing about the room is that you can check out on the tv, just follow the menu although you hafta press menu item 4 & when I tried to do this, it wouldn't let me, that's when I found out I owed a dollar for a call I never made. Why in the world wouldn't they charge it anyway at check in rather than at check out is beyond me. You can also check out by filling out a card they give you & dropping it w/the room keys into a container at the elevator downstairs from the room but I had to borrow a pen from a security guy to fill out the card because this hotel didn't provide pens or paper either so bring those w/you if you think you may need them. Overall, this hotel is only good if you're desperate for a room at a 3 star hotel but I could've done better w/my choice. The Orleans was only $3 more & is a lot nicer & easier to get to, I should've stayed there. So if you can, just visit the Adventuredome or casino or what it has to offer in entertainment but stay elsewhere unless you just HAVE to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Family Hotel does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: BarG
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel a few years back. The hotel I found was pretty good but I would recommend the hotel more for people with young clildren that would enjoy the in-house circus and roller coaster. The beds were comfortable the room large and clean. Rates reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at ALL cost”
Reviews.Author: Jyrol
Reviews.Content: Two people manning the check in desk for a line of well over 50 people, filled with loud, obnoxious kids and loud, oblivious parents, paper-thin walls that let even the slightest snore feel like it's right by your ear, noisy neighbors (it's all about listening to someone vomit their whole insides from 2am to 6am, then blast the TV as loud as possible), terrible service (reporting said noises doesn't amount to anything), mattresses that haven't been changed since the hotel was built (i could feel every single coil under me), no extra pillows (unless you call room service), "manor" rooms, crapiest restaurants and casino on the strip...or in vegas, for that matter. Don't go there during the summer, but go during spring when Vegas is kid-free (as it should be). One of the worst experiences I've ever had at a hotel (ranks second, behind the Madonna Inn in San Louis Obispo)

Reviews.Title: “I Would NEVER EVER Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: MustLoveLasVegas
Reviews.Content: I never stayed here, but we DID visit this place. We were going to go ride rides in the Adventuredome, but Canyon Blaster looked like it was ready to fly of the track! It was shakin every where and it made a cracking sound when it got to the top! There was so many kids that were shoving us. And it STUNK in there! I couldn't imagine to see their pool! I am SOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO glad we didn't stay there! Trust me, do NOT stay at Circus Circus! It NEEDS to be torn down! Oh yeah, and we spent 4 hours just to get there. The trolley driver kept passing it and going to different hotels. It was sooooooooo HOT in that little trolley!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time here!”
Reviews.Author: AnnaLucy
Reviews.Content: I arrived at Circus Circus with my two teenage children and we all loved it! Our room was in the Manor rooms, it was huge and very clean. We had no complaints at all about the place, staff were knowledgeable, polite and helpful. Yes there were a lot of kids around but what do you expect in a hotel with a name like Circus Circus! Great value for money and would recommend it to any one (kids or no kids)

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus - Tears Of a Clown”
Reviews.Author: Stuartbuxton
Reviews.Content: Checking in was a dreadful experience with endless queues stretching as far as the eye could see. You REALLY want this after a long haul flight ! Consequently the fraught check-in clerk hardly has time to answer any questions, let alone direct you to your room, which due to the size of the place is invariably in another time zone. The room was clean and the shower was very good, but there was a lack of towels (2 small ones) and it took repeated requests for additional towels to be delivered. Lack of coffee making facilities smacks of third world accomodation. Lack of adequate hotel guidelines & information data confirms this status. The meals were good (we are English, so what do we know!)and the queues properly controlled so any waiting was minimised. The lifts (sorry, elevators) were at best spasmodic and lengthy waits became a feature. The Third World Status confirmed again. No, we would not go back. You only had to walk around other nearby hotels to realise that Cicus Circus was in fact a Clown in disguise.

Reviews.Title: “What an Experience!”
Reviews.Author: PinkNFluffy
Reviews.Content: What an experience!! We initially booked a manor room, but after reading mixed reviews about Circus Circus on this website and others, we contacted the hotel and paid the extra money for a tower room. When we got to the hotel, the check-in process took a short while, as we arrived on an airport shuttle-bus with a lot of other travellers, but I would say it was only about 25 minutes or so. The staff were efficient enough, but did not seem to have the time to spend being sociable - I put this down to the number of people they must have to process every hour. They provided us with a map, and I must admit, it took us a while to find our way to our room, but the hotel lobby, lift and landing were all immaculate. Our room was fantastic, and we had an amazing view over the adventuredome and out to the mountains on the horizon. Each room has a safe, iron and TV but you have to pay for the safe here (which is a bit cheeky in my opinion)! The restaurants were a little disappointing on-site, but that's mainly because we had really been looking forward to visiting the Blue Iguana, which has now closed and become some strange Italian/Tex Mex place with a rather obscure menu. We visited the Mexican restaurant at Sahara, which was amazing! The buffet in the mornings is fantastic value for money and much recommended, although you may want to take a lie down afterwards!! We spoke to another couple whilst we were in the restaurant - they were staying in the manor rooms and were not so happy with the accommodation - that made me even more glad that we had changed our booking! The Pink Pony cafe is also good, although there are better places if you are willing to look about. The free circus acts are on all day, and if you have children, it is well worth a look. The adventuredome is also fantastic, although a lot of the rides were out of action while we were there. Also, be careful with the lockers in here - we lost our money a couple of times on lockers that were tempramental! The location of the hotel was ok, although it was at the top end of the strip so it took a while to get down to the other hotels. Overall, we liked Circus Circus and would happily go back. Although there were a lot of families here, we were not bothered by children everywhere - maybe we just struck lucky! We also went on a helicopter tour of the Grand Canyon whilst we were in Las Vegas - highly recommended (Papillon Helicopter Tours are excellent, and run a shuttle service from all of the strip/main downtown hotels to Boulder City to catch the chopper)!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: mrtravler
Reviews.Content: Arrived late at 2 am, had to wait 1 hour to check in. Ist night had 2 rooms at manor, yuk, one room smelled like an outhouse, not kidding. Rooms paper thin, no sleep that night as upstirs room must have been doing a boxing match. Checked into Sky Rise next day, some what nicer, cleaner. Shower and drain terrible. The wait for elevator was a nightmare most of the day. We got stuck on one elevator and never rode it again. Lots of famlies with lots of kids, had to play dodge the crowds all day, night. May be a good place to stay if you want save dollars, and like poor service. Charged for local calls, never used the phone, they said thats in the fine print. Tv options and use stinks, I like the weather channel, and its not there as most hotels do provide it. No paper provided. No Coffe pot. Some major channels have Vegas adds attached, I almost felt like big brother was running the tv system. The only restaurant we liked was the steak house. The buffet lines are insane if you are late, the food is fair. I always felt like I was in a maze, going from one side to the other.

Reviews.Title: “Really great choice”
Reviews.Author: Silvertongue
Reviews.Content: I must say, I was very surprised by the others reviews. We were on a 17 days tour of the USA Southwest and we spent one night in Las Vegas. The Circus Circus Hotel was very good value for money, we payed 60$ (no taxes) for a night in the West Tower and the room was clean, elegant, new, tidy, with a view at the Strip. A really excellent room for that budget price. We also had to queue for the check-in, about 25 minutes, but we didn't think it was so bad, you usually go through this in Las Vegas. We also didn't have bad experiences with the elevator, the waiting time was decent. The whole atmosphere is not very elegant, people who go there are either budget travellers like ourselves, or the very average uneducated family with loud kids, but we thought it was really ok to pay that money, have a really nice room, acceptable casinos and restaurants and still be on the Strip. We won't go there again if in Las Vegas because we would like to try out something else, just for fun, but our staying was pleasant and I would recommand it, as a very good price /value result.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: RAMMAN1
Reviews.Content: Ok where do I start, first of all the property is to confusing, the check in is in the back of the property and if you think your checking in in less then an hour forget it. Second we were placed in the SKyrise tower, now I understabd that the property went through a 30 million dollar renovation to place Adventure Dome and a new shopping mall. Do ya think they may have thrown a couple Million into better elevators?. We were on the 14th floor of this place and it was a gamble to get down stairs or upstairs within an 15 minute period the whole 3 days. I got stuck at least 3 times in and elevator that would not open the out side doors on all 18 floors. We understood that there was going to be a lot of kids there thats why we stayed there with our son. but.... The security staff were on us all the time about him walking through the gamIng areas with us. You cant get any place there if you dont, and we were not about to walk in the heat LOL. aLSO ON THE HOTTEST DAY OF THE STAY NO POOLS OPEN... Never again

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Valmarie
Reviews.Content: This was the worst experience I have ever had at a hotel in my entire life. First of all we got there 1am and waiting in line for 1hr and 45mins to be checked in. the service at the check in desk was an absolute joke. we eventually got to our room at 3am. There was no rooms left in the main building so we had to stay in the manorwhich is about 5-10 mins away from the main building. The room was an ok size but the walls were like paper, i could hear the person in the next room sneezing and farting thats how thin the walls actually were. the next day I tried to book somewhere else as after waiting in line for 2hours and then getting the worst room in the place i was just not in a good mood. We were unable to book anything that night but manged to get the following nights at another hotel. We tried to prepare ourselves for the 2nd nite. It got worst, the couple next door to us started arguing, and when i say aguring i mean it, i had 911 on my speed dial it was that bad, i thought domestic violence was going to occur, the language was obsense ,i was terrified. I could not sleep the entire night. I do not want to fo on holiday and hear very loud and clear other peoples problems. We cheched out the next morning, and then began to enjoy Vegas. I would not stay at is hotel again even if you paid me.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: hithyrd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Circus Circus for 4 nights and were happy. It was only about 45 dollars per night and you definitley got what you paid for. Yes, it is crowded, but nowhere is quiet Las Vegas! If you want 5 star service then stay somewhere that charges 5 star prices. This place is great for families, couples...whoever. The check in lines are usually quite large in all the large hotels so there's no surprises there. The pool is a little walk away but once you're there you're fine (little snack shop, towels etc). The rooms are great, are clean and there are so many things on site you need not even leave the hotel, especially the adventuredome for kids. Great place, would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “what happens in vegas.....”
Reviews.Author: formerfanofvegas
Reviews.Content: this was my second trip to vegas and i was expecting it to be as good as the first, boy was i wrong! when we got there we did not get the room we were promised, ok i can live with that. we went to the buffet the first night and yuck!!! the food on the buffett was old and cold not a good first experience. the beds in our room were so bad that we lifted the mattress to make sure we weren't sleeping on the box springs- it took 4days of phone calls to the front desk to get this addressed, i finally went to the manager on duty myself and was assured the bed problem would be fixed or i could move to a new room. an hour later my door to my room opens and a large plastic bag is thrown in by someone in the hall then the door was shut-it was the answer to my bed problems(3 fleese bed pads) and hour after that someone showed up to make my beds-no thanks..the next day we ate supper at the PINK PONNY cafe in thecircus circus we were seated directly behind the hostess one person took our drink order, anothe person took our food order, another person brought our drinks, another person brought the crackers and napkins, another person brought our food and then noone came for 30 minutes . did i mention there were some very large roaches in our room? don't stay @ the circus inLV. It was the worst hotel i've ever stayed in!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus is the Worst”
Reviews.Author: rgross
Reviews.Content: Picked Circus Circus because we were traveling with kids. First the check-in process is like stepping into a Disneyland line. Took over an hour. Then the directions to the parking garage were wrong. Finally made it to the room. No towels. Then no ice .... anywhere (28 floors). Called the front desk and their fix for the ice was to check on the different floors (28 of them) or go buy some. The beds have matress covers that don't fit so they move during the night. Went to the buffet. The food was sub par at best. Then the crowning point to the stay was the shower. The showerhead was so plugged that most of the water went on the wall or curtain not on you. Glad we made this a short stay. Good luck if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Kids had Great time at Circus Circus”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Circus Circus for 7 nights during the July 4th week. We were worried our kids would be bored so many days in Las Vegas. We have two boys, 12 and 14. They had a great time, never bored. They went to the Adventure Dome two days and spent the whole day there, well worth the $23 pp per day. Another two days were spent at the arcade. That's more expensive, though. If you have kids, this is the place to go. If you don't have kids, steer clear because there's tons of kids running around. The rooms were average hotel rooms, nothing special, but we were rarely there. The buffet is the only thing we thought was terrible. Don't go. All the other restaurants at the Circus Circus were okay and reasonably priced. We wouldn't think of staying anywhere else in Las Vegas if we go there with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Hated It”
Reviews.Author: 819keystone
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at Circus Circus. We will never go back there again. We definately want to return to Las Vegas, but not that hotel. The elevator system was the worst we ever encountered. Some waits were easily 10-15 minutes. With kids, that's a hard thing to deal with. Elevators were filthy. The elevators to the pool, looked like they have never been cleaned. Pool was filthy. They definately do not clean the pools properly there. The skymobile that is supposed to take you from the room area, to the main entrance was broken until 2 days before we were leaving. That's a long haul from our rooms to the strip entrance. Easily a 20-25 minute trip, just to get to the strip!!!!! The only thing that was fair, was the price we paid for the room. It was reasonably priced, but actually wasn't worth anymore than we paid. I would never recommend this hotel. It really was the only dissapointment of the whole trip.

Reviews.Title: “Crowds at the Circus”
Reviews.Author: BlueMoonFarm
Reviews.Content: Circus Circus is one of the few places on the Vegas strip with attractions suitable for kids. Consequently, it's so congested with children and teenagers that it could be mistaken for a carnival midway on a Friday night. The allure is the the family-friendly price and circus midway that attracts every kid dragged along to Las Vegas by their parents. What are they thinking? These rude hordes parade through the midway non-stop, leaving little space for paying guests of the hotel who thought Las Vegas was an adult vacation destination and chose it over such kid-infested locations as Disneyland. Since kids are allowed to walk through the casino areas along some invisible "green zone," the staff also are preoccupied with keeping the kids away from the slot machines. That about tells it all for service. The tower rooms themselves are nice enough, but getting to them is a feat fit for a circus. There's a long wait for elevators and there are extremely long check-in lines unless you arrive late night. If you are energized by noisy crowds of children, this is your place. However, if you prefer a more relaxed atmosphere, I'd recommend a hotel that caters to adults, such as the Riviera across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: mf4516
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with wife and 3 kids for 2 nights at the end of an 11-day vacation driving around the Grand Canyon area. I should preface my review by saying that we are not Las Vegas type vacationers—the culture shock from the national parks to Vegas was hard for us. We also don’t gamble … the point of our trip was to see Hoover Dam, architecture along the strip, and to say that we had been at Vegas. We picked Circus Circus because it sounded like the most kid-friendly option along the strip, and we figured the circus acts would be fun to see. We and our kids felt safe and comfortable there, but we also felt comfortable walking through Paris, Caesar’s Palace, Bellagio, the Hilton, and the Mirage. If we could do it again, we would have stayed at the Mirage, which has a great pool, a somewhat nicer clientele, and more things to do in the neighborhood (not to mention the white tigers). The pools at Circus Circus were older, dumpy and filled with screaming, impolite kids. The hotel has strict policies about kids not being left alone, but I gather it must be hard for them to enforce the rules. I wouldn’t say that the circus acts are any huge draw, either—it took us so long to weave through the slots from our hotel elevator that we only got to watch one act unless we had been planning on hanging around the machines (illegal with kids, anyway). The adventuredome was noisy, crowded, and very, very expensive (although we enjoyed watching part of the clown show). The rooms were standard for a hotel, with moderately comfortable beds and a large, clean bathroom. Very little has been updated about any aspect of Circus Circus, as far as I can tell. The most annoying thing about Circus Circus was the elevator. We stayed in the Skyrise tower and at most times of the day had to wait for more than 10 minutes for an elevator. As far as I can tell, parking is free for all the casino hotels.

Reviews.Title: “I Love It! Hubby Loved It! Child Loved It!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 8nointed
Reviews.Content: I have to start out by saying I read a lot of reviews and we were a little scared to stay at circus circus, but we gave it a chance anyway. It was absolutely wonderful. Words can not express the fun we had at this hotel. Everything we needed was in the hotel. The food was wonderful (Garden Grill is a must!). It is definately a family friendly place. When we got there the check in line was so long, that we got a littlle scared, but then it moved so fast that we were checked in and in our rooms within 30 minutes. if you can request the west tower it is the nicest and the most recently built. I would stay here over and over again. And don't forget, go to the Hoover Dam, it is only about 45 minutes away. Have fun, we sure did.

Reviews.Title: “worth the pay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: myfamily (with 3 kids) and friends stayed in this hotel and it wasnt really as bad as described in some of the reviews. the accommodation was okay, check in time was fast (less than 10 mins) and we easily found our rooms (west tower) as the eleveator was conveniently located near the check in counters. the rooms, beddings as well as the bathrooms were also clean. i recommend this hotel to guests with children.

Reviews.Title: “Long wait at check in but good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were told check in was 3pm, arrived at 4:00 and found a huge line up at check in. Waited 35-60 minutes to check in, drove the kids crazy. Very busy, difficult to offload luggage in the small unloading area with the huge amount of guests. Room was clean, comfortble, and neat. Only 6 or so tv channels. Full of kids which was good, so we didnt stick out with our kid. Buffet was ok, but better deals out there if your an eater. If it weren't for the cheap hotel rate, the check in wait would have really ticked me off. I guess that was the tradeoff. Overall happy with the facilities, but hated the long check in line up.

Reviews.Title: “Good family-friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joe Tripper
Reviews.Content: My family chose this hotel because of the reputation of being family friendly, but I was a little hesitant to reserve the room because of the negative reviews on this Web site. However, I was pleasantly surprised at the whole experience. The room in the Sky Rise Tower was large and clean. In fact, I think the whole hotel looked OK -- sure, it is an older hotel but it's in satisfactory condition. The room of course didn't have a microwave or refrigerator. For a TV, it had a small 18- or 19-inch variety. For food, I admit I am a cheapo and we went to McDonald's quite a bit. I was surprised at the low prices at McDonalds. The other places to eat, from the Pizzaria and Garden Grill and Pink Pony, are good too. We never tried the buffet. Our kids, ages 11 and 14, enjoyed the Midway, pools and Adventuredome. If you are going to ride many of the rides at all, it's best to get an all-day pass. Coupons are available. Being a fairly conservative guy from Idaho, I was glad that my kids enjoyed Circus Circus without being exposed to the darker side of Las Vegas -- well, besides the gambling aspect.

Reviews.Title: “More than I anticipated”
Reviews.Author: tinker1bell
Reviews.Content: Booked a 1 week trip to Vegas at last minute - only hotel/air deal was with Circus Circus - was a little leary but did it anyway. Came home read the reviews and thought OH OH what have we done...but you know it turned out to be great - check in was a little slow (at 12:30 am) but no problem - had some medical issues which required some extra service like fridge - not a problem - everything we asked for was in the room before we got there.........room was GREAT - big, clean, nice beds and huge bathroom - was on 29th floor in the Sky Tower - disadvantage there was the long walk to the casino or strip (but then isn't everything a LONG walk in Vegas) - while they had a tram to take you to the front from the Sky Tower - it wasn't working most of the week we were there. As it was Memorial Day - it was very busy with families (lots of kids) but one expects that at this hotel...........pool was great - lots of parking......not much more I can say - the only "BAD" thing I'll say is that they could have better TV service - that sucked when you wanted to chill out in the room after a long day!!!! Other than that - we enjoyed the hotel and enjoyed the location at the North end of the Strip - a little quieter in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Elevator Nightmare with Children!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Tower Rooms on the 26th floor at the Circus Circus Hotel for five nights. WHAT A NIGHTMARE ! Here is our list ... and we are trying to be VERY KIND . . 1. Three times we had to walk down the 26 floors of STAIRS because the elevator system STINKS! Each time we tried to access the elevators we had to wait at least 30 minutes . . .and then tell our 2 young kids . . . we need to walk! 2. We were so depressed to see children in the the casino areas with very little or no direct adult supervision at UNGODLY HOURS! 3. The view from our window was nothing shy of DEPRESSING! A mere look at the top of another building or a SCARY VIEW of the TRAVEL LODGE & RV PARK! 4. FINALLY, the half hour ADVENTURE WALKS to and from our hotel room to the FAR OFF PARKING GARAGE was TOOOOOO MUCH!!!! We would NEVER STAY AT THIS HOTEL AGAIN EVEN IF OUR LIVES DEPENDED ON IT! GO ANYWHERE ELSE AND YOU WILL HAVE A BETTER STAY IN LAS VEGAS THEN WE DID! ( P.S. Run from any VACATION PACKAGE that has you staying at this hotel ! )

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful. Fantastic Value for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Newo
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel for the price. Great location on the strip. Deuce Bus stop and trolley stop in front of hotel. Monorail station is about 10 minutes walk away at the Sahara or the Hilton. Large clean comfortable room with a king size bed, lounge chair and desk. Bathroom was large and in excellent condition. Many convenience shops and dining venues within the complex.

Reviews.Title: “Worst ever”
Reviews.Author: Kenzzze
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Circus Circus in Reno many times and really liked it so I was thrown for a loop when I visited the Las Vegas hotel. We had two rooms and both were filthy. The paint on the celing was pealing. There were streaks and spots on the walls. The bathtub in one room suddenly backed up with sluge when we were not even using the bathroom. The mattresses had springs poking through. It also looked like someone threw up in the elevator days before. The staff were rude and slow. I would never stay there again, it was the worst hotel experience I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Glennswo
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Circus circus for two nights. the check in procedure was unorganized. The wait for check in was long. They tell you to be in one line and later they telll you are in the check out line. Not enought desk clerks for the number of people checking inn. After that everything was fine. I stayed in the west Tower which was very nice I think it is pretty new..The hallway was clean and the rooms were nice and big. I requested a high floor. I was on the 33rd floor facing the strip. I would suggest they have some air on when you arrive at the room. It was very hot in the room. Outside it was 102. the casino looked like it was not being maintained. Itt needs to be refurbished. I did not eat at the buffet because of bad experiences not have good food previosly. I ate at the Sahara breakfast buffet which was excellent for the money at $11.99. I ate one dinner buffet at the silverton casinot which is off the strip. they just remodeled it. It was very good. The decor made you feel like you were eating in the outdoors. Lot of videos on walls of mountains, deserts, sea shores etc. back to Circus Circus it is a great value but if you want more than basic stay somewhere else

Reviews.Title: “Stressful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: booie521
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Circus Circus for 3 nights. I would never stay there again no matter what the price is. There were 4 people in front of us and we still had to wait 30 minutes to check in. This was very hard to do with a 1 yr old and a 3 year old that had been on a plane for 6 hours. We finally got our room. We stayed in the skyrise towers. To get there we had to walk far and take two elevators and walk through the smoky casino. Then when we got to our room it was given to somebody else so we had to walk all the way back down to get new room. The hot water also did not get hot, only warm and one night there was a note on the door saying that there would be no hot water from 10pm until 6am. I think it is a hassle to stay there. It was hard to find the circus acts and everything was very spread out. Also we would have to wait about 20 minutes to see a 5 minute circus show, it was not worth it. I also did not think the buffett was worth full price, it had limited selection and long lines to get the food. I do not find this hotel kid friendly for people that have real little kids. I would reccommend a hotel off strip where checkin is quick and parking is easy and close.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel”
Reviews.Author: mdowner
Reviews.Content: I've just come back from a weeks stay in Circus Circus and thought it was a great hotel especially for the price. I was a little worried about staying here after I read a few of the reviews but my worries were put to rest as soon as I got there. I had one of the rooms in the main building on the 2nd floor and found it more than adaqute. The room had 2 double beds, bath with shower, iron/board, hair dryer, tv with pay movies, safe, phone etc. The room was in a good condition with great maid service. Rooms cleaned everyday along with clean towels. The only downside to the room was it was a little dark due to the lighting being just lamps and it could have done wth a fridge. This wasn't too much of an issue as there was a drink/ice machine at the end of the hall plus right at the bottom of the lift was a 24 hour shop. There is a bus stop right out the front of the hotel so even though it's at the north end of the strip it's easy to get around from. Most days we ended up walking as the bus service stops at every stop so can take about 30 mins to go about 4 miles. The only other downside to the buses is the inconsitantcey of them. You could easily wait for 30 minutes then see one or 2 at the same time but due the amount of people on the buses half the time the bus will drive by without stopping. I'd definitely reccomend staying at this hotel especially if you're working to a budget. You can't go wrong. If you want to be in the thick of the action though consider something near the Luxor or MGM.

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus for families with children”
Reviews.Author: jaciet
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 days stay at the Circus Circus in May 2006. The hotel was not as bad as some of the previous reviews but it was a really busy holiday weekend and there were lots and lots of small children. I probably will not stay there again because of all the children. We did eat at the buffet two times and I thought is was pretty good. We also ate at the Pink Pony a couple of times and food good there also for the price. The rooms were clean and about equal to the average local hotel room. We ate the buffet at the Belliago and I was not impressed at all considering the price. The buffet at Ceasers was much better. The only real problem we had with the hotel was they double charged my credit card and had to get that fixed. Next time will pay a little bit more money to stay at a better hotel with less children. You reviews were very helpfull in preparing us for our trip to Vegas. I hope my review will be helpfull to people considering the Circus Circus Hotel. If you are on a tight budget and have children this would be a good place to stay. Jacie T St. Cloud, Fl.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine for the price...no real problems. Recommended for budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: gemmacarolyn
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Mannor rooms at the back of CC for 3 nights. The line at check in was long when we arrived at around 4pm on a Tuesday, but the people were friendly and someone came round to enroll us into the players club, which we wanted to do anyway. The room itself was clean and tidy, and the maid service attentive, although our room wasn't cleaned on the second day because we were in our room. The rooms are basic-ours contained 1 king bed, a TV, 2 bedside tables, 2 chairs and a table, a 'fridge, a dresser, lamps and a bathroom. I would say that for $39.95 a night this was a good deal. Security was also good-outside security doors that needed a keycard to get into, plus a security guard outside at night. There was no noise from other guests. The location is obviously a little away from the centre of the strip, however, the bus stops right outside the hotel and costs $5 for a 24hr unlimited pass that takes you to all parts of the strip and downtown. It's really not that far to walk to Treasure Island, but I wouldn't want to walk further, unless you like to do that! The pool was fine-nothing special, but nice to sit at for an hour or two...clean and plenty of room for the amount of people there. We didn't gamble in the casino much, since we preffered the Riviera opposite and Slots-a-fun right next door. We didn't eat in any of the restaurants either, but didn't see lines at them when we went past. Although we didn't take children we went upstairs to the carnival games which were easy to win at and quite fun. All the children we saw there were well behaved and seemed to be having a great family vacation. The only problem we had was upon check out when they tried to charge us for a couple of phone calls we didn't make, but when we queried them they printed out what they had on their records, then cancelled all the calls off our bill-even the ones we made-so we didn't have to pay. Overall i'd say this is a very basic hotel, but great for the price. Don't let the location put you off because the bus service is great-one every 6 mins daytime/10mins night time 24hrs a day. If you're looking to spend a lot of time in your room this isn't the best hotel to choose, but for a place to lay your head it's clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Anywhere But Here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt, this is the worst place I have ever stayed. It was 102 degrees the day I arrived, and the hallways of this hotel in the Skyrise Tower will stifling hot! This is Vegas, and it gets hotter than 102 degrees. I would hate to imagine how it would feel in July. The room was another story. The most uncomfortable hotel bed ever. The room was barely cool, and it was obvious the room had not been thoroughly cleaned in some time. There was dust on top of the picture frames on the walls, the window was covered with fingerprints. Dining was marginal at the casino. We went down the street to eat after our poor waitress and adequate food at The Pink Pony. Stay away from the BUFFET at all costs. It may be cheap, but you're better off spending a few bucks. Pay a little, you get little. Next time, I'll pay twice as much and stay in a much nicer and modern place. They need to knock this building down.

Reviews.Title: “Run Forrest Run!”
Reviews.Author: SoloAdventurer88
Reviews.Content: Run from this hell hole as fast as you can - it ruined our stay in Vegas. We arrived at 4pm to join over 200 other guests in the line to check-in. We didn't queue this long at Disneyland. People and luggage were strewn across the floor throughout the lobby. It was like being in a refugee camp, except that we had all paid for the privilege of being there. We calculated that the hotel accommodates over 6,000 guests on an average night, but can probably only provide facilities to feed 1,000 in its poorly lit and grimy cafes and restaurants. The hotel seemed to be full of equally dazed guests, milling around looking for somewhere to eat that was clean and enticing and didn't involve queuing for hours. We stayed at The Manor - the dreary motel rooms at the back of the property where the "security" doors do not lock. The best thing about this hotel was the speed at which we were able to escape - they have an Express check-out feature on the room TV. The rooms are admittedly cheap, but this place ruined our stay in Vegas. Spend a few more dollars and stay closer to the action at the southern end of the strip. Oh yes and congratulations to Circus Circus for your recent win in the Vegas Dirty Carpet Awards - I believe that makes it 5 years straight now!

Reviews.Title: “Skip this place”
Reviews.Author: Smartyfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Circus Circus recently for 5 days/4 nights. While the price was great it wasn't worth being away from all the activity. Hotel is very run down and dirty. Elevators did not always work and the tv checkout system was down creating long lines at checkout. We just walked out after seeing those lines. Definitely pay the extra price and stay at MGM, New York, New York, Luxor, etc. The rest of my family stayed at MGM. The rooms there were clean, the location great and the pools were fabulous. The pools at CC are shabby at best. Some tips for staying in Vegas - leave kids home, rent a car and use valet service at all hotels (it is free at every one); put out the extra cash for the better and more centrally located hotels. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “disgusting”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Circus Circus and our first room was in the "Manor". They should not even charge people to stay in that part of the hotel. In fact, I think they should have paid us! The hallway to the room was dirty and smelly. When we got in our room, we were disgusted to see dirty carpet, dirty bathroom floor, the walls looked like they had a coating of grime on them, lights didn't work, and the air conditioning barely got cool (it was 102 degrees that day). I called the front desk and they did upgrade us to a tower room. Our new room was much more satisfactory. Nothing outstanding, but clean and tolerable. They need to demolish the "Manor" part of the hotel! The Circus Circus staff was quick to upgrade us and we were impressed with their response to the situation. We were on the 11th floor and one day we waited over 25 min. for the elevator. Unfortunately we had a lot of heavy luggage, so we didn't want to take the stairs. The tower was an OK place to stay, but if I went back I would stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was apprehensive about booking this hotel after reading some of the reviews on this site. In the end budget constraints saw us book it and we resigned ourselves to the fact that it was not going to be great. We were more than pleasantly surprised with this accommodation. We stayed in a room in the Sky Tower and it was huge and very clean and we had no complaints at all and believe me I am pretty fussy about accommodation. Value for money. The only thing about this hotel is that it is located at one end of the strip and the strip is quite long.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: brilliant place to stay this is the third time we have stayed at circus circus its good value for money staff where brilliant any thing you needed they would try and get it for you rooms where nice and spacious and cleaned every day plenty of clean towels every day loads of nice places to eat will deffinetly be going back again x x x x x

Reviews.Title: “Bring an air mattress”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: All I can say is as long as you don't plan on you or the kids sleeping comfortably then this is the place to stay. Yes it's a nice place to stay if you plan on taking the kids to Vegas with you. Our son had lots of fun at the arcade, watching the circus acts and riding rides in the adventure dome but after a long day if you think you're going to snuggle down comfortably and fall a sleep.... You better bring a mattress topper or an air mattress. We could feel the springs digging into our ribs all night long and ended up buying an air mattress to sleep on the rest of the week. The showers could be improved and the tub plug could have actually been IN the tub, but other than that we enjoyed our stay. Just be sure that if it's a good night sleep you want...bring something to put on top of the mattress or walk down to the Walgreen's and buy an air matress for $40.

Reviews.Title: “dingy, good location”
Reviews.Author: SubwayRider82
Reviews.Content: We were in the SKY TOWER. GOOD STUFF: low price, accessible location - can get anywhere if you purchase 24hr DEUCE bus pass which gives unlimited bus travel along the strip and connects to other regular city bus routes -only $5, room seemed average in cleanliness, daily maid service, worn but clean sheets, firm beds; not far from downtown for Freemont experience; near slots of fun which offers $1 blackjack up to 11am and free coffee and donuts if you play between 8am-11am; near stardust hotel & casino which has $12.99 steak & lobster dinner (can save $2 if you pull out coupon from the many promotional tourist booklets); across the street from riviera casino hotel which offers a 1lb T bone steak dinner for $10 (we had steak almost every other meal!) BAD STUFF: neglected aging/broken furnishings - one of 3 lamps in the room did not work due to broken on/off switch; knobs missing from desk drawer; white hotel towels were worn and grey; bed cover had cigarette burn holes; lamps glued to middle of table tops - can't push aside to accommodate more things on table surface;poor maintenance planning - they shut off the hotwater one night between the hours of 10pm-6am for maintenance and notified people by slipping notes under everyone's door in the afternoon of the same day they were turning off the hot water - we just happened to come back to the hotel at 9:45pm that evening and were rushing to all take showers before the hot water was turned off - inconvenience. - would have made more sense to do maintenance during the day when most of the guests are outside enjoying the city. Unusual pricing rules: all rooms are double occupancy priced and if you should have a 3rd person in the room, all three parties pay the double occupancy rate plus a premium to enable the 3rd person to stay in the room without the 3rd person getting a separate bed - in effect, you pay a premium for less service and amenities per person, eg. instead of 2 people each paying $25 for the room, 3 people had to pay $30 each for the room with the same stuff in the room as if only 2 people paid to stay in it - the hotel collects $90 instead of $50 for the same room without accompanying increase in service - a reverse of how many other hotels do things where charge is done by basic room rate divided by number of occupants + low premium for extra bed. We were there for 5 nights and had to call for an extra set of towels and soap for 3 of the 5 days there. ROUNDUP: Ok to visit for first timers who aren't too fussy and on a budget and travelling double occupancy. If you are three adults travelling together, you might do better at another place that prices the room for what they offer as opposed to head count.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: mrwillyjay
Reviews.Content: I Stayed here from 1 May-6 May and had no problems. The room was large and clean as was the bath room. Not a lot of channels on the TV but I didn't come here to watch TV. Pool was small but I didn't come here to swim. On another subject the local bus service named The Duce which runs the length of the strip and sells 24 hour passes for $5 often has a 45 minute wait.

Reviews.Title: “viva las vegas - the circus circus hotel”
Reviews.Author: griseldis
Reviews.Content: i spent some days in the circus circus hotel las vegas during a california roundtrip in feb. this year. i found the hotel ok, my single room was large, everything functioned properly. towels were clean, i got about 6 new ones very day, new shower gel, etc. cleaning was carried out daily and well, maids were friendly. the buffet was huge, all you can eat, it was ok as well. as the circus hotel is very large like most las vegas hotels it is very easy to get lost, really. it is not expensive and it is not a luxury resort and it might need a bit of renovation but it is perfectly ok for the room rate you pay. don´t shy away from booking it.

Reviews.Title: “Run down and dirty”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very run down and dirty. Our lights in our room did not work and were never fixed . Staff at hotel did not seem to care about the awful experience we had from the moment we walked in the door. The area was not safe for our 15 yr daughter. Pool was fillthy. We did not have enough towels for our family. The list is long, but just wanted to let travelers know to beware. This was the worst experience we have had as a family at any hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in LV. I was a bit nervous of staying at Circus Circus b/c I've read some less than stellar reviews. I decided to give it a whirl. We have relatives in the area and I figured we could stay w/ them if the hotel was intolerable. I was very pleasantly surprised. Check in took no more than 10 mintues. Check out took about the same amount of time. Our room was spacious and clean. I found the mattress to be comfortable, my daughter thought it was too hard. The A/C system worked very well. I've been to many hotels where it only blows warm air. The buffet was OK. I've been to better, but I've been to worse. The staff were helpful and friendly any time I dealt w/ them. Only 2 complaints. The foot traffic in the lobby was totally insane. It was worse than NYC at Christmas time. The other thing was more annoying. I was trying to leave my room around 11:30 on Sunday morning. I was never able to get an elevator. All the elevators were full of people w/ lots of luggage checking out of the hotel. I ended up having to take the stairs which were also full of people and luggage. I was nervous that I'd be stuck in this same throng when I checked out (on Wednesday). I was not. There was no problem at all at that time. I would recommend Circus Circus. The rooms are very reasonably priced. Save your money for shows and gambling. How much time does one really spend in the hotel room?

Reviews.Title: “The Best Deal on Las Vegas...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fabulous... we stayed here already and our last visit was horrible... now after 3 years... we satyed here again and it really improved... make sure you book your room in the WEST TOWER!!! It was the best visit in Las Vegas ever and hopefully it will make yours also.

Reviews.Title: “deteriorated in the last year”
Reviews.Author: westsussex10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel a year ago and had a great time, however it has deteriorated noticeably in the last year. We rebooked the West Tower as last year the bedrooms/bathrooms were brand new, and a good size. They have now had a year's wear and tear and we had to phone room maintenance on 2 consecturive days for a blocked sink and a faulty bath plug. The most noticeable deterioration was with the buffet though, which was good last year. We visited for breakfast on our first day - but never went back. The 100% orange juice was heavily watered down, as was the coffee out of the self serve machines, the breakfast patries were all far from fresh and the hot buffet was of a generally poor standard. We did however have a very good $9.99 prime rib dinner at the Pink Pony Restaurant within Circus Circus, which was so good we went back for another one!

Reviews.Title: “Picked it because it was Cheap”
Reviews.Author: Tritrillian
Reviews.Content: Stayed for seven nights Mar 12-19. My frist visit to Las vegas. I worried about previous reviews but my daughter had stayed here twice. She said to stay here for cheap and spend money on other stuff. Check in was fast only five minutes. We did see line ups at other times.The woman at check in very friendly when I told her we were here for my birthday she found us a room with a view on a non-smoking floor. The room she gave us had not be made up yet. I just called the desk got another room right away no wait. We needed extra pillows called house keeping, they came in ten minutes. Rooms were large. Really only two complaints. The mattresses had seen better days(much like my own) and should be replaced. And the room had a connecting door to the next room and unlike some hotels it was just a single door. So the first night my daughter said the newborn baby next door cried seven times during the night(I wear earplugs as she is a fierce snorer) I thought the casino was ok (we are not big time gamblers) We only ate at the Pink Pony. The food was OK but the service was horrible(I think it was just our waitress she disappeared for twenty minutes)Otherwise we found the staff to be couteous and helpful. When we checked out there was no wait, and as we were not leaving Las Vegas until quite late we left our bags at the bell desk. I did find getting around in Vegas to be frustrating. The Deuce would be fine if it ran with the frequency its Website says and it did not take ten minutes at every stop for people to get on. The stop in front of Slots of Fun has a ticket machine I don't recall seeing any others. They would speed up the service if people were prepared before getting on the Bus. Lengthy discussions by people "Honey should we get the pass or sinlge tickets? Is it cheaper for kids? Oh! you don't make change?" While eveyone waits. But beyond that I REALLY enjoyed my visit and will be back at Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A warning to all families thinking that staying at this hotel is a good idea - STOP!! We have just returned early from our 5 day vacation mainly due to the intolerable conditions at this hotel. The hotel is quite dirty and in terrible repair. During our limited stay we noticed room service trays in the halls for days, and many of the elevators and escalators were either inoperable or on the verge of breaking down. In fact, there were many roomers between the other hotel guests about how people were stuck in some elevators which broke and the fire department were called in to rescue them. This hotel was built in the late 60's and it feels that they have not made a real effort to maintain and repair the hotel since. The services are nearly non-existant. Room service is only available during the morning hours and most of the restaurants are only open during certain hours. For a family with kids this is ridiculous. You end up scheduling your day around thier operating hours and not your activities. What kind of vacation is that. There is no real spa or gym services and everything in the rooms are bolted down. It makes you feel that they think your going to steal the $10 alarm clock. The food at the buffet was disgusting. Other than being cold and hard(pancakes) it was obvious that it was under the heat lamp for a long long time before I got to it. The other restaraurants were marginal at best as well as the service. My wife noted that it seemed that it seemed that all of the service personnel that could not make it at a real hotel ended up here. Many of the hotel employees were very rude in general. Everyone from the security guards to the front desk were rude to us and generally gave us the feeling that they did not want us or themselves to be there. Given all of this we left early. A first in all of my vacations. They should stick to their one strength the adventure dome. My kids loved it. They should knock down the hotel and expand the adventure dome. It seems to be the only thing they know how to do. My advice is to stay somewhere, anywhere else and visit the adventure dome.

Reviews.Title: “Better than average”
Reviews.Author: jayala2k
