Reviews.Content: Heard some bad things but could not turn down great rate. I was at the hotel for 5 days and found the hotel casino to be well kept with good service. My room was very clean and the bed was better than average.

Reviews.Title: “CANT WAIT”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I lIVE IN AZ. AND I meet freinds from New York at circus every year once a year and I cannot wait, we always have a great time do yo'all go to vegas to sleep? We love slots o fun and there is so much to do and if you cant find something good to eat there is something wrong with you, I would say the only thing wrong with it is the gawking parents dragging their screaming poor little children around , they dont look like they are having much fun to me. I am due for a trip again this June and I am counting the weeks .

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: bonabona
Reviews.Content: We went to Las Vegas from Italy in the 2005. We've an hotel (The name is "Ulivo") in the Italian Riviera at Diano Marina. We found the Circus Circus Hotel nice & cheap, the ideal place for Families and simple youngs like us. Ok for informal people. Ciao Ciao

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We wanted a cheap place to leave our stuff so we could go out and see vegas, baby!! If you are not homeymooners how much time do you spend in your room anyway? we got an awesome deal ($100 canadian for 3 days!!), and we asked for an upgrade on our room at check in and we got one, plus our phone fee was waived. Lesson:it pays to be nice to stressed staff in costume!! the bell boys (Tim) were helpful, and gave us great off strip ideas. Yes the hotel is a little older, but the savings are worth it. Appreciate the cheese and live it up! The carpets are trippy, and we noticed that the casino was always pretty clean. The slots o fun next door is a blast- pays out well, with friendly dealers, fellow bluecollar gamblers are more fun. The walk to the wynn and the fashion show mall is only 10 minutes, the hotel is not as out of the way as people make it out to be, if you are not a fat [--] and don't mind a walk. the rooms are a little dim, and lack a sewing kit, but really, who are we kidding? if you want to spend a ton of money on a room you are never in then stay at the bellagio. if you want to meet cool people and blow cash on tables, then stay here. and you have to walk forever to get to any room in any hotel, not just this one. that's how they get you to sit at the tables on the way by... duh! cheap people should no be so picky.

Reviews.Title: “Spend More $ and Go to a Different Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Circus Circus a few years ago and I still cannot forget what a terrible experience it was. I have been meaning to write this review and I feel if I can save one family from going to this hotel, it will still be worth writing it. Upon entering the hotel, it is how obvious what dire need this hotel is of renovating. We were on the 12th floor (?not totally sure) but I remember the elevators always being broken and large lines and long waits for the 1 or 2 that did. I remember families being allowed to sleep on the benches in the casino, they must not have rooms. I remember smoke/fire alarms going off often. One time we left the building, only to see no one else paying attention to this alarm. We went to the front desk and was told that they go off and not to worry about it!!!!! The room was ok but dated and I felt like I needed to clean it. I see others have written the location is good. It is on the very end of the strip and we thought not convenient at all. Anyone thinking of this hotel, please spend more money and head up the strip to a nicer hotel. You will be grateful you did.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Phone Fee!”
Reviews.Author: PegnGeo
Reviews.Content: The hotel has seen better days, with everything from the casino areas to the rooms needing a good remodel. Our room was clean, but the connection for the hand-held shower was corroded and badly leaking, and a bathroom light was burned out, and even though we reported it, it was never replaced. The lighting was poor thoughout the room. We did not have kleenex for the first two nights of our stay. When we tried to use the express check out, we had a $3 dollar fee for local telephone calls that we though was an error. (Actually, we thought the maid had used our phone, and we did not leave her a tip as a result.) We had to go down to Reception and wait in line and when we disputed the phone charge, they said they charge everyone $3 for the telephone even if it is not used, and we should have been informed about the fee when we checked in. It is only $3, but they charge each room that, and many people may not dispute it because of the time involved. The hotel is located far away from the new part of the Strip, where most of the activities are, and it costs $2 per person each way, and it is often difficult to get a bus, as they are full and don't run on schedule. Between the shabbiness of the hotel, the bad location and that ridiculous phone fee, we will not return to the hotel. This is not the place to go if you don't have kids.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest experience”
Reviews.Author: Darlynn1995
Reviews.Content: We did not have the best experience with Circus Circus. First of all, we pulled into the driveway off the strip and there were no parking spaces. We had to pull back onto the strip (no easy task). We called the hotel to find their parking area and were told to come in back to the Valet parking area. When we got there it said "Valet parking full". So, we found a space ourselves and parked. We then got our kids and our suitcases and proceeded to walk quite a distance to the doors. At which point we were greeted with a line for check in that was about 50 people deep (no kidding!). After 1 hour, we finally made it up to check in and the lady behind the counter gives us a hard time (okay, I would be grouchy too if I had that many people waiting in line). We were given room 29749 out of 29750 rooms. It was way out of the way! (you have to go up to level 2 and walk quite a distance, go through the skyrise casino and then catch another elevator to the 29th floor, Very inconvenient). I wouldn't have minded so much, if the room was at least facing the best part of the strip, but we got one with a view facing the other direction. Then we wanted to take our kids to the adventure dome. It closes at 6pm on the weekdays! I thought this was Las Vegas, a city that never sleeps! A lot of the shops were closed too. Lady luck was not on our side!! On the up side.. The elevators were fast and my kids won a couple of stuffed animals in the midway. The free circus acts were good, they need to vary the types of performances though. We saw three acts and each one had two performers doing different hand stands on each other. Oh yeah, and what's up with being asked every 5 seconds if we were going to be in Vegas for a couple of days? There is someone around every corner ready to pounce on you. We made a game out of dodging them afer a while. Ridiculous, leave me alone!!! All in all, I would say this experience has soured me on ever going to Las Vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden telephone charges”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked into Circus Circus because it is cheaper than other Hotels on The Strip. Rooms have two double beds and were immaculate, excellent maid service and facilities. However, on arrival we were asked to pay $7.00 telephone charges in advance for any local calls made during our week stay. I informed reception we would not need this as we did not know anyone to phone. Apparently everyone staying at Circus Circus has to pay this irrespective of whether they use phone or not and it is not refunded on departure. Quite a nice little earner for them!! If you don't have transfers to Hotel use Hopper bus from airport, $5.00 per individual to your Hotel. Lots of children in Circus Circus as you might expect particularly over the weekend. Next door you can find 'Slots A Fun' also owned by Circus Circus - really cheap, Margaritas and draught beer for 75c, cheapest roulette on Strip, hotdogs for $1.29 etc and free coffee and doughnuts between 0800 - 1000hrs. Riviera opposite does an excellent Tbone steak for £9.99 including soup or salad starter - massive!!!! Weather up and down at the moment, we had sleet one day and not too warm.

Reviews.Title: “love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Pink83
Reviews.Content: I dont know why people slate this hotel i have been to Vegas 4 times due to return April of this year and i love it. I have never seen it dirty and the staff are always polite and friendly. The rooms are big and spacious and are always cleaned well. The thing i like most about this hotel is the friendly warm atmosphere. In many of the other hotels i have visited many holidaymakers waltz around with airs and graces and when im holiday i do not want this, i simply want to chill out, relax and enjoy myself without worrying whos watchig! I like to visit the other hotels dont get me wrong but i wouldnt choose to stay there. Ok circus circus has a lot of kids, its kid friendly and it doesnt hide this, so if you dont want kids round do not pick this hotel. I think it is silly to pick it and then complain! When we stay we like to stay in the main tower as it is nearest to the casino and buffet!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We planned to stay here for a night so that our children could see all the lights on the strip, then move over to Fremont street. Never again! check in took forever. Aside from the person checking us in, the staff was very unfriendly. We went to the adventuredome and took our kids on an age appropriate ride, which one of them was too scared to stay on. After about 10 or 15 seconds the attendant stopped the ride (grudgingly), but after we got our crying child off, she refused to give back our tickets. I later spoke to another employee who said she should have as that was the hotel's policy, but at that point, we were so disgusted with the whole experience we just left(minus the $8 for the ride tickets). Also, if you are out in town and need to ask hotel staff a question, forget it-the phone system seems to be set up to keep anyone from talking to an actual live human being. If you like being herded in like cattle, then ignored once you have paid for your room, Circus Circus is just the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “As bad as it smells”
Reviews.Author: JayKun
Reviews.Content: This hotel was decent.It wasn't rat-infested or anything like that to make me hate it completly, but we did not like it. For one, it was dirty. The floors were poorly vaccumed, the halls and rooms, even non-smoking ones, smelled of smoke. We had a tough time actually getting a decent room. And the cleaning staff basically makes your bed and puts some towels in the bathroom. Hardly any TV chanels, and I warn parents, the only "kid" friendly channel 24/7 is "Clown TV". A repeating loop of clowns in tv show knockoffs to advertise for the hotel's buffets etc. Also, loud toilets.

Reviews.Title: “A wonder hotel with wonderul amenities”
Reviews.Author: matthewcookies930407
Reviews.Content: I am sure that the fare for staying in Circus Circus in the cheapest in Las Vegas but also the best hotel in Las Vegas. I am a bussiness traveller to LAS and I found the this hotel is friendly for children but also for adults. Theme parks is excellent. Service is quite good and the crowns always make children and their parents laugh. The dinner in Circus Circus is good. Well done for this hotel and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay”
Reviews.Author: Sarah73Ireland
Reviews.Content: I have to say that my stay at the circus circus was a pleasant one. I had read previously all the negative reviews and was expecting the worst, but I was happy when we got to our room and found it spacious and clean. I went with a wedding party of 15 and no-one had anything to complain about. The wedding went off without a hitch and the staff at the chapel were very helpful and polite. The only thing I would say is be prepared for the walk from the casino - front door, to get to your room! Other than that all was good.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: txadams06
Reviews.Content: Room was big and clean. Stayed in the West Tower with a view on the strip side. Food is below average, with the exception of The Steak House which was absolutely fantastic. Pink Pony Cafe, Circus Buffet, and the food court are to be avoided, unless you like having an upset stomach. The main casino area is very crowded, with long waits for reasonable ($10/$15 hand) blackjack. Slots are very tight here. Huge lines to check in every day we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Kids loved it and practical for Mom and Dad”
Reviews.Author: BrettT
Reviews.Content: What to do with a weekend when its raining in San Diego? Why not take the whole family to Las Vegas. This was our first outing to Las Vegas as a family. My wife and I visit about twice a year and have stayed at most of the higher-end hotels on the strip. It was all about the kids this trip so we decided on Circus Circus. The hotel definately looks older and more tired than some others, but for the price (two room suite - clean rooms) and the attractions for the kiddies, it was worth it. Buffet was unimpressive but the "Adventure Dome" was a big hit for the kids and was well worth the near $100 for all five of us to get in on all-day passes. I was surprised with the amount of smoke in a family oriented hotel. I guess if you don't like the smoke or if it bothers you then don't go to vegas. Anyway, great trip and practical. Also recommend the Dolphins and "big cat" exhibits at the Mirage.

Reviews.Title: “i wish i was there now i love it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i have been to vegas three times and each time i have stayed at circus circus the last time i stayed there was for 12 nights and throughly enjoyed it.the staff are very helpfull and it is kept very clean and tidy. one of the very many things i enjoyed doing at circus circus was sitting in the "horse around bar" where i enjoyed the cocktails whilst watching the fabulisous circus entertainment.i miss vegas so much but to me when i think of vegas i think of circus circus because i enjoy it so much there.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: TangSooPap
Reviews.Content: The accommodations were pretty good for the price and the room very clean but there’s needed improvement. Most of staff was friendly, a few were indifferent. The ice machine never worked and after the first night it wore a “Temporarily Out of Order” sign on it for the remainder of the stay. The water was never really hot for showers and on the last morning it was down right chilly. The kid liked the place so that was a plus. The pizza at the pizzeria was excellent, the buffet was adequate. By the way, “the Duce” (a double decked bus) is much more reliable than the trolley for getting around the strip with wait times of 10 minutes vs. a half hour.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Review "Circus Circus"”
Reviews.Author: rockpebblar
Reviews.Content: Arrived expecting high standards within the hotel, initial appearences were not good..seemed a big grubby and past its sell by date. On check in, was given directions to room and expected to walk through casino/shopping mall negotiate stairs and lifts with my luggage, managed to find room eventually after two wrong directions taken putting a little extra journey on to the 1/4 mile to room. Room stank of tobacco smoke, fire alarm was hanging off the ceiling and plumbing was a joke! it took 10 minutes to empty the bath after a shower. Plus's were the location (at the end of the strip) and the friendliness of most of the staff. A good meal (and I mean a good meal) could be had 24/7 in the "Pink Pony" within the hotel and of course the amount of slot machines and tables left nothing to be desired. When I compare the Circus Circus with other hotels I have stayed in throughout the world, it was by no means the worst, but there were no facilities at all in the room, so if I wanted a tea/coffee it was the choice of room service or a half mile hike to the cafe. A nice jesture was the "Spliff" I found inside the safe when clearing it out...would have preferred it if the management had left me a bottle of wine or basket of fruit though!

Reviews.Title: “Horrid”
Reviews.Author: jan047
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. Like many of the hotels on the strip it is huge and bussling with lots of people. Our room was clean and big and have no complaints about it. However money was taken from our room on our 4th night and our safe had been broken in to. The staff were not helpful and really didn't seem to care that we had money taken. I would not stay at this hotel again or recommend it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Like A Horrid Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Chengstatraveler
Reviews.Content: When first arriving at the hotel I found screaming kids running all over the place in a smog filled enviroment. I ignored it until they started running into me, feeling incredibly annoyed I stepped into my room. The room was decent but looked past its prime. I hardly spent any time inside the hotel. The adventure dome looked fun for kids but the food at the buffet lacked the art of Vegas buffets, as did the rest of the hotel to Vegas. Honestly, the only reason the hotel hasen't fell to ashes along with the sands and aladdin is because of the Adventure dome. If parents have kids I reccoment you to stay somewhere else and go to the adventuredome during the day, you'll thank me for it.

Reviews.Title: “Traveling Senior Ladies”
Reviews.Author: Margaret_Mary
Reviews.Content: Four traveling Seniors stayed here from 2/23/06 to 2/27/06 and had an enjoyable time. Met our cousins from Ireland here for their first visit to L.V. We had lots of fun playing the slots and seeing shows at other locations. The room was fine, clean bathroom with minimal amenties, but who cares, we brought our own anyhow. Ate at their inexpensive restaurants, food was OK, but don't eat at the Buffet unless you have a really large appetite, much to choose from. This was a weekend and loaded with people, many families with children doing the Circus attractions and many Teenagers (probably Locals). Had stayed here a few years ago and would stay again, certainly not deluxe but who spends all their time in a Hotel room?

Reviews.Title: “Never Again Circus Circus”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've been to Las Vegas on numerous occassions, and as far as this trip is concerned...never again!! A lot of the rides in the Adventuredome were not running, the Hotel was unclean, no soap in one of the restrooms in the Hotel, one restroom was Out of Order next to the Buffet (which was extremely inconvenient with a child). The Hotel smelled horrible and one of the cashiers in the casino (a male) was extremely rude when asked a simple question. The morning Buffet was OK, but as for the dinner buffet, it was inedible. I will never recommend anyone to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “cicus is circus”
Reviews.Author: thebakes1959
Reviews.Content: In the land of plenty, Circus is what is is...an inexpensive place to be in Vegas..Food is OK.. the Pizzaria has decent, affordable food... the buffet (or, as I like to call it, The KILLER BUFFET)is overpriced and ,again, average..the Pink Pony is your very typical coffee shop...Gambling is good..

Reviews.Title: “Not very clean and more expensive than other good hotels.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Las Vegas. We always enjoyed the area a lot. However, this hotel is not in the best neighborhood and more expensive than Aladin and others. The rooms were big and clean but the rest of the hotels not so. No intentions of ever go back to that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Was satisfied overall”
Reviews.Author: missamy1978
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from Feb 1st to the 5th. Overall we were very satisfied with our room. Very clean with daily maid service. Room was big and had a nice sized bathroom. Hotel was pretty calm until friday night into saturday morning. Saturday night was a nightmare! So overrun with children that you couldn't walk. We could hear every word of the conversations coming through the walls on either side of us. Beds were hard as a rock but we were so exausted we didn't care! This was our first trip to Vegas and it was a blast! I probably would not stay here again. I would advise you stay at a hotel were the Monorail stops..would make getting around town and back and forth to your room much easier! In all honesty, your not in your room that much so don't spend a fortune on your hotel..go cheap...and put the rest of your money on the Blackjack tables...because it is Vegas Baby! Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Old and dumpy...Never again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 23-26 Feb & didn't have a pleasant stay. The room we stayed in was in the Skyline tower which was old and musty. The walls were paper thin and we enjoyed hearing the screaming kids next door at 4:00 am. Evidently the number of people you can have in your room is not enforced, the family(s) next door to us had no less then 10 people staying there. The lamp shades were missing in our room and the nightstand drawer was half torn off. There was mold in the shower & the carpet smelled of who knows what. If you are looking for a place to take a shower & hit the strip, this is your place. There were kids running wild unsupervised for the 3 nights we stayed there. We also enjoyed the 10+ minute walk to the skyline tower. This place needs updating in the most urgent way. The only plus to our stay here was the fact I took this casino for a nice chunk of money gambling here. Avoid this place if you can, if not, bring ear & nose plugs with you.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely vile”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well, Where do I begin. I felt like I was staying in a sleazy motel with who knows what under the surface. The photos on the web look good but they do not show the grubby worn look of everything. I was nervous even getting into the bed incase of what I may find. The place had a feel that it needed a good scrub down, remodel, new everything actually. The place is great for kids. That is it though. Very tacky and never again.

Reviews.Title: “beware cab drivers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: our stay was okay,except for buffet,not the place for people without kids ,tooo many kids for me.rude cab driver ,must had bad day.also rude personnel in poney cafe,one in particular, might have been just us.place really needed a makeover .also be careful checking out on tv ,might purchace movie hahaha,what i get for not being carful

Reviews.Title: “trip of 2005”
Reviews.Author: dian7
Reviews.Content: we stayed at circus circus, last may 2005, we enjoyed the hotel& casino very much ,however the buffet could be improved on.. the rooms are large and clean,and we slept comfortably. We enjoyed it so much we are going back in march break of this year. see you then.. d lachance thunder bay ont. canada we stayed on may 1 2005 until may5 2005 we are returning on march 12-17 2006

Reviews.Title: “A Las Vegas classic!”
Reviews.Author: americantraveler080
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the circus circus hotel with family members in September of '05. GOOD POINTS: Room on the 25th floor in the Skyrise Tower (room 25724) had an ok view of the strip, restaurants were delicious, front desk personnel were very helpful and friendly, and the midway and circus was the most fun thing I saw on the whole trip, and the parking was great! Las Vegas was awsome! BAD POINTS: Room smelled smoky even though it was "Non Smoking", the comforters had cigarette burns in them, the brekfast buffet was cold and wasn't very tasty, and the pools were ice cold; we couldn't even go in up to our knees! You had to walk thru the casino to get to the elevators to the rooms, and after a long day seeing the sights and then coming into a noisy surrounding, it wasn't very restful, but of course this is Vegas. For my family, it didn't bother them too much. Overall, it was a classic hotel that was very nice with a couple of problems. My family and I enjoyed it,

Reviews.Title: “This Circus Act needs to close down”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms were dirty (i.e. windows not cleaned for 2 years). 4 rooms later we were finally in a room with a toilet that didn't run all night, but we had to deal with springs in our backs all night while we slept (tried to) in this aweful room. The 1st room was very smokey (we requested a non smoking room), 2nd room there were guests already in it, the 3rd room remote did not work, toilet ran all night, AC did not work, some strange beeping from the wall, shower was old and dirty. We had travelled a long distance to visit with family and also have a nice family vacation. We made the best of the Hotel, but would never stay here again. Also the outside pool was only open when they could find someone to work. The hours are only 9-5pm. Only 1 of the 2 pools were open (life guard was also very sleepy!). Don't try to get in touch with anyone at the front desk in a hurry. Each time we called we were holding at least 15-20 minutes for an answer, and once the phone was answered the Hotel Staff was very rude. Signed-- Unhappy Circus Circus Guests-Close down this Circus Act.

Reviews.Title: “Trailer Park of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: BEDEE
Reviews.Content: 3 Words sum it up... Dirty, Dingy, Dump. Do yourself a favor and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Was OK but wouldnt stay again”
Reviews.Author: RAEAUST
Reviews.Content: Arriving after a 20 hour flight and not having slept for 48 hours I was informed when I first arrived I had not booked for that day (Australia being a day behind the US I had inadvertly booked Sunday night onwards when I landed on the Saturday). It was my mistake so I just told the reception girl there I would pay for another night. The hotel was fully booked which was fair enough, so she advised me to look for another hotel for that night. What annoyed me being my first trip to the US was there was no offer of ringing another Hotel to check availability or a recomendation of where to go for me it was just, bad luck, next customer. Which I would think be the courteous thing to do. I ended up getting a room at the Riviera for the night. The food is the worst there I tried the Buffet, and tried the blue pony I think it was called yuck,yuck,yuck, then gave up go to the Bellagio or one of the better hotels for food. Loved that Krispy Kreme though! The room was well appointed and clean. Very busy place with lots of kids, which I like actually, having two myself and doing this trip alone. They have a carnival there which my kids would have loved. Some of the staff where good, most absolutely atrocious. For a circus type theme hotel its not very jolly. Its a tired looking place and when I go back this year I will stay somewhere else, they do a very good job at making you feel like you are cattle. By the end of my stay here I could only say "moo"

Reviews.Title: “Basic but ok, Clean room and hot shower!”
Reviews.Author: barkinpablo
Reviews.Content: One thing to say straight away is you get what you pay for! Circus Circus is one of the cheapest hotels on the strip so you cannot really expect it to be a four star property. Stayed in room 1235 in the main tower from Jan 31 until Feb 7 and it was ok, the room was clean, and very spacious with it being one of the large king tower rooms. We had a King bed and a separate seating area including a sofa, chair and a coffee table. The bed was comfy and clean, no sign of any strange marks or stains. The furniture was very tired and this is the main complaint, they really do need some new furnishings including sofas chairs and carpets, it is starting to show its age! The bathroom was clean but on the small side, but as you don't spend a lot of time in there it really wasn't a problem, the shower was instantly hot every time we used it including peak time in the morning 7am until 9am. Plenty of clean towels. We waited 20 minutes to check in but the queue was small by comparison to hotels such as MGM and Bellagio where we saw hundreds of people queuing! I really would have been annoyed if the queue had been as big as those hotels! There were children in the hotel but at no time did I see them in the casino! and the only place they were a problem was on the midway but that is where they are meant to be so I couldn't complain. Staff were friendly and helpful, we requested a room change due to being given a non smoking room and within 5 minutes we had a new room with a security guard waiting for us with new keys, impressive. Cocktail waitresses were plentiful in the evening, and the bar staff were on the ball. Overall I would say this hotel is exactly what I expected for the price, I would recommend it for people on a budget. Walking time to Bellagio was about 30 minutes for us and a taxi from MGM to CC cost us $12, to the stratosphere from CC was a 15 minute walk and a taxi from CC to Freemont street cost us £12 also.

Reviews.Title: “Not very good”
Reviews.Author: bradhouse1
Reviews.Content: The place is over run with children. The beds were hard. One door was torn off the armoire.

Reviews.Title: “Dont waste your time!!!”
Reviews.Author: kiwinurse
Reviews.Content: We stayed here mid january 2006 and were very dissapointed. It took us 45 minutes to check in!! the place is filthy, the staff are rude and unhelpful and the rooms are in desperate need of a makeover. For the same price or a little more move closer into the strip...trust me its worth it! I would never go back to this hotel...one of the worst hotels I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place at all”
Reviews.Author: lma55806
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights last week. Room was fine, pretty much just as we expected. No problems with the water, pressure or not having hot water. Never had any wait for the elevators at anytime of the day or night, never had any problems with the staff or maid service and our requests for additional items for the room were met promptly. The buffet, what can you say, pretty so-so but what do you expect from a buffet. All in all this is a decent place to stay for cheap with things for the kids to do.

Reviews.Title: “Great room - horrible casino!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at Circus Circus and had mixed feelings about it. Our room was great - very large and spacious and wonderful views of the mountains and the Northern strip. The bathroom was also very large and spotless. THe only thing I would have liked was a fridge to keep drinks in. However. the rest of the place is altogether different. THe place is indeed a circus! THe place is enormous. Our room number had FIVE digits! IT is easy to get lost, and it is a long walk to the stripside entrance through all the casino rooms. THe casino parts were pretty awful in our opinion. Endless slot machines and the associated beeping and smokiness. Not a great deal of effort has been made to make the inside attractive comared to, say, New York New York. We spent an afternoon in the adventuredome, which was fun, but only worth doing using the 2 for 1 voucher you get by staying there. Overpriced otherwise. We also used a 2 for 1 voucher to visit the buffet on the first night, which was thoroughly disappointing. What it had in variety and value it lacked in quality. We got the rooms very cheaply (approx $100 for 2 nights) and it was great value. HOwever, there are nicer hotels on the strip in terms of outward appearance and internal layout. Customer service was fine in our limited experience. We locked ourselves out of our room just before checkout, and they resolved this very quickly and checked us out at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Go someplace else.”
Reviews.Author: Blond4
Reviews.Content: My son and I just got back from Vegas last night. We went with a big group and we all stayed in the Circus, Circus. Mainly because we had kids with us and also it was cheap. I would never had stayed there otherwise. There were some positives. The maid service was good, no complaints, and the staff seemed friendly. The rooms were so-so, definately needs to be updated. It reminded me of a budget motor lodge. We did stay in one of the west tower rooms, and it was fairly easy to get to. I tended to shower in the afternoon, so the pressure and temperature were fine. I would instead have a quick bath in the morning. We ate at the buffet twice, both times for breakfast. It was not great, and the place was confusing. We ate at the Pink Pony once for dinner, and it was disgusting. Do not go there! The service was bad and the food was bad as well. Don't waste your time. Next time I am in Vegas, I would definately stay some place else. I don't mind paying the extra. My 9yr old son hated it at Circus, Circus. One thing I have warn you, is they charge a fortune if you call long distance from your room phone. Try not to do it. I almost had a heart attack with the amount they charged. I have stayed in hotels around the world, and have used the hotel phones to call long distance, and this was the most expensive. If you have a chance to use your cell phone to call long distance, you would be better doing that I think. You have check that out. One positive thing, is that it was quiet where we were, no noise whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not in the best of shape, hotle couldn't handle crowd control”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was ok but getting there was a hastle. They have an evlevator problem in tower rooms. Had to take stairs due to all elevators being full every morning. Even the escalator was broke for our 5 day stay. Way too many little kids hanging around in the hallways with no parents in sight?

Reviews.Title: “Could be a lot worse!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Circus Circus one night on our way to Disneyland. It was a Sunday night. After reading reviews we got a West Tower Room for $46 a night on their website. It was good. No real complaints. We were able to check in early, around 11am. Check in wasn't until 2pm. The front desk was friendly, asked us what floor we wanted to stay. We told them the higher the better. We had a great view on the west side of town. We really didn't stay here long but my only complaint would have to be the water pressure!! It sort of made a groaning sound and flipped back and forth from low water pressure to even lower water pressure. If you've got kids don't miss the free circus show they do every 30 minutes under the big top. We've stayed at the Tropicana and Aladdin. They were more high quality, but if you're on a budget Circus Circus is a great value!

Reviews.Title: “Urgent Improvement”
Reviews.Author: Tabinin
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights in this hotel for a recent big event in Las Vegas. All other hotels were full therefore had not too many options so gave a shot. I was located at the Manor building, which is at a 5-10min walk from the lobby, at a trhee-sotory buildings complex crossing a street besides the main building. After the walk, which was confusing, when I got to Manor, my first impression was of upset, the buldings are poorly maintained and all inside, carpets, elevator, stairs "looked" very old and not clean. Perhaps it was actually clean but I could not confirm that only by its appearance. Once in the room, the room smelled like "closed", not like any ohter hotel I have stadyed before, it was unconfortable. The bed had a mattress of a road-side motel quality, very cheap all in general. I was disapointed in this stay, and afraid of leaving my laptop in the room, anybody could enter the building. Fortunately nothing happened. I am not rating it as Terrible but it is not Okay neither, a good thing it is on the strip. They need an urgent improvement if they want to keep people coming, I am not coming to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “What an absolute disgrace!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Aussieduo
Reviews.Content: My Husband and i arrived at Circus Circus after driving from Anaheim (we were so proud we didnt drive down the wrond side of the road once!!- being Aussies this was a mean feat!) to enter the main carpark off the strip (or so we thought!) only to be sent out of that carpark onto a side street then into another and totally confused, the parking instructions for checking in were very unclear so we pulled up and parked behind another car..... We got inside to ferals everywhere, people just sitting on the floor with beers and plastic plates of food and the lighting was very dim, my husband and i looked at each other with disbelief! Now we understood that Vegas was going to be busy as we were checking in on the 30/12/05 and out on the 2/1/06- New Years Eve, a very busy time but still.... we thought that there would be some standards. We lined up in a line which seemed to take forever and that was cool we expected that- what we didnt expect was the rudeness and attitude we copped from the check in staff. I asked a guy behind the bellhop desk if we had left the car in the correct spot- i was met with a very rude response and must have looked so shocked that another older staff member called me over and asked if i was ok- he was the only person the whole time we were at the hotel that gave us the time of day. So we are given te instructions to our room, we had were in a Tower room. We drove out to another carpark accross the street then went up the lift which took us into the casino, we then had to find how to get up any further to our room on hte 11th floor.... we had to ask as the sign was so small we missed. So we wait for another lift, go up to the 11th floor and get out to a hallway covered in wet towels under the ice machine (the same towels were there the entire trip, the towles were swimming in water eventually.... very disgusting!) The room was fine, the bed was lovely and the maid service was ok, we had left a do not disturb sign on our door and when we returned from the outlets for the day we discovered our sign was on the inside of our door and our room had been made up- we specifically did NOT want anyone in our room as we had bought a new suitcase while we were out and had things spread in piles over the room. Room service only exists from 6am-11am so forget dinner! The Casino was an absolute disaster, i had heard that there would be kids around- thats cool-im a teacher that wasnt too much of a worry. BUT what disgusted me the most was the ammount of children and babies and toddlers who were sleeping on the floors or on the chairs which line the walls. not only were there children sleeping there bu teenagers and adults at times. It was incredibly difficult to move through the lobby, as the ammount of people that were in the casino was a joke. Children of all ages were sitting on the floor next to the slot machines watching their parents play. Security guards were walking around and didnt seem to care that this was happening when we had explictly read that this was not to occur. The child neglect and abuse which was occuring in the lobby and casino of Circus Circus was horriffic! They have a sky rail thing which takes you from the tower casino and rooms to the main casino which is a great idea- however this chose to stop running at any time with no explanation and the staff were rude when you asked them why this may be. so it was back to battling through the crowds of teenagers who walked around as if they ruled the place and stepping over sleeping children whos parents were to lazy to take them back to get a good sleep. On new years day the lifts didnt work at all and we had to walk down 14 flights of stairs in the fire escape to get out of the hotel, thankfully we didnt have to drag our bags with us but many other people who got sick of waiting for the lifts did have to! Oh and make sure you dead bolt your door as you will get plenty of advertising material stuffed under your door thoughout your stay for companies other than Circus Circus. Circus Circus was an utter let down and the staff responses when concerns were raised was truely unsatisfactory. We loved our trip in the USA and everywhere else we went we were treated with such respect and felt welcome into a land so far away from our own, sadly though Circus Circus was an utter waste of time and we felt that New Years was a shamble. we also dont believe that the excuse of 'because its news years weekend' is an adequate excuse for the extreme breaking of laws and lack of concern which we encountered at this hotel. Oh and by the way try to avoid having showers in the morning, as the hot water didnt come through and the shower was cold, if you can hear anyone around you in the shower.... avoid it. Go for a time in the middle of the day or very late at night if you want a hot shower!!!! Aussies Dont even bother wasting your time staying here spend a bit more and go for another hotel as we saw nothing this ridiculous anywhere alse!...

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare Lobby”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was there over a holiday, New Years, but the horror of working your way thru the lobby to get to elevators destroyed this experience for me. There just seems to be no easy, short way in or out - you have to push thru the casino and amusements forever. I would certainly pay more in future to avoid this. It seemed so full of people - plus it seemed people with families were just camped out in the lobby and on benches etc, seemed like they were not hotel guests. I will say the room, once you got there was fine and housekeeping was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel,okay location”
Reviews.Author: juliana84
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel in oct 05 for 3 nights. we were in a tower room which was nice, the bathroom was quite large, and the bed was huge. we loved the casino and did not see any kids running through all the time, even so i don't know what people expect from a hotel called the circus circus, it is a family hotel.we liked this casino better than any other as a lot of the other hotels casinos were a LOT more expensive.the location is not central but it only takes about 15 mins to get to the centre of everything. the only downfalls about this hotel was the wait when you check in, there was not that long a queue when we arrived but we waited 45 mins because there was only 2 staff who were not friendly or helpful at all. but overall we had a great stay and will definately be returning in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “vivs las vegas”
Reviews.Author: Jenksmith
Reviews.Content: Well what can i say except excellent! This is now my 11th time staying in Circus Circus. I had heard various reports regarding the hotel, but i cannot complain. The hotel was spotless and the staff were all excellent. They couldn't do enough for you. I would recommend it to anyone, whether you have kids or not. This november 2006 will be the first year i have taken kids. Roll on November. Nothing like wishing your life away!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The check in had a long line (at 3.30pm), but we moved through it in about 20 minutes. The room we had was on the 18th floor and whilst not facing the strip had a nice view of the mountains and still many lights to look at. Plus it was closest to the pools and spa which we enjoyed. Dinner Buffet was good value with wide selection of hot, cold and deserts @ $9.99 per person plus coupon from hotel for two for one. Bathroom modern with shower over bath and air conditioner worked well. We had a great time in Vegas and enjoyed the Circus Circus. And like the rest of the reviewers we pretty much only slept in the room but there was still plenty to see and do within the hotel. Pros: Good family/couple hotel for those on a budget. The Location was fine, with strip bus stop out-front, the Circus shows every half hour, internal McDonalds and games arcade with sideshow games of skill. Cons: Closing time of pool 5.00pm, no fridge in room (just ask) and the kids were shattered that the Adventure Dome (main attraction of this hotel) was closed all four days we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Very disapointing!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: natalie78
Reviews.Content: Having read all the reviews of this hotel prior to my trip I really wasn't expecting much but this hotel really is a dump!! We stayed at Circus Circus for a week over the New Year's period. It's old, dark, dingy, has a poor location, poor facilities compared to other hotels, and has an overpowering smell of stale smoke everywhere!! Our non-smoking tower room (on a non-smoking floor) smelt of strong stale smoke the whole week and had no ventilation as our window was sealed shut. The hotel is overrun with children (even in the casinos) and the food is of a poor standard. The only good point is that the rooms are of a reasonable size and get cleaned everyday. Don't make the mistake we did and stay here because it is cheap, save a bit extra and go for any of the hotels further up the strip as they all seem excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Same problem as the review below”
Reviews.Author: Townie1974
Reviews.Content: I completely agree with the review below. We noticed all the kids at this casino when we were there in October. My wife and I are the proud parents of 7 and 8 yr old boys. We are both 28 yr old blue collar people from Charlestown, MA whose parents chipped in and gave us this Vacay for our Wedding Anniversary. We would not even have considered Vegas for a family vacation. After hotel, flight, and gambling they could have brought there kids to Disney World. I have deal to with these yuppies every day because of gentrification in my town. They refuse to make sacrafices when they have kids. "I need my personal time". Guess what? You have kids. There's no such thing. I got that at 20 yrs old. To see these little maniacs running around at 11pm was ridiculous. Next time (if ever again) we will go to the Wynn. At least they make it difficult for kids to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Children EVERYWHERE”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I guess I will never ever understand the mind set of parents who think Las Vegas is a great family vacation destination. And Christmas at Circus Circus was a truly an amazing sight. I have never seen so many children in one place -- it would really be a close contender with Disneyland. As I sat in the casino, where children are not allowed, and played on a machine at about midnight one evening, I had the feeling that someone was watching me. Looking over my shoulder, I saw a 10-year-old standing right there. Apparently he was waiting in line for the pizza joint that happens to be in the casino area. As a slightly younger than middle aged married woman with no kids, I look forward to my twice-yearly adventure with my husband to Vegas. Typically we go when school is in session, but thought that Christmastime in Vegas would be something to see. Never EVER again. And NEVER at Circus Circus. At least at the Wynn, there is a polite sign at the entrance that says, "No strollers." Now there's an idea for sin city.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice if on a budget”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Circus Circus hotel for 4 nights during September 05. Our ‘tower room’ was clean and spacious with a good sized bathroom. The only problem we found was that on arrival the room did smell of stale cigarette smoke (despite us requesting a non-smoking room) which wasn’t very pleasant. The hotel itself is vast, and in some places the décor and furnishings are looking a little tired, but that’s only to be expected from a budget hotel with so many visitors. Although the pools are a bit of a maze to find, they are clean and the children are very well supervised by the life guards. There were plenty of sun beds and free towel rental – the perfect place to relax in the day before hitting the strip in the evening. We did have dinner at the hotel buffet which offered a good range of food with great value for money. Circus Circus is a great choice if you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel on the strip. It’s certainly not grand but it is comfortable and makes a good base for visiting the other stunning hotels and casinos located towards the middle of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1976cac
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights at the Curcus Circus back in Septemeber. It is an ok hotel. We went with an open mind having read other reviews, and therefore we were not "shcoked" by anything. The hotel is a liitle far up the strip, but as long as you are reasonably fit you can walk to the Bellagio in 20 mins, if your not so fit, then the 302 or 301 bus stops right outside the hotel, and you can get an all day pass for $5, or you can walk to the Sahara and get the monorail which will take you to MGM in about 10 mins, $3 for one way. Circus Circus is one of the oldest hotels on the strip, and I think you must remember this when you see the newer hotels such as Wynn, Venetian or Aladdin, how clean and bright they are. We liked the character of the hotel, yes in some places it could do with being re-painted and re-carpeted but for the price you pay you can'treally moan. I would suggest you try to stay in the main tower rooms, they cost about an extra $20 a night, but they are much nicer and bigger than the Manor rooms, and you don't have a 10-15 minute walk to get to them! We had no complaints about the room, it was big, clean, air conditioned and everything worked. Well actually amybe there was one tiny complaint, they could do with putting more lighting in the room, you only got 2 bedside lamps and one big lamp. We found all the staff to be friendly and helpful. The checkin/out area is quite small, but we only had to wait 10 mins to check in (at 3pm) and you can self serve check out if you haven't run up a bill. I would not recommed eating at the Buffet, it is rubbish and the food looks like it's been there all day, but having said that what do you expect for like $5-7. We ate at the Blue Iguanna (Mexican place) a couple of times and it was really nice and quite cheap. We never ate at the steakhouse, but heard from other guests that it is very nice. I thought the swimming pool was a bit out of the way and small for the size of the hotel, but that said, we never really got a chance to sit and sunbathe, in Vegas there is just too much to see and do! I wouldn't recommend staying at the hotel over Labour weekend, we expected kids (it is a kid friendly hotel) but the hotel was swamped with them running around everywhere. We took refuge in the casino (where they are not allowed). The casino is big, and the tables seemed to be kind, and the dealers were nice, We never had an empty bottle, as the cocktail waitresses were rounf quite often. We mainly played the slot machines and were lucky enough to win $1000 on a 25c machine! All in all we would go back to the Circus Circus and have recommeded it to friends & family for a lovely holiday in a budget hotel. If you are thinking of going to the Grand Canyon, I would really recommend you go by helicopter, it's more expensive than going by coach or car, but the views are spectacular, and it only take 40mins as opposed to 5 hours by land. We went with Sundance Helicopter tours, who are one of only 2 companies who have permission to land in the rim. We went for a sunrise breakfast and it was absolutely fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “We Will never return to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We chose to surprise our son on his 7th birthday by taking him to Las Vegas and Disneyland. We had never been to Las Vegas. We had originally planned to stay at Circus Circus (we figured it was a place catering to children) for 6 days. When our bus was driving us to the hotel, we immediately realized that it was too far from the strip. This was obviously an older hotel. When we went in to the lobby, we were overwhelmed by cigarette smoke and the dark interior. I have a strong suspicion that the dimmed lights hid dirt, grime and other filth. The staff were certainly very friendly (I got a $12 a day refrigerator for free) but the building seemed to be crumbling. Our hotel room was not too great. The linen did not look that clean and the bathroom had calking problems and did not look properly cleaned. At dinner time we waited in line for Pink Pony. The food and service were less than ideal. The waiters forgot what we wanted and after too long, we were served cold food and the glasses were dirty. With the overwhelming stench of cigarettes even though we were in the non smoking section, we didn't stay long in the restuarant or downstairs for that matter. My husband and son did enjoy the Adventure Dome and all of the kids attractions. Before we went to bed that night, we canceled the rest of our reservations at Circus Circus and reserved another room at another hotel on the strip for the rest of our stay. We paid substantially more for cleanliness and less second hand smoke, but it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: wckdtrix
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Circus Circus from Dec. 10-18...in the Skyrise Tower (floor 22). The rooms were very clean and nice. We ate at the buffet several times and really enjoyed it. Nothing fancy here, just good decent food. The other places were good to eat at well. The casino was very nice as well, with a variety of games and machines. The free slot tournament was a plus as well! One thing that was irritating was the pushy "time share" salesman every where you turn, both in the casino and the hotel "common areas". These guys were easily turned away with a simple "not interested", but you would have to say it every time you walked by them. It was almost as bad as the guys on the street handing out the "dancer cards" All in all the hotel, casinos, and restaraunts all exceeded my expectations. I will certainly be coming back to Circus Circus on my future visits!

Reviews.Title: “Expected better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Got a couple of rooms over the internet, rooms were categorized as manor rooms. I had no idea what they would look like, until after we registered and started walking towards the buildings which are completely separated from the main hotel building. We didn't even get into the rooms, instead we made a fast u turn and back to the registration desk to upgrade to tower rooms. It was only $10 more per room, which is a very small amout to pay for an upgrade. The hotel is OK, I thought it would be nicer. However, the nicest thing I thought was the Adventure Dome, kids will love this place, rollercoasters, arcades, spongebob simulator ride, etc... I don't recomend manor rooms unless you really have to be there like on a New Years eve, and there are no more rooms elsewhere, and you don't mind freezing your ears and cheeks in that 10 minute walk you'll have to take to get to the casino and dine.

Reviews.Title: “What a Dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old, looks and smells terrible, has woeful service and is poorly located. If you are making the effort to travel to Las Vegas get a real Hotel and enjoy the pleasures of excess. If you stay here and expect to enjoy the upbeat nature of Las Vegas, you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay was good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Only booked this for one night on a busy Saturday in Vegas and switched to Boulder Station for another 3 nights. Check-in took almost 40 mins. Did not like that, although they did have about 10 hotel workers checking people in. The person who checked me in was professional and helpful however. Our room was in the main tower and it was clean and acceptable. Bathroom was fine, although a little small and two of the towels didn't look throughly cleaned with spots on them. Aside from checking in, we had no other contact with hotel staff. Dinner buffet was very good, we had a two for one upon check-in. Last year we went for lunch and it was not good, but this year's dinner selection was superior. One complaint is how crowded it can get in the common areas. Especially with all the kids running or sitting around waiting for their families. Overall, I'd say it's a good, standard hotel. Not luxurious but not a dump either. Probably a good choice if you have kids, with the Midway games and the amusement park in the back to keep the kids occupied.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Nice!”
Reviews.Author: lorilynn
Reviews.Content: For the price, this hotel is fabulous. We have stayed there 3 times now and never a problem. Its clean, the employees are helpful and friendly and its cheap! Easy check in and check out. The only two downfalls is walking through the hotel with all the families. Everyone is in very large groups and sometimes its a pain to maneuver around all the people. Also, its on one end of the strip with a bit of a walk to the monorail (longer than expected). I guess for the price, those couple things don't bother me. If your want a good meal at 2, 3 or 4 in the morning, the Pink Pony restaurant is great. Overall, looking at the price compared to other hotels on the strip - its a great value and we're sure to return!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great room”
Reviews.Author: Sueliz
Reviews.Content: Travelled with a friend in October this year for first time visit to Vegas. Warned before travelling that this hotel was not one of the best, and was situated at the less desirable end of the strip, but two work colleagues had also stayed in the past and rated it ok. Pleasantly surprised that after reading some of the reviews on this site before leaving UK, it turned out to be better than expected. Loads of kids and families, but hotel was a base only so didn't spend much time there during the day, room was brilliant, very spacious, lovely bathroom, and spotlessly clean. Although we hung the towels up each day to be reused, they were replaced every day with clean ones. The buffet was good value and we ate breakfast every day, and also used the Pink Pony late at night. Food was good and plentiful. Most of the staff we had contact with were pleasant and helpful. However, should a return visit to Vegas be on the cards, would not stay here again as it was too far from most of the attractions at night, and we had to use transport each time we went out. A hotel more centrally located would have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: carowin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night as part of a driving holiday around California and Nevada. If you only plan on staying here for 1 or 2 nights don't bother booking. Our room cost $41 which is about the same as the motels but Circus Circus is much better (not one of the best hotels but better than a motel). If you can stay during the week rather than the weekend its cheaper. The room was large and very clean and the staff were quite friendly for such a large hotel. It can be a bit of a trek from the car park to your room so beware for that. The location was good, at the bottom end of the strip but definitely walking distance to the other hotels and casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel ever!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TomPagan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 days (Sun-Tues). First they "claimed" my room rates were incorrect and they had to charge me 10$ more. No biggie. Next I needed a "Roll Away Bed" so I called the front desk at 10:30pm. After 30 min. and no bed I called the front desk...No answer. Call the bell desk and had them track someone down. After quoting me $13.08 charge for the bed he said it would be right up. 30 min. later no bed. Called housekeeping, they had no request. Called fron desk again....No answer. Called bell desk again, they tracked a manager down "Jesus". He appologized and offered me the bed at no charge. 30 min. later no bed STILL! Call back to bell desk, transfered me to a "busy" Jesus. Said he call the housekeeping manager. 30 min. no bed. Called housekeeping..said it was on the way. 30 min. later no BED! Called Jesus back, said he would call again. Door knock, it's the BED! But....he forgot the blankets and sheets. Phone rings, it's Jesus telling me housekeeping told him the bed was delivered. It was 2 sec. before his call. I informed him about the missing bedding. He appologized. In the morning I was charged for the bed. I called downstairs and they said there was no record of Jesus's conversation with me. WHAT A JOKE! The next day, put a $25 deposit down for a movie. Only watched 1 movie so $15 was owed back to me. When I went to get it the woman asked if I had the deposit receipt. I thought I didn't. She said if I did't have it the would have to mail me a check. Now if they have ALL my information, my drivers license and knowledge of my cash deposit why would they not be able to give me my cash without the receipt? Does not make sense. Buffet was the biggest waste of money ever on food. The place "---" majorly.

Reviews.Title: “really great”
Reviews.Author: NickyfromNotts
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed in circus Circus twice now and would like to say we have had a brilliant time on both trips. Our rooms have always been spotless and very large. The bathroom was fab too with plenty of fresh towels every day plus soap shampoo ect.. his and hers sinks were nice. Room service was good and if you need an iron and ironing board they bring it in double fast time. the food is good in the Pink Pony and we also went to Stavalis Italian and had a really romantic and supper dupper meal. The hotel does get really busy at weekends with a lot of children but we have never found this a problem as they are not allowed in the casino areas so you can be kid free if you prefer. I also must say the hotel smells really yummy its like piped popcorn smell going round weired but nice. If you stand by a fruit mashine with a few coins in your hand you also get free drinks offered to you, I can personally recommend the Pina Coladas, sounds a bit tight doing this but we prefered to spend our cash else where such as Belzt out out town mall which is just a $10 taxi ride away and the shopping there is really cheap. In fact we took empty suitcases on the second trip and filled them with gifts for friends, family and ourselves too. pefume is a bargain plus trainers and branded sports clothing is a steal compaired to the UK. All in all can't fault the place and honestly can't see why a lot of people are worried about it being a budget hotel. I have staying in a few budget hotels in the past and had to move as they were filthy holes but this place is super nice. We were planning to have a second wedding there last year but three weeks after booking it all I found out I was 9 weeks pregnant so unfortunatly had to cancel but as soon as we can we will be off there again with the kids in tow, then will try the baby sitting service out!! Great place !!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine!”
Reviews.Author: Bandango
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at Circus Circus for 3 nights in october and weren't disappointed at all. What you have to remember is compared to most Vegas hotels this one is a budget hotel! If you remember that you'll be fine! The rooms were very large which was great and even though there are a lot of kids, they are not allowed in the casino so if you don't like kids, just stay there! This hotel is down the far end of the Strip but I've just read a review on here that says you have to take taxis everywhere-this is rubbish! There is a Strip trolley that stops at nearly every hotel continuously & for an all day ticket (9am-1am) its only $5-well worth it to see all the hotels. We're already considering staying here again next year because if you just want somewhere to sleep, its great!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on the hotel before our trip, I was scared what I might find when I got there. To my surprise it was wonderful. The staff was helpful, our room and bathroom was very clean. The only problem we encountered was the directions to our room. Overall we had a wonderful time and wouldn't mind staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Circus-circus”
Reviews.Author: jonik8667
Reviews.Content: What can I say- your get what you pay for. After waiting in line for 1 1/2 hours to get checked in, (my husband dropped me and our 3 teenage daughters off, headed to the airport to drop off the rent-a-car, caught a taxi back to the hotel and I was STILL standing in line waiting to check in!)We finally got to our rooms. After going into the wrong section of the hotel, two parts exactly alike- just differt towers- and same room numbers. When checking in complained about long wait and was told it was normal. HMM. This hotel is for families as they advertise. We were only staying 1 nite on our way back home from San Diego so we thought this would be a nice choice for our 3 girls that are 17,15, and 14. That way they would not be bored in a city thats 99%for adults. If your into screaming kids running around without supervision and including the casino- this is the spot for you. If you enjoy having kids running up and down the halls all hours of the nite- this is for you. But the highlight of our stay was exiting the doors to go see the strip at dusk and to see the lights once nite arrived was walking right past all the dumpsters, loading/unloading docks that had this wonderful aroma of garbage cooking in 105* heat for days. The "bums" lining the walk way begging for money was a nice touch. Enjoyed the terror we felt w/ our 3 girls. Sure am glad my husband has a black belt and that I always carry mace. For less money and a great veiw, great hotel and more stuff geared toword our teenagers I wish we would have gone back to the Stratasphere like we did on our arrival for 1 nite. They loved it there, we got a free show (which was great) and the rooms where $35 cheaper and alot bigger, cleaner and an all around nicer property. Its a bit farther away from the strip BUT the bus comes right there and picks you up and drops you off steps from the door. Circus-Circus is for punishing yourselves even if you take kids, don't waste your time and hard earned money.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Stressedad
Reviews.Content: Almost cancelled after reading the reviews on this site, pleased I didn’t, it’s a great place to stay, and the two girls age 5 & 9 loved it, we stayed in the main tower and the room was very spacious and clean, nicely decorated, quiet air con, not smoky or noisy, the view was partly obscured by part of the hotel, the circus acts were very good, they are repeated but I still didn’t get to see them all, there is just so much to see and do in Vegas, you cannot stop at the gaming tables with the kids so one of us had to stay while the other played, we walked to the Stratosphere and watched it get dark, it’s a great view from the top, we then walked back to Circus Circus, without getting mugged or murdered, just seen loads of other tourists doing the same, the next day we walked south and had a look through the other hotels, madam tussauds at the Venetian, secret garden at the Mirage (lions sleep a lot !), dancing fountains at the Bellagio, we walked back in the dark, we missed the volcano at the Mirage, but did see the pirate act at the Treasure Island. Another day we took the monorail back from the MGM it drops you way, way from the strip, the walk is almost as far. Don’t listen to the scare stories, it’s not as scary as Heathrow.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for the money!”
Reviews.Author: MitzieLee
Reviews.Content: The rooms at Circus Circus were colorful, comfortable, clean and big. Quite suitable for what we wanted, just a place to sleep at night. The location is nice as it is in between the Stratosphere (try the Big Shot at night!) and the Fashion Show mall. Everything on the strip was within walking distance except the outlet mall at the far end of the strip. We did take a taxi the night we were dressed up for the Celine show. For the money this was an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for a room with no phone!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I checked into Circus Circus, Las Vegas, Nevada on Oct 29 for 2 nights. I purchased the room on SouthWest Airlines vacations, so it was prepaid. When I wanted to express checkout, I saw a $2 balance on our bill for local calls, and we DID NOT even touch the phone. I called the front desk to check whether there was a mistake in this charge. I was informed that an automatic $1/day charge was added to the bill for unlimited local calls, whether you use it or not. Upon expressing my displeasure at this, I was informed that it was stated on the check-in sheet, which we did not read thoroughly, and will now do so at all future accommodation establishments, even though it will hold up many many people waiting in line to check in! When we tried to express our displeasure at the front desk, in person, the reservations person was not very sympathetic either, saying that this had been in place for 4 years! When I mentioned that we have stayed in hundreds of hotels and not have to be separately charged for something like this, she told me that all the other hotels in the group, Luxor, Mandalay Bay, Excalibur, do this. When I mentioned that other groups do not do this, she mentioned something totally irrelevant, i.e. Circus Circus do not charge a fee for parking. Duh, which hotel/casino in their right mind would charge parking fee in Vegas? It was not the $2 that I minded paying. It's the fact that hotels could slip in these little things, and catch one unaware. Hey, why not add this into the pricing of the room, so I don't have to feel like a total fool, caught out for not reading the fine print???? So, what's next? Paying an extra $2/day for TV, an extra $2 for a flushing toilet?

Reviews.Title: “good value for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: ex-sailor
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a stay at Circus Circus after a gap of fifteen years. Although the queues were long at check-in, it took very little time to get our keys and map. The room was well-decorated, clean and even had a safe. Somewhat short of coat hangers but we didn't mind because it was at the end of a holiday. The circus acts aren't as good as fifteen years ago but there are plenty of activites for a family. We didn't use either of the pools because it rained for 5 days. Instead we visited the new outlet, Premier Outlet, which is very close to Circus Circus. You can drive there in under 10 minutes. It's quite 'upmarket'. However, don't visit when it's raining because, unlike the other outlet centre at the end of The Strip, it is not under cover! The buffet is reasonable but if you want something special, visit the casinos at the far end of the Strip. It's a pity that Circus Circus doesn't provide any music!

Reviews.Title: “ok for one night”
Reviews.Author: alderson
Reviews.Content: We stayed at circus circus for one night in September, after reading reviews on this site we had prepared ourselves for the worst. I don't think it is half as bad as some people have described. We arrived around five in the afternoon so check in was quite quick and the staff were quite friendly and helpful. Our room on he 14th floor was large, clean, and had everything other hotel rooms in Vegas do, also had a great view of the Stratosphere hotel. It was not luxurious and possibly verging on shabby and dated but it was clean and the bathroom was nice. The hotel itself was ok, the casino seemed to have very low ceilings and felt a little claustrophobic, but the staff were good, and were quick to bring us drinks etc. We had a meal at the pizza place which was ok but we did not have time to try any of the other cafes/restaurants. I did not find the hotel to be particularly noisy, there were a lot of children about, but obviously not in the casino, and later on in the evening it was quieter. Location at the top of the strip, we walked to the Venetian that night, quite a walk but not impossible. We checked out via the tv which was handy. Overall I was glad we only had one night here- it is fine if you don't really intend on spending much time in your room (why go to Las Vegas to sit in your hotel room?) but I would prefer to stay elsewhere next time, closer to NY NY or Caesar's Palace. We had reservations for the rest of our stay at the Luxor, which was much more our scene, but if I was stuck for somewhere to stay in Vegas again I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a bed on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Kevin_Ann
Reviews.Content: We got married here many moons ago and it's sad to see the decline in Circus Circus's status and standards. Having said that, it's probably the cheapest bed you can get at a major casino at this location on the strip. We stayed in the skyrise tower and had the same long waits at check in that other reviewers have experienced. In addition, a really obnoxious man served us who made the wait worse by talking down to us and not listening to anything we said. We too had trouble finding our room and thought the hallways in the skyrise tower to be dim and dirty. The rooms themselves were better, although are now probably due for renovation. The A/C unit was noisy but the room and bathroom spacious and clean. There are good views over Las Vegas. We ate across the road at the Riviera at Kady's cafe where we were able to get food that suited all the family plus reasonable wine for the adults.

Reviews.Title: “Had the best time”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaBarb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Circus Circus and found it to be very child friendly.

Reviews.Title: “not so bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: excellent service - we were there on a Tuesday - excellent service by the staff - stayed in the tower paid an extra five bucks - room was clean, nicer than the rooms at the Excalibur to be honest with you at a fraction of the price - would stay there again but for us Vegas has to be done mid-week to avoid the weekend rush

Reviews.Title: “Surprise at the Kiddie Casino”
Reviews.Author: vegasgal
Reviews.Content: My Friend and I just returned from a 3 night stay at the Circus Circus and we were surprised with the stay. We stayed from October 18th to 20th in the Skyrise tower room 22734. It was a smoking room with 2 queen beds and a nice view on the 22nd floor facing south looking at the Stardust and Wynn. We arrived at 3pm and we decided to check in along with about another 75 people. Although there were so many check in only took 20 minutes and the desk clerk was very nice and cheerful. We had originally decided to stay two days and paid $49.95 a night (e-trill deal from e-mail). When we asked the price for a third she gave us the same deal no problem right away. She then gave us our coupon book and directions to our room. We found it no problem but it is at the back of the casino. I've stayed in the South Tower at the Golden Nugget and that was a further walk than the Skyrise at the Circus Circus. The room was very clean and each day the housekeeping was an excellent standard and no one bothered us and only cleaned after we were gone for the day. We found that since it was the middle of the week there were very few kids and they were well behaved. My friend and I used the 2 for 1 buffet coupon (which made the cost of the buffet $6 each) and the buffet was another surprise. I've heard reviews of the fod not being good but I liked it. It was hot , fresh and clean. The selection isn't a good as the other strip hotels but what do you expect for $10 for dinner. Everyone else on the strip charges over $18. We went on the rides at the Adventuredome and used the $4 off coupon given to us at check in. Same rides as at the PNE. All day pass regular price $24.95. Save your money and go a couple of times on the Manhattan Express. Gambling was okay lots of selection didn't eat my money as fast as Paris but I found my money lasted longer Downtown. Every worker we encountered was friendly and helpful. The first night we stayed there the people in the next room were getting a little out of hand so I called the front desk and security was there in less than 4 minutes and handled the situation very professionally and we didn't hear them again for the rest of the night. Basically Circus Circus is a great place to stay if you have no kids only during the weekdays. Weekends the place is a zoo. If you sign up for their e-mail letters you can get a good price if you want to stay on the strip but don't want to pay strip prices. I was expecting kids swinging from the ceiling but we had a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fine place if you're just wanting a bed”
Reviews.Author: uncletony
Reviews.Content: We (myself, wife and adult daughter) stayed in Room 25744 (25th floor) in the Skyrise Tower for 4 nights. It was just fine with a good view south towards the Stardust and the new Wynn casinos. It was quiet, large and clean, with two double beds, but (as is standard in LV) no coffee maker or mini fridge. There is an ice machine and beverage/snacks vending machines on each floor. The bathroom was clean with a good supply of towels and soap/shampoo. Beds were comfy and the sheets were clean (changed every day). The airconditioning was set at a good temperature. Check-in was a misery...only one person on duty at a busy time, we were in line for almost an hour. Instructions on getting to the room were confusing. Luckily we left our luggage in the car when we checked in, so when we eventually found the room it was easy to go back for the bags. There is a safety deposit box in the room operated by inserting quarters. Every time you opened it you had to put in another two quarters so it could be closed and locked again. There is a mandatory $1 a day charge for the phone - whether you use it or not. That's for the 'free' local calls. All other calls are charged at much higher rates. No internet access. There are several food outlets in the casino area - we ate once in the pizzaria, but won't go back. Very greasy pizzas and too much left-over food scraps under the tables. Not cheap either. We got into the routine of making the walk over to McDonalds for breakfast (free coffee refills) - but you had to be there before 10:30, that's when the menu changes to regular meals. Some of the slot and tables areas are a bit shabby/tired. This is an older establishment and it is beginning to show its' age, but it still is good value for money (we booked thru Expedia). We just used it as a sleeping place - never saw a circus show and never had a meal (except the pizza). And only gambled a few tens of $$$. Check-out is amazingly easy - follow the instructions on the TV using the remote control and navigate thru the pages. There are unmarked boxes strategically placed near the elevators to deposit your room key when checking out. We would stay there again without hesitation.
