It is fine for the price and with so much to do along the Strip and elsewhere (please don't miss visiting Fremont Street in Downtown LV - stunning!!), all you will really need is Circus Circus' bed for the night. uncletony and family

Reviews.Title: “Good for budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: Muk_muk
Reviews.Content: The casino is small compared to the other hotels on the Strip, but of course Circus Circus is a place for budget-minded people so I guess that's normal. The room we had was on the 16th floor. It was spacious and clean, which is all we were looking for. Only complaints would be that there were no "nice extras" in the room like a fridge or nice soaps to use. The hotel has a buffet restaurant which is ok. There is also a Krispy Kreme's and some other small shops, all of which are really expensive. The other restaurants in the hotel were very quiet when we were there. The Adventure Dome is also pretty expensive and not as spectacular as we were expecting (small rides which cost a lot to go on). Next door is "slots of fun" (or something like that) which has a Subway in it if you don't want a buffet or donuts for breakfast. Having said all of this, it was one of the cheapest places to stay on the Strip yet its location was really good: in one day we were able to walk to all the casinos down the Strip and then we got the bus back up, which stops right outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad”
Reviews.Author: joeannemcf
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was not as bad as i had been expecting, i had read reviews and heard people say that they were disappointed. When we arrived i had my doubts abouts staying but i was surprised, the room was clean and tidy and the room served its purpose! It was only a base, somewhere to sleep etc... I spent a little time in the casino and it was a bit chaotic. I had the chance to see the acts and they were not that impressive!! All in all it was not a bad hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas !! Once is enough !”
Reviews.Author: maldiveslover
Reviews.Content: We arrived home just this morning, after a week in Las Vegas. Travelling with our friends, we went by Virgin Atlantic. I have to say that i really was expecting something better than the average airline but was sorely disappointed on both the outbound and inbound flights. lets just say i wont book with them again ! On to the holiday itself. We booked with expedia, which was simple and straight forward. We booked 7 nights at the 'Circus Circus' hotel and casino, and also had a hire car. The hotel was, at first, very disappointing. We were booked into the manor rooms which were located across the road from the main hotel building. The rooms were awful.... smelly, dark, and very sparse.... the stained carpets eventually sent us back to the main lobby to complain. Our complaint was dealt with immediately, and pleasantly, which was a godsend at the end of a very long and tireful day. We were relocated to two lovely rooms close to one another in the main building, and settled in quick. large clean rooms, with huge bathrooms, huge beds, great views of the vegas strip, and maid service everyday. (but no mini fridge or tea/coffee making facilities). The weather in Vegas was in the 80's everyday, a dry heat which was great... but i have to say that the air conditioning everywhere was so cold. We all suffered with nasal problems including a few nose bleeds here and there... and we weren't the only ones ! Our skin went really dry due to the amount of chlorine in the water (shower)... (not pool). so we all felt a bit yuck all week. Now for the good bits ! The strip was filled with great hotels... all themed, and well worth visiting. We celebrated our first wedding anniversary with a lovely gondola ride inside the 'Venetian'... a really stunning hotel not to be missed. 'New York New York' ... the rollercoaster is a must ! (but i lost my earings !!). Harrahs has a very lively casino... great atmoshere. The 'Bellagio' is quality... the food is fabulous. 'Treasure Island' has a live outdoor show 4 times a night with two pirate ships having a battle... worth seeing ! The Stratosphere.... WOW ! You just have to go to the top ! The rides are totally crazy... but we stayed with our feet firmly on the ground ! Every hotel has something worth seeing.... and last of all, i have to mention 'Caesars Palace'.... not only is this hotel huge.. it has shops, restaurants, huge casino.... but best of all, it has the Colloseum Auditorium. This is where Celine Dione appears on a regular basis..(she even has her own shop in the hotel ! ). BUT.... my friend had her birthday on Wednesday and we were fortunate enough to aquire tickets to see Elton John, as he is there for 3 weeks while Celine has a break ! We even flew over Celine Diones vegas house in a helicopter.... we pre-booked a trip on the internet to the Grand Canyon, and then on to a cowboy ranch for lunch... well worth doing.... but a bit over-priced we thought. $279 each.... but hey, no point in not seeing it... the views were spectacular. Vegas on the whole was good, clean, friendly, warm, and fun...lots of shows to see,,also the old casinos and fremont street with its light show...lots of designer shops and malls... but overall, the sound of slot machines, arcade games, roulette wheels, and casino noise in general can get on your nerves in the end. I think we had all had enough by the end of the week, and felt more than ready to come home. SUMMARY:- Glad we went, but once is enough !

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargin”
Reviews.Author: travelingurl01
Reviews.Content: I was a little leary about staying at Circus Circus last time I was in Vegas we stayed at the Flamingo (great Location) and CC is at the far end of the strip. This hotel isn't as nice as others but the room (skyrise tower) was clean and large, the houskeeping staff was great as was the rest of the staff. We decided to stay here b/c for the amount of time you are in your room who cares about all the fluff. I will say the pool area was just a pool very basic the Flamingo pool is much nicer but it worked for us. We had no problem getting up the strip and around the trolley worked great for us or walking it is quit a trek but if you don't mind walking no problem. Good food at the pink pony cafe open 24hrs and great service. The casino is good low ceilings make it not as open as the newer places but overall a great trip would head back there again. Escpecially b/c the price is right at Circus Circus!

Reviews.Title: “best hotel i have ever stayed in !!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i went to las vegas in april 04 and loved it i went for a week and it was great i stayed at the circus circus hotel and it was great full of kids but that did nt bother me! circus circus is well placed on the strip its near the riveara and stardust it has a wonderful shop across the road called walgreens i was in there everday cos i thought it was great and cheap. the room was good service was good what more cud i ask for? it was really good so i decided to go bak for 10 days in october as 1 week is not enough time as i did nt get to see everything so i decided to back and look at what i had missed i went back to the same hotel as i thought it was great first time. a five minute walk would get you to a great shopping centre callled fashion show mall it has loads of top lables and good brands and a really goood food court. i am going bak to las vegas next month but to a different hotel as i want to try something different. if you have kids i would recomend circus circus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mpt3742
Reviews.Content: I just got back from an awesome trip to Las Vegas. I was a little leary about staying at the Circus Circus after reading some of the reviews of the Hotel, and I had some low expectations before I arrived. The Hotel was more than I havd expected. A lot of the reviews said that there were hoards of children running around and the place was a madhouse, don't believe them. We barely saw any children. The only place where there were a a lot of children was in the Midway where all the circus games are set up. If you don't like children then don't go to where they are, it's that simple. The room was very clean and well maintained. It is an older hotel so of course there are goinge to be a few blemishes here and there. The pool area was a bit windy on the day we went down to it but it was very relaxing. And as for the circus acts, they were breathtaking. we didn't get to see them all but the ones we saw were well worth the standing room only seating. All I can say about this place is that you get what you pay for. For those traveling on a budget, this is the palce to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A very plaseant stay at Circus circus”
Reviews.Author: makeawishmn
Reviews.Content: I am going to be as complete as I can with my review. I will say that overall we enjoyed Circus Circus. My wife and I went with two other couples. It was a great deal and we couldn’t pass it up. Let’s start with the check-in. I read all the horror reviews about the long lines and slow service. We had no problems when we checked in. Having said that, I must also add that we got to the hotel about 10:30am, so that may have made a difference. Our room wasn’t ready, but they do say that check-in is 2:00pm. We went back at 1:40pm, and the room still wasn’t available, and they said they cannot even give you a key until 2:00pm, even if just wanted to drop off your stuff in your room. At 2:00pm, we got our key and our room was ready. We requested adjacent rooms with couple 1, which they obliged (actually, we got rooms directly across the hall, which was just as good). Couple 2 was put in a room on a different floor in a different building. They requested a room on the same floor as us, which they changed with no problems. There was nothing available on our floor, but there was one on the floor below. Now on to the room. The room was nice, and had a purple color scheme, which we liked since purple is our favorite color. It was nothing fancy, but overall very clean and spacious. We were missing the top part of the lever behind the faucet that lowers the stopper for the sink. Also the alarm clock on the nightstand didn’t work, but they had already put another one on the desk (I still don’t know why they didn’t remove the broken one). We didn’t ask maintenance to fix these problems, since they weren’t really a big deal. Both of the couples we were with had a light burned out (one had a burned bulb in the bathroom and one had a burned bulb in the entryway). They called maintenance and someone was up to replace the bulbs immediately, so that was good. As for food, we only ate in two of the restaurants. We tried the Buffet, which had a nice selection and was very reasonably priced, plus the food was good. We mostly ate at the Pink Pony, which was a very basic restaurant. The food, however, was awesome! They give you a nice selection, and the portions were more than you’d ever expect, for not a lot of money. We highly recommend this place to eat. At least give it a shot. The hotel in general was nice. Yes, there are a lot of kids around, but they aren’t in the casinos, nor are they running around the hallways. So don’t let that concern you. The place is huge, so be prepared to walk a bit. It took us a day to get used to where everything was. Overall, we enjoyed our stay. I honestly don’t know what people expect. Is this the Ritz? No. Is this the Hotel at Mandalay Bay? No. But this is a very nice place, and a great value for the money. Don’t let the negative reviews scare you off. If you’re looking for an upscale hotel, go to the 5-star hotels. But if you’re looking for a nice place to stay for a low price, then I would definitely recommend checking out Circus Circus.

Reviews.Title: “A well priced hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: serap
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Las Vegas, and we were staying for 3 nights but hadn't pre-booked a hotel. On the drive up, we heard lots of adverts about circus circus being the "best deal on the strip", so decided to stay there. It wasn't a bad decision, the price was very reasonable, and the room we had in the manor rooms, was comfortable, clean and quite big. It wasn't soundproof though and we were woken at 7am by next door's screaming children, who managed to scream continually for about an hour. The location was good for us, as we had a car, so we could park right outside our room, and then drive further down the strip to visit the fancy hotels that we wished we could afford! Circus circus itself was fine, but full of kids, so we didn't spend too much time there, but we did look around the shops, do a bit of gambling, and see some of the entertainment, all of which we enjoyed. My advice is book before you go, as the hotels are so big and complicated to get into that it would take hours to visit even a few of them. I would try somewhere different next time, but this was a good place to start, and Las Vegas as a whole was brilliant..

Reviews.Title: “Mad - Circus”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Gannon
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights paying 09/04/05 = $129.95 09/05/05 = $54.95 09/06/05 = $54.95 for a large room overlooking the Travel Lodge - their pool seemed closer that the CC one! It took approx 1 hr to check-in as it was Sunday before Labour Day and you could only checkin after 2pm! - nightmare. Returning to the hotel on our first evening we were met by a throng of people, the casino was heaving - it was great to find a lift and get up to our room. But lifts can be tricky with certain ones only going to certain floors. The Pink Pony cafe is good, with excellent food and good waitress service. I must say after Sunday, Monday was less busy and we felt more relaxed, but I wouldn't stay there again. I'd use either the (budget) Travel Lodge (great pool) if up that end of the Strip or (extravagent) MGM looks good at the other end. I can't complain about our room, good views, good size room and bed, with TV, full bathroom and dressing area with lots of space, no tea/coffee facilities though. Discretly cleaned everyday when we were out. We only looked around the funfair bit once - mayhem! Got a better view when it was closed. We only found a bar when the place was closed and no people were around, it was then we also found the shop with large fridges selling alcohol, (but a 24/7 across the road also does). The beauty shop was ok but I'm blonde and the hairdresser used black clips! Says it all really. This hotel is v dated in some areas.

Reviews.Title: “no complaints”
Reviews.Author: ted58
Reviews.Content: not a bad word to say. no big waits at check in like we had read. fantastic holiday spot with plenty of food options and heaps to do. the only tiny hassle was slow lifts, big deal. we are going back to las vegas in 2006 and would not bother to look at staying any other place as far as value for money,

Reviews.Title: “In need of refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: pfield
Reviews.Content: We were allocated a Manor room at the back of the hotel on arrival, but after taking a shower which was difficult as the bath was filling up at the same time the shower was on, I could not turn the tap off. The air conditioner unit was old and noisy and couldn't be adjusted to a satisfactory temperature and the net curtains on the windows were filthy. Added to this we had booked for 7 night stay and were provided with 5 coat hangers on a rail (no wardrobes). I requested a move and was transferred to the Skyrise Tower, slightly better but not much different. We had to have the bath tap changed in this room as this also would not turn off. During our stay we took a meal in the Pink Pony, it was the worst meal we have ever had. The hotel is shabby and in need of complete refurbishment, full of children and even babies, I find it hard to comprehend the mentality of parents who take children to a gambling casino for a holiday. In conclusion I would not recommend this hotel and would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Complete Carnage”
Reviews.Author: shazza_h
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Circus Circus for two weekend nights in July. Thankfully it was only two nights! The hotel is total carnage from the second you walk in to the second you leave. The reception area really is pathetic for the shear number of people flowing through it. Expect there to be long lines waiting to check in - thats assuming you can find the line amongst the masses of travellers sitting all over the floor. Our room was nice(ish) but we had a whole high school basketball team staying just down the corridor who thought it was amusing to bounce balls in the wee hours of the morning. When I rang the front desk to see if they could send someone out to sort out the problem, I had to explain the situation to 4 different members of staff who didn't know how to deal with the problem! I would have thought travellers would complain about this hotel to the staff on an hourly basis. Apparently not. Apparently all travellers enjoy their stay and there is no need to complain, according to their staff. The biggest problem that I had with Circus Circus is that despite the fact that they are targetting families, the stale smoke smell which lingers in the air and gets all over your clothes etc is not satisfactory for young kids especially those with asthma. Overall, I am thankful that we survived our 2 nights of complete hell at this hotel amongst the chaos and mayhem. If you can afford it, I would encourage future travellers to stay elsewhere as this hotel is miserable!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Rooms, mad casino”
Reviews.Author: wantingtowander
Reviews.Content: I loved Vegas! Totally different world and worth seeing, BUT i would pay the money to stay in one of the really nice big theamed hotels! We choose this hotel because while still being a resonable price was also offering that vegas experience! The rooms were lovely and clean and added bonus was our room was at the back of the hotel which meant we were not kept awake at night by the noise of the casino (which looking back now was a stroke of luck) and most of the staff were friendly and helpful. But the location was not great, its quite a walk to the main part of the strip and takes a good half hour at a medium pace. The hotel itself was very noisy and jam packed full of kids wondering around (which was to be expected at some extent being 'Circus Circus') it was a complete nightmare to get to your room, you have to walk through all the casino and shops, which is not what you want after a busy day and worst of all they had six elevators and the whole time i only ever saw about two working (we waited for one for three quarters of an hour on our last day and couldn't even get hold of front desk to help). The pool was small but good enough for a quick swim and cool off. But even with all that its not a bad place to stay if you have kids as they will love the adventure dome and its not bad value, but if your looking for a bit of relaxation and a little luxury then i would definatly reccomend paying that bit extra and going for one of the really nice hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful Dreadful More Like It!”
Reviews.Author: rw_808
Reviews.Content: Staying at this dump was entirely my own fault-- I simply drove to Vegas one Saturday afternoon without reservations and, after a few disappointments simply drove to Circus Circus out of desperation. Never again. Check in was the nightmare everyone describes. The shrieking kids were just as everyone describes. The long walk to the lousy room, the awful restaurants (didn't try their famous steakhouse-- I was too angry), and did I mention the unruly brats with their shrill air-raid siren yelling? I can see why their target markets are families with kids and Brits-- the former group just want to keep their rugrats busy somehow while they gamble, and the latter group doesn't have any idea of the horror that awaits them ("It's Vegas and it's dirt-cheap, mate!" is the pitch, I imagine). But take my advice-- stay anywhere else but Circus Circus.

Reviews.Title: “Noisey/Mad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night during our tour. Wasted most of our time walking as we were at the end of the strip. Its a long walk in the blistering heat to the other hotels. Quicker to walk because the traffic is soo bad. Our hotel room in the tower was fine - spacious and clean - no coffee making facilities. I would have preferred to stay at one of the other hotels as Circus Circus seems tacky in comparison to some of the finer hotels. Its very noisey and there were loads of children running about and Reception was absolutely crazy when we tried to check in - seemed to be hundreds of people sitting about on the floor waiting to get checked in. The breakfast buffet was value for money but skip the Italian restaurant - glorified fast food. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “fine hotel , little too far along the strip.”
Reviews.Author: Booboo_bear83
Reviews.Content: hotel itself was fine, although we chose the manor rooms which were not part of the main tower, would advise paying a little extra to stay in the main building. overall, hotel is fine and very cheap, next time i go to vegas, will not stay in circus circus purely based on its location. would advise not staying any further down the strip than the pirate hotel. otherwise you spend far too much time walking!!

Reviews.Title: “Great( but depends on what you are looking for)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, and we enjoyed our stay there. We decided to stay here based on a recommendation from friends and the cheap prices. We stayed in one of the tower rooms. They were large and clean and there was free parking. If I were to nit pick, I'd say the following: 1) Check in always seemed to be busy when I was there. To be fair, the hotel seemed quite full, and the front desk staff were very nice. 2) The food was "ok". We ate at the buffet twice (mostly because we didn't have time to look around for other restaurants). Anyway, there are plenty of dining options in LV. 3) Getting in and out is a hassle. This, however, is par for the course in LV hotels - you have to navigate the casino to get out! Beyond that, ask yourself what you are looking for. There were alot of families (read: kids) - we are you and don't have kids, so we're not crazy about spending out vacation surrounded by them (no offence)! If you want a cheap, clean hotel, then this is the one for you. It's towards the end of the strip, however (a cab ride to Excalibur was like $11), and if you are young and single, and want to "club it up" - then go somewhere else like the bellagio, Luxor or the Palms. Circus Circus was perfect for us because we planned day trips out of LV 2 out of 3 days we were there. For gambling, CC has some $5, single deck blackjack, and the dealers are patient in teaching you the ropes. This is far less intimidating than some of the other casino's. We took day trips to the Grand Canyon and Death Valley. With the canyon, it's a long day - I would advise you do a flyover, and leave it at that. The bus tour doesn't do any justice to it. For a better look, hike it. Death Valley is a great trip, about 2 hours away, and I think there may be tour buses that go there. If you have a rental car, stock up on water/gatorade, and make the trip. Cheers, David

Reviews.Title: “Wedding reception nightmare!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: They admitted they screwed up the dates of stay of our wedding party reservations, that were made 4 months in advance-then said they couldnt do anything to fix it. after a big tado and screaming at the higherr ups they fixxed that- only to be followed with when finally be given the key to the suit the reception was to take place it-We went in to find it had NOT been cleaned from the last party. trash, used towels in the bathroom, food etc. after that. we were supposed to have the bartender for 3 hours. at the end of the 3 hours they just came in and took everything away- the food i prepaid for my guests ($1000 worth of orderevs) they brought in a trash can and threw it out in front of all my guests. even the wedding cake. they did leave the top piece on the counter- without a box to put it in. The wedding cake was to be off white with no top because we had made cake toppers-on an off white cake they put large bright white roses where there should have nbeen nothing- we could only smash them down with the cake topper -removing them would have made a mess of the basket wieve design on the sides. after the dirty room ordeal the catering manager in charge said he was off at noon and was gone. my daughters wedding reception was at 7 in the evening.The chanpaingne punch I ordered for the cake cutting was so bad the waiter told us laughing that they only put one bottle of champaige in it. They charged me $80 for the punch. Discounts on the reception room for going over a certain ammount on food and beverage. I was told and written I would get $200 credit on the room I have yet to get. The reservations people were rude and condisending especially the supervisors. If you have small children, please watch them closely and be careful at the pool, the lifeguards were worthless. Very scarey. They ruened my only daughters first wedding. If someone can learn from this and either beware going in that its a junk show or go else where. Just trying to get 2 extra chairs for the wedding party at the buffet took an arguement and 15 minutes . just incredible. and every bit of this is gospel truth!! signed The Mother of the Bride from California

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal -- Don't Be Fooled By All The Bad Reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Circus Circus for three nights last week (8/05). We booked the room in a package deal and were horrified after reading the reviews. However, we absolutely LOVED THE HOTEL! It is an EXCELLENT DEAL! We payed $40 dollars per night for a huge room on the top floor of the west tower. Upon arrival we found that we were booked in a manner room (the budget rooms out back of the main hotel). I kindly asked the guy who checked us in if we could upgrade to a room in the main part of the hotel. He gladly UPGRADED US AT NO EXTRA CHARGE! It was great! The room was very clean and the maid service was excellent. I've never seen such a huge hotel room. Sometimes, all you have to do is be nice and ask if you'd like to make changes to your reservation. Circus Circus is not a four star hotel, but it is a great value hotel that is right on the strip. If you want glammer, stay at the Wynn. If you want a nice hotel at a cheap price, stay at Circus Circus. The hotel is not located in the heart of the strip, but there are buses that run every 5 minutes that will take you anywhere on the strip you'd like to go for cheap. ($5 for a 24 hour unlimited pass.) The only thing you need to be aware of is that Circus Circus is a huge hotel--one of the largest in the world--so it takes a long time to get anywhere. There are a lot of children, but thats what this hotel is known for. Overall, we were very pleased with Circus Circus. We'll definitely go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: nycvegas
Reviews.Content: I just got back from 6 nights at Circus Circus from 8/3 thru 8/9/05. The hotel was decent but beware the inordinate amount of children in the lobby. I didn't encounter many children running the hallways and it was very peaceful at night. There were children throughout the hotel even in the casino. I encountered one blackjack dealer named Simon that was very animated and did impressions. I had a really benjoyable time playing at his table. I've stayed at circus Circus 4 times and think that this is my last time . If you have kids stay here by all means but if you appreciate refined entertainment and classy service stay at Bellagio or The Venetian .

Reviews.Title: “Rude check in staff.”
Reviews.Author: jimmyb01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Circus Circus at the end of a two week road trip around California and Nevada, when we checked in we were unluckly to meet the rudest check in clerk, this is a shame because throughout our stay in America we found nothing but helpful and kind staff even in the smallest motel. Apart from this, this Hotel will be fine as long as you know that this place is overcrowded with kids. You get exactly what you pay for, a nice comfortable room but with no extras, like the personal touch. This Hotel is 37 years old and it shows.The location is not too bad as long as you don't mind a 20-30 minute walk to the heart of the strip. The swimming pools are small for the size of the Hotel so they are always overcrowed, but they do have lifeguards always on duty. I really can't complain for $50 a night, however I wont stay here again because of the check in clerk.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was just right!”
Reviews.Author: Debbie978
Reviews.Content: I admit I really hesitated about staying at Circus Circus in Las Vegas. I used to think of it as a real 2nd class place - but in looking at taking a family of 4 on an 8 day vacation - the price was right. I told my husband to be prepared - I would give this place a chance, but we may be paying all over again by moving to a different hotel. The check in process was slow. They have about 30+ windows for customer service, but only had about 2 clerks working. So it was slow. It didn't help that I wasn't 100% sold on staying here at that time. We finally got checked in - had a Skyrise Tower room. The way in was a little weary -beatup looking elevators from the parking garage, but then you're in the casino and right around the corner from our tower elevator. The carpeting in the hall and in our room appeared to be very new and recently replaced. Our room was on the end - but we found it very pleasant. The room was clean, the bed sheets were crisp and clean and the bathroom was very clean. There was some crud on the carpet in the corner hidden under the curtain, but we called housekeeping and when we returned later in the day it was gone. It was a basic room. I don't know what people expect when they pay a lesser price. You get what you pay for generally. But we were very pleased with these accomodations and would definitely stay there again next time we head out west. Not to mention that my kids loved the Adventure Dome. That was excellent. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling with families. If you're looking for a bunch of amenities, then you need to pay more and stay elsewhere. But if you're looking for a clean and basic place to stay, this would be good for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great for those with children”
Reviews.Author: yukoner
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent property for those with children. Rides are great!! For the young children there is an area upstairs meant just for them in main casino. Let them take your change and see how many balloons they can pop and stuffed animals they can win. However, for the rooms make sure you are in the main bldg not the ones in behind (row housing type) as they are noisy. Walls paper thin. Get in line early for the restaurants as they are endlessly busy. Food value is good. Very helpful staff! Would recommend this hotel for those with young children to young teens.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as they say...”
Reviews.Author: thirty-something1
Reviews.Content: I went to CC for a friend's impromptu wedding 45 days ago...rooms were cheap, checking in took about 20 mins, not bad for 12 pm on a Saturday. Bought booze at the giftshop, too much money, but convenient. Room was clean, 2 queens, NOT in the manor, and very reasonable. Understand that my hubby travels every week, 1*-5* hotels, and we thought it was just fine. Not luxury, by any means, but fine. We make a middle-upper middle income and can afford to stay elsewhere. But we knew we would not be in the room much (who is?). The view sux, restaurants are Dennys-ish. But it was clean, cormfortable and suited our trip. Dont stay in the manor, I hear, but don't count CC out entirely. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: airamVancouver_Bc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Circus Circus for 4 nights in July and had a great time. I had stayed at the hotel several times as a child but this was my first time in Vegas since I turned 21. Booked hotel and air thru Americawest website and got great deal. Check in line was almost an hour long but we had a really nice room on the 18th floor Skyrise Tower. The room was very clean and big, no bed bug bites and great view of north strip. We saw alot of other guests in the hallway but never heard any noise when in our room. Only con would be the location...alittle far north from alot of the attractions. We used the 301/302 bus and monorail to get around. We could have walked more down strip but was just too hot! All in all we had a wonderful vacation and would have no problem staying at the Circus Circus Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible place to stay”
Reviews.Author: gwynshees
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July with our three teenagers. On arrival we had to wait in a huge queue for at least an hour just to check in. Circus Circus is extremely run down, the carpets were very grubby. The only consolation was our rooms were in a seperate building with its own car parking so we didnt have to go through the casino to get to them. Our kids amused themselves at the fun fair which was ok for a few hours The swimming pools were far away too - we had to cross a road to get to it - quite small and crowded and you don't want to walk that distance in your swimwear - I can tell you! Outside our block of rooms families seemed to just hang around the stairways - very offputting. After a trip to the Grand Canyon we had to return to Circus Circus but we couldn't face it - so forgot about the expense and booked in to the Luxor - a much better and more pleasing experience.

Reviews.Title: “great for children”
Reviews.Author: capdeblu
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great if you have children with you. But I booked it for the very reasonable rate of 99$. Check in was prompt and friendly even though there was a long line. The room was very clean and had a view of the strip. But it was a long walk or monorail ride to the room. There is no room service after 12pm??? Location is good but if you are single or a couple you may want to go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went as a family to Circus Circus 5 years ago and had an amazing time - granted at the time my sister was 12 and I 14, we thoroughly enjoyed it, however so did my parents! We had a beautiful room overlooking Las Vegas with a gorgeous view at the busy night life that is Las Vegas after all! The circus was amazing and the adventure dome was fantastic - Cicus Circus is like a city all on its own, we still hadn't ventured out onto the strip after 3 days of being there as there was so much to look at and do! There were all types of shops and restaurants, and the staff were very friendly and courteous! Circus Circus is an awesome destination in Las Vegas if you are looking for a family vacation with competitive prices - it is the best deal on the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Hated The Circus Circus”
Reviews.Author: SOFTBALLDAD
Reviews.Content: We stayed heres because our daughter's softball team was book here and that was only reason. I checked reviews and there was many neg reviews. I told the coach because Reno circus circue was also not very good place. First because daughter had Graduation on that Sat morning we had to fly in day after team. Because of this we stayed extra night. The hotel made us book all new reservations without the discount the team was given. We also had to pay full price for our daughter even though she had room with team for one night. After spending one hour from airport to hotel and having car parked we went to check in. We had first game in 1 1/2 hours and was in a hurry.We stood in line to check in for 45 min with over 60 people. Three people doing checkin while fourth closed to clean her computer right in front of everyone. Fifth one closed to teach new employee about chec-ins. We get directions to our room(Tower) and 30 min later we are still looking.We ended up at ladies Hair Solon and they called the desk just to be told they gave wrong room number. 45 to check in and 45 min to find room,we missed first game after all this just to get here in time. I jump in the shower and water doesn't drain from tub.Wife couldn't take shower until they sent a man to fix. After 15 min I check and he is taking water out of tub with a glass.We left then for second game without getting cleaned up. After all this and another 20 min to find the checkin area and our car we are told there is parking lot across the street at our Tower. When we told parents about this one mom said their tub backed up also and they had to call service dept. Never go to this hotel again and wouldn't stay free. This place is packed because people that spend little money come to this hotel. Circus Circus really is one of the lowest hotels we ever stayed in . The really sad part is on Sunday when our daughter stayed with us she said her room was worse than this one. Tower was ok to just sleep in and leave,nothing more.

Reviews.Title: “OK...not bad, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: selj
Reviews.Content: Just got back 6/25 from a 10 night stay. Circus Circus is an affordably priced hotel, on the strip. If you don't like kids, stay away. I have two, so it was an obvious choice. I think of all the hotels we explored, this was by far the most crowded. We had 6 in our party, 4 adults, 2 children. Requested non-smoking, connecting, strip view rooms. First set of rooms we went to had the Adventure Dome theme park wall right in front of our windows, with a tiny peek of the strip up by the Stratosphere (this was the West Tower)...this was overshadowed by the fact that my father-in-law and his wife swiped the key to enter their room, only to find another guests luggage and clothes strewn about and literally someone was in the bathroom !!!! Flew back down to the desk...was not waiting another 45 min. in line to check in, so I barged my way to an available person. Gave us two new rooms (upgraded us to the Main Tower) with everything we wanted except strip view (however did get to get an upfront look at the bungy jumping place and watched some brave souls take a plunge). We checked back in the morning and again in the evening for any openings of other rooms, like they told us to do. Nothing. Stayed in those rooms another night. The next day, they said they had two new rooms, connecting and strip view right across hall and down a few. Great...except when we got our keys to get us into these...again my father-in-law walked into a room occupied by other guests. Couldn't believe it. This time I was fit to be tied and got right on the phone and called the front desk. Explained the situation and was told to come and see the supervisor. She was very polite, and had two other rooms for us, on the 15th floor of the Main Tower as well. After all this, wouldn't give me two new keys without ID, which I left with my husband in our temp room. We were told to move all our stuff into our new room, and they put a rush on getting the connecting room cleaned for my father-in-law. They sent a bell hop up and gave me the keys to our room, but the supervisor would not give keys to my father-in-laws room until it showed up as cleaned in the computer. It was cleaned right away but because of a discrepancy between housekeeping and the front desk with the computer system, the room couldn't be released to us until it showed as cleaned. That took almost an hour to get the housekeeping inspector to look and call down and say it was cleaned. Then it took another hour for us to get our keys to that room. Once in the room, we had a view of the front of the property looking right at the Riviera...which wasn't bad except these top floor rooms have this permanent scrolled cement design that covers the entire window, so you don't have a plain window to look out, but this weird stuff to look through. But at this point we just wanted to get our stuff out of our suitcases finally and get settled. After having done this moving around, I would stay NO WHERE BUT the Main Tower. Everywhere else is a quite a hike to get to the main part of the hotel where the casino, restaurants, midway, etc. is. I was very disappointed in the pools there. They have two pools serving the towers to the hotel and I think one across the street for the Manor and campground. These pools aren't much bigger than a large inground pool someone would put in their backyard and for a hotel having almost 3,800 rooms, I think this is terrible. Getting to the pools is like a mouse in a maze and the pools being the piece of cheese at the end. Having explored around Las Vegas (this was my 2nd trip in 10 years), if you have an attitude that "you get what you pay for" The Venetian is absolutely the nicest hotel on the strip. Gorgeous architecture, no expense was spared. Other nice ones were The Mirage, Mandalay Bay, Aladdin. Circus Circus is not centrally located. If I were to go back, I'd definitely stay somewhere around Venetian, Mirage, Treasure Island. Side trips we did were Death Valley, CA (awesome), Grand Canyon, Red Rock Canyon, Hoover Dam. If you have kids and plan to take them to the midway, expect to drop a small fortune on these games and pack an extra bag to get all the stuffed animals home in that you can check or carry on if you have to. I had to stop our kids because we had so many animals...they do give nice prizes to the kids. Adventure Dome was neat. No where near worth the $25 or whatever they charge, but you can't really get away from doing it when you have kids old enough to know it's there and what it is. Oh, one last thing...several times, around the weekend days the valet parking would be full and they wouldn't accept any more cars. I think being a guest there, you should be able to no matter what. It was so full because of the circus acts and midway. And a last suggestion...valet park !!! Don't waste time trying to park yourself. Drive up, get your ticket and walk right in the front door of the hotel. When you are done, show them your ticket, get your car, tip a dollar or two and be on your way. This was sooooo worth it. It was less hassle, no headache, less walking.

Reviews.Title: “Hated Circus Circus”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Circus Circus Hotel and Casino has to be the biggest clown show in Las Vegas if you’re look for a cheap so-so stay. We arrived at the hotel at 2:30 PM on Wednesday (6/22/05) and were already greeted by a long registration line. There were all of 3 clerks helping 30+ guests and a bellman helping direct people. Two hotel managers were doing whatever behind the desk. Our first room was in the non-smoking section in the Circus Circus Manor. After finding out it wasn’t part of the main hotel and we had to walk about 1 full (normal) block to the buildings. No shuttles or golf carts for guests. After entering the building it smelled of cleaning supplies. We got into the room and it smelled of vomit so we call the front desk to get a room in the main hotel. The second room was much better in the West Tower. The next morning we went down to the breakfast at the Circus Buffet; cash is king in Las Vegas and no different here while I waited 5 minutes for them do a “Room Charge”, guess they don’t deal with “Room Charges” often. The food was ok but nothing to write home about. The room service breakfast on our last morning was better and obviously came from a different kitchen. Like a fair number of casinos in Vegas there are families with kids. Circus Circus is especially bad where most of the day Mom’s or Dad’s are sitting on the side benches with 2-4 kids in tow trying to make time. Older kids tend to be at the AdventureDome mini amusement park. One afternoon we hung out at their pool of which there are three. Two are a short walk from the hotel but not as far their Manor buildings. The third pool is over closer to the RV Park and the Manor buildings. Having a slight breeze is a nice thing in Vegas but not this afternoon by the pool where we got these occasional smells of the garbage crusher. Our last morning I wanted to do a late checkout after calling the front desk I was told that a checkout between 11AM and Noon would cost $10 and between Noon and 2 PM would be $20 – what a joke, their casino must not be making money or something. I would not recommend staying at Circus Circus unless you want a so-so hotel and be “nickel and dimed” on everything.

Reviews.Title: “Yuk.......”
Reviews.Author: cathyBelfast
Reviews.Content: Circus Circus is awful if one year we hadnt been put in a hotel in Greece with pipes in the bathroom instead of fawcets I could and would call Circus Circus the worst supposedly 3 star hotel on earth, a damp smell prevades the rooms I think its from the air conditioning pipes, they have put no smoking rooms in but never cleaned the rooms enough to lift the residue of previous smoke, its just very dirty and run down. I am not an overly fussy person and have stayed in 2 star accomodation in Spain etc, I usually shrug and say you get what you pay for but at least the most basic hotel should be clean its not much to ask, is it?.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While Circus Circus is an older strip hotel, and aimed at the family market, I still think it's great value for money. We've stayed here several times before, and this time upgraded to a tower king room. The room was huge and well serviced. It was in the most central tower to the casino and the floor was quiet. Check-in was smooth and they offered express check-out to avoid lining up. We stayed 4 nights. Prices for food and entertainment are very reasonable at the hotel and the ones around it. It was very busy due to summer holidays, but it didn't bother us. If you don't like seeing a lot of kids and families wandering around the main shopping areas, this hotel might not be for you. The only negative was the business centre, where the internet connection was poor. However, they didn't charge us when we couldn't complete our business because of it. Again, great value and upgrading the room is worth it for longer stays.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews aren't always right!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have to give Circus Circus an excellent review because we had a great time with no complains at all, and frankly I was terrified after reading the reviews here. It took us about 20 minutes to check in, but they were pretty busy. We had a room in the Skyrise tower, but I asked for a room in the West tower and we were upgraded at no charge. (I had heard the Skyrise was a bit of a walk) The room was non-smoking as I requested and looked exactly like what you see on thier website. House keeping came both days around 9:45, but we asked them to come back later and it was no problem. The room was very clean anyway. I did hear a screaming child @ 9:00, but she/he was screaming very loud and it only lasted a bit, and I couldn't really tell if they were next to,above, or below our room. We ate the breakfast buffett at 10-10:30 and only waited about 5 minutes in line. The food was great and the selection was huge. For other meals we ate at other places. I came with my boyfriend and no children. We did see children around, but they were not running around crazy anywhere. Our plan was to see Las Vegas so we actually only came to the room to sleep and relax. It was a great time despite the reviews I read here and we would definately stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Okay and Not Okay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Circus Circus is affordable during the week which okay, but if you don't smoke. They stick you in this 3 story hotel out back of the Circus Circus tower. They say the whole tower is Smoking only. How fair is that too people who don't smoke, we deserve a view too. The rooms are huge, and have a frige which is a plus, but out of the way to walk from the main part. Circus Circus casino itself was fine. Slots of Fun is close by, and has some great drink specials. No frills when staying at the Circus Circus, except for saving you some money. Maybe stay again, if it's the only thing affordable on the strip when I come back. Prefer the Luxor, but can't always afford it. Also stayed at family timeshare Jockey Club which is nice, and next to everything. We would stay their everytime if we owned it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Circus Circus”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to Las Vegas at least twice a year and most of our stays are at Circus Circus. Our last visit was March 2005. The hotel, employees/staff, clientel, even the children were great. The food and rooms were very nice as usual. We have stayed at the Manor on numerous ocassions as well as the Skyrise and Main Casino towers. I have nothing but wonderful feelings for the hotel and the Club One perts. Because of the family atmosphere and services, we have planned a family trip for July when we will be bringing our 5 grands and oldest daughter for 4 days. We are really excited about visiting Circus Circus again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: laserheid
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights in early May 2005. Its an absolutely huge hotel with something to do for everyone. Live circus acts ongoing all during the day. Plenty of shops etc. and of course slot machines. Internal free overhead mono rail very handy for getting to exit, without walking all through the complex. Was taken to front of the queue at check-in when staff noticed I walked with a cane, also was the same when queueing for fantastic value buffet breakfast. Very clean well run hotel. I heard that it does become over-run with schoolchildren at holidays and weekends, however I missed this scenario.

Reviews.Title: “Hated every minute”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stopped here for 3 nights as part of a fly drive. It took 20 minutes to find a parking space and reception, 45 minutes to check in and a further 15 minutes to get to the room with all our bags. Then hotel was totally crowded, you couldn't move. The guests all seemed to smoke, drink and curse at every opportunity. We requested a high room to be away from the noise but as the walls are so thin you can hear everyone on your floor. We were woken every night several times by people returning to their rooms. The only way to cut out the noise was to have the air condition unit running all night. The reason it cut out the noise is because the air condition unit is so loud no other noise can get through. I had to wear ear plugs to get to sleep over the air con. The rooms were not that clean, stained carpets and everything is bolted down, and I mean everything, TV, lamps even the alarm clock. You only get one small flat pillow each and when we requested more pillows we were told we could only have 2 even though there were 4 in our party. The food was poor quality, the hotel itself was dirty and the pool was a joke. After fighting your way past the litter, the bins and the discarded towels the pool itself is tiny. Very disappointed with our stay and will never return.

Reviews.Title: “The pits”
Reviews.Author: kiwi_mica
Reviews.Content: Long wait to check in, long walk to find trhe elevators through crowds of people, rooms had paper-thin walls. We hated it and checked out and went to the Monte Carlo, which was great

Reviews.Title: “Stop the Fussin' and Smile!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After yearning to see Moby (electronic DJ) in concert for years, hubby and my schedules were finally in sync with his Las Vegas performance. I was more than a bit apprehensive, not being a fan of gambling and maintaining an allergic-like reaction to cigarette smoke. Circus Circus appealed to me because of the great rates and fun atmosphere. After reading some of the fierce reviews on this site I booked our reservations through Hotwire with great trepidation. I feared for nothing! We arrived at 1 AM and found at least 5 or 6 desk clerks working hard checking in a steady flow of patrons. After a 20 minute wait (it is a very large hotel) we were given a well illustrated map to guide us through the complex as well as a coupon book to hot spots in the city. The hotel room was more than adequate. The tub, toilet, sink, and bathroom floor were very clean and the bed linens were fresh smelling. No smoke smell, no mold, and no evidence of previous occupants. The bed was fairly comfortable and the water pressure was good. We are late risers so we often chatted with the housekeepers who were friendly and hospitable. A phone call down to Housekeeping was needed for an iron, but it was delivered within 5 minutes. The complimentary circus acts were entertaining and the Adventure Dome, filled with amusement park-type rides and activities, was a pleasant diversion. There are several eateries in the hotel, including McDonalds. The Buffet was reasonably priced and the food was acceptable. The hotel is located near the end of the strip, so pack comfy shoes. Public transportation in Vegas runs 24 hours so we did not bother renting a car. The lobby is clean and not overwhelmingly smoke-filled. We stayed for five days and neither my husband and I were accosted by crazed, parentless children. I cannot comment on the Manor because we stayed in the main hotel. I would definitely stay there again. It’s a good place to rest and shower and I felt safe and comfortable at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, on the strip, no complaints”
Reviews.Author: ism6507
Reviews.Content: For US$47 we were expecting worse and pleasantly surprised at a clean, spacious and quiet room in the Sky Tower. Check-in fast, parking free, casino area little dated, but the $$ well worth it. No fancy add-ons, so if you want good value room for a night or 2, would recommend Circus Circus. Breakfast Buffet at $8.95 well worth the value too. No line-up at 10 am, food pretty good, good selection, lots of choices, etc. Don't bother with the "Vegas Monorail" especially if you have a car. Monorail always at the back of each hotel and you have to walk a LLLLLLOOOONNNNGGGG way to the next hotel. Not so bad, except for the 100 degree temp! Free parking in most hotels, so just drive from one to the next. Don't miss The Cheesecake Factory at Caesar's Forum. BEST restaurant in North America!!! and reasonably priced. ANY of the cheesecakes will send you into sheer heaven. (and we don't even LIKE cheesecake normally).

Reviews.Title: “More than we expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our wedding and honeymoon in May 2005. We chose to stay at Circus Circus, because we were trying to cut costs. We didn't expect alot from our hotel, since it is one of the lesser expensive ones on the strip. We were pleasantly surprised. They offer an express check-in service...which was very nice to avoid the usual long line at check in for most vegas hotels. Any time we had to call the front desk, the phone was always answered on the first ring and any request was treated as a priority. They went out of their way to please us. Our room was very nice and clean and most of the furniture and fixtures looked new. We both noticed how spotless the bathroom was. The insulation must be good, because we didn't notice any noise from any of the other rooms...and our view was amazing. We were overall pleased beyond expectations with our stay at Circus Circus.

Reviews.Title: “A trifle tired”
Reviews.Author: chicco
Reviews.Content: The Circus Circus Hotel:- 2 of the elevators were out of order, therefore we had long waits to get to our floor. At times we waited about 15 minutes. The drinks machine and the ice machine on 22nd Floor were also out of order. The Rooms were clean but the decor was very tired looking. The Circus Buffet was not at all good, some of tables were not cleared of large amounts of leftover food. Not at all conducive to a pleasant dining atmosphere. The actual Buffet Bar was one of the poorest in content and badly cooked I have ever been to. Generally poor value for money. Not at all what we expected in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we thought”
Reviews.Content: Great for kids! very nice views.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Mad-Maz999
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed with Circus, Circus. It was loud, hot and noisy. The room was OK, big enough for the 3 of us but I found it all very "brash." If you can afford a better hotel go for it. Kids loved the adventuredome but as you can imagine the floors were covered in litter that seemed to be there for days. The carpets were sticking to your feet and the bins were overflowing. It is one of the furthest hotels out on the strip but closer to the new fashion mall and the stratosphere roller coaster ride. The breakfast buffet was reasonably priced with plenty of choice but get there early as after 9am the queues were horrendous, even at Dennys or Macdonalds over the road. I would not stop at this hotel again, and I would say to anyone travelling without kids to stay somewhere else on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “happy with the hotel choice”
Reviews.Author: mustangjudy
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the west tower, large clean room and bathroom. we had kids with us 13 & 16 so the kids in the hotel did not bother us. I read some bad reviews on this hotel but decided to stay there anyway I am glad that we did. the circus acts and adventuredome and midway are great for the kids. the staff was friendly and helpful. It's not fancy like mandalay bay, wynn etc. but I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just exactly what one should expect of it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is neither terrible (despite the horror stories you may read from other reviewers herein) nor the best bargain in town (though it is a good value for the money). We stayed in a Tower Room. Stayed here because it was one of the few places in town where I could get a decent deal on the dates I was staying -- and because I had never stayed on the this (the North) end of the Strip before. Plusses: Good-sized room; nicely decorated; amusement park on site. Minuses: Longs walks to wherever you're going; no hot water in sink! I would stay here again -- but would not actively seek it out. If you're expecting first-class room and service -- look elsewhere. If you're looking for value and will spend a good portion of your time outside the property anyway -- this fits the bill (and I would not say that about all Vegas hotels).

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I expected”
Reviews.Author: ckelley03
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Circus Circus yesterday and it was exactly as it should be. The rooms were just like a typical hotel room and the buffet was similar to a Old Country Buffet. It never ceases to amaze me the people on here who want to pay $50 a night and get bellagio quality. Then they complain about it! That's just as bad as those who complain about too many kids at Circus Circus. Come on! If you are considering staying at Circus Circus, pay the extra $5 and don't stay in the manor rooms. If you pay for the cheapest of the cheap, that's exactly what you are going to get. But don't believe the doom and gloom of some of these reviews. I've stayed at three hotels now that have sounded absolutly horrible on this website and they have been just fine. Circus Circus is NOT luxurious. It is at the FAR end of the strip. The food is pretty BASIC. So if this isn't what you want, you need to spend the extra money and stay somewhere nicer. Otherwise, Circus Circus is exactly what it should be. p.s. If you do stay at Circus Circus, the $1 blackjack table right next to it is great. You can play for hours and not lose money, while drinking the free drinks!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Circus Circus Easter 2005, enjoyed every minute of it. Rooms were large, clean and comfortable, staff cleaned every day. Restuarants were good, busy but queueing was not long, buffet offers a good variety, but nothing changes so it gets a little boring. Good location, although at the bottom end of the strip, has a bus stop right outside the door so easy access to the top of the strip and Downtown Las Vegas. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: greenmountains
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas was just a stop-over for us on the way to the Grand Canyon. I was shopping for price when I booked Circus Circus for two nights, long enough to catch Mystere by Cirque du Soleil and to get a small glimpse of Las Vegas. Our room, on the 11th floor of the towers, facing the Stratosphere was clean, large, and truely a "non-smoking" room for less than $100/night. This hotel is obviously frequented by folks of more modest means than the fancier hotel/casinos at the other end of the strip-lots of young children. We were rarely in our room and walked many steps to catch all the sights of LV in 36 hours. If you are looking for a luxury resort experience in LV, don't stay at the Circus Circus. If you are just looking for a relatively "cheap" place to crash each night and don't mind putting on a few miles, Circus Circus is perfectly adequate.

Reviews.Title: “mediocre at best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was generally unimpressed with Circus Circus. They messed up our reservations, and basically were willing to resolve the problem only some prodding. Further, although we asked, and were supposed to have a non-smoking room, the room we got had had smokers in it very recently. We tried for three days to get rid of the odor, and never did. Obviously, the people who had been in the room recently did not care that it was a non-smoking room. The problem is that I have two kids who are allergic to the smoke, and it two several days after the trip to clear up the problems. The rooms at the manor, where we stayed, are not only not as nice as the rooms in the towers, they are, in my opinion, not any nicer than rooms at someplace like Travelodge, which are much cheaper. The only thing Circus Circus has going for it is the Adventuredome. But you don't have to stay at Circus Circus to use it. All in all, my recommendation would be, if you have kids along, to stay in a different hotel, and go the Adventuredome and circus acts anyway.

Reviews.Title: “The place for families with children”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at this hotel last week, put in a room in the West Tower overlooking the strip which had obviously been refurbished. Everything seemed brand new, including the bathroom. Staff were friendly and helpful and it was great value. Our kids loved it in the adventurdome and it was their favourite hotel on our US flydrive trip. Why book Circus Circus and then complain about kids when it is specifically aimed at families with children (doh!).

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Eri
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the circus circus last april during the nab convention. I decided to stay there because my friend was staying there and because it is walking distance to the convention center. When I was checking in, there was a screaming baby right behind me. I was thinking why was there a 6 month old baby in this setting. I know that the hotel is geared toward kids, but come on a baby. What where these parents thinking? I had to listen to this kid crying and screaming for a half-hour. The employees at the hotel where very nice and helpfull. The hotel and my room was very clean. It was nice that cat bus was right in front of the hotel. I had a nice time there and would recommend this hotel. Except for that baby no other kids bothered me alot, of the kids were well behaved.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as you think”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Circus Circus gave me a big clean room at the last minute for $80 dollars per night. Not bad considering I went down on 3 days notice. All of the other hotels were I usually stay were booked. I stayed in the West Tower. My only complaint was that the bed was not firm enough. However, I avoided the casino and food court while I was there. If you know your way around Vegas and need a place to stay when everything is booked then Circus Circus is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Way too many kids”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Only stay at Circus Circus if you are bringing your children to Vegas with you. If you are doing that it is a great place for them. If you are like me, and have no children this place was terrible. Kids screaming and running in the halls. And the food was more catered to the family, and not very good at all. Granted I spent most of my time out of the hotel, but when I did come back, I really didn't want to be bothered by a bunch of little kids. You can spend about the same amount at Paris Paris and there are less kids there. The best buffet I had was at the Luxor.

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus is great for kids”
Reviews.Author: nancct
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Circus Circus in the Skyrise Tower for three nights. The room was OK, faced Treasure Island and the Rio. The Adventuredome was great for the kids, buy an all day wrist band and they are happy. It is quite a walk from the Skyrise Tower area to the front of the casino/strip area. One thing that I did not like was the pool/jacuzzi area closes at 5:00 PM! We went to check out the pool area and the stench was so bad we wouldn't have gone to the pool even if it was open. We did not eat there based on the reviews I have read. Ate at Green Valley Resort in Henderson, wonderful food, fresh! Also ate at the Palms buffet for lunch, pretty bad, also ate dinner at the Palms mexican restaraunt, the food wasn't bad but it took over an hour to get our food. Visited Fremont Street for the light show, neat thing to go and see down town at night. Took a bus tour to Ethel M. Chocolate Factory, Hoover Dam, and boat tour on Lake Mead. A wonderful day, highly recommend it if you want to get out of the cansinos with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised after reading so many bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Circus Circus March 22-26. We had a great time. No waiting in line to check-in, large clean room and definitely not as smokey as others have complained about. (I would be the first one to complain had this been a problem) We traveled with our 13 & 14 year old children and they were able to find a lot to keep them amused. They especially enjoyed the Adventuredome and the Midway games. We ate at the Pink Pony twice, once for breakfast and once for dinner. We had quite a wait both times, but the food was very good. We would stay there again in a minute!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: FishFever
Reviews.Content: Stayed with 2 other adults and an 11 year old 3/23-3/26. Checked in at 1:15pm. Took about 5 minutes. Presented drivers license, credit card and $20, asking to see if upgrades available. Was given a non-smoking room on the 29th floor of the west tower (where check-in is). Fabulous view of the strip. Rooms were large and clean. No complaints excepts the beds were a little hard. Called for extra pillows and blanket-were deliverd in 10 minutes. Spilled water on bedspread and was replaced with clean bedspread when housekeeping made up the room. Lots of kids, but that was expected. Did not eat there at all, so cannot comment about the food. Quarter slot machines were very tight, but cleaned up on $1 Magnificent 7's. Usually have to wait for a machine, so that speaks for itself. Never visited the midway which is why we stayed there. I have no problem with staying there in the future, but just to be sure, I would make sure I get another room in the west tower. Checked out via television. Elevators very slow in the morning when everyone is checking out. Saw no roaches, dirty carpet, etc. as reported in other reviews. Had no problem whatsoever with any staff.

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus ----!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: what can I say, we arrived at 2am to find our room had not been cleaned (my sister arrived the following day and had the same problem) a bell hop was sent to take as to another room but when we got there the new key cards we'd been given didn't work so the bell hop let us in to drop off our luggage and we had to trail down to the lobby (by now it's 3am!) to change our cards. There is no tea & coffee facility or mini bar in the rooms and the bath is made for dwarfs! sound proofing between rooms is non existent (I spent several nights laying awake listening either to next doors TV or arguments) The buffet may be cheap but it wouldn't be value for money even if they paid you to eat it!! The Pink Pony was much better food wise but there was a permanent queue due to low staffing levels. The whole place looks tired grubby and shabby and I couldn't tell you how many times I got bitten. In fairness there were some polite helpfull staff but there were also a lot of rude, stupid ones. It actually got to the point where we were embarrassed to tell cabbies on the strip where we wanted to go as their faces dropped when we told them (one even informed us that the circus buffet was commonly known as the worst on the strip) As for child friendly - it's not!! there is a theme park (which even guests have to pay to get into) but if you have a child under 5 forget it, the height restrictions mean there's very little they can get on. All in all a total dump!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Circus Circus on March 14-17, 2005...I was surprised how it looked inside...The rooms were clean and the staff was very nice...I thought it was a great place to stay...My daughter and my mother both like the hotel...plus my mother loved it because she was winning at the casinos...Over all I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Anyone else here have a fear of CLOWNS?”
Reviews.Author: SLOJen
Reviews.Content: Figures that one of the only hotels with rooms available during Spring Break would have to be circus-themed. Clowns are frightening...am I alone here, people?? I consider this hotel to be sub-standard compared to the others I've stayed at in Vegas, yet I still paid over $100 a night. Oh well. It wasn't like I was in the room longer than the time it took for me to shower, dry my hair and apply some make up. (Ssssshhh...don't tell anyone that. Remember kids: What happens in Vegas, stays in Vegas.) The best part of my stay here was that I made a new friend while waiting for the elevator one night. He was short and black, about 3 inches long, with a great set of "feelers." And boy, what a charmer. It was a cockroach. He seemed to really enjoy his stay at Circus Circus. I did NOT...

Reviews.Title: “a room is a room”
Reviews.Author: picchick
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas twice in the last 7 months and both times I opted to stay at the Circus Circus hotel. The first time I went I stayed at the manor and although it was by no means modern it was adequate for what I needed it for, (i had no concerns of contracting bed bugs or cooties.) The second time I went with my spouse and we stayed in the tower which was considerably better. The room in the tower was clean and decent, and we were not in Vegas to rest :0), the point is the hotel was acceptable for the price it served well as far as to have somewhere to shower/sleep and store your clothes. I was severely disappointed with the food ( I had a brown salad). The staff was okay. The view was not. But a room is a room. If you want the prestige of the venetian/bellagio, rise early and catch the CAT to the other end of the strip for a $5 pass. All in all, the hotel was average. Plus,I liked the fact that I was in walking distance of the IHOP! yummy. I have made arrangements to return to vegas this septmber and have chosen to stay at TI, because it is next to the mall. I will let you know how it goes.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It should have not been a surprise that the only available rooms in the city during a massive convention (ConExpo) would also be the worst. The rooms were booked on a non-smoking floor and yet all three rooms wreaked of cigarette smoke. The floors were filthy and the view was of an adult bookstore across the street. The whole experience left me with a sour taste in my mouth. This was my first trip to Vegas and after having toured nearly all the major strip hotels; ours was by far the worst. When I go back again in July I will be staying at the Mirage. The price I booked at was identical to what I paid for Circus Circus. What a shame.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for, not as bad as people make out”
Reviews.Author: varkanoid
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on here I was slightly concerned, however upon arriving I was presently surprised. We were told to avoid Fri/Sat as this is when most Americans come to Las Vegas for the weekend and the check in queues are very long. We arrived on the Monday around 5pm, no queue, and the lobby didnt smell that musty as previous reviewers complained about. Reception friendly and helpful. When I booked I made sure we got a room in the Skyline Tower and the room was great. Big kingsize bed, great shower, pillows were rubbish. Asked for an additional one and it came in under ten minutes. View from room was ok but West Tower obscured view of strip. Ah well. Hotel was pleasantly clean. Unfortunately there was the College Basketball and Schoolgirl Soccer tournament, plus several conventions, including ConExpo. So Las Vegas was full of burly construction workers. Did not have problems with kids at all. In fact the kids were more polite than the adults, who seemed to wander aimlessly in front of you. Only time kids were in abundance was at the weekend, and then again not too much of a problem. Las Vegas is not really a place for kids, and Circus Circus was one attempt for the hoteliers to cater for families, so bear this in mind. We went in most hotels and you do pay for what you get, however we were disappointed with the look of The Mirage, Treasure Island and MGM Grand, they were not as good as we expected them to be. Venetian and Aladdin was the best in our view, we got lost in Caesers Palace. Yes hotel was a bit smokey but then so were all the others around the casino. Only ate breakfast at the cafe opposite the adventure dome which was good value. The slots in the back tended to pay out more than the ones in the main casino, oh and try the Megabucks machines, whilst we were there the jackpots was $114M, my fiancee couldnt keep off them !! It was a bit off the strip, but you either walked over to the Hilton and caught the $3 monorail (which is now fully working), or caught the CAT bus at $2 a ride or $5 for all day. There is a bus stop for the 301 and 302 smack bang outside the hotel so no excuse for people complaining its too far. It also only took us 15 minutes to walk down to the centre of the strip, so cant understand the complaints ? The hotel is a cheap 3* hotel, so you cant expect the Bellagio. I was pleasantly surprised as the previous reviews make out its a dingy hole but it was quite clean and tidy and the hotel staff were really friendly. I cant really speak for the food though as we ate out most of the time. Only other grip was that the TV channels were rubbish but who stays in to watch TV ?

Reviews.Title: “Horrible for ages 21+”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the first 5 minutes i walked into circus circus to relive the childhood days i would be here when my parents went here continuously, i witnessed high school aged kids fighting in the casino!? where is security when you needed one?? there wasn't any!? the fight lasted for a good 2 minutes and no security came to stop it. Kids where running all over the casino. the buffett sucked. and the waitresses that served drinks looked like zombies. stay away if you really want to experience the real vegas.

Reviews.Title: “you'll get better”
Reviews.Author: topcat72
Reviews.Content: stayed at the circus circus in january this year on part of our honeymoon before moving on to san francisco. first the pluses - room was fine, big, good shower and bathroom, comfortable bed, , hotel not noisy in bedroom area. breakfast buffet was excellent minuses - hotel is old, grotty enough in casino area compared to ther hotels on strip, (and we went into most of them) smells of cigarette smoke (always). location is at the wrong end of strip, but is short enough walk. staff okay, but bars and franchise restaurants in the hotel are the poorest we saw, plus the grottiest mcdonalds in the states! overrun with kids, great to amuse kids, but not for anyone else. we spent all our time in the other hotels and venues on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you have to stay there.”
Reviews.Author: hapeit
Reviews.Content: The kid shows are OK, but only stay here if you have to. I stayed there 3/10 to 3/14/05, would have been a better trip if I stayed at another nicer hotel and took the kids there for a few hours each day.

Reviews.Title: “To many wild kids”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i just didnt like all the kids running around knocking on me and my wifes hotel room late at night when they should be in bed! the gambling was decent but the cocktail waitress's will forget about you when you ask for a drink even if its just a bottle of water ,the best thing about this place was it had slots a fun next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The name was not all to appealing to me, but the hotel proved you can't judge a hotel by the name. I thought it was afforadable and pretty fancy. The place is huge! The resturants, gift shops, promenade, even slots had great deal. All hosts and servers were polite and never let my drinks get low. There was so much to do, so much to see. The location on the strip was pretty nice too! I had a blast and would totally recommend staying there at least once on a trip to America's playground.

Reviews.Title: “Over The Top - Just What You Expect In Vegas”
Reviews.Author: little_jo_uk
Reviews.Content: This is by far the biggest hotel I've ever stayed in in my life. I know I was probably the naive little Scottish lassie arriving from a small town, but it blew me away. A working funfair and a circus going on in the middle of a hotel, a mono-rail to take you to bits of it and an absolutely huge room with a very comfortable bed. The selection of food in the buffet was staggering. You could have everything from waffles to spaghetti for breakfast should you so desire. I'm a bit annoyed that other reviewers criticise the presence and noise of the children. This is a family hotel. It's made for kids. They are entitled to make a noise and have fun on their holidays as much as we did when we were that age.
