If you don't want kids near you, don't stay there, but Circus Circus doesn't pretend to be anything other than a family hotel. There are plenty other hotels in Vegas if you want something more sophisticated; however if you like a bit of fun, a nice comfotable room, a handy location, and lots going on all the time then this is recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Yes it's cheap and convenient.... but don't get lured in by that!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Circus Circus with the understanding that it was going to be less than luxurious. I wasn't looking for luxury, I was looking for cost-effective and close to the convention center... and I must say that Circus Circus fits both of those criteria, but economy lodging and a sub-standard slum are two different things! If you do stay there, do NOT allow them to put you in one of the "Manor" Buildings... these are low rise hovels that are a block and a half from the main hotel and don't look as if they have been rennovated since around the same time Gerald Ford was president! The carpets are so disgusting that I didn't feel safe walking around the room barefoot, the hair dryer, remote, electrical outlet and safe were all broken at some point. The cockroach in the room on the last night was the final straw. We were then moved to an "upgraded" room in the Sky Tower which was halfway decent at least. For all of this trouble we were given a $30 adjustment on the total bill (three night stay) and a comp breakfast for two in the Pink Pony restaurant... and had that not been free, I would have had a major compaint because the service was so horrible in that restaurant. One final pleasantry was, before we checked out, when I was getting dressed, putting on my boxer shorts and the maid walked in without knocking and then proceeded to ask me "When are you going? I need to clean this room" as I stood there half naked. Do yourself a favor if you're looking to save money, spend the extra $40 or $50 a night and stay at New York New York or the Luxor. Trust me, it's a small price to pay to avoid the hassles at Circus Circus.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We do not know why some people gave Circus Circus such poor reviews. After reading some of them, we were quite concerned about going there but as our trip was already booked we couldn't back out. For the price it was good. We were also in the Manor section of the hotel and it was clean and comfortable but a bit of noise from the other rooms came through to ours once in a while. For the price, it was quite acceptable. The buffet was also great and the food was excellent with everything kept clean all the time. The only complaint that we had was the unsupervised children that kept turning the escalators off on a regular basis. This was not the hotel's fault but the ignorant parents that let their brats run wild.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Angel723
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Circus Circus for our honeymoon from 2/18 to 2/20. Had emailed with hotel for several days. Received an upgrade to a mini-suite for $10 additional per night. Room was large and clean but very, very plain. No mini-fridge even! I asked for a bottle of champagne to be in our room when we arrived but was told they wouldn't know what room we would be in until we arrived. Arrived at 1:00 pm. Called for room service for the champagne. They only have room service from 6 am to noon!!! Ridiculous!!! The hotel was packed with screaming kids and some very unsavory characters. Rules are no kids in the casino. Baloney - they were EVERYWHERE. And very loud!! Food was very plain, only ate breakfast buffet twice. Won't ever stay here again. Pay the extra money and stay somewhere else....anywhere else!!!

Reviews.Title: “Below Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Checking in took us an hour. Room is below average, so is the shower room. Circus Buffet is horrible. Overall, I was very dissapointed. I will not recommend it to anyone. First time and last time I will be staying at Circus Circus.

Reviews.Title: “Underrated!!”
Reviews.Author: swindy10
Reviews.Content: Listen, we weren't expecting much. This is one of the older hotels on the north end of the strip......but we really had a pleasant experience. The room was nice & clean....spacious....the front desk service was top-notch. A young lady went above and beyond to assist us with some questions. If you do not have kids.....beware...this is a more family friendly Las Vegas Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Served the purpose”
Reviews.Author: mjv111
Reviews.Content: My wife, son and I stayed at the Circus Circus from Thusday, February 3rd through early Sunday February 6th. We stayed there because the tournament we were participating in was at the convention center and several other families from our area were staying there. The hotel was fine for that purpose. The phone in line for check in worked well. I was able to bypass a long line and get my room keys quick. The lobby was very dark - not sure why. Elevators were ok, sometimes slow. The room was average - not bad. We ate the breakfast buffet one day. Disappointed that no omlettes were made but then we should have asked before we paid. Did not eat any other meal there except for Krispy Kreme Doughnuts. Hallways were clean. It took two calls to get an extra pillow but I called early in the morning to make sure I received one by bed time. The follow up call to remind them about the pillow was at about 4:00. Overall, I would probably stay there again for the tournament at the convention center but have stayed at the Excallibur also and would stay there for any other visit to Las Vegas. If you don't have kids (or don't want to see them on your trip) do not stay at the Circus Circus. Kids are everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: RCUK
Reviews.Content: Have just returned (3rd Feb 2005) from 6 nights at circus circus. Though all the review seem to pan it we stayed (3 rooms) in the skyline tower. The room were pretty well finished, decent size and bathrooms etc were all really clean - absollutely no complaints. What wasnt good was the beds and pillows - it was impossible to sleep in the rooms for any of us! The staff etc were okay - lets be honest - this isnt the Bellagio, so you cant expect the same quality of staff. You pay for what you get and if you pay cheap you get cheap. I wouldnt go back, or recommend it to anyone. But considering we didnt pay much for it i was happy enough with the place

Reviews.Title: “Love the circus circus”
Reviews.Author: Vegasgirl
Reviews.Content: Some of these reviews are ridiculous! The circus circus is great. I went there in December and put my first $20.00 bill in a machine and won $1000.00. Go and check out circus circus!

Reviews.Title: “Yuck”
Reviews.Author: SkyTravel
Reviews.Content: I did not actually stay here, my friend did and I visited her room. We also ate dinner there and I have been inside of the casino many times. The main thing w/this hotel is that it's very OLD and outdated and it shows! The circus theme is tacky and cheap. My travel agent actually said not to stay here because another agent did, and when she went to step into the shower and her foot went through the tub! If you want to go cheap but you have a way to get around, try one of the smaller hotels off the Strip. They are often cheaper but nicer.

Reviews.Title: “not bad, but never again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Circus Circus in September of 2004. When we arrived it was VERY crowded. Also, the employees there are very rude. Actually all of Vegas was rude, but these employees the most. Overall, the hotel was ok, if you have kids. If you do not, go elsewhere. I never thought a hotel appearance would mean so much to me (especially in vegas my motto was that we wouldn't be spending too much time in the hotel anyways) however I will never stay there again. Rude staff, boring pool environment. Not a place for young people.

Reviews.Title: “fourth time was terrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at circus circus for the last five years. This year2005 was the pits. The mattress in our room was lumpy, and you could feel the springs Most of the staff couldnt speak enough english to answer any questions or help you in any way. Slot attendents were terrible I waited 30 minutes for change for a !00$ bill, and 20 min for a machine fill. In general circus circus didnt care when I mentioned these things to them most of the staff had the personality of a coiled rattlesnake. Michael my stay was 1/9-13-2005

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus good Value 4 Money”
Reviews.Author: CasseyCollie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Circus Circus for 4 nights whilst on a 2 week driving tour around California, Nevada & Arizona. We found the hotel was fine, the room was clean & spacious, and staff were friendly enough. We ate at the Pink Pony and also the Buffet, both of which were good value for money and the food was ok. I would definitey recommend a trip to the award winning Steak House at Circus Circus when you visit Vegas. The food here was fantastic. We are visiting another hotel in Vegas in June 2005, and will definitely be eating at the Circus Circus Steak House! The only downside we found to this hotel was the location on the strip, it's a good walk to the central hotels, but you can always use the shuttle buses to get around. It may not be as fancy as some of the newer hotels on the strip, but in a place that never sleeps you only want somewhere to get your head down every now & then for a reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: lovetojourney
Reviews.Content: We stayed in late December 2004 for 4 nights. Have to admit the adjoining rooms we had in the Sky Tower were large, clean & adequate. Two queen sized beds in each room The rooms were value for money. We were lucky to be able to check-in at midday rather than having to wait for the hundreds at 2pm. Perhaps they took pity on us as we'd travelled almost a day to get there from Australia. No fridge or tea/coffee facilities. We just slept there & were out all day. Didn't dare eat in the buffet or restaurants. The entire downstairs areas of lobby/casinos/restaurants/shops were dark, dingy, smoke-filled & unpleasant. We all felt very uncomfortable. Would not stay there again. Prefer something closer to the action. The bus back took 30 minutes because the traffic was bumper to bumper.

Reviews.Title: “**Dirty and tacky...pay the extra for somewhere else**”
Reviews.Author: Stallica
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Vegas in November of 04 and our initial impression of the entire City was blackened when we first entered the CC hotel. It is very dark and dingy. The carpets were filthy and all around smelled dank. People hanging out in the casinos were seedy and questionable. It felt like miles to walk to our room up escalators and elevators through drab hallways and corridors. When we first arrived it was quite late, so nothing on the upper floors was open except a small bar which was actually pretty friendly. Our room was just that, a room. Truly nothing to write home about. We started our journey out of our room the next morning and noticed that still, none of the shops were open. It was like everything was shutting down even though the day had just begun. We left the hotel to venture down the strip. Again, take good walking shoes because this hotel is MILES away from anything good. You have to walk past all of the creepy areas of that end of the strip before we actually reached almost midway where everything changed completely. **HINT: BUY A $5 CAT (TRANSIT) PASS GOOD FOR 24HRS. THE SYSTEM WORKS REALLY WELL AND WILL SAVE YOU MUCH PAIN IN YOUR FEET!! Our holiday was overall really great. But that was because we spent all of our time on the OTHER end of the strip. We tried the buffet at CC ONCE for breakfast and that was all it took. NEVER EAT THERE! The food was disgusting and tasted like plastic. The only good thing on the buffet was the bacon and the specialty coffee you poured yourself from a machine. The staff? Didn't really see much of them except for check in, check out and of course the casino workers... if there were tables open. My opinion? Stay at Treasure Island for the few extra bucks and definately check out the Dualing Pianos act for free at Haarahs. Now THAT'S Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “Whatever you do, Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Eurrgghh! Whatever you do, don't stay here! This hotel's not up to the standard of the other hotels in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Not a business class hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We thought we were back 20 years ago when we went to Vegas on business for convention and stayed at Circus-Circus. Las Vegas hotels have really racked up their rates for convention visitors and some who are accustomed to staying in the better hotels on the south side of the strip are staying in other hotels to save money. You have to go downstairs to the "business center" to get high speed internet. The room service is only from 6:00 am to noon. Their are no phones on the desk and you have to plug in to the phone all the way across the room to hook up to the slow speed modem which you can get from the room. The lobby is dingy and the carpet looks filthy in the lobby area. If you stay in one of the newer tower rooms you can get a good view of the strip. These rooms are large but nothing like the newer Las Vegas hotels when it comes to furniture and beds. The beds are not that great but we did sleep okay. Don't ever want to stay here again! Great for kids and families but not for business travelers. Lobby smells bad when you first walk in. Elizabeth W.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect more than the rate you're paying”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaPhotog
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Circus Circus a couple of times. Fortunately, I've been in the main tower each time, which is convenient to food, casino and taxi's. It's one of the oldest hotels on the strip and caters to families. Do not stay there if you don't want kids around. Rooms are average, food is average. It stays booked because of the low rates. It's at the north end of the strip, so it's a walk to the newer mega resorts and shows. Best to take a taxi or the monorail (whenever it finally opens). I wouldn't be surprised if it's imploded one day for a new property. In the meantime, it's probably the cheapest large casino hotel on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “stay away during children's holidays!!”
Reviews.Author: ak_kimby
Reviews.Content: Oh my GOD, screaming, noisy children everywhere!! We did not STAY at this hotel, but just went there for the day to see some circus acts.....which we never saw. It WAS the day before Christmas, so I suppose it's not like this everyday!??! I remember it being a fun place as a kid, but that was before all the video game area and rides were there I think. It seemed like there were 6 billion children there and 2 billion adults trying to control them. Plus STROLLERS everywhere!! We wanted to ride a roller coaster but left in frustration. Never ever going to go to that part of town again!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: chris_mla
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with my 4-year old daughter as I thought that the Adventuredome would be nice for her. Only, sadly for me, she liked the Excalibur better! The room was comfortable and the reception staff were not rude at all ( perhaps we were lucky), but I still don't think that I would go back there. The hotel is huge, but so are most of the hotels in Las Vegas. It's just the horrible run down atmosphere that really got me. Yes, it is cheaper than some other hotels on the 'Strip', but I think that it would be worth paying that little bit more if, like me, the hotel makes difference to your holiday. I would definitely NOT recommend it if you are not a child friendly person as this hotel IS full of children. The food in the restaurants is also bad and the pool area very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Hor-r-r-rendous”
Reviews.Author: SimonLancaster
Reviews.Content: Why dont they give this dump the Dersert Inn treatment,,..i.e blow it up. Vile horrendous place devoid of..well anything. If you're a Krispy Kreme Kid you will love it. Anyone else stay away. Nasty bedrooms festooned with polyester and all the charm of a funeral parlour. In fact thats what the bedrooms reminded me of. It was one night only but one night too long. A cautionary note to all Brits who are sent to this place on a package. If you dont own a shell suit and dont buy your jewelry from Argos (clown necklace , horse shoe earings et al) demand to be put somewhere else. It is not and I repeat NOT a wondeful hotel.. it is the lowest common denominator of a tatty Vegas hotel..be warned!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: esg13
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from vegas on the 3rd of dec and we stayed at circus. I was in the horrors about staying in circus after reading all the reviews on this site. The rooms were great, bright, clean and spacious also the bathroom looked as if it was new. Also we never seen screaming kids everywhere and the corridors were nice and quiet. Overall good hotel that represents great value for money!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good on the whole”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our rooms were lovely and very clean. The staff were helpful - our family had 4 rooms and they managed to put us together even though we were arriving at different times. On the downside - there were no tea/coffee making facilities and room service finished at midday but I suppose they want you in the casino not in your room! Rooms were quiet. Downstairs was noisy and smokey but it's a casino so you expect that. Not as upmarket as some of the other hotels but the price isn't upmarket either. Excellent value. The buffet was good for breakfast and evening meal not too bad. Plenty of healthy options. Avoid Pink Pony which was dreadful - both food and service. We would come again but eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spend 8 nights from 12 Nov. This hotel was booked for us as part of a package deal and as we had never been to Las Vegas before, how do you know what it will be like? We know now - absolutely dreadful! When telling friends where we would be staying they had said it would be full of kids, but it was completely overrun. Although I had specified a room in the main building, we were booked into the Manor Rooms which were quite some walk from the main areas, and completely open to public and traffic. The idea was I could gamble late as my husband doesn't, and just go to an elevator to return to the room. No way did I feel safe enough to walk alone back to the Manor. I immediately requested a move to the main building, but was refused on the grounds that the company who had booked the room would have to do the amendments. I did not find the check-in staff helpful; they were completely indifferent to my request. I felt they could have helped, even if it meant charging us a bit extra, which we would have gladly paid. In the end, we were on holiday and didn't want to live out of a suitcase whilst spending days on the phone trying to get moved, so we stuck with it. The lifts in the Manor were filthy and smelt awful; the room was not clean; the sheets were OK, but the bedcover had seen better days and felt sticky and dirty; although the bathroom was kept clean by the staff, it also did not smell fresh at any time. People returning to their rooms throughout the night were very noisy and inconsiderate of others who were sleeping. The whole place is just OLD! From Mon-Thur it was quiet when all the families disappeared, but on Friday it started to get manic again. The buffet was OK during the week while it was quiet, but don't bother at weekends when the kids run around the food areas helping themselves, completely free of parental control, heaping their plates with food they're never going to eat. Dreadful, dreadful waste. Luckily, there is so much to see and do that we only slept there. The casino is also smoky, overcrowded and overrun with kids, so no gambling there either! We'll definitely go back to Vegas, it was GREAT! But never never Circus Circus. Time it got the Desert Inn treatment, imploded to bits!!

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: No1_mom
Reviews.Content: I visit Las Vegas every year, but this time was on a budget. I had heard good things about Circus Circus, but that must have been from people who haven't stayed in a good hotel. The room was lovely, but the rest of the hotel: amusement park - over 60% shut, tiny in size, not enough attractions. Circus, where, we seen one good although short trapeze act. Buffet - don't unless you an upset stomach. Poor quality, and for an extra $ or two you could eat in luxury. Staff, seemed mostly over the hill, with an odd young face, but certainly not many cheery faces - unless they were talking to each other, then it was all smiles. The shuttle train was shut, no reason given. This is one hotel needing a full and complete make over, it was shabby, dirty and tired (except for the bedrooms). Spend a few dollars more - it will be worth it (in shoe leather alone!!)

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there!”
Reviews.Author: Glenda99
Reviews.Content: With our New Zealand dollar not going far in the States, we went to Las Vegas on a bit of a budget but we had strong recommendations from friends who had enjoyed staying at the Circus Circus Hotel before. What we didn't reckon on, was how it had gone so down hill since the friends had been there. The bathroom and the linen were clean but we had to ask them to clean the windows as there were kids fingermarks etc all over them. The blankets had holes in them, some of which were darned. The room was in the most depressing colours with the discoloured ceiling hanging like a storm cloud over our heads. We stayed on because we had prepaid but we certainly wouldn't recommend it to any one. Time it went!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ok so it's one of the oldest on the strip and could do with a coat of paint, but value for money doesn't come any better than this. Oversized rooms, fantastic restaurants, especially The Steak House and Stivali, make eating in an excellent option- not to mention the buffet Circus Circus really does have something for the whole family!! Staff were friendly and courteous and I wAs surprised that a member of one of the stores remembered me from my stay six months before!! If you want extravagance go to the Bellagio, but if you want a friendly atmosphere with loads to do in the hotel Circus Circus is perfect

Reviews.Title: “It's an Okay place to stay”
Reviews.Author: merasyph
Reviews.Content: Spent 10 days in Las Vegas for our honeymoon. Despite the terrible reviews of Circus Circus, we still stayed there since they offered such great package deals. We stayed in the West Tower. The hotel is older, obviously, but clean. Our room was your basic hotel room. Nothing fancy, but not horrible either. Personnel was friendly. We walked about Circus Circus and noticed alot of kids, but with the exception of kids screaming while eating at the buffet, they weren't bad. Our hallway to our room was always quiet and we couldn't hear our neighbors. I will say that Circus Circus's buffet and restaurants ranged from horrid to somewhat less then mediocre. We tried 2 buffets and the Pink Pony Cafe, and vowed never to eat anywhere on C.C. property again. I would say if you simply want a place to lay your head at night, then Circus Circus is as good a place as any. They offer great deals. I've read alot where others feel C.C. is too far from the rest of the nicer hotels on the Strip... but from my experience, the Strip is 2 1/2 miles long with a ton of stuff - from Mandalay Bay to the Stratasphere. You're either gonna want to just gamble or see it all - and if you're in the latter, you're feet are gonna hurt no matter which hotel you stay at. We chose to be at one end of the Strip (end of Strip but closer to downtown), and used CAT transit.

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus: Just for Kids”
Reviews.Author: wonderwoman
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent three nights at Circus Circus from 9/17 - 9/20. I booked my flight/hotel through Alaska Air because it was the least expensive package available at the time. Knowing what I know now, I should have paid a little more ($40-$50 more) and picked the Aladdin or Excalibur. Don't get me wrong, Circus Circus is not horrible at all, it's just not appropriate for single women in their '20's partying it up in Vegas! The hotel was far from any kind of action ($10 cab rides to the middle of the Strip can add up), restaurants served mediocre food (how can one mess up Mexican food?) and there were kids everywhere. But, it is a hotel greared for families, so what can one expect? If the Bellaggio is Nordstrom, Mandalay Bay is Macy's, then Circus Circus would be K-Mart. One thing that I liked about Circus Circus was that the rooms were pretty clean. Will I stay at this hotel again? Probably not. Not my style at all.

Reviews.Title: “Are people expecting the Ritz???”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For £110 for 4 nights for two people you really cannot go wrong here.We found the room more than adequate- I've paid more and had worse in many, many hotels. It was huge, clean and had great views of the strip (Granted, not all will have that).Yes, the hotel is a fair bit older than the rest, and therefore a bit of fraying and peeling is to be expected- but how much time do you spend in one hotel anyway? Especially in a place like Vegas. The hotel is at the top end of the strip, but either have a stroll down it, like we did, (or is it old fashioned using your legs?) or catch the very regular and cheap buses to the more fashionable and EXPENSIVE hotels. We saw a number of families with kids, but all were well behaved. In fact, they seemed to be having fun in a hotel geared up for the budget traveller and family group. Loved the circus acts!!! If you prefer to go out and about and spend your money on entertaining yourself and enjoying this unique city, rather than on a bed you use for a few hours a night, this is the place. We stayed 4 nights, ate, drank and flew over the grand canyon in a helicopter for the price of a couple of nights in one of the more expensive casinos- and visited all of them into the bargain. This hotel is fun, cheap and somewhere to rest your head at the end of the day. I'd definately do it again!

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as we thought it would be”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I spent three nights at Circus Circus last week. Given all the horrendous reviews, we were expecting to be attacked by cockroaches and small children at every turn -- but our experience was fine. We arrived shortly before the 2pm check-in time on Tuesday. There was a substantial line, but it moved quickly. We were placed in the West Tower, the elevators for which are convenient to the back door of the hotel, but a bit of a hike from the front door on the strip. Our room was large and clean, with a few of the mountains (and the enormous tacky pink glass "Adventuredome"). The bed wasn't particularly comfortable, but not awful. We've definitely experienced worse at various hotel chains throughout the US. Our only complaints were that: (1) for some reason the housekeeping staff loved to start vacuuming the hallway at about 7am, and (2) if anyone on the floor ran their shower or flushed their toilet, it sounded like Niagara Falls was rushing through our bathroom. Also, (3) the location of Circus Circus basically sucks unless you happen to like the seedy end of the Strip. We spent a fortune in cabs to get us to the places we really wanted to go. Also, we had a tendency to stay out very late and then sleep until late morning or noon. As a result, we missed out on the housekeeping experience and never had our bed made or our towels replaced for the duration of our stay. We never had that problem at Luxor or the Tropicana. All in all, though, Circus Circus was fine for the price. If you're expecting luxury, stay at the Bellagio. If you want a clean, average room and you enjoy the sounds of vacuums and plumbing, Circus Circus is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at Circus-Circus Hotel. Was pleasantly surprised at the accomodations. Stayed in the West tower. Rooms were very nice and large, bathroom very large, water pressure very strong, lots of clean towels. Housekeeping very thorough. Was a little reluctant after reading some of the reviews. Will definitely stay here again. Had a wonderful view of the Strip. More children than expected for this time of year, but they were no bother.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot believe you get this service in USA!!!! Never again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed October 2003. Totally dis-organised, staff indifferent, double booked rooms, room had towels etc missing. Every little thing costs more money. Had credit cards taken and staff would not let us pay cash to call companies to cancel cards! Eventually agreed an hour later! Expected better from this chain as stopped in others and more like Blackpool B&B run buy children with raging hormones! NEVER AGAIN TRY THE EXCALIBER FAR SUPERIOR

Reviews.Title: “Worse than a YMCA”
Reviews.Author: guy999
Reviews.Content: I stayed at circus circus this weekend. I don't know where they people who liked this place have stayed before, but the YMCA is better than this. The rooms are dark and dank. We complained only to be told that we could leave. We didn't complain until the next morning however and we should have done so earlier, although it would have been difficult finding a room at 10pm. I will never ever stay here again. I will never gamble her again. The shower wouldn't drain, there were cockroaches, I was afraid to lay on the comforter. I wonder if they people that like it work for circus circus, because this place is the biggest hole I have ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Great Fun”
Reviews.Author: amitkkk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights at the start of October. We had a great time here. It was a lot of fun, located on the strip. he theme park is excellent, and if you want you do not need to leave the hotel for days-it is that huge. Word of waring-dont lose your party-it could be days until you find them

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT stay here”
Reviews.Author: roomfinder
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Friday 17th of September around 3 o clock. The queues in the dark lobby were ridiculous. Finally after check-in we got to our room. The safety bolt on the door was broken and there were signs in the room advising you to bolt the room during the night. I called housekeeping who promised to come and look at it. Guess what - they never did! The carpets were dirty and the whole place was horrible. It is not really ideally located either, it was my first time in Vegas and I made a mistake. If possible try to avoid it. We went to the US for 10 nights and stayed in 5 different hotels and this was by far the worst and only one I have any negative comments about.

Reviews.Title: “circus circus no problem”
Reviews.Author: Davynessie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Circus Circus during September 04. I was a little worried after reading other reviews which called it a dump. But every eye sees it's own beauty. When we entered the lobby I thought it to be a bit dark and dismal but the check in staff were very pleasant and allocated us a room on the 26th floor of the west tower. The room was large and spotlessly clean my only gripe would be that there was no fridge or iron. The casino was as you would expect busy but the standard of cleanliness was good. We used the buffet quite often and found it very good for breakfast and evening meals. Any staff we were in contact with were polite and helpful. Circus Circus is at the north end of the strip so it is a bit of a walk to the likes of the Bellagio or New York New York especially in the heat but a taxi can be taken from the lobby or a tram type bus can be taken from the corner of Slots of Fun next door for $1.75 a ride or $5 for an all day ticket. Over all we would recommend Circus Circus there are better hotels/casinos but you pay accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place was total chaos and confusion during our very brief stay in August. What hotel in this day does no include an ironing board in the room. Thank goodness Mandalay Bay had availability - we quickly transferred to that property and "ate" the money we paid through the Expedia booking. Expedia needs to reduce the star rating of this property.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for the budget traveler”
Reviews.Author: maynard7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Circus Circus in late September 2004 and had a nice time. I was nervous after reading other reviews about the hotel, but the price was much lower than other hotels and I decided to take my chances. The only fault with the room is that the drain in the bathroom sink didn't drain fast enough, otherwise, everything was just fine. I was on the seventh floor of the Skyrise Tower. The room was clean, the bed was comfy, there was a wing-back chair, plus two other regular chairs, a desk and small table. A word of advice, try to get in the Casino (west) Tower if possible because you will walk a lot less. When you stay in the Skyrise Tower, you have to take a 10 minute walk through the casino every time you want to go out to The Strip. Did you forget to put your Chapstick on? Sorry... it's a ten minute walk back to the Skyrise Tower, and ten minutes back. When I first arrived in the room, they had sprayed some fragrance that I didn't like at all. Fortunately, you can open the window a few inches, and then twist open the round suction vent in the bathroom to clear the air. When I came back later, the smell was gone. Blackout curtains let me sleep late. They charge a dollar a day extra for unlimited phone calls from your room, but calls to 800 numbers incur a 75 cent charge. Checkin line took about 20 minutes to get through. Desk staff was nice. Video checkout from your room means you don't have to wait in line again when you leave. A word to the wise: do NOT stay in the Manor rooms. They are usually five dollars less per night than tower rooms, but you will regret not spending that five dollars. I think many of the negative reviews about the Circus Circus were from people who stayed there. The Manor rooms seem to attract trailer-park types, along with the noise and other problems they bring with them. By the way, if you stay here during the week, and not during summer vacation months, you won't have kids running around everywhere... they're in school!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa_S1977
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Circus Circus for the first time in 2001 and had no problems, thus we booked there for our return trip this year in Aug/Sep. Yes check in did take a while, but we didn't mind. At first we were given a smoking room (we weren't asked for smoking/non smoking). Called reception and we were changed without problems. Yes there are kids running around but we knew that and we didn't have a problem. What did upset us is the amount of kids left unattended whilst parents gambled...sometimes very late at night or very early in the morning. Something really should be done about that. We only had breakfast at the Pink Pony and the food was fine. We had a pizza at the Pizzeria, cocktails at the Blue Iguana (cheap!). Overall, it was a pleasant stay. The rooms were clean and spacious and the bathroom was huge (compared to some hotels). Our view was of the Stratosphere. I do recommend a stay at CC for someone on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Dreams”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Las Vegas in May 2004, we stayed at Circus Circus. The room was very nice and clean, we had a view of the stardust hotel from our window and we enjoyed playing in the Casino and especially enjoyed the slot tournament and Slots of Fun which is located right next door. The Strawberry Daiquiri in the large hurricaine type container(can't think of the name of it) was very good. The food at the Pink Pony Restaurant in the hotel was excellent. The Buffet at Excalibur is Excellent-I think it's called The Round Table. The only aggravating part of the trip was waiting on the shuttle bus from the Airport to the hotel, we waited almost an hour for the shuttle bus. Everybody seemed to come in at the same time that night. The Bellagio fountains were beautiful at night and we found a lot of great deals in the shops. I had alot of luck at Caesar's, and the Gaundula's at the Venetian looked like fun(we didn't get a chance to ride them). There were alot of things we didn't get to see and we were there for 3 nights and 4 full days. We plan on going back next year hopefully around the same time, the weather was beautiful with a nice breeze everyday about 85-87 degrees. Very dry heat, you will definitely want to carry a bottle of water while walking the Strip, you will get thirsty real fast, even after eating. We had a great time and plan to see more sites on our next visit and take in a couple of shows and tours. Excellent vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Neekeesha
Reviews.Content: We stated at the Circus Circus from 9/6-9/11. This hotel is awesome. The price was affordable. Our room was kept clean everyday. We received new towels every morning. This hotel is definately not a Cesaers Palace or Monte Carlo. If I could compare this hotel to another, it would be a Hampton Inn. The buffet food is nasty. Do not got to the Pink Pony or the Pizzaria. It looks good, but it's nasty. There is a Krispy Creme there. This was not there 3 years ago when we visited. The upstairs is devoted to kids. It's an Xtreme Park that has roller coasters and video games. So parents if you want to get away, let your kids play in the park upstairs. To me if your going to Las Vegas to site see, and gamble this is perfert b/c all of your money is not spent on the hotel and then losing your money in the casinos. That's right, you will lose your money. IF I COULD GIVE YOU ANY ADVICE, DON'T EAT AT THE BUFFETS ANYWHERE. ALL DISGUSTING.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awful! We were in Las Vegas over Labor Day weekend and the only hotel that wasn't outrageously expensive was Circus Circus. However, I would have gladly paid more if I knew what we were getting into! The rooms weren't clean--there were gross stains on the beds. The place smelled musty, old, and used up. The dealers and cocktail waitresses looked bored and lifeless. But that may be part of the charm of this Las Vegas landmark! I also have to point out that the people that stayed at the hotel during the weekend were part of the issue--they were mean to the hotel staff, loud, and rude. No wonder the place isn't kept up if the hotel employees are treated disrespectfully! If you don't know Las Vegas, you also have to walk very far up the strip to most of the newer hotels. Overall it was a very unpleasant experience. If you have a choice between spending $20 or $30 more bucks at a diff. hotel or staying here--def. go somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “A bit old but it was clean”
Reviews.Author: SashaJade
Reviews.Content: We stayed on 16th and 17th August and although the hotel is getting old, the room was clean and comfortable, which is all we needed as we only sleep in there. The place is very busy with families and its sad to see children lying on the floor in the coridors at 1am waiting for their parents to finish gambling. We enjoyed watching the circus acts till the early hours and won loads of cute teddies. The food at the Pink Pony and the buffet breakfast was very good and good value as well. Don't think I would stay again, but it was an experience.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Circus-Circus hotel & casino. September 2nd-3rd. The price was pretty cheap. I had problem parking and had to park in the gross unclean parking garage. The elevators in the P.Garage were disgusting. When I got in to check-in around 4pm! The check-in line was horrifying (Keep in mind this is Thursday night, before Labor Day weekend). Saw there was an express check-in line, wasn't sure what this was for. So I got out of line and went into the "express: check-in line hoping I qualified for it, when called, the Guest Service clerk, "CAROL," was EXTREMELY RUDE TO ME! After telling her my confirmation number (because I had called & got reservations prior to check-in) told me I was not eligiable for it without any explanation and told me I would have to go back to the end of the regular line (which, now had about 6 more people added to it)! After checking-in with a pretty nice clerk, "Shaun." we went upstairs to our room. I must say the room was small, but clean. Very nice room. Overall, I give it an "Average" rating due to the poor customer service by guest service clerk, "CAROL." And because the check-in line was very long and agrevating! Especially, when they should had more people staffed for an upcoming holiday weekend. But, since the rooms were neat and clean, it brought the rate up to average. Didn't stay long enough to give any more information!

Reviews.Title: “excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: having read some of the reviews before heading to cc on 11th august i feared the worst.how far of the mark they were! the buffet was beautiful(we ate there the whole week) and the room in the skyrise tower was spotless with a great view towards the stratosphere.yes,there are kids in the place,but what do you expect,that is who it is aimed at! if you don't like kids, simple, go somewhere else.thoroughly recommended to one and all and as for the whingers, well, i guess there are some people you will never please.

Reviews.Title: “Judge for yourself ~ We enjoyed it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As many others had done, my wife and I read most of the previous comments about the establishment which gave us some pre-conceived ideas and images about the place. First of all, it was one of our many stops on our month long air/road trip vacation in America. We were absolutely resolved not to let any infraction disturb us so that it would ruin our time. It really depends on how you see everything with your minds eye. Yes, its up to you! Check-in took only 20 minutes, considering the size of the property and the myriads of guests that it accomodates, it wasn't bad at all. The lines seemed long to wait just to check in, but it rapidly moved along. They had about 20 desk clerks handling the influx of people. Our desk clerk was helpful beyond what many may assume. She answered all of our questions politely, confidently and without any hesitation. Knowing that the staff here are always busy, my wife and I acknowledged that and made it a point to commend her for her professionalism. Needless to say, she upgraded us to the sky-tower 14th floor with a view of the desert and the Stratosphere. Now this was for only $45 per night for three (3) nights! I consider that a bargain, especially for summer peak travel season. The room was huge and was beyond our expectations. Absolutely clean and tidy. Everything worked. Plenty of towels and toiletries. Maid service was prompt and efficient. We ate at the Circus Circus once. It was for the breakfast buffet on our second day there. For the price, $8, it was more than satisfying. Wide variety and more than enough choices of food and beverages. And just a little tip for all you readers. We came down to have our breakfast at 11:00am. The lunch menu starts at 11:30am for about $11. That gave us the opportunity to have "brunch". We stayed and ate for both the breakfast and lunch service. No big deal, but we were hungry and it sufficed our appetite. Yes, there were plenty of children there. But not, in our opinion, like what other reviewers had commented on. They were well behaved and were supervised by their parents. Of course you have the exceptional few (they tend to look under 4 years old) who may have a stubborn attitude and a temper for who knows what. I'm sure that we all had one when we were little. The only minors that were unattended by their parents were the ones in the Adventure Dome. They were kids ranging from 8 years old to the mid-teens. You would EXPECT that for a place that caters to families with children. Besides, all of the children were focused on staying IN the Dome. They had no interest outside of that. The location was at the north end of the Strip. No big deal. We expected that and arranged accordingly. Got to enjoy the entire Las Vegas experience while spending our evening sleeping at the Circus Circus Hotel and Casino. You would have to judge it for yourselves. Many may seem to regard this hotel rather bluntly and downgrade it. I suppose anyone would say so if they expected to stay in a castle. Staying here served its purpose rather sufficiently. It actually was better than expected after reading many of the reviews for earlier posters. Remember, you can have a good time or not. It really is all up to you! Some people may be either too sensitive or had a traumatic experience in order to elaborate on the many so-called "negative" aspects at Circus Circus. Too bad they didn't enjoy the time they had at Circus Circus, especially considering that many were on their vacation. We enjoyed it!

Reviews.Title: “I thought it was great! Kids love it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We picked this place because it was kid friendly. I was kind of worried about taking my 11 year old son to vegas because i knew he would be limited on what he could do, but choosing this hotel, he never once got bored. I wouldnt stay here if i didnt have a child, because there are so many children, and it was so busy, but... im glad i did this time. The room was very clean, the only complaint was the TV stations, there werent any for children, and only about 10 to choose from. I know that children arent allowed on the casino floors, but when ever my son would stop, or if he was waiting with me for change, sometimes the workers could get really rude...at one point, i thought my son was going to cry over how rude some were to him. I understand and all, but i think they could be a little bit nicer and ask the children to leave in a friendly manner. They cater to kids, so their employees should be alittle easier on them. The shops here were great! There was alot to see and do right in the hotel. Catching a bus or trolly wasent ever a problem, the stop is right outside the hotel. Room service is a bit pricey, but with all the restraunts in the hotel, u really dont need in room service. Krispy Kreeme was SUPER! The buffet was GREAT! The best place for slots for me was their casino next door...i wasent too lucky in the main building. All in all i had a great trip here, if i choose to take my son again, i will stay at circus circus.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT EXPERIENCE!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and three friends stayed at Circus Circus in May for the supercross finals. We had a wonderful time! We were placed in the main tower above the casino on the 12th floor. The rooms were large and clean. Maid service was efficient, and were more than happy to come back if we were in the rooms during cleaning time. The food was great and inexpensive. The only complaint I had were unattended children. It was not a huge problem, but rather an annoyance that adults would bring their children and then not do anything with them. I leave my children at home, and expect others to. I was not too upset, because I did know beforehand that this was a family hotel. The slots payed off well, with my husband and myself leaving with the same amount of money we took, and our friends leaving with about $100 extra. The staff is friendly and courteous, and there are in-room safes for your use. Great Job!

Reviews.Title: “Nasty!”
Reviews.Author: North_Wales_Lass
Reviews.Content: This place is the pits! Thank goodness we were at Caesars! The whole area is just dodgy. Reminded me of Blackpool Tower. Full of kids, casino games and tackyness. I'd never stay here! There was a fire there when we were there. THANK THE HEAVENS THAT IT'S BEING TORN DOWN!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “OK, if you don't mind the smell”
Reviews.Author: rawkneee
Reviews.Content: Great low limit gambling, but at the expense of a foul odor. There are tons of kids running everywhere, which I think is the cause of the smell (dirty carpet floor). The rooms are descent. If you don't plan on staying much in your hotel, this is OK. I wouldn't plan on enjoying the pool, unless you enjoy tons of kids screeming and peeing in the pool. This casino is very ar from the action as well. It's a bit too far to walk to where the action is. Be prepared to ride a lot of taxi cabs. When you step outside of the casino, keep your wallet close, it's a little bit scary outside. If you don't mind living in filth, then this place is great. otherewise, I would look for a hotel room deeper into the strip.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE BUFFET”
Reviews.Author: Ohiomom454
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, my family and I ate here. There were no kids with us, we just wanted to see the casino and grab a quick meal. DONT DO IT!! The food was terrible, not a lot to choose from, the place was a mess, half the drink machines didn't work, we made leaning tower of dirty dishes before someone picked them up! This was all after waiting in line for 20 min. becuase there was a party of 15 in front of us that they wouldn't move aside. two other complete lines of people were sat before we pretty much pushed our way through and sat down anyway. the people are the rudest I have ever met!

Reviews.Title: “You couldn't pay me to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were going to stay here, and I am so pleased that I listened to other people. We stayed in a better casino for less, and a better location. We drove here, and the parking garage looked like it would cave in. Didnot look very safe to me. We found a parking space not in the garage. We got in the casino, and it smelled, and looked so bad. They say it had been remodeled??? When What YEAR?? I thought that Circus Circus in Reno was bad, but this couldn't even compare. Casino was not very clean, and kids running all over. Our daughter didn't even like it, and wanted to go. Also, it is at the end of the strip not the best neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and play”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had our family reunion there. the place was great had a lot of fun would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Other places to stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We took our 12 year old and stayed for 3 nights here and 2 at Excalibur.... wish we were at the excalibur the whole time. The room, lobby, casino, and midway games are ok...but most of the newer hotels have a game area for kids that were much nicer and just as fun....circus act was nothing special. The parking garage was rundown and just plain dirty....with as many people staying there you would think that they could clean it up a bit. Buffet was cheap.....you get what you pay for...Pink Pony was pretty good though. If you are bringing children to vegas...try excalibur it has an area for games and is much closer to other hotels that have fun stuff for kids to do...Luxor, NYNY, and gameworks is nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Hated Circus Circus”
Reviews.Author: lifebegins
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for! Last time I was in Las Vegas I stayed at the Excalibur which was excellent. This time around I opted for Circus Circus as being a slightly cheaper option (but not by much), also having my teenage daughter with me along with a friend it seemed to be the hotel with most to offer to suit all our needs. Disaster from the start. Waiting 2 hours to book in, rude reception staff, waiting a further 2 hours for fridge for insulin storage - not a good start when you've already been travelling for 20 hours. Buffet appalling, noise levels apalling, sight of young children running around or waiting for parents who were on the casino floor (even at midnight!) disturbing. This end of the strip is dirty and unattractive. I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Better deals elsewhere, even for families with kids”
Reviews.Author: MarkDavid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Circus Circus for one reason--our kids. We have four--oldest is six. We read the reviews, all the warnings that Las Vegas is not for families, and decided we would stay at Circus Circus because of all the supposed kid-friendly activities. We were leary--the price was so cheap (51/night). When we walked in the lobby, the check-in line ran from one end to the other. We waited almost an hour. The clerk said this was "pretty normal, especially for a Sunday night." We had asked for two rooms, nonsmoker, connected. We got two rooms, but smoking rooms and no door connection. The rooms are okay--pretty old but okay. The big disappointment was the kid activities. The "circus" acts are all of 20 minutes. The "theme park" was very crowded and surprisingly expensive. We quickly found ourselves visiting other hotels where the rates are slightly higher (70-90/night) but much nicer, much newer, less crowded and just about as kid friendly. Next time we'll consider the Luxor or Excalibur--they're connected with each other and with the Mandalay Bay, are much nicer but really not much more expensive and have some amenities that Circus Circus doesn't have, like a McDonalds on-premises.

Reviews.Title: “not so bad”
Reviews.Author: organ254
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews i was extremely concerned about staying at the hotel. On arrival our worst fears faced us with long queues to check in. however,as we had been forewarned by your reviews we came prepared with one of us joining the queue and the other fixing a large gin and tonic for the both of us! the staff to be fair were very efficient and are obviously used to the rush.when the rush was over all staff were always ready to help. checking in took 40 minutes and as long as you accept it will take time it really isn't that bad. we had a room in the west tower away from the noise,it was large room with a view of the stratosphere,no complaints there. it is a family hotel with many children but we found it ideal to use as a base, the main complaint being having to wait for the monorail to get you to the main building which definately doesn't run every 4 minutes as claimed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the circus”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a really great time at Circus Circus. We had our Grandchildren with us and they had a really good time. We have all intentions of staying there again. The only thing we did not like was they closed the theme park to early.

Reviews.Title: “A Love/ Hate Day”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to the Las Vegas Hilton to get away for Father's Day weekend and wanted to see the Circus Circus Hotel. The Casino areas had children dashing in and out which was nerve racking. The Casino areas are great if it if wasn't for that. The whole place outside of the Casino area is geared for families with lots and lots of children. I would totally recommend this Hotel for parents that want to see Las Vegas and have to take their little ones along. We really enjoyed the relaxing mood lighting in the lobby with the comfortable seating when we got tired. The children were resting and mother's were tending to their infants in a quiet setting. There was quite a festive atmosphere everywhere else. I wouldn't recommend it to my senior friends because there are too many children who decide to run off from their parents and crash into people walking through trying to get from place to place. I had a few encounters. Luckily my reflexes are still fast enough to stop them. But at 4'11" I can be knocked down by a big child if I don't see them coming. We had a good time when we went all the way in to the Casino area away from the kids running through. All in all we found it to be a very nice concept. Great shops and eating places. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus was the best thing about my trip!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am sixteen years old and I have just come back from my tirp to Vegas three days ago. Like many of the people on this site, I have read many reviews, trying to get a taste of what Circus Circus would be like. I was astonished when I read some of the reviews. After reading them, I didn't even want to go. But I toughed it out and went anyway, and I must say this:DO NOT LISTEN TO ANY OF THE NEGATIVE REVIEWS. For all of the people who write bad reviews about CC, what do you expect? You're only paying forty dollars for a room. If you want a Bellagio-style room, then go to the Bellagio. If anything, you should be happy you got such a nice, spacious room for only FORTY BUCKS! I loved my room and it didn't smell like anything. And as for check in/check out, of course it may take very long sometimes. THOUSANDS OF PEOPLE CHECK IN AND CHECK OUT EVERYDAY. For me, check in took an hour, but check out was very speedy. The last issue I would like to address is the size of the hotel and all of the complaints about walking. IT'S THE FIFTH LARGEST HOTEL IN THE WORLD. YOU SHOULD EXPECT TO WALK. After awhile you even get used to it. I speak for everyone in my family when I say this: CIRCUS CIRCUS IS A GREAT HOTEL FOR THE ENTIRE FAMILY, AND YOU SHOULDN'T MAKE ANY DECISIONS ABOUT IT UNTIL YOU'VE BEEN THERE IN PERSON.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in Main Tower room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Main tower room for 3 nights, with the Internet rate of $54.00/night. The room was so-so quality (slightly better than Comfort-Inns), but the price can be beat. Like others wrote it's a dream place for kids, as my 3-year-old son went completely nuts. Although it's still off-season, from parking lots to restaurants the entire complex is packed with families (all kids in the Strip visits here), so probably it's gonna get real messy as summer vacation season starts ;-) But if you want your kids to be entertained for the entire stay, this is the only place.

Reviews.Title: “Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nancy46
Reviews.Content: Our room was in the tower and was very nice. The circus acts and midway are fun. There are many families with children so if you're looking for adults only this is not the place. The breakfast buffet was really good, lots of variety (use the 2 for 1 coupon you receive upon check-in). The property is older but for the price is great!

Reviews.Title: “If you don't have kids, stay far, far away”
Reviews.Author: philsdottir
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Circus Circus a number of times over the past two years. Each time I swear I will never return, but this was just the worst. It's unfortunate because the price is good, and the property itself is just fine (we stayed in the main tower, I wouldn't stay in one of the annex areas) - but it's got the ambiance of a refugee camp. Kids, kids, kids. It's two-thirty in the morning (or any other time, really) and there are little islands of them, in groups of three to ten, scattered all over the casino, the hallways, the shops. They're dirty, crying, some of them are eating or drinking and many look like zombies. You're literally tripping over them anywhere you want to go. Who knows where their parents are - probably at the slot machines. I have occasionally seen Gaming Board folks telling people to get their kids off the floor and so forth, but it's been very few and far between - and then the parents just dump them right at the edge of the floor - hence these islands of kids. I don't see how this is a "fun family vacation" for anyone. The casino-level restrooms stink like no one's business because of all the people changing their babies' diapers all over the sink counters - yes, that's the sink where you are supposed to wash stuff OFF your hands after using the loo. Waiting in line to check in or out is more of the same - it'd be fine, the line moves pretty fast, but sheesh, I don't need little kids using me, my husband or our bags as hide and seek obstacles. I know, it's not their fault, they're probably disoriented, tired and bored. You can't even go up on the second floor, which is the arcade area, because of all the kids. The Pink Pony is a mess - again, no fault of the establishment, really, but all those kids and they're throwing and spilling food and running around... and the wait staff kept having to dodge them and sometimes lost food on trays because of them... then you get your food an hour late. The food was okay, the pizza place is good, though. Like I said, the place itself is okay. The rooms were good-sized, housekeeping was fine and the elevators were all fine. The casino part was okay, a little tighter than I'd expect but it was alright (all we ever do is play penny or nickel slots anyhow). I like the location and how you can walk from casino to casino without having to hike a million miles. I feel badly that I am allowing my experience with unruly, undisciplined brats color my feelings toward this property, when it's their parents' fault, really, but I can't help it. It's just terrible and this time I mean it: I will not go back until this problem is dealt with.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I got married at the Circus Circus hotel and the nicest thing I can say is that the wedding chapel is nice. As far as the rest of the hotel... not so nice. When we arrived, we had to stand in a long line to check in and as we were standing in line, we noticed that there were places in the carpet where electrical tape had been put down to hold pieces of it together. I WISH I were joking about this. This seemed to be a continuous theme in the hotel. We stayed in the manor - which reeked of cigarette smoke and was a hike from the rest of the hotel. Usually, the escalator leading down from the casinos and shopping area was generally out of service and the elevator seemed as if it had seen better days. Just outside the elevator of the manor where we stayed was more of the electrical tape. Our towels were never changed out, our shower was broken (it took many calls and 2 days for it to be fixed). To sum up, beware - you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Circus-Circus was great!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family spent 7 nights at Circus Circus and we had an awesome time! Our 14 year old thoroughly enjoyed himself in the "big pink dome", Circus Circus' amusement park. Security was excellent so we felt OK to leave him there to have a blast - we don't recommend long unattended drop-offs, but when we were gambling we kept vigilance via cell phone. The room was beautiful, inexpensive and had a fantastic view. One complaint: TV only had 12 stations which is not good for a TV addict like myself, but for the price you cant beat it! Otherwise the accomodations were top notch!My wife and I were the luckiest at Circus Circus and, their neighbor, Slots-of-Fun. (We visited every strip casino during our 7 day stay - ended up with very tired feet). Not only lucky but well fed with complimentary drinks -no other casino compared when it came to quick, free drinks! Our hats off to Circus Circus!Overall, we expected OK and got GREAT! - THANKS CIRCUS CIRCUS!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “people lighten up and relax!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have read all the reviews and we still plan a vacation at the Circus Circus each year. We have always had great service froma quick check-in to great food. Don't be an idiot and expect this place to be the Bellagio or something like that. we have two daughters ages 6 and 7 and they love this place to death. We stayed June 5-11 last year and are staying again this year from June 13-19 and we are so looking forward to it. Sure there are alot of kids but this is a family oriented hotel. My wife and I had a great time and everyone we met was so nice. Our room was huge and really, when you are away from the house, the dogs and your workplace; any room will do right? for us, we went in with our eyes open and we had a great time. It is a great value and we enjoyed it here as much as the Mirage. I mean, all we did in our room was sleep and shower and it was a huge room and very clean and quiet. i asked for more towels and they came up right away. The check-in was smoothe and courteous and there is so much for the kids to do. we vacation for the kids, and we really cannot ask for more. Just don't be too picky and expect so much and I think you will be pleasantly surprised. The food was great at the buffet, you can take a cab to anywhere fairly quickly and when you are on vacation just try and have fun and remember that you are there for fun. Getting stressed about anything like not enough towels or slow check-in is so not worth it. We will stay at the CC every year until my kids get sick of it. It's all they talk about during the school year and you cannot put a price on that. Frankly, I enjoy this place more than the ritzier places simply because I have yet to meet one jerk during vacation. Give it a shot and just relax. If you have young kids, you cannot go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Good place if you are just looking for a bed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel March 21-25, 04. Let me start out by saying the good points. The location is ok (at the end of the strip), the staff was great, and the food was ok. I took lesson on Blackjack, and the crap tables and they were excellent. Now the bad stuff, the room was very smoky (we asked for a non smoking room and floor) the room service was slow to the point of being nonexistent. One day they did not make up my bed at all just brought me sheets and towels. The pool, in order to get to the pool I had to go down, over up and back down, only to find a small area with no were near enough chairs for all the guest. They need another couple of pool areas for a hotel this size. This hotel was full of kids, running all around the place, stepping on your feet and running into you. If you want to avoid kids do not stay here, they are everywhere. I would stay here if I needed a place to rest my head, and had no other place to go, but as far as for a vacation, pick a place that has more to offer.

Reviews.Title: “good for kids”
Reviews.Author: Cecili
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days of an 8 day spring break. 4-11-04 to 4-19-04 We had stayed at the RV portion 2 years ago and was satisfied with those facilities. We knew because of spring break it would be overloaded with kids, but we had 2 teenagers so it was not a problem. Picked the location as we were attending an event at the Speedway in North Las Vegas. Had problems at check-in. First they had us reserved for 6 nights and we only reserved 5 nights. They had us as a no-show the first night and charged us and said they did not have rooms available in the tower at this time. We had reserved a room in the west tower in October 2003. They offered us a waiver of the one night no show charge and would lower our rate by $20.00 if we took a room in the manor. We knew someone who previously stayed there and did not have good things to say about the manor rooms, so opt to decline this offer. The check-in person then checked with their supervisor and said they could put us in the tower, but would have to charge the no show fee. We went ahead and took the tower room just to get a room and not deal with anymore hassle. They put us on the top floor (35th) and had a nice view. The only problem with that, is that you end up stopping on just about every floor on the way down. All the elevators to the upper floors were not always working. In fact only 2 of the 4 worked on a continuous basis. We also had a rollaway too. $12.00. The rollaway was worst than a cot. Actually a cot would have been better. FYI the rollaways at each hotel are different. The Excalibur has a much comfortable and nice rollaway for $15.00. However, the CC room itself was much bigger and nicer than the Excalibur which we stayed at earlier in the week. We could actually keep the rollaway bed down and it was not in the way when moving around the room. Can't say that for Excalibur. The Italian Restauant in Circus Circus was very good. Only ate the buffet once and chose to eat elsewhere during our stay. There are a lot of kids around sometimes real small ones too so just prepare yourself if you choose this hotel. Remember there is a theme area and video/midway area geared for kids. Plan on a lot of walking. FYI. the RV park does have a laundry facility if you really need to do laundry as we did. Not sure if it is only for the RV park guests, but no one seem to notice. We would stay at the RV portion again, but not sure about the hotel facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Take it for what it is”
Reviews.Author: Autarky71
Reviews.Content: Circus circus is the most northern casino on the strip barring the more isolated Sahara and Sratosphere and if you except it for what it is you'll be fine. Basically its cheap accomadation offering acss to the strip. I've stayed in the manor lodges twice now, purely because I've used the car a lot. (Have stayed in Vegas many other times). Walk out of your room and your in your car. Its about a 5 minute walk to the casino proper depending on what lodge your staying in. The rooms are fine but basic and the house keeping very good, though the walls are thin and depending on you neighbours , can be very noisy! The casino itself looks much like the others inside, though definately cannot compete with the grand scale and space of newer additions to the strip. The buffet ( a big part of Vegas dining ) was good for breakfast and poor for lunch. Never tried an evening dinner. The diner (pink pony) was o.k though the queues were overly long and the service definately not the best. Not really worth the effort given whats available elsewhere on the strip. Now the biggest downside ! The children... Circus circus is a family oriented complex (with a good fun park for the kids). But you can, and I often did feel over run by them and that they were getting under my feet. Only the excalibur (owned by the same people) felt the same. Basically use it for what it is. A cheap base from which to go out and explore the strip. From the Circus to the Southern most Casino - the Mandely bay is about 3 and a half miles. I say this as most people new to Vegas spend time hopping form every casino to the next. I know this is a much used for package holidays from the u.k and I'll say its fine. though for a little bit more you can do a lot better.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel may be one of the cheaper properties on the Las Vegas strip, but it’s still not good value for money. The hotel is poorly equipped and staffed in nearly every area. Our stay started with a 2 hour check in process! This included 15 minutes waiting for a parking space, 45 Minutes waiting in line to check in, and an hour during which we were sent to the wrong sized room, told that the hotel was full and the correct room was not available, then issued with the correct room only after complaining very, very loudly and publicly. Expect long lines for everything from the lifts, to the Deli (30 minutes plus to buy a Hot Dog). The rooms themselves are dark, dingy and poorly equipped and ours smelt strange! The public areas are tatty and actually quite dirty. The Swimming Pool is tiny (for the size of hotel) and only open 9am to 6pm, so forget an early morning or late night swim. We ate in the buffet once, and never again, after standing in line to get in you can expect to stand in line again each time you want hot food. The hotel is poorly positioned, right at the wrong end of the strip, to far to walk to the newer hotels such as the MGM, and with the Vegas traffic this journey can take over an hour in the car. The much advertised Circus acts are quite good, however, the seating area is small and don’t expect to be able to sit and watch unless you’re prepare to wait the 20 minutes between acts (they last 8-10 minutes and perform on the hour and half hour). The best thing about Circus, Circus is the Adventure Dome, at around $17 (with the $4 discount coupon that’s printed in all the local free magazines) it’s a good half days entertainment for the under 13’s – and not to busy in the mornings. My advice is to give the hotel a miss and drop in on the Adventure Dome if you have young kids that need amusing for a couple of hours.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the negatives!!!!”
Reviews.Author: pinkypunkyprincess
Reviews.Content: To all of you who have read the scare stories - please take them with a pinch of salt. I read all these reviews before staying at Circus Circus and was dreading it. I was SO pleased to find that the hotel itself is lovely, check-in quick (arrived at 8pm and in room by 8.35). The staff at the check-in desks were wonderfully helpful. The room was huge, and very clean. I would definintely stay there again, if only it could be moved slightly further down the strip!!One word about The Manor - although I didn't stay there, we checked it out and it looked fine. As soon as it got dark, there was a security guard pacing around but really, there are loads of people about and I felt totally, 100% safe everywhere I went on the Strip. Please don't worry un-nessasarily!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Dirty, noisy and messy. I tried to go the pool to relax but was surrounded by screaming children running around unsupervised. Also so far away from the rest of the strip that you have to take a taxi, which is really expensive, or the bus, which is unconvenient. Not the place where you want to take a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Circus-Circus Hotel- Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: reserve a room dose not get you what you thought! at circus-circus LasVegas. just the room. very unplesent stay. unclean,no service, express check in no way more like your rooms are not ready yet. No room service after 12:00 Noon. One Restrant open after hrs. Just all around a 1 star place to stay. They tell you what you want till you get their. Will never pay in full again,Once there they have you at there terms. Sent letter in with full bal stating what we reserved. Beware of sure we have when reserving rooms there.

Reviews.Title: “ok but....”
Reviews.Author: zeb
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in CC twice now, summer 99 and summer 02.. Summer 99 was myself and a mate, i loved the place and had no problems, although this was my 1st time in the USA and i didnt know any better. 2nd time being more seasoned and taking the family i kinda disliked the place. MOST dealers were nice to talk to and even the pit bosses but there was one stuck up dealer who i think was trying to wind all the customers up, he was evenshocked when i tipped him after the games. The location isnt too good, and if you turn left out of the main doors to the store or the Arbies (excellent) then it gets a little scarey, lots of hoods in cars i found, got followed back to the hotel once by a guy who jumped out of the back seat of a parked car and started trying to talk to us even though we only said hi and walked away, he followed us right into the casino. The only other prob we had was with a taxi driver taking us from Freemont to CC, he took us all round the world and wouldnt check his cab when i said he had my wifes bag. i tried to get the valet to help but he wouldnt listen to us at 1st and dismissed us with a wave of the hand whilst he put his head and body through the cabs passenger window to check what happened with the cabbie 1st. it turned out the cabbie did have our bag and the valet himself even said at 1st 'he has checked the cab' but how would he know? Anyway rant over, we did report the cabbie and he got 2 ticket things worth $75 each or something but that was only for taking us the long way. The adventure dome is nice for the kids and i liked the arcade part, the little shop is ok but go to the massive shop opposite, next to riviera, also the food court in riviera is good, the chinese for 2 or 3 courses and noodles is excellent.Also go downtown to freemont street experience if u do nothing else, i didnt go there 1st year and when i went 2nd year we went nearly every night, $1 drinks in most casinos and u can drink em on the street.

Reviews.Title: “loved it all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have stayed there twice before, great service, wonderful for the kids- will be there again next February.

Reviews.Title: “Circus Circus”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Circus circus, was a pretty nice place to stay, the rooms were very nice, and clean, the only complaint was the buffett was pretty high priced, and there was NO break on the price for the kids, 9.99 per plate

Reviews.Title: “Pleasenltly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After booking our trip, I started to read reviews on Circus Circus and became quite distraught. Not many positive reviews so I dreaded the worst. My husband and I were quite surprised. The room was clean and the staff was friendly. A long line to check in but if you go and get a drink from the bar - it makes the time fly. LOTS of kids in the casino - but what do you expect! Since we only spent sleeping time in our room we were happy with the price. Far from the Heart of the strip - we spent alot of time walking so next time we will book closer to the heart. But all in all - a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel every 18mths for about 3-4 months. I am a teacher and he's retired. We often take our grandson, so always stay at Circus Circus LV. I've stayed in all areas of the hotel but like Manor House the best as its close to the pool and only a few steps from the excalators to the main casino., also no worry about being trapped in high rise. Just fantastic for kids, and the bedrooms are very quiet. After 6 visits I'll be there again next year. Don't forget access to all the other hotels, attractions, dining and shows is very very easy. Amost affordable holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased, well kept.”
Reviews.Author: SBLbs
Reviews.Content: After reading so many poor reviews, I was very relived to find that or room was very clean and well maintained.
