I know some people will be put off with its location, but its in an area where you can still find $3 tables, and drinks cheap enough that you won't be bothered waiting for a waitress. I booked 2 other couples with us and everyone was pleased. Our rooms were on the 3rd floor of the Skytower. It would have been nice to have been up higher for a view but we spent very little time in our room with our eyes open. Id would definitely return. Slots-a-Fun out front was a good cheap time.

Reviews.Title: “Trash!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would NEVER stay at Circus Circus again. Our room was so far away from the casino, and Circus Circus is so far away from everything. The walls were paper thin, and the house keeping staff was noisy. The room was dingy. This casino is way too child-friendly. Las Vegas is an adult vacation destination. People should not be encouraged to bring their children. If you want to go on a family vacation, go to Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “You can get so much more for your money than this place”
Reviews.Author: jimmylo1108
Reviews.Content: Having been to Vegas many times, this was a pretty below average hotel experience. Negatives: 1. The Smell - ugh! Worst smelling casino in town. 2. The tram between buildings broke down when I was on it and the operator panicked more than the guests did. She did not know how to use her emergency cell phone. 3. Was charged for $12 per night for a crib (usually a courtesy) and received queen size bedding and some towels to prep it myself. Hardly adequate - in fact, dangerous for a baby. 4. Waited more than 1 hour for a drink at the slots (pumped in $150 and no drink?). Finally had to get a supervisor. 5. Phone in room did not ring, towels were not replaced fully, no ironing board, no coffee maker in room and you had to walk half a mile from our room to the Krispy Kreme that sold coffee at 6am. 6. Staff was not helpful getting us around. Positives 1. Hotel is smelly but rooms were clean. 2. For children, the adventuredrome theme park, the circus acts, and the carnival games were great along with an indoor Mickey D's and Krispy Kreme for little ones who couldn't sit through a restaurant meal. 3. I hear they have the best steak house in all of Las Vegas. Top rated by NY times. 4. Slots weren't too stingy, dealers were nice. My recommendation: stay if you have kids that need to be occupied with games and rides and you don't care too much about quality. If your kids like animals/zoos more, then I'd recommend the Mirage. The Mirage has the beautiful Sigfried & Roy animal garden with dolphin pool. The reception desks have huge fish tanks. The Venetian is right across the street from the Mirage with Gondola rides and Treasure Island pirate show at night right next door. Mirage pool is beautiful and casino is tasteful.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: usarelay
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 8TH TO 15TH Feb.after our travel agent booked us in by mistake [should have been the Sahara].After reading some bad reviews we were pleasantly surprised ,the room was big and clean and the view towards the Rio and palms casinos was good.It was also very quiet and we had no problems with kids at all. The buffet was as good as any other we have been to in this price range.We went as three couples and none of us had any complaints.The RV.park was almost empty so perhaps we was lucky and the schools were not on holiday.We always try to stay at a different hotel each visit and this one is as good as any other and not too far away from the action.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms fine - location too far”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the previous reviews I was a bit apprehensive about staying here! First thing to say is that this is not a 'bad' hotel - on the other hand it's not The Venetian, but then again you won't be paying their prices! The rooms are totally fine - a normal standard room that you'd find in the average city - these are not motel rooms, but proper hotel rooms. The minus points for the hotel are that for me it was too far north on the strip, so we had to take cabs everywhere - you probably could walk, but it's a pain. Next, the hotel is huge, it takes forever to get to your room - but then again there are lots of other huge hotels in Vegas. As for previous reviewers saying that the hotel was full of kids running wild, I think that's exaggerating things a bit! The hotel was extremely busy, but most Vegas ones are, and yes there were children there, but none of them were causing a problem! The final minus point is that the hotel caters to a more down market client - but maybe that's me being a snob though! I wouldnÂ t' stay here again, not because we had any kind of bad experience, but because it's just not central enough and I would prefer in future to pay a little bit more to get something closer and a bit more upmarket!

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay.”
Reviews.Author: BeeandCee
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have travelled to Vegas well over 15 times and have stayed in a variety of hotels including the Stardust, Treasure Island, Caesar's, MGM, Alladin and Bally's. This was the first time that we have taken our boys (12 and 14) and we chose Circus Circus because of it's "kid friendly" reputation. However, after making the non-refundable booking we were very dismayed to read the negative reviews on this web site. We were kicking ourselves thinking it was going to be a dump and complete bust. Well, it turned out to be anything but!! Our check-in on Sunday, Feb 15th took only about 20 minutes and a very helpful desk clerk (Lulu) got things straightened out for us after our travel agency screwed up and booked the 4 of us into single room. We stayed in the West tower (26th floor) in two interconnecting non-smoking rooms. The rooms were large, bright and very well maintained. The elevators to our floor were very fast and readily available, the vending and ice machine were close by and worked fine. As we were constantly on the go we did not eat much at the hotel other than the 2nd floor deli. we have heard the buffet is a disaster so deliberately stayed away. The kids had an absolute blast at the midway ( came home with 20 stuffed toys that they won) and the Adventuredome is an absolute bargain at $15.99 each after discount coupon for an all day pass. I found the casino action to be fine and picked up over $1100.00 playing video poker. There is no question that the hotel is overrun with kids, but duh, that is to be expected here. No, we would not stay here again if it was just the wife and myself, but if we bring the kid's with us again. absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “The Steakhouse”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband took my to the Steakhouse for my 50th Birthday and it was great. Although we had no reservation we were able to be seated within 5 minutes. We weren't dressed up but that didn't matter. The food was great and the portions more than one person can eat; which can be a bad thing if you're staying in a hotel and no way to heat up leftovers. Before going to Vegas we researched steak places and was surprised that this one was so recommended; being at Circus Circus and all. You don't expect an elegant restaurant in a family place. It was a little hard to find in the casino, we walked right past it and didn't even see it. It's been a while since I stayed at the hotel part so I can't review it. I have gambled in the casino several times over the last year and wasn't too impressed. The place is old and needs to be remodeled which I'm sure will come in time. The circus act was almost a joke. The one show I saw had the main act of a girl and a hula hoop. Don't think it was worth the 30 minute wait. Try the Steakhouse, you'll enjoy it, but it's not cheap; average price of a meal looked to be $25 - $30 but is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Mads
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights during the month of August. What a holiday. Was touring the west of the US, so Las Vegas had to be visited. Circus Circus was great. I was there with 3 other girls and we all stayed in the one room - not a bit cramped, and worked out much cheaper for us. The facilities in the hotel were great. Lots of restaurants, the pools were a little small and crowded but we always managed to get sun loungers. Spent most of the time in the pool itself anyway as it was so hot! Lots of kiddies around, but they were well behaved. I wouldn't recommend it for couples really, as there are so many kids around. It is aimed at families and groups of people really. The Adventuredome was fantastic...has the biggest indoor rollercoaster!! If you're looking for a few days of pure fun...Circus Circus is for you. If you're looking for a romantic quiet time...not for you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room - Bad Buffet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have always stayed at Paris, but this trip included the kids so we tried Circus Circus. I thought it would be a dump, but much to our surprise, the room was large, clean and comfortable. (This was in the main hotel tower not the motel section) However, the buffet was the worst I've ever had ! In addition, Circus Circus and Excaliber have some nerve charging full price for kids under 12. Get a car, get a cab, take a bus, but don't eat there ! Terrible's off the strip has a great buffet for $9.95 and $4.95 (kids). Thanks to Las Vegas Advisor for that tip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms tooo many kids.”
Reviews.Author: bikergirl
Reviews.Content: I know its a hotel with a circus theme thats made for kids ,but it really did my head in with them running wild in all areas of the casino and hotel.The room and maid service were excellent ,as were the prices for drinks and the waitress service.The choice of food leaves a lot to be desired.Liked the location as it is less frantic than other areas of the strip.Slots a fun ,Riviera and Westward Ho all close by for cheap gambling and drinking.Enjoyed my stay but wouldn't stay there again.Ideal for familys.

Reviews.Title: “circus circus”
Reviews.Author: lpglarry
Reviews.Content: we just returned from vegas, stayed at Circus Circus, Main Towers, what a difference it was to be in Main Towers, Rooms clean, quiet ,clean,and i can say we enjoyed it. Rates are very reasonable,we had one complaint, our view from window overlooked air conditioners, great hotel larry

Reviews.Title: “TIME FOR A CHANGE”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After staying in the circus circus for the second time I don t think that I will be returning. Not because we had a bad holiday, I just think there are better places to stay for not much more money. The hotel was clean as was the rooms and bathrooms but on the second visit I realised that the hotel seemed to be looking very tired and could do with some modernisation. The rooms are a decent size with either two queen size beds or a super king size bed make sure you stay in the towers as the other part of the hotel looks even older and to an extent run down. The down side to the rooms are that most of the views are of either waste land or the top of the adventure dome (but who goes to Vegas to look out of the window) secondly the rooms are quite a distance from the front of the hotel. The gambling in the circus circus is cheap and cheerful so if you don t want to loose a fortune this is the place, tables start from $1 for blackjack but depending on how busy the hotel is these tables fill up quickly. If the hotel is quieter you may find that the minimum bet is $5. The other down side to the hotel is the location on the strip you soon get fed up of walking the long distance to get to the next decent hotel (Treasure Island). I would also take into consideration that the hotel is probably the only one which caters largely for children and at the weekends it seems to be over run by them. On the positive side if you are looking for somewhere which is cheap and you don t mind walking this will probably be sufficient. The 24hour pink pony restaurant caters for those late night snacks and the staff are more than willing to help you book excursions and aid in any way they can. A good holiday can be had if on a strict budget.

Reviews.Title: “clean and pleasnt service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i was impressedwith the cleanliness of the rooms.also the housekeeper was a warm and pleasant person. the theme park was very nice,yet it could get really busy @ times. i feel circus circus is for people with family. if your looking for a good time for your kids circus circus is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Like little kids running everywhere screaming and yelling until 2:00am?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Cheap place to stay in vegas. If you're on a budget, this place will do the job. But not a fun place to gamble. Last time i checked, there were laws about little kids running around on the gaming floor -- not at Circus Circus! Bring all you kids and your trailer and let em run wild! The last group of my friends who pre-payed a package deal to Vegas (airfare and Circus Circus) ended up moving the second night to the Luxor (kind of sucks too but know one ever listens to the guy who actually lives in Vegas and knows the ins and outs). Long story short... Circus Circus has the biggest RV park in vegas right out in the back parking lot. Enough said?

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The old adage is true... You get what you pay for. Circus Circus brags about being the best bargain on the strip for a reason - their cheap. If you re looking for upscale and pampering - stay elsewhere BUT... if your looking for cheap rooms and a Kid friendly atmosphere, Circus-Circus will be just fine. We found the rooms to be clean, the staff helpful and very responsive, and the food fair. The Hotel is older than most and shows its age. We spent a full day in the adventure-dome. The adventure-dome is clean with no lines. After 4 days in Vegas, our Kids agreed the Adventure-dome was the high light. 2 Warnings: 1) The Casinos entire 1st floor was one of the smokiest on the strip. 2) The location is less than desirable. If you plan on seeing the strip and you do not have a car... you will be in for a long hike (2-4 miles one way).So... if you have a car, want a cheap clean room, and are bringing kids. Circus Circus should be just fine

Reviews.Title: “Comfiest beds ever!”
Reviews.Author: KatyGreenbank
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel and as I believe, one of the largest in the world! With its own rollercoaster! Brilliant buffets and the comfiest bed I have ever slept in. Only negative comment is that it is located quite far from the main bit of the strip and the walk is quite long to and from the casinos, especially in the desert heat.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading different reviews - our experience was great. We had good rooms, no hassle check in - no hassle check out. Pink Pony, 24 hours restaurant was great especially when you find you have forgotten to eat and it's 4 am in the morning. We went in November 2003 and as it's out of school time I would recommend this hotel if you don't want a lot of kids around. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great For Families & Kids”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself aswell as 20 friends and family stayed at the 'Circus Circus' in August 2000. The main reason that I am writing this review is that so many people seemed to have put this hotel down. Saying its full of kids, kids activities etc. WELL THAT'S THE IDEA!!! We had a ball at the 'circus circus' yeh its not as posh or fancy as some of the major hotels further up the strip - but you get what you pay for. All of our rooms were excellent, they were cleaned daily, room service was fabulous and all the staff who worked there who we had any dealings with were very very pleasant. Its great for children, with lots to do e.g. circus acts, an indoor adventure park, onsite McDonalds etc. We all hope to return someday - hopefully all the people who have criticised the hotel won't be there to spoil it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the price but not want they want on the weekends”
Reviews.Author: RosaElliott
Reviews.Content: stayed at Circus Circus in mid October, stayed during the week so the rates were low, the room is not worth more than $40.00 US. the carpeting in the casino and the wallpaper is gross, dirty and it looks like it really needs a big over haul, the room was okay, no screens on the windows and the windows were full of dead flies that no one bothered to clean out, the carpeting in the hallway was all heeved up, easy to trip on it, you had to walk through the whole casino to get to your room, never used the pool, it closes up early in the night, front desk staff was not all that friendly, come Friday look out the place is full of teenagers running around like mad. I do not think I would stay there again, probably would stay across the street at Riveria or downtown. Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Circus, Circus are you sure?”
Reviews.Author: Ranny
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in no hurry to return, rooms average and hotel too far down the strip. The hotel also charges $1 per day whether you use the phone or not which I did not like. The hotel is very old and is in need of a refurbishment, this did not put me off Vegas though I hope to return soon.I think having a RV park in the back of the hotel did not help either as there were abandoned children left on the sidelines of the casino whilst their parents gambled not a pretty sight at 2 am

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Misshell
Reviews.Content: I didn't stay at Circus Circus, but I did spend the day there at the adventure dome. Overall the atmosphere didn't compare with any of the other hotels I visited. The bathrooms were cramped and almost everything could use an upgrade. You could tell no one there liked their job, and a few were just out and out rude. Thank god I didn't reserve a room here, im sure it would have made my trip a miserable one.

Reviews.Title: “Been twice Never a problem”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been to Circus Circus twice this year. Once in May and then again in November. Had a nice room both times. You have to do alittle more walking to get anywhere inside Circus Circus but so what. Walking is good exercise. There are alot of children running around but that is not the fault of Circus Circus. I blame the parents for not keeping reign on their children. So for me I had good experience both times and will probly stay here again because of the cheaper rates. I would suggest the Tower Rooms tho I hear the manor rooms are pretty bad.

Reviews.Title: “good value........ pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at Circus Circus over the internet for Nov 5 thru 10, '03. My decision was mostly based on rates for the rooms. Personally, I do not see paying $170 plus for a room. However, after reading a few of the reviews after I had made my reservations, let's say I had some second thoughts; "dirty rooms, noisey, etc." Oh well, figured I would check in, stay one night and find something else. However, was pleasantly surprised........* the room was clean, including the bathroom.The bed comfortable. The refrigerator worked.There was a small store next door in the RV Park. The lobby was not 'trashy', there were no kids running wild and unsupervised;as lead to believe by other reviews. During stay maid service was good, everyday.Found stay to be comfortable. good deal for money. Yes, Circus Circus is a large property, it can take a while to walk from rooms to casinos, etc. ( however, nearly all the hotels are huge !.) Suggest good walking shoes, a map and and rental car. and use of valet parking if visiting other Las Vegas hotels/casinos. Found valet parking at all Hotels visited to be courteous.Bonus getting around in Vegas is not difficult as there are streets that parallel most of the strip. ALso, found slots hit better on Monday??

Reviews.Title: “get to know this brilliant family hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Dont go to circus circus if you are a drunk or an old slot addict. This hotel is a brilliant place for a family with fast attentive staff and good rooms. As a popular hotel it can get quite busy but the wait at check-in is worth it. I requested a high tower room with a forward view and this was no problem with a 32nd floor room quickly allocated. In the room was a comfortable space , two queen beds ,large bathroom and a brilliant view. The hotel pools have hot spas but the large rectangular pool at the RV park is the best with a spa and sauna and is easily accesed through the sky casino and moving walkway from the lobby. The restaurant queues can be beaten by crossing the road to the rivieras food court which is large and varied , however the circus steakhouse is the best in Las Vegas for good reason. Loads of on site shopping and entertainment with circus acts every half hour and most lasting for 20 mins. Housekeeping is fast , smiling and courteous. No drunken stag nights , no nude parties , and family orientation throughout , just make a point of talking to people and finding out what is where. Remember its a busy , popular hotel for people with kids and as with all of las vegas it gets busier on a weekend.
